Summary Heading: Has potential but I'll pass for now
Summary: I wanted to love this hotel, I really hoped it would be our go to for Disney but nope.   Pros- the room was spacious (deluxe queen). The room had a second door that lead to the pool. The chairs are nice, and I prefer the comfy chairs over sitting on the bed. The Disney shuttle is great, especially after a long day at the park. In the morning there was a duck in the pool - yes this is a pro because it's funny. They have very nice grounds with fountains and ponds. Cons- there were french fries on the floor of our room when we checked in so there's no way the floor could have been vacuumed. The beds were awful. They appeared to be at least 30 years old.  The bathroom is tiny and was in dire need of a complete remodel. There's a fridge but no microwave. There's hardly any outlets

Summary Heading: Square footage and parks shuttle service, not much else
Summary: The rooms at Majestic Garden are quite large, perhaps the largest of any similar hotel nearby. However, the rooms are dated, heavily used and need an upgrade. The rooms have single-paned windows and there's LOTS of traffic noise.  I have stayed here before but it's been awhile. Still, I had realistic expectations. Unfortunately I found the condition of our room this time to be poor (Room 3200). The hotel room had a small television probably around 32in which was not a problem, just felt very awkward given the larger size of the rooms. The curtains in our room looked pretty old and a little dingy with one panel having significant staining on it.  My bed was long past its prime. It was completely worn in the middle (where people usually sit on the side of the bed)  I check beds no

Stayed here 3 nights this week.  A great location just around the corner from the two Disney parks.  Easy to reach right next to the freeway.  A shuttle bus leaves for Disneyland every half hour, starting at 0730 and picks up on the quarter hour.  The hotel itself is well kept, the rooms are large, clean and comfortable.  Beds are good.  The buffett breakfast is a little expensive for what is on offer.  There is an in house deli where you can get a basic toast, cereal breakfast for a lot less.  Dinner in the bar is good value.  If you are not able to be at Disneyland for the evening fireworks then walk out into the hotel carpark and get a great view anyway.  Good value for money and would stay again

We felt unwelcome and unwanted. 1st night called front desk, Paul was sarcastic, when I asked How do I turn on heater? Before I continue to describe the issue he replied with the snark laugh, something like" "you just do!" Put number higher?!... I said are you making fun of me? I don't appreciate your sarcasm, I then went further trying to discuss the issue. We were moved to room next door.  All was working this time.   Next day at nigh we came back from Disneyland and found no service was addressed to room, no beds made nor towels called front desk they said they follow covid protocols they only go if we request the service.   Are you kidding me? We paid over $354 for 2 nights for this?
Room tip: If possible drive further to get better customer service , newer or remodel hotels that will feel...

Summary Heading: First time stay - and probably last
Summary: This hotel is dated. The price was great, can't argue with their online FLASH sale. But really - the remote had about 4 buttons on it. The TV channel guide looked to be about 2004-era. Everything else in the room looked like a walk back to 2008.  This place would never survive a mile away from Disney. The theme park is the only thing keeping this place in existence. Although the facilities were mostly clean, you're going to be staying in a sad, dated hotel. A complete renovation would serve their guests well. Have the owners ever been to Vegas? Check out how style, technology, and common sense towards the needs of their guests can create an unforgettable night's stay.   Both the guests and the owners are unfortunately hanging onto the Disney dream: "Just stay here! We'll slash

This was the best stay we've had so far in our four trips to visit Disney. We've stayed at an Airbnb, Kings Inn, Cortana, and now the Grand Majestic. The shuttle was a game changer. Being able to come back and rest made our trip so much better. The room was quiet and comfortable. It was clean. I loved the mural and the atmosphere of the building and grounds. The pool area was great (not very heated, but my daughter didn't mind) and the hot tub was wonderful after all the walking. You could see the fireworks so well from the parking lot.   Cons are that the bed was small for a queen and stiff, but not undoable. The security on the door to building in the back side (I think it was "e" building) did not work. The keys did not work for the pool at first, but they did say they were

I stayed here for a large conference.  The meeting rooms were excellent. and our room with 2 queen roos was excellent.  The hotel has a restaurant with a good breakfast buffet.  The hotel as a gift shop which also sells sodas and snacks.  The hotel offers a free shuttle to Disneyland.  I had problems logging onto the hotel's complimentary wifi and sometimes I had to use my phone's mobile data to access the internet on my computer.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, please come back and stay with us again.

Summary: Pros: Wanted to love this hotel, it has the makings to be great. Very large room, loved the mural, front desk at check in great, shuttle was awesome.  Cons: Bathroom was disgusting, dirty, wore flip flops because we didn’t want to stand in tub. Night desk not so good, room cleanliness not good. Wi-Fi in tower garden rooms nonexistent.

Summary Heading: Incredibly convenient access to Disneyland, but 2.5 star hotel.
Summary: The big draw of the Anaheim Majestic Garden is of course Disneyland. The convenient shuttle takes you right to the park gates every 30 minutes. This was incredibly convenient, we were able to open the park, and then come back to the room for lunch and a nap before heading back to the park in the evening for fireworks.   The hotel itself is adequate. I think it’s just misclassified in the booking sites. If it was listed on the booking site as a 2.5 star (based on price and amenities) then it would be a 5-star.  The booking site had this listed as a 3.5 and that lead us to unmet expectations.   The rooms are very large, which is great for large families. I didn’t even really mind the upkeep and decor. Like many reviewers, we had complaints about housekeeping. We found a slim-Jim
Room tip: Some of the back doors provide convenient access to your room but don’t work. Find the closest...
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, please come back and stay with us again.

Summary: Very good hotel close to DisneyLand. Our room was spacious, though the bathroom is due for a refresh. The breakfast (available for an extra charge) was a good one offering good options with both a buffet and a-la-carte. The free shuttle to Disney Parks was very comfortable and ran frequently. The store in the hotel lobby was well stocked and also had some grab-n-go food options.

We loved the hotel and the staff — they were very courteous and friendly. Very helpful at all times. The shuttles to the parks were also super convenient and very frequent.    My issue however is with the sad state of the rooms and bathrooms. They definitely need an upgrade. The bathrooms have rusty fixtures, some cracked tiling too. Shampoos, Body wash and conditioners are low quality and installed in mediocre dispensers. The mattresses are old and have an uneven bounce to it. Room was dusty — we even found a silver fish on our bed.   Advice to Management : Keep up the great work on training your staff. They’re are your asset. But you definitely need to do something about the quality of your guest rooms. They’re definitely below par.

Summary Heading: Great Stay at the Anaheim Majestic Garden
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for 6 nights. We had a lovely stay. The room was big, clean and tidy but a little noisy as we were located next to the car park by a very busy main road into and out of Disneyland. I slept fine but it may impact on lighter sleepers.  The hotel was in a great location and within a handful of minutes walking distance to Disneyland (although they offer a superb free and regular shuttle service). The hotel is also close to Knotts by taxi.  The hotel was beautifully decorated for the holidays.  The bar area was lovely and clean and welcoming as were the restaurants. The breakfast buffet was brilliant and well priced for all that you get!  The staff were friendly catered to our needs.  Overall an excellent hotel in a brilliantly location. We will be back for
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, please come back and stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Theft from your room while your gone
Summary: Theft! People break into your room here while you are gone and the hotel DOES NOTHING ABOUT IT.   They known it happens. Read the multiple reviews of it on here! Stay far far away from this place. Oh, and the police can’t do anything about it, so it’s super frustrating.

My wife and I have stayed at this place even before it was named the Anaheim Majestic. We never had any issues until this last time.  The problem is not the issues, the problem is the lack of customer service all the way through.  First, our sink was stopped up and going to the Disney park from sunrise to late at night, we didn't have the energy or time to call for someone to fix this or move rooms. The shuttle has a schedule but 2 different occasions the shuttle was 1 HOUR late.  I realize schedules are flexible but an hour is not acceptable.  The elevators are small so with one not working, the other one was filled quickly with 6 people and you sometimes had to wait for another elevator when you are already tired.  We expressed these concerns to the manager on duty and she at

I was here solo, for a conference at the hotel, for 3 days M-Th, and I booked through a 3rd party.  Pros:  -foyer was beautifully decorated with Holiday Cheer -Cool little deli/shop with food and microwave and ice cream -Arcade was a nice surprise -Staff was pleasant and helpful -Nice lighting and lamps in the room -fridge in room  Cons:  -Room wasnt ready in time (check in at 4, room ready at 4:45, so I had to wait, with my cart full of stuff) They said it was b/c I had requested a room that opened to the garden.  -$20/night for parking just sucks, period -Room was FAR away - if you have mobility issues, request one close to front desk, this place is a huge compound with long hallways. I kept getting lost - lay out is funky.  -Tub did not drain - gross. abandoned my plan to

Our family recently stayed at the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel.    The staff over all was nice.    There were 3 staff members that really stood out.  A young man that works the front desk named Adrian.  He was very helpful when it  came to providing us with clean towels and garbage bags.  We dealt with him on a few occasions and he was always very professional and friendly.  Another person that was great with a lady by the name of Teresa who also works  the front desk. She was extremely professional and very caring.   There was also a man named Camilo who did a great job cleaning up our room.  He left our room even better than when we had checked in.  Our son-in-law  is a sweet funny man, a great dad to our granddaughter and good husband to our daughter.  That is what we see

Summary Heading: Definitely NOT ADA compliant or friendly.
Summary: Shuttle bus in disrepair for scooters and wheelchairs, the dri er told my daughter to get off her scooter and walk to the bus, up the steps and find a seat, he would ride her scooter on the broken ramp up to the bus,SHE IS DISABLED, since we did not/could not do this he left her on the sidewalk and drove away. I called the hotel and was told "Well he gave you options". Also there is no button for the door to open if you are in a scooter/chair, crutches ect... and can't open the door yourself.  Very bad experience.  I was assured I would her from the General Manager, Nothing. The bus below is what they should have sent, instead they sent the long school bus like vehicle with broken ramp parts.

We checked in to this hotel today oct 9. Not even an hour in changed rooms there looked like mouse poop on the sofa bed and black hairs all over the bed. Move to 2nd room and there was garbage all over old celery under a chair tooth pick under the side table.For 650 to 750 a night gross the location is great for Disney, but I don’t feel like for the price you should have to give up the room being clean. Also for a week stay they tell you in advance you only get room service 2 times. A local told us that the Sheraton sold this place to a company out of county. They have let it go. Gross. Front desk and was good checking in and the first move. Horrible service horrible place. Gross.

There was a clump of hair folded into one of the beds and at 8am we got woken up by the hammering of a construction crew re-roofing the hotel and throwing shingles down at our window. The manager was not helpful at all.

I stayed here for the first time and have already scheduled my next stay.   Room: I was in the Garden Tower. The room was impressively large for a 2Q room-- maybe 20' x 15' or so? I'm bad with measurements, ha! Bed was "firm" but this is so common around the Anaheim resort area that I expect it at any hotel now. It would be prohibitively expensive to keep pillow top upscale mattresses completely comfortable for everyone with the amount of rooms and nightly guests. The longest wall in the room had a forest mural; nice touch! There was a desk/TV stand/3-drawer dresser/fridge/coffee stand against the longest wall. It was all one piece, but each area was it's own area-- the TV wasn't above the dresser or the on the edge of the desk for example. There were two nice chairs and a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, please come back and stay with us again.

Summary: Great family hotel close to Disneyland. Staff are lovely. Rooms large and comfortable. Free shuttle service to park. Cute if you want the princess/Prince vibe. Excellent breakfast in hot plates, if that is your thing. Also have nice pool and on site activities.

Great looking place, staff friendly & helpful. Couple minor issues was the door had to be pushed all the way shut otherwise it stayed open a crack so we were cautious of that when leaving the room also plugged in my EV car by green roundabout then whole car engulfed in ants in the morning. Great pool, beautiful atmosphere, could see the fireworks over the fountain, loved and appreciated the very accommodating friendly shuttle staff and every 30 minutes was awesome. Overall a great experience and will be back

Rooms are dirty not clean and even no housekeeping. The front desk said housekeeping will clean the room only if you stay 3 days or more !!!!! We had to stay in dirty rooms and even the towels were not changed!!  Also no porters were there to help us in carrying our luggage. The front desk said you have to help yourself no one cared at all or even no one in the front desk offered their welling to help verbally!!

Once I arrived at the hotel, I was informed that there is no housekeeping service. That absolutely no one would enter my room and that if I wanted fresh towels, I could call the front desk and they’d bring some.  We traveled on vacation. I can’t believe that Even when we are on vacation, paying for a hotel room, we need to make our beds, throw away our trash bins, tidy up the room, etc. It is unbelievable.  I have no idea the reason for such a measure.  If they have customers who feel more comfortable when no one enters their room, that’s perfect, but we should be given the alternative either when booking or at check in. Incredibly disappointing. They are not reducing the nightly rate either.   I had stayed at four different hotels the week before, all of them in California and

For $300 a night during peak summer season you are paying for being literally next to Disney, free Wi-Fi, and for the snazzy castle bunk beds (kids loved it) but frankly not much else. The shampoo is the worst I’ve ever had at a hotel — can’t believe I’m even writing this — but i wondered if I was being punk’d because there were literally NO suds or lather and my long hair actually felt more dirty afterward. Huh? As many others have mentioned the tub was indeed clogged and turned into a mini pool after 5 minutes which, on the bright side, my toddler loved. And we noticed our room was missing the usual amenities, like USB outlets, or at the very least multiple power outlets for devices, shampoo that actually works, hand lotion, a robe, laundry service. The tv remote wasn’t

Our room got broken into and $250 worth of items were taken.  They did an "investigation" and determined that only our key cards were used to enter the room so they couldn't do anything,  but Frank told my husband to call him directly when we decided to come back and he'll give us the best deal.  Are these people out of their minds??!!!  Our first time here and definitely our last. I filed a report with the BBB and they continue to say no one but us had access to our room (we were at Disneyland for 12 hours when this happened), so no one is held accountable and we're out our stuff with no form of compensation. They even took the receipt with a brand new mug I had just bought (left the bag) so they could return it for cash. Looks like an inside job with people erasing key card

Summary Heading: very bad experience / Muy Mala Experiencia
Summary: Estuve 5 noches en este hotel y la verdad que no cumple con las condiciones en comparación costo vs beneficios, la construcción es vieja, el servicio es malo, no limpian las habitaciones, tu pides servicio y nadie va a la habitación, en cinclusion una de mis peores experiencias en hotel de cualquier categoría. ✔️ 5 días del mismo desayuno ✔️Nunca limpian la habitación ✔️Sucio, viejo y mucha humedad ✔️La atención es mala y casi nula. ✔️Hace 15 días de mi estancia y aún no me reembolsa el deposito. No volvería a este hotel así sea gratis. ------------------------------------------------------------------------ I stayed 5 nights in this hotel and the truth is that it does not meet the conditions in comparison of cost vs benefits, the construction is old, the service is bad, they do

The only selling point is a shuttle that runs constantly throughout the day. Other than that, our recent stay was very poor. I realize that part of this is due to a lack of staffing. Room was not ready on time, toilet in one of the two rooms did not flush, door was almost impossible to open, you have to pick up towels, soap, and TP at the front desk, they no longer offer lunch. Our first stay there was 15 years ago, and it has really gone downhill.

Summary Heading: Fantastic shuttle, large room, fabulous staff
Summary: Fantastic staff everyone we interacted with was friendly, professional, and helpful.  The shuttle to Disneyland was fantastic-it regularly and easy to find on both ends.  The room was very large-we got a 2 queen & a pull out.  It had a large closet.  But the bathroom was tiny.  I wish they’d had at least some sort of vanity in the bedroom side so others could at least have a well lite mirror.  Bathroom was surprisingly small since they said the room slept 7.  They said it slept 7 but not sure where #7 was intended.  We used the couch cushions to make a bed for the 7 yr old.  Every thing was clean-a little worn but clean.  Room had fridge.  Microwave available off the lobby.

Mediocre at best.  there is NO housekeeping (until the 4th night), due to COVID ... but staff is unmasked. Incoherent I think. Rooms are not as clean as they should be (dusty) , found plastic tags from previous guests all over the floor, and a used bobby pin in closet. On the other hand rooms are large (small bathroom) and closeness to parks is unbeatable (This is what draws guest is and they abuse this ... cause it is not cheap) Oscar/bellboy, is a VERY good asset for their hotel.

The hotel in itself was gorgeous and the décor gave it a very vintage look which didn't make it look outdated, but more retro and somewhere which I would definitely recommend to others. We actually came for a wedding so in that respect the hotel was an excellent venue choice and looked beautiful where the ceremony took place. Also the weather we had was absolutely perfect which helped. You're in for a treat if you go into the courtyard as you'll be greeted by various families of ducks, tiny lizards, doves and a pond of large koi carp.. Stunning!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, please come back and stay with us again.

Summary: I am staying at this hotel currently. While there are a couple of nice things about it — namely, proximity to Disneyland and a convenient shuttle with friendly drivers — this place is a sad, worn-out excuse of a hotel. Major disappointments for me: 1) dated, dingy interiors; 2) no housekeeping service…I would understand if they just limited service or made it on a by-request basis, but none?! 3) inadequate wifi — I have been unable to access their wifi over multiple days across multiple devices, which is a bummer when you hope to download a few things for your kids to watch on the return flight…it’s 2022, working wifi isn’t optional; 4) towels that are frayed and stringy at the edges; 5) when I called the front desk last night (twice!) asking for some more towels and a couple of

Aesthetically this is a very beautiful hotel & has some beautiful garden areas. We were here for a wedding & the staff were all fantastic. The amenities in the hotel are also very good & our parking was free. Which was also good. The shuttle service provided was also very good. Only downsides was that our room was looking very dated & in need of an update, the common areas were very hot & their were no carts available for luggage. Some of the rooms are very far away!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, please come back and stay with us again.

Summary: Stayed here close to Disney with my adult children. Very nice accommodations, room size was great, comfortable beds, couch and set up. Very clean hotel with great customer service! They were very helpful with organizing my mothers scooter too. Nice people and place.

Summary Heading: don't be fooled by decent prices
Summary: Won't stay here again. First night loud commotion outside from midnight until 2 am. My family and I were scared and thought we were being robbed. Second night wanted to give it another try but saw random people going up and down the hallway yelling and knocking on doors. Checked out the final day.

Summary Heading: DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU WANT A CLEAN ROOM
Summary: DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU WANT A CLEAN ROOM. The rooms are very filthy, full of dust, human hair, dirty socks. Completely gross!! Plus they “misplaced” our baby sleeping sack from inside the room and management didn’t even know who had gone in the room!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: It was clean and recently renovated but you could tell the bathroom was not part of this renovation, it was small, and there was rust in the shower. The bedrooms were big but nothing to write home about. Not mad about the hotel but nothing special. Pool was a nice touch but hard to find (it was also heated).

My family & I decided to give this hotel a try. It was my parents anniversary & I was taking them to Disneyland. First things first, when I booked a room I requested a handicap room (ADA) when we arrived the lady behind the counter said well Our apologizes but we don't have that room available anymore!! (WHAT?!!!) at this point it was too late to do anything so I said ok we will take the regular room! When we got to the room it was nice, good artwork & theme! But... here comes the nightmare, when I went to take a shower there was hair all over the bathroom it was disgusting! I left it alone & cleaned it myself. Fast forward a few hours, My family got hungry & soo I went to get us food, my dad called me & told me he fell off the toilet! I'm immediately rushed back to the hotel
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we appreciate the feedback. We take all reviews very seriously and follow up on details to ensure that if there were any issues during a stay they would be corrected. Since your review had some very strong accusations we went back and pulled the email correspondence that you had with the hotel’s General Manager which constituted 10 emails over the course of several days. We were unable to substantiate your claims. We found in the email correspondence that due to issues that you had during a previous stay; you were seeking compensation for this stay. You had asked for the same rate that you paid during your previous stay and that was granted. You had asked for a room in the courtyard area, and this was granted. In addition, we provided you with upgraded accommodations. At no point in this correspondence was an accessible room requested. We would have been happy to provide you those accommodation, but you requested a courtyard room instead. During the time that you were a guest in the hotel you could have contacted the General Manager directly if you were dissatisfied with your accommodations since you had her direct contact information. It’s disappointing that this did not happen, and this review was the only follow up we received. This inaction deprived us of the opportunity to resolve any issues during your stay.

Summary: We had a great stay. We were there 12/12-12/17. No complaints. Gal at check in was polite. Got our requested room 3 hours early. Requested a rollaway bed which they brought up while we were at Disney because we were out late and it was in the room waiting when we got in. We needed towels and the garbage changed and they were brought up within an hour. All staff was wonderful. The room was huge and spacious for 2 adults and 3 kids. Very clean. And so quiet. Will definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the excellent review, I will certainly share your notes with the other departments here at the hotel and we hope to have you back again with us very soon. Thank you!

Summary: Where to begin...reading the reviews, I agree with many folks giving the low scores. Have been coming to this hotel for more than 15 years, always had a great experience in past - this time, not so much. Booked a suite, but ultimately NOT worth the extra $$, and no real value...To begin,  there are NO HOUSEKEEPING SERVICES being given, AT ALL ("due to Covid" - ?!?!?!). Many staff don't seem to care about "guests," and in fact, seemed annoyed that we were even there. Unpleasant experiences with front desk staff when I called with a request. No additional pillows "available." Everything seems like a hassle to the MANY staff who seem to be there (but not necessarily helping guests)...ONLY  bright spot this time was the lovely shuttle driver - wonderful man who made jokes and made

Summary Heading: Only consider this place as a last resort measure.
Summary: As other reviews have stated, the bed is extremely uncomfortable (specially considering most of their customer are spending long days on their feet at the parks), pillows are paper thin, shower drainage does not work and the bathroom is in overall rough shape.  This property needs a substantial investment and shuttle service doesn’t make up for any of these issues. You’re better off staying a little closer to the park entrance and just walking instead.  This hotels rating needs to be downgraded.

My husband and I came to visit Disneyland and stayed here. I was amazed initially at the hotel front lobby. It was beautiful. But then going to our room.. we found a large amount of ants coming from the drainages in the bathroom. They sent housekeeping to the room to spray the room, and we had a 2 month old baby. I explained I wasn’t going to be staying in that room any longer. The drain itself in the bath tub did not drain properly either. The bathroom was not thoroughly cleaned prior to our stay. The shuttle to and from the park kept breaking down and we had to walk back to the room from the park with our baby alongside a busy street side in the middle of the night. Even the air conditioning in the shuttle stopped working and the shuttle was not clean. The staff was really

Summary Heading: Rude desk staff & managers and staff looking for ways to make a dime by raising false complains
Summary: The restaurant staff was superb super hospitable and serviceable the front desk staff and managers should go train after them.  When we were checking in the front staff was rude - with comments like "if you would of read what you just signed" and basically denying statements she made and when we asked for clarity she starting arguing with us.  We talked to the manager that said ok sorry and we then said your room will not be serviced during your stay until you check out if you need towels let us know.  There was hair on the wash clothes in the room (gross).  Then the staff accused my party of taking a heart shape pillow that was never in the room.  Been calling, emailing without a returned calls from the managers.  Filed a claim to the BBB because they can't treat customers in

Summary Heading: Not much for what you pay
Summary: Mediocre at best. Hotel is really old and smells like it. Beds were really uncomfortable and worn like they were 10+ years old. No hot water in the sink. For the price you pay I would have expected more. Bathtub was clogged so we were showering in a pool of water. About the only good thing I can say is the close proximity to Disney.

Check in was quick and easy. There is no housekeeping daily. When you need towels or any supplies you call and they will bring them to you.  The air conditioning didn't seem to be cooling as it should. The outlets seemed loose and were not convient to get to. The bathroom was clean but no fan which made it steamy. There is a nice size closet. The mini fridge worked well, a microwave would have been nice. The beds were average. The overall feel of the room is a bit dark.   The hallways had a musty smell, almost reminded me of the hotels at the Jersey shore.  The shuttle is the best part if this hotel! The shuttle picked up from Disneyland every 15 minutes. It left the hotel for Disneyland every hour, sometimes every half hour. Its a quick ride to the park.  Iif the price stays as

Summary Heading: Have stayed here for years, will never return. RUN.
Summary: If I could give zero stars, I would. We have stayed at this hotel twice a year for the last five years. It’s always been a nostalgic, enjoyable location with an awesome shuttle service. Now under the guise of “COVID” they’ve stopped room service and cut the shuttle service back to once an hour. They unsafely cram people on top of people in this bus to try to get everyone to and from the park and if you don’t make it on they will sure leave you sitting in the 100 degree heat for an hour with your small kids. There is only room for about half the crowd per trip. They have several “shuttles” (they’re just dirty old busses), but only run one per hour. They no longer clean the rooms either, because of “Covid” and it shows. They’re dirty, have bugs and smell like mold. You only get a

I throughly enjoyed my visit to the Anaheim Majestic Garden’s Hanagi restaurant. The service was excellent, the food was DELICIOUS!!! The manager, Mr. Shigeru, was very kind and patient with me as this was my first time experiencing a sushi anything. I definitely am looking forward to my next visit!!!

I honestly can’t begin to explain the depth of disgust we felt staying here. The cover photo they use to advertise must be one single updated room, because my daughter stayed in a different part of the hotel as we did and her room was as bad as ours. We discovered cockroaches the second morning, and instead of taking the shuttle to the park we packed all our snacks and drinks back into our car. I took clothes out of the dresser and repacked our suitcases and then put everything up on the dirty stained chairs. I put the trash cans in the tub so there would be nothing to attract roaches to our bedroom. The towels were literally falling apart, everything smells of musty old clothes. Our son tried to sleep on the pullout couch and it was so bad he cried. It was so bent and swayed as

Where to begin?  Walking in the atmosphere is decent. The lobby is nice. Move past the lobby to very confusing hallways and a maze or a puzzle to find your room. Checked into the first room after being told no upgrades available and the small of mildew hit us so hard. I called back down to the front desk and told them I was told there were no better rooms available, but online showed availability. The gentleman was kind enough to switch the room for us to a suite. On the way to the room the different people we asked for help to show us to our room received calls about bugs coming from drains and just being present in the room. The suite is much better. There is at least no mildew smell and it looked a lot cleaner, but it doesn't curb the anxiety the kids now have about the

We just finished two nights at the Anaheim Majestic to celebrate my birthday at Disneyland and Knotts Berry Farm. It was decent hotel since we did not stay in room much but here are some of my personal pros and cons: Positives: shuttle service, beautiful gardens with baby ducks, convenient deli/convenience sore for quick food, toiletries, souvenirs. Easy check-in/out.  Negatives: Not quick walk to Disneyland, and not best area to walk in late at night.  Shuttle crammed everyone in. No social distance at all.  Room bathroom  was older and needed to be updated. Small.  Walls paper thin.  Killed spiders in room.  Not many outlets for charging or plugothinhs in.  $100 security deposit that I wasn’t aware of ahead of checking in.  Honestly if given fabulous deal may stay here again

We enjoyed our stay here as it is close to all the the disney attractions. The shuttles to Disney were a lifesaver and a big plus of why you should stay here.   Highly recommend for anyone looking for a great service. Thanks Michaela for your awesome service!

Definitely recommend staying here for your Disney trip! Rooms are great, there's a pool & jacuzzi. You really can't beat the price with all the amenities that come with the rate, such as the Disney Shuttle. Stay here and skip the walk to Disney.

my family and I had a wonderful stay at the Anaheim Majestic! We loved exploring the gardens and swimming in the heated pool. The staff was so helpful, especially Kellie who gave us lots of information. This hotel is very close to many restaurants and attractions as well. Lastly, our room was large and we loved the extra room!

Not the best hotel around, but it's a really good hotel with great food made in their kitchen. Very kind staff. Very clean. Beautiful landscape. Good sized, comfortable rooms. I have nothing bad to say about it at all. It's not the Hilton, but you also aren't paying Hilton rates. It's actually a lot nicer than the Disney Hotel for like .. half the price. It's my go to for Disney trips.

Summary Heading: Best place to stay near Disneyland!
Summary: This was our 3rd time staying at this hotel. With it being the first time they were open due to covid 19 we were extremely happy with the cleanliness and the awareness of safety precautions. The staff were excellent, Michaela and Oscar stood out as they were will to go above and beyond to make our stay incredible. Due to the friendliness, hospitality and extremely great service by Michaela and Oscar I will never stay anywhere else when we return to Disneyland. Every thing from check in to check out was handled professionally and friendly and these two made my family and I feel like we were family staying on property not just another random guest in a room. I will for sure rank this stay a perfect 10 of 10.

It was not the first time we went to Disney Land but it was the first time we stayed at Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel.  When we looked up the review we had 60% of expectation, but the price was fit with our pocket, they had free shuttle, free parking, so we hope if the guest room was decent then we might have a decent trip...However, when we arrived, we had our parking (first happiness), then the reception was nice, staff was nice, the check in was smoothly and quick. Coming to the guest room and it was exceeded our expectation.  It was perfect:  room was clean, roomy (what was perfect), 2 queens for 4, bed was clean, sheets were clean (another perfect), furniture was nice.  Air was nice and ventilation.  Bath room was small but clean.  Overall, it was clean, private and safe.

Booked this hotel during a rate special where parking and breakfast was included. We stayed in the garden tower, the room was clean. In the future, I'd ask for a room in the main building and avoid the garden tower as it seemed that the rooms there weren't as nice. The A/C controls were difficult to use, but it was cold enough to sleep. The beds weren't the most comfortable, but they got the job done. The staff was friendly and the shuttle was extremely convenient. The value of saving $20 on parking and additional money on breakfast made this a win for us.

Honest review long but detailed...So this is coming from someone whose worked hotel as front desk and housekeeping at Marriott. So for starters i called to make reservation the lady was nice however did not tell me I would have to pay for parking. Did not mention breakfast would be another $20 a person. Than I arrived at the hotel and not much parking. When I got inside usually you are greeted whether they are busy or not you should always greet a guest even its to tell them you be right with them. I waited for 10min before I was greeted. One older gentleman was helping guest but there were 2 other agents up front which one them went in the back and the other gentleman just kept glancing up every so often. Finally i get checked in they did not explain any amenities basically

Summary Heading: Awful customer service, rude staff and no privacy
Summary: First, we were not able to book online for multiple rooms because of their reservation system so we lost out on the online discount.  Two, we asked specially if the breakfast was included and if the shuttle to Disneyland was free--should have asked if there was a fee for parking but that is on us.  Imagine our surprise when we were presented with a bill before we had finished breakfast.  I went to the front desk and tried to work this out to no avail.  Went back to the restaurant and the waiter said he would only charge us for 5 people.  There were 11 of us.  Five kids under 11 and six adults.  Two adults did not eat.  I called the "manager" several times from Disneyland and received no return call.  We waited a very long time to speak face to face with a manager the next day
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and details from your stay. We are sorry to hear about the issues you mention here. We would like to speak to you about the situations you describe. Would you please contact Tchi Willette our Director of Operations back at twillette@majesticgardenhotel.com or call the hotel directly please. Thank you.

Summary: Built in 1969, the Majestic has a lot of character. Good dining options, and nice ambiance. We enjoyed the gardens and the pool area was very well kept and quite large with cabanas and plenty of seating. Funky art and a story adventure on the walls and floors in the halls on each level was a nice touch.  Many nods to it's close proximity to Disneyland,  While it's a little run-down and occasionally a bit shabby, it was clean and the staff was polite and professional. We utilized their shuttle service to and from the Park that ran every half-hour on the quarter hours and had a late last pickup runs.  All in all, we didn't have any complaints beyond a bit of a struggle sharing the few outlets to charge 4 phones and a portable charger, lol.  They also offered a $5 off voucher if
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and comments about your stay with us. We appreciate the feedback. Thank you.

Summary: Every time we go to Disneyland we stay here, it is very roomy and clean, They have a nice pool area and free shuttle to and from Disneyland. I like that you can see the fireworks from the hotel if you’re not in the park, they also have a little arcade and snack store
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review of your recent stay with us. We appreciate the feedback and hope you'll return to visit us again soon. Thank you!

Summary: We just returned from a lovely stay at this hotel. The room was very large which was unexpected. The grounds were beautiful and picturesque. The location so close to Disneyland was great. You could walk even although it was about 1.2 miles, so a bit far with kids. However, they had a free shuttle that took you right to the entrance of Disneyland. It runs every half hour, but in the mornings, it runs continuously until the line dies down. The pool was rather small, but still refreshing. There was a small hot tub. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for this feedback from your stay with us. We appreciate you taking the time to share this information and we hope that you will choose to stay with us again the next time you are in the Disneyland area. Thank you!

Summary: Celebrated my Birthday and Valentines Day with a two day getaway visit to Disneyland for Sweetheart Nite. Stayed at The Majestic Hotel. It was an amazing stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. It was convenient, clean, safe and the staff was amazing. We visit Disneyland a few times each month and we always like to stay at different hotels. We’ve had our share of bad stays and good stays, but The majestic has now made our top five on our good list. Will definitely be staying there again.  Thank you again for a wonderful stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review of your stay with us, we appreciate the feedback. Please do share with your friends and family and we will hope to have you back again very soon. Thank you.

Summary: We stayed at Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel when we went to visit Disneyland and California Adventure. The rooms were clean and the bed wasn't too bad. The wifi is decent enough to watch youtube videos - should you want to. The coffee that comes with the room is terrible though.  A big perk of the hotel is regular busses to the Disney parks from just before park opening to just after park closing. The bus drivers were very friendly!
Manager Response: Thank you for this review of your stay, we appreciate your feedback. We are pleased that you enjoyed the shuttle service to the theme park from the hotel, it is one of our guests most loved feature.

Summary: Having stayed at this hotel on 2 previous occasions when it was the Sheraton Anaheim, it was our first choice to return to. Sadly we were extremely disappointed. We booked nearly a year prior to going informing that it was for a special occasion. We were given two rooms in the old block which must have been the furthest rooms from the reception area. The rooms were adequate but nothing special. Staff were not very friendly, not very helpful and rather lax. This was reflected most definitely, as unfortunately we were travelling with Thomas Cook who collapsed whilst we were staying at the hotel the staff couldn’t care less about our plight, were completely unsympathetic and totally unreasonable. The CAA did everything they could to liaise with the hotel who would not listen and
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, this stems from an event that happened in June of 2007. We are sorry you were traveling during this unfortunate time with Thomas Cook. Thank you!

Summary: We just did a 2 night trip to Disney and stayed here with our 15 month old and 7 year old boys. The hotel itself is okay, there's a nice pool (basic), games room, and restaurant. The shuttle is great, on time running every 15-20 mins to/ from Disney.  Parking is $18/ day, be aware of this beforehand if you're bringing a car. Staff is friendly. It's a very short drive to Disney, but because of its location, walking is long because they're are no sidewalks on the direct route to the gates (which is a short hwy).   Where our complaints come in, is with the room. They're very dated and we found the bathroom to be a bit dirty. There is no water pressure in the shower. And the worst of it - you cannot control the temperature in your room. There is a thermostat, but it wasn't doing
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback. We are sorry about the situation with the room temperature controls and we will share your comments with the teams and maintenance management for review. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Beware!  There are two sections at the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel.  Newer section and Old Tower.
Summary: On a recent trip to Disneyland, we were given (2) rooms in the 'old' section.  Disgusting rooms - dirty windows, rusty bathtub, dripping water, dingy lights, broken lampshade, wallpaper falling off, crib in hall, no nozzle in fire station, air conditioning broken, carpets not vacuummed, lights out on elevator - and the room faced the highway - SO NOISY! ...We asked to be moved.  Next (2) rooms were in the same 'old' tower, just another floor - same conditions, but with an additional disappointment with a huge tree blocking light through the window.  We had plans to attend Disneyland for half the day, but when we got back later in the evening, we quickly got on our phones and started checking around for another hotel - Thankfully! found one and checked out next morning.  Asked to
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. It has been forwarded to the housekeeping department and general management so that they can review and respond to the issues that you noted here. Thank you for staying with us and providing this review.

Summary Heading: Worst Hotel we have ever stayed in.
Summary: Worst hotel we have ever stayed at. We had cockroaches, ants, old food left in the fridge, safe didn’t work and there was a nasty big yellow stain on a “clean” bath towel. Tried to get managers to call me back for 2 days with nothing. Finally got a manager to call us back and we were able to switch hotels but they did not honor the refund we had spoke about. So much time was wasted with this hotel instead of spending it with our kids like we should have been able to on a family vacation to Disneyland. DO NOT stay here if you want to enjoy your vacation.

We booked last minute, spent the day at Disneyland, didn't want to spend too much for a room.  The staff was ok, shuttle to disneyland and back was the best.  Room had no heat, went to complained at the desk, they said the rooms were fine. REALLY.  We put the little one to bed it was pretty late by then.  I take a look at my bed sheet... it's full of blood stains. Noise from the heavy traffic was annoying.  We checked out the next morning.

Great stay overall. It is nice and close to disneyland and the property is decently kept too. Prices are great too. There is a complimentary shuttle to Disneyland as well which is great. Staff are nice and there is a few cool facilities, bars, restaurants. Would recommend this spot for sure for anyone wanting to stay close to Disneyland without it costing an arm and an leg!
Manager Response: Thanks for your feedback, this information is very important to us and we are so glad that you had a great time here at the hotel. Please come back again soon. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Convenience is the best thing about this place
Summary: This hotel is very close to Disneyland and the shuttles were fairly prompt.  It boasts a lot of extra special activities that tend to disappoint.  The resident princess is often absent for whole days, the on site restaurant was published on the website when it wasn't open yet. the staff isn't all that attentive and getting a letter back from the princess required going above & beyond with follow up phone calls & emails for months after our visit.  Slowest, noisiest elevator I've ever experienced.  Giant room with a closet of a bathroom. The hotel is clean and very fun the pool is nice, but the customer service is severely lacking.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are sorry that you felt disappointed with some of the aspects of your stay. Our Princess Corinne is available on the days & times that are listed online and in the lobby as meet & greet days, we are sorry if your stay didn't coordinate with her visits in the castle. She is also busy ensuring that guests enjoy the magic of her castle and we are sorry she can't meet every guest, everyday. Additionally,  she tries very hard to respond to every letter that she receives but sometimes she is provided addresses that are incorrect or illegible and unfortunately can't get a letter back to these guests. We appreciate you providing this feedback and will share your concerns with the departments and management responsible.

Summary Heading: The Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel has a very frustrated guest tonight!
Summary: A very frustrating hotel experience. I checked into the hotel at 3:30. I immediately went to the room to discover our room faced significant road noise so I returned to the reception  to request a room change. The staff immediately moved me to another room with equally excessive road noise. I returned for a third time and yet again was given a room just off Interstate 5. Needless to say, I’m completely unimpressed by a hotel staff that can’t place me on an interior courtyard room. The staff was helpful in letting me know I could purchase ear plugs in the hotel’s store. Thus, if you would like a quiet room to relax after a busy day flying might I suggest you look elsewhere.

This hotel has it all, free transport to and from Disneyland, breakfast, lunch and dinner.    Conference rooms.   Friendly staff.   Clean rooms and spacious.   Very convenient location and easy access on:off the freeway.

We chose this property because of it’s close proximity to the Disney parks and I had seen generally good reviews on line.  We checked into the hotel after a long day visiting the parks.  I was exhausted and all I wanted was a hot shower and to crawl into bed.  What I got instead, was lukewarm water that was coming out at a trickle.  The following morning I gave it another try.  This time the water was not even warm, it was cold and the water pressure was even less than the night before (what is less than a trickle???).  We called the front desk and they said they would send someone up.  After waiting for quite a long time, someone finally knocked on the door.  At this point, I had already dressed and was all done with giving the bath a chance.  The maintenance person said that

I needed a one-night stay prior to attending a convention in Anaheim and found this location. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and the property had so much charm. The hotel grounds were so pretty. My only regret is I didn’t have my family with me. I would stay here again, especially if we were visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback and hope you'll be back to stay with us soon with your family. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Fraud and Misery at the Anaheim "Majestic" Garden Hotel
Summary: Based on decent Tripadvisor reviews, I decided to stay at this horrendous hotel to take advantage of the shuttle service to Disney Land (which would make it worth paying for overnight parking because it would avoid having to pay for parking at Disney) and because it seemed like an ok place to stay.  When we arrived we noticed long lines in front of the hotel and no shuttle.  We quickly learned from talking to the people in line that the shuttle that the hotel said would run every 30 minutes had been gone for over an hour.  I had a sense of foreboding that would become more intense over the course of our stay.  We went to the front desk to get a parking tag and got in line right away.  It took another 40 minutes for the shuttle to arrive.  After a day at Disney, the hotel's
