Summary: Came from WI for a surprise 16th Birthday for grandaughter...sent request with charge card info to have balloons in room when we arrived..not in room..asked for the next day then...NO balloons...hall way by our room had food laying on floor for the full 3 days...asked to have it cleaned..and not until night before we left was cleaned up. Also when we left i wrote and said I left something in room and asked that they call me...Never heard from them!! even tried calling. The good thing about the hotel is that the shuttle back and forth to Disney was perfect for us...If I ever came back would look for another Hotel!~

We love this hotel!  It's clean, the staff is great, the grounds are beautiful, the rooms are spacious and it's an easy shuttle ride to the parks.  The pool area is great too - clean and lots of seating.    The only suggestion I have is the option to order food from the restaurant (e.g. pizza) and pick it up versus room service.  We ended up ordering from Round Table because we didn't want to spent a fortune on little 10 inch pizzas from the restaurant.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your feedback from your stay with us, we appreciate it. Please share with your friends and family and come back and stay with us again soon. Thank you.

Summary: The staff is very friendly. They have a private shuttle to Disneyland and the hotel is huge.   Unfortunately my daughters air pods were suddenly missing after the first day of housekeeping. Not only missing, but she could no longer track them or pair up on her phone. They were fully charged but rather than assuming they were taken, we stripped the room and our luggage with no luck. They were last seen on top of her blanket which was on the bottom bunk in our room. She never pulled open the sheets to the bed, or even uncovered, our entire trip - except when we stripped the room down.   Oscar was who I spoke with the most of the 5 employees I spoke to during the week. He owed me a call the next day which I never received. Upon check out I spoke with him again and he assured me

We loved the hotel. It was big and done up lovely for Christmas. Our room was big and spacious and very clean. The shuttle to and from Disneyland all day was great, saved the tired legs.  Martin one of the shuttle drivers was so nice and Alex another shuttle driver was full of fun.  The kids on the shuttle loved him playing Disney Music and singing along.  Alex you are a great asset to the hotel. The only negative thing I have about the hotel was the charging for packages to be delivered there.  When you're an overseas guest and staying in the hotel it was a bit bad to be charged just for them to sign for the package(s).  I wouldn't have a problem with paying for storage if the parcels had been there for a few days, but while you are a guest at the hotel and staying there for 11
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your feedback from your stay with us, we appreciate it. Please share with your friends and family and come back and stay with us again soon. Thank you.

Summary: So convenient for Disneyland. There is a free shuttle from the hotel that runs all day.   Rooms - We had a double room, with 2 large queen beds. Room was huge, and did not feel at all cramped with 3 adults. The room has a bar fridge also. Beds were extremely comfortable.   Lobby - nice lobby with fire place and lots of Christmas decorations.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your feedback from your stay with us, we appreciate it. Please share with your friends and family and come back and stay with us again soon. Thank you.

Summary: Staff could not do enough, family room was huge and the shuttle service was brilliant! You can walk to Disneyland but it’s along a few busy roads and we found the shuttle was either always available or just a few minutes away. Only downside is the shower which has really low water pressure and is a bit dated. Otherwise brilliant stay and we will stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your feedback from your stay with us, we appreciate it. Please share with your friends and family and come back and stay with us again soon. Thank you.

Summary: When we go to Disneyland or Knott's Berry Farm we always stay here.  Rooms are always clean, staff is friendly, secure parking and a shuttle to Disney and back.  They have a bar, two restaurants, and a snack bar too.  The grounds are really nice and you can view the Disneyland Fireworks from multiple locations.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your feedback from your stay with us, we appreciate it. Please share with your friends and family and come back and stay with us again soon. Thank you.

Summary: Spent Christmas holidays with my family in Anaheim with 3 days at Disneyland! The hotel is wonderful and well decorated for the holidays! The rooms are spacious and clean, staff is very accommodating and the restaurants are great! Free Shuttles to Disneyland every half hour and a pool, hot tub and fitness center on site. The gardens are well decorated and there is a koi pond.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your feedback from your stay with us, we appreciate it. Please share with your friends and family and come back and stay with us again soon. Thank you.

Summary: I would like to give this beautiful hotel a great review but after talking to the desk staff about a coupon they give out if you don’t get your room cleaned for two days I’m going to rate the hotel less. If I had of known the $5 coupon would be such an issue I wouldn’t of asked. I honestly wanted to cry after being treated that poorly. We didn’t get our room cleaned the 3rd day because our little one was having a much needed nap from being sick and all the exhaustion of the parks. He is not a light sleeper either. This desk staff who wasn’t wearing a name tag made me feel like garbage for doing what was best for my child. I would recommend staying closer to the park anyways where you can walk instead of waiting for a shuttle.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback. We are sorry you felt that you were treated poorly. We take interactions with our guests very seriously and would like to get more details from you to better understand the situation. If you are willing to provide us more details please call the hotel and speak with a manager about your stay. Thank you.

Summary Heading: A Tired and Gaudy (for my taste)
Summary: We stayed here for two nights in November.  It is a huge, rambling hotel, a warren of halls, designed to maximize the rooms - each, of course, with a window.  However, many windows looked across a narrow, dark outdoor space into another window.  Some have views of some more pleasant court yards.   I realize that there is a demand for hotels/rooms with castle or Disney-like themes.  Our room had dark brocade curtains and other design choices of this nature - and was not to my taste.  It just seemed dark and tired.  The room was, otherwise, large and comfortable with the standard amenities such as coffee, refrig, hair dryer, shampoo etc. The free rides to Disneyland were necessary, even this location.  We rode on the first buses in the AM - which were full (no standing allowed) so

Mediocre customer service. Outdated facility with no modern means. Rooms are poor with very limited power outlets, towels and coffee. Good shuttle service to and from Disneyland. Facility lacking many comfort means.

Went to turn light on in room, and there were a scattering of cockroaches.  Husband checked bed and there were bed bugs in the bed.  Immediately left the hotel and went to a cleaner hotel - a Sheraton.  Ever since this place was bought by this new ownership, place has gone downhill.  Not at all cleanly like it used to be.  The word "Majestic" does not belong in the title of hotel because it is the complete opposite of majestic.  More like disgusting.

Nuff said! This place just gets dirtier and dirtier ever since it's changed ownership.  Staff are clueless - especially front desk.  Be careful with reservations with this hotel too, they seem to be running out of money, so there were a lot of errorneous charges on our bill that we never charged to our room.

I was freaking out reading all the poor reviews but no issues here. The room is huge (king size bed) super comfy,  bathroom is very tight. Yes it's an older hotel shows its age. Shuttle service is great except *some drivers don't help with loading  stroller in the back* but very convenient and it's only about a 5 minute ride to the park. Its also walkable 20 mins. One drawback no safes in the room but they have safety deposit boxes at the front desk for free. Ordered room service it was fast and hot. I would recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your feedback from your stay with us, we appreciate it. Please share with your friends and family and come back and stay with us again soon. Thank you.

Summary: I was kind of skeptical about staying here since I saw mixed reviews, but I enjoyed my stay here. Our room was larger than most rooms we have stayed at. The beds were okay and the restroom was a bit small. I found a strand of hair in the bathroom sink which made me question did they even bother to clean the restroom? I also didn’t like the fact that there was no central light just a bunch of lamps. The outlets were loose as well and there wasn’t many options to plug in your phone chargers. We had a nice view of the fireworks which was a plus. We also had the chance to try the happy hour downstairs which was an awesome plus! Try their wings they are so good as well as their onion rings. The decor of Christmas was well put up all around the hotel and they even have a shuttle which
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your review of your stay here with us. We are pleased you enjoyed your stay and the hotel amenities. Please come back again and stay with us soon. Thank you.

Summary Heading: I love staying at this hotel.
Summary: This hotel has become my favorite to stay at when visiting Disneyland. I love staying there around the holidays because they go above and beyond with creative themed Christmas trees. The staff are very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for this wonderful review. We are happy that you enjoy the holiday decorations and the amenities the hotel offers. Please share with your friends and come back again soon. Thank you.

Summary: Lobby was relaxing, rooms were super clean and beds were comfortable. The shuttle drivers were friendly, accommodating and reliable. This was our 3rd trip to the hotel and we could not think of a better place to stay. Grabbed sandwiches at the deli for our flight home.   Highly recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for this feedback and we are happy to hear you are repeat guests that love the hotel. Please do tell your friends and come back and see us again soon. Thank you!

Summary: Hotel was super outdated, lots of janky stuff and dirty tubs/toilets.  Tried room service and it was gross, tried to give it another chance two days later and it was still disgusting. Super bland and extremely overpriced... $40 for pasta, salad and a soda. Do yourself a favor and order delivery from literally anywhere else !

Place is very outdated, bad rust in bathtub, stains on towels, wallpaper on bathroom walls coming off, tub wouldnt drain and toilet not take down waste, took 3 flushes, took # days to fix/repair!! I spoke to 2 dif managers and asked for a credit for the inconvience of the plumbing, and as of today i see no credit on card, said they could move me but i have a handicap in room and would take upto 4 hours to move to set up his machines and then time lost at disneyland!, i  The hotel desk has control of the buildings rooms on heater and air conditioner??? Furniture was so outdated, bed lumpy.  Deli food looked so old and yucky, Japanese restaurant very expensive didnt get much for price, there is no where else to eat in the area without jumping in car and traveling.   Never ever
Manager Response: We are very sorry that you feel this way and we would like to discuss your review and see how we can help. Can you please provide your contact information of call us here at the hotel toll free at 1-844-227-8535 and ask for Tchi Willette our Director of Operations. Thank you.

Summary: This was the second time we stayed at the Majestic Hotel.  The hotel is nice and the rooms are good and the beds are comfortable. The staff is very friendly and it’s great that they have a free shuttle ride to Disneyland.  They even have a good breakfast buffet but you have to pay for it. Hotel is priced right, very family friendly oriented and I would definitely recommend you stay here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for being a repeat guest of the hotel. We are happy you enjoyed your stay and welcome you back anytime. Thank you!

Summary: Good: room was very spacious with a separate vanity. Bad: rust stains in the bathtub. Frame on the bathroom mirror paint was peeling off. Not enough outlets. Room was 80 degrees and ac was shut off for the entire hotel. Tech said he would bring a fan but never did. We were overcharged for an extra car we didnt have. Didnt utilize their maid service so we could get the gift card from the deli, but we never got it. They need to do allot of improvements.
Manager Response: We are very sorry that you feel this way and we would like to discuss your review and see how we can help. Can you please provide your contact information of call us here at the hotel toll free at 1-844-227-8535 and ask for Tchi Willette our Director of Operations. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Do Yourself a Favor and Don’t Do It
Summary: I don’t normally leave poor reviews but having read several conflicting reviews on this hotel I thought I’d share my recent experience. Under no circumstances should you book a room in the Garden Tower unless you have really low expectations. I think the rooms in the castle have been renovated and are probably great but we were put in the garden tower which was just fairly clean, not renovated, and the temperature in our room was very humid and warm. I talked to the front desk about it (very politely) on our way out to dinner and they were very uninterested and let me know the thermostat was automatically set for the entire building based on the temperature outside and there was nothing they could do to change it. I totally get what she’s saying but the person I spoke with was

Stayed 3 nights with my son while visiting Disneyland. The room itself was clean, with comfy beds and enough space in the room to not feel cramped.     The hotel has beautiful garden feel, an impressive lobby, and arcade which my son loved. There is a small market with essentials, however pricey which is expected.   Shuttle service is the best. They are very accommodating and fast. We never had to wait longer than 15 minutes for a shuttle.     I like that the room doors dont face outside!    The downside.. unlike other hotels, nothing is close or easy to walk to from here. Starbucks is close but you have to walk over a major road and then go over the I5. Same with the gas station. Cant walk anywhere really. Anytime we needed food/drinks I drove to a nearby market. No
Manager Response: Thank you for this feedback and we appreciate you being a guest of the hotel. We are pleased you enjoyed the hotel amenities. Our location is a difficult issue to resolve for future visits, however the Resort area was designed with guests walking in mind. All streets and areas around the hotel have wide sidewalks and are lit very well. Many guests enjoy walking around the resort area. Again, thank you for your review; we love getting this feedback from our guests. Thank you.

Summary: This hotel was clean and the lobby was very nice.  The shuttle was convenient although it didn’t really seem to follow the schedule.  My biggest complaint is there was only one accessible outlet in our room.  And it was in a very inconvenient location at the end of one of the beds.  There wasn’t even an outlet near the desk!  This made charging our phones and portable charger impossible.  They really need to upgrade and even get the lamps with USB ports.  Bring a power strip of you plan on staying here!

Summary Heading: Wonderful place to stay for Disney
Summary: Loved this place. Excellent location with half hourly free shuttle to and from Disney, friendly and helpful staff, excellent facilities, great food and breakfast buffet (including omelette station), lovely rooms - and all for a reasonable price. Really couldn't have asked for anything more. We'll be back.

I have stay at this hotel many times, including when it was a sheraton. The rooms are very large, however they need to update their charging startions, and phones.  The garden tower is very outdated.  I like this hotel for the shuttle service, however, when trying to get to magic morning, one day the shuttle driver, took for ever to get going. Perhaps on these early mornings, the shuttle driver could make an effort to leave promptly and get the guests to gates before the drop rope.   The other problem don't use their in house cab, he doesn't have set rates and charges what he wants.

Summary Heading: Absolute best hotel for Disney trips
Summary: Absolutely my favorite hotel for Disneyland trips.  The hotel staff is fantastic, the property is very clean, spacious and beautiful.  They have a live Princess walking around to charm the kids, Koi ponds, salt water aquariums, quiet reading areas, restaurants, an arcade, etc.  Great property.  Currently all decked out for the Holidays.  Free shuttle every 30 minutes to and from Disneyland.  This place is the best.  Special shout out to Leslie and the front desk staff.  True pros, all of them!

I have stayed at this hotel many times. I really enjoy it. This last visit left me upset, and frustrated by the hotels lack of communication. I booked a specific room, because I thought my mother in law might like this room style better. When I checked in, they switched my room to a different room without asking me if that was ok. I thought that was a little strange. We get to the room, and as soon as we walk in with all our luggage, I realize it’s not the room I booked. I thought it was unfair that they did not ask. I called the front desk and politely expressed why would they not ask.   Before heading up to the room I asked the special ticket counter how long they would be selling Disneyland tickets today. The gentleman working there stated until 8pm. After going to our room

Just returned from our stay and wanted to set record straight on this hotel. The hotel is clean and beautifully landscaped. It is a peaceful oasis in a very busy area. It provides a shuttle to Disneyland which was always on time with kind and friendly drivers. During busy hours they provided more than one bus so we never had to wait long for a shuttle. Our room was large and comfortable with a lovely view. It was always refreshed in a timely manner. We used the dining area each morning for breakfast before taking the shuttle to Disneyland and were never disappointed in either the buffet or the menu choices. We wished our grandchildren were with us because of nice child menu selections as well as Princess Corrine in lobby. I am so glad I stuck with this hotel despite prior trip

I’ve been staying at this hotel on and off for the past several years, some for business and some with family.   It’s location to Disneyland Resort is actually not too bad and that’s what really brings people here.  The hotel staff has always been friendly and checking in typically doesn’t take too long.  If you bring a car there is a parking fee.   The rooms here are spacious actually, even the standard ones. Bathrooms are small but they work.   This hotel used to be an old Sheraton Hotel and when you get to your room your phone may still say that.   There are some things about this place that o wish they would change and update but truthfully it’s a 3 star hotel and will always stay that way.  Some easy things though would be to add USB charging ports to each room. You can do

Summary Heading: Very Pleased with Staff and Value of this hotel
Summary: When booking a theme park hotel we always look for cleanliness and location and this had both.  I saw another guest complaining about the shuttle service. But with this hotel you have your own shuttle and don't stop at a million other hotels when you are exhausted before heading to your own.  We did have to wait for the shuttle on Saturday night but then they arrived with 3 shuttles to transport guests back to the hotel.  Note: we were staying at the hotel when the park was at peak over the Veteran's Day weekend.  The staff was very friendly (especially housekeeping staff).  Rooms were large and clean. Price was right for the location. We were also starving when we came back from the park and ordered room service. The menu was much priced better than the theme park and was of

Summary Heading: Dated, terrible hotel with shabby shuttle service
Summary: If you are staying at this hotel after booking through Priceline, demand they accommodate you somewhere else immediately!  They shove you in the worst room possible out side of the main building right on top of the free way.  Room is dated with Forrest wall paper, HVAC unit that is decrepit and does not work, sinking beds, showers with no pressure...awful!  I am sitting here at Disneyland typing this after waiting for more than 45 minutes and still at least another shuttle pick up away from getting back.  This is unacceptable to have such a crazy line of YOUR guests waiting for a shuttle while every other hotels lines are empty. You should be embarrassed.

The room we got was filthy and in severely outdated condition. The décor MAY have been acceptable if it was well-maintained, adequately cleaned, and presentable. I am not exaggerating by saying that my fiancé and I were horrified by the state of our initial room. It seemed as though the rooms were in a different hotel from the grounds, entry, lobby, and other common areas which were actually quite nice.  We changed rooms but the next one wasn't a significant improvement.  However, customer service is good overall and we were partially compensated for our issues with the room(s), but I cannot recommend this hotel nor will I stay there again until rooms are renovated.

Summary Heading: Stay away if you don't want your belonging got stolen!
Summary: My family and I stayed in the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel for our Disneyland trip from Oct 14-17. We stayed there 3 nights and only requested one time for the room cleanup on Oct 16th. My wife realized that her Apple Airpod got stolen after the housekeeping on that day. She used her phone to keep track of the Apple Airpod and it showed the last location was inside our room. I have talked to the front desk, she asked me to fill out the lost and found form and will have someone to call me to give me an update the next day. On the next day, I didn't receive any calls from the hotel, so I called and talked to the manager regarding the incident. I was told that she will conduct an internal investigation and promise will call me back to provide me with an update. Again, I didn't

My son and I stayed her for 3 nights. On checking in the lady didn’t smile or seem like she wanted to be there. She then told us the wrong way to our room which after 24 hours of being awake and travelling you don’t want to walk around a massive hotel that seems like a maze. A helpful maintenance man “Humberto” helped us find the way. Once entering the room it was old and worn with no usb outlets. One plug socket on the wall was hanging off and couldn’t hold our UK adapter. I went down to reception and the said maintenance man came to inspect our room. He then brought us an extension socket that could hold our adapters. He was the only happy member of staff I encountered. The beds were comfortable at least. The restaurant was very poor and expensive for what you got and the deli

First off let me say that I booked this room using credit card points. Now, I knew I would be arriving around midnight on the date of my arrival. Since their check in cut off is 3 am I thought I'd be ok. Even so I tried calling the hotel 3 times to confirm this and each time I got a very short tempered employee that would forward my call to the reservations department that never answered. I drove 8 hours to make sure I got to the hotel in time. Once I arrived (at 1am after traffic) I was told that they could see I had a reservation but no room was assigned to me. So I had to wait around for them to find an available room. The front desk person tried to call the evening manager for 20 mins to get the ok before she actually answered her phone. About 40 mins after I arrived I got a

Check in went smooth.  It was a bit of a maze to our room.   So pay attention to what hall you go thru.  The room smelled musty.   The bed was comfortable.   But the curtains were dirty and hard to open. The table and night stands had finger prints.    A shelf to the left of the toilet was was filthy.   The shuttle bus driver was friendly.  But, the shuttle bus needed some cleaning.  The windows of the bus were dirty and old.   The air conditioner didn’t work very well.     I expected more from Majestic Garden Hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and we are sorry for the issues you mentioned in your guest room. Obviously this is not how we would like for your to experience the hotel. We will share your concerns with the Housekeeping management team and ensure these issues are taken care of. We hope that you will give us another try when you are back  in the Anaheim area. Thank you!

Summary: I stayed with my son for 4 nights, friendly staff, rooms are good, food has a resonable pricing. The number one reason that I booked this hotel is because of the free shuttle to Disneyland parks. Would definitely recommend this hotel
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your recent stay with us. We are so pleased that you enjoyed the hotel and our free shuttle service. Please do tell your friends and we look forward to having you as our guest again soon. Thank you!

Summary: My two boys, ages 12 and 14, and I visit Disneyland a few times a year and have stayed at a few different hotels around the theme parks. This hotel was wonderful! The theming was spot on, the rooms were spacious and clean, and the staff were all terrific! The shuttle was such a blessing and each driver was professional and friendly! We did utilize in room dining a couple times and the food was delicious and reasonably priced. If you are looking for a high end hotel on a dime budget you'll be disappointed but if you're looking for a moderate hotel that is comfortable, clean, and welcoming, this is a great place to stay. I will warn, when I was checking in the front desk doesn't take non chipped cards for the incidental hold so I had to get $100 cash from their ATM. Also, the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your recent stay. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the hotel and all the amenities that we have to offer our guests. We look forward to your return to the hotel in the near future. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Not bad, better than I expected
Summary: On my last trip to Disneyland, we stayed at the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel. I was on a budget and this hotel met our needs, however, I expected we'd be in an old and smelly place. Having previously stayed in a Disney property, I wanted the best I could find within my budget. Although the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel is an older property, it was clean and well maintained. They don't offer a complementary breakfast, but they have a nice buffet and offer $5 off if you don't want your room cleaned. I personally hold off on that anyway as I don't like having someone enter my room and move my things around. The pool is open until 11, which was a nice bribe to get the kids to leave Disneyland willingly.  The room was big and the beds were comfortable.  The free shuttle to the parks
Manager Response: Thank for your feedback, we appreciate your review. We are happy you enjoyed the hotel and that you were able to take advantage of our "Go Green" initiative here at the hotel. We look forward to having you back again with us soon. Thank you!

Summary: Hotel is beautiful, minutes from the park and provides hourly shuttles. Despite being busy the rooms are quiet. Rooms are also large and we'll appointed.  Staff was friendly and the food at the hotel is quite good as well which is welcome after a day at the parks where everything comes with lines and outrageous prices.  Would absolutely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are so pleased that you enjoyed your time here at our Castle. We hope to have you back again with us in the near future. Thank you!

Summary: For 10+ years I have stayed at The Disneyland Hotel. Now that I am retired that was not finnacially an option. This hotels staff is GREAT! From the front desk, bus drivers, house keeping restaurant/bar staff all were top notch and need a pay raise! The only negitive I have is there is no safe in the room. For 1/3 the price of The Disneyland Hotel and not missing out on much "Disney Magic", from now on this is my "go to" hotel in Anaheim! Thank you Majestic Garden Hotel for a wonderful, magical, worry free stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are so pleased that you enjoyed your time here at our Castle and especially our staff. We hope to have you back again with us in the near future. Thank you!

Summary: This hotel was a pleasure to stay in , it was warm , welcoming and the staff where really helpful . The lobby is pretty and has a lovely garden and small pool for children , a games room , little shop with cafe reasonably priced with friendly staff . There’s lots of rest rooms really clean , the restaurant is very good and breakfast was buffet style with plenty of choice . The room was very clean and massive for the two of us , there was a fridge but no safe , you can ask at reception for a safety deposit box . Parking for 24 hours is $18 but we left our car there after we checked out to go to Disney for no extra charge . The hotel runs an excellent shuttle bus to and from Disney for no extra charge every 15 minutes which save paying parking fees . The whole stay was wonderful
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are so pleased that you enjoyed your time here at our Castle and all the amenities that we have to offer our guests. We hope to have you back again with us in the near future. Thank you!

Summary: This was a surprisingly huge hotel! Lobby area was different and was quite cozy. We only spent one night as a transition stay so couldn't take advantage of all the hotel had to offer but it looked pretty cool. The price was quite affordable for the area and the free shuttle to and from Disney is great. Only recommendation is they have more shuttles when park closes as some people did not get on when we returned. Room was nice and big but washroom somewhat small. And there is no safe in the room which was disappointing. Don't really want to carry passports around when visiting Disney.

Summary Heading: Excellent property though the experience of stay was not of the best class
Summary: I had selected this hotel after getting recommendations from Disneyland website as a good neighbor hotel. Hotel property is no doubt excellent however there were a few unpleasant experiences during our stay. First of all they did not have room service after 11pm and from 10:45pm the guest services refuse calls from the room. Even the Deli have a limited options available for food and drinks. The shuttles to and fro Disneyland were low in frequency in-spite of the fact that it is one of the busiest hotel in entire Anaheim. Rooms given to us had bad views, half of the window faced the wall and half of it a corner of the garden in-spite of paying for a garden / pool view room. Food was overpriced, and there was a leak in the bath tub. They could not arrange a birthday cake even

Summary Heading: Great hotel close to the Disney Parks
Summary: We are staying here for 9 nights.  Great rooms, awesome breakfast, free shuttle to the parks, nice staff. I couldnt ask for more. You can see the fireworks Really nice hotel and i can really recommend it.

Summary Heading: We found our new fav in Anaheim!  Great for families
Summary: Very much enjoyed this hotel.  Lobby, breakfast, and transportation to Disneyland are excellent.  You probably wouldn't want to walk to Disneyland, given the freeway crossings.  Still, its an absolute bargain for the price.  We found the small store downstairs to be a lifesaver when our 2 yr old came down with the flu.

Summary Heading: You can see the fireworks, free shuttle, and they offer
Summary: You can see the fireworks, free shuttle, and they offer AN ADDITIONAL BED...my aunt and niece and I stayed here and they brought up a twin bed...it was a real mattress not an air mattress for my 9 year old niece. I live in los angeles and we stayed here just so we could get to the park super early when my aunt and niece were visiting.

They put me as far from the front desk as possible in a room with two beds when I booked one with a king. The air conditioning barely works and the room is stuck at 78 degrees. The hotel is clearly dated and is trying to be something it isn’t. Would never call this a resort. I will never stay here again. And I’ve only been here an hour.
Manager Response: We are sorry to hear that your stay thus far isn't living up to your expectations. Have you requested a room change from the front desk. I am sure that there is another room that we can get you into that would be closer and with the requested bed type. Please stop by the front desk and speak with a manager about a room change and I will let them know to expect you. Thank you!

Summary: Beware if there is an error when booking using their website or you accidentally book for the same time you make the reservation and don’t catch it in 24 hours, these guys will charge you the no-show fee without question or care for you as a potential longer term customer.  They lost all my future business over a $100 no show fee that was applied out of principle (despite us trying to resolve the error) and they lack of any real management.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and we are sorry that you feel this way. It is important for the hotel to adhere to room booking policies stated on reservations especially during our peak season. This would include no show fees and cancellation of rooms that have a "non cancel" policy attached at the time of booking. However, all of these policies are clearly stated on our booking sites at the time you are confirming your reservations. Thank you!

Summary: We stayed at the Majestic Garden Hotel between the 3rd and 6th August 2019, we visited Disneyland/California Adventure on the 4th and 5th August.  We chose the hotel due to it's location near to Disneyland and we were not disappointed.   The hotel was very welcoming and the staff were mostly very helpful.  The hotel itself was in a very convenient location for our visits to Disneyland and the free shuttle bus was fabulous, the drivers were excellent and even did an extra trip when the bus was really full one evening meaning we didn't have to wait for half an hour (which is not a massive amount of time to wait really).   We ate in the restaurant twice and the food was nice, it wasn't fine dining but it was all good and what we expected.   On the day we arrived we went to use the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and comments about your visit. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your time here in the hotel. We work hard to ensure our guests are happy and satisfied; so it's a pleasure to hear that you enjoyed your stay. Thank you.

Summary: I will give 5 stars for the size of the room, very spacious.  It has a powder room with sink. I will give 3 stars for the housekeepers, if I don’t remind them for extra shampoo, they’ll only give us 1 which is not enough for 3 people. Same thing with tea, I had to remind them. When you are in Disneyland, everything are expensive and you’ll appreciate to get the freebies in your hotel room. Wifi is also a big concern, in our room which is in the garden tower area, we didn’t get the connection 95%. We were located first floor almost to the end so that’s probably the reason. We asked to be moved but there was no room available and we could not change hotel either because there none available except the Disney hotel which is $500 - $700/ night.  The shuttle bus is very convenient
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and details about your stay that concerned you. I will make sure the management for the responsible departments is aware of these concerns so that they can be addressed for future guests of the hotel. We are happy to see that you mentioned other areas of the hotel that you were happy with. Thank you for your review.

Summary: The hotel is huge, with lots of services. Room was really big and clean. The cleanliness of the bathroom was a bit disappointing on the other hand. Fridge and coffe maker present. There is a restaurant inside where the food is pretty good. I went for work so not many info about Disneyland but the hotel is in front of it with a ticket desk and transportation to it. Overall a good hotel, maybe a bit dated but still functional.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your recent stay with us. We hope to have you back again as our guest. We work hard to ensure that our guests are happy and satisfied with their time with us. Thank you!

Summary: Clean room, good service, quiet :)   Wanted to go to this hotel for ages, finally made it and truly must say it’s worth the stay.   Everything you can wish for.  Everything you can wish for. $18 parking fee is definitely OK and so are the $16 for the breakfast if you book and half does not include.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us and everything that the hotel has to offer. Please come back again soon. Thank you!

Summary: Wish I could give a 3.5. It was serviceable, and honestly if you are spending most of your time in the parks, who cares? It was clean and had beds to sleep in. Dining room food was average, and the CA Deli was closed even though the in-room info said it should be open. Warning though - they hold a deposit on your card in addition to the cost of the room (seemingly like many establishments in CA). They wouldn't take one of my credit cards b/c it had my husband's name (we go them mixed up). But, shuttle works and gets you to the parks quickly!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the time you spent here with us. We are happy you enjoyed most aspects of your stay. We will make sure that the managers of the departments are made aware of the other items that concerned you from your stay. I am glad to hear that our Front Desk staff followed our policy about credit cards and asked for a different one with your name on it; this is a protection for You! Thank you.

Summary: We are staying at this hotel in Anaheim.  I must say when we arrived I was taken aback by the beauty of this hotel.  The gardens and the front of the hotel are impeccable.  Going inside was stunning, check in was quick and we walked to the room.  We have a king suite and my oh my, the room is huge.   Beautifully appointed.   Swimming pool, guest laundry, breakfast is available and plentiful.  They have shuttles that run all the time to take you and bring you back from Disney.  You can also purchase your Disney tickets at this hotel. It is a very safe area and has I. The vicinity of 480 rooms.   It looks like a Tudor palace.   We love it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review on your recent stay with us. We appreciate the kind words and hope you'll be back again to stay with us soon. Thank you!

Summary: The positive:  I enjoyed this hotel. I needed a super early check in and they catered to my request.  I was able to park my car there for the day and take advantage of their free shuttle service to Disneyland until I returned late that night for an open room.  The amenities are convenient. The style of the interior and exterior are very welcoming.  Very decently priced.   The negative:  The only reason why I didn't give this an "Excellent" is because there was no breakfast included; only for purchase.   Overall, I would recommend this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your recent stay with us. We are pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us and just wanted to point out that we offer several types of reservations options here including rates that include breakfast. Please take a look at our special and/or packages page on the website for the best offers and deals we can provide. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Great hotel, little far from resturants
Summary: The check in went very smoothly and pleasant. I found it strange that there are no safes in the rooms, I was told I can store my valuables at the front desk. The room itself was very clean. What brought down the overall mark for this hotel was their shuttle service. They move a lot of people and do an amazing job 80 percent of the time. It is the early morning service that there is a problem with, on days Disneyland offers early admissions they offer one shuttle at 6:30, if you miss or if it is full it they do not offer anymore services until 7:30. By 7:30 they have enough people to fill two buses, the had 3 drivers standing at the bell hop desk but refused to run an extra bus early. At 7:30 they now load 2 buses, my question was why not offer a 7 am bus to reduce the foot

Summary Heading: NIce place to stay with great shuttle service to and from Disney parks
Summary: BUS to and from the parks ran very well, at peak time (Park close) you may have to wait for the next bus as they can fill up, but at the end of the day they really do a good job of getting people back to the hotel.  Plenty of parking, you have to pay for it, but there is little free parking the area and cheaper to pay parking at the hotel and bus to the parks than park in another location and pay for Disney parking.

We enjoyed our stay here. The free shuttle service to Disneyland was very convenient and was worth paying for parking.  Many restaurants and other attractions in the immediate area.  Pool is nice. We were able to see Disneyland fireworks from the hotel. Room was spacious enough for two.

Great location, price...Would have given a 5 but shuttle waited for late comers and caused us to miss reservation. Called bell service twice no answer...figured they were busy... when got downstairs 4 ladies behind reception chitchatting and no one checking in and out. Seems petty but pulling bags on rugs is not fun.   Cynthia at the bar and Alex check in bell went above and beyond!

Summary Heading: Clean, comfortable & well priced with easy access to Disneyland
Summary: Good quality family accomodation with easy access to Disneyland thanks to the free shuttle.  The hotel is well kept and whilst the rooms are older they are very clean and a good size.  Beds were comfortable with good quality linen, plenty of towels in the bathroom.  Housekeeping did a great job each day.   Nice pool area, and a guest laundry which was very handy when travelling with a family.  Friendly porters/bus drivers who arranged a private transfer back to LAX for us at a reasonable price.  Disney desk onsite to purchase tickets, and shuttle runs regularly back and forth to Disneyland - less than a 5 minute bus trip.  Shuttle does get busy around closing time and sometimes we had to wait for up to 30 minutes.  Hotel provides all you need when visiting Disneyland - a place

We recently stayed at the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel... which we nick named the Anaheim Decrepid Hotel with plants...  Once upon a time (in the cheesy spirit of the place) this was a nice hotel.. They are "celebrating" the fact that it has been in business for 50 years.  And it looks like it.  Years (decades?) of neglect have left it shabby and tired.  One has to wonder if the sections of missing roof tiles and falling off woodwork are a danger to guests..  The broken windows held together with scotch tape are clearly a danger.  The rooms are large (good) In comparison the bathrooms are microscopic and barely large enough for one person. The furnishings are severely worn, dirty and a hodge podge of hand me downs from the previous 50 years.  It smells... sorry but it does..

We love this hotel, great for families who cant afford Disney Hotels. Great pool for the family, large hotel grounds to walk around and sit around random benches next mini waterfalls and ponds. Great lounge to sit and relax for conversations, Has tv's and fireplace perfect during Christmas time

The two of us were traveling to visit the Disneyland Parks, and this hotel just was not for us. This property seems great for budget-minded families who wish to be close to the park. Many of the groups staying there seemed to be enjoying themselves. My husband and I are sticklers for detail, and this property is overdue for a new finish & room updates.  Despite the building's physical shortcomings, the service was great. Our first room had so many small problems we requested to be moved. We received great service at the front desk; the agent listened to our issues and did the right thing to move us into a different room.

This hotel is close to Disney but that’s it for the positives. It seems old and looks dirty due to aging carpet and such. The shower drain was rusty and very little water pressure. Bathroom sink was extremely slow draining. The bathroom door is cheap particle board and it is deteriorating. Thin walls are thin so we heard a lot of noises from other rooms and hallways.

Hotel was very clean. Parking was fine. 18 dollars a night. We could watch the fireworks from the hotel which worked out well.  9 minute drive to Disney or a short walk. Whichever your preference. Easy check out. Free shuttle bus to disney. Shower wasnt very powerful and no safe in the room.

I booked this hotel for 4 days and 3 nights. I stayed at this hotel for my vacation to DISNEYLAND and CALIFORNIA ADVENTURES PARKS with my kids. When we arrived to the hotel at 2p, the staff was very nice to let us check in early than 4p, because my room was ready. When I first walked to this hotel, I got lost inside because it's very confusing and hard to find the way out. And after for a few hours later, I finally remember how to figure out to get to my room. This hotel looked so "SPACIOUS" and "SPECTACULAR". It was so clean and huge to walk in this hotel. The room I had was "TRADITIONAL"  and it was nice and clean. But, the only thing I didn't like is the room has no "MICROWAVE", only FRIDGE. Other than that, every thing is gorgeous. Just so you know, for the arcades and pool

After a quick one day trip to Disneyland after a cruise we stayed at the Majestic Garden. The staff was very nice and helpful. You're able to buy your park passes right in the lobby and catch the complimentary shuttle to the park. When we returned (early evening) we enjoyed a great meal in the dining room. The rooms were awesome and ours had a back door that opened up into the courtyard where we could watch the fireworks from Disneyland. Probably the best view from below you could get as the fireworks were exploding right above our hotel! We had a very early flight out the next morning and the hotel staff recommended a fantastic driver to get us to the airport on time who's much more reasonable than a taxi. I would totally recommend this hotel for your Disneyland stays!

While I didnt take pics of the Hotel, it was clean and fairly comfortable. It was a great place to stay while visiting Disneyland. It had all the amenities that we needed, and the shuttle to the park was a great plus.

Wow what a wonderful hotel. We had switched out reservation from a leading chain to here becuase of the price. The rooms are huge. They have a couple of restaurants. The buffett in the Bistro is wonderful. The staff is very helpful. Lush grounds with beautful roses, Koi Pond, gazebo. Very quiet. They offer a free shuttle to Disneyland. It was so nice at night to see the trees lit up . For the size of the hotel it was a wonderful experience

The hotel is geared for families in my opinion. The price was right.  The hotel staff were friendly. The decor is quite dated. However the rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. The layout of the hotel is a bit awkward.   The gardens of the hotel are quite pretty!  The breakfast was fine if you like buffet style.  The shuttle is a plus except the line ups are very long, we ubered many times instead of waiting! Overall, it was a decent hotel and a great price.

We visited here for 3 nights during our visit from the UK. Hotel is big, staff weren’t overly helpful and we got lost getting to our room due to poor direction from the staff. The corridors were dirty, very dated decor and smelled of cigarette smoke and occasionally weed which we found extremely disappointing. Our room was big, bathroom was clean and our room was fairly clean which was the main thing! Nice addition the free shuttle service to and from Disneyland but prepare for a queue!!! Probably wouldn’t stay again as we have stayed in cleaner hotels closer to Disneyland.

We chose the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel for our trip to Disneyland for many reasons; proximity to the parks, the complimentary shuttle to and from the parks, and the breakfast that was included. Our only complaints with those reasons are that the shuttle can be a little inconsistent or fills quickly especially in the morning and the breakfast isn’t great.   Our concerns don’t really have to do with the reasons we chose the hotel. First, when we checked in the hotel bill was more than what we were told when booking. The issue was that we were paying for parking which was included in the deal we selected. If you don’t have it included, it is $18/day. Second, we always check the sheets when arriving and we had to have a whole bed changed because of a red/brown stain. When

The hotel is really nice.  A great fit for a big family with little kids. The shuttle to Disneyland was a HUGE plus but be prepared to wait as the lines het really long. The restaurants were less than mediocre. The staff was very polite and helpful.

This hotel originally caught my eye with the good prices. However there are so many hidden prices, including paying $20 for parking per car per night as well as a 20 dollar breakfast, similar to the free continental breakfast found anywhere.   The shuttle service was horrendous, the timing was inconsistent and very unprofessionally done. Save yourself time and frustration and don’t stay here.

We loved everything about this hotel and for its class (mid-range) it is excellent. The staff was so pleasant and helpful (with the exception of one grumpy evening waitress) and they were always busy cleaning. The bathrooms need updating but they were clean, like the rest of the hotel. I loved the variety in the breakfast items from day to day, the breakfast staff were so pleasant and the food tasted great. We didn't find the walk to Disney long at all (we did three round trips the first day), but then we didn't have small children with us. We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Decent Value For A Disneyland Trip
Summary: Overall I liked the theme and value of this hotel.  The castle theme and characters were a nice touch for the kids.  The castle bunk beds were one of the big selling points.  The shuttle to the park was pretty reliable.  The food was above average, and seemed to be priced practical for the area.  Service was hit or miss.  We were tired after a long day at the park and chose to seat our selves at a booth in the lounge area instead of waiting for somebody to come around and seat us in the restaurant, and the bar tender was rude and grouchy.  She made a show about how little girls had to behave or something along that line, but came across as mean.  There was no need as we were all tired and beat.  There were other families in the lounge at the time.  Maybe it was the grumpy bar

We stayed at the Majestic Hotel which provided a free shuttle to Disneyland! It left every 30 minutes for Disneyland and was always there to pick you up at the given times! We stayed in an affordable room and my bed wasn’t as comfortable as I thought it would be and you could hear water running through pipes in the wall all day and all night! It was on the 3rd floor! Because of that I was unable to get a quite nights sleep! Parking was $18 a night additional!  We didn’t use the restaurants but we did get water and a few things at the gift shop which was convenient. It has a outdoor pool and spa which we didn’t use also because the weather was kind of cool and windy!  The TV reception came and went many times and they didn’t have very many outlets for your phone charging

Summary Heading: Pretty hotel, nice people at front desk
Summary: Good relation between quality/price, expensive parking, pretty gardens, close to Disney, the Rooms would be nicest with a refresh , has transportation o Disney, clean hotel and they have an adorable mini cinema

We love the majestic!  The staff is always friendly!  The happy hour is the BEST, the food is 👍🏽 !  The gardens, and pool are so lush and welcoming!  Thank you majestic for being our go to when we visit the parks!

Great location - across the street from Disneyland Park.  The rooms are big and accommodated 4 adults perfectly. Bathroom is a bit small but it didn’t bother me.  Perks - free shuttle to/from Disneyland Park.  Parking was decent too.  We arrived Thursday evening, and planned to hit Disneyland on Friday.  The hotel let us use their parking all day Friday at the overnight fee of $18 (no additional fees). Shuttle runs 30 minutes prior to the Parks opening and runs an 1.25 hour after the park closes.

We have stayed at a variety of hotels near Disneyland and found this one a great value and very comfortable. It is within walking distance of the park but there is a convenient shuttle that runs all day, free of charge. The staff at the hotel were pleasant and accommodating. The rooms were clean, however the bathrooms were a bit small with vanity, toilet, tub all in one small space so plan your family shower schedule carefully. But honestly, it’s not bad at all.  The property is beautiful. The gardens are enjoyable to spend time relaxing in and the pool is very clean and well maintained. The hotel is a Disneyland “good neighbor” and you can purchase your park tickets in advance right in the lobby.  We did not use room service, but the hotel restaurant and bistro were wonderful

I’m sad to be leaving a bad review of a hotel I have loved for many years. We have been staying at this hotel for about 15 years when we travel to Disneyland. Unfortunately, the quality of this hotel has been going downhill since they left the Sheraton brand a few years ago, but the last stay was so bad we won’t be back.  The room: I booked a room online. Their website is clunky and difficult to use. I ended up booking a king room with what I thought was a sofa bed, but I accidentally booked a room without a sofa. I recognize this is my own fault, but the photo of the room clearly shows a sofa. The room is a “premium king” but doesn’t deserve that title. There was nothing premium about the room. It had a bed, dresser, table with 2 chairs and a huge empty area with one awkward

I used to hate this hotel back then because of their grumpy service but my cousin convinced me to give it another try and i am sooo glad i did! everyone that i have come across with has been amazing to me and my family. The Front Desk were very welcoming and was very helpful which is a huge change prior to last year. We even saw cute little ducklings. We will come back sept again.

We have been staying at this property for 20 or 30 years; it was formerly the Sheraton Anaheim.  There have been improvements since the new owners took over, but it may be that they just aren't able to deal with such an old facility.  Our room was spacious and clean.  We also like the grounds which were well kept and beautiful.  We had a problem with the plumbing -- and this was not the first time.  Last year when we stayed here we were moved to another room because of plumbing issues.  The toilet just barely flushed.  We called the hotel twice and I believe they sent someone up to deal with it, but it never really worked well.  Fortunately it did not overflow, but it did seem to come close to that.  The TV didn't work well, either.  Channels and volume were nearly impossible to

I do not recommend this hotel. They have terrible customer service and their supervisor in the reservation department called me a liar on the phone. I canceled my trip over a month prior to our reservation date and they charge my card anyways. I rate them a zero out of five stars!

Summary Heading: Shuttle service / location NOT worth it
Summary: Do not, repeat, do not stay here if you value cleanliness, friendliness, or spacious, updated rooms. Everything is dark, old, musty. Hotel gets good reviews due to pools & shuttle service. These do not offset the look & feel of the place. Hardly majestic! Definitely do not recommend.

Family friendly, and great service. It wasn’t as clean as expected when going to and from the rooms, the halls had garbage on the rugs. The rooms were very spacious, but the bathroom was a cubical. Overall a 3/5 is reasonable for their rating.

Family Friendly, Clean and Safe. Shuttle is very convenient and save so much time when trying to get to Disneyland Area. Parking is also spacious. Breakfast at the hotel is great.  Hotel Price and Quality make this our favorite hotel to stay at while visiting Disneyland.

Just came back from our first family trip.. which was at Disneyland.  Got the hotel through Get Away Today. Our room was ok, nothing special. The bathroom was a little small and we had a HUGE water stain above our bed. Our room was in a different building from the hotel which was very inconvenient due to the room key being demagnetized. We had to visit the lobby and get a new key every day, sometimes twice a day for FIVE days.  When we came in and expressed our frustration no one really seemed to care and was advised to talk to the manager. The next morning we came and spoke to the manager who somehow thought there was something wrong with our door and not the key, even after we stated that the key wasn't allowing us to get into the building. Again nothing was done. We also

Summary Heading: Big Rooms, Breakfast has rice option, near Disneyland
Summary: Enjoyed staying there last month.  One of the biggest rooms we have stayed in.  Being a Filipino, having rice in the breakfast buffet is surprising and much appreciated.  Being near Disneyland is an obvious advantage.

This is a very spacious, comfortable hotel. The rooms comfortably fitted the four of us. Rooms maybe require a little TLC but are clean and do the job. The pool is quite large and wasn't particularly busy when we used it. Food options are good and fairly priced. The shuttle bus works well and if full they run extra services. A good option for Disneyland.

Nice clean ,large spacious rooms. Air conditioned hotel, the shuttle are quick and easy and on time. Too far to walk to Disneyland for us to walk but the shuttle is very good. You can watch the fireworks from outside. Good pool area with lots of chairs and umbrellas.

I will be the first to admit I am picky when it comes to hotels.  I stayed here as I was traveling to California on business, so I decided to go early and visit Disneyland.  I was looking for a budget hotel, and this property definitely falls into that category.  I'll try and be fair.  The hotel is tired, but generally clean.  My biggest pet peeve is moldy bathrooms and this one definitely was.  I also like good water pressure. Unfortunately, when you turned on the shower, half came out the shower head and half in the tub.  I ended up having to rinse my hair with the ice bucket!  I did report it to the hotel, and they would have changed my room, but after 12 hours at Disney the last thing I wanted to do was pack-up and change rooms!  The bed was comfortable, however, the air

The motel is huge a massive place .Our room was vey spacious and plenty of room we had 3 in the room with 2 beds .Our other family had 2 people in their room ,was amazing small lounge area and king bed .Room clean and tidy and all linen ect replaced daily .They have a beautiful pool area which has a seat for the disable as well .And spa area  .Have a shuttle bus that takes you too and from Disney Land which is very handy .We ate one night at the restaurant the meal was outstanding .All. Room staff were loverly and polite and helpfull.loved this place good for families also 😀

Staff was amazing. Nice large rooms. No fans in the bathrooms. Windows are all fogged up and need replacing. Hot water was spuratic. Clearly no money has been spent on this building for some time. Nees a major upgrade.

My family stayed here for 4 nights and it was just OK (2 rooms.) Booked via Expedia and was disappointed by the room. It’s an older hotel that they’re trying to upgrade. Unfortunately we stayed in the old part of the hotel. Bathrooms were disgusting but the rest was OK. Shuttle to Disneyland was every half hour. It’s a 20 min walk away. Stay but don’t pay full price!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disneyland
Summary: My cousin came down from N. California to visit Disneyland 23 years since her last visit there. She noticed many changes in the Park and went back home filled with many new memories. Our weather was fantastic: overcast in the morning, sunny in the afternoon.  The hotel beds were so comfortable, it was a challenge to get out of it in the morning.  The hotel’s shuttle bus, “The Dream Machine,” leaves the hotel at the hour and at the half hour; it leaves Disneyland’s bus lot at 15 after and 15 before the hour.  The hotel has a restaurant that offers a buffet or table service breakfast, as well as, regular service for lunch and dinner.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: Which is really a positive aspect to take into account! Room big and comfortable, housekeeping  perfect.  Breakfast with many options like breads, cold cuts, cheese, eggs, fish, sausage etc., etc. Nice to have a coffee jar each table. Princess Corine at the lobby delighted children! Shuttle to Disneylad a concrete and efficient extra benefit!!   Everything could be excellent but....... Staff must be careful in some points in order to avoid embarrassing situations with guest. March 6th in the night we were resting in our room when suddenly at midnight 2 people entered . They received from the reception desk a room-card with a wrong number. Frustrating but not serious for us. However, 15 minutes later 2 employees (one of them part of security ) knocked the door to interrogate us

Staying here for 3 days for Disney. Close location to the park. Have free shuttles but only running 1 bus and lines are super long so took an Uber in the morning. Waited 30 min at the end of the day and never saw the shuttle so took a $10 taxi back. Giving up on the shuttle. In a room with bunk beds. Bathroom is ridiculously tiny and tub is in rough shape. Thermostat set at 65 but isnt working and too warm. Walls are paper thin. 6am and some lady is chatting up a storm so loud!!We hear Everything in the hall too! And this room is $280/nt. Majestic my %#*.

Great location for visiting Disneyland. Rooms are exceptionally large and very clean.  Laundry facilities available on premises. Local buses at door. Staff extremely friendly and very helpful. Shuttlebus to Disneyland is fantastic running all day long. Within walking distance of Disneyland and plenty Restaurants close by offering variety of food
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: Stayed here for 10 nights , large rooms , amazing hotel staff , I used room service ,the food  arrived very fast and was hot .  There Dream shuttle bus to Disneyland is a dream , runs every 30 minutes , super friendly drivers , as a solo traveller I felt very safe , and the rooms are perfect for families 😊
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: We have stayed in this hotel multiple times. The rooms are kept well the staff is always a delight and happy to help. The shuttle service to and from the park is always the best part of the ride especially if you have the pleasure of being driven by Bill. This man can always make the kids smile no matter how tired and upset. He will make every trip to and from the park a special one! This will always be the hotel I recommend. They have regular room all the way up to the castle sweets. For no matter how big or small you’re family is.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: They always seem to upgrade our room without asking which is nice. The grounds are huge so I get lost alot but I am directionally challenged... Did not eat at the hotel but was very inviting and comfortable
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary Heading: Nice location not don't stay in the tower rooms!
Summary: It was very warm in the room and the thermostat did not work. Later after security brought a fan to the room he told me that the tower room temp is preset and the guest cannot change the temperature settings. This is a hotel not a dorm room or jail house. A guest should be able to adjust their own thermostat because everyone's level of comfort is different.

We booked a three nights stay direct through the hotel website, inclusive of buffet breakfast and parking.  The direct shuttle to and from the parks every half hour was excellent. Buffet was great, for the price you pay. A lovely visit from Princess Corinne over breakfast one morning, was great for our four year daughter.  Room size is huge, we were on the ground/first floor, and it is a big hotel so is sometimes a bit confusing finding your way.  Only small gripe, was that we were charged twice for our stay, but within a couple of hours of a phonecall to the hotel, the issue was resolved and charges reversed. We were able to get an early check in, at no extra cost, and the midday checkout is a nice bonus. Overall for the price and location, our family thought this was an
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: My rating of this hotel would’ve been better had it not been for the extremely POOR shuttle service to and from Disneyland. The hotel boasts 3 shuttles and are supposed to depart Disneyland at 15 minutes and 45 minutes past the hour. However, this has literally never been the case during the 4 days we used the shuttle service. It’s ridiculous that guests who time their departure end up running after a shuttle that’s leaving on the hour. Despite the few, and I mean few, positives about this hotel- the shuttle service completely detracts from the entire stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we appreciate your feedback and apologize for the situation that you have described. We are very sorry if the situation regarding peak time shuttle service wasn't shared with you; typically during peak times we try an operate the shuttles on an "on-going" basis to get as many of our guests to and from the park as quickly as possible. When this is happening it would appear that we are off the scheduled drop off and pick up times, however we are actually running more frequently and guest will have a shorter wait time when using the shuttle. Thank you again for your feedback and we hope that you will stay again with us on a future visit to the area. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Terrible Room Experience and Unresponsive Staff
Summary: My recent stay on 03/09/19 was genuinely the worst hotel experience I have ever had near Disneyland.  Upon return from Disneyland park our room was flooded with the smell of marijuana.  We reported this to the front desk and they said they would send security to check it out.  No action was taken by the staff and the neighbors were loud and continued smoking well past 1:00am.   We woke up exhausted and miserable as the neighbors again the flooded our room with the smell of marijuana around 7:30am.  We had planned on sleeping as this was the night of the clocks moving an hour forward but this was not possible for us under these conditions.  We decided to check out early and again reported our frustrations to the front desk.  The front desk team offered no service recovery and

My 5yo and I stayed here for 3 nights for our Disneyland adventure. We didn't book directly through the hotel, but through Priceline's Express Deal so I didn't choose this hotel. Just the rating and price.   By far the best advantage of staying here is the free shuttle to the park. We always had a line to stand in for the shuttle, but that's the nature of DL trips in general.   My daughter LOVED staying in a "castle" even though our eyes were closed the majority of the time we were there. I loved having the option to refuse housekeeping in exchange for a credit at the restaurant. We had breakfast at the restaurant one morning. Nothing spectacular, but also not over priced. Service could have been quicker, but ....  Our room was comfortable and clean. We faced the back of the
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: I prefer to stay on resort, but this place is the next best thing. We have stayed here twice and love, love, love it. I have stayed in both the standard and premium rooms. Both are very nice, although I would recommend the upgrade if you can afford it. They have a very reasonably priced cafe with food, over the counter medicines, and great salads. The in house princess is very sweet. In fact, we received a letter from her just last week.  The hotel restaurant is worth every penny.  The courtyard is very nice and has a coy pond that the kids loved.  There is also a good sized pool and shuttles that run every 30 minutes from before the parks opens until after they closes.

Summary Heading: Great Location, Spacious Rooms, Lovely Gardens
Summary: The Majestic Garden Hotel ticked off all the boxes for us. It was a family, friendly hotel with a heated outdoor pool, great restaurant, shuttle bus to Disneyland, and could accommodate six people in their spacious family rooms.   Their restaurant was comfortable and inviting.... just what we needed after a day in Disneyland and tired children with no line-ups or waiting .  The menu was geared to family dining.  Very quick service, and really good meals. I suggest a hearty breakfast there before you leave for the day, as you get good value for your money.  Our grandchildren used the heated pool a lot in the early evenings and we enjoyed the hot tub.  The gardens... complete with a Koi pond, were exceptional.  The feeling of Disney was evident throughout the building with Minnie
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: I've been staying here for the last 16 years ( 6 trips ).  It use to be a Sheraton.  Rooms are a bit outdated, BUT the cost of the room is factored into this.  The rooms are large, clean and comfortable. Very reasonable rates if you book smartly.  The pool and pool area is large, clean and gets good sun.  The shuttle to DL is timely with great drivers.  Some of these drivers have been here for 20 plus years ! That says something right there.  The restaurant has good food at reasonable $.  The buffet breakfast is well worth the money if you have a good appetite.  It is not the crappy BW breakfast. Far from that.  My 3 teenage daughters talk about the breakfast as much as DL !!  Lastly, i have worked for a large U.S. company for 25 plus years and have stayed at a wide range of
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary Heading: Outdated rooms - old mattresses - tiny bathroom
Summary: My 2 kids, husband and I were really disappointed with the rooms at this so called 3.5 star property.  They are very outdated.  Mattresses are old, saggy and squeaky.  Bathrooms are tiny in that you can sit on the toilet while washing your hands.  Fixtures are old.  One of two phones didn’t work. Small tv and too many cords exposed. The front desk supervisor sent a security guard up to show me another room, unfortunately it was in the same state.  Upside, the breakfast buffet was great and restaurant is nice.

I’m reluctant to post this, but I haven’t heard back from the manager, so okay. I also had a semi-expensive ($50-60) pair of earrings disappear from our room. No one ever contacted me about those either.   1. Mold on the bathroom ceiling.  2. No second mirror on hall closet. I believe previous guests must’ve broken one of the mirrors. I found a glass shard on the carpet in the closet. We had a 1 year old child with us. We just didn’t let her walk in the room barefoot/unaccompanied.  3. I had an omelet 2/15. I said “Eggs, cheddar, sausage, tomatoes, I’m allergic to onions and bell peppers.” The potatoes had onions in them, so I couldn’t eat them, then just as I was finishing the omelet, I found a bell pepper. I didn’t need my epi-pen, but I threw up 20 minutes later, had to use 4

Summary Heading: Very nice staff but below average hotel
Summary: Pros - large rooms - friendly front desk, bellhop and restaurant staff - shuttle service  - deli/store downstairs for quick grabs - lobby in good condition  Cons - housekeeping has a lack of attention to detail or good standards (mildew in tub tiles, broken latch) - rooms are way overdue for updating. Can’t find a useful outlet - my laptop, cell phone, etc all had to sit on the floor to be charged and couldn’t charge at the same time since there weren’t enough outlets! - thin walls - have to walk a lot but it’s Disneyland so I suppose that is the nature of the area - nickel and dime you ... a fee to receive packages?? $18/night for parking?? - impossible for taxi and Uber drivers to figure out how to get in  I can’t remember the last time that I stayed in such an outdated hotel.

I’ve been to Disneyland California 8 times and stayed at this hotel twice. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the park. On both visits, I’ve had a great experience. Rooms are quite large and clean. In terms of comfort, the beds/sheets/pillows are standard. Mini fridge was available in the rooms. Hotel staff were friendly. The food in the hotel restaurant was quite good and offered large portions. The breakfast buffet was reasonably priced for what you get  (17 us$) and had a large selection. The hotel is on a massive property and they have beautiful gardens and a koi pond on the property. They have a nice pool and a decent sized workout room. From certain areas on the property, the fireworks from Disneyland are visible. They also have a free shuttle than runs back

Summary: We stayed (family of 4) for two nights.  We had a room with two queen beds.  It was clean, nicely decorated, had a fridge, TV, and ample space.  The cost to park our car was $18/night.  The cost for the buffet in the morning was just under $20/person. The wifi was free, but dropped every five minutes, so it was impossible to watch something on a device.  The TV was just okay.  It was a smaller flatscreen and was very hard to hear - the volume wouldn't go all the way up to get better sound. Room service prices were very affordable. This was a nice hotel, and we spent most of our time at Disneyland anyways.  The shuttle to get there was every 30 minutes, free, and on-time.

Summary: Front desk was never too busy. Check in was easy. Rooms were large and clean (and being remodeled while we were there). The coffee shop/deli had great options. Shuttle was so great. Always on time. Love

Summary: Great themed hotel that cost a fraction of the price of Disney hotels. Just a 5 min drive to Disneyland, and they provide a free shuttle to the park every 15-20min. Very nice pool & hot tub. The kids watched the Disneyland fireworks from the heated pool. The cafe serves very reasonably priced breakfast, lunch, & dinner. We found this hotel on the Hotel Tonight app for only $77 - which is a great way to find same day deals on hotels. We will definitely return.
