Summary Heading: It was what we expected.  Room comfortable.  Loved having a coffee machine.
Summary: We booked through Expedia, and did receive a room upgrade at arrival. Room was spacious, we had a bedroom and sitting area.  The bed and pillows were comfortable.  The bathrooms small and narrow, but clean.  Our fridge had not been cleaned from the previous guest, and it smelled bad.  We did leave a note for housekeeping, it still get not get cleaned.  We were hesitant to take it out and clean ourselves, as the whole room would have smelled.  We ate at the deli a couple of times.  The food terrible, and overpriced. But, the prepackaged foods saved us in a snap.  The shuttle service was great, a nice bonus. Not too far to walk to Disney, but, the shuttle is frequent.  Staff nice, check in was easy.  Gated hotel, you can see the fireworks from the parking lot.   The lobby was nice

Hi, I recently booked this hotel for a Disneyland vacation. My partner and I both had are days off approved before booking. Unfortunately, my partner's work changed their minds about him being off that week about two hours after we booked. I cancelled our trip in hopes of rebooking for separate dates. Unfortunately, the hotel does not refund their rates. Expedia offered to call for me to try and get a refund since I had cancelled within 24 hours. They denied that request. I tried to reschedule my trip in hopes that I could still use those funds towards different dates, but the staff and manager denied that request as it is against their policy. I am now out about $675 and I will never try to use this hotel again. I hope this can help other people booking with tentative plans or

Stayed here for a week with family during our California vacation. The free shuttle was great and the proximity to the parks was good. The check in staff were friendly and the Disney desk staff were helpful and efficient. The restaurant had good food and a good breakfast buffet. The rooms were clean and comfortable and quite large. The bathrooms are quite small and a little outdated but we managed and it wasn't a huge issue. I've read some other comments on here about their hotel room floors not being cleaned, but whenever the housekeepers were around I always heard the vacuum, so the floors were being cleaned (at least when I was there). The rooms have adjoining doors and the guests next to me were extremely loud...the walls are a little thin so that was a minor annoyance in
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: i always choose this hotel because the staff is always friendly and always acknowledges us but this time i encountered a small issue when i checked into the room. It was so bad i had to get the housekeeping supervisor involved because the damage was so drastic that i had to say something. when i walked into the room i could tell by the sheets that the entire room was done very fast. i found hair on the sheets, dust on the t.v on the lights it was bad that i even showed the housekeeping supervisor that drapes were coming off and were full of dust and the mirror had milk stain on them.  just please when checking into your room pay close attention to the details of the room. i am still going to return because i do believe everyone deserves a 2nd chance, So i will see you guys soon.

Summary Heading: Nice commons and pretty rooms, needing inlrovement
Summary: Grounds are beautiful, and common areas are cozy and feel high class. Our rooms had new wallpaper and carpet. Bathrooms were SO tiny and cramped, and we are small people. I couldn’t even use the sink without the toilet hitting the back of my leg. Showerhead barely worked. Beds were very hard and they sagged in the middle. It was difficult to sleep. We were told we’d have a full-size crib for our toddler, but it was a mini-crib which is about 12 inches shorter in length and 6 inches shorter in width than a standard crib, so she also had a hard time sleeping in the cramped crib. They did not have bed rails to offer for her to sleep in the larger bed. The restaurant inside is pricey and mediocre.

The rooms are very spacious. I love the feel of it. Also it is wakable distance to the parks. Also, they have shuttles and its own store/foodshop. Also a restaurant in the premises. My son loved the pool. It was a great stay.

Rooms are nice, but just starting to show their age (grout in our rooms, (2112/2114) really needs to be redone on sinks.) But 3 things to be aware of if traveling with the family.  1) It says “across from Disneyland.” I guess that’s technically true, but it’s no where near the gate. Summary Heading: Great room, great place,  just one little problem.
Summary: The beds are comfortable, the bathrooms are good, the food is decent, the market handy and the shuttle to Disney is great. Great front desk staff and generally really great staff except the very, very, surly waiters in the restaurant at breakfast. No smile, lucky to get a grunt from some of them. At least the hostess was always friendly but at one point in the evening she had to take our order as the waiter just ignored us. Still overall I would highly recommend this as a place to stay.

I would rate this hotel with only one star. First they gave me a ride om that has a foul smell and I asked to have a different room. The next room they gave us is even worst.  The bath tub drain is clogged that while I was takin a shower it doesn't drain so my/our feet is soaked in dirty water while taking a shower. The toilet was not  clean. I can see the yellow stain on the seat and on the floor. The bed skirt was so dirty, I don't think they even change it.. I took pictures and show it to the front desk so they will see it for themselves. Ohh yeah the public washroom in the lobby is sooo filthy. I will not recommend this hotel. I just like their shuttle service to and from Disneyland

This was the second time I stayed at this property and this visit we stayed in the remodeled rooms. My friends cable did not work in their room. The bathroom counters did not match in ours. You can still tell it is a very old hotel by the size of the hotel and the finishes were done on a budget. Some base board was missing around the closet and you could see the concrete coming through. The colors were very pretty and the hotel has potential if they would have paid attention to the details, but they didn't.  The carpet in the room was clean. We were up here when it rained and they had towels on all of the doors that lead out to the court yard so I am assuming water was leaking in. The elevators are VERY tiny. the best thing is the shuttle to and from Disneyland but it does not

Summary Heading: Booked and Charged twice for a Hotel Room
Summary: They booked and charged me twice for a room. We couldn't dispute it with the hotel and have them cancel one of the reservations, because they have a contract with the hotel where there are no cancellations and refunds. When we tried to have the issue resolved with Cancelon, we were told tghat they would call us back after they will cancel the reservations with the hotel to refund us. We never heard back from them.

The room is spacious and clean and surprisingly very quiet considering how close it is to the freeway. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was very clean. I really enjoyed the lobby area. This was a great cost effective way to do Disneyland. The shuttle is very easy with the times however returning at the end of the day can be hectic with so many people trying to get on the bus. Wonder why they don't allow standing in the isle ?   The negatives were minor but being in the industry, I notice small things. In the hallway when we went to our room there was a plate and glass on the floor from the room across. When we came back from Disneyland at 1 AM it was still there. When we left for Disneyland at 8am on Day 2, it was still there. I know at least one employee must
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary Heading: Perfect, clean hotel for nearby Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at the Majestic Garden Hotel for  3 nights in September to visit Disneyland. The hotel and rooms are both clean and nicely presented. The staff were friendly and the free shuttle service to Disneyland was superb. We never had to wait long for the shuttle. It did take a little bit longer when the park is closing as a lot more people waiting but that’s to be expected. Would definitely stay here again as a more affordable way to visit Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: We stayed in 2 queen jr suite. 6 people plus crib. Coffee maker and fridge in room.  Very spacious, clean room.  Beds were very comfortable. Except for sofa bed. It was lumpy. Had view of pool. Location was quiet at night. Deli had delicious food. Only complaint was the Shuttle service driver was not courteous nor helpful during rainstorm.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while seeing the sites
Summary: Excellent hotel, the room is large and clean. The staff always had a smile on their face. Very close to Disney without Disney traffic. Excellent location for getting on and off the I 5. The only draw backs are the parking cost
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: We stayed at the hotel for four nights on a trip to Disneyland. Pros: Free shuttle to and from Disneyland. Convenient location to Disneyland - if you miss the shuttle, you can easily walk it. Was a reasonable price.  Cons: Very outdated rooms - paint chipped, wallpaper peeling, door frames scratched and dented, rusty and chipped bathtub.   No outlets on the bedside tables for convenient phone charging. No kettle in the room for tea. They offer a $5 voucher if you forego housekeeping, but the voucher must be used the next day.  Because we spent the entire days at Disneyland, we were unable to use the vouchers.  It would have been better to apply a $5 discount to the room, or allow the vouchers to be used at the deli for snacks and drinks. Beds are not comfortable.  Overall, the

Arriving at the hotel, staff are there to help you get your bags. Check in was friendly and speedy. The rooms are HUGE. Facilities are great. Breakfast buffet for $17 each is very good. Not a massive continental selection, but plenty of everything else. The shuttle is every half hour and very prompt. Ride to Disney is literally 5-10mins. Overall a great hotel for a Disney stay!
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for a night or a week while at Disneyland
Summary: Being from the Pacific NW there are several times a year we like to head to California to warm up, get sunshine and play at Disneyland.  We, accident came across the Majestic Gardens and loved it.  They have a great restaurant, comfortable beds and a terrific free shuttle to Disneyland.  We will definitely be staying there again.  Price was great also.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary Heading: Awful...Look elsewhere there is much better around !!
Summary: Stayed here 6 nights and I should know better than to trust hotel photos of rooms !  These are stretched and likely many years old with a wide angle lens used!   Cons... Our room and bathroom were very small compared to their advertisement and very dated plus not overly clean..  The $5 voucher they offer for foregoing house cleaning don’t do it can only be used in the restaurant not bar and only on the same day it’s issued... get the house keeping as you get no coffee or supplies either otherwise not just no towels or linen they don’t service at all..  WiFi horrendous at the back of the hotel on advising staff of this on multiple occasions staff said they would re start it.. manager said I could call AT&T who supply it? Pretty sure that’s their job to chase up not mine ?   Noisy
Manager Response: Thank you for providing this feedback. Avoiding standard replies as you mentioned already. We would like to have our Operations Director reach out to you and speak with you about your stay but we only have your screen name here and no means to reach you outside of this reply. If you can reply or email me your contact details I can make sure that someone does contact you about this. We do take your concerns very seriously and would like to discuss this further with you. mhale@majesticgardenhotel.com Thank you. Matt

Summary: Close to the parks, free shuttle and parking. Overall awesome hotel would stay here again because the location is so convenient. The room was clean and spacious. Many nearby restaurants and stores around.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: OMG worst hotel ever. But, let's start with the positive things.  Positive: Room size and shuttle to Disney.  Negative: Hotel needs an upgrade ASAP, but this is not the biggest problem. The main problem is the hotel room is dirty. They do not cleaned the carpet, we requested two times and they ignored. Also they didn't change the sheets, we requested several times but they also ignored this request. The result, we slept several times in a dirty bed. Another disgusting point, the tub. Rusty and dirty.  So, before you book this hotel, ask your self, can you handle a dirty room?  If the answer is no, run from this terrible hotel and book another one.  Para os meus amigos do Brasil, corram desse hotel, é furada!

The people at the Majestic Garden hotel are always very friendly and try to make your stay as pleasant as possible. Some of the hotel is a little dated but I’ve found the rooms to be very comfortable. Room service is quick and good. Parking is pricey but comparable with other hotels in the Disney resort area. I will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: Staff were very friendly. Free shuttle to Disney is great. Room was very nice and large. Restaurant reasonably priced and good food. Raining today so there were movies for the kids which was cool. Cute gift shop/sandwich shop. Highly recommend for families going to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary Heading: Low key and comfy - read this!
Summary: So I have stayed all over the Disney area in Anaheim and each place has their own merits but this place I actually really like. It is not the most fancy room Ive had and there are some rooms that are a little old but not so run down that I feel the need to bash the hotel like others on here. So lets talk about the good stuff - the shuttle service is every half hour and free dropping you off just outside of the main entrance of the park,  the restaurant is open late, the room service is full menu and delicious and runs until 11 pm, the pool area is nice and clean, Shakey's pizza is right down the street and the freeway entrance is literally just outside the property gates, the beds are comfy, they offer free infant cribs and what I love the most is that if you stand just outside
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary Heading: Spacious Rooms, Friendly Staff & Great Food
Summary: Recently stayed for a week with a large group of 100+ for business meetings at this hotel. The guestrooms appropriately fit the castle theme of the hotel and were spacious, clean and comfortable. The food experienced during the meetings was incredibly good. The banquet team was attentive and friendly to everyone in our group, ensuring that everyone was satisfied. While the hotel is targeted to families and leisure travel, our business group very much enjoyed their stay.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback!

Summary: I have stayed in this hotel several times in the past and have it booked for an upcoming trip.  The shuttles run regularly and there are decent food options in the hotel, though the rooms are bare/basic. Unfortunately, the booking experience this time has been horrible.  The online booking did not give me the discount it said I would get from booking directly, and once I was done it said it was a non-refundable rate....which was the reason I was booking direct...so I could change if needed.  In trying to add on a date at the beginning of my visit they said they couldn't confirm that I would be able to stay in the same room.  Most of the people I talked to did not speak English.  Not sure if this has been sold over the last year or so, but I hope our actual stay isn't as bad as

Summary Heading: Anything But Majestic - Outdated and Expensive Compared to Other Choices
Summary: I can only say for those who write great reviews about this place, they must have been lucky to get rooms unlike the 2 assigned to our family. They also must have had the pleasure of being greeted at the front desk on check-in by someone with a brighter personality.  Our entire stay was riddled with reasons for not returning.  I've attached photos of some of the room conditions.  In addition, in both of our rooms, the bathtubs did not drain properly, leaving the person standing in inches of dirty water each day.    As you can tell by the photos of the emergency equipment in the room, as well as the piping under the sink and in the bathroom, things are corroded and rusted.  This can't be safe and within codes?   Admittingly, this was a very busy time for the park, however, we

We have stayed at many of the "Good Neighbor" hotels near Disneyland, and this is relatively above average on the list. It is much more updated than its rival "medieval" hotel across the park. The shuttle made getting to the park easy (they have several buses going at a time, so we never had to wait for a very long time even with a party of 6). The food at the restaurant is fare and has generous (shareable) portions, but it is overpriced. We found the Tower Rooms to be very spacious, which gave us plenty of room to unpack and unwind after the park. Beds were comfortable and the room was very quiet. The restrooms are a different story--very narrow and made it hard for two adults to get ready at a time. The second half of our party had an issue with tub drainage during our 5-night

Nice Hotel, Easy acces to disneyland using their shuttle service which is free if you staying in there. Their in house room service got a lot of option that you can choose if you hungry.. overall its good..

Summary Heading: The shuttle service and comfy beds make this worth a stay if going to Disney.
Summary: We stayed here for five nights Dec 25th-29th.  It is true this is an older hotel but our room was very clean and everything worked well.  The shuttle was soooo convenient and on time every thirty minutes.  We never had to wait on a late bus and after a long few days of Disney this shuttle was wonderful.  We had two teenagers that enjoyed the pool and hot tub.  We grabbed a quick oatmeal and bagel breakfast each morning in the cafe for a good price and headed to the park.  GRIZELDA was our waitress at the restraunt a couple of times and she was very friendly and accommodating.  The food was a little bit too expensive but always very good.  It was still less than eating at Disneyland.  Our beds were so comfortable and the grounds of the hotel are beautiful.  We loved watching the

Summary Heading: Huge rooms in dark, dated hotel
Summary: I stayed here for a conference held at the hotel.  The rooms are very large and spacious.  That said the hotel needs to be updated as it is showing a its age. The rooms are dark, in part because they are deep/long.

This hotel is perfectly situated for the Disneyland attractions. The hotel itself is in desperate need of some attention. The rooms feel tired and really need a good clean. The cupboards and drawers were damaged and looked like they had been that way for some time. There is no safe in the room, so storing your valuables is an issue. The nets and curtains need replacing as they barely close properly. The rooms are of a great size however the bathrooms are tiny. The air conditioning could be quieter. The breakfast, which is not included, is of a good standard but no cheap. In this day and age you should expect and receive better than this has to offer. Do not believe the photos shown as they were probably taken a good few years ago. Such a pity.

You can tell this place isn’t owned by Disneyland. The stay will talk if you talk to them but they don’t use the 10ft or 2 ft rule of saying hi. The hallways are dirty. Little screws were on the steps that a vacuum would have easily gotten it one were to be used. All tables in bar and sitting lounge including the tables by the fire were dirty. One night we happen to be sitting by the fire and a lady and a man came in obviously mgmnt of some sort and moved all the pillows and the out of place gifts before they left for the night. Never said a word to us and they walked right through us. This is why the staff never talks to the paying guests.   Now to the room. Here just a few pictures of the room. Bathtub is gross and doesn’t drain while taking a shower until about five min after
Manager Response: Thank you for providing this feedback from your recent stay here with us. We are sorry if your stay was not up to your standards; we work hard to provide our guests with a very positive experience. If we missed the mark with you we do apologize. The hotel is a Disney "Good Neighbor" hotel, we don't claim to be Disney owned or operated, sorry if there was confusion about that. Thank you for this feedback.

Summary: Pretty horrid experience. Only stayed one night and things were going smoothly until my girlfriend went to take a shower. Apparently there was a clog or something and the sink started overflowing and bubbling up with this disgusting water. I called the desk about it and they said they were sending someone, however, 20 minutes later when they hadn’t arrived I called back and they had just send the person. By the time the person got there the clog had already stopped, but now the bathroom floor and countertops were disgusting. All he did was wipe a couple things down then said they were going to send someone else to destabilize the room. I was a little frustrated but still fine, but then we waited up for another 30ish minutes for someone so show up before calling back to see what

A magical hotel to use for our Disneyland adventure! My kids were so excited to check into the 'castle'. Christmas decorations in the lobby were amazing. Staff were very helpful, especially the waitstaff in the Gatden Restaurant. The free shuttle to Disneyland is fast and regular and drivers are friendly and informative. Our room was huge, very comfortable and clean. Good value for money although it would be nice to have breakfast included. Would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and providing this information from your stay. We appreciate the feedback and hope you will share with your friends and family about our castle here in Anaheim. On your next visit please check our website for booking your reservation as we offer some room & breakfast packages that you might enjoy! Thank you again for being our guest!

Summary Heading: By far the best stay we had
Summary: I have been coming here once a year during the holidays and i was checked in by Micaela a Manager she made me and my family feel like we are important and she is just the sweetest! Once we had dinner we were taken care by francine she is great aswell! The male person at the booth every morning always have a smile on his face. I see the changes that this hotel is making. Thanks Majestic!
Manager Response: Thank you for this feedback, we appreciate you taking the time to provide it. We will share this with the mentioned associates and their departments and we are so glad that our team helped to make your stay even better! Please come back and be our guest again soon! Thank you.

Summary: The perfect hotel for a Disneyland vacation without the big price. They are right off the 5 and just outside the park. The room we had was very large. The staff was friendly, helpful and polite. Their free shuttle runs every 30 mins starting 30 mins before the parks open. This was very nice since we were there, on the very rare occasion, when it rained. Will definitely stay here again when we go back.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing this review from your recent stay here with us. We are pleased that our staff helped to make your stay more enjoyable. Hopefully we will see you again soon with Sunny skies for that trip. Thank you!

Summary: Worked great for me. My family were visiting the parks and I decided to go last minute. Got a great price on Hotwire and was very pleased with service, free shuttle, location and amenities. They have a good gift store deli and a nice bar and restuarnat
Manager Response: Thank you for this review of your recent stay here with us. We appreciate you taking the time to give us this important feedback and we hope you will choose to stay with us again soon. Thank you!

Summary: Myself and my two kids recently stayed at Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel for our Disneyland holiday. The hotel was much bigger than I had expected and we were surprised at how huge our room was. The staff were friendly and helpful and we were lucky to be visiting near Christmas to see all of the lovely decorations going up around the hotel. It was just beautiful. The shuttle to and from Disneyland only took a couple of minutes and was an excellent way to come and go each day to Disneyland. We had a great holiday at this hotel. Highly recommend it!
Manager Response: Thank you for providing this feedback from your stay and we are so pleased that you enjoyed your time here with us and the great staff that we have to assist you. The holidays are a beautiful time to visit and we are committed to making the hotel even more festive moving forward. We hope to have you as a guest again very soon. Thank you!

Summary: This hotel is what it is - relatively inexpensive and close to Disneyland.  I'm sure there are worse places to stay, but our room was pretty dirty.  The hotel is outdated, everything was dirty, the bathroom was gross with mold on the walls and a shower that drained so slow we were up to our ankles in water. For the price, I wasn't expecting a luxury hotel, but this wasn't as nice or clean as many of the Holiday Inn-type hotels we've stayed in before.   All that said, the staff were friendly, it was nice to have the mini-mart downstairs, and the Disney shuttle was always on time.  We spent very little time in our room, so it didn't ruin our vacation.  At 1/3 (or less) the cost of staying at one of the official Disney hotels, it was a decent deal as long as you are fine with the
Manager Response: Thank you for providing this feedback from your stay here with us. We are sorry that you experienced the issues you mentioned while you were here. Summary Heading: Proximity to Disneyland and Shuttle are the main good things
Summary: Stayed here for one night with my family (4 year old and 9 month old).  We don't live too far, about 50 miles away, but wanted to be at Disneyland first thing in the morning.  The shuttle was great and we were in the park within 15 minutes of leaving the hotel.   This was great.  The hotel is severely outdated and is in need of a remodel.  Our room was dusty and the bathroom door was rotting at the bottom.  Fixtures were dingy and old. The armoire in the hallway was stained and was peeling.  There is no wifi available and there are no convenience outlets in the rooms for your devices.  It was like staying at a big old motel.    It was otherwise clean enough for one night.  My family comes down to Disneyland quite often and we stay in a hotel.  Unfortunately, this was our first
Manager Response: Thank you for your review from your recent stay with us. We appreciate this feedback and will share it with the team so that we can provide even better service and amenities in the future. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Two day stay to visit Disneyland
Summary: Celebrating my grandson's birthday at Disneyland, the Anaheim Majestic became a stoping place for two days.  While the price seems high for what you get, being this close to Disneyland makes it worth it.  As prior reviews state, there is a free shuttle which makes not having to pay parking fees worth the extra at the hotel.  I spent time in the hotel and enjoyed the different amenities that it provides.  Breakfast was good as well as service at the bar.  The room was average nothing to really write about.  No thing they could do is to give better directions in the many halls that they have in this hotel.  It is easy to get lost.  I would stay there again if going to Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, we appreciate you taking the time to provide this. Just to let you know we have heard you and are currently working on additional signage and key packet maps of the property to help get you to your room quickly. We are a large resort here in the Anaheim area and understand this concern. Thank you!

Summary: This hotel is in a convenient location, has a free shuttle to Disneyland on the half hour, the staff is nice but the hotel is not CLEAN. The carpets upon entry to the lobby are stained. The elevator smells very musty and that carpet was filthy. Our room was not maintained. There were two chairs, one had the stuffing coming out. The bathroom mirror was framed in wood laminate that was visibly cracked and peeling.  The other wood type furniture in the room was also in poor condition.There was painters tape around the smoke detector...it's called Majestic Garden and the gardens look neglected...like the neighbor who didn't do much. Would not stay there again.

We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It's a little worn out but it has a shuttle, a restaurant, a coffee shop/mini mart, and a full bar. The beds were comfy and the window opened. The air conditioner was too noisy to run at night but with the window open the room was very comfortable. One inconvenience was the lack of microwave in the room. I had to run all the way to the coffee shop to make some popcorn, and the grounds are big. There is a fridge in the room so that was a perk.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide your review from your recent stay with us. We try hard to please all of our guests and are very happy that you enjoyed your stay here with us. Come back again soon. Thank you!

Summary: It was our first time staying there and the hotel was good for the price. It isn't luxurious but was clean and comfortable. There is a free shuttle to the park that leaves every half hour but it can get busy and you may have to wait for the next one going to or from the park. Breakfast was not included but buffet was good and quick serve are had good take away food.

Stayed here for 2 nights while we visited Disneyland for the full day.  We entered the foyer and it seemed really nice and ambience was good. There are a couple of different eateries and bar that branch off from this reception space and they give the place an exciting feel.  We were given a room that was in an adjoining building so we had to walk down a long corridor, walk outside and then access another building next door that felt a little shabby and old. However, once we caught the lift up to our room we were pleasantly surprised with it.  Room was spacey, clean, nice decor and one of the walls was covered in garden wallpaper which gave the room a really nice feel. Beds were comfortable, carpet looked like it was relatively new and seats in the room were comfy. The first
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide your review from your recent stay with us. We try hard to please all of our guests and are very happy that you enjoyed your stay here with us. Come back again soon. Thank you!

Summary: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel! It was convenient for us considering that we were travelling with 2 kids. The hotel itself is really nice and the location doesn't get any better. It's so close to Disneyland. The rooms were big so we had ample area to move around and the room service was delicious! We will definitely be staying here again!

Summary: My daughter and I stayed in one of the Turret suite rooms for 2 nights.  The room was huge, extremely clean, and all outlets worked (you'd be surprised how often they don't!).  My daughter slept on the pullout couch in the sitting room and was surprised how comfortable that was, as well.    Everyone was super nice and we were attended to very quickly at the restaurant, the bar and the front desk.  The free shuttle to Disney was an added bonus!  It left the hotel every half an hour starting at 7:30AM and left Disney to go back to the hotel every half an hour until 1:15AM.  Very convenient!  I would definitely stay here again :)

Summary: I love this Castle type Hotel. Makes you feel young again. The staff are all nice and helpful. The food was good. The room is big and spacious and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. I love everything about this hotel.

Summary: I made a reservation months before my trip to Disneyland.  I got an email two nights before I was supposed to leave stating my credit card was invalid.  I wasn't notified it was invalid at the time of first booking.  I updated my card and got an email stating it was a successful in updating. Twenty minutes later I received another email stating my reservation was cancelled.  I called and asked for what reason and they said it was after 24 hrs of EMAILING me of an invalid card.  I asked why they didn't call to have this problem resolved.  I was told to go online and rebook.  The hotel was sold out.  I called and emailed and was given a price more than double.  All the hotels in the surrounding area was outrageous in price or sold out.  Understandable, for it being 2 days before

Really liked this hotel. Granted it's older and the rooms could do with updating but it was clean and our room st the front was huge. Traffic noise and doors slamming are a hazard of hotel stops but the staff on the desk were helpful. Busses to Disney could be more frequent but I'd recommend this hotel and I would stay here again

Summary Heading: Overpriced for not so convenient location.
Summary: I booked this over the phone, and was informed that parking was free. However, upon checking in found out it was $18 per night. The room was very nice, but OH SO FAR FROM THE LOBBY, luckily we are lively senior citizens. There should be something in between a sandwich shop, and fine dining.

Summary Heading: Clean, very nice, perfectly located hotel
Summary: Stayed 3 nights with my two children 9 and 11.  We had a room with one queen bed and a "castle" bunk bed for the kids, very cool!  Fast shuttles to and from Disney.  Nice large outdoor pool and hot tub.  Skip the breakfast buffet.  Parking was a breeze, friendly check in.

The furniture is not in the best of shape and for some reason the sheets  and comforter felt damp but my group said it was me. Maybe I am leaking? Anyway they have a cafe we got in around 9 pm and when we walked in to buy food she said I have to take a break come back later.  REALLY? When I asked the desk they said someone called in sick. Summary: I chose the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel solely for the free shuttle to Disneyland - knowing it was more expensive than other hotels we've stayed at on previous Disney trips, I figured it would be nicer overall.  Sadly, I was wrong.   Upon entry into the hotel, I was pleasantly surprised by the spacious and beautifully fall-decorated lobby; I thought to myself, "wow, this is going to be a nice change of pace, staying at a fancier hotel."   But then after checking in, we headed toward our room.  Unfortunately, the room was in an obviously older part of the hotel (a different building than the lobby).  The automatic doors that led into the building wouldn't open with our room key and we had to pry them open manually.  The smell in the building was musty and unpleasant and the

Summary Heading: Favorite Place to Stay at Disneyland
Summary: The service is fantastic, the rooms are comfortable, clean and well decorated. You cannot beat how close the park is! I have stayed there three times in the last year and that shuttle is a god send. I have stayed at another property nearby that sold tickets to their shuttle and it did not run as often as Majestic Garden's. Plus, it is included in your room rate.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us and providing this review of your time here. We work hard to make our guests happy and appreciate your feedback!

Summary: I overall very happy. Family of 4 with kids aged 11 and 12. Pool is great for them and open late to wash off the Disney 'day'. Rooms were fine and front desk were very good with storing our luggage before our room was ready (we were early).Used the security boxes there for peace of mind. Shuttles to/from Disney were super easy and convenient. The in-house shop was well stocked and had gear cheaper than Disney itself.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel overnight in a suite as a family member had an event here. We stayed in what was advertised as a renovated suite. The one bathroom looked 30 years old with a nasty sink and bathtub that was nasty. Room has old ripped carpet and trim around bottom in bedroom coming away from wall. For the money they charge this hotel should be embarrassed. Grounds could be nice but not really manicured. It is close to Disneyland. It is really too bad that hotels like this take advantage of the consumer because of location. Spend your money elsewhere. I will not be back.

Summary Heading: Graet location and Disney Park access
Summary: This hotel lets you park in their lot if you are a guest of theirs.  Come in early and get a blank room key from the desk so you can use their shuttle.  When you return from the Park late in the day pick up your room key. Even on the last day you can check out, leave your car in hotel lot, use their shuttle, and leave parking card at kiosk when you leave.  A convenient service that makes visiting Disney hassle free. The hotel has great garden atriums and is well maintained.  Love it and will stay there again.

Summary Heading: The best Disneyland hotel, hands down.
Summary: We always stay at this hotel when we visit Disneyland, which usually ends up being three or four times a year. The rooms are the largest you’ll find in Anaheim for the money. The grounds are full of winding paths, green gardens and seasonal flowers or decor. The staff goes out of their way to accommodate your needs and make your visit special.  Each room has a mini-fridge which is great for keeping snacks for the kids. The on-property breakfast isn’t complimentary, but it’s reasonably priced at $15 per adult for a good variety of high quality breakfast items.  What really makes this hotel a steal is the shuttle service to and from Disneyland Park. Summary Heading: A Good Stay - Free Shuttle to Disneyland
Summary: A good stay. Not the newest of Hotels, it feels overused and the distance between lobby and some rooms is a long walk... Also, breakfast is a bit weak (if in room, we didn't try the buffet)... But that's the only relatively negative things I will say about Anaheim Majestic.  We stayed for 2 nights. The Best part of it is the free shuttle bus to Disneyland. The room is spacious. The staff is helpful and friendly. Just what we expected. We surely recommend this Hotel for someone visiting Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Good Location For Disney. Budget Hotel With All You Need For A Short Stay.
Summary: We stayed at the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel for 5 nights at the end of July when touring California.   We chose this hotel as 3 days out of 5 we would be visiting Disney Parks. Location is a plus with Free Shuttles from the Hotel running every 30 mins beginning 7am. Shuttle takes under 5 minutes but is necessary as there are lots of busy roads and crossings. Summary: Hotel very large and located about 5 minute drive from Disneyland.  Rooms were clean, beds comfortable, cleaning staff were outstanding.  Hotel is filled with families and staff is well trained dealing with that.  Shuttle service worked perfect and was on time for the 4 days we stayed there.  Angels stadium is also a short drive away. There was an arcade on site as well as a little cafe that served sandwiches and breakfast.  Pool was clean and well maintained. Hotel bar onsite as well.  Overall, great stay and if ever back on Anaheim, I would certainly stay again.

Pros: - Check in and Check out were easy; the front desk was very friendly upon both check in and check out. - The lobby was very nice. - There is an in hotel restaurant - Complimentary parking for booking the Costco travel package - Shuttle to the Parks - Walking distance to the park  Cons: - We called the day before to make sure there was a crib for us in the room.  Upon check in we were told "one will be brought up for you."  Hours later, it still wasn't brought up so we had to call down to the front

The hotel does have a nice dining area and the menu is family friendly. Best of all there is a free shuttle every 1/2 hour that drops you off and picks you up from Disneyland.  Con daily self parking is expensive.

Summary: This was a nice hotel to book for Disneyland. It has a castle theme and rooms that even include a bunk bed castle for a premium price. But if you are coming in early and planning on going to Disneyland for the day, you can leave your luggage, take the complimentary shuttle to and from the park, and then check-in upon your return. My daughter and I had already gone to Disneyland the day before with family as we had an AirBnB for the weekend and we were using this day to rest before going to the park again the next day. So we had to wait in the lobby for two hours before we could check in. They

When we arrived here, we thought we'd hit the jackpot if you exclude the daily self parking charge which is an eye-watering $18 a night!  It all started to go down-hill pretty fast when we checked in. It took us over 2 hours in total to actually get a room that would be "suitable" to sleep in for the night. We only stayed here for a night as the overall cleanliness and location of the hotel really put us off our stay.  The castle is currently undergoing refurbishment, and the "towers" area feels something out of a horror film at night when wandering around.  The first room we were checked into looked like it hadn't been touched in 10+yrs even though we had been told it had been recently refurbished (they made a big deal about this).   There was bad water damage/mould accross the

Summary Heading: WOW just WOW what a plac
Summary: What an amazing place to stay. A family friendly place with wonderful staff and just minutes from Disneyland with free shuttles every 1/2 hour. Whilst not on the Disney precinct the price and access to the park make this the ideal place to stay. They offer a tour desk and all LA tours get picked up at the hotel free of charge. Rooms are so quiet and beds are just superb. Special place.
Manager Response: Thank you for being our guest and we appreciate the wonderful review and details that you shared here. Please do come back and stay with us again and make sure you let your friends and family know about the place you found in Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel. Thank you!

Summary: A beautiful hotel but after reading the reviews I requested to stay in an" updated" room and they said not a problem so when we checked in they gave us a map with instructions to "another building"( I had already read about the older rooms in a separate building) and sure enough it was what the reviews had stated,stained carpet,dark and dreary,musty odor so called front desk and they upgraded us to a room close to the lobby that was very nice! The pool is clean and house keeping was very good.The women at the front desk had a snippy attitude they could have been nicer.The shuttle left 5 min early so we missed it and the other problem was I called the night before for a 5:30 am wake up call (shuttle to airport) and never received call why offer it if you"re not going to follow

Summary Heading: Decent hotel... if you catch them on the right day.
Summary: Let me start out by mentioning the positives of this hotel: they provide a free shuttle to Disneyland, they sell Disneyland tickets on-site, the exterior aesthetics are quite pleasing. Now, I have stayed at this hotel several times in the past 3 years... and, it’s really hit-or-miss. I’ve had very pleasant stays where I didn’t have to be concerned with whether housekeeping was going to clean the entire room, or just replace the towels; and on the same token, I’ve had stays where I am checked into a filthy room with bathrooms that look like they haven’t been cleaned in weeks, and stains on the carpets and bed linens.
Manager Response: We have sent your feedback to the personnel concerned. We apologize for this bad experience. This is very disappointing to hear, but we hope you give us another chance to make it up to you next time you are in the Anaheim area. Thank you.

Summary: Have stayed at this hotel for 22 + years while visiting Disneyland. It has slowly been going downhill since leaving Sheraton. This last visit was shocking regarding the filthy hallways and rooms. First room had non vacuumed carpet, stained furniture, hair in bathroom, macaroni in carpet, and huge urine stain in middle of bedspread. Got moved to different room and had a disgusting smell only to realize the refrigerator door was cracked open with moldy food in it. Also silverware laying around the floor in the room. When I told the person at checkout how disappointing it was to see this property neglected, they said they have a hard time getting housekeeping staff. I could see that first hand. There are several newer name brand hotels in the area with standards that they adhere

Summary: Looking for information and/or reviews, recommendations on how to get to and from this hotel to LAX. This is our first time visiting Disneyland coming in from LAX and we would like to choose the best option. Travelling with small children.

Hopefully this will be helpful in your trip planning and thank you for reaching out to us. We look forward to your arrival. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Only needed a bed and a bathroom.
Summary: In all honesty, all we needed was a bed and a bathroom. The main objective of our stay was only for the purpose of Disneyland. We spent most of our days out in the park and came back to the room for a shower and sleep.   The hotel is surrounded by the freeway so there aren’t any shops or places to eat apart from those onsite.   The shuttle bus was the biggest positive. Due to the location of the hotel it’s too far too walk and only a small 5 min ride to Disneyland. The shuttle to the park every 30 mins was a big help. I would recommend going out to line up for the shuttle 10 mins prior to departure at peak periods. Ie. before park opening and after fireworks/parades. There were times where we took the bus to the park and just at the restaurants around Disneyland then came back
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, we are happy you provided this review. I will make sure that your issues are mentioned to the departments and managers whom are responsible for review. Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights on a family trip to Disney.  Hotel offers a great shuttle service to Disney parks. Pool area nice but unfortunately weather wasn't great so didn't get to use it. Reasonable breakfast in a nice restaurant.  Only complaint would be housekeeping missed our room one day. Came 15.55 to service room and I was on bathroom, they said they finished at 16.00 so no clean that day

Summary: Upon my sister’s recommendation, we chose Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel for our recent Disney visit.  Checkin was a breeze and the young man at the front desk was very pleasurable and informative. It is obvious that this hotel has standards for their employees and it exceeded my expectations.   This is a fairly large hotel, and our room was at the opposite end from the lobby. This made for a long walk when we needed something, but it’s just a warm up for Disney, right?😉 I was appreciative that they had an in house convenience store when I realized I was missing a toothbrush. They also sold snacks and souvenirs, which was handy.  Our room was fairly spacious, but was in need desperate need of carpet replacement. It appeared that it may be on the horizon, as there was plastic on
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us. I am very pleased to hear that our staff made your stay pleasant. Do checkout our Facebook and Twitter pages for promos that you might be interested in. Looking forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: We visited Anaheim for a Birthday Disney trip for my granddaughter. I usually do the planning, however my daughter wanted to plan the trip. She chose this hotel for all the features for the price. I read the reviews and knew from the get go that it was not above a 3-star. The kids room was nice, had a castle bunk bed which the kids loved! Our room was in a different building. Beds were on the firm side baths were outdated, especially the bathtub. I love to take baths, especially after walking all over Disney, however there were stains and the tub was just old. Would not take a bath in there. My daughter told me the pool was not heated, so the kids didn't want to swim and the hot tub was not hot. We did enjoy the shuttle to the parks which came every 20 minutes. My husband and I
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I am glad to hear that overall your experience was positive. Summary: Looks like they may be starting to do some much needed renovations in parts of the hotel.  The walls are very thin and sound really carries so if you are a light sleeper it could be a rough night.  The bed linens were nice and the room was clean.  This hotel is nothing fancy and no one will go out of their way for you (although the Princess at breakfast was exceptionally sweet) but it’s close to Disney, and has everything you will need.  Plus the price is one of the better ones for the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and feedback from your stay. Please stay with us again and see what changes are in store in our most recently renovated rooms. Thank you!

Summary: The room and carpet were clean although the carpet did have a few larger black stains on it.  The beds were comfortable and we were pleased with the large size of the room.   The young, women at the front desk was not pleasant and seemed annoyed with people.  Not sure why she was working at a hotel if she didn’t like hotel guests.  We had to call for an operator to request a hair dryer because we didn’t have one in our room.  After 2 hours and 2 calls later we finlly got one.    Pretty much most of the staff were rude except for the hotel security and housekeeping. The shuttle was frequent but wish they played more appropriate music or at least turned it down so you could not hear the lyrics.  Bottom line you get what you pay for when it comes to this hotel.  We would not stay
Manager Response: Thank you for this feedback from your stay, we appreciate your honest view of the hotel and staff. Summary: From the time you walk in to the time you walk out, the service is great. The price is great. The rooms are so nice. Wonderful place for Disneyland. They have a shuttle bus that is pretty awesome to take you to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel, would stay there again
Summary: This was our first time staying at the Anaheim Majestic.  We enjoyed our stay.  The property was nice, the rooms were nice (but a bit dark) and we enjoyed the onsite happy hour, game room, and mini store/cafe.  We did go to the pool which was nice, it was a little disappointed the spa was not in working order.  The property is large and can be a little confusing since our room was way towards the back of the property.  They also have an onsite Princess, my daughters never got to see her, but was able to write a letter to her.
Manager Response: Thank you for this review of your recent stay with us. We are so pleased that you enjoyed the hotel and amenities offered here. Please do come back and stay with us again. We appreciate your feedback. Thank you!

Summary: This Hotel beat my expectations by a lot. We are Annual passholders and try to go every other month,  I usually try to find good deals throughout the year.  Our next 3 trips were booked at different hotels and we have now switched all those trips to this hotel.  The check in was a breeze and the room was super nice and big.  The biggest room I have stayed in before that wasn't a suite.  The Lobby had a nice bar and restaurant attached to it and looked like some good food.  The Shuttle wins the cake though.  It leaves every Hour and every 1/2 hour from the hotel and picks up from Disney every 15 and 45 of every hour.  Mind you this shuttle is Free which in not common at all in Anaheim.  I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to Visit Disneyland.

The room was one of the largest I've ever stayed in for a standard double room. I did not witness any mold or insects as other guests have documented. The furniture was a little tired but again you must remember that you have chosen to stay in a 3* hotel. The breakfast was good for the money. Miguel was polite and attentive. Manager Response: I appreciate your positive feedback about our hotel. We do take pride in catering to our guests' needs the best way we can. If you're traveling to our area gain soon, don't hesitate to visit again. Thank you!

Summary: On the whole we were extremely impressed with this hotel. The public spaces were nicely decorated and the rooms were large and well equipped.  However, I am a wheelchair user so had an accessible room with roll in shower.   The bathroom was well equipped but the shower was awkward to use so my partner had to hold the shower from behind the curtain in order for me to shower. Secondly the sink was too high and finally the bed was ridiculously high for a wheelchair user to get into. I had to have help to get in and out of bed. To be honest it was so humiliating that I was unable to get into bed myself. I found it very upsetting.  We had a lovely breakfast the following morning before making our way to Disneyland. The Majestic provided courtesy buses to and from Disneyland. They

Summary Heading: Great stay for families visiting Disney
Summary: This hotel is great for stays with the family. The rooms are large, the buffet breakfast is delicious, and the grounds are beautiful. The only complaint was how incredibly uncomfortable the bed was. Couldn’t get comfortable and well rested on that bed. The bathroom was also way too tiny but it gets the job done. We didn’t spend enough time at the hotel to use the pool, although it’s nice that it had one. If you’re staying here, you’re most likely going to Disneyland and not spending every minute at the hotel. Therefore, it’s definitely at a great location to get to and from Disney. And the shuttle service to Disneyland is definitely a plus. The employees were all friendly and welcoming. Definitely would stay here again.
Manager Response: I appreciate your positive feedback about our hotel. We do take pride in catering to our guests' needs the best way we can. If you're traveling to our area gain soon, don't hesitate to call us.

Summary: Came here about a year ago and I still think of it and plan to book it on our next trip to Disneyland! Check-in was a breeze, lobby is huge and customer service was good.  Our room was spacious and clean. Beds were comfy.    We only went to the pool at night but it was nice to relax our tired bodies in the jacuzzi and watch the fireworks while enjoying a nice little drink while the kids played in the pool.  Shuttle line fills up quick for those first few departures so plan accordingly or just plan on getting Disney later (like 10ish) if you don't want to be waiting in lines.  Shuttle driver was super nice, wish I could remember his name.    Overall great experience, no complaints!

Summary: I stayed here for 5 nights. Checking in was a breeze, done and dusted in 5 minutes! As the hotel is fairly big, I had a bit of walking to do in order to get to my room. The room itself was very spacious and comfortable, but the bathroom was a bit dated (not a big fan of shower curtains).   There is a shuttle to and from Disneyland every 30 mins - make sure you wake up early to be at the front of the queue!   Staff were friendly, the facilities were good and the lounge area with the fire place was an awesome place to relax, perfect with the bar a few metres away!

Summary: My wallet was stolen by a guest at this hotel. Creepy. The video cams captured the image and the manager, security and Anaheim police got it back from the thieving hotel guest. The guest was allowed to stay in the hotel and got a misdemeanor. Grateful to get my Id back so I could fly home but surprised the hotel didn’t accommodate us further. Hotel was fine, happy with size of the room, clean enough. Nice staff. Food was ok. Great happy hour, terrible coffee. Shuttle to abd fro Disney was slow and we had to get an Uber several times. Clean pool and convenient deli on site. Darling baby ducks wandering throughout the grounds. The breakfast was good, don’t miss the omelet station outside like I did. We are so happy that your items were recovered and returned to you with the help of our diligent associates. We will share your other concerns with the responsible managers for review and follow up. We hope that you won’t let this tarnish your view of our hotel and that you would choose to visit us again in the future when your plans bring you back to the Disneyland area.

Summary Heading: Two night stay to visit Disneyland
Summary: Fast and friendly check in - off to the room within 5 minutes of arriving. No queue! Very surprised by the quality, size, and cleanliness of the room - on of the biggest and best we have stayed in in the US. After the highway noise issues in the previous hotel, we were worried about the proximity of the highway. However, the windows were excellent and there was almost no noise. This combines its amazingly comfortable beds led to a good nights sleep. Had a few drink and some snacks at the bar. Very reasonable prices and excellent service. 10 minute regular complementary bus trip trip to Disney. I recommend this hotel and will stay again in the future.

Summary: We stayed at the Majestic for 5 nights split over two periods during the Easter holidays. On balance I think it was positive. We were then subsequently disturbed by the rooms either side (both connecting). In general during our stay the noise from other rooms was quite significant.  The first room was huge but the bathroom was tiny! The second room had been refurbished and was on the other side of the hotel which was a little quieter (and only one connected room).  We used the pool one afternoon which was great. It was busy but there were enough loungers and towels were replenished

Summary: Our stay at the Majestic Garden was over Spring Break; arguably one of the busiest times of the year at Disney. Even so, the Majestic Garden never felt too busy, even though they were fully booked; the grounds are so expansive and rooms so large that we never felt like sardines (not until we got into the parks, anyway...).  The rooms were clean, the theme cute, and the grounds and garden were just plain pretty. It was also lovely to have a bar, restaurant and gift-shop on-site - a relief at the end of a long day to have the option of staying put.   My only complaint would be with the shuttles. Although the drivers were all truly wonderful, the busses were always off-schedule. I know it was a very busy time and they seemed to be doing their best to keep up, but the long waits

First of all I must say the majestic has a really cool castle theme that you see as you pull up to the hotel. The lobby is full of Disney magic. They even have their own princess and special story/meet and greet with her. They have their own buses to transport you to disneyland. I was so excited to stay there until we got to our room. They are outdated, the whole side of the mattress was so worn out that the bed sloped and dipped from countless guests sitting on the edge of the bed The air conditioner in the room blew out warm air. Summary: I recently visited this hotel and I was amazed of the quality and amenities it has to offer  To start off I have to say the customer service they provided was MAJESTIC!!! Splendid and very helpful!!!  The room was very spacious, the bathroom is a little small but why need a big bathroom?, The decor in both the lobby and rooms are very welcoming and reminded us that we are on a vacation and not a overpriced hotel. Summary: I love staying here. Beautiful hotel, lovely staff, and free shuttle to the park. Rene Del Toro in the restaurant was fantastic!! And the food was great. Loved the breakfast in the morning. Rooms were comfortable and never heard any noise. Will stay again for my next Disney trip.

Summary: The hotel was clean and comfortable.  Old style AC where you turn the fan on manually so may be chilled in the morning.  Popcorn ceiling is outdated.   Nothing real fancy.  You're paying for location to Disneyland and shuttle to the parks.  Not disappointed, not super impressed either.  Served it's purpose well.  Great view of the fireworks from outside the check in area
Manager Response: Thank you for this review of your recent stay with us. We are so pleased that you enjoyed the hotel and amenities offered here. Please do come back and see us again, Thank you!

Summary: Two months ago I stayed at this hotel and the room was awesome. Last week I stayed here and my room was a huge disappointment! It was a old outdated room that I suppose they haven’t got around to renovating yet, unlike my last room here. If you saw both rooms you wouldn’t think that they were in the same hotel. But the worse part was that the bed mattress’ springs were broken and there was a huge uncomfortable dip in the bed that could not be ignored. It make a horrible clunking sound when anything moved on it. I was lucky enough to be traveling with my child who opted to switch sides with me. Also while I was climbing into the bed I was barefoot and stabbed the bottom of my feet on some big dried up nail trimmings on the carpet right next to the bed. (See picture below).In

I'd give this 2.5/5, as it's just tolerable for the price. The hotel itself looks adorable, but once the kitsch wears off this carriage turns back into a pumpkin.   Pro's are the lobby looks nice and festive, especially when you go during fall and winter holidays. The hotel's adorable princess mascot is often greeting families in the hotel lobby, and successfully distracts kids during the long check-in process. The Disney Shuttle is frequent, was mostly on time, and had very friendly drivers. The gated parking lot felt very safe and secure. The upgraded rooms and grounds are also lovely. It's a fun place to wander and enjoy all of the castle-themed details. It has very comfortable beds, and spacious rooms. They do provide a good, quiet, night's rest here.  The downside is that
Manager Response: We have sent your feedback to the personnel concerned. We apologize for this bad experience. This is very disappointing to hear, but we hope you give us another chance to make it up to you next time you are in the Anaheim area. Thank you.

Summary Heading: Disgusting bathroom, no free breakfast and no free parking = dealbreaker
Summary: We had an OK experience. On the good side, the hotel's lobby, dining, pool and surroundings is MAJESTIC as the name says. But that is about it. The room is also pretty amazing and then it isn't. It was well prepared, clean, and the suite we had was spacious and very well / recently renovated .... except the bathroom. It was near disgusting and almost DANGEROUS...  poorly lit, paint peeling, a large rectangle cover that looks like its going to fall off the ceiling, fixtures, door knobs and faucets that are creaky, barely work / latch / turn and in various stages of disrepair. Its hard to explain the disparity of how nice the reception / dining / part of the room was compared to the bathroom. You know if the price was right, I'd let it go but we paid a premium to be here.
Manager Response: We have sent your feedback to the personnel concerned. We apologize for this bad experience. This is very disappointing to hear, but we hope you give us another chance to make it up to you next time you are in the Anaheim area. Thank you.

Summary: I read the reviews and thought we would still give staying here a chance. Just checked in and room is big, but not updated and worn out. Carpet is severely stained, furniture is dinged, scratched and worn. Even the sitting chair is so stained we won't be sitting in it. Bed is clean and so far it is quiet. Cannot believe they charge for this quality and then parking on top of it. This is going to be a long four days and not starting out well. Front desk was very nice and friendly. Room, two thumbs down!

My daughter and I stayed here during a school trip to Disneyland. This hotel is huge with a pool and a hot tub. The fun thing is that from the pool area you can view the Disneyland fireworks around 9:30.  There is a free shuttle that takes you to the parks every half hour and from Disneyland the bus stop is 13 to get back to the hotel. The breakfast buffet is packed with pastries, breads, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, cereal, juices and the best part is just outside in the courtyard is an omelet station, delicious. They also have a gift shop that sells sandwiches and other snacks if you need a small meal. I enjoyed a roast beef sandwich that was very good. The room was spacious but the bathroom was on the small size. Some of the girls that were staying in a quad room said it

Great hotel to stay at close to Disneyland, clean room but no microwave oven the staff is very friendly and helpful Liszt was very nice and helpful very nice I love the parking and getting to Disneyland was easy with the   Shuttlebus

The good: Happy Hour was amazing, appetizer and drink specials were both top notch. Ate dinner there one night and the fish and chips and Caesar  salad were both delicious. Room was clean but a little dated. Staff was friendly and helpful. Having a Disney rep on site was also a bonus. Shuttle was always on time and the bus drivers were very friendly.  The bad: $18 a day to park your car...as a guest!! Pool area is a little run down, hotel is very close to where the fireworks go off at Disneyland so no early bedtime due to the booms and all the car alarms set off. TV was a little hard to get to work in the room and the one in the lounge area was always on FOX news and I was told they couldn't change it, so that was a bummer.  All in all a very nice stay and we would stay again.

My family booked a few days at the Anaheim Majestic Hotel so we could take our first trip to Disneyland with our 7 year old daughter. We arrived at the hotel at 4:00 and the parking lot was packed. It was very difficult to find a place to park. Apparently the hotel sells day parking to people not staying at the hotel and did not account for those who were. After several laps around the parking lot we finally got a place to park and then proceeded to check in. Then we went to the front desk we were told our room was not ready yet (check in was at 4).  We decided to sit at their in house bar and have a drink and some food.  We ordered our first round of drinks and then decided to order our food.  About 30 minutes went by and we haven't received our second drink order or our food.

My wife, daughter and I recently stayed at the hotel and were forced to end our stay early because the hotel was not clean. My family and I checked in late Thursday night (3-15) and when we got to our first room (4224) we conducted our normal bed bug check When we lifted the mattress we found the underside of the mattress to be stained with blood. We contacted the front desk and to their credit they moved us to a new room directly across the hall (4225) right away. My wife and I checked the beds, gave the room a quick once over and went to bed. The following day we went to Disney and came back to the room late at night. After my family had gone to bed I began to work on my computer and when I moved one of the large stationary chairs in the room I discovered two large pieces of

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for a visit to Disney
Summary: We stayed here for five nights and we were pleased with the hotel. The first morning we decided to walk to the park because we were up and didn’t want to wait on the 7:30 shuttle. It was about a mile walk. Not to bad actually. Rode the shuttle every other time. Shuttle is great and on time. Loved that! We got the deluxe room so there was plenty of room for us (me, wife, two kids). Would have liked a sofa as opposed to the two chairs we had. There was no microwave which was a bummer but we knew that before we got here. The bathroom would be my only complaint.  To small for more than one person to get ready at a time. I didn’t like that I had to pay $18 a day to park, but I figure that’s probably anywhere around there.  Staff was great and I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: A tad run down, But good value
Summary: We stayed here as it was close to Disneyland without the Disney price. Site is a tad run down and our room was large but in need of a revamp. Check in was so slow.... Breakfast we had included and was very good lots of variety. The shuttle was always on time and had very happy drivers.   No milk for free!! Being from England we do love a good cuppa tea but the hotel refused to give us any milk instead they advise us to use room service and purchase it. In all its a reasonable priced hotel close to Disneyland could you get better probably yes could you get worse definitely yes.

Summary Heading: Majestic prices in Anaheim without a lot of garden
Summary: This hotel close to the Disneyland looks good from outside but then the majestic impression fades quickly. Long queues and slow service when checking in. Its faster to rent a car in Alamos as walk in customer than to get a reserved room. The reception employees were very friendly though. The rooms are typically American. Worn down, big and wasting energy and water with old bathrooms and piping systems that deserve a brush up. Beds are old but clean. Overall cleanliness is NOT good. In the bathrooms a lot of hairs ....the only majestic thing is the final price when checking out....You can do better. And please, dear manager rather than writing some answer to my review with this boring mix of "you could have asked for another room" or "we are refurbishing" make your job and bring

We stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel is old, dark and kind of smells. The room was dark and not that clean. The bathroom was small, the sink wasn’t separate so only one person could get ready at a time. There was no fan in the bathroom. On the plus side, the shuttle drivers were great, very friendly and always on time. I don’t like having to depend on a shuttle but the hotel is too far from Disneyland to walk. With so many better choices closer to the park, we definitely won’t stay there again.

The first thing I like about this hotel is that is has a shuttle that will take you over to the park. They leave quite frequently and make sure to find out when and where they are picking up from the park. It's not the same spot as drop off. The hotel has a castle and royal theme. Perfect for families visiting Disneyland. I suggest booking ahead of time and paying attention to you charges on the receipt. They were out of standard rooms when we checked in and we got upgraded to a castle room with a kind bed and castle bunk bed! Super awesome and perfect for your kids. Room service is excellent. Would stay here again.

Summary Heading: A Great Alternative to Disney Resorts
Summary: We booked this hotel for our family’s week-long vacation to Disneyland. We booked here instead of the $500/night Disneyland hotels. The castle decor, both inside and out was a huge draw for us, even more so when our kids saw the hotel!   We stayed in the room with two queen beds. The room fit our family of five and all our luggage and souvenirs very easily. Only complaint was a slightly small bathroom, but the mirror and furniture in the entryway of the room made that easy to tolerate.   The grounds are beautiful, and the dream machine shuttle to and from the park made the trip to the park a breeze on the days we couldn’t walk the one mile.   Overall, the only major issue we had was the access to our room. In order to get to our room on the 3rd floor, we had to walk all the way

This is our second time staying here.  The place looks the same, room a bit worn down, carpets and walls have stains.  Location wise, great for Disneyland, shuttle run regularly and transit time short due to the great location.  They have a on-site Disney ticket counter which will save you time buying the tickets at the park.  Nice size pool for the kids.  Not great, not awful  just fair.

Summary Heading: A great little place to stay
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It was good value and decent price point. Shuttle ran fairly consistently too from the park to the hotel and back. We also walked one morning and it was a decent amount of time to get there... I wish the rooms were a little more updated and the shuttle ran a little earlier in the morning prior to the gates opening. It it is good value.

The hotel was a little old, only some towers were remodeled. My sister's room was really big, but the washroom was extremely small. My room size was smaller and I had a bigger washroom. Not a lot of food options at the hotel. You must take a car to get to the closest restaurant or grocery market.  Although, their shuttles run very often to Disneyland and coming back, and that was convenient.

We are currently staying here for five nights. We asked for one of their rermoldeled rooms and are quite happy with our room and entire experience. The bus to the park is punctual and, if needed, they add another bus. I too was surprised by the parking fee as it is not prominently displayed. However, considering the cost of the room, it is still a good bargain.  Since a complimentary breakfast is not provided, we ate outside the park before entering. I would return.

We booked our trip through Costco and found all kinds of extras included in our package.  Some of them too late to use them all!  I love this hotel, and will definitely be back.  We never had to wait too long for the shuttle, and when we did have to wait, it was never long.

My son and I stayed here in 2017 and went to Disneyland. I expected the hotel to be very nice, but it was what I would consider a 3-star hotel. More attention to mold in the bathrooms and musty smell in the carpets should be given.

The hotel was not bad. Very easy to find, the staff was friendly and it was clean. We stayed in the North tower, which was very quite but....the doors into the building require the use of your room key, which seemed to only work part of the time. We had to manually pull the doors open every time. I really feel the hotel should offer free parking. I know hotels that are located much more conveniently to the entrance to Disneyland that offer free parking for their guest. What am I getting for $18 a day? There is a shuttle that runs to Disneyland all day, but it wasn't quick enough for us. We ended up walking. It's about a 20-25 min walk. We probably would not stay again, only because of the cost of parking in conjunction with the location.

Location of this hotel is great.  Shuttle service to the parks was super easy and efficient.  Love that they offered breakfast, had a bar, and all general amenities.  However, rooms are extremely dated. Furniture, carpet torn and stained.  Questioned cleanliness. I went to put something on shelf in closet and decided to wipe first and it was disgusting.  Hotel has great potential IF it is upgraded.  Would not stay there again at this time.

We chose this hotel based on somewhat decent reviews and the fact that the website we were booking through didn’t mention that there was a fee for parking. It’s very close to Disneyland, and the outside of the hotel seems very nice. However, upon arrival, you realize that there’s an $18 fee for parking, and they’ve carefully trained all of their employees to be as heartless as possible. Being shocked by the parking fee, we asked for it to be waived, at which point they printed out the Priceline website where it shows at the bottom, “additional fees may apply” — using that disclaimer to justify charging twice as much as most of the local hotels. Not an ounce of empathy whatsoever, even though, having worked extensively in hospitality, I am always super friendly with people in the

Stayed here with a friend. We had a decent stay but overall I don't think either of us liked it as much as other places we have stayed in the area. The property just felt dated overall for the price range, immediately upon entering the lobby. The rooms, while clean and decently comfortable, just felt dated as well. Disneyland is walkable, although a decent hike. They also offer a shuttle that we did not use. I think I would probably stay somewhere else for the price range next time without a nice refurb.

Over the past 30 years we have stayed at pretty much every hotel near Disneyland. We planned a quick trip to Disneyland for my grandsons birthday and all the usual hotels we usually stay at were booked.  The Anaheim Majestic Garden showed up on a booking site and we went for it. Guess what!!—>We are never staying anywhere else again!  This hotel is the bomb. It looks like a castle, with beautiful courtyards, waterfalls, a koi pond and it’s landscaped meticulously. The hotel itself is huge- you can get lost walking around in fact. The lobby area is majestic and beautiful with a nice sitting area, tv area for the kids and a whole bunch of computers for adults to do work on.  The hotel rooms are also humongous, you feel like you are sleeping in a fancy castle with beautiful big

Summary Heading: Always a great stay from beginning to end.
Summary: Great hotel to stay at while in the Anaheim area. Beautiful garden areas to relax in along with refreshing pool. Spacious renovated rooms some opening into the gardens. Great food and excellent room service.

Summary Heading: Easy disneyland access, nice pool and food
Summary: We stayed here and had a great time. Though the hotel is showing its age, the staff is great, restaurant was good, rooms clean, and it is freeway close.  One nice thing is the free shuttle right to downtown disney, with on time pick ups every 1/2 hour.  David Minkin's magic show is also here, a bonus!

Summary Heading: Friendly and helpful staff.  Clean and large rooms for families!
Summary: We found the hotel to be clean and the staff were friendly and helpful.  The rooms are quite large and fit our needs quite comfortably.
