The shuttle drivers were very friendly, even though they had to deal with a few grumpy people at the end of the day.  (Kudos to Bill our night shuttle driver!)  The bistro cafe was much less expensive (get your 15% discount when you check in) and better tasting than at Disneyland.     We loved the garden areas and the kids enjoyed the pool most evenings.

I was a bit leery booking this place after reading some of the reviews, but we really didn't encounter any of the issues most complained about.  I was there for a trade show at the convention center and this place worked out quite well, especially the price.  I flew cross country and arrived at the hotel at 10am.  Amazingly, my room was ready and I was able to check in immediately.  During my check-in, there was a guest checking out with a laundry list of complaints and I thought uh, oh....  But, I was pleasantly surprised.    The room was clean, spacious, and included a coffee maker and fridge.  No microwave in the room, but there is one in the coffee/convenience shop off the lobby you can use. Our room had two queen beds (very comfy) a nice sized desk, a sitting area, and

We were there for a trade show and while I knew it was an old hotel undergoing some room renovations this is just not right.  We arrived on Thursday afternoon, there were dirty dishes outside our room from previous people, THEY WERE THERE UNTIL WE CHECKED OUT FOUR DAYS LATER! Our room was not vacuumed, the older doorman never opened a door or helped anyone with bags. I honestly think owners need to overhaul the staff. We moved to another hotel for the remainder of our stay.

Summary Heading: Clean, loved Free Shuttle to Disney!
Summary: Family Friendly, store located in Lobby for milk and Coffee Free shuttle is a Plus, Bedrooms are roomy we stayed next to the pool. Clean comfortable rooms, sitting areas in Lobby are nice. Shuttles come by every 15 min.

I was expecting a run down, old, not so great hotel due to reviews and the low price I paid.  I was so surprised by how nice it was!  The parking lot is large so it was easy to find a parking spot.  The check in process was fast and smooth and the employee was helpful.  The hotel is beautiful, well decorated and has every amenity that you could want.  I love the themes you see just walking around the main hotel floor.  Our room was large, comfortable, clean, and had a fun forest themed wall.  The best part to me was the shuttle to Disney.  It leaves every 1/2 hour and goes all the way until after the park closes.  I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a nice, affordable place near Disney.

If I could give negative stars I would. FAR FROM MAJESTIC!!  The third night here our car was broken into in their parking lot.  Mind you we are paying $16 a day to park here and there’s security on site. We were not notified about the break in even though it was hours after being discovered by the hotel.  We had just had room service delivered when my husband went to the car and noticed our window completely shattered.  Frantically wondering what we’re going to do with a broken window 6+ hours from home the gentleman at the front desk assured us the hotel will take care of their guests (there was about 10 others this happened to).  That made us feel better so we went to bed.  My 5 and 7 year old were scared but we were able to calm them down.  The next morning my husband spoke

Pros - Staff was great. The sitting areas and dining areas are nice. Looks like they are slowly remodeling the property. New carpet and fresh walls in the hallways. Rooms are large.  Shuttle to the park was very convenient.  Great water pressure in the shower.  Breakfast buffet was a good price. Eggs Benedict was good as well. Disney kiosk in the lobby for information.   Cons - went to check in and looks like housekeeping forgot to remove dirty dishes and melted ice cream from the entrance to our room.  Rooms are absolutely filthy. Stains on the couches, floors, curtains etc. Beds are old. When checking in at the front desk the fabric wall paper looks to be from the 70’s and is in horrible shape ( imagine that old 20 yr old tee shirt you have to do yard work/painting/garage

If you like sleek modern hotels, this is not the place for you.  If you have young kids (or you are just a kid at heart)  who are excited about Disney this is a fun place to stay. It looks like a castle and there is a princess who reads stories. Very retro, a little shabby chic.  The elevators are creaky but the rooms are large and clean.  Very Disney focussed. The shuttle to Disneyland is great.  The morning buffet is fabulous and reasonably priced.  Hotel staff very friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disney
Summary: Had a lovely stay at this hotel. Couple in our twenties but loved the castle style of the hotel. Its very close to Disney and they run a free shuttle every 30 minutes. Room was very large however bathroom was quiet small in comparison, not an issue, just found it strange. Hotel was very clean. Wifi wasnt great but worked ok. Staff were friendly and helpful. Didn't enjoy the breakfast buffet but in general I find american buffet food under whelming. Good place to stay for Disney but far out if you want to do other things in LA if you dont have a car, $40 Uber to Hollywood walk of fame.

Summary Heading: Son was injured on glass top in our hotel room.
Summary: I am giving the one star to the lead front desk who took an incident report for my son getting injured in room 1178 on 1/5/18, and for the amazing bartender who worked the closing shifts at midnight during our stay. After my son cut his arm from an unkempt glass top in our room, Karen, the supervisor or our stay when we checked out, advised that someone from the corporate office would follow up with me via email or phone call. As nice as the grounds are, the rooms are still outdated and rundown. At least in the room we were in. We stayed overnight for 3 nights, and not once did we realize the glass top on top of the cabinet of our room entrance was split and had smaller cracks around the split. We occasionally put a drink or what not on top of it for a few minutes during our

Great hotel.  Huge room.  Beautiful gardens.  Easy check in, friendly staff.  Very clean room.  Have stayed here many times and is one of my go to hotels when in Anahiem.  They sell tickets for Disney at a conveniently located kiosk.  They provide free transportation to and from the park.

Summary Heading: Horrible security,  hotel is dirty and needs updating, except for the lobby
Summary: since they let their Starwood status drop, the hotel has gone very down hill. The hotel is dirty and needs upgrading. Customer Service is horrible.  rooms have fryway noise, and the parking is dangerous, with no security. My son's car was one of 12 cars broken into.  Hotel's position; not their problem.  The only good thing about this hotel is the shuttle to Disneyland

Summary Heading: Poor hotel for large (or small) groups.
Summary: Our rooms were not ready despite the assurance that they would be upon arrival. We waited for two hours in the lobby, after being told we'd have rooms within a stated check in time. Staff was rude and acted as if nothing could be done. Managers were rude as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience as all feedback is appreciated and communicated so we may continue to improve.  We apologize for the experience of which you describe, as it is never our intent delay the check-in of any guest or group.  We take every guests comfort with utmost of care.  As with most youth groups such as yours, we try to place all guestrooms nearby each other for the additional safety, security and ease of coordination of the children with the organization or school.  We have learned this is a best practice appreciated by the chaperones and adults in charge of their supervision.  The hotel’s check-in is after 4:00 PM.  Although we were advised of your early check-in arrival of 2:00PM on the same day, it is important to know with the hotel’s sold-out status the night before your arrival it may be challenging to have the entire groups rooms ready earlier than our normal check in time.   We were happy to get most of your group rooms situated by the 4:00PM time frame with only the remaining few shortly after.  We apologize if any of our staff were rude as that is not how would like to be remembered.  We will share your comments with the Front Office Team and the General Manager.  We hope the remainder of your stay will be perfect and we that we can gain your confidence in a future stay.  Thank you.

Summary Heading: Great themed hotel and great location for Disney
Summary: Loved this hotel when we arrived, it was magical! Had a great room, massive for a family of 4 (2 older teenage kids).  Didn't try the restaurant as was busy and some reviews were not so great about it. Fitness room was good and staff were friendly.  Shuttle bus too and from Disney even over Xmas day was really good and frequent.  Would stay again.

My mother and I stayed here for vacation (Disneyland) in June 2017. We didn't have any problems checking in at all, although finding our room (in the old part of the hotel) was challenging. I found a few french fries under my bed, but decided it was not a big enough deal to complain at the time. I decided to go to the restaurant to have dinner while my Mom took a swim in the pool. While eating my dinner, I received a call from her that the bath tub was not draining while she was in the shower and had quite a bit of standing water in it. I stopped by the front desk and advised them of this. They did not have any other rooms that we could be moved to, so they sent maintenance to take a look. A better part of an hour later, maintenance finally arrived. After a little bit of him

Disappointed as the morning of the 4th day we were there we found dried dog poop in the corner of the room next to our bed.  Also behind the door going out to the court yard. They gave us $100.00 off our 8 day cost.  Unfortunately when we left we were asked to pay $28 for remaining cost of parking ($128.00-$100.00=$28.00). So keep in mind it costs $16.00 daily for parking. We found the staff very nice and the shuttle was great to and from the Disneyland.

Decent location. We needed a room after deciding to stay another day in Anaheim to visit Disney and the Marriott had a conference and were sold out so we booked something close to Hwy 5.  Nice reception & bar for a 3-3.5 hotel. Staff was friendly. Then we saw the room which was a solid 3-star, but seemed like someone forgot to clean the floor that day and left the top sheet of the beds unchanged... it was for 1 night, comfy bed and it did the trick as a place to sleep and leave early in the morning.  There was a shuttle that runs every 30mins to & from Disney but we didn't use the free service.

We stayed two nights at the Majestic Garden hotelfor our trip to Disneyland with grandkids.  It was clean and spacious, very nice lobby and dining.  The beds were comfortable and very nice pillows.  There is coffee in the room but no refrigerator for any leftovers you might have or drinks.  there is a breakfast buffet along with single meal dining.  The staff was courteous and helpful.  We had a need of a wheelchair and they were quick to respond.  In the morning there was a princess going to talk to the children at the buffet and welcoming them to her castle.  They did charge 16.00 for parking each night but they had a free shuttle to Disneyland that runs frequently.  The kids enjoyed the pool and you can see the nightly fireworks from the hotel lot.

We stayed in this hotel 25 years ago for part of our honeymoon and decided seeing we were back in LA to stay again. The hotel used to be a Sheraton hotel and it was better in the past but for a three star hotel near dis eye it is very good. Our room was large slightly outdated but very clean. The staff were excellent and waived the parking fee as we were celebrating our anniversary. Best part it the hotel is being able to see the fireworks from the hotel pool. Brilliant. There is also a free shuttle to the park every 30 mins. If you are looking for a 3* hotel near Disney you could do a lot worse.

This was the first time staying here and likely our last. Dont get me wrong, the staff here are very nice and polite especially at the bar. But the room we stayed in was not worth the money we spent. First the room was not ready until 6pm. Check in is at 4pm. Granted it was the day before New Years and im sure they were a little under staffed, but if check out is at 11am. It should not take 8 hours to clean a room. The room it self was a HUGE box with nothing really filling it expected a stained covered couch and coffee table, a small dresser, a small desk and a bed shoved into the corner. The bathroom was so small, I had to walk in sideways because of the small door frame. It is definitely a 3/4 of a person bathroom. The tub would not drain, so you could take a shower and a

Summary Heading: Beautiful but not close to the parks
Summary: Clean and beautiful inside and out. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Loved the hotel itself.   Location was a bit of an issue. It’s a 20 min walk to the parks along the freeway entrance through downtown Disney. Not a lot of choice for picking up supplies, there’s only a gas station convenience store near by.

Summary Heading: If you are going to Disneyland this is a great place to stay.
Summary: Shuttle to Disneyland was a bonus and the restaurant there was fantastic. The shuttle driver was friendly and we were able to check in in 15 minutes.  They were so nice in letting us check in 20 minutes before, this rarely happens, I guess we were just lucky.

I loved our stay, the room was big, quiet and comfortable, room service was quick and the food was great. Nice shuttle service to Disneyland (they have 3 that I noticed, a big one, a medium one and a smaller one), the wait wasn’t long at all, and they run since early in the morning up until 1:15hrs after closing time. Christmas decorations were pretty, and staff was nice and helpful. Manuel helped us book our transfer from Anaheim to Hollywood, he was great help.  I would definitely stay there again :)

Summary Heading: Poor, not worth it! Look for another hotel in the area
Summary: We stayed at the castle bed room for 3 nights. We upgraded to the castle bed room for $100 per night. That was the only thing worth in the room.   The room was noisy with freeway noise coming through all night. The room had popcorn ceiling, the toilet was small and cramped. No safe, you need to go to the front desk to get a bank like locker, only a few small things might fit in. You are given a key and if you lose it, you are screwed.   Breakfast buffet was good.  There is nothing else to see in the hotel, even though it's a 20min walk from Disneyland, you don't really see any activities at night.  Average staff, room service is till 11pm and doesn't take an order if you are not in the room. Very little curtsey at the front desk. Was asked for an ID at the bar, that never

Cute hotel undergoing refurbishment throughout. Good facilities, restaurant, shop, cafe, games room for kids, laundry and themed rooms.  Shuttle service is complementary and therefore busy however if you are not travelling with younger kids the Parks are only a ten minute walk from the hotel.

We stayed here overnight between days at Disneyland, and it was just right for our needs (3 adults, 1 child).  The beds were comfy, the rooms clean with nice amenities like coffeemaker and refrigerator. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, quickly and graciously providing little extras we requested.  The Christmas decorations were great.  There are so many choices in Anaheim, and we've stayed in many of them, but this one we will try again for sure.  We didn't happen to use the free shuttle, but we might consider it next time.  That is a terrific extra for them to provide.  We were a little disappointed that the pool was closed when we returned from Disneyland, but we understand the need to have a quiet time after 10. It would also be wonderful if a light breakfast

The walls were very thin. We were kept up all up all night long by noisy children and crying babies. The pull out sofa couch was dreadful. We weren't  able to get a good nights sleep. The shower was clogged so that you had to stand in water to shower. The tv cable came in and out the entire time.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We're sorry but you can counter the situation that you described. At any time were you able to reach out to a manager for assistance while you were here. We hope that you will give us another chance when your plans bring you back to the Anaheim Resort area.

Summary: Said it was a pet friendly hotel so booked it they than said we could not leave our small dogs unintended. We came here to go to Disneyland.What a joke !Got our pet deposit but we could not leave room! Really

Summary Heading: Nice staff, clean hotel, will definitely stay again!
Summary: We loved our split level room!  the grounds were decorated so beautifully for Christmas.  the restaurant has amazing food and the breakfast buffet is over the top! As Disney Pass holders we will definitely choose this hotel again!

Summary Heading: It's our home away from home when we visit Disneyland !
Summary: We always stay at Anaheim Majestic when we visit Disneyland ! The staff is always friendly and remembers us when we arrive! the rooms are spacious and nice and always  tidy. The Hotel bar is a great place to relax after visiting the parks and the deli is great for grabbing a quick bite to eat.   We love being able to see the fireworks from the hotel, and We love the convenient shuttle ride to the Disney parks.

This was a good place to relax after a long day at the theme parks. The Christmas decorations added to the good atmosphere; the desk staff was nice, the maid was nice, and they sold ice cream in the lobby - a good experience all around. There was some police activity in the lobby and parking lot (not unusual at a hotel near a theme park), but, from what I could see and hear, the hotel staff and the police handled the issue as quickly as possible; this was another reminder to never leave anything visible in my car.

Despite being for families, we found the lobby bar a peaceful respite from the Disney crowds.  Despite being close to Disney, don't expect to be able to walk there.  The roads/walkways are designed to prevent you from getting there by foot.  So you'll be stuck using the shuttle system.  Miles cheaper than a Disney Hotel.  The pool was very basic.

Good comfortable rooms. It is an old hotel but well kept and clean.   The toilet size can be bigger but still good enough.   They have good shuttle services to Disneyland every 30mins but they increases the frequency of the shuttle services when there are more people then what the bus can carry and that is very nice.  Will I consider staying here in the future? If we can get a good price, yes.

First time staying here, checked in at 10pm, front desk was very nice. We got a little confused finding the room, but other than that, the room we stayed in was nice, renovated, clean and very large. Got 2 queen beds, pretty comfy. Stayed here for 4 nights. Used the free shuttle a few times back and fourth to Disney, that was nice. Drivers were very nice. Parking you had to pay for, which is no biggie. Had to park kinda far, because the lot was pretty full. For Thanksgiving weekend, would definitely stay here again!!

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay - Convenient, Clean and affordable.
Summary: We were looking at different accommodation options for our 3 days in LA. I was going to go to Chino the the air museums there, my daughters wanted to go to Disney for a day and the rest of the group wanted to explore LA.  This is a perfect location for all those things. Its next to Disney, literally across the road and they have a free shuttle, its on the 5, you fall onto the freeway from the hotel, so you can get anywhere from here.  The hotel is really nice, a little dated but very clean. Our rooms were adjoining, so we were able to go in to chat with the family as need.   The staff were courteous and helpful, they sorted out options for our tour of LA, and without being pushy.   When we checked in, we were give a 15% discount voucher for use in the hotel restaurant. So on the

This hotel is wonderful.The Majestic Garden Hotel's blueprint seems like a castle, which is pretty cool. I stayed here for my birthday in August. Parking wasn't ideal when I arrived, I had to park is the very back and pull my four suitcases all the way to the front. The lobby was very nice. There was a booth that allowed you to buy Disneyland tickets, and a nice fireplace area. The front desk service was slow, and there was a small bistro. There was also a small giftshop that had a nice variety of Disney things, and it had a small selection of snacks. My room was a nice size, I had two queen sized beds, and a nice flatscreen television on a small dresser. There was also a nice setup of a glass table and two chairs in the middle, and two night stands in between the beds, which of

I recently stayed here with a friend who was running the Superheros half marathon in Disneyland.  I rely on TA reviews, and there will always be good ones and bad ones.  First this hotel is in a great location, 15-20 min. walk to Disneyland, but they also provide a free shuttle which was great.  The check in took a long time as there was only 2 people working.  Our room was big, clean and although it faced the freeway, the noise was minimal.  A/C also worked very well.  I liked that they had a seperate sink as well outside the bathroom which allowed 2 people to get ready at the same time.  The room is well appointed with large TV, sitting area and fridge in room.  Cynthia in the bar was fabulous but the food was lacking, I would not suggest eating here.  The water pressure in

I didn't have a choice in where I stayed since I was traveling for work, and my company chose this hotel. At first, I thought it was old but stately; I soon realized it was just old. I give them credit for trying to update some things, but there's still a ways to go. I'll start with the bad stuff so I can end on a high note.  Cons - The bathrooms are tiny, and my drain (much like others' reviews noted) was slower than molasses. I was standing in about three inches of water, which is grody, and the shower curtain kept blowing in on me. The tubs and bathrooms themselves are TINY, and the lighting is awful. - The rooms are pretty large, but there are hardly any outlets. I had to unplug the clock just to plug in my cell phone charger. - My room was right next to the pool, and there

My check-in experience was great at the front desk.  My husband and I walked around the property and liked how it felt comfortable and ideal for families.  We used the free shuttle to the Disney Parks and it worked out great for us.  The only thing I would recommend is that they upkeep the minor cosmetic details of the room.

Very impressed by the Service we received, the whole hotel is beautiful and we were very surprised at how big and attractive the lobby area was. The shop came in very handy for last minute snacks and the the Man who helped us at the Disney planning desk was very friendly and informative. The free Disney shuttle bus was a brilliant way to get to the Disney parks and downtown Disney. All in all I can’t Fault a single part of our stay here! I would recommend the Majestic Gardens to anyone travelling to Anaheim!

Looks nice but, rooms are very dated. Rooms need a total remodel.Furniture had holes in it.  Small parking spaces. So if you drive a truck, you won't be happy. Had to squeeze in trying not to hit other car. Slow check in even though there was only 2 other people in front of me in line.  Nice looking lobby. Nice staff. We ate at the bar area {restaurant was closed} Food was good for bar food. Over priced room for what it was. Only good thing is free shuttle to Disneyland.

This is a large hotel which obviously caters primarily for people who want to go to Disneyland. There is a free shuttle bus, which runs from outside the front door every half hour. There was always a queue, but it didn't take too long to get a seat. Checking in took absolutely ages, even though it wasn't particularly busy. Hotel dining is limited for vegetarian guests. It is quite easy to get lost, so use the map they provide! Room was comfortable enough and we could hear the firewaorks from Disneyland at 9:30pm, which shows how close this hotel is.

Nice lobby, friendly staff but...  We were allocated a "renovated room" which meant new wallpaper. Bathroom seriously needs updating, shower was not hot just mildly warm and the aircon/fan didn't even work (wouldn't even turn on). Good location and nice to have a complimentary shuttle to Disneyland and wifi however the rooms seriously need proper renovations. Overpriced for the very average rooms.

Summary Heading: Horrible management team. Good hotel otherwise
Summary: While checking in I was informed the person that booked my reservation over the phone had booked it for the following day. Instead of trying to accommodate my wife and two young kids, the numbskull front desk person went to speak to the manager and came back stating the manager had checked for available rooms and there were NONE.   After an 8 hour drive and with two young kids going bonkers, I needed to figure out where my family was going to spend the night since they had screwed up my reservation and didn't seem to care. I went on Expedia and to my surprise, there were rooms available. I understand that certain companies, like Expedia, lock rooms as they want to sell them. I still think that since my reservation was screwed up by hotel staff, the manager should have taken that

Arrived last night and surprised the kids with the castle room (bunk beds with a castle look). They loved it. Parking is $16/night but the hotel has a shuttle to and from Disney so it saves in parking at the park or Downtown Disney. Rooms are clean. There’s a story of a princess and dragon on the walls and carpets that goes around the hotel and the kids really enjoyed finding pieces of it to read.

Summary Heading: Dog owners beware, Hotel dog friendly, but no place to eat that is.
Summary: I called here to see if we could dine on the patio with our dog (Who is quieter and more well behaved than most of the children there) They said it was OK. When we showed up for a meal we were informed that they did not allow dogs on the patio. I asked how guests were supposed to get a meal if you can't leave your dog in the room or take them to the patio. The response was "Room Service" Really. Take your dog and your money elsewhere.

This hotel was wonderful from the minute we checked in until we checked out. Staff was friendly and helpful. Free shuttle to Disneyland, on time and comfortable. Rooms decorated and comfortable. Price was so affordable. Food was delicious. Disney desk inside the hotel for assistance with tickets and information. Very clean.

Easy shuttle service to the park was a huge reason we stayed here, we were not disappointed. Staff was so nice and quick to resolve issues. Cute and clean hotel. We picked the castle themed rooms and the bunk beds were the best part for my grandchildren. Breakfast buffet available was convenient for getting everyone fed and to the park. Little pricy for what was offered but service was wonderful. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

This was my first time staying at the majestic. we stayed in the older style room. Yes they do need refurbishment, the carpets are a bit stained etc but for the price you can't beat it. knowing this going in i wasn't shocked. The staff at this hotel is fantastic.The shuttle staff is also super friendly and made our trips back and forth from disney great. I would definitively stay at this hotel but i do hope that they spend more money to refurbish the rest of the rooms. We stayed in 2105 i believe just upstairs from the lobby looking at the courtyard. it was very quiet.

Summary Heading: Dated in need of an upgrade, front desk not helpful
Summary: We were very disappointed by this hotel. Stayed here a few years ago with previous owner and the Hotel is getting run down. The carpet in the room very stained, bathroom small and shower grout needed cleaning. The bed was uncomfortable. The refrigerator in the room worked well. The bistro did have good food and service. Went to get a spare key and was told I had checked out of my room earlier that day when I hadn't. The desk clerk just walked away. I billed dinner to the room and they wanted me to come back down, I told them no I was not checked out and gave them my reservation number and wanted to talk to a manager. they said he was busy and would call back, he didn't. The next day when we checked out they had fixed the bill but over charged us which they fixed. After my wife

2+ hour wait to check in. Got to our room and found mold in the bathroom which looked liked it hadn't been cleaned in weeks. The sheets on the beds had holes in them and were never changed in days. We know because we found the same holes in the same place when the beds were made. They also put a hold of $920 on my account instead of the agreed $100 for incidentals. We asked them to take care of the room situation and it was never taken care of. We asked them to remove the $920 hold and it was only removed when we decided to check out a day early to stay somewhere else. They refused to refund the night we didn't stay there. Spent hours at the desk and even when we told them we had a special needs child they didn't care. To this day their general manager has never called me when I
Manager Response: Thank you for providing another review of your experience. We have apologized and authorized the full refund for your stay. Please let us know if there is anything more that you need assistance with. Thank you!

Summary: Bed was comfortable, bathroom very tiny, lighting way too dim, room smelled musty, access from elevator to room required dragging luggage down several steps, restaurant not open in afternoon, greeter and waitress argued loudly in dinning area, exit from hotel to car had ramp permanently blocked so only option was dragging luggage down several stairs. Housekeeping skipped room service 1 of 4 days for no apparent reason. Bus service to Disneyland was good, usually on time and comfortable.

This is a nice hotel that is very close to the park. The amenities are nice, if just a little dated. It offers a good alternative to the more expensive Disney brand hotels. The room itself was nice, but the sink was cracked. The room looked as if it could use a little bit of remodeling. The staff was courteous and helpful. Overall, it was not a bad visit. I would come back again.

Summary Heading: Superb facility and near perfect location
Summary: This is the former Sheraton and the current operators have kept up the resort and full featured aspect of the facility, nice grounds and large common areas. The newly modified family-castle rooms with bunks were a hit with the grandkids. Cost is comparable to other locations. Restaurant is open when needed with sufficient choices available. Better than usual and relatively inexpensive buffet at breakfast, although the scrambled eggs are a bit strange.  The shuttle bus schedule gets you to park however at peak times in the morning you either have to get in line early or wait for a second bus. It is possible to walk to the park if desired.  Check in took longer than needed due to "extra helpful" conversations by staff, suggest more staff at counter if the average checkin really

Summary Heading: Horrible Experience. I do NOT recommend!
Summary: Just came back from our stay at Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel. I do NOT recommend it at all! My husband and I had a horrible experience. We were greeted with rude customer service followed by low quality rooms that were not only dirty but had issues with plumbing, no hot water, tv's not working, plugs falling apart, toilets that did not flush, torn headboards that looked like someone had to claw their way out of the room. We didn't even receive a key to open the gate like we supposed to....luckily security was nice enough to let us in. Talked to one manager she just brushed us off saying there was nothing she could do. Went back and complained to another manager the following evening after visiting Disneyland and she changed our room to a room that was even worse! Called her
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on you recent stay. I am sorry if you felt our front desk team wasn't up to par. I will share this with the rest of the management team for follow up. We are glad that you reached out to management while you were here with us and that they tried to better accommodate you in alternate rooms. Obviously your experience isn't typical of what we try to provide for our guests. We hope that you will give us another chance next time your plans bring you to the Anaheim area. Thank you!.

Summary: Horrible at every encounter. Room was late for us to check in(4:30-4:45?).  Concierge doesn't answer and when they do they give outdated information of restaurants that are closed. Manager Nathan says 'stay somewhere else next time' even when I'm super nice and express desire for their improvement. They could give an F about your stay. Close enough to Disneyland to not care. Shuttle driver was funny (only good interaction).

This is the right place to stay with your family for your Disney trip.  The shuttle makes going to and from the park and hotel easy.   It is clean and the price is great if you are set on a budget.  We got the Jr. Suite for our family of 4 with 2 teenagers.   Nice and helpful staff, clean rooms and bathrooms.

The staff and shuttle bus drivers were the highlight of our trip! We were in the F building... Room 1159.. I have NEVER stayed at such an disgusting room. Looked like someone used the room to work on car engines! Stains (multiple) all over the carpet! Long black hair inside the bed sheets and on the top of the shower curtain! I wish I had taken pictures! Most disgusting hotel room I have ever stayed in...!!

Highly recommend this hotel.  The rooms are clean and spacious, and you can’t hear the people in the rooms next to you.   The shuttle service to Disneyland was excellent!  And if you miss the fireworks at the park, you can see them very well from this hotel!  Nice bonus!

Summary Heading: Honeymoon was perfect because of this hotel’s staff
Summary: I want to take a few sentences to commend he staff at this hotel. The servers, bartenders, bellmen, shuttle drivers, and housekeepers all took time out of their day to answer our questions (my husband had many), give us recommendations, and engage in conversation with us throughout our stay here. We still have a few days left to go, but they have really made our stay here wonderful. The front desk staff was also nice, but didn’t really have the time to talk to us I suppose.  The hotel is definitely older, but it has been renovated and updated and it is very well maintained. The gardens are all beautiful! I wish we had enough energy when we get back to spend more time enjoying them. Breakfast buffet was well enjoyed each morning (with our favorite server Valentine to recommend

Arachnologist delight. (Spider infestation!)   Planned trip to Disneyland we arrived to a very rude front desk who seemed bothered to give directions to our room. This is a very large hotel. We had to take my 1 1/2 year old son to urgent care because he was bitten by a spider see attached photos. We were told it was non poisonous but not being from the area and the look of the thing we wanted to be damn sure it wasn’t poisonous. The bathrooms have mold on the grout lines, you can hear everything going on by the pool if you’re near it and want to come back for a mid day nap.....so the nap doesn’t really happen. After we got back from the park we double checked the room for spider and ended up killing 6 more two by our beds and two more found under the bed. Also killed one walking

Summary Heading: Fair Accommodations. Poor response from management.
Summary: I recently planned a girl's trip to California with a friend and we decided to start in Disneyland before working our way up the coast. We purchased a Disneyland and Hotel package from Costco and received great price with numerous perks. The hotel accommodations were acceptable. They weren't amazing, but clean and adequate for our purposes.   The true issue arose with our interactions with hotel staff and management.  The hotel is currently undergoing renovations which is not a problem, however on Monday night we returned to the hotel (around 8) to find jack-hammering the area below us and we could hear the conversations of the men working. We did wait until about 8:30-9 to see if the noise would stop and when it did not we called down to the front desk to inquire about when the
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your feedback from your experience here. Since you also contacted the executive offices with this information all response has and will come directly from them. Thank you again for sharing this information, we appreciate it!

Summary: Super Location.  Transportation to Disney Parks was very good.  We could watch the Disneyland fireworks from the parking lot, even if not on the Disney properties.  We will absolutely stay there again. Restaurant was ok.  Rooms were comfortable.

Great value hotel.  We upgraded to a premium room, awesome space. We were a family of 4-two adults and 2 teenagers. Lots of space! The pool was great for a dip after a long day at the park. The shuttles were great, ontime and if one was full they would run another. Used the restaurant, bar and little store in the hotel. All were great! Watched the fireworks from the car park, you probably get a better view there than at Disneyland. Reception got busy and had to wait in line but that would be my only negative feed back. And Anaheim packing district (highly recommend if you are looking for great food) is only a $7 Uber ride away. Willcstsy here again if we return 😀

Staff was friendly, and customer service oriented. The only issue with service is that check in could have been faster.  The hotel itself has a very magical ambiance. The halls are filled with paintings of dragons and knights and castles, and there are magical stories on the wall for kids to read.  The shuttle was excellent, and the driver very friendly.

We have been regular visitors to Anaheim over the past 5 years and we pretty much used the same accommodation the last few times and it suited us perfectly We had a more upmarket requirement on what we normal picked  This hotel was picked by friends and we must admit that we are extremely glad we stayed their. It's a absolute gem.. Easy access to Disney via shuttles Large updated rooms

Summary Heading: Human feces in the sheets - hotel would not address
Summary: The following is a letter submitted to the GM of this property regarding our experience.  To date, in spite of multiple efforts to contact the General Manager and discuss this hazardous situation created by the hotel, we have received no response.  The reason for this review (as well as the communication we will have with the Disneyland approved hotels department, Orange County Health Department, multiple hotel review sites and social media) is to warn potential guests of this property of the lack of commitment to guest and employee safety and service provided by this hotel.  Again, we have documented multiple efforts, have multiple photos as well as a video to the management of this hotel and they will simply NOT respond.  The General Manager was given multiple attempts to

Front desk people and staff couldn't be friendlier. Food at bar is good. Drinks, pricey but i guess better deal if you go at happy hour 3-6. Room was very clean,  had a double bed type room. I took lots of pics but not sure if all included in this review. Headboard of the bed frame had finish that was "peeling". I was like okay, maybe these beds have had some workouts---if ya know what i mean. But i think they had been painted over. I woke up with some specks of paint on my face every morning. I think the wear could have been from people sitting in bed web surfing...? You know people these days.... i was sharing the room with my mother so we were using both beds. Toilet was clean but had strange discoloration on seat rim, not dirty, just discolored.  Shower is good. Didn't smell

I booked through a 3rd party, something I have never done in the past nor will I ever do again. We had to switch rooms but once we did our room was fine.  Our first room was next to the freeway and the noise was terrible.  We were able to move to the garden room we had requested and it was much better. Everyone was pleasant and accommodating. The one problem was that the elevators take you between the second and third floors.  to get to the second floor you have to go up and down 7-10 stairs with your luggage.  The third floor you have about 4 stars.  Not always easy for older people to carry luggage up and down stairs. The shuttle was great and always on time.  I would probably stay there again but I would only book through the hotel's website in order to avoid switching rooms
Manager Response: Thank you for your review from your recent stay here with us. We are pleased you enjoyed the hotel and the dedicated staff we have here. We will share your concerns with the rest of the management team so that everyone can be brought up to speed and we thank you for providing this feedback.

Summary: Clean, well presented themed hotel. Nice pool. Good reception area. Rooms are large, bathrooms a little dated, beds comfortable. Great free shuttle to Disneyland. Large car park. Staff are friendly. Within walking distance of Disneyland, fast food outlets and Walmart.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star reveiw of your stay here with us. We are pleased that you enjoyed everything that the hotel had to offer. We appreciate you taking the time to provide this feedback for future guests of the hotel. Thank you.

Summary: This is a spectacular hotel minutes away from Disneyland. Airport shuttle and hourly shuttle to Disneyland. Rooms are elegant, spacious and very clean. I will definitely stay there again. The staff is well trained and extremely gracious.  The grounds are a must see. From the Koi ponds to the well maintained pool and spa. You can watch the fireworks from Disneyland from there.  There's a lovely Cafe that is well stocked.
Manager Response: We are so pleased you enjoyed the hotel and the spacious grounds here. We hope you will share with your friends and family about your time here and stay with us again when you are back in the area. Thank you for the 5 star review.

Summary Heading: Great hotel walking distance to main road and Disneyland
Summary: Excellent customer service . Great hotel . Great cocktails. Great room. Only improvement could be the bathtub as I didn't feel comfortable in taking a bath in there . I would have loved having some bottled water in the room to make coffee in the morning or for us to sip on .
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your review from the time you spent with us. I will share your positive and areas of improvement with the rest of the management team here. We hope that you will stay with us again when you are in the Anaheim area. Thank you!

Summary: I planned a nice family vacation for the West cost. I have travelled all the way from east coast. Went from yosemite to Anaheim. It's a 7 hours drive. The temperature was 112 degrees. When I tried to check in the room the door meet was not working. They are old system we need to try 10 times before it opened. The key was not getting read by the door lock. After checking in the hotel room the air condition was not working and the temperature was 81 degree in the room. When asked to fix it the guest service said the engineer is on his break it will take at least 30 min. They were not giving a different room. Room is dirty with old dirty carpet. And we had some mosquitoes in the room. Horrible experience. I stayed in Garden block 3rd floor. I usually don't write negative reviews

Our family of four, two adults and two young boys, recently stayed at the Majestic Garden for 10 nights. We chose this hotel due to it's character, price and proximity to the Disney Parks. We are so glad that we did. This was a fantastic location for all that we did. Disney 2 minutes by the free hotel shuttle and well sited for other venues including Angel Stadium, Medieval Times, Beaches and Universal Studios. What really made the Majestic Garden however was the friendliness of all of the staff. Everyone was helpful and always had a smile on their face. Nothing was ever too much trouble. Breakfast and dinner servers were superb and ever so friendly and professional. We stayed in one of the Castle Bunk Bed rooms which was large in size, clean and comfortable. Bathroom was small
Manager Response: Wow!  What a wonderful review, we truly appreciate your business and your trust in us.  I am very happy to hear that our staff and service met your needs and expectations.  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary Heading: Clog bath tub / hair in the bath tub
Summary: We check in they told us we don't have to pay for parking, we say ok when to the room try to take a shower the bath tub was clog  we coulnt give my daughters a shower one of them the 3 years old we'd the bed we ask for clean sheets they give me wet sheet I put my daughters on my bed because there bed was wet and I have to sleep on the floor I call the front desk they told me that they need to investigate next day they send a engineer to fix the tub it was full of hair they never apologize for the matter or give me a discount they even want to charge me for parking please don't use this hotel
Manager Response: We have sent your feedback to the personnel concerned.  I apologize for this bad experience.   This is very disappointing to hear, but we hope you give us another chance to make it up to you.  Please let me know if you want to discuss this personally.

Summary Heading: Great price,  perfect location,  beautiful hotel
Summary: Overall satisfied with our 2 night stay here. They let us check in early (11:30am) for no charge. First night we booked the room with kids castle bunk bed, our daughter loved it. Booked through Expedia. We decided to stay a 2nd night in a regular King room,  booked through Expedia for less than $100, when we went to check out and move rooms the front desk gave us the same room, so we basically got a 50% discount for the room and of course our daughter was happy to sleep in the castle bunk again.  Staff was all very nice and accommodating. Shuttle service was great and on time. If you go to the front of the hotel you can watch the fireworks from there.  Also the grounds are beautiful and the pool is great for small kids since a large portion of it is 3.5ft.  We ate lunch at the
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments.  I will be sure to let our staff know how much of an impact they made on your experience.  We are always pleased to be your second home when you’re in the area.

Summary: It is close proximity to Disneyland, and room is spacious with lush gardens, but the hotel it self is old and dated and needs refurbishments.  If you are a pokemon GO fan, then there are poke stops within the hotel grounds.
Manager Response: We appreciate your taking the time to provide us with such candid feedback of your stay.  I am very sorry to hear that your stay did not meet expectations.  This area that you mention in your review is now under renovation and we hope you'll give us another chance when you are back in the area. Thank you!

Summary: We love the hotel and have come back many times.  We love the way we feel when we walk through the doors and see the beautiful decor.  The rooms are gorgeous and the gardens are absolutely beautiful.  One of our favorite places is the koi fish pond.  We have had wonderful experience with the staff and they make sure we get back and forth to the park safely.  We recommend them highly.
Manager Response: It brings me a lot of pride and joy to hear that you’re an avid fan of our hotel.  We appreciate your business, your loyalty and your trust.  Don’t hesitate to call us if there’s anything we can help you with for your next trip.

Summary: We stayed at the Majestic in march of this year as part of a 3 stop trip around Cali. The Majestic is a nice hotel steeped in Disney magic and its location is brilliant for the Magic Kingdom so much so we walked home after one visit as the buses were full. It took less than 15 mins. The hotel presents itself as a castle type stay but in some ways hides some of the tired aspects that could do with some attention. The pool is pretty small but adequate for how much you might need it but has four high sides of hotel so the sun isn't all day long so it's not the best to return to after a day in the park. Rooms were ok and very typical basic accommodation for America but did the job as acting as a base. Reception were good and listened well and were happy to help and there are some
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive comments.  I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us!  I hope your next stay is just around the corner.  Call us if there is anything we can help you with.

Summary: Room was simple, but comfortable.  Free shuttle to and from Disney was perfect! (It does get busy so there is sometimes a lineup but it doesn't take too long) The pool area was nice, not too busy! The castle theme of the hotel is really fun for kids as well. Would stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for providing this review and tips for future travelers to our hotel. We are pleased that you enjoyed your time with us and look forward to your next stay. Thank you!

Summary: everything about this hotel makes you feel like you're in a fairy tale castle from the rooms to the garden, koi pond, gazebo and even the lobby with a sitting area in front of a fire place or a mail box to send a letter to the princess
Manager Response: We are so pleased to be your Castle away from home. Thank you for the positive feedback from your stay and we hope to have you as a guest again very soon. Thank you!

Summary: The Anaheim majestic gardens hotel is a family favorite.  We have been staying at this hotel for over 18 years.  It is the automatic choice for all trips to Disneyland for our family and should be for yours.  Great rates, fabulous pool area, excellent service from Len and his employees.  You will not regret your stay at this grand hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us again.   We appreciate your loyalty and your continued trust in our hotel and our staff.  Rest assured that we will do everything it takes to make us deserving of your loyalty.

Summary: The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are great. The food at the restaurant is very good. The decor is fantastic. Even the shuttle that takes you back and forth to Disney was excellent. I gave 2 stars because our room wasn't vacuumed. My husband complained.  The next day our room was vacuumed AND my expensive bifocal glasses were missing.  We have the hotel the benefit of the doubt. Maybe my glasses were swept up with the bed linens....however, I remember leaving them on the bedside table. We left word with the front desk and have called.  No sign of the $300 prescription glasses.  Rotten.

Excellent service with friendly staff. Always going that extra mile to help to make sure our stay was a great experience. Park distance is not far and the shuttles are always on time for pick both at the hotel and at Disneyland. Dog friendly hotel

Summary Heading: Dated, but still served its purpose
Summary: This is really more of a 3.5 stars hotel, but the overall experience we had (which was very good) pushed it up for 4 stars for me. First of all, almost everybody that stays here are Disneyland visitors. I don't think there is a good reason for this hotel without it. Overall I will consider staying here again but it will not be my 1st choice, I will try to find something closer to DL entrance. So first, the good: + Large rooms + Attentive staff + Nice pool area and pool bar + Nice theme hotel and decoration + Shuttles to/from DL all day on time + Nice convenience store in the hotel for occasional items The bad: - Overall upkeep of the place is a bit low, stains on carpets and walls, we were locked out of the room at one time and the door had to be fixed - Pool can get a bit small

The hotel was nice. Could use a little updating. Carpets redone new paint. The staff was pleasant. There is a shuttle all day to and from Disney. The gardens were nice. Can see the fireworks really well. Very shocked we had to pay $16 a day for parking when we were guests at the hotel.

In June -17 I traveled with my wife to Los-Angeles, and stayed for 8 days at Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel. It is wonderful place, like an old castle. Very kind and respectful personnel, ready to help in any inconvenience.

I would have really liked to give this hotel a glowing review. The room was very nice and clean but we had such a frustrating booking experience and after our departure we were even more disappointed than we were during booking.  We had found a great rate for this hotel and I asked my boyfriend to make our reservation. Unfortunately, we booked online and he got a room and rate that was not refundable which is frustrating in itself, considering a 24 hour cancellation is normal. We called the next morning because my boyfriend somehow ended up booking a room that was almost double the price I had found and wanted to book,. We spoke to a manager that was not very accommodating in the beginning but after us finding much better room rates elsewhere she finally agreed to give us at

Taking 2 teens to Disneyland/ California Adventure, we stayed at what I thought would be a great place. I was half right. We arrived about 4 hours before check in time. Having worked in the hotel industry while in college, I know some things from experience.  There were no rooms available, and that was fine,  I don't expect to check in when many are still checking out.  We asked to be notified when a room was available and they said that should be fine, return closer to check in.  that didn't happen, so 3.5 hours later we returned.  The front desk staff told me nothing was available, but come back at 4 (listed check in time), they MIGHT have something then. From experience, I know they can call housekeeping and check status to see what's available. They would not so much as make

I had a terrible experience at the restaurant of this hotel; the waiter didn't treat us as guests and everything went wrong with him; while serving juice he spilled everything in the table, he then was pissed for not getting any tip and even though I asked to put the bill on my room he asked me to fill another check ticket and threw me the pen to do so....in summary...unbeleivable they have people like this guy in a "SERVICE" area.... and the day before wr saw the same waiter treating another family in the same way.....if you don't want to have a bad day...avoid staying at this hotel

- long wait during hotel check, wait time 30-40 minutes - front desk staff charged again for prepaid hotel reservation, poor training on front desk staff - keys provided does not work, after prolonged wait again in front desk; met with unapologetic staff without reason provided - dirty carpets in the room, poor training with the cleaning staff - poor bathroom design, fall risk for elderly travelers - unfriendly front desk staff and security staff  i would recommend to avoid this hotel if you want to have a good vacation in disneyland

Summary Heading: have not even made it there and already a waist of money
Summary: Have not even made it to the hotel yet and the cost keeps adding up I'm paying almost 200 dollars a night to stay there and that does not include parking or breakfast those are additional fees. normally when the hotel gets nicer the amenities like a place to park your car at no additional fee increase not decrease. at this rate I'm sure there will be more to follow after i get there. might as well have stayed at motel 8 they have free parking and a breakfast at a lower price

Summary Heading: Perfect for disneyland and good value
Summary: I have stayed in the hotel a number of times over a period of 12 years. The hotel bedrooms have recently been redecorated after the changeover from The Sheraton to Majestic Gardens. The colours would not be my choice but at least its  fresh and clean. I must say that all the staff in the hotel are very pleasant and helpful. I still find the hotel to be the best value in the area. The hotel was very busy in July and there were large queues for the Disneyland shuttle buses in the morning. I had a rental car so I prefered just to park at the Disney carparks and come and go as I wished, although Disney are now charging $20 per day for parking.I will always use this hotel if I'm in the Disneyland area as it has always treated me and my family very well.

I was in Anaheim for a convention and booked this hotel online. A girlfriend told me she had a great experience here, but this was not the case for me.  My friend and I dropped off our bags before our event and immediately regretted our decision to stay there. When we walked in the room the bathroom and entry way smelled musty, and it was gross. I brushed my teeth and could taste something nasty from the pipes/water.  When we returned to our room after our event I checked in at the front desk about a possible room change. They were booked and were unable to accommodate our request.  We were exhausted and just wanted to get some rest so retired to our room.  It was a awful night, and I had an allergic reaction which resulted in little sleep. We were woken up very early this

It must have been the timing but waiting to check in took an hour, with only 2 workers.  Thought I was in Vegas.  Place was pretty decent, 2 queens.  Parking was pretty bad, needed luck to find any space, late night. If affordable, might stay again.

It was ok but completely overpriced. On the positive side, it's close to Disneyland, the front desk staff was friendly, and the bed was comfortable. I very much appreciated the free shuttle from Disneyland back to the hotel late at night...it was a lifesaver when my friends wanted to stay later at the park than I did.  Now for the issues: It's an older hotel with dated decor. I was completely floored that the corridors were not air conditioned and they had the windows open when temperature was in the 80s. Room had limited electrical outlets. We had to unplug lights and alarm clock to charge electronics. Bed was comfortable, but headboards were stained and damaged. Was kinda gross and I didn't want to sit up in my bed because of it. Bathroom very dated and in need of a deep clean

The room was better than expected. Big and clean and updated. Check in was ridiculous. It took me an hour. There was an hour long line behind me still when I was done. Never made it to the pool but could see it from the room and it looked nice. Lobby was ugly whoever picked the colors must have grown up in the 70's. Parking card never worked. Honestly after seeing all the perks of the Disney California hotel on property I would have bit the bullet and stayed there but the room itself was great.

Summary Heading: Needs some work...but close to Disneyland
Summary: Bed 5/5 Mattress firm/soft-in the firm side.  Room 3/5 room is clean.  Limited number of outlets and moderate amount of lights. It would have been nice to have an outlet by the bed. Found an outlet behind the bed. Room has a flat screen TV. There is a desk area. The room does not have microwave but it does have a refrigerator. Shower took some time to warm up but has  good pressure. Central air conditioner.  Price $$ Proximity 4/5. Close to Disneyland and offers free shuttle service to the park every half an hour. Also if you have an Annual Passport the hotel offers discounts on rooms and meals. The hotel has a restaurant. Parking is $16 per night. The hotel is a little out dated but it's proximity to the park makes it a great place to stay!

Summary Heading: Wow!  1 hour to check-in. Only 2 front desk staff.
Summary: It took us 1 hour to check in. The line was out the door they only had 2 staff checking people in. Very disorganized. I hope they give me free breakfast or something. Maybe they should waive my parking.   They had room for 8 checkin staff. Why would you have 2 people working.

Summary Heading: Convenient hotel for last minute trip to Disney!
Summary: My daughter got some time off from her summer job and so we decided to take a quick trip down to Disneyland.  Now normally I try and stay on property.  We are Disney regulars and huge fans, however this time we were so last minute that there were no rooms at any of the three Disney hotels.  This hotel was recommended to me by a friend and it was perfect for our trip.  They have a FREE shuttle to and from the park.  It runs all day and until 1 1/2 hours after the park closes.  We found it easy to catch, that it ran on time for the most part and the best thing was that if there were more guests than could fit on the shuttle they quickly ran a second one.  So one morning we were unable to fit on the first shuttle and they had another one ready to go within 5 minutes.  Our rooms

Free shuttle bus to and from Disneyland was extremely convenient. However, more frequent buses should have been provided after the fireworks as people were shouting, pushing and shoving to get onto the bus. The Disney desk at the hotel is also convenient as you can pre-purchase tickets there for the same discounted price as online.   The hotel room was very big and nice (I think ours was newly renovated) but other parts of the hotel were very outdated and old.
Manager Response: Hello and thank you for your review from your recent stay with us. We appreciate you leaving feedback.  Thank you for the details about the shuttle pick up, I will share your concerns and ideas with the management of that department for review.  On a positive note, we are starting a renovation of the areas that you mentioned this August, so please do give us another chance next time your plans bring you to the Disneyland area. Thank you!!

Summary: Back in 2003 I had an engagement party at this hotel. It was beautiful, clean and overall a positive experience. Now fast forward 14 years later decided it would be a fun stop here with the kids and show them where we had out engagement party.  Let me say, when this was Sheraton, it was clean. Rooms were nice and kept up-to-date. It does not look like they changed anything in the rooms since 2003. The first room we were in had rust in the shower and mold/mildew on the shower head. It was gross. Stains on the chairs in the first room and the carpet did not look much cleaner. I am not even going to try and figure out what those stains were.  AC unit was shut off and the room was a sweat box and the smell of the room and the hall ways were musty at best.  Complaints to the front
Manager Response: Thank you for providing this feedback from your recent stay here with us and we are sorry that your experience wasn't up to your standards. I will share this information with our hotel management team for reveiw. We are still owned and operated by the same owners and management that we were when the hotel was a Sheraton, that hasn't changed. You'll might be interested to know that we are starting a renovation of the areas that you mentioned in your reveiw this August. Please do give us another chance next time you are in the area, I'm sure you'll be happily surprised. Thank you again for this review.

Summary: Here is yet another example of a really nice hotel being marred by the reception experience.  We arrived at 2pm after a long drive from Lake Havasu, and immediately advised we had a room upgrade (to a turret room no less!).  Brilliant we thought..... but you can either pay $25 to gain access now or wait til 4pm!!!  Now as Expedia platinum members I assumed this was included.  Unfortunately I didn't read the letter I was given (tired and hungry!), as once we did get into the room at 4pm it did state that early check in was part of the package.  I booked as a VIP Expedia hotel expecting free breakfast and parking.  A tad naive as pay for Parking and just a 15%off card for the restaurant but with breakfast at $15.99 decided to give a miss.  I will then go onto how much we liked

Summary Heading: Hotel Badly Let Down by State of Room
Summary: We stayed at the Majestic Garden from 27th June to 6th July.  We have previously stayed here in 2004, 2012 and 2014 when the hotel was owned by the Sheraton group.  Since we last stayed there have been good and needed improvements to the corridors in the hotel with new décor and carpets.  The hotel has a good shuttle bus service to Disneyland running every 30 minutes.  The hotel also has laundry facilities within.    The negative points were that when it was owned by Sheraton as returning guests we would have the daily car park cost of $16 waived which they weren’t prepared to do for us this time, when you are staying for 9 nights this is a significant amount.  Also the improvements carried out need to continue into the rooms.  For example in our room plug sockets were broken

We have stayed at the Majestic Hotel three times.  The first time the hotel staff was courteous but slow.  We had three rooms for hour family of 11.  Each day we had to ask for additional coffee and cups.  We needed more towels and had to go to the front desk to request them as they didn't answer the phone.  Two the three rooms were ready when we arrived at 2:45 but they would not let us into the rooms without paying an additional $25 per room.  When my daughter arrived at 3:00 with two little ones they said she could not get her room until 4:00.  She did not get her key until she asked at 4:00.  But, that doesn't upset me as one happened next.  My granddaughter left her Hello Kitty in the hotel room when we checked out. Yes we should have found it when we checked the rooms but

Summary Heading: Convenient but in need of refurbishment
Summary: The hotel exterior is cute and mirrors the Disneyland theme. The lobby entrance was getting a makeover when we arrived but it is the rooms that need some refurbishment. They are very tired, particularly the carpets and bathrooms. We were able to purchase Disneyland tickets from a booth in the lobby managed by a lovely and informative woman. The shuttle from the hotel to the park did not stick to a firm timetable, sometimes leaving a few minutes early and sometimes a few minutes late; however the shuttle did offer extra buses at the start of the day and after the fireworks to accommodate the peak passenger period. For the prices being charged, the hotel management may like to consider reinvesting some of their profits in their rooms. I will check out another option next time I
Manager Response: Thank you for this detailed review from your recent stay with us. We appreciate all feedback and wanted to share with you that we will conduct a renovation starting this August and updating some of the issues you mentioned in your review. We hope that you will give us another try next time your plans bring you to the Anaheim area. This feedback will be shared with the other hotel managers for review and providing direction to the rest of the hotel team. Thank you!

Summary: Lovely, clean accommodation.  The perfect place to rest our heads after busy days at Disneyland, Universal Studios etc. Perfect distance to the theme parks and pick up services via buses for tours etc. The pool and poolside bar/food services were excellent and it was a perfect view to watch the fireworks from Disneyland while relaxing poolside. The restaurant/breakfast buffets were great. Overall we had a great experience here and would love to visit again some day.
Manager Response: Thank you for the positive review from your recent stay here with us. We are pleased that you enjoyed your stay and what offerings that hotel provided. Please come back and see us again soon. Thank you!

Summary: Great location, excellent shuttle service at the end of the evening.  The property is a little dated but still comfortable and very clean.   I suggested they provide a more convenient way to charge electronics as I had to reach over and under tables to access outlets.

We booked this hotel for 5 families,  never having stayed here on our several annual trips to Anaheim we went off reviews.  Overall its a nice hotel. Beware of hidden fees, parking and the all so ridiculous early check in fee.. ive never heard of this?! We arrived early to be told yes your room is ready, but if you want to get in its $50. Completely ridiculous.  As if it affects them to let you in when its ready and empty.  The bar is convenient and the evening bartender is fabulous! Loved her!

This hotel is older but it still offers some convenience and was decently priced. It has a shuttle to Disneyland out front and a Disneyland desk within the lobby that you can purchase tickets from. The room was very spacious and comfortable. The restroom was very small but for the functionality of a place to sleep and refresh, it worked. The shuttle was a little slower but it wasn't too bad. Also the parking at the hotel wasn't bad either.

Summary Heading: Very Nice and Close to Disneyland
Summary: We got a room for 4 adults for 2 nights. This was our first stay at this hotel and it was a great experience. Our room came with 2 large queen size beds  This hotel has everything you could ask for i.e. 24 front desk service, cribs for babies, accepts pets {2 per room), coffee shop and cafe, free WiFi, large rooms and beds. You do have to pay for parking but it does have a free shuttle to and from Disneyland that leaves every 15 minutes. The Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel was a great experience and we will be using it again.

Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel is a good hotel but could use some work. They need additional staff as the staff is constantly busy and at times doesn't answer the phone because they're too busy. The room I stayed in had the bathroom redone but the carpet In the room could've either been replaced or needed a good cleaning. No issues with bugs but did have to kill a small spider.  The beds were clean and comfortable. The room had an iron and ironing board, which was a great plus but had no microwave, a huge negative from my standpoint.  What good is having a refrigerator but no microwave? The chairs in the room needed a good cleaning. The hotel doesn't have a free continental breakfast but if desired you can eat at their breakfast buffet $9.99 for kids 3+ and $15.99 for adults 12+
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review of your stay.  Your comments are important to us and will be shared with those departments for continued improvements to ensure welcome and comfortable stay. You will be happy to know we will begin phase 1 of guestroom renovations in mid-August and complete by end of September. We look forward to your return to see our new look.

Summary: Went to our room, air conditioning didn't work. Took over an hour to get someone to fix it. There wasn't another room to move us to. Took the person they sent an hour and a half to fix it. All the appliances were unplugged and the remote batteries were all switched around.  Ordered a cot at check in, didnt arrive till 10 pm. Wifi is horrible. Not high speed at all. Coffee pot is broken, still don't have another one. Ice machine on our floor is broken. Water won't get hot or stay hot for very long. I would NOT reccomend this hotel at all.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback...it is always important to get feedback.  We apologize for not presenting you with a perfect stay and will share your information with the appropriate departments. It is important to know that we care about your stay and wish to share the following upgrades coming: 1.  Phase 1 of Garden Tower guestroom renovation will start August 14 and be completed September 30 2.  Phase 2 of our remaining guestroom renovation will start mid-November and be completed early January 3.  Internet upgrade: In the schedule to upgrade our system and increase the bandwidth for a more stable and robust system to handle increased demands. We hope you will give us another opportunity in the future as we strive to improve the hotel operation.

Summary: The room I stayed in was absolutely phenomenal. Very clean, smelled great. The beds weren't clouds, but they were fairly comfortable. As a 6 foot man, most hotels I go to don't have shower heads that go above my head. This one had about a foot on me. That was very nice. For a room with two beds, it was extremely spacious. The staff were also very polite, they know how to do their jobs. The only downfall of this hotel is that it doesn't have any weights over 50 pounds in the weight room. Whatever problems this place used to have are no more.
Manager Response: Dear Jacob: Thank you for your very kind review.  We are happy to hear you had a pleasant stay and that we have made improvements to exceed your expectation. We look forward to you returning again soon. Please share your experience with your friends and family looking to visit the Disneyland area.

Summary: We've stayed here many times when it was the Sheraton and even after it changed owners and became the Anaheim Majestic Garden. They made some major changes and I will never come here again. When we arrived at 2:00 PM our room was ready but they told us if we wanted to check in early we had to pay $25 extra. I am just stubborn enough to wait until 4 o'clock. I voiced my displeasure and told them it is insulting to their guests. Needless to say, at 4 o'clock the line was almost out the door because people who had arrived early were now returning to check in. There were many of us in line who refused to pay the $25, but in hindsight it would have been worth it. I waited in line for over 45 minutes to get my room key. I asked if we could use the Bellman cart to take our luggage to
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback...all feedback is important. However, there are somethings that may be of interest to you: The Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel is under the same ownership and management and have enjoyed our independence since May 2015. We have updated our policy for guests that arrive prior to the standard 4:00 PM check-in time to avoid the early check in fee.  If guests arrive between 1:00 PM and 4:00 PM and a room that meets your booked reservation room type is available we will happily check you in at no additional charge.  All other early arrivals prior to 1:00 PM will still have the option to pay the early check in fee.  We look forward to welcoming your next visit to Disneyland.

Summary: Nice clean reasonably priced hotel.  Rooms are large with comfortable beds.  Bus service to Disney Resort 2x an hour.  The hotel even has their own character, Princess Corinne.  I would stay here again and have recommended to friends.
Manager Response: Dear Feebeereba...thank you for your positive feedback and sharing your wonderful stay.  Princess Corinne, will be especially happy to hear this news.  If you have any little ones with you on your next visit be sure to drop a note to her at her special mailbox...she loves to write to her fans! We look forward to seeing you again in the near future.

Summary: Took an ambitious trip to Disneyland from Texas alone with our 3 year old twins :)  Pros:  Cheap hotel, clean bedding, fridge (no micro), free shuttle, downstairs deli w/snacks  Cons:  -arrived and ordered room service for kids for lunch and dinner first day (missing soup both times)...woke up to a charge of $593 that has still not been credited back to my checking acct. Was told they assume your room service routine for whole trip and charge ahead of time. I wasn't planning on eating in room after that, though, and found that ridiculous. 5 days later I've been charged correctly for entire stay PLUS charged for this bogus room service business. Paid over $1500 for a $900 stay. Unfriendly and unhelpful regarding this matter. Still waiting to be resolved. -arrived early as

Summary Heading: Noisy and outdated - stayed with a 1 year old
Summary: I stayed here several times when it was a Sheraton about 10 years ago...and I'm pretty sure they haven't changed much except the name of the hotel (meaning this place is pretty outdated.)   My husband and I stayed here with our 1 year old. We stayed in a turret suite and we could here a lot of street noise. The windows are so old they don't block out much noise at all, which was not good because we needed our baby to nap and she heard sirens from the street. We could also hear our neighbors coming back from the park at night.   The air conditioner in our room worked well to keep it cool, but when it shut off because it had reached the desired temperature it would make a loud "bang" noise.   The hallways were always hot because they did not have the a/c running. Doesn't seem like
Manager Response: Thank  you for your feedback...it is the best we for us to uncover any issues and to seek improvement. The hotel is an icon of the area with a rich history and the following information will be beneficial to know. The Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel will begin guestroom renovation at the end of summer with phase 1 completed by end of September.  Phase 2 will begin mid-November and estimated to be finished by mid-January.   We look forward to your return to experiences our refreshed changes in the future and our convenient "Dream Machine" shuttle to escort you to a fun-filled day at Disneyland.

Summary Heading: My go to hotel for playing at Disneyland
Summary: Hotel located on Disney Land drive has large well appointed rooms, great pool area and game room for the kids and a nice hotel restaurant and bar and best of all a free shuttle every 1/2 hour to the Disneyland main gate. Rooms are reasonably priced with plenty of parking only bad point is they charge 16.00 and is not valet parking.  Elevators in main building are really small.
Manager Response: Dear Christena: Thank you for your positive feedback, we like to know we hit the mark to making your stay special as one of our loyal guests.  It may be helpful to kn ow our parking rate is among the lowest in the Anaheim Resort district and we do not charge a resort feel   We look forward to your return and thank you for letting us be a part of your memory making!

Summary: Have stayed at this property many times when it was the Sheraton.  It still has many great services including shuttle to Disney, and Deli.  The room must have been one of the older one, they are in a renovation.  Room was Large.  Almost to big for the furniture they had. The restaurant was a pleasant suprise with fresh food and good entrees.    A few things were the cause of a 3 out of 5 star review.  I pour room keys kept deactivating and when I would go to the desk thy would give me a hard time because the reservation was in my wife's name.
