The shuttle would filll up,and people would be left standing for 30 minutes.  When it was a Sheraton Hotel they would run an additional bus rather than have people wait.  Overall I like the Hotel. Price could be better consider they charge
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and for being a loyal guest!  We apologize for the key inconvenience, but we are very particular about guest security.  To avoid being questioned about receiving a new key be sure to include your name on the reservation as well and you will be good to go! We do our best to keep on top of the "Dream Machine" demand times, you may have caught us at a time when our awesome drivers was on a break or lunch...will be sure to share this with our operations team! We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary: Rooms were OK. Beds were old and very noisy - never had a loud bed, but this one made loud groans every time you get it or move. The service was satisfactory. They have a breakfast bar that was well stocked, but very overpriced - and not included with the room rate as I was lead to expect. The shuttle to Disneyland was good and on time - probably the best feature. Parking was also extra ($16 per night for registered guests and even more for visitors).
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, it is appreciative so we can keep striving for the perfect stay! Some tips for future visits, be sure to check out our specials page on our website where we usually have inclusive value packages that feature breakfast and parking! We look forward to your next visit soon!

Summary: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary. Quick check in. Rooms clean and shuttle to Disneyland was on time. Got in at 10 in the morning and the lady at the counter said our room was ready but it was a $25.00 early check in. I told her ok as we were driving since 4 in the morning. I told her it was our anniversary and she waived our early check in fee. nice little surprise. Of coarse if they had free parking and a free continental it would have been better
Manager Response: Thank you for your awesome review and for sharing your anniversary celebration with us!  We are glad you took advantage of the early check-in offer...it's a great way to get some extra time and your vacation started early! Be sure to check out our specials page on our web site to ensure you are taking advantage of our value added packages...some include a full breakfast buffet and parking! See you soon!

Summary: I have stayed here a couple of times now overnight after a long day at Disneyland.  Once during the Christmas season.  It was very cold and getting back to the hotel on the free shuttle and sitting by the fireplace was the cherry on top of an amazing day.   This time I brought my best friend and her daughter to stay.  We had plenty of space in our hotel room.   The shuttle is so convenient.   The staff at the hotel is very friendly and helpful.  I am hoping for a longer visit next time so I can explore the hotel a bit more!  Clean hotel room, very comfortable beds!  Had a great nights sleep both stays.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for sharing your amazing stay with us!  We appreciate you sharing the details so we can pass them along to our hotel associates. Kudos for bringing your bestie and her daughter with you to experience the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel...no wonder your are best friends!   Don't miss out on some great deals for fall by checking out our web site.  We hope you will continue to spread the word and see you again soon!

Summary: Majestic Garden hotel formerly Sheraton Anaheim has changed hands and has deteriorated ... from what was once a fantastic ,fine , clean and unique hotel to an old rundown not so clean hotel. It saddens me to write this review as my family and I have traveled 4 times from Australia since 2009 and have stayed at this hotel. It was such a great hotel with the up keep of it from the beautiful gardens to the nice clean rooms even the staff service was so much better. This time round we had booked through a travel agent and I had requested this hotel noticing there had been a name change/ ownership change and I honestly didn't think it would be any different , i mean it was only 4 years since our last trip. We arrived late afternoon and I  checked in I asked for a nice room as we were

Summary Heading: Poor location for LA and dated hotel,
Summary: This tired and somewhat rundown hotel is right next door to Disney world. So it's location is good if your are visiting there and like lots of giddy children and families. If you are looking to go to LA, Hollywood etc it's too far out.   The room was large with two kingside comfortable clean beds. I say clean I did find hairs in my bed. Equipment is basic but it did have the usual amenities like fridge (not stocked) iron and limited coffee making.  No room safe. The free wifi was excellent.   The public area are not particularly clean and look dated like the plumbing in the room. The over-bath shower needs replacement and the room need serious work.  The headboards on both beds were severely worn (see picture).    The hotel restaurant provides a good service with rather ordinary
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback about your stay...we appreciate hearing about your experience and will share them with the appropriate departments. You will be happy to hear that we will begin phase 1 of the Garden Tower guestroom renovation August 14 and be completed by September 30 with a fresh and updated look.  Phase 2 will complete the remaining guestrooms starting mid-November and finish early January. We hope you will give us another try and check out our new look in the future.

Summary: Beautiful hotel and grounds, friendly service, and a shuttle ride to and from Disneyland every half hour. Rooms a little dated, but the rest of the amenities make up for it! Will definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback...it is important to hear from our guests so we can continue to improve. We agree the hotel's gardens, awesome associates and our Dream Machine shuttle are some of the things that make our hotel special and will be sure to share your kind words with our team. Good news on the horizon!  We will begin phase 1 of our guestroom renovation mid-August (after the summer rush) and finish about September 30.  Phase 2 will begin mid-November and be completed by early January (working around our busy holiday schedule). Thank you for being a loyal guest and see you again soon!

Summary Heading: A LOT nicer than we expected!!
Summary: I'm sure most hotels surrounding the Disneyland resort can be cheesy, family hotels.  But this one was quite exceptional.  Sure it's shaped like a castle, but it's more of a "classy" castle.  The hotel grounds are beautiful complete with fountains. There's also a convenience/coffee shop and game room/arcade on the first floor as well as a nice bar and restaurant.    My friend's and I were checked in by a handsome, friendly gentleman named David. I joked with him that 4 adult women would LOVE to be upgraded to a room with castle shaped bunk beds, but there weren't any available. (Hey, David! Jousting match at 8pm!!)    Our room was very spacious with ample outlets for 4 women and all their devices.  Parking was $16 per car with in and out privileges. AND the good news is, when
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: great location walking distance to California adventure, beds were comfortable. Visited with school group.  Staff was always attentive to what we all needed and always kept it clean. Had a great time at this hotel and will visit again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review from your recent stay with us. We are so pleased that you enjoyed the hotel and amenities offered here. We hope you will tell all your friends and family about us and then come back and see us again very soon. Thank you!!

Summary: At $140/night deal, this was a good bargain, especially with the free shuttle to the parks.  It was very annoying to have to pay a $25 early check in fee in order to get an available room at 2 instead of 4.   The room itself left some to be desired.  The carpet, drapes and furniture were well worn and outdated.  We could hear freeway traffic from our room (be careful about which way your room faces!), the bathroom was cramped (though the room itself was large), and the beds were saggy/uncomfortable.  I could feel every slight move that my husband made. On the plus side, the pool was a great temperature and a great plus for our son.   The food at the restaurant was also tasty and the lounge and bar were comfortable.   All in all, we will probably opt for one of the hotels
Manager Response: We appreciate your taking the time to provide us with such candid feedback from your stay.  We are very sorry to hear that your stay did not meet your expectations.  Your concerns will be shared with the management team to reveiw and follow up with our staff.

Summary: A Disney "Partner" hotel at the 6 story Disneyland "Mickey" parking structure which charges $ 20.00 per day. Then hike to the Tram and Hike off. Majestic Garden charges $ 16  per day parking with door to door shuttle service to the park every 30 minutes. Some rooms have bunk beds at a extra fee; many 1st floor rooms open up to the interior garden courtyard. Staff is friendly and eager to please. A Disney desk s in the lobby, excellent computer center, cartoons in the lobby, and a booze bar for mom and pop. A deli with beer and sandwiches. Please note: There is NO bottle opener in the rooms. If you order bottles with room service ,ask for a bottle opener.
Manager Response: Thank you for being an awesome "recommending and loyal" guest!  We appreciate you sharing traveler tips and your great experience with others too! We look forward to your visits in the future.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay close to Disneyland.
Summary: We were in town for the Tinkerbell 1/2 Marathon Weekend.  We really liked the location.  Although they did offer shuttles, it was just easier for us to walk back and forth to the parks. (no children with us.)  Our room was clean and huge.  Nice mini-frig too.  The carpet in the hallway outside our room must have recently been replace as it was clean and super soft.  Although this was not a new fancy hotel, I would stay again. The lobby/restaurant area was nice, cozy.  We ate breakfast at the buffet and had dinner there too.  All was good.  From inside our room, we could not hear anyone next door (you could from the hall way).  The only noises that was loud was the park fireworks but that's what you get when you have a great location to the parks.  We were in the building so I am
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback...it is a gift and looks like you enjoyed most of the serviced our "castle" hotel has to offer! We will be sure to share your comments with our departs so we can continue to reach for the perfect stay. See you again soon!

Summary Heading: Nice, but be prepared to pay for parking -
Summary: I recently stayed for two nights with two tween family members and we enjoyed the accommodations. The hotel is older, but all surfaces and materials were in nice condition. Our room was squeaky clean and furnished comfortably. The only issue for me was paying $16/night for parking in the hotel's lot. That was a first. However, the price of the room and the complementary shuttle to/from Disneyland balanced out the parking bill. Overall, a positive experience -
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive feedback...we are glad you appreciate our overall value and the convenience of our Dream Machine shuttle...saves the feet from a long day at Disneyland! Be sure to check out our specials page on our web site for value added packages that include parking and breakfast! See you again soon.

Summary: I will not be staying in this hotel again.   The restaurant saved our stay from being absolutely terrible.   I have traveled all over the world with my husband and kiddo and this was they worst hotel stay in any state or country I have experienced.   We booked via hotels.com and I think they save their worst rooms for guests who book this way. Another guest comments below that they were in the garden tower, same as us, booked through hotels.com, same as us, and had a stained and dirty room. Maybe other parts of the property are cleaner and nicer, but the garden tower, the tower that is separate from the main property is not a nice place to stay.  We had stains on the floor and chair, but the beds were clean. The carpet and floor boards were puling away from the wall from what

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay close to the parks.
Summary: The rooms are dated and could use an upgrade, but the room was clean, the staff friendly and it was a nice stay. The morning shuttle driver had everyone laughing. Was there for a half marathon at Disneyland and was pleasantly surprised that there was not a long wait for check in or out. Will stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback...we are happy to hear you had a great experience and enjoyed our complimentary "Dream Machine" shuttle to Disneyland. Good news...we have phase 1 of guestroom renovation beginning mid-August to September 30 and phase 2 starting mid-November to be completed by early January. We look forward to "showing off" our new look when you return.

Summary: We stayed here for three nights in May 2017.  We had first stayed here in 2008 when it was a Sheraton.  Happily, it has managed to maintain the great theming and service after dropping the brand.  The bell service and check-in are exemplary, warm and friendly with nothing to complain about.  Breakfast buffet is a good deal with helpful wait staff even if the eggs are only fair.  The fruit selection is excellent and it opens at 6:00 AM, useful for jetlagged travelers.  The rooms are excellent and comfortable with no outside noise even though we had a view of the highway.  Bathrooms could use an update although they were very clean.  Shuttle service was very punctual and regular, which greatly added to our enjoyment of the parks.  Just with this, I would highly recommend this
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind feedback...we enjoy hearing from our loyal returning guests and look forward to seeing you again on your next visit!

Summary: This hotel was charming in that old timey way.  The lobby looked straight out of an old movie with a hotel bar and clocks of various cities.  The walk to our room was a bit confusing as it isn't marked very well.  However, the front desk gave us detailed directions.  The hotel had a convenient shuttle to Disneyland.  The rooms were definitely old.  The vinyl headboards were peeling slightly and the bathrooms showed signs of wear.  It was a fine stay but not spectacular
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback as feedback is a gift for us to continue to improve.  We have an update regarding guestroom renovation plans are in the works to start phase 1 on August 14 through September 30...we think you will the updates! Come back and check us out soon!

Summary: this hotel is just behind Disneyland and has a very nice bus that runs every half hour to and from the hotel to Disneyland which makes it a very handy to come and go to the park throughout the day and not have to mess with the parking garage. Hotel is clean and children friendly and has a good buffet breakfast.
Manager Response: Thank you for the excellent review.  We appreciate making out guests happy and will be sure to share your kind words with our team We look forward to your visit again soon and please share with your friends and family!

Summary Heading: Great stay , rooms were nice and clean , older building but clean.
Summary: Would recommend older building but clean. Not far from Disneyland ,shuttle was great .  Restaurant and lounges great.  Shuttle service also great didn't have to wait long between trips.  Staff appeared to be shortage but were efficiently.  Didn't have children with us but appeared a lot of families staying there.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive feedback.  We look forward to you becoming a loyal guest of the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel.  Travel tip: check out our web site specials page for many value added packages that might appeal to your on your next visit!

Summary: My husband and I were looking to get away for a few days and head down to Disneyland. My husband, wanting to make sure we had a good time paid a little more per night than we normally would, hoping the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel would be that wonderful respite from the world. Boy, were we wrong.   When we first checked into the hotel, the lobby looked nice and the desk person was nice and explained to us where our room was located. We booked through Hotels.com and no where did it say we would have to pay $16 a day to park there,  but fine. We understand.   Walking to our room, the halls were neat and nice and looked freshly painted. We exited the building to enter the other Garden wing where our room was located. Instantly, we were in a run down poorly maintained building

Summary Heading: Great hotel, very close to Disneyland
Summary: We were here for 2 nights and had a great stay.  The hotel was very clean and comfortable.  We enjoyed the suite and found it to be very spacious and comfortable.  The staff provided great service.  The in room dining had some great food and fast service.  We enjoyed the breakfast on both days prior to going to Disneyland.  The shuttle that is available to get to and from Disneyland was also a nice option.  We would take an uber in the morning to get to the park as the line for the shuttle to the park gets very long but would take the shuttle back at the end of the day.  The shuttle leaves about every thirty minutes to go to the park and leaves about every fifteen minutes to return from the park.  Overall, we enjoyed this hotel and would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive feedback...looks like you are on your way to being one of our loyal guests and we appreciate that! We we will be sure to share your kind words with our hard working team. Travel tip: Check out our specials page on our web site for the latest in value add packages!

Summary: We've been staying at this hotel for at least the last 20 years and have always loved it, but I think this will be our last visit.  Walking in, the wall behind the front desk has torn wall paper and the wall of clocks is missing clocks, leaving just the hooks and empty space.  Tacky.  During check in, I was informed that while I was there an hour early to check into my three rooms, I would be charged $25 each.  This was not disclosed while making my reservations but I did find the information while clicking around the website tonight. Not easy to find but it is there if you search.  The clerk informed me that "all the big resorts were doing it" and the camera behind him was watching him and he'd get in trouble if he didn't charge me.  I asked to speak to the manager to maybe get
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, we take our guests comments seriously and will be reviewing them with the key departments. It is worthy to note of our recent upgrades and renovations plans: The Garden Tower guestrooms will begin renovations on August 14 and be completed September 30, 2017.  Final phase of guestrooms in the main building will begin mid-November 2017.  Due to the busy nature of the Resort area, Disneyland and Conventions we have to take our renovations in phases.  We just finished our Bistro Patio upgrade...we hope you had a chance to enjoy this beautiful outdoor setting and fountain. The Reception Desk is high on our list for attention after the guestrooms have been completed. With all of that, we hope you will give us another opportunity  to check out our improvements in the near future.

Summary: Nice hotel....carpeting in room a bit worn and should be replaced.  Close to Disneyland and having the free shuttle to the parks is a nice feature.  Food was good and plentiful.  Staff was polite and helpful.  Did not use the pool, but it seemed clean.
Manager Response: Thank you David for your feedback, as we always try to strive for the perfect stay. You will be happy to hear that we will begin phase 1 of our guestroom renovation on August 14 and completed by September 30. We will be sure to share your positive comments about our staff with our team and look forward to your visit soon.

Summary: We got 2 confirmations prior check in about the time we arrive, when we do they didint respect that, repeat the same useless info over and over again to avoid confront that info the staff provide wrong guidance, their mistake cost us an extra night and 250usd , didnt acept my credit card, overall it was the last time we stay there. That politic about a 100 dollars deposit in cash is ridiculous.
Manager Response: Thank you Sergio for the review. We appreciate all feedback. It looks like your reservation was booked through hotelbeds, if that is the case it was hotelbeds who was providing you the misinformation regarding your arrival and check in. We are very sorry that this situation happened and understand you thinking we were at fault. You might want to reach out to hotelbeds and see if they can help you with your situation. Thank you for being our guest and we hope we can welcome you back again in the future.

Summary Heading: Beautifully decorated, comfortable beds, gorgeous gardens, clean
Summary: We stayed in the King suite with pull out sofa bed. The mattress on the pull out couch (for our kids) was very comfortable with a 100% cotton blanket and nice sheets. The housekeeping staff was extremely efficient in bringing extra blankets at 1 AM in the morning (when we got back from Disneyland). The shuttles are free and awesome! They drop you off right in front of the Park, and pick up every 20 minutes (up until 1 AM at Disneyland). There are several gardens at the hotel, a pond with Koi, and fountain and pool. Our view of the gardens from our room was spectacular. The bathroom toilet handle was a little askew, but aside from this it was a wonderful room with updated fixtures and furniture. We were able to purchase Disney tickets inside the hotel which saved us time in the
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay and experienced most of the amenities our castle hotel has to offer.   Travel tip: Check out our specials page on our web site for many value-added packages to suit your budget!  We look forward to seeing you again soon!

Summary Heading: Disneyland getaway without the Disneyland prices
Summary: This Hotel is wonderful... to sum it up. My family and I, stayed here for a birthday event that we attended over at Disney Walk and of course we have to spend the following day in the park. We choose this hotel unexpectedly, the usual hotel that we use is booked up and this is the one that came up with shuttle service. My kids are not adapt to walking and I am not adapt to carrying my 3 year old on the way and back from the park so we have to get a hotel that offer shuttle service and this is it. The lobby is old world charm, the people up front are very friendly and accommodating. The hotel grounds are beautiful, this is in every sense a garden hotel. There is a coffee shop and a restaurant next to the lobby if you want a meal or a cup of Joe. Also, on the right side hallway
Manager Response: Thank you for the awesome review...you gave a lot of great inside travel tips about our beautiful hotel that are definitely worth knowing and sharing to make the most of your stay. We hope you will share your comments with family and friends looking to visit Disneyland.   Here is another travel tip:  Be sure to check out our specials page on our web site where you will find a whole host of package options with value-added amenities to save your money! Thanks again and see you soon!

Summary: We just had our second stay at Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel and they didn't disappoint.  I booked directly through the hotel and both times the agent was very helpful, polite and friendly.  They made sure I got what I needed and we're quick without making me feel rushed.    The hotel and room are clean and neat.  We always inspect our rooms as soon as we walk in and on both occasions the rooms looked, smelled and felt clean.  we have yet to stay in an updated room so the rooms we had were a little worn and dated but they were clean.  The rooms are also spacious.  The first trip this past July was with my full family of 5.  We had plenty room to spread out and never felt like we were on top of each other.    The pool area was clean and well maintained with plenty of space.  The
Manager Response: Dear RockingDisneyStyle: Thank you for the awesome review...you hit all the marks about what makes the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel the place to stay and why! We hope you will continue to be loyal guest as so many have over the years...we love being a part of your family memories! See you soon and don't forget to check out our special page on our web site for many value-added amenity packages.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for a Disneyland vacation
Summary: We had an amazing time and were so glad we stayed at Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel.  The shuttle was very convenient to get to Disneyland, our four year old LOVED the castle bunk bed in the room, the view to the fireworks was amazing, and everyone was very nice and helpful.  The room and hotel were clean and the pool was great.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback.  We are happy to hear we hit the mark in many areas especially with your four year old, the Castle Bunk Beds are pretty awesome! Thank you for letting us be a part of your family's memories! Come back to visit us again soon!

Summary Heading: Average room, showing age, but clean and close to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for four nights in late March, 2017. The hotel is showing its age, particularly in the bathroom where there is no fan and some obvious water damage. That said, the room was clean and comfortable. The staff was pleasant, check-in was quick, and the shuttle to Disneyland was worth it.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  This May we begin a renovation on the guest rooms that you were speaking of; by your next visit these issues will be a thing of the past. We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: This hotel is literally adjacent to Disneyland and as you would expect draws tremendous traffic from vacationers planning to go there.  I stayed recently for a conference hosted at this hotel.  This is a large property but clearly showing its age.  The furniture in the room, while functional, shows all kinds of routine wear and tear.  The rooms are spacious as well as the generously sized bathroom.  The hotel complex is enormous and not intuitive to navigate.  I, and many other guests, wandered often down labyrinth corridors trying to find our area.  The keycard system is somewhat older and mine continually failed when trying to enter the room.  The internet is inadequate for the large number of guests.  The signal constantly dropped and was excruciatingly slow..this is
Manager Response: Dear Gary: Thank you for taking the time to share your review with us...and we are glad you did to give as an opportunity on share what is in store for our Majestic Castle. Mid -August we will begin renovation of the Garden Tower Guestrooms.  This project will be completed September 30, 2017.  Our last phase of guestroom renovation will start mid-November and complete by early January, 2018.   Internet:  With guests traveling with so many wireless devices these days it can be a challenge to keep up with the demand.  We will be upgrading our internet service after guestroom renovations are completed. Thank you again for your awesome review...we look forward to being your "Castle" of choice when you visit Disneyland!

Summary: I usually read negative reviews with a very large grain of salt and have never written a negative review, until now.  Our families' stay at the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel was tainted by very poor response to the almost non-existent in room Wifi. This, by the way, is touted on their website as an amenity.   Upon checking into our room we tried to access the Wifi with no luck. After phone calls and visits to the front desk with promises to check on it, I asked to speak to a supervisor. The supervisor, Kim, indicated that they had no other reports of problems and forwarded me to AT&T to have them check the problem. The AT&T representative indicated that there were several dead spots due to equipment and he would try to fix but might have to replace some equipment to solve the
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.  Your comments were shared with the key department to oversee our complimentary guest WiFi service.  We will be doing an equipment upgrade in the future to remedy the few challenging areas we have and to accommodate the every increasing demand for WiFi Again, thank you for sharing so we can continue to improve our services. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: I stayed at this hotel 20 years ago when it was known as the Sheraton Anaheim and did not know what to expect.  Everything was the same apart from the fact that there was no longer a goldfish pond inside the hotel.  I was pleasantly surprised and have nothing but praise for this hotel. My first impressions were that the carpets in the reception area were a little tired and could do with replacing, but when I had rested a while and walked through the reception area, it seemed fine. The reception staff were very helpful and welcoming. I arrived just at the right time, because I noticed that there were often long queues, but this was not because the receptionists were inefficient, more likely they spend extra time making each person welcome. My room was very spacious and spotlessly
Manager Response: Welcome back!  We hope you don't was as long to come back for another stay.  Your review hit all of the marks that any guest would like to know about...thanks for the very thorough and thoughtful comments. Here's a travel tip from us:  Be sure to check out our specials page on our web site where you will find all of our great value-added packages! We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: Attended a conference here and was expecting a run down highly trafficked property near Disney.  Accommodations were fine and the staff was better.  Attendees used the hotel shuttles for both the airport and the park and had no difficulties.  Better than expected and priced well.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review...we appreciate you sharing your experience and the services you received.  We will pass your comments along to those departments.  We hope you will consider us for a future leisure stay soon!

Summary: Spent two nights, three days here with my wife and two daughters for spring break Dland trip. Great location, staff was super friendly and helpful, but....seems like ownership stopped investing in hotel about 20 years ago. Place seems to be falling apart. Headboards tattered, torn upholstery, carpet dirty and damaged. This place needs a major fixer-upper.
Manager Response: Thank you for your travel review!  We think our location is awesome and our guest service team tops too and will share your comments. You will be happy to hear that we will begin phase 1 of our guestroom renovation project mid-August and complete it by end of September.  Phase 2 will start mid-November and be completed early January. We look forward to your return with family to see our improvements...Mickey's Halloween Time is just around the corner starting late September through October taking Trick Or Treating to the ultimate level!

Summary: We stayed at the Anaheim Majestic Garden hotel during our two day Disney trip. You can tell that the inside was newly renovated. The outside needed work but it looks like they're keeping it up to the best of their abilities. The staff was wonderful and very accommodating with two young kids. We were able to check in early with a $25 early check-in fee which was perfect considering the boys needed naps. They also provided us two cribs which were free.  Also, the shuttle to Disney ran every half an hour so that was nice as well. We would definitely stay there again!
Manager Response: Thank you for the awesome review.  We are happy to hear you took advantage of the early check-in to get re-charged for the big day at Disneyland! Our housekeeping and engineering team to a great job keeping our Castle tip-top and we continue to make improvements!  Starting mid-August we will begin phase 1 of guestroom renovations and finish end of September; phase 2 will start mid-November and be completed early January. Come back soon to see our changes!

Summary: We decided to stay here as it was very close to Disneyland, coming here we knew it wasn't going to be amazing based on reviews and price ( although not cheap, it was good value in comparsion)  Rooms were a good size for families but they wewre old, bathrooms were horrible, cracked and tiny. I felt I couldn't walk on the carpet as it was dirty. We also had to take our bags up stairs (weird layout after getting out of lift) Reception staff were very average not that friendly. lobby bar staff were nice. The shuttle buses were good to and from Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid feedback.  We are very sorry to hear that your stay at the hotel was not up to par.  Please note that this information has been passed on to our concerned staff for review. Despite this, we hope to be able to welcome you back on a return visit to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Nice motel - a couple of minor disappointments
Summary: This is a large, very nice hotel.  Our room was spacious and clean - beds comfortable - and it was surprisingly quiet.  We had a mini fridge, coffee maker, but no microwave.  Kids enjoyed the pool and hot tub.  With one minor exception, employees were friendly and helpful.  The on site deli has some nice options and the restaurant serves good food (breakfast buffet was great).  The Disneyland shuttle was awesome and very much appreciated.  This was my first stay at this hotel - usually I book a Disneyland Hotel or one right across the street from the Disneyland entrance.  I didn't think that the short distance difference would be a problem here, but it was.  We came back from Disney late one night - hungry.  The hotel restaurant and deli were closed.  No restaurants were within
Manager Response: Thank you for your review from your recent stay with us. We are so pleased that you enjoyed the hotel and amenities offered here. We hope you will tell all your friends and family about us and then come back and see us again very soon. Thank you!!

Summary: The room was very comfortable. The shuttle to Disneyland was prompt and great. The staff  was friendly and helpful.  The negatives were: no window or fan in the bathroom; and no complementary breakfast. The dining room is expensive for breakfast. It was noisy early in the morning because some children were in the next room and shouting, but otherwise, it was quiet, especially at night.  The internet connection was intermittent and slow.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience and glad you enjoyed your stay.  Yes, we do have a fair share of excited kids here who just can't wait to get to Disneyland in the mornings! Although breakfast was not included in your stay, we do want to suggest you checkout our specials page on our web site.  There you will find an assortment of packages and seasonal offers that include breakfast and even parking...something to fit your needs and budget. Thank you for staying with us and hope to see you again soon!

Summary: My daughter and I had a great experience at the Anaheim Majestic last week.  We took advantage of the onsite deli, pool, story time with Princess Corinne and happy hour.  The shuttle was very convenient and always followed the schedule.  I found the drivers, front desk, bartenders and deli/cafe workers to all be very helpful and informative. Everyone was always smiling and no one seemed to mind at all my five year old or my questions. The only reason for a 4 score instead of 5 is some of the hotel is pretty dated- carpeting, elevators and wallpaper, but it did not take away from our stay at all.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us be a part of your Mother & Daughter making memories stay!  Looks like you took advantage of most of our amenities...especially story time with Princess Corinne. We love our staff too...they do their best to ensure you have a perfect stay. You will be happy to know we are beginning phase 1 of guestroom renovations mid-August and will finish end of September...just in time for Mickey's Halloween Time!  If you haven't experienced this yet, it is the ultimate Trick Or Treat experience...come dressed up in your favorite costumes!  Tickets go on sale soon!

Summary: Terrible! Dirty, nothing in the room, rude front desk( I wanted to offer her some money to get my questions answered)! Zero customer service, bad food, noisy, over all it's out! We usually go to only 5 star hotels but this was chosen by our 4 year olds grandsons only because they had castle shape bunk beds and they really wanted to sleep there. That's all. Never again!

The hotel is ideally located near the Disneyland Resort and a free shuttle is provided every 30 min. The hotel itself is very beautiful. I was a bit disappointed by the rooms, poorly decorated. The bed heads were damaged and the room looked a bit old. The staff at the Front Desk was very friendly.

Beautiful, large room!  Nice lobby, pool, spa....very clean!  Great reception and Disneyland ticket representative very helpful!  Need clearer instructions on the shuttle service as they say pick up is between 13 and 19; however, if you stand at 13 and other guest are at 19 you will not get on the bus.  There was security one night which was helpful.  Also,  if you do not want the buffet breakfast, the service was very s l o w!

Stayed in a one king bed plus sofa bed room. Family of 5!! Room was ok..  a little bit outdated but doable.  We stayed here for 2 days.... a little outdated but doable! It was nice having a shuttle to Disneyland...  I did hate paying for hotel parking.

So let me start off by saying the most important thing to me is the room must be clean, and that it was! Second they have a wonderful restaurant with many affordable options, a free shuttle bus that runs ever 30 minutes. Everything was literally wonderful, big comfortable bedroom a comfortable bed. I guess the only thing that would be considered a negative was the size of the bathroom but even that was perfectly fine. DisneyLand in March was great! Next time I go I'm staying at the Anaheim Majestic Garden hotel:)
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for your positive review of our hotel and team!  We appreciate hearing about your perfect stay and that you have become another loyal guest! Don't wait too long to come back for a visit...check out our hotel web site specials page for packages with value-added amenities to suit your budget and needs.

Summary: We booked here via a Priceline Express deal (I believe we paid around $119? There was a big cheer convention the weekend we stayed which drove all area hotel prices up). We hadn't stayed here before, but I'd always admired the hotel from the outside. We checked in late, around 10 PM, for a one night stay. We were kindly upgraded to a Junior Suite (the very light beige colored room featured on in one of the main pictures up top). The room was a double full (maybe queen?) with a small sitting area (couch and chairs). It was quite roomy! But - the bathroom was teeny tiny. Like a one person max bathroom, door barely clears the vanity type bathroom. It was clean, but looked quite old and a bit dingy (as did some of the moldings and such in the actual room). However, beds were comfy
Manager Response: Thank you for your great review!  We are glad you took a chance and enjoyed our Castle hotel and grounds and you experienced our spacious living space guestrooms. We will begin phase 1 of guestroom renovations mid-August and finish end of September.  You will just HAVE to come back for a visit to check us out!

Summary Heading: A lovely hotel with wonderful staff
Summary: First of all the staff were beyond helpful during my stay, from signing for my suitcase to allowing me to check in early and generally making sure I had an enjoyable stay. They were also kind enough to ensure that I was able to still visit the parks on the day I was checking out.   The hotel is in a great location with a frequent shuttle service to the parks which was easy and convenient to use. Also loved the tower/castle décor, it was very atmospheric.  The room was lovely and I had a fantastic nights sleep there!
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive stay...sounds like you enjoyed all of our best amenities, especially our free "Dream Machine" shuttle bus that takes you to and from the Disneyland Parks in about 5 minutes! Travel tip:  Check out our web site specials page for lots of packages with value-added amenities to meet your needs and budget!

Summary Heading: Disgusting stains, sink doesn't drain, no air-conditioning
Summary: It was 77 degrees F (25 C) and the air-conditioner blew only hot air. The front desk said there was nothing they could do. I noticed that there were two fans at the front desk that were not being used. I asked if we could borrow a fan because sleeping was really difficult in that heat. I was shocked that he told me "these fans are for staff only."   There was also a large disgusting stain in the middle of the room. We didn't feel comfortable walking in the room without shoes on.   The sinks didn't drain.   Vinyl peeling off of the headboard.   Check out the elevator coming apart.   I asked for a refund for that one night because the new room was acceptable. Nope. They would not consider it.   Asked Trip Advisor for some help and they weren't able to help either. Think I'll find
Manager Response: Thank you for your valuable feedback.  We apologize for your less than perfect stay.  We have shared your comments with the appropriate department heads for improvements.  You will be happy to hear we will begin phase 1 of room renovation mid-August and will be completed September 30. We hope you will give us another try to gain your loyalty.

Summary: Not bad, we've stayed at others closer to the park as we usually have a scooter (ECV) that we need to go back and forth with.  We were a little skeptical at first on how well the bus would work, but the bus crew was awesome!  They helped, were very friendly and efficient.  Kudos to the bus people!  The hotel was a bit dated, but added to the charm.  Food in the restaurant was good, and the staff was friendly.  The room was more spacious than others around the park which was nice as we could park the scooter in the room rather than leaving it outside and worrying about it.  Beds were comfy'ish, but better than most others in surrounding hotels.  Overall a nice stay, would have been 5 stars but the front desk staff was a little grumpy when we checked in, not very helpful.  Though
Manager Response: Thank you for your valuable feedback.  We are excited to hear you enjoyed your stay and our free "Dream Machine" shuttle service was helpful and fun. Our spacious rooms  are definitely spacious...parking your scooter inside and still have rooms to stretch WOW...that is awesome after a fun day at Disneyland. We hope to see you again soon...the shuttle drivers miss you!

Summary Heading: Great value and location! Useful shuttles too!
Summary: We really liked the hotel. The grounds are magical. The room was spacious, and the bed was comfortable. The convenience to the Disney parks was wonderful. It was so useful to have the frequent shuttle to Disneyland. If I had to identify something needing improvement, the bathrooms are not as updated as the rooms themselves--it would have been nice to have a sink outside of the bathroom. (There were 3 of us, and we occasionally bumped into each other while getting ready.)
Manager Response: We couldn't be happier than to receive your very complimentary review.   We agree our grounds are very relaxing and pretty...the fountain area is a favorite spot to enjoy.  Glad you enjoyed our spacious rooms! You will be happy to know we will start phase 1 of guestroom renovations to be completed end of September. Come back soon and check us out!

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with excellent customer service
Summary: Stayed here over President's Day weekend for my girlfriend's birthday.  Experienced exceptional customer service from Michelle behind the front desk.  The loft suite we were upgraded to was incredible.  The amenities I ordered, as well as the room service were great and our server was very friendly.   Had an completely unforgettable weekend!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your magical stay with us.  We will be sure to let Michelle know she made your stay exceptional! We look forward to your return as a loyal guest...tell your friends and family too!

Summary: My son and I stayed here while on Vacation in the LA area and absolutely loved this hotel. The rooms are over sized so they are very comfortable. Plus the overall theme of the hotel is so cool. It's like staying in a British Manor House or a magical castle. The lobby area is so awesome with suits of armor and all kinds of cool stuff on display. Not to mention the grounds are immaculate with peaceful gardens, courtyards and a wonderful pool area to explore. There is also a delicious restaurant on the premises that we ate at several times for dinner and a convenient gift shop in the lobby area with everything you could possibly need for your stay. Another big plus is the shuttle bus that goes to Disneyland everyday which runs every 30 minutes. That was super awesome. In less than

Summary Heading: Beautiful place to relax and unwind but close to Disney Land
Summary: We had a lovely stay the grounds are gorgeous and the staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. The shuttle to Disney was really convenient and quite friendly. Our room was spacious and comfortable. We are definitely making plans to return.

Stayed here a lot when it was a Sheraton. Still beautiful. Still love it. Free Disney shuttle is great! However, the beds are definitely not sweet sleepers any more. Not the worst bed but not that comfortable. Every time my husband moved, the whole bed shook tremendously.

This hotel is not in walking distance to Disney, but they do have a shuttle that runs every thirty min. They charge for parking and don't have a free breakfast. Their rooms are great for families. They also have a great view of the fireworks that Disney does nightly! The staff is kind and professional. They keep the hotel clean. We will definitely come back here again to stay! It is a good alternative to some of the more expensive hotels. My daughter (2 years) loved that we stayed in the "castle" when we came to visit. This hotel looks like a castle!

Summary Heading: Worst service ever! Treated very badly.
Summary: The staff was very unfriendly and very unhelpful. First they couldn't find our reservation. Thank God we had printed out. Then the type of room that we ordered was not available. Rooms are not up to standard.

We stayed here for 2 nights during cheerleading competition weekend. There were very few hotels, so stayed here. First off, it's very close to Disneyland. The shuttles are convenient, but very old and worn out. The people were friendly staff. The headboards on our beds were disgusting. The price was under $200 per night, so we just wanted something that was on the lower side. I guess you get what you pay for.

Summary Heading: It's Majestic and grand - an older classic hotel
Summary: Love this property ! It's got perks that the other hotel on the main strip doesn't have. Rooms are big, space is large with a two double bed it feels so grand! Cute touch with having royal curtains in the room! The grounds are spacious, swimming pool is a plus and the shuttle is quick and fast, it's also on time! Considering that this weekend was crazy busy ! Some room packages come with breakfast but we didn't avail of that. Parking is expensive - 14 dollars a day although your vehicle will have in and out privileges. Other than that - this is another one for the Anaheim books for hotels !

I'm all about good vibes great customer service and smiles honey! If guest feels welcome that mean we most likely will be back but Nope not me and my family of 4. First off my check in was at 4 p.m so late...things didn't go as planned at home that i got there at 7pm! I still had plans  to get to this room decorate it for my childs birthday and wake up early enjoy disneyland. I didn't cancel I still went. Front desk wasn't bad but could of been more friendly. This is where it went bad...I got to my room and I turned the light on where the beds are in between the beds they DID NOT work. I called and they said they will send someone up. Someone showed up and when I opened the door he said "Where's the light that doesn't work?" just like that . Like he was annoyed but reminder I'm

Summary Heading: Perfectly decent tourist hotel with great shuttle service
Summary: This was the last hotel with conference pricing availability for a recent trade show at the convention center so I had to book it. And after reading a lot of the grumpy reviews I was pretty trepidatious. We stayed for two nights and I have no idea what people are complaining about. Yes, the hotel is a little outdated and has turrets and a silly "Princess and Dragon" theme but people, it's Disneyland, not Paris.   Pros:  -Excellent service at the front desk. We arrived very early, before 10:00 AM, and the front desk staff did a pre-checkin and took all our information and held our bags. I went back at 1:30 and she had a room ready for me. Very friendly and nice. -Shuttle to Disneyland ran spot on time both ways. It's every half-hour and the driver was friendly. It's also within

It was a very pleasant stay. The hotel was comfortable and walking distance to Disney although shuttle runs back and forth at regular intervals. Convenient store/shop on premise. Good restaurant/bar. Happy hour with good menu items. Breakfast buffet is good. Pool area was comfortable. Game room for kids.

Wasn't sure when we booked what we were getting based on the mixed reviews, however we later determined that some people like complaining about everything. In fact i personally liked it more then my stay at Disneyland Hotel. Beautiful lobby decorations (at christmas), friendly staff, clean rooms, convient location. This would be the perfect affordable resort to stay in next time you're visiting Disneyland.  :)

We stayed here for 4 nights. I had booked our plane tickets with the hotel for a special discount package. After reading all the reviews about the non renovated rooms I got really scared. Expedia paid for us to change rooms for a premium room and that made me feel better. We got there early and there were no rooms available yet but they take your luggage and store it safely for you to hit Disneyland. The first shuttle half our family got on and the other half they left without.  If you are leaving first thing In the morning you need to get in that line at LEAST 15 minutes before the go time. And on early opening mornings a good 30 minutes before. Or else you will have to wait for the bus to come back. People will hold other people's places in line so you may think your safe in

This hotel is absolutely beautiful! I stayed one night for a solo trip while visiting family in Southern California. Andrew, the gentleman at the front desk, was very kind and courteous, and made sure I had a memorable stay. I highly recommend this hotel for families and individuals alike!

I travel to Disneyland 4-5 times a year.  (We are annual pass holders)  Unfortunately my other two favorite places to stay were completely booked so I looked on Hotels.com and found this place.  My daughter a friend of hers stays there and likes it so I booked the stay.  The first thing we saw when we arrived was a sign by the automatic gate detailing the parking rates.  This included hotel guests at $16 per night!  I have stayed at many of the area's lodgings and have never had to pay to park at a place where I was a guest.  I figured that the charge would be waived....I was wrong.    While waiting to check in I was reading the hotel's foreign exchange rate and noticed that Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel would give $0.98(US) per 1 British Sterling Pound.  What a rip-off

We booked this hotel for the location not expecting too much.  The service was excellent. The bar man was great and even though he mixed our first cocktail wrong every other was great. He was lovely to talk too and we had a good time there. There was a lady behind the counter who was very helpful and informative when it came to Disneyland which is why we were there.   Now for the not so great: - The room was old - The shower was horrible and the bathroom was set out so there was no room to dry yourself - no in room safe which meant we had to lock all of our valuables on our suitcases - Our room was off the pool area that was noisy with people. Even though it was middle of winter and freezing cold. - Room service stops at 10.30pm. We had just come from Australia so our body

Summary Heading: Not majestic at all, you have been warned
Summary: I can't begin to tell you how disappointed with my stay here. We were here for 3 nights. I really should have carefully read the reviews on here before booking. I will tell you now that I will never stay here again. Plus, it was not cheap to stay here so we expected more.   The hotel is very dated. Nothing is new or modern. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!  Here are my list of my pros and cons:  Pros: - 15 min walk to downtown disney (faster than taking a shuttle because you have wait in line super early and may not even be able to get on)  - large rooms  Cons: (please bear with me because this list is long!) - no restaurants close by. The hotel is situated near highways so there are no restaurants or even coffee shops nearby. You will have to eat in the hotel or at disney. - very

Summary Heading: Hotel is nice enough, but the shuttle service is the WORST I've ever seen, anywhere
Summary: The rooms and other were fine (other than a leaky faucet that they failed to repair fully), clean and spacious. However, if you want to ride the shuttle to Disney, good luck, make sure you line up WAY before, and plan to wait 2-4 shuttles, coming AND going, about 20-45 minutes. ALL the other properties with shuttles had them continuously rotating, enough so that ONLY the Majestic Garden hotel was left with a line, and an enormous one at that.

This is a very good Hotel if you want to be close to Disneyland.  Rooms: Nice and Clean no problems TV and Internet: TV was so so, no movie channels. WiFi was very good Pool: Outdoor pool very clean. It's heated but not that warm, I guess in the summer time it would be great but a little chilly for February Jacuzzi: Next to the pool, very hot and Great. Can see the Disney fireworks from it. Dining: The Hotel has a restaurant and Bar. NOTE: if you want to save some cash, eat out in the morning otherwise you will be using some serious cash for breakfast with a big family. There are lots of restaurants close by. Amenities:  Gift Shop and place to get some early morning coffee and snacks  There is a fireplace to cuddle up to while texting or online in the main open area near the

Summary Heading: I was so badly hoping to give 5/5
Summary: We are from Utah and travel to Anaheim about once a month for the escape and to do Disney and because of that, we've stayed in quite a bit of hotels.  Here's my review based on our 2 nights staying here. The first night, we showed up after a long day of driving with our 3 kids to check-in. They put us in the back in building G, which not only has the tiniest parking area ever, but it was in the older non-renovated building. It was raining so we loaded up everything and went back to G. First of all, when you get off the elevator, there are ZERO room arrow signs telling you which rooms are which way. Once we found our room, we were not impressed.   Our room was old, the paint was peeling on the headboard, our room was 76 degrees when we walked in and when I called to ask about the

the location was great but the hotel was not, it is a very pretty hotel, they charge you an early check in fee of $25 even if your room is already ready, they charge you double room tax and when you ask them about it they say oh there is nothing we can do. the customer service people were extremely rude when we brought up the over charges for the double room tax, room service that we did not order, and over charged us for parking when we only stayed one night, they had no idea what they were doing and even the manager when he finally came out of the back was extremely rude to us said well that what happens and we can not fix it. they do not care about people at all. the maids decided it was a great idea to vacuum the hall ways at 7 in the morning, this is not the best idea

Great location. This hotel has a free shuttle bus to the disney park, which leaves every 30 minutes. The rooms are big, the windows were dirty and a bit dated and the wifi is awful in the part we stayed in. Tea coffee maker in room which was good.

Summary Heading: One of the only free shuttles to Disney. Stay in upgraded tower rooms.
Summary: We like this property for the close proximity to Disneyland and the free shuttle. The bar and store is open until at least an hour after the park closes if you need a nightcap or snack. We always get the upgraded Tower rooms and they are spacious and allow for a family to stay with the large sleeper sofa. The staff is fantastic and always accommodating. We like the breakfast buffet and the store with soup and sandwiches. To have a great time, only stay in the Tower rooms!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Recent trip to Disney with friends, booked this hotel on Hotwire....  Rooms are in desperate need of care. Paint peeling off the walls and headboards, no water pressure, toilets and sinks not draining ie) standing in 6 inches of water while showering. The room was a 5 minute walk through the hotel into another building... oh and the giant saucer sized spider on the wall was a nice touch!   Would not recommend..... and I'm not picky!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review from your recent stay here with us. We are sorry that your experience wasn't up to your expectations. Your concerns and comments will be shared with the management team for future resolution. Did you happen to express your concerns to a manager while you were with us so that we could have tried to correct any issues and turn your stay around? We hope you'll give us another chance if you are back in the area. Thank you!

Summary: We stayed here for 6 nights while visiting Anaheim while this hotel is not really in walking distance to Disneyland or should I say an easy walk the hotel does provide a free shuttle service to and from Disneyland which we found was good only as with any time it's busy you may have to wait but that's to be expected. The room we had was an updated one in the tower area and was nice and large with plenty of room in the bed area only gripe I had was maybe make the bathroom a little bigger as seemed a little small but other than that the room was clean and tidy we did notice a little bit of a musty smell in the hallways more so when high humidity but the room itself was fine. We ate at the onsite restaurant more for convenience than anything else the food was what you would expect
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your feedback from your recent stay with us. We appreciate all comments and will work to improve in the areas you mentioned we were lacking. We are pleased that your overall stay and experience was good. Please come back and stay with us again. Thank you!!

Summary: Stayed here for 5 nights. They let us check in very early for a small fee, we were able to buy our multiday Disney tickets, head up to our room, shower, and then get on the free shuttle for a day at Disneyland. The room was huge! The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the little bath was great for soaking our feet after long days wandering.  The staff were exceptional, and did everything they could for us.  There's a little cafe downstairs where you can get essentials like shampoo and chocolates... and the breakfast buffet in the restaurant was brilliant. We relaxed in the hot tub, which was a great place to meet new people. On our last day, we checked out, and they allowed us to store our luggage and use the shuttle bus to get to and from Disneyland for one last time before
Manager Response: Thank you for the rave review. We are so pleased that your experience exceeded your expectations. Please share with your friends and family and come back again when you are in the Disney area. Thank you!!

Summary: Exactly what we needed for our Disneyland vacation.  Regular and reliable shuttles, clean spacious, well appointed room, and friendly professional staff members.  One ridiculous traveler ahead of us in line one day was irate and obscenely rude and the staff and management at the front desk still remained calm amd composed.  Kudos to the young, small framed, female manager on duty that day!
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest feedback, we appreciate you taking the time to provide this for us. Thank you for your kind words which will be shared with the front desk staff regarding their demeanor while dealing with an upset guest. They will appreciate you  understanding where they are coming from. Please do stay with us again when you are back in the Anaheim area. Thank you!

Summary: TLDR; it was an average hotel in a decent area. I probably wouldn't stay here again, but I would recommend it for those on a budget.  First want to give a quick shout out to Alexis at the front desk. She is so helpful and nice!   The positives: - We requested a king bed and our room was massive. I mean huge. You could easily fit two king beds comfortably and not feel cramped! We loved how much space there was. - Our window was garden-facing so it was very quiet and peaceful. I would highly recommend requesting this side, otherwise you may hear the traffic from the street. - Free shuttle to Disney and California Adventure, and back to the hotel every half hour. This was the biggest perk! It saves you 20 minutes of walking there one way, and it's welcomed after 14 hours of walking

Stayed for a business trip as was closest to the event.  Was given room in the garden tower which is clearly outdated and poorly maintained. Elevators don't always take to the correct floor. Attwifi super slow even for business needs.  No Ethernet in the room. TV only has local channels and slow.  Headboard is peeling. Shower tiles are cracked. Door stop broken and hanging loose.   Def not staying here again if in the area. The staff though were nice enough.

I called the hotel prior to check in to see if by chance our room was ready and we could check in early (it was raining in the park and we wanted to dry off a bit). The man on the phone told me he couldn't tell me anything over the phone I needed to come down there,  I explained I would have to Uber there and would rather not if it wasn't ready,  needless to say he didn't care.   Once arriving to the hotel the lady at check in told us our room was ready but if we wanted to check in early there was a $25 dollar fee.   WHAT?! I've never ever ever heard of such a thing.   That's nickel and diming at its finest.   We opted to just leave our bags with the bell boy,  he was the highlight of the hotel extremely nice,  so pleasant, and helpful.   We took the shuttle back and forth from

Summary Heading: Only if there's no place else!
Summary: Well....this hotel makes for a haul to Disneyland and the convention center. You have to shuttle or Uber. No way to walk. I was here for a music event. The hotel was so disappointing and was not cheap. It's dated...run down...and felt kind of dirty. It's also smack next to the freeway and the windows are old so of course it was noisy.  The only thing I liked about it was the hotel staff was nice.

We were really excited to stay with our family of 4 for a few nights on site.   We had called prior to getting to the hotel to see if we could check in early.  Sure...if you wanted to pay $25.  We passed and went and explored the area instead.   When we got inside, check in took a bit but nothing too extreme.  When we got to the elevator to go to our room it was the size of a small closet.  Yikes.  There were stained ceiling tiles on the first floor which was kinda yuck and obviously meant either fire system leak or HVAC leak.  I'm assuming the latter since our air conditioning didn't work in our room.  When we got inside to settle down for the day we turned on the TV which instantly turned off.  Fluke?  No...it just didn't work.  We called to order room service for the morning,

Summary Heading: Pets allowed but maybe not worth it
Summary: My wife really wanted to stay here because the hotel looks great for families and they accept pets. We brought our dog with us (we're new to CA and don't know anyone to watch the pup, also there is a day time kennel at the entrance of Disney that we utilized) and we ended up in a room that was part of the old hotel which is a separate building from the main lobby.  Very dated and used/abused room. The fabric on the headboard was ripped and peeling away leaving little pieces all over the pillows. The bathroom was painted over several times and they just got what they could with a roller. Carpets were stained/grimey and I forgot to bring Flip flops so I wore my shoes until bedtime. The kids had to stay on the beds all the time. No microwave in the room to heat water to warm up

I'm not sure where "majestic" fits in. Rooms were old and not especially clean. The AC didn't work and when we told the front desk they said "oh, just don't turn on the fan." Parking was listed at $16 a night but charged us $18 a night. It's not that the $2 made a difference, it was just a bunch of little things. Honestly, go somewhere else and just order an Uber/Lyft. Chances are it will be a nicer hotel for less.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the time spent with us, we are sorry you feel your experience wasn't up to par. We would love to discuss the parking discrepancy with you; our parking fee is $16 per night so there should be no instance where you should of been charged $18 please contact us to discuss and settle this for you. Thank you!!

Summary: Aloha!  I am loyal to the SPG hotels and  I really enjoyed this former Sheraton Property, the Anaheim Majestic Hotel at the recommendation of a friend who's in the industry.   I loved this hotel!  It is located behind the left side of Disneyland (back at the cast areas and Disneyland Park HQ).  I had wonderful service from check-in and throughout my stay.  I find that I always receive great service if I'm simply kind to the staff.  Since I arrived very early (7 hrs before check-in) they held our luggage and provided us with room keys that allowed us to immediately board the free shuttle to the park, yay!  The excellent shuttle service operates every 30 minutes (see all prior reviews for shuttle details). On one of your hotel nights, try to time it to be in the lobby at the start
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review from your recent stay here with us. We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay and please do stay with us again next time you are in the area. Thank you!!

Summary Heading: Quiet and large rooms, beautiful grounds
Summary: We all enjoyed our stay here. The best part is being so close to the Disney parks and the beautiful gardens of the hotel. Staff were all very friendly and helpful. Our room was very spacious and looked out onto one of the garden areas. I really enjoyed the convenience of the breakfast buffet with having a sick two year old on our trip. It was a good buffet! Our bathtub drained very slowly so it felt like you were taking a shower and bath at the same time. Bathroom was very small and outdated but does the job. We loved visiting the koi pond but wish they would clean out the coins and put a sign up asking not to throw any in, as it isn't healthy for the fish. Would recommend staying here for the price and location.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review of your stay here with us. We appreciate the feedback and will share your thoughts with the other area department managers for review. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Big place, met all our needs
Summary: Stayed at Majestic Garden for two night while visiting Disneyland.  The shuttle service was great, picking up at each location every 30 minutes.  We left Disneyland at the point we felt exhausted and did not have to wait more than 10 minutes to be picked up.  We did breakfast at the hotel for two mornings, once in the restaurant and once in the cafe/store.  The restaurant is nice sit with both buffet and menu options.  We did the buffet and felt satisfied with what we ate.  The cafe/store was perfect for our quick breakfast prior to shuttling to Disneyland. Had a couple of drinks at their bar, which is a reasonable size for a family hotel. Didn't utilize the pool or gym. The hotel is multiple buildings and we stayed in one of the non-main buildings. It was a bit a a trek to our
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and feedback from your stay. Please follow us on social media and we hope to have you back again with us very soon. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Employees don't know they work in the hospitality industry
Summary: What a joke. AVOID THIS PLACE!! -No safe in room, and every time you need access to your safety deposit box you have to wait in the long line to see the 1 or 2 front desk attendants. ALWAYS UNDERSTAFFED. -$16 a day to park. -No Microwave -refused to let me refill my coffee after I left from breakfast.  -Restaurant staff told a customer they can't sit until "that group leaves" pointing at us -drawers in dresser do not stay closed. They were literally open for 3 days straight. -Shower clogged entire time. -heater out of control. No AC only heat. Had to open window facing freeway to get air. SO LOUD! -Soda machine broken, and charged me $7 for 1 soda which was labelled as costing $2, and hotel refused to refund, AND refused to give me a soda. -front desk employees are rude,
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent feedback and we are very sorry you had this experience during your stay. We appreciate our Expedia guests of all levels and want to correctly recognize them. We will alert the front desk team and management of your concerns and make sure that everyone is on top of their guest service skills. Thank you for sharing this with us and we hope that you will give us another chance when you are in the area again.  Thank you!

Summary: It (almost) felt like staying in a castle! Our room was spacious and comfortable. My 4 year old and I had a great time exploring the grounds. The Disneyland shuttle was a great service, and they provided more than one bus at the busiest times, so we didn't have to wait a full half hour until the next scheduled shuttle when the bus was full.  The breakfast buffet was good value for money, my son was thrilled to have his favourite - pancakes and bacon! I could imagine that in the warmer months it would have been nice to use the pool and outdoor garden dining option, but there's always next time.... Will definitely come again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are pleased that you enjoyed your stay here with us and will be back again. Please share with your friends and family and we'll see you here again soon! Thank you!

Summary: Staff was very nice. Did reserve a King bed and got doubles. It was just me and my husband, I didn't complain because they got us checked in before check in. This place is huge, I got lost more than once...
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive feedback from your recent stay here with us. We hope you'll stay with us again. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Nice place and convenient to Disney and the Convention Center
Summary: For the most part the hotel was fine.  The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel provided shuttle service to Disney and the Convention Center.  My room did have some minor issues such as a tear in the bed headboard and a tv remote that was broken.  The beds were very comfortable and my room was huge.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review from your recent stay here with us. We appreciate your feedback and glad that you would come back and stay with us again next time you are in the area. Thank you!

Summary: I stayed here on business, although my wife was with me. If it was a personal trip I think we would've been all over some of the quaint areas we only saw from a window. You do get a somewhat Disney feel there, but it's not overwhelming for the business traveler.  The room was a good size and for all intents and purposes quiet.  We were there in (cold and rainy) January, and the hallways were cold! Fortunately, the heat was kicking on in the room. The water pressure in the shower could've been better. I was disappointed to call down to have more styrofoam cups sent up for use with the coffee maker, only for them never to fill my request. I was also surprised that there weren't any extra blankets, say, in the closet.  Also, the server in the restaurant during breakfast definitely
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and feedback from your recent stay here with us. We are pleased that the  majority of your stay sounded like it was a positive one. Please come back and see us again next time your travel plans bring you to the Anaheim area. Thank you!

Summary: Our room was huge! Plenty of room for myself and the hubby plus our two adult children. The beds were so comfy with plenty of blankets and pillows. We didn't have to worry one bit. We could spend the day at one of the Disney Parks or Universal Studios and know we had a worry free comfy room to collapse in waiting or us. The shuttle to the Disney parks was clean and on time. The drivers were friendly and accommodating. It's a bit of a drive to Universal Studios but well worth it.  Lastly, the hotel was very affordable. We were well rested and well taken care of at the Majestic Garden Hotel. Thank you all for making our trip that much more memorable. Cheers! Terrie & Scott McKinley
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and hope that you will recommend us to a friend. We hope to welcome you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: The front desk was great, Very easy to check in. The room was nice and clean, very spacious. Didn't have much of a view though. Beds were very comfortable. Outside of the hotel was very nice. Front lobby and grounds were very pretty. Parking close to my was impossible. The hotel was very close to Disney land so I was extremely happy. I would recommend this hotel for your visit.
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid feedback.  I am very sorry to hear that your stay at the hotel was not up to par.  Please not that this information has been passed on to our concerned staff.  Despite this, we hope to be able to welcome you back on a return visit to Anaheim.

Summary: We stayed here for a rundisney race weekend. I booked the hotel on orbitz and the problems seemed to start there. I tried to add a friend to the reservation, but when you book through Orbitz, you have to call Orbitz for changes. I called orbitz to do this and placed another request for that room at the same time. When we checked hotel, they had the other request on file, but apparently didn't have any requests to add people to the reservation. Instead of asking if they should add my friends name who was standing right next to me, nothing was said. The next day my friend's room key didn't work, so she went to the front desk to get a new key. The front desk wouldn't give her a new key because her name wasn't on the reservation. Eventually they gave her a key after she gave them my
