Called the front desk and they had no clue why he was in my room. Finally got a call back from the front desk and there was a call from days ago about a leaky shower head and they decided to fix it while I was out even though I asked them not to enter my room because of $10,000 worth of camera equipment in the room. Asked to talk the manager, Lyn. He made every excuse in the book instead of

We loved it! Clean.. Huge rooms.. Beautiful pool..... Love the little store brunch area..  Stunning hotel.. Inexpensive hotel... Started planning our next visit before we even left.. The shuttle drives we're beyond kind.... The best...
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and hope that you will recommend us to a friend.  We hope to welcome you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: We had a marvelous 10 days at hotel. From our arriving to our departure we had help from all the hotel staff. Very supportive were Manuel, Miguel, Yanina, Zeke. All the time given the right recommendation or advising where to go or visit, apart from Disney. The attention at the restaurant, fantastic.  The room all the time clean and the beds very comfortable. The shuttle system to Disney park, sharp on time !, departing every 30 minutes, either from the hotel or from the park. Finally, totally recommendable for families.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and hope that you will recommend us to a friend.  We hope to welcome you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary Heading: Castle Premium 2 Queen Beds Room Fantastic
Summary: I must say this room was a marked improvement over last year when we stayed in the older part of the hotel. The room is massive and was spotless even in the bathroom area, There of course is your 2 queen beds and tv cabinet with a small bar fridge underneath and a table and 2 chairs and a few other nice touches to go along with the castle theme. Also the staff were friendly and helpful. Like I said pay that few dollars extra per night for the Castle A Rooms and you won't go wrong
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive comments.  I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us!  I hope your next stay is just around the corner.

Summary Heading: Was good but for me to far away
Summary: We come to Disney once a year and have always stayed directly across the park walking distance we tried something different. The hotel was massive so big, they had shuttles running to Disney every 15-30 mins and never had issues at all with waiting long even to come home from the park. Paying for parking at the hotel bugs me considering you are already renting the room from them. Check in was Greta bell boy was probably the best much better then the front desk told us all about the activities, buses etc princesses had story time and read to the kids, lots of little activities. I found the rooms in need of updating very 80's but for how long you are in there they worked. No coffee machine $15 extra for a rollaway if you needed one. Pool was nice because we needed up in a heatwave

Huge hotel, we were in a seperate building on the other side from the reception desk, but had a really big room. Not sure if we had been upgraded (we were on our honeymoon).  Free shuttle was perfect - every half an hour, always on time. One evening there was a huge queue, and they sent extra shuttles to collect us all. Very accomadating.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and hope that you will recommend us to a friend.  We hope to welcome you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times in the last year. The rooms are clean and spacious. The shuttle to Disneyland is convenient leaving every 30 min for the park and running an hour and 15 min after park closing. Their bell hop Roger was amazing in assisting us with our luggage and assisting my elderly mother when her back went out after our long car ride to Anaheim. He went above and beyond to fetch her a wheelchair and bag of ice and bring to the parking lot. He took extra time, care, and assistance getting us set up in our room and situating my mother in a comfortable position in the room. We will definitely be staying on all of our trips to Disneyland.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and hope that you will recommend us to a friend.  We hope to welcome you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: A really nice hotel. Ideally situated for Disney. I.e. not too close but close enough to enjoy the fireworks. They have succeeded in making it seem like a castle and the young children, of which there were a few 'cos of Disney, found it enchanting. The bar and restaurant were very good and the sitting area around an open fire were a perfect place to relax.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and recent stay with us. We are pleased that you enjoyed the hotel and your time here. Please do share with your friends and family and come back soon. Thank you!

Summary: We recently spent 4 nights at the Majestic Garden as part of a family Disneyland vacation.  We come to Anaheim about 4 times per year and stay at many hotels and I have never been moved to complain about any of our hotel stays until now.  The "Dream Machine" shuttle is a joke.  The shuttles are filthy on the inside, the seat covers are either stained or coming off the foam interior of the seats.  Additionally, we were unable to board the shuttle leaving the park 3 out of the 4 nights we were there because it was full. Keep in mind this was not at park closing time, or after fireworks, or any time that one would expect to be particularly busy, just at a random time in the evening. Once we learned we had to line up EARLY if we expected to make it on the return shuttle, we employed

Let me start out by saying that this hotel has very poor overall service. We were in an updated Castle King room and our Son and family in a standard double room three doors down. The updates in our room were minimal. The standard double was down right awful. Dirty, smelly carpet / mold in bathroom / stained drapes ect. Very small windows in all of the rooms. There is very little natural light in the room so you feel like you are in a cave. The bathrooms are so small you have to shut the door to access the vanity or shower. The whole hotel is very dated and seems to be updated only when absolutely required. For the price you can do much better.   The shuttle is a plus leaving every thirty minutes on the half hour. Can be very crowded so you should get in line out front ten
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and I am sorry that your experience was not up to par. Additionally, I am sorry that you had problems with replies that I have made to other guest reviews here. The items that you mentioned that were problems with your room or the hotel have been shared with the department managers for resolution. We will work to correct those items and thank you for bringing them to our attention. Other items mentioned in your review are guest opinion and this is the forum for you to express those. Thank you again for this feedback and please feel free to contact me directly if you have any questions or concerns.

Summary: Stayed here for a long weekend while we did a couple of days at Disney and another at Universal.  The complimentary bus service to and from Disney was great.  Could have gotten bus service, for a fee, to Universal also, but we drove.  Being just off  I5, was a convenient location to do that from.
Manager Response: What a wonderful review, we truly appreciate your business and your trust in us.  I am very happy to hear that our staff and service met your needs and expectations.  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: Amazing hotel, beautiful looking, rooms were immaculate. The hotel is only just a short bus drive to Disney which is a courtesy bus from the hotel which runs back and forward to the park every 30 mins. If you are going to Disneyland California this hotel is the perfect one to stay at, has a Disney help/sales desk and plenty for the kid's to keep them occupied with the pool and thing's all round the hotel.
Manager Response: We appreciate your positive feedback about our hotel.  We do take price in catering to our guests’ needs the best way we can.  If you’re traveling to our area again soon, we hope you'll choose us again. Thank you!

Summary: The hotel is much larger than expected which was a plus and the shuttle was very convenient. I stayed in a newly renovated room which was nice. The only reduction in a star was because the walls were super thin. I could hear the kids crying in other rooms next door and woke up to kids yelling at the pool which is the way our room was facing. I would probably stay here again. I worried about the bathroom being small as per other reviews and it was small but I wouldn't say it was unusable, it was still manageable for 1 or 2 people.
Manager Response: We appreciate your positive feedback about our hotel.  We do take price in catering to our guests’ needs the best way we can.  If you’re traveling to our area again soon, we hope you'll choose us again. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Card security debacle tarnished honeymoon stay
Summary: The hotel generally is lovely, but the rooms are a little tired and the bathroom certainly could do with updating. The sockets in our room couldn't handle a regular plug let alone using adaptors for our UK plugs. The bar staff were rude and made comments to other non-US guests about "we tip in America". The front desk also tried to make charges on our card without telling us, the only reason we knew was because our bank stopped it. If the hotel were to be updated, and their staff trained better on customer service & card security we would go back.
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid feedback.  I am very sorry to hear that your stay at the hotel was not up to par.  Please not that this information has been passed on to our concerned staff.  Despite this, we hope to be able to welcome you back on a return visit to Anaheim.

Summary: Close to the park w/ a shuttle provided Rooms were large & very clean. Restaurant was great. Buffet excellent & efficient. We saw a Princess visit during breakfast to make sure all the little princes & princesses ate well before their long day. Hotel staff were very helpful...front desk...Disney lady...wait staff. We really enjoyed our stay here. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Close to the parks, great shuttle. Nice pool with even nicer rooms. Bunk beds were awesome
Summary: Close to the parks, great shuttle. Nice pool with even nicer rooms.  Rooms were clean and the bunk beds were so great for the kids. The bar was great and the food was spot on. Parking a bit more then I wanted to pay but felt like the car was safe.

Summary Heading: Loved the fireworks from the hotel.
Summary: The hotel was nice.  The King room was larger than expected. Very clean. The bathroom was small, no big deal, we don't spend much time in the bathroom. The gardens were nice. I liked the way some of the rooms were around a fountain and garden area.

Summary: Free shuttle, friendly safe drivers. My experience at check in was smooth, friendly staff. Huge lobby and lobby restroom lets you know this hotel was built years ago, and in grand style. The bed was extremely comfy, plush bath towels and washcloths. Even though my room faced the interstate, it was surprisingly quite. Now for a few negatives. Hot water , I ran it straight hot for my bath , not that hot! Los stained musty carpet all the way through. Couldn't get my temp control below 74 degrees, Peeling chipped paint and porcelain. No free Continental breakfast for sure. $1.50 for a banana , same for an apple. Other items in the grab and go were equally pricey. Great Conceiere service. Would I stay here again, maybe. But would hope they would get new, fresh smelling carpet. I can

Summary: I picked this hotel because it had a free shuttle to Disneyland. This hotel is beautiful. The outside areas are lovely with sitting areas, fountains, ponds, luscious plants. Lobby area was decorated for Halloween and fall and again lots of areas to sit and relax. The Disneyland booth was really helpful. Restaurant was nice. We only ate the breakfast buffet but lots of items. Staff were friendly and helpful. Shuttle was on time and easy to use. Rooms were very large and decorated beautifully. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Disneyland.

Summary: If you ever plan on staying at this hotel by Disneyland, I strongly recommend you read the reviews. I had planned to drive from Washington down to Disneyland and back for my significant others birthday. I researched hotels for days and I felt this one looked the nicest, had a high star rating on hotels.com and it was very close to the theme park. My one regret with this weekend getaway was not reading the reviews beforehand. The overall stay was terrible, from booking the hotel to staying in the room. 	I had originally booked the night for a double queen room with four adults. In pretty much any hotel, after two adults per room there’s an extra charge. We had our two friends cancel on us a few days before the trip, and we had changed our reservation so it only showed two people

Summary: Staff is very friendly, and we love the taking the shuttle back and forth to Disneyland. Room could have been a little cleaner, there were a few small trash items left in the bathroom, but for the most part the room part was clean. We have and will stay here in the past/future. Awesome view of the fireworks from our room as well- which also had a door to the pool area!

Summary Heading: Great base for Disney or exploring the area
Summary: Spent two nights here before embarking on a tour of the Western US. The area is frankly anonymous except for Disney - to which the hotel runs regular free shuttle buses, but it was ideal for our purposes. Restaurant and bar are fine but the coffee shop is, we thought, overpriced.The hotel and restaurant staff are attentive and pleasant, food is good - especially the buffet breakfast.The hotel is in really attractive grounds and there is a firework display fro Disney every night at 9/9.30 which you can get a great view of from the front car park. Rooms are adequate and overall,  I would say its well worth considering if a little far from LAX.

Summary: Awful customer service. I rarely complain but our experience was so bad I felt compelled to post a review. Look elsewhere if you can. It took a bit of shine off our trip to the happiest place on earth.  I also agree with other reviews - it is a dark hotel with poor signage.   But what really soured us was the poor customer service.    We won't be back.  We came here because it was less expensive than other hotels close to Dineyland. Sometimes you get what you pay for.

Summary: The Majestic Garden Hotel is a great place to stay if you want to be close to Disneyland.  The free shuttle is terrific!  The rooms are nice and big, the grounds are beautiful.  It is a charming hotel, but its age is showing.  It could use some updating.  Over all I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a basic place to stay while going to the parks.

Summary Heading: Dark hotel in need of updates
Summary: This hotel as an overflow hotel for a recent conference. I spoke with several of the others who all had the same feelings. The hotel was dark and old. The rooms are in need of updates and a good cleaning. The shower had mold in the corners, two bugs in my room, smell of mold, etc. I would not recommend the hotel for the price. You can stay at a nicer hotel for the same or even a little less.
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid feedback.  I am very sorry to hear that your stay at the hotel was not up to par.  Please not that this information has been passed on to our concerned staff.  Despite this, we hope to be able to welcome you back on a return visit to Anaheim.

Summary: This is the second time we have stayed here this year.  The rooms are very spacious but the bathrooms are in need of remodeling and are very small.  A double sink is nice when you are travelling in a group. The rooms could still use a little tlc.  The lobby is very inviting and I was pleasantly surprised to see they decorated the hotel for Halloween.  Nice touch.  The shuttle service is extremely convenient. The door from our room  leading to the pool never worked.   Our TV was hit and miss.  On both trips we had problems with the bartender in hotel bar.  First trip I asked for a new glass of wine since my first glass had debris and lipstick in and on the glass.  She was rude and acted like I was crazy for wanting a clean glass. This trip my daughter was treated shabbily by the
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid feedback.  I am very sorry to hear that your stay at the hotel was not up to par.  Please not that this information has been passed on to our concerned staff.  Despite this, we hope to be able to welcome you back on a return visit to Anaheim.

Summary: We stayed here after spending a full day at Disneyland - and we will be back! The hotel has a certain nonchalant luxury about it. The hotel lobby and the common areas are nicely designed and functional. We did not use the pool (goodness, were we pooped!), but it looked like a great place to convene with the kids.  Our room was fantastic. No hyperbole: the linens were some of the best I've ever been on. Once you get on that bed, you want to take it around the block! The bathroom was nice, and there was a beauty vanity, too, so multiples can get ready at the same time. Perfect room. Amazing night's sleep. Incredible service.  This is an outstanding place to stay!
Manager Response: We appreciate your positive feedback about our hotel.  We do take price in catering to our guests’ needs the best way we can.  If you’re traveling to our area again soon, we hope you'll choose us again. Thank you!

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for!
Summary: When booking this hotel I looked at the star ratings online which were very high. I didn't bother to actually read the reviews. Please read the reviews! The star ratings do not coincide with the actual review.   Carpets were stained, mold in the bathroom, leaking faucets, running toilet, non working air conditioner, lots of loud traffic all night long.  Our room was so bad they had to move us to another one for our second night - hence the 2 star rating from me, since they did try and the shuttle was nice.  I would not stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review. We appreciate all feedback. Sorry that your stay wasn't up to par. Your comments will be shared with the rest of the management team for resolution. We hope you'll give us another try on a future trip to Anaheim. Thank you!

Summary: Lodging at Disney was full, so this was the next best option. Transportation to the Disney parks was awesome. They left from the hotel every 30 minutes and brought us back to the hotel in the evening. The beds were great. I loved the pillows. The rooms are very large. The gift shop/café in the hotel had everything you would need. Good for morning coffee. The following sort of negatives were not really bad for us. Pkg coffee in the room w/little coffee pot was really bad. Soaps, shampoo etc provided not great either. Room was worn, headboards and furniture. However very Clean which was more important to us. I would stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: We have been staying at this hotel for a few years.  We take several trips a year to Disneyland.  The beds are so comfortable you don't want to leave and the staff make your stay very enjoyable.  The shuttle bus drivers are great and the shuttles are always on time.  We stayed across the street from the park once and we were very disappointed.  From now on it is always the Anaheim Majestic.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: Family and I wanted to stay close to Disneyland. We booked one room, but when we arrived we decided to get two without a reservation. The hotel was very accommodating with the room for that night but said we would need to come by the next day to get a new room because they were all booked up. The hotel staff worked their magic and got us a another room. all the staff was very nice and respectful.   In all we had three room, each different with small minor details. All the rooms were very clean, plenty of room for a family of 4 in one room if needed. One room was next to the pool which is nice.   The hotel has a shuttle service that will drop you off at Disneyland and pick up. Very convenient!  The bar is nice and has a small but delicious variety of food. The on site restaurant
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: We have stayed here every year for the last 7 or 8 years and I always have the same complaint. The staff at reception are possibly the most unhelpful staff I have witnessed in any hotel I have stayed in. Whenever you ask for help or have a request they are saying no before you have finished asking. I love the hotel and Cynthia behind the bar is a national treasure. Great base for a trip to Anaheim and good size rooms just the attitude and willingness to try and help by the first people who greet you in the hotel would be appreciated
Manager Response: I am very disappointed to hear that you found our service to be below your standards.  We would like to know more.  Please email us with a phone number or email address so our Hotel Manager can discuss your issues personally.

Summary: Stayed for 3 nights in Aug a family of 3 adults and 1 teen. Room was nice & clean, alot larger than we expected it to be.  The complimentary bus service is a God send & for all its not far to walk to disney we were glad of the lift back after a long day at the park!!
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: Only the lobby and restaurant area is renovated. The castle like architecture is just a joke. The rest of the hotel is cover with dirty carpets, stains and does not not smell good. My room was locate in an outside building (room #4xxx) that is even worst.  Morning buffet is good as well as service so this is compensating a bit. TV wake up time is terrible, and it needs 5 seconds to setup each time you switch channel. What a pain. ATTwifi internet sucks.

Summary Heading: Best Fireworks, free shuttle and close enough to walk
Summary: Grounds cared for nicely and the inside lobby and halls have decorations and story walls.  A great feel to the place when you enter.  There are nice garden landscaping, a pool and koi pond.  The bed was comfortable, but the pillows large and lumpy. Our room was a little tired with poor water pressure in sinks and the rug could have been cleaner, but it was very large and would be great for a family with the connecting room added.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: I was looking for a hotel with a free shuttle to Disneyland and saw they had a special package.  It included the room, breakfast (which was an excellent buffet), parking and a Halloween treat bag for the kids.  We didn't need the parking, but even so it was a great deal!  We arrived super late and everything was ready and decorated super cute.  The theme is executed beautifully through-out.  The headboards were like mother of pearl dragon scales.    The staff were nice.  The amenities were outstanding, and the beds were seriously comfortable, which is so welcome after a full day at the parks!  The shuttle was great - although at closing be prepared to wait a few rounds. The room never got really cool, though and we're used to sleeping with it pretty cold, so that's the only
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: We brought our 4 year old twins to Disneyland for their 5th birthday and stayed at the Majestic.  Our friend had the cheapest room you can find online and her room was quite dirty (the bathtub looked gross) which was access in a 2nd building quite far from the lobby.  We got a room with the castle bunk bed and was quite pleased with it!  There is a beautiful inner courtyard with a gazebo, fish pond and little bridge.  Overall - we were quite pleased with our room.  There's a complimentary bus that runs every 30 minutes to the Disney main entrance.  Line up for the bus at least 15 minutes early.  The line up gets quite long - however, the hotel is excellent at ensuring a 2nd bus is available if necessary.  No safes in the rooms.  Comfortable beds.  Average swimming pool and hot
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: Don't book a "traditional" room! The main building looks nice, has new carpet, etc. All "traditional" rooms are in the tower. The tower is awful! The carpet was gross with stains and looked like it was never vacuumed. There were missing ceiling tiles with exposed pipes in the hallway. Our room had stained wall paper and two different shades of wall paper. The carpets were not clean and the walls were stained and banged up. The shower left everything to be desired with a trickle of water and absolutely no water pressure at all. The TV had no volume even with the volume turned all the way up. The toilet clogged twice with average use. We asked for a crib when making the reservation, but there was no crib in the room when we arrived late at night after a long day in Disneyland. I

Summary Heading: Great Hotel -- Close to Disneyland -- Free shuttle
Summary: I have stayed here more than 15 times and every stay has been excellent. No complaints at all. Rooms are very spacious, clean and luxurious. They have an excellent breakfast buffet feast as well. This is definitely the best place to stay and best value.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review of your recent stay. Please share your thoughts with friends and family and come back and stay with us again soon. Thank you!

Summary: The hotel is quite close to enjoy Disneyland. The room, facility, restaurant, and price is perfect for it. Disney fireworks can be seen quite nice from the hotel yard. Would recommend for a family Disney trip.
