We do hope you give us another chance as we will definitely improve services.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel if you don't mind extra charges
Summary: We had a nice stay here at the hotel until we received a bill for $192.00 for pillows we never received. We had two rooms during our stay one with a King size bed and a pull out queen. The other had two queen size beds in it. When we opened the pull out queen we did not have pillows for it so we called housekeeping for four pillows. We were told that the pillows would be brought to the room in just a few minutes. After waiting an hour for the pillows to arrive we decided to just get the pillows from the other room since they were not being used. We did not think anything of it at the time. When we checked out three days later we put the borrowed pillows back in there room of origin and went on our way. We continued on to the next stop for our vacation. I received a text for a

Rooms were nice.  Love the free shuttle bus to Disneyland.  Love that you Can buy disneyland tickets in the hotel lobby !!  Nice pool area.  Nice little arcade area.  There is a small gift shop and a deli.  It was nice to come back from Disneyland and the deli was still open.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: Our tour operator changed us to this hotel as part of Western discovery tour. We had been told it was in the Los Angeles area, it was a 45 minute drive to downtown LA so the hotel is not that close. Anyone looking to visit Disney land the situation is great, but not near to anything else.. The hotel is large, the rooms a good size, the beds comfortable and clean. Food options are limited one restaurant, the food was acceptable but not a great choice. There was a convenience store which sold limited food e.g salads, oatmeal, toast coffee, tea etc. there are a few tables to sit at but these quickly filled up at meal times. The only thing this hotel is suitable for is DisneyLand, the hotel does a reliable, frequent shuttle service. We certainly wouldn't stay again
Manager Response: Thanks for your review and sorry that your tour operator wasn't honest with you about our location. Thank you!

Summary: We were very impressed with the shuttle and the drivers , the staff and the castle rooms. All of the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Enjoyed room service one night and had the morning breakfast buffet each day. It was very good and fresh. I would definitely recommend. Shuttles could be very busy but they Would always send another. My only complaint was it's difficult to change the channels on the remote. Very minor complaint.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: Room was great. Clean and oversized. Pleasantly surprised. We enjoyed the space. We didn't have a chance to check out the pool or gym but they looked pretty good. We would definitely stay here again. Nice place!
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: We were quite happy with things for about the 1st 2 days but after that things went downhill!! We booked a remodeled room after reading reviews about the standard rooms. They were a few more bucks a night but we assumed it would be well worth it!   We arrived Sunday morning about 9:30 assuming there was no way our room would be ready; well we were wrong! The checked us in right away and had us right up to our room!! Pretty impressed so far! The elevators were quite small, barely fitting 5 people let alone any luggage, smelt stuffy and old! Whatever it's just an elevator.   We were on floor 2 in room 2243, right next to the pool, the very very loud and obnoxious pool! Certainly made afternoon or early evening naps during breaks from the park nearly impossible!!! The windows are

Summary: Ok, this place has some good points and then some issues. First the positives. Place is a few blocks from Disney and has a free shuttle to drop off and pick up. It runs every 30 mins and they have more than one. We never waited long. Rooms are large and the staff was very friendly. There is a Disney desk in the lobby to purchase tickets and answer questions. Now the issues. This place is well used and shows the wear and tear. The layout was strange. We stayed on the 3rd floor but elevator only went to 2. We had to go up some stairs after the elevator.....weird. Parking was always an issue and cost $14 a day. You will have a room key and parking card. Why not just use room card for both? Disney =lots of kids so expect noise. People coming in late and those getting up at crack of
Manager Response: Our location is definitely one of the things we are very proud of about hour hotel.  We are so lucky to have a property in the heart of Anaheim and a very strategic location that brings our guest just a few steps away from the must-see attractions and modern-day conveniences.

Summary: I had booked a reservation for Friday morning (at 1am,) assuming it would be Thursday night, until Monday afternoon. I was told by your customer service line that since I was coming in at midnight it would only be 3 nights. Thinking this was strange, I asked again, confirming that coming in at midnight on the 17th, would in fact, count as the next business day. I was consistently reassured as I paid for the reservation. Upon my arrival at 2am today, I was told that I have no reservation until 3pm. I explained the situation and was told that no one told me that, and that I was mistaken. I am NOT mistaken. I then had to fork over an extra 180 dollars for a room I should have already had, and prepaid for, when I had the money. The 180 came out of our honeymoon excursions. Upset, we

Well the hotel is very large, so getting around is a little confusing. Parking is also not the best, especially since you have to pay $14 a night for parking. But they do have a free shuttle to Disney which is very helpful.   As for the hotel rooms, they are very nice. You do hear the fireworks from Disney so be prepared for that. The workout room is standard and if you want to use their pool it is outside so that's a negative.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: Us: just visiting family looking for a place to stay.   Everyone else is here for Disneyland obviously.   The woman above me sounded like she was going into full labor the entire time, and she birthed six fully grown children with steel toed boots. I've lived in apartments before, it has nothing on that.   Not sure what management could do because it was at 5 AM. I hate experiences like this, because I desperately want a refund but the hotel did indeed fulfill their obligation!   Rooms were super clean and nice.
Manager Response: Thank you for your candid feedback.  I am very sorry to hear that your stay at the hotel was not up to par.  Please not that this information has been passed on to our concerned staff.  Additionally, thank you for saying that the hotel wasn't to blame for these instances. Despite this, we hope to be able to welcome you back on a return visit to Anaheim.

Summary: *Disclaimer: This was my experience with the hotel and I do understand that standard rooms usually only fit 4, but when we input 6 people they said that it would work so we booked it*   After reading the reviews on this hotel we thought we would check it out and see if it was worth the overall rating it got.   When you first enter the hotel the over decor is very nice and I did enjoy that. But fair warning to those getting a regular room, they are very small and I would recommend to upgrade.   We're a family of 6 and decided to book a room online with the hotel saying that they could provide for all 6, but when we entered the room there wasn't enough space to move around freely without getting in someone's way.   When we went down to the desk to ask about it the lady said it's
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write such a detailed review.  All your comments are essential to educating our staff about good and bad service.  We will ensure your feedback will be given to all.  We look forward to welcoming you back then.

Summary Heading: Not the best hotel for the money
Summary: We stayed here thinking it would be "castle-like" and because it was close to Disneyland. It was close to Disneyland and offered a shuttle service, which was nice, but it was just another hotel. Nothing Majestic about it.   The pool closed too early for us to use it after Disneyland. We walked all day around the park and then had to walk what seemed like another mile to our room at the far end, 3rd floor, of the hotel.   It was higher priced them some other hotels in the area and I can't justify paying more for this mediocre of an experience.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to provide us with such detailed feedback about your stay.  I am very sorry to hear that several things throughout your stay did not meet your expectations.  Please note that your concerns have been passed on to our management. Summary: We visit Disney often and always book with Priceline and choose 3.5 star or higher quality hotels. This hotel promised rooms of a 3.5 star quality and what we received was dirty carpet that was lifting and had holes, moldy stained pillowcase, and a peeling headboard. Supervisor offered us to move to a new room that had been remodeled at an additional cost per night not even knowing what we already paid with Priceline. We declined because why should we have to pay more for what we should have already received?! The room description and star quality was clear at time of booking and what was delivered was the opposite, the service was also a disappointment as they acted as if they could care less because they already had our money . Do yourself a favor and do not book here you can

We stayed here for five nights and there is no better location for Disneyland. The staff are great, bar and restaurant great. Cynthia in the bar is lovely and very friendly. My only complaint is the hotel is looking a little tired in places, stained carpets and very dark in the room. But that is being fussy, would recommend
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive comments and I am pleased that you had a good stay overall.   However, I apologize for the inconveniences that you experienced during your stay and don’t hesitate to call me to share more information and I will try my best to rectify the situation.

Summary: Arrived from the LAX to fireworks in the sky! We loved it! Good rooms for families. The grounds are wonderful to walk around. We would have liked to stayed another night to swim in the pool. Free shuttle to Disneyland. Next time our plan is, go to Disney am, come back, relax in the pool and rest, then back to Disneyland. We're glad we saw the fireworks when we arrived they cancelled the next nights due to winds.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: For our trip to Disneyland, we stayed at this hotel after seeing good reviews and photos. However, we have pretty mixed feelings on it.  Pros: close to Disneyland, and shuttle to the parks is free and frequent and comfortable. The hotel grounds are pretty and interesting to walk around. The lobby and restaurant are nice and food is good. Beds were comfy.   Cons: if you get a deal on a room, expect a crappy room. It seems they put us in the building that hasn't been updated, or at least not maintained well. Our shower had no pressure, the tub was clogged, stains on the carpet in the halls, stains on the wall and furniture, dirty windows, peeling wallpaper.   Next time we might consider this hotel but only if booking one of the updated rooms. No we did not complain to the staff
Manager Response: We have sent your feedback to the personnel concerned.  I apologize for this bad experience.   This is very disappointing to hear, but we hope you give us another chance to make it up to you.  Please let me know if you want to discuss this personally.

Summary Heading: Loved staying here! Would definitely recommend!
Summary: Honestly didn't expect much when we first got here but it's actually a great place to stay! The beds are big and rooms are spacious and everything is more modern than meets the eye. Staff were super nice and highly  accommodating. The free shuttle buses to and from Disneyland are excellent. We would go in the morning, head out for lunch and take a nap and then resume to Disneyland again at night. Super convenient, super close, super awesome. Had our expectations blown through the roof. Thanks for an awesome stay!
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and hope you'll recommend us to a friend.  We hope to welcome you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: We recently stayed here while visiting Disneyland. We found a great deal online and we were extremely happy with the price. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. They have a shuttle that runs every 30 minutes to the park which is extremely useful although its still close enough we walked a few times. My favorite part was their room service. The room service menu is the same price as in their restaurant which is a nice change. After a long day at Disneyland we loved coming back to the room and ordering very tasty food and being able to eat in the comfort of   our room. We would absolutely stay here again.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and hope you'll recommend us to a friend.  We hope to welcome you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: We had a beautiful room! It is so great that they have FREE shuttle service to Disneyland! On the day we went to Disneyland we arrived back at the hotel in time to get a quick shower then headed outside the hotel entrance to watch the fireworks.... we were told we would have a better view than the park visitors since they launch them from the back side of the park (facing the hotel!) It was GREAT! The hotel restaurant was nice. Ended up having breakfast and dinner there! We also attended and Angels baseball game while we were there and it is very close to the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for giving us a perfect rating and for recommending our hotel to other travelers.  I’m sure our entire hotel staff enjoyed catering to your needs as much as you enjoyed your stay.  Take care!

Summary: I had an issue that the staff solved immediately. I highly recommend staying here because they are friendly to the traveling businessman and family. I want to thank the Majestic Hotel staff, specifically, Vivian and Cindy, for being attentive and accommodating. I will be returning.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: We arrived on Saturday 4th of June around 12 noon.We just thought we would leave our car in and check in later.The girl on check in couldn't have been more helpful and upgraded our room to a really spacious newly renovated room as we were on our anniversary trip.We found the shuttle service to Disneyland fantastic as it dropped us off right at the gate.We found the hotel very clean and the food was great.We really hope to return to the hotel again in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: We stayed here for 3 nights at the start of a bus tour run by ATI. The hotel is such a fab location for Disneyland, and the bus service was great. At 1st I thought that our room in the tower would be a huge trek , as it happened this was not a problem.  The room was spotless and well serviced. The bus drivers were really good fun and made my day. My only niggles were that the bus does not run late enough to really enjoy DTD after hours. Also the rooms were a little tired (faux leather on headboard flaking off and wallpaper a bit scuffed). I was also charged a fee for a free phone call - after I specifically asked if it was free and I was assured it was. In all I would love to stay here again as it suited everything I needed and more.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: The hotel is in a convenient location.  The shuttle runs frequently to and from Disneyland.  The gardens are lovely and the staff is very friendly and helpful.  The story about the "castle" is written on the walls which makes a cute addition to the hotel.  While the rooms are clean and comfortable,  I feel the overall look could use some upgrades.  I would recommend this hotel.

Clean friendly hotel.  Laundry a bonus.  Lobby inviting. Free shuttle to Disneyland. Enjoyed our stay. Easy access to freeway but not noisy. Looks like a castle so popular for the kids. Great pool and hot tub area.
Manager Response: Thank you for this review from your time spent here with us. We appreciate all feedback. Thank you!

Summary Heading: AMAZING hotel, right next to Disneyland.
Summary: The start of my vacation had some very bad luck, I called the hotel in advance of me checking in to tell them I would arrive around midnight due to mishaps. Upon arrival, the hotel staff was very friendly and very helpful. I was upgraded to a suite with no extra charge. The room service was very convinent and very delicious, with a wide variety of options to choose from. Room service was always earlier than expected, as well as the Disney shuttle. Every single day, they were always on time and they would make sure everyone was picked up and taken back after the park closed. Housekeeping did a magnificent job everyday by changing out all the towels and linens while we away. For the price of the stay, it's a hidden gem! (I had always previously stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn).

This was our first time staying at The Majestic Garden Hotel. Once we walked in we were greeted by a very friendly staff member at the front desk. The hotel has a wonderful ambiance about it. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are very large. We have decided to make this our Disneyland Hotel for now on. We are looking forward to returning to the Majestic Garden Hotel and have recommended it all our friends.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: Anaheim Majestic Gardens has many great sights. The food was absolutely delicious and the staff was great. However if you plan on booking at this wonderful place, book it at the newly renovated rooms because the rooms are newly painted and great wallpaper. Also, you get a free shuttle, saving you $18 parking at Disneyland.
Manager Response: I am glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and please recommend us to a friend.  We hope to welcome you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: We chose the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel because my daughter's class was staying here for a school trip.  We usually stay at the Embassy Suites, but for convenience reasons decided to stay here along with the class.    Upon arrival the first thing I noticed, obviously, was the parking lot.  It's huge and in that area parking is hard to come by.  If you don't have a package deal, parking is $14.00 per night but well worth the price.    The lobby is clean and inviting.  There are some fish tanks and seating areas, one of which has a very inviting gas fire place burning.  The check in process was easy and the staff was friendly.  The friendly, helpful staff was not just isolated to the front desk either.  Every single employee I encountered was friendly and smiling.    We ended
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us.  I am very pleased to hear that your staff made your stay pleasant.  Do checkout our Facebook and Twitter pages for promos that you might be interest in.  Looking forward to seeing you again soon.

Summary: The staff were kind, I have nothing negative to say about them. The terrible review is for the property itself. The outside is deceiving, it looks to be well maintained. The inside is gross.  We booked a suite for almost $300 a night.  It was so dirty. Leftover fake rose petals were found in the bed, along with some long black hair.  There were no linens for the pull out couch so we called housekeeping. They had no pillows left.  What?!?! No pillows? So...we just don't get pillows for the night? I am sorry, that is unacceptable, especially when we are paying that much.  If you want a nice hotel room in the close proximity of Disneyland, bite the bullet and book one of the Disneyland hotels. The convenience is worth it.  This could be a nice property if they renovated and cleaned

Summary Heading: A little less than I expected
Summary: Rooms were clean and bathrooms were clean.  Room accommodated my family of 5, 3 small girls, just fine.  We all felt safe and comfortable.  The shuttle back and forth to the park was great.  It was very timely.  The laundry facilities were great.  Great big washer and dryer.  The few negatives were slight.  The TV intermittently worked, which much to the chagrin of my husband was only attempted to be "fixed" by the maintenance fellow mashing the buttons on the remote and offering no real solution except that maybe another one could be found somewhere in the hotel  (but we never saw him again).  The shower temperature was a crapshoot.  Ranging widely during your shower from scalding hot to perfect to freezing cold.  The restaurant was hit or miss.  The breakfast buffet was great

Summary: Charming place. The hotel is enormous and the rooms are huge. Great amenities to make your stay more comfortable including coffee shop/cafe, good restaurant serving large portions of tasty and affordable food, fitness centre, pool and laundry room. The grounds are beautifully maintained.  The hotel is a 15 minute walk from Disney or you can make use of the free shuttle service that runs every 30 mins. Disney fireworks can be viewed from the car park however be aware that from this vantage they are bone shakingly loud.  Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Despite the hotel being busy it was so spacious and well laid out that we were able to enjoy a peaceful stay.  There are a couple of things to be aware of, the hotel isn't really in close proximity to any shops or
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to review our property.  I hope that we will be your top choice when you visit Anaheim.  We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: I've stayed at this hotel for the last six trips I've taken to Disneyland, and I haven't considered changing. The hotel's facade resembles a fairy tale castle and could easily be at home in the center of Disneyland proper. Inside, the lobby has been renovated to have a modern, stylish look.   The rooms at the time of my stay ranged from your usual "bed, TV, and restroom" to a fancier "hardwood desk and chest of drawers" kind of affair. But honestly, I wasn't in my room much. The grounds of this hotel are amazing. There's grassy corridors and trees, A pretty gazebo where people sometimes have weddings. In October, there were Fall decorations out. You won't even believe you're in L.A. Except that you're close by a freeway. Personally, I didn't mind the noise, but I grew up around
Manager Response: I appreciate your positive feedback about our hotel.  We do take price in catering to our guests’ needs the best way we can.  If you’re traveling to our area again soon, don’t hesitate to call us.

Summary Heading: Nice, family friendly , walking distance from Disneyland!
Summary: We really loved our stay and wish we could stay longer! Nice, quiet place just walking distance to Disneyland. All staff is very friendly, our bellman was so friendly and helpful, he gave us a tour on the way to the room, check lights and the fridge for us. Our daughter loved her Royal Bed and didn't want to leave ) We'll come back again !
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary Heading: Would not stay here again for the price we paid.
Summary: Photos are a bit deceiving on the website. Buildings are very run down. Not within walking distance to the park. Charged the entire five day stay three days before we got there!! Breakfast was overpriced for what was available. Found breakfast cheaper in the park. The only bright spot was that the shuttle drivers were very nice and helpful. The rooms were just decent. Really old carpets but the beds were clean. Did not feel good walking barefoot in the room.  Finding your way to your room was a bit of a labyrinth. Housekeeping staff were very nice.

Summary Heading: Great Shuttle and can walk to Disneyland
Summary: We had a girls weekend 3 night stay at the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel. Unfortunately we didn't get into the renovated part of the hotel but it was still good. I slept really well, which isn't always the case when sleeping in a hotel bed. AND it was so quiet, we never heard any doors slamming close or anyone running down the hallways. The free shuttle to Disneyland is a great option; most of the time though we chose to walk and burn some calories. It's about a brisk 15 minute walk. Hotel staff were great. All in all a great stay that I would do again.
Manager Response: I am so glad to hear that we were able to offer you a refuge from your busy schedule.  Looking forward to welcoming you back soon.

Summary: I do love the fact that there is a shuttle to Disneyland quite frequently. The food at the restaurant there is pretty good. They do try to accommodate you as best that they can. Some rooms are upgraded but the majority are not and those rooms do show poorly. Overall, great place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive comments.  I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us!  I hope your next stay is just around the corner.  Call us if there is anything we can help you with.

Summary: We brought the family back up for another trip to Disney and decided on our favorite hotel, again. This time we were celebrating a 40th birthday and I called ahead to find out about some places in the area to make it special (balloons and dining). The new management team responded back with a few suggested places and provided us a new room, which after all these years of staying here, we weren't sure was possible, and it was great. They even had balloons inside the room which was just really an extra they didn't have to do, so I was thankful.  They also greeted our birthday member at the check in desk with very cheery happy birthday wishes. Another appreciated and considerate thing to do, that makes our choice to stay here easy.  I have to admit I was doubtful at first of the
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing to stay with us and I am glad to hear that your stay with us was a memorable one!  We look forward to welcoming you back to the hotel in the near future.

Summary: I had the pleasure to stay at the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel for the Tinkerbell Half Marathon. This hotel was one of a select few being recommended by the Run Disney Organization. Normally I like to stay on property or across Harbor so that I can walk back to my room, but the bus was so convenient and the bus driver so pleasant that I've changed my mind.  First, yes this is an older hotel. But that just means the rooms are bigger than your usual hotel. My room was a little outdated, but it was big and clean and had a great view of the fireworks. I did have one small issue with the toilet continuing to flush, but maintenance was there 10 minutes after I called and fixed the problem. The beds are very comfortable and I slept great (which is always a problem for me when
Manager Response: Thank you for taking time to review our property.  I am glad to hear that we will be your top choice when you visit Anaheim.  We look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: There are many many hotel choices for your stay at Disneyland. I chose the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel because I enjoyed a brief stay last September, and knew I could count on a large quiet room. Quiet is KEY for me. I've read reviews about other hotels that are a bit closer, and noise always seemed to be a problem.  I would have liked to have the Majestic package for my entire stay but it was only available for two of the nights (directly from the hotel website). It included free parking and a really great buffet in the price. I've attached pictures. For the other two nights I booked through a third party website for the best price. I was able to keep the same room for all four nights because the person at the front desk was so helpful.  This stay, we had one of the upgraded

We are so happy that you enjoyed your time here with us and hope that your next visit is just around the corner. BTW, amazing note about your earplugs and sleeping through the fireworks, they are quite loud and kudos to you for being prepared! Thanks.

Summary Heading: Never disappoints!!  Great Stay!  Even better than last time!
Summary: Stayed here several times when it was the Sheraton.  Was very excited to stay in the newly renovated rooms.  We stayed in the king room with bunk beds.  the bunk beds were super cool with castle them.  Kids really enjoyed them.  King bed was the most comfortable we ever slept on.  Have to get the name!  room service was as delicious as usual.  always fresh and tasty.  the store/cafe had a wonderful chocolate cake that was amazing.  Shuttle service to the park was great.  Pick up at park closing was a bit slow.  Will stay here many more times to come!
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive comments. I am so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. I hope your next stay is just around the corner. Thank you!

Summary: I loved this hotel!! The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because it's showing its age a little. The rates were SUBSTANTIALLY less than the Disney hotels. You could not ask for a friendlier staff or cleaner rooms. This hotel is located well within walking distance of the races and expo. There are well lit sidewalks and it truly is less than a mile to the parks. They offer a free shuttle to/from the parks during park hours. There is an on-site Disney rep who is extremely helpful. And best of all they offer a happy hour from 3-6!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for choosing our hotel. I am happy that you enjoyed your stay and I'm looking forward to having you again as our guest in the hotel.

Summary: Stayed for two nights over a weekend in one of the limited two story loft suites. What a pleasant experience overall! I have stayed in at least 5 properties in the Disneyland area in the past 2 years. This is the best value experience of them all.  Exterior:  castle themed, but not cheesy; beautiful gardens, water features, bridges, and gazebos throughout; lots of parking surrounding the hotel (which is HUGE)  Interior, general:  Classy castle theme continued, bistro, restaurant, fish tanks, lots of sitting areas, free computer usage Check-in, amenities, etc: Check in was quick, gift for child, staff friendly; lovely shuttle goes to and from Disney every 20 to 30 minutes (more often if busy); pool is large with some gazebos for free use and hot tub with lots of sitting areas
Manager Response: Many thanks for your feedback and detailed review. We are pleased you enjoyed the hotel and please do share with your friends and family. Thank you!!

Summary: We went there on a mini trip to take our kids to Disneyland. They were very accommodating and the service was great we were suppose to switch rooms the second day because we added an extra day last minute through the hotel. But the hound lady at the front desk made it easy for us an kept us in the same room so we didn't have to switch around with the kids and come back from Disneyland just to switch rooms. Overall the hotel was great and would definitely stay here again!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review from your recent stay here with us. We appreciate your feedback and look forward to you staying with us again soon. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Stay here for the Dream Machine Shuttle!
Summary: Hotel Parking: If you plan on driving, parking is $14 a day. They'll give you a parking pass to hang on your rear view mirror and a parking card to use for in-and-out privileges.   Room Location: So our room was on the 3rd floor, but you have to take the elevator to the 2nd floor and walk up 6 steps to get on the 3rd floor. It may seem weird but that's how their hotel was designed.  2-bed Guest Room: It was pretty spacious, and clean. You can actually push the windows up to let a nice breeze into the room. The bathroom was rather small, but not a deal breaker. Our room overlooked the rose garden, and we enjoyed watching a Wedding take place.  Garden Court Bistro: We had there breakfast buffet. It was decent, not spectacular. Your typical run of the mill: Scrambled eggs, bacon,
Manager Response: Thank you for your very detailed review of your stay with us. I am sure you words will help many others who are deciding on booking our hotel. Many thanks for the feedback!

Summary Heading: I Stayed at Disneyland Hotel where I got rotten service and paid over $2000.00 for 2 days.
Summary: I went to Disney for a perfect trip .vacation-,daughters birthday. I live local so I visit a lot I was so disappointed. The price, the rooms, It wasn't nice at all for the price The Grand Calif is the only property they seem to care about. I was fed up and because of many problems with the room at Disney I decided to cut my trip short and head across the street to Anaheim Majestic .I ve stayed here lots of times.25 years ago I came here and since then it has changed hands a couple times. When I stayed here a couple of years ago It was cheaper but the quality wasn't that good.The Majestic is now awesome. I love it here.This is my secret hide away.They have normal rooms but a lot of time you can get a nicer room if you ask .Alot of the time breakfast is included in the price.They
Manager Response: Thank you for your review from your recent stay here with us. We are glad that you found us and hope you'll share with all your friends and family!

Summary Heading: Great spacious hotel, very close to Disney.
Summary: The beds were so comfortable, the room was huge, restaurant was convenient, and the shuttle to and from Disney made the trip so easy.  I would definitely recommend. Plus the price of the hotel was so reasonable I don't know why people would stay anywhere else.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review of your time with us. We are so pleased you enjoyed the hotel and hope to have you back very soon.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, service and food... close to Disney with shuttle. Kinda Pricey.

Manager Response: Thank you for your review from your recent stay with us and thank you for loving the hotel. Please share with your friends and family.  We appreciate you staying with us and look forward to your next visit! Thank you!

Summary: The rooms and the bed are very comfortable and roomy. My two boys (15 months, and 3 year old) had a blast running around without running into any of the furnitures.  The breakfast buffet was OK, the service for the buffet was subpar.  The bathrooms are small, yes.  The FREE shuttle service was a really nice touch. During peak hours, they run at least 2-3 of their shuttles. And the drivers are very helpful with the strollers, and things.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review from your recent stay with us. I will share your concerns about the shuttle service with the respective managers.  We appreciate you staying with us and look forward to your next visit! Thank you!

Summary: After reading a few mixed reviews about this hotel I wasn't expecting too much, but we had the best time ever! I stayed with my sister for a week in April, and we arrived quite late at night after leaving Las Vegas earlier in the day and driving down. Check in was really quick and easy, and we were really pleased to see that we had been put in one of the new rooms on the ground floor (A section). Our room was big and there was a door that led out to a courtyard garden which was amazing at night - and offered a fantastic view of the Disney fireworks! We ordered room service one day as the menu had a lot of choice -the food was great and it was delivered quickly. There are vending machines pretty much in every corridor which was handy. The staff were amazing, they were extremely
Manager Response: Thank you for your review from your recent stay with us. We appreciate you staying with us and look forward to your next visit! Thank you!

Summary: This by far is one of the nicer hotels near disneyland. The room was spacious and clean. We had a 2 queen castle theme room. I felt like a ninja walking through the halls because it is well padded to reduce foot traffic noise, which is a huge plus. The grounds are also very nice, as was every staff member we encountered.   If you are booking this hotel because of the shuttle service, the warning on the website is very accurate. At the beginning and end of the day, if you are not early in the morning or leaving the park before closing, plan on waiting a while to get on a shuttle, which really sucks after a day of line waiting.  I don't know if disney restricts how many times they can drop off, but the hotel does not seem to adequately plan for the larger crowds in the morning or

We checked into our room and found it to be dirty and a complete disappointment. We found dirty clothes on the floor, tops of furniture was not clean, terrible. We were offered another room but even as we looked for another room that wasn't dirty, we noticed the hotel itself is not maintained. New carpeting and linens are intended to give appearance of updated, but it doesn't work. This place is horrible.

Summary Heading: Good hotel. Shuttle service is terrible
Summary: Terrible shuttle service...might be worth the money staying closer. The hotel was clean and staff friendly enough. Would have been nice if they had a higher sense of urgency when it came to shuttling massive amounts of people. Very small bathrooms.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, we are sorry you were unhappy. I will share your concerns with the management team for review. We appreciate all feedback and hope your'll return to give us another change when your plans bring you back to Anaheim.

Yes some parts of the rooms are dated, like the small bathroom, but we managed with 2 adults and 2 teenage daughters. We really enjoyed returning to our large spacious room with courtyard access, away from the busy strip alongside Disneyland. In saying that during our stay in April 2015 we saw a new hotel being built alongside Disneyland, and decided to try this hotel as well. Manager Response: Thank you for the reveiw of your recent stay here with us. We are pleased that you enjoyed the hotel. Come back soon!

Summary: Based on what I paid, I'd rate this 5 star, but the price will vary with the season (also I had AAA discount).   We were given a free room upgrade, likely due to the hotel not being full. The mattresses were very comfortable and, despite being VERY close to the freeway, the room was quiet due to good double-paned windows. Nice decor and I loved the plum colors.   The staff was excellent and the shuttle service was amazing.   That said, I would have been upset if I had paid for an upgraded room. There were a number of small maintenance issues in the room. Toilet would barely flush, water sprayed out of sink faucet, counter was separating from wall, sink had major cracks, bathroom door was badly peeling.  As I said, your satisfaction may vary depending on what you pay, but for us
Manager Response: Thank you for the reveiw of your recent stay here with us. We are pleased that you enjoyed the hotel. Come back soon!

Dont pay for the buffet breakfast it was awful  - cold and coffee horrible. there are places to buy breakfast just outside disney. Get the shuttle bus there which runs every 30 mins and have breakfast before you go in.
Manager Response: We are sorry that you were not happy, thank you for bringing these issues to our attention. We will work hard to correct the items you mentioned. thank you!

Manager Response: Thank you for the reveiw of your recent stay here with us. We are pleased that you enjoyed the hotel. Come back soon!

Summary: I was very happy with our stay at the hotel. Everyone was very friendly and help full. We used the shuttle back and forth to the parks and it worked out great and they were always on time. I would for sure stay at the Majestic Gardens again

Manager Response: Thank you for the reveiw of your recent stay here with us. We are pleased that you enjoyed the hotel. Come back soon!

Summary: Everyone was wonderful. The room is nice, clean and peaceful. Family friendly, loved the shuttle bus, the Majestic Garden is a wonderful place to stay. There is nothing bad to say about my stay.  Very relaxing.

I called the front desk and they immediately sent a new one over which was beyond my expectations. Our room was on the ground floor and faced Disneyland Drive. There was significant road noise. Manager Response: Thank you for your review from your recent stay here with us. We appreciate your honest feedback.  I will share the concerns you mentioned here with the appropriate managers for reveiw and follow up. Thank you!

Summary Heading: I've found my new Disneyland hotel!
Summary: I stayed here last week with my mom and teenage son. Everything about the hotel was great. The room was clean and neat, and fairly spacious. We arrived in the evening and weren't going to Disney that night so we watched the fireworks from the hotel's parking lot--honestly, if they could pipe the sound in somehow I think that would be the best viewing available! The fireworks were literally right above us. The free hotel shuttle was large and they run it continuously at high-traffic times. We did not use the pool as the weather was a little cool during our visit, and I will say the pool area seemed small. Our beds were VERY comfortable and our room was quiet, and all the hotel staff I interacted with were friendly and helpful. The only thing that irked me a little was the parking
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review from the time you stayed with us. We appreciate the feedback.

Summary: We just got back from our vacation. We stayed at the Majestic Garden Hotel not because we went to Disneyland (that was our first stay in Oct 2015 and it was fantastic) but because of the great service we received the first time. This time we went to other attractions in Southern CA, even though it was an hour away to LA we still wanted to stay here. The price was great, Room are comfortable, it has the shuttle if you want to go to Disney, Their little store inside is GREAT to get water for your day trip, some fruit, snacks coffee, or just a fountain drink… (remember that before you pay $4.00 for water at Disney) the people are great there, and the rooms are just right. I will have to say that we usually stay at the Disney Grand Hotel, but it was sold out in Oct, and believe me I
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review from the time you stayed with us. We appreciate the feedback.

Summary Heading: Beautiful, Quiet, and Convenient For Any Disney Goer!
Summary: My boyfriend and I booked our suite from April 15 through April 17, 2016. His friend at work tipped us off about the convenience of this hotel if we were going on a trip any time soon! He booked us a suite that is really unlike any hotel room we have ever stayed in. It was like a one bedroom loft style apartment! Downstairs was a bathroom and vanity, two big closets, a dining area(THE CHAIRS ARE VERY OLD AND PULLED APART, THEY NEED REPLACING), a living area (W/ A PULL OUT COUCH) and up the stairs was our bedroom with a king size bed (VERY COMFY!!), closet, vanity, and bathroom. We didn't realize that we were going to have that much space and we loved it but I know a family of 5 or 6 would LOVE that room!   The Disneyland Shuttle is amazing for those that want to save on parking
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review of the time you stayed with us. We appreciate the feedback.

Summary: Loved the room, location and staff!! Beds were very comfortable and I slept like sleeping beauty. Distance from Disneyland was perfect and free shuttle to the parks was provided. Ordered room service for breakfast and food was hot and delicious!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review from your recent stay here with us. We are so glad that you slept like a princess while you were here. Please come back and see us again. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Anaheim Magrstic Garden Hotel is a nice place to stay
Summary: We stayed at the Majestic Garden Hotel from April 10-13, 2016.  We booked our Disneyland trip through Costco.  We had a double queen room and it was huge.  The only drawback was the bathroom was pretty small compared to the size of the room, but we made due.  They provided plenty of towels and the beds were very comfy.  We LOVED the free shuttles to Disneyland and used them several times a day.  The hotel itself is pretty nice with a very large lobby.  The grounds are also very nice.  My 7 year old great grandson loved the fish tanks in the lobby and the coy pond outside.  The buffet breakfast was good, $15.00 for adults and $9.00 for kids.  There is also a deli type Resturant and gift shop where we ate a couple of times.  Prices there are not bad.  I bought a huge chefs salad
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review of your time here with us. We are pleased you enjoyed the amenities we had to offer and hope you'll come back and see us again soon. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Nice, spacious rooms.  Convenient for Disney.
Summary: Room was great, very spacious. (we had a new 'castle' room)  Nothing special being 'castle', just newly renovated and well equipped. Disney shuttle be warned.  Perfectly convenient, EXCEPT at busiest times, eg, first thing in the morning from hotel, last thing at night (after fireworks or parade) from Disney park. One night, at Disney park pick up point there was a queue of near to 300 people!! waiting for MINIbuses to come and pick up.  They do their best but hotel SHOULD make more effort laying on more buses at busy times. This night, we were about half way down the queue and waited around 20-25 minutes before boarding a bus.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your feedback from your recent stay with us. I will share your comments with our transportation managers for review and resolution. Thank you!

Summary: The hotel and staff cannot praise them enough, the curtsy and concern for customers. I would highly recommend the hotel if you are planning on visiting Disney World, you get free transport to Disney and Disney Downtown. You can watch fire works most nights weather permitting at about 8.40pm that last for about 20mins. Plus restaurant has a great choice of meals for both breakfast and dinner. Rooms are the best that I have ever been in. No problem getting a taxi. ( just see the staff at the front door and they do their best to get you a good deal. Swimming pool outside very clean and also the Hot tub. My wife and cannot praise this hotel and staff enough
Manager Response: Thank you for your review from your recent stay here with us. We appreciate the positive feedback and will share it with the rest of the hotel staff. Thank you. Come back and stay with us again soon.

Summary: Very clean rooms, beautiful gardens and lovely staff. Food was good in the restaurant, breakfast buffet was a great spread. Fantastic shuttle service to Disneyland, drivers were lovely and always very helpful - picks up and drops off every half hour which is great for long days at Disneyland!! I do hope to come back one day, and I will definitely re-book here!
Manager Response: Many thanks for your review from your recent stay here with us. We appreciate the positive feedback and will share it with the rest of the hotel staff. Thank you.

Summary: This motel is disgusting! The carpets are stained, the furniture is old and raggedy, there are holes in walls in the hallways and in the rooms.   The first room we checked in to had blood and fecal matter wiped all over the bathroom walls.  We were "upgraded" to a better room that at least looked over the courtyard instead of the highway.  The front desk staff was unconcerned with our complaints and actually put another family in the room with the blood and poo on the walls as we were standing there.  There was also a bee infestation and the air conditioning was broken in many of the rooms. This motel is not on the Disney strip and you have to take a shuttle to and from the park.  Unfortunately,  only one shuttle bus works, so you end up waiting in line for 45-60 minutes each

Summary Heading: Good resort with a very poor housekeeping
Summary: The resort is good. The entire staff is very friendly. However our room - for all 3 days - despite repeated notes to Housekeeping, could not get rid of stink. It was the most disappointing part and the main reason for turn down. The housekeeping unfortunately was really below par for any decent acceptable place. Especially when such a place is really looked forward to a family vacation the housekeeping is one area that can really help make people feel comfortable despite being away from home. I hope they improve!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review from your recent stay with us. We are sorry you had some issues with your room while you were with us. We will work hard to correct the issues you mentioned. Thank you!

NOW I CANT TAKE MY DAUGHTER TO DISNEYLAND and i live in sacramento so they RUINED OUR DAMN TRIP>>>> so thanks for the poor service by the front desk and the rude brunette and the lil mexican who said it wasn't going to charge us. SO I GIVE THEM A NOTHING STAR cuz i drove all this way for nothing then since they charged my account even more then it initially was when i first was going to stay and they lied and not what i expected horrible horrible customer service

We stored our luggage with the bellhop and took the shuttle to the Disney. About 11:30am I got a call back from the hotel saying our room was ready so we went back at 1pm to check in and take a nap.   Shuttle runs every half hour from the hotel and every 15 and 45 mins from Disney. Very convenient especially if you have small children who needs to take a nap (including myself! :)  Hotel employees are very friendly and courteous. Room are nice but bathroom and elevator
Manager Response: Thank you for your review from your recent stay with us. We are happy you enjoyed the hotel and the amenities that we offered. We hope to see you back again very soon. Thank you for the feedback!

The room is sad and poorly lighted (will I be able to read my book tonight?), the telephone is old, the bathroom size is almost a joke, and the TV's USB port is blocked. Oh my god, not again... So ridiculous... Please update your protocols, a lot of people will want to use USB and HDMI ports on the TVs if available, how frustrating is to find how it's blocked. The front desk is not helping

The place was a little run down but to be expected when they just bought the property.  I found it very clean and organized.  I would like to see a couple changed.  With most hotels with restaurants attached continental breakfast are not available.  The restaurant is a little pricey so free for kids to eat would be more inciting to eat there then outside the hotel.  Not to fond of people who are staying having to pay to park.  Maybe one vehicle free to park then have a fee for additional vehicles.  Overall our stay was pleasant.

Manager Response: Thank you for your reveiw of your recent stay with us. We appreciate your feedback!! We will additionally work to correct the issues you mentioned, thanks for letting us know.

The concierge was more than helpful and reserved us a private tour to LA, Hollywood and Beverley Hills. The hotel has a nice fairytale theme and a Princess Corinna walked around at breakfasts delighting the little girls. The rooms are on the smaller side but really comfortable, and service was fantastic. The private shuttle to Disneyland is great to have. The games room needs looking at as the majority of arcade games didn't work when you put your money in and one of the two pool tables had all the balls. The cafe reasonably priced and  we ordered a giant pizza which was delivered through an external business  for our dinner. The half hourly shuttle is very handy to disneyland and with free parking and a cheaper hotel rate ( we went off season ) it saved us paying for parking at Disneyland and so made it a reasonable priced night away.

Summary: We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel. Supershuttle took us here directly from LAX, and the shuttle to Disneyland is great. I thought it might be within walking distance but it's pretty far and the roads are all highways, so we took advantage of the shuttle. Our room was spacious, clean and quiet, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the deli is fine for breakfast and buying sandwiches. There's a great view of the fireworks from the parking lot, too! My only small suggestion for improvement would be to get better tasting bagels in the deli! Thank you for an enjoyable and comfortable 3 nights!
Manager Response: Thank you for your reveiw of your recent stay with us. We appreciate your feedback!!

Summary: The shuttle for Disneyland is the best selling point for this hotel.  You don't have to share with any other hotels, it's for this hotel only, super convenient.  We bought park tickets in the hotel lobby and saved ourselves a lot of time (park lines are long).  The hotel is no longer a Sheraton, and we noticed it's not quite as pristine as it was on our last visit.  The room we had last year had been renovated and this years room definitely had not been.  The room was very cold (winter time) because the thermostat was not working, and it didn't work in my sister's room either.  Overall, the beds are comfy, the room is clean, and the staff is very friendly.  I will probably stay here again, mainly because of the ease of getting to the park, and price for level of hotel.

Summary: Nice hotel, it was decked out in Christmas dècor during my visit which may have helped. It's location is perfect for Disneyland. I found it annoying that they have rooms in a separate building in the back. There's a small souvenir store and an arcade room in the lobby which was kinda neat.

Summary: Really enjoyed this room/hotel. Clean rooms, hotel super nice. Lot's of lights in bathrooms so you can see shaving. Shower had great water pressure. WIFI. This used to be a Sheraton, but they re-branded and went independent. I liked the super awesome Koi pond outside that had water filtering reed beds inside. Had some interesting salt and freshwater fish tanks. Nice bar with happy hour. FREE Shuttles that ran every 30 minutes to and from Disney.  They will store your bags for free if you need to check in early or leave late. The front Desk clerk Glenn was very helpful. he knew a lot of info about the parks and had some awesome tips and tidbits that I didn't know about the park that really made our stay extra special. Thanx!
Manager Response: Thank you for the 5 Star review of your recent stay. Come back and see us again soon.

Summary: Found the proximity of this hotel to be ideal for visiting the Disney parks and Downtown Disney.  The free shuttle is so convenient.  The hotel bar is quite enjoyable and relaxing. We did not find the decor cheesy but on the contrary quite nice and the changes very subtle yet classy.  The con for this hotel is that there are no floors/wings for adults only.  The walls of the rooms are somewhat thin. We had requested a quiet room prior to our arrival but I am not sure the hotel is able to

Also our room was huge but the drain in the tub was really slow. My husband was standing in knee deep of water. He was smart enough to remove the plug for the drain. After that it was fine. The lobby area was nice. Overall I would stay here again.

Summary: We have stayed here 4 times before. We stayed Dec 16 to 24th . We are a family of 5 and love the spacious rooms. We used the pool and could see some of the fireworks from the hot tub .The shuttle bus picks you up at the hotel doors and drops you off next to the Entrance, which saves lots of walking . . Would not recommend walking to Disneyland but with the awesome shuttle going every 30 min you dont need to !

Summary: I have stayed at this hotel twice (and I only 25 miles away).  It was great to be able to stay near the Disneyland Resort in a very nice, large, clean and comfortable room. We took the shuttle back at the end of the night and I overheard the driver radio for a second shuttle to come pick up additional guests who were waiting.  They also frequently have very good deals on rooms so it. Is. Very economical too!  They definitely treat their guests like Royalty.

Room Service if you don't want to dine downstairs. No lines, like you find in the Restaurants across the street from the Park. ~ ~ The beds are comfortable. The room is clean.

Summary: Just returned from a lovely week long holiday at the Majestic Garden Hotel. I think i still have soap in my hair. When flushing the toilet the top bowl fell off twice. Our favorite waitress was Griselda; she definitely knew how to make meal times comfortable.  We also ate at their restaurant for lunch was offers a tasty menu with fair prices. Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review of your time here. As we continue our renovation the issues you mentioned regarding carpets will be taken care of. Sorry if this caused issue during yoru stay. We appreciate you taking the time to provide your feedback!

Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and positive review of the hotel. We are happy to have your feedback and thank you for providing it!

Our room had a great view and was extremely spacious and luxurious. The pool is a little cool in temperature but the hot tub soon makes up for that.  I truly can't fault the hotel and would definitely recommend this to anyone.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and positive review of the hotel. We are happy to have your feedback and thank you for providing it!

Summary Heading: A good 'budget' hotel, but too expensive for what it was
Summary: I stayed for three nights in mid-July. I had booked the stay from Australia through STA travel. I was talked out of booking the more expensive Disneyland hotel by my travel agent.   On all my itineraries, it was listed as the Sheraton still, so the airport shuttle dropped me off at the wrong hotel. When this mistake was discovered, my friend and I realised we'd also booked all our outgoing transfers from the wrong hotel.  When I arrived at the right hotel, the Majestic, they also couldn't find my booking. While I had paid for and made the travel arrangements and was the lead passenger, at some point my friend, who was arriving from Canada the day after me, had been changed to the lead passenger (despite the fact I'd paid for the entire stay).   The lady at the front desk was
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review of your time with us. We are sorry about the challenges with your booking agent that put a damper on your time here at the hotel. We are pleased that you had great interactions with our team here and hope that you would choose to stay with us again. Thank you!

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for a week when it was still a Sheraton. The location is very close to DL. However the walk to the main gates is still a good hike. We suggest the hotel shuttle or parking at DL as that walk home in the evening can be too long for little kids. Our room was main floor, pool side. It was a crazy big room with an hilariously small washroom. Desperately in need of updates, everything was worn out and old but kept clean. We were told the hotel was under renovations so maybe these rooms have been updated now. The grounds are lovely, lots of little gardens and ponds. The parking was the only bad thing. Hopefully the new hotel owners fixed it. None of the gates worked with guest hotel cards and you had to come and go through the main gate or take a pay to park
Manager Response: Thank you for you past stay and review of the hotel, we are no longer the Anaheim Sheraton we are the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel with same owners, staff and excellent service. Please come back and see us again. Thank you!

Summary: We Stayed here for 5 days and 4 nights. Sept 3rd-7th  everyone there went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. helped us plan other activities besides Disney. arranging transportation and making phone calls on our behalf. Free shuttle to Disney was so convenient. always on time and ready to go. thank you everyone from management to cleaning crew. We would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: We thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us and the 5 star rating is most appreciated. As the General Manager of the hotel I will assure you that I will share your wonderful comments with our staff and I can honestly say that we look forward to your next visit. We value your patronage.

Summary Heading: Great location for Disney but odd billing practices
Summary: We stayed for 4 nights at the end of July and whilst we couldn't fault the location or the hotel itself we were very disappointed with the front desk customer service as it took us 3 days to find out why the hotel was randomly charging our credit card during our stay without our authority. We finally found out that because we had a meal in the hotel on our first night the hotel automatically blocked the same charge for every night of our stay without actually informing us assuming we would eat every night in the hotel which we didn't. A very odd practice and we had to keep asking a number of staff during our stay why this was happening and only got an explanation after 3 days of asking at the front desk.  I would suggest you inform guests when they check in that although you
Manager Response: First of all we apologize for the accounting glitch that happened on your folio as this was an issue with a few of our guests. It is not a practice that we have in place and the error was fixed in our system as soon as it was discovered. We also thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Stayed here in a double queen room for 5 nights on the recommendation of our travel agent.  Room was huge,  great as we had two elementary school aged kids with us.  Super quiet,  never heard the traffic.  Disneyland has nightly fireworks,  which you an see from the car park in comfort,  not crowded in the Disneyland precinct. Pool was great,  big enough to play in and they serve snacks and drinks poolside. Reception staff were knowledgeable and friendly. Only 2 mile down the freeway from a shopping centre with a Walmart. Warning though, housekeeping came through 8-8.30am, so remember to put out the do not disturb sign!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for a wonderful review and yes Travel agents do not go wrong recommending our hotel and for that we thank all the travel agents in the industry. We appreciate your patronage and hope that you can stay with us again real soon.

Summary: We went to Disneyland for the Dumbo Double Dare races, and booked a hotel on the property. We decided we needed another day in Anaheim before the races, so we booked a night at the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel. We were very pleasantly surprised. The room was HUGE. It was a suite, really. Checking in at our Disneyland hotel the next day was kind of a let down because the room was so small in comparison.   The Majestic is a good hotel. It's obvious it hasn't been renovated for a couple years so it's not the freshest place with the most innovative features (such as available usb ports), but it was absolutely fine. The spacious lobby was warm and inviting, with a fireplace that I wish I had had time to enjoy. There was a Disney ticket desk, and a restaurant that we should also have
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful rating and great comments regarding your stay. Yes, our rooms are large in fact we have the largest guest rooms in the Anaheim resort area. We offer many amenities over our 13 acre grounds and hope that you get the chance to come back and enjoy all of them. Thank you for your patronage.

Summary: Pros: Castle looking hotel, very friendly front desk and doorman, clean and big room, quiet and neat lobby, Disney ticket booth is available inside the hotel, free Disney shuttle, walkable distance to Disney, relatively cheap parking $14/day, free in room wifi Cons: hotel dining is slow in service as they struggle with short staffing, small hit and miss in room service such as forgetting to refill tea bags but overstock on coffee, not much dining options around unless getting back to Disney parks
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and providing your feedback from your time with us. We will share your concerns with the rest of the management staff and thank you for the feedback. Please come back and stay with us again soon. Thank you!

Summary: Myself and my family have been here for two weeks as of tomorrow, and the staff here have been great. After starting our holiday badly, (American Airlines lost our luggage and have the most rude and unhelpful people working for them), the staff at front desk have helped out and truly made our stay as good as it could be. I have to send out a special shout out to David Evans on the front desk, he did everything in his power to help us and has been fantastic! The hotel is beautiful, rooms are very spacious and the beds are really comfortable, pool and gardens are great and well tended. Only thing is there is not much in the way for children. I know Disney is only 5 minutes away, but on those days you just want to chill by the pool it would be great to have a smaller children's
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your 2 week stay with us and we were sorry to hear about your luggage getting lost by the airline. Your 4 star rating is most appreciated and we were happy that we were able to meet your expectations. I have given David your comments regarding his excellent customer service and is most appreciative.  We thank you for your patronage and hope that you can come back soon so that we may serve you once again.

Summary: Great hotel!  Spacious room and great breakfast!  Beds were comfortable.  However, you can easily get lost in this hotel - it has many wings.  You can buy your park tickets very easily in the lobby.  Front desk very helpful.  Only thing - it advertised that it is a short walk to Disney.  It is about 15-20 minutes and you have to cross a highway. Its better to use the complimentary shuttle.  We would stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful comments and the 4 star rating. We are happy that we were able to meet your expectations and we look forward to your next stay.

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel when it belonged to Sheraton and always enjoyed the experience. We stay twice a year and we decided to continue going once it switched over to the Anaheim Majestic owners. This place is great and convenient to the Disney parks. We enjoy the cozy atmosphere and the quiet that is found through out the property. The shuttle is a number one reason to stay, an actual hotel that provides a courtesy to it's guests, without a charge!! We had a few instances with staff over the years but that was quickly resolved by Lee who is an awesome manager, who is quick to correct your experience back to the positive. Can't say enough and we will continue to return to this property, even as they work through updating the entire hotel, never felt an inconvenience. Thank
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review of the hotel. We are happy that you chose to stay with us on several occasions and hope you will continue to do so. We appreciate your positive feedback. Thank you!

Summary: Our family stayed for 3 nights while here for a Disney visit. Check-in was very pleasant with Cedric, who was so friendly and welcoming. Everyone from desk services to maids and deli young woman server were so friendly and kind. The room was very large, clean and nicely furnished. Loved the 2 FREE water bottles each day. The gardens were beautiful, and my grandsons loved the large pool. The Disney shuttle was great! Great rates and service!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and the 5 star rating as we are happy that our hotel and staff was able to meet your expectations. We look forward to your return. Thank you for your patronage.

Summary: we first stayed in this hotel in 1998 & 1999  decided to return mainly due to the location & although we would agree there was an improvement from the old Sheraton days we still had several issues over our 4 day stay,   1) there were no special offers when we stayed (not that we are complaining) but will point out its $15 per night parking.  2) breakfast buffet is $15 per person all you can eat.  3) housekeeping girls are very good but the rooms we were in could do with decorating (& new carpets ours were filthy)  4) staff who deserve a VERY special mention = Cynthia in the bar area David in reception & most importantly Maria in the ticket & information booth.  right, now be careful, we had a major issue with one of the bell boys trying to sell excursions & booking them without
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay. I apologize for any confusion you may have had regarding tour bookings. I will be discussing with our bell captain to see what happened. I also apologize for our restaurant manager as he has never had a complaint so I am a little surprised that there was an issue. We appreciate your patronage and look forward to your next stay.

Summary: I've always wanted to stay at this hotel because it always catches my eye on our way to D'land. On a recent visit they had a Grand Opening type special.  Room/breakfast and parking was $119.  Great deal.  It used to the Sheraton.  The best part about this hotel was the free shuttle to D'land. Not many hotels offer that. The staff was very friendly, the front desk, bell hop and restaurant staff. The hotel could use a little polishing up, but I think they are in the process of doing that.  You can tell it's been there for a few decades.  The room we had was a standard 2 queen room and it was large, except for the bathroom.  A little tight.  Our room package included the breakfast buffet which was very good.  We would stay there again especially if the same deal was offered.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review of your time here with us. We are pleased that you enjoyed the hotel and hope you will come back and visit with us again soon. thank you!!

Summary: We were, overall, pleased with our room.  However, my daughter's family's room had a poorly functioning shower (water running out of the faucet as well as the shower head) and a couple of other bathroom issues.   The worst part: every night the grounds were watered.  If the water is recycled,  , the staff didn't know about it.  It really rankled to think that my Northern CA garden is dry and dying and we are taking other steps to save water while it is being pumped to southern CA to keep their grass and non-native, water dependent plants green.  There wasn't even a note in our room asking us to limit our time in the shower.  The staff were very nice and the shuttle to and from Disneyland every half hour gave us wonderful flexibility.  Maria at the Disneyland Desk was incredibly
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and recent stay with us. We appreciate your comments and will share your concerns with the rest of the management team at the hotel. thank you for providing your feedback.

Summary Heading: Better than the old Sheraton Anaheim
Summary: We stayed here in May when the property was still known as the Sheraton Anaheim. So, we were surprised to find that only a month later, the name had changed to Majestic Garden, and wondered why it no longer was a part of the Sheraton (Starwood) hotels.  There was a good special going on that included breakfast, free parking and free internet at the same price we paid a month or so earlier at the Sheraton Anaheim, so we went ahead and booked.  There was no difference that we could see between the Sheraton Anaheim and the Majestic Garden.  Many of the people we encountered were the same, the service was the same, the rooms were clean (ours was recently renovated) and there are signs that there is a general renovation in progress, although we never thought the hotel was in bad
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review. Our hotel owners made the decision to go independent, the hotel was not dropped by the brand. Being an independent property we have much more flexibility to offer specials, provide a more creative environment and to provide added value in our rates. This is why, like you mentioned the same staff, same owners and likely a higher service standard than before. We are happy you are a fan of our hotel and hope you'll come back and stay with us again. Thank you!

Summary: I was not a fan of this hotel at all!! First off my biggest issue was the air conditioning unit was awful! When we got to the room it was very warm so we turned on the ac unit and turned the fan on high...the highest setting felt like it was on low! And then when we selected to turn down the air it never went down....I believe the unit is for show because the features actually do not work and the lowest temp the air went was 75 degrees which because the fan was so low still felt muggy and warm when I called down I was advised to open the window...really?! Then there were Mosquitos throughout the hotel. There were a couple in our room and a few by the ice machine! The room itself felt dirty cause the walls were stained and gross and the tub looked like it had seen better days.
Manager Response: Thank  you for your recent review and stay with us. We will happily share your comments with the management team here and thank you for providing the details. We are sorry that your experience didn't meet with your expectations. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Our Disneyland home away from home!
Summary: We loved it when it was the Sheraton Anaheim, we still love it now - same hotel, same great amenities, rooms, grounds, koi pond - everything. The toiletries are awesome, too!  They're by Paya and smell like papaya and peaches.  Room service is great.  Seriuosly, people.  I don't know how you can write a bad review about this place.  Yes, the building is older - but so is Disneyland!! Will be back soon. Thanks!
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review. We appreciate your feedback and look forward to your next stay here. Thank you!

Summary: Terrible terrible!!! Floors dirty and pet stained! Air conditioning was blowing on our faces all night! Woke up with flea bites! Just awful! When we checked in the Lobby was very nice so we thought wonderful, staff was friendly too! When we stepped into the hallway oh my gosh it should have been a sign! The carpets were dirty and bubbled up or torn in places! All I can say is yuck!!!! Do not stay here!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review of our hotel. We apologize that the hotel didn't meet your expectations; we will share your comments with the management team here for review. Did you alert the front desk or manager about your claims while you were here? We likely could have resolved some of these issues for you and hopefully improved your experience. We appreciate your comments. Thank you!

Summary: Stayed there again and really like this hotel apart from not being able to find it as it was called the Sheraton Anaheim when I booked and this is what was on my paperwork and wasn't advised of the name change which took place two months ago! This hotel is excellently located for Disney and if has a free courtesy bus to the park every 30 minutes. The bedrooms are a nice size and has lots of amenities. The price of the rooms are good and also food on site in their cafe was reasonably priced. Parking is $14 per night which is good compared to other hotels we stayed at in California. Would definitely use again in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to review your recent stay with us and we appreciate the 5 star rating. We are glad that we were able to meet your expectations and hope you visit us again real soon.

Summary: We stayed for a night. The key system at the hotel wasn't working that day. Had to wait for 30 mins on one occasion just to be escorted to the room !! The reception staff during this was mostly indifferent and uncaring barring one girl who at least admitted it was causing guests a problem. Other reception staff was outright awful.   The hotel itself is not well maintained. You can see that from the floor carpet and the bathtub (at least the room where i stayed).  So I asked while checkout - guys i don't think i should be paying the full price for room as your issue with keys caused way too much trouble for us. But to no avail. They said they cannot do anything as money was paid to Expedia. ROFL.   My advise: find something else.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and recent stay with us. We apologize your stay was not up to your expectations and we apologize for key system being out of order, there was a Anaheim area blackout that caused the system to go off line and as soon as it was able to be brought back to normal the system was but we apologize if this caused you issue during your stay. Thank you!

Summary: We stayed here during a family trip to Disneyland.  Their website was advertising "newly remodeled" and "grand reopening" this could not be further from the truth. The first room we were put in was old filthy and smelled like cigarette smoke.  The drain backed up in the tub so you were standing in ankle deep water which was absolutely disgusting.  There is no ventilation in the bathrooms so they are all fogged up after every shower and the ceiling is covered some kind of yellow sludge, which I'm assuming is mold.
