The 3rd room we were put in after complaining about the first 2 was a "remodeled room" (which we were up charged for!!) it had no screens on the filthy windows, the trim at the base of the wall was falling off, the bathroom door knob was falling off and the icing on
Manager Response: We thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us and we apologize for the hotel not meeting your expectations.  As you have mentioned, we do have a very high rating on all of the social media sites and again we apologize for not meeting your needs.

Summary Heading: Nice Older Hotel close to Disney
Summary: This is a nice hotel close to Disneyland with a great and friendly staff.  The downside is it is older and only part of it has been updated.  We were put in the older section.  When we got to our room the air conditioning was not working and the room was 80+ degrees. We had to wait for the maintenance staff to repair it as best they could.  It took a couple of hours for them to get it running.  It still did not run well and did not cool the room to 72 degrees until our last night there and the only way we were able to accomplish that was to make sure the black out drapes were kept closed.  We had to leave a note reminding the cleaning crew to please leave the drapes closed.  The tub did not drain well so by the time you were done with your shower it was like you were taking a
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review of our hotel. We are pleased that you enjoyed your time here and hope we will see you back again in the near future. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Great hotel with much fun for the kids!
Summary: We had a great time in Anaheim at this hotel. It is a beautiful property and the best part is that you can see the Disney Fireworks right outside. The kids loved it because they had bunk beds that were fashioned into a castle looking facade. Wonderful shuttle to Disneyland and nice staff. Would mos def stay again.
Manager Response: Thank you for providing your review on the hotel. Please do come back and stay with us agian. Many thanks!

Summary: Our family has stayed at numerous 3 star hotels and this one is probably at the bottom of the list.    We booked the reopening special which included free parking and breakfast. Check in was a breeze. We were assigned room 3324 in the A wing which was not updated. The carpet was dirty. The headboard was ripped. The chair was also peeling. The bathroom was really small.  I felt claustrophobic.  The bed was surprisingly comfortable.   The gate card reader never worked so we had to take a ticket to get in every time.  There was no problem getting out.   The breakfast was better than I expected. The surrounding gardens set a nice atmosphere.   I will not stay here again anytime soon.  I'll wait for them to be fully updated.
Manager Response: Thank you for your stay and review of our hotel. We will share with the management team your comments on your stay. thank you!

Summary Heading: Just got back from a 3 night stay
Summary: I booked this hotels Grand Opening special for $119/night (plus taxes).  The special was for 2 guest so I paid an additional $20/night for my 2 children. Overall I felt it was a pleasant stay and value for our quick family getaway.   The positive: Special included:    *free full buffet breakfast (much more then pastries/dry cereal and really enjoyed by the kids)     *free parking $14/day     *free internet (the dh used but would of been additional fee) free shuttle for all guest~at busy times more then 1 bus was used:) Beautiful gardens/water features Decent size pool with lots of lounge chairs Friendly staff at front desk/shuttle drivers Good sized rooms Quick elevator service (stayed in hotels that elevators don't accommodate #of guest using them) Plenty of self parking
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review on your stay with us. We will share the concerns your noted in your review with the management team and hope you will come and see us again. We are still completing the renovation as part of the changeover and many new exciting changes are still to come. Thank you!

Summary: My friend and I decided to take a quick trip to the Happiest Place on earth. We so happened to stumble upon this hotel based on the a good neighbor recommendation. We were very impressed! The hotel staff was very friendly, the hotel was very clean and very family oriented. The rooms were HUGE. We had a king bed room, which included a little living area and large closets. The bathroom was very tiny, however. The hotel breakfast was included with our stay, but it was average. Nothing to write home about. We had tickets for all 3 days of our stay, but only used 1 breakfast ticket, so that should say enough about that.   The hotel has a shuttle service to the park that runs every 30 minutes. If you dont feel like waiting for the shuttle, the walk is about 10-15 minutes, super close!
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review of the hotel. We appreciate you taking the time to provide your comments. We hope to have you back again in the future. Thank you!

Summary: We just got back from 3 nights here under their "Welcome Back just re-opening under new owners" special.  They included the breakfast buffet, which was pretty good, and parking, which would otherwise cost $14/day...a bit steep.  More on that later.  They have 5 buses to shuttle guests to Disneyland.  Two are large buses and 3 are smaller, perhaps 18 - 20 passengers.  They leave the hotel twice per hour and they keep a pretty good schedule.  They will run more frequently when there is a long line outside waiting to go...which is most of the morning.  Now the clincher, why they got such a low rating:  None of their 5 buses have working air conditioning.  You haven't lived until you 've sat in 90+ Degree heat on a bus without air conditioning and its windows do not open!This is a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. We apologize for the unseasonably hot weather that we experienced and yes only one of the shuttles had "working air conditioning" as we were unable to get them into the shop as we are quite busy as you know and we needed all of the shuttles on property. The 5 minute ride to the park is normally very comfortable and we apologize for the warmer than normal ride. We appreciate your business and are sorry that we were unable to meet all of your expectations.

Summary: Great place to stay while visiting Disneyland. We've stayed here numerous times and have always been satisfied. It's a little older, but has been updated beautifully. Rooms are generous in size, and the shuttle is convenient. My only gripe is that they were completely booked my last visit. They will always be my first choice. You get a lot of bang for your buck!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide a review on your stay with us. We are happy that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again soon. Thank you!

Summary: Everyone from check-in, lounge and maintenance has been friendly and helpful. The facility is spacious and we'll appointed. I will add pictures of my room. Am here on business. The property has a gym.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review on your recent stay with us. We are pleased you enjoyed the hotel and what amenities we have to offer. Please do stay with us again, Thank you!

Summary: From the moment we arrived -- they almost fell over themselves to make us feel comfortable. Our room was not ready - the front desk said it might be in an hour. Within 15 minutes, they had upgraded us to another room! --- way spacier! Rooms were clean and tidy --- There were little hairs in our shower --- but, my wife's a super clean freak.  The font desk was way helpful- guiding us about when to catch the very convenient shuttle to the park. The drivers went out of their way to make sure we were well informed about any activities and what to skip or not to skip. The last night we were there we decided to skip the 9:30 fireworks. As directed, we sat in the grassy area of the hotel and could see Disney's display!  If you want to stay in a conveniently located, off site hotel this
Manager Response: Thank you for you recent stay and review of your time with us. We are so pleased that  your experience seemed to exceed your expectations. Please come and see us again. Thank you!

Summary: just an o.k. hotel.  Workout center doesn't open until 5:00am - should be 24 hour access these days. Took two days to get the water jug replaced.   Pool doesn't open until 9:00am - most hotels open at 6:00am.  Great room service.  Polite front desk staff.  Rooms are spacious yet the bathroom is very small.  I couldn't share the space with my 13yo son.
Manager Response: Thank you you for review and recent stay with us. We appreciate your comments and will share them with other management teams here for review. thank you!

Summary Heading: Go for the bus, bed and the buffet breakfast, but be wary of the bathroom
Summary: Our experience with Majestic Gardens started a week before we arrived when we arranged to have a bag shipped to the hotel. The staff were more than accommodating, telling us exactly how to address it so it did not get lost, and the bag was waiting when we checked in. Our room was available earlier than we expected, which made for a relaxing start to our stay. All staff we dealt with were courteous and professional, and always willing to help in any way. Although it was not included in our room price we opted to get the buffet breakfast, which was great value for money. The room (we booked a refurbished room) was large and spacious. The bed was more than comfortable and was just what was needed after long days at Disney.  Unfortunately the bathroom was not up to the same standard
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel and we are pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you!

Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.  We had a two bedroom, two bathroom suite and it was perfect for our family of four.  The extra bathroom was wonderful!  The hotel is huge and very clean.  The food was good, the service wonderful, and most of the staff helpful. There is a desk to purchase Disney tickets, which was great, since we saw the lines  at the park were quite long.  The pool is large and clean, if not a slight bit chilly....but we swam at night, so it's probably perfectly refreshing during the day. You can see the fireworks from the courtyard, and I'm sure you can see them from some of the rooms as well, but we were on the wrong side of the hotel for that.  My only complaint would be two female staff members, whose only job appears to be walking aimlessly around the
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review of our hotel. We are so happy that you enjoyed the hotel and all the amenities here. We will share your concerns about the employee experience with the management and thank you for your comments. Please come back and see us again! Thank you!

Summary: I really loved this hotel. It's not a big hotel. The building is beautiful, clean and looks like a castle. The staffs are polite and friendly. They offer free shuttle to Disneyland parks from 7:30 am to 1:30 am.  The food is great and not expensive. I recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and providing your review on your experience. We are so pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope that will come back and see us again soon. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Stayed 4 days and had a blast
Summary: We ALWAYS stay at a super pricey on-property hotel, usually at the Disneyland Hotel, but the weekend of Martin Luther King Jr holiday, there were no rooms available because of a huge marathon. My husband was at his annual guys trip in Vegas so my 5-year old and I stayed Friday to Monday and loved every minute of it. The only con was the poolside environment which reminds one of what you expect to see at a very old apartment building. But the castle architecture outside and the beautiful princessy newly remodeled rooms we stayed in were great!  We even watched a wedding and could see fireworks clearly from our room. I'm planning an end-of-summer overnight trip to Disneyland currently and if we can get into the same rooms we had in January, we will book here again and save a ton
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive review of your stay with us. Please come back and stay with us very soon. Thank you!

Summary Heading: Hands Down Best Hotel for your Disneyland Vacation!!
Summary: We started our vacation at a different hotel - thought we would try a different hotel (on property) what a mistake..we switched after 3 days for the balance of our vacation (6 days).  The atmosphere, the staff, the service at the Majestic is beyond compare.  This is our 3rd stay at this hotel and will not stay anywhere else again when we go to Disney.  We had a Queen Turret suite which was unbelievable - the space was exactly what we needed for our family of 5.  Excellent clean and comfortable rooms.  I cannot say enough about how great this suite was - so worth the money!!  All the staff were fantastic - no matter what our questions were - and if the shuttle was full...another bus was brought so we didn't have to wait another 30 minutes - which was great with 3 little kids. The
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and positive review of our hotel. We are so pleased that you enjoyed the suite and the amenities offered here at the hotel. Please do share with your friends and family and we hope to see you here again soon. Thank you!

Summary: Get the rate with included breakfast- it's hearty and yummy and will hold you over til afternoon. Watched the fireworks from hotel one night and it was amazing! The room was large and beds comfy. Shuttle is terrific and drivers very courteous. Pool is clean and refreshing, not too cold. We came back to hotel for a dip in the pool around 3 then back to Disney. My only complaint is the small bathroom as only one person can get ready at a time. We will definitely stay here again. BTW I've stayed at Disney hotels in the past and will never waste my money on that again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review of our hotel. We are so pleased that you enjoyed our facility and all the amenities here. Please do come back and stay with us again. thank you.

Summary: Very disappointed in our one night stay while visiting Disneyland for two days.  To begin with, the room had a very musty smell to it.  Bed sheets and carpet had stains on them and ceiling had water stains visible. Wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling off the wall. When you entered our hotel wing the carpet was worn, dirty and pulled along with the hallway light fixtures broken. On top of all this we had to pay a $14 a night fee for parking. The online pictures apparently show a remodeled room which is not the one we were given. Will never stay at this hotel again nor would I recommend it.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. You comments will be shared with the engineering team who is currently in the process of completing the renovations here this summer. We are sorry that you felt that your room was not up to par. Thank you for sharing your comments.

Summary: Great place and fair price. The staff was courteous and helpful. Very clean pool was nice and shuttle was great when going to Disneyland. Would definitely stay again. The only negative thing was the carpet in the one hallway I was on was starting to bow up.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review of our hotel. We are glad that you enjoyed your time here with us and hope you will come back and stay with us again.  Thank you.

Summary: Nice lobby. Larger than average sleeping area in a newly renovated room, but a poorly laid out bathroom. I'm an average size person and I had to have the back of my knees up against the toilet to close the bathroom door. Not sure it would work well for a larger person and certainly not for use by more than one person at a time. The new toilet seat was obviously the incorrect size for the toilet, and the bathroom door was improperly fitted and hard to open and close. Walk to Disney is further than it looks on a map, about 20-25 minutes, however their shuttle runs every half hour. Bottom line...For the price I've stayed at better options in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of our hotel. We appreciate your comments. Unfortunately at the time our building was designed and built the impact was put on the room and less on the bathroom size. We will share your other comments about functionality with our maintenance manager to address. Thank you for your stay with us!

Summary: We had the opportunity to stay at the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel July 20-24, 2015. We wanted to pass on our thanks and appreciation for the wonderful service we received. From the moment we entered the hotel and were greeted by Glen at the front desk, our holiday just got better. The rooms are extremely large and clean. The service was exceptional by Glen, the restaurant staff, the cleaning staff, poolside attendants, and the shuttle drivers particularly William.  The food in the restaurant was delicious, great choices and huge portions.  The shuttles ran on schedule and they ran extra shuttles during peak times. We never waited for a shuttle either at the hotel or at the parks.  The fireworks can be seen almost as well from the hotel grounds including the pool area and the
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review of our hotel. We are so pleased that you enjoyed the hotel and all the amenities we have to offer. Please DO share with your friends and family and we hope to see you here with us again soon.  Thank you!

Summary Heading: Large hotel with confusing layout, close to Disney
Summary: We booked this hotel as we couldn't get another night at the Hyatt Place for a reasonable rate. Hyatt Place is very new and modern, the Majestic is neither of those things. The lobby was quite nice and the check-in staff very friendly, but we had some difficulty finding our room as the hotel has an incredibly confusing layout. I would recommend that they put a few more signs for guests for when they step out of the elevator as well as signs to the elevators from the lobby. The elevators are strangely small, and one of the times we took an elevator that went straight to the laundry room! There were no signs to say that it was staff only, although the metal floor with a dirty towel on it, was probably a clue:) Like I said, the hotel lacks signage.  The room was a little noisy as
Manager Response: Thank you for you recent stay and review of our hotel. We Hear You and one of the features of our renovation will included additional signage to help with guest flow about the property grounds. We are happy share your comments with the management staff to address the room issues you explained. With our location in the resort area (along with most every other hotel here) it is a busy area and city. There are busy highways and roads everywhere so I would agree with your idea of looking for a courtyard view. Thank you for your comments.

Summary Heading: Memorable Location to Create a Memorable Vacation
Summary: If you are looking for a place to have a business meeting or create a fantastic memory for the whole family, the Majestic in Anaheim is well worth the consideration.  The property sits on 12 or 13 acres and designed like a castle with gardens. Very pleasing to the eye.  There is a large pool area, fountains and sitting areas if you just want to relax.  The staff is knowledgeable about the area attractions and are very willing and eager to assist.  The rooms are large (I believe that the brochure I had stated around 500 square feet).  Wi-Fi is free and there is as family game room, gift shop, and laundry service and fitness center.  The hotel is in a great location and you would have easy access to getting to such places as Disneyland Resort, The Disney Adventure Park, Six Flags
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and positive review of our hotel. We are so pleased that you enjoyed to property and all the amenities offered. Please do share with your friends and family and we hope that we can have you back again as a guest in the near future. Thank you!

Summary: I would recommend this place overall: Pros - very close to Disneyland, and it's a huge hotel.  Our room with a King bed and pull out sofa was $199.  Overall it was comparable in price to other hotels in that same area, especially considering I booked at the last minute.  Nicely decorated, and offers shuttles to Disney so you can park your car and forget about it.  Also, a decent breakfast buffet for a reasonable cost, I have certainly paid more for less.  The bar guy was friendly and had a good selection. Cons - The front desk was slow, so check-in took awhile.  The first room I was given did not have the pull out sofa that I had reserved, so I had to go back for a second time to the front desk.  Overall this took almost 30 minutes to get the room I had originally reserved, with
Manager Response: We appreciate your review and thank you for staying with us. We will share your concerns with the other department managers to help with any training issues and thank you for point out the good and where we have some challenges to overcome. Please do stay with us again soon.  Thank you.

Summary: I just called to confirm my room for later this week. I am worried because although they have my reservation they could not confirm that my family would receive a "pet free" room. We have sever allergies and I am worried about what will happen if we are in a room that allows pets. (I understand they can't guarantee that a pet has never been in a room- much like a non smoking room might have had smokers).  I'm disappointed because we made this reservation in February and we were told to call before our visit to remind them about the pet issue. The third lady I spoke with did offer me a castle room which would have been a renovated room for an additional $50/day. That's not what I want although a renovated room would probably be best for allergies. This is my first Trip Advisor
Manager Response: We look forward to your upcoming stay with us and we will do our best to see that you have an enjoyable visit.

Summary: Unfriendly front desk staff, carpet on 3rd floor bubbling up by wear and tear.  If you get the suite don't expect to use the sofa sleeper as an actual bed if you have a larger party since you will be sleeping on springs.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review and stay with us. We are currently undergoing some renovations that include the issues with the carpet you mentioned, so we are working to make things better here for your future stays. I will share you comments with the front office managers about the issues with the front desk. thank you for your visit and we hope you'll check us out again.  Thank you!

Summary: Our check in went smooth. I had called for a shower chair a week before, when we went to the room no chair.  I called front desk to ask for one then went to front desk to make sure that we would get one.  They assured me that one would be placed in room so we left to Disney.  When we got back., no chair. I went back to front desk to complain, that seemed to work as a chair arrived. The chair was dirty and had crud sticking to it. We had to clean the chair ourselves. Other than that problem we have no complaints, room was clean and staff was friendly.  The shuttle service was great, they got you there and let you know what time they would be back
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the the to review your recent stay with us. I apologize for the confusion with the shower chair as we normally are on top of special requests and it looks like we missed this one. We appreciate the kind words and 4 star rating and we hope you return soon.

Summary: In July 2015 I conducted a small business professional conference at this hotel (55 people).  I found the entire staff to be most helpful, polite and caring!  In particular, the Events team was by far the best I have experienced in over 8 years of conducting both mid-size and small events for Century 21 Real Estate LLC.    The room layouts were very functional, the food and beverage selections were outstanding, and the hotel rooms were high quality.   The feedback I've received from our attendees has been very positive.
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for your wonderful review of our hotel and we enjoy having you and your company staying with us. You are still in the hotel and it is unlike our guests to give us a rating before they have left so we thank you for that as well. We hope that you have the opportunity to stay with us again and we look forward to continue serving you.  Thank you for your patronage.

Summary: I have to say this hotel has so much potential, the location is great if you are headed to Disneyland, they offer a free shuttle service that operates every 30 mins to an from Disneyland which is very convenient, a 15 min walk if you don't want to wait. The lobby of hotel is cute. It does have a Disneyland desk so you can purchases tickets right there, when you walk down the hallway you can smell new carpet and can tell this has been remodeled and I must say looks great (see photo attached) this is in building E I would recommend this is the building you stay in, everything looks to be brand new. I was in building P and that building not so much when you first walk in the carpets are disgusting and smells like mold, the carpet in my room was absolutely disgusting and I did not
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us and yes we are in the process of remodeling the property and I apologize for any issues that you encountered.  We do our best to meet all of our guests expectations and we appreciate the feedback that we receive from all of our guests as we know we can always improve in many areas. Again we thank you for your patronage.

Summary Heading: Enjoyed our visit and are staying here again in Sept
Summary: We surprised our niece with a Disneyland trip for her 5th birthday and our vacation package included this hotel.  We were very pleased with it - clean, comfortable beds and very friendly staff.  Now, we are planning a surprise trip to celebrate our daughter's 4th birthday (sept 1-4th).  Although we have stayed at the Grand Californian before in 2013, we decided to stay at the Majestic Garden again for this trip (leaves us more $ in our budget for other things).  It's a great value and our experience was very good.  I'm pleased to see that it's refurbished and hoping we can get one of the remodeled rooms.  I'm also looking forward to checking out the fireworks from the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and review of our hotel. We are very happy that your stay with us exceeded your expectations and that you'll be joining us again in September. We look forward to serving you again then.  Thank you.

Summary: Our family visited this hotel for a 2 nights stay.  We LOVED it.  The grounds were totally delightful, the shuttle to Disneyland was timely, the pool had good bar/pool service, the beds were comfortable, the rooms were nicely appointed and large, the morning brunch was tasty, the front desk was very helpful....in all we were very happy with this hotel!  I would highly recommend it to anyone!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your review and your recent stay. We are so happy that you enjoyed the hotel and all the amenities that we have to offer. Please come back again and stay with us.  Thank you.

Summary: Stayed here as part of Titan travel package and it was a lovely hotel The rooms a nice although we stayed in the un-refurbished part We ate in the restaurant where the service is excellent I ordered my meal and said I needed gluten free and they very helpful especially at breakfast they even do GF waffles and pancakes although the fruit selection not as good as some hotels but ok The only thing that I didn't like was the enter into our building was key carded but the part that had been refurbished was. Travel to the Disney  parks is good although quite busy but they have a quick turnaround
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are so pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay with us. Please share with your friends and family your experience here and we hope to see you again very soon.  Thank you.

Summary: Recently stayed here for 9 nights while on a trip to the World Cup of Softball in Irvine. Although we didn't go to Disney, we like the idea of being close to Downtown Disney for some options for night time activities. The staff was all friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, with a great view of the pool and fireworks at night. The bed was so comfortable-slept fantastic every night. We only had breakfast there one day, not a big fan of buffets, but did have it one day. My daughter got to go food one evening from the dining room and loved it. Would defiantly stay here again. The only thing I would suggest is better signage in the hallways directing you towards pool, lobby, etc.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent stay and your review of our hotel. We are very happy that you enjoyed your stay with us and the amenities that the hotel offered. Please come back and stay with us again soon.  Thank you!

Summary Heading: Best hotel in Disney area, hands down!
Summary: Let me start by saying that this is THE place to watch Disney fireworks.  They have an unobstructed view that will allow you great viewing of the fireworks, right overhead.  And then you don't have to fight the Disney crowds after the show is over (you know - that shuffle step thing you do when you're packed in like sardines and can only move your feet 2 inches at a time).  Beyond that, we LOVE this place.  The rooms are great, roomy, and love the extra sink outside of the bathroom so that multiple people can get ready at the same time.  They are currently undergoing some renovations but this is done without imposing on the guests.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  The breakfast buffet (be sure to get that included in your rate) is really, really good with lots of
Manager Response: Thank you so very much for the great review and kind words. We strive to deliver the best possible customer service and it seems we were successful with you. Please come back and visit us again real soon.

Summary: This hotel was very comfortable.  The shuttle to Disneyland worked fine for us.  The food in the restaurant was good.  The only problem we had was a foul odor coming from the refrigerator.  We reported it in the morning before we left for the park and they took care of it while we were gone.  I would stay here again if visiting Disneyland.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay and i do apologize for the issue that you had with your refrigerator, but am happy that we quickly resolved the problem.  Please come back and visit us again real soon.

Summary Heading: Massive rooms - Fantastic Location for Disneyland
Summary: Very close to Disenyland - Massive rooms, very clean, very large hotel - long corridors and easy to get lost - they run a courtesy bus to Disneyland main entrance every half hour which is a great service and if it's full they put on extra buses.   It is a walkable distance - but save yourself for the walking in the parks  -  when it's very hot too - I wouldn't recommend walking.     Parking was free and and there was a huge parking lot
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the wonderful review and 4 star rating. We all look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: We just got back from our four day trip to Disneyland to celebrate the 60th anniversary. We stayed at the newly renovated Majestic Garden Hotel. The lobby and restaurant were very nice and spacious. The grounds were well taken care of. We arrived around 10 am and were given the option of taking an available room facing the freeway or waiting for a courtyard room later in the day. We chose the courtyard room and the staff stored our luggage so we could get to the parks. We purchased our tickets in the hotel lobby. This was very convenient and then we went out front to catch the shuttle. It picks up every half hour but I recommend getting there at least 10 minutes early so it doesn't fill up. This hotel is HUGE and not everyone in line will get on the first available shuttle. Also
Manager Response: We thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us and we appreciate all the kind words and the 4 star rating. We do however apologize for the situation you encountered with your phone, and we did have our engineering department rectify issue. We look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: This hotel is Majestic! This is the best hotel I've stayed at my  Los Angeles vacation. I agree with someone that said that this is what a hotel should be. It's beautiful, staff is friendly and nice, rooms are comfortable, it has a good restaurant and a convenience store/cafe where you can buy sandwiches, salads, snacks, coffee, etc. The hotel is very close to Disneyland and has free shuttle service. After leaving the Anaheim Howard Johnson because of the noise and bad attitude of employee, I slept very good here, which is what you want after being all day at the parks.
Manager Response: We thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us and are glad that we were able to meet your expectations. We do everything possible to deliver the best possible customer service as that is and and always has been our goal. We love to see satisfied customers smile during their stay and hope that they come back again and again. Thank you for your patronage.

Summary Heading: Great stay, clean warm and friendly
Summary: From the first day my family and I arrived we were amazed of how nice the hotel looks and feels. Everyone there is super friendly. It really makes you feel like you are on a vacation. The front desk associate was really friendly. She even asked where I was from and asked how our trip was going so far. I told her we were from the bay area so she really acknowledge that we were exhausted. The check in was really fast and efficient.  Yes the hotel is pretty big. I got lost lol. It wasn't that the nice lady didn't give me the right directions, it was that I was so excited to be on vacation and of course visiting Disneyland the next day... luckly I found a nice lady that was happy to show us to our room. The room was clean,  I was  happy I was able to pick whether I wanted the 1st
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review and yes we are going through a renovation program of many of our guest rooms and public areas. The ownership has not changed as has our management team and same fine staff. The only change was our name. We appreciate your patronage and look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: We really loved this place! The hotel staff is very friendly, and the hotel itself is really nice! They have a Disneyland booth inside the hotel, so you can purchase your tickets there, and they also have a shuttle that shuttles guests to and from the park. When staying here make sure to try the breakfast buffet! It was amazing! :)
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us and for the 5 star rating. We do everything possible to meet or exceed all of our guests expectations and it looks like we were successful with you. Please come back and visit us again soon.

Summary: My friends & I planned our first Disneyland trip together & we wanted to stay at a place near the resort. I was actually really surprised at how nice the hotel and our room were! Shuttle service to Disneyland, the pool, & coming back to a clean room was perfect. Oh! And we went to the arcade and tatted ourselves up with temporary Disney tattoos. Would definitely stay here again :)
Manager Response: Thank you for the 5 star rating and the wonderful review. We appreciate your patronage and look forward to your next stay.

Summary: Stayed 3 nights everything was wonderful. The buffet breakfast was excellent. The staff was great and knowledgeable. Well worth the trip to stay here. The in-house Disney staff member was very helpful. Well stay again next year.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind words and review of our hotel. I am glad that we meet and hopefully exceeded your expectations and look forward to your return next year. Thank you for your patronage.

Summary Heading: Good hotel close to Disneyland Parks
Summary: Nice Hotel with a great location to Disneyland. Little old and needs a bit of TLC around the pool area. I would come back again but only with my children. Need to get a room away from the hghway for the noise. Shuttle was a great service to get to and from the Disney Parks
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to provide your feedback and experience. We are finalizing some renovations and you'll be happy to know the items that you mentioned should be taken care of by your next visit with us. Please share with your friends and family about our wonderful hotel and we look forward to you visiting again very soon.

Summary: Windows did not close well - we had to line the windows with towels to keep the freeway noise out.  Also, the sheets on the bed were not comfortable, had a plastic feel to them.  The people were friendly and the Disney shuttle was a plus.
Manager Response: Thank you for you review and we appreciate you taking the time to let us know about your stay. We are glad that you enjoyed some of the special options that staying at our property offers. We will communicate your concerns with engineering and housekeeping to help solve those issues. We look forward to you returning again soon. Thank you.

Summary: After being extremely disappointed that all the Disneyland Resort Hotels were sold out during the time we would be there, I didn't think I would be satisfied with anything else. Majestic Gardens is a Disney approved neighbour hotel so that's why we chose it initially, also because it had a free shuttle bus to get to Disneyland! The hotel was beautiful, the rooms were extremely comfortable (although the super cloud like pillows were a little soft for me personally). It is a bit like a warren walking around the corridors so the map of the hotel came in very handy for me. The free wi-fi was actually really good and we had no problems accessing it, which was very unusual as nearly every other hotel we had stayed at had terrible wi-fi. The rooms had two free bottles of water per day
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to provide your feedback and experience. We are so glad that you enjoyed your stay here with us and invite you back the next time your travel plans bring you to the Anaheim area.

Summary: The grounds of this hotel are beautiful and the public areas are very nice.  It also seems like a lot of the rooms have been remodeled, but not the area of the hotel we were in.  It was a little worn.  The shuttle to Disneyland is super nice and very handy.  There was free bottled water in the room daily which we enjoyed.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review and yes we are going through a renovation program to many of our guest rooms and public areas. We appreciate your business and look forward to your next stay.

Summary: We were visiting friends in Southern CA and decided last minute to take our 2 1/2 year old for a day at Disneyland while we were nearby.   We had wanted to stay at one of the Disney resorts originally, but their last minute prices started at $588 for the nite and that just wasn't worth it to us.  I looked at the "friendly neighbor " hotels listed on the Disney site, and none of them seemed to have available rooms. A quick trip over to Hotels.com told a different story and the Majestic Garden had good reviews, a free shuttle to the park and very fairly priced rooms so I booked it for the night.  We got to the hotel early the next morning so we could have a pretty full day at the park, and I was initially just hoping to leave our bags at the front desk, but by 9:30 am, they told
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful review and kind words regarding your stay. Our goal is to meet our guests expectations and it seems we did so with you. Thank you for your patronage.

Summary: Horrible guest service.  Shuttle service is a complete joke.  We were told, "well it is a courtesy shuttle and you are welcome to walk or call a cab."  We missed our magic mourning because we had to wait over an hour for a shuttle.  It's a real far walk with a freeway overpass and second busy street overpass.  Shuttles are every 30 mins if you are lucky but they don't have enough shuttles or seats so you will wait over an hour like us.  Our magic mourning was ruined and the return service at night is always just as bad.  The staff is use to complaints so they are ready to blow you off.  Room service is a one man show.  Literally, one man named Jose.  I never slam anything like this but if you work hard for a nice vacation, you deserve it and should completely stay clear or here.
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing your recent stay and we apologize for the hotel not meeting your expectations. Our complimentary shuttle service operates on the premise that we have historical data that gives us volumes during every hour, however once in a while we get over 200 guests at once and there is no way to gage the volume. The drivers must have a class B license so not just anybody can drive. Again we apologize.

Summary: They have one shuttle running while three sit behind it and at least a 100 people stand in line. This was at 8:30AM right when the parks at Disney were opening why would they have such infrequent shuttle service. It ruined the whole stay for us. It was so incovienet to get back and forth from the park.
Manager Response: Thank you for the review and we apologize if the shuttle service did not meet your expectations. We staff our drivers based upon previous demand and sometimes with over 100 guests in the hotel we are unable to accommodate every guests needs at one time. We run the complimentary shuttle on a continuous basis when we are busy, otherwise we operate every 30 minutes. Again we apologize for any issues you encountered.

Summary: This was a last minute stay with family that was in from out of state......it is in the middle of renovations as it's being taken over by a new hotel chain. I think I would maybe check it out again when it's all done but right now it's really worn down. The carpet is really old and somewhat dirty and mix matched all over the hallways throughout the hotel. It's just really dated and feels run down. The beds were comfortable enough and the linens were nice. The shuttle back and forth to the disney parks are convenient.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and yes we are in the process of renovating many of our guest rooms and public areas. We recently changed our name however we are under the same Ownership, same management team and same fine staff. Only the name has changed. We appreciate your patronage and look forward to your next stay.

Summary Heading: Shuttle service is NOT as advertised.
Summary: Would have given it a 5 except for this awful shuttle service.  Too far to walk but only 1 shuttle running and 3 parked behind this massive line of people. I even asked and they said "just 1 running".  Seriously. 3 shuttles just parked there while 100+ people stand in the sun. Otherwise it's been good. But if they don't fix this shuttle issue we won't ever stay here again. The desk staff werent concerned.  The other drivers were busy helping a tour group get their bags out. Per the desk staff, shuttle service is a courtesy, the tour group was not and we are welcome to walk or call a cab if we don't want to wait.
Manager Response: We apologize for the complimentary shuttle service not meeting your expectations however sometimes with over 1000 guests in the hotel all wanting to go to Disneyland at the same time our shuttles do get backed up. Again we apologize and we do hope that you will visit us again soon.

Summary: Not impressed...stayed at this hotel for 5 nights.  My traveling party had two rooms.  Both rooms were dated.  In one room, despite the front desk being advised, the A/C was not working and was not fixed for our entire stay.  No initiative was taken to fix the problem. The bright spot were the bell men.  They were very helpful.  It was nice to have a shuttle to and from the hotel  The hustled in the evening while a long line waited for a ride home.  The little convenience store was nice to have as well.  Otherwise, I have stayed in Motel 6's with nicer rooms.  We would not stay at this hotel again because there are quite a few nice hotels in the area at most likely cheaper prices.  We paid a premium for our rooms through a travel agent and were provided a dated room.  Now I know
Manager Response: We thank you for your review of your recent stay. We are in the process of renovating many of our rooms and public areas. We apologize if the hotel did not meet all of your expectations. We do appreciate your patronage and hope that you will visit us again.

Summary Heading: First stay since the Sheraton departure - still our choice hotel in Anaheim
Summary: Our first stay since the hotel left Sheraton was the weekend of June 20 for just the night. The last time we stayed was 2 months ago in April (see my previous review).  In those 2 months so much more has been updated!  There are more common areas that have been upgraded, most notably the hallways in the hotel itself. I will include a few photos. All high quality carpets and unexpected fairy tales on the walls!  New art has been added to the walls as well. Also, the room numbers are new. Not as nice as the previous ones but, who cares! It's just a room number.  The hotel staff, again, was impeccable. Superior front desk service.  Excellent service from Jose at the bar (looking forward to seeing Cynthia on our next trip!). In fact the person working in the little shop even
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay and yes we are in a renovation mode and will be doing more of the public areas and guest rooms.  The only thing that changed was our name as we still are under the same ownership, management and have the same fine staff. We look forward to your next stay.

Summary: we had three nights at this hotel and were really pleased with the quality of service and standard of rooms etc.  Check in went very well and quickly, we were in a party of around 40 tourists. The rooms were of above average standard and contained everything we needed for our stay. Really close to Disneyland and tickets were available from a stand in reception, there is a shuttle bus from right outside the hotel which runs every half hour with a return shuttle also every thirty minutes at a quarter past and a quarter to the hour. As some people have stated the hotel is a bit of a maze, but once you've memorised your route you should be ok. The pool area is fine but when we went the kids must have been on school holidays and the dozens and dozens of kids all seemed to be
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review and we enjoy our international guests very much. As you pointed out, we are a family hotel and with 489 rooms you can imagine the number of excited children we have daily just waiting to go to Disneyland. We appreciate your patronage and hope that you get another chance to visit our hotel.

Summary: We just got back from our trip to Disneyland and we stayed in room 1126. First, we were upgraded to a remodeled room AND IT WAS BEAUTIFUL! I took a ton of pictures of just the room. I did notice the baseboard came unglued and fell under the window but I forgot to mention that to them. Easy fix though. Check-in was fast and the front desk associates were warm and friendly. The Disney desk was equally friendly. The cafe was great for a quick bite and had fresh delicious salads, big sandwiches, and donuts..basically what you want for a grab n' go snack/meal. The restaurant was wonderful. The breakfast buffet was delicious, although, expensive and we also had dinner there. Our server was an older gentlemen and was outstanding, attentive, and friendly. He made my daughter feel like a
Manager Response: Thank you for the very kind review and the 5 star rating as all our our employees do their best to deliver great customer service and to see that all of our guests expectations are met. We appreciate your patronage and look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: We stayed at the Majestic Garden Hotel, (formerly the Anaheim Sheraton) this past weekend in room 1106. The Hotel has been updated a bit since our last stay (12/14) there but they still have a ways to go with the updating. When we walked into our room I noticed right away the carpet had a big wrinkle in it and it was coming up on some of the edges. It needs to be replaced. Also I had to unplug the TV several times during our stay because it froze and I could not turn it off or change the channel. Also the channels are messed up. The TV will say its on showtime when its really on a local channel. And the water in the shower backed up a little during a 5 minute shower. It needs some work.  The shuttle at this hotel works great during the day but early in the morning and late at
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to let us know about your recent stay with us. As you could see, we are currently going through a renovation program of many of our guest rooms and public areas. We are also upgrading our TV service to include HD service which I apologize if your TV channels had some issues. Our goal is to meet all of our gusts expectations as we want to deliver the best possible customer service. We appreciate your patronage and look forward to your next stay.

Summary Heading: Home Sweet Home just got better!
Summary: Formerly the Anaheim Sheraton, the Majestic Garden Hotel is now the name of the hotel modeled like a castle. New features already available in some of the remodeled rooms include new wall paper which looks like woods in the mist, newly carpeted areas and some rooms with bunk beds shaped like a castle. Further re-modeling is taking place. We liked magic touches such as the legend of the lair (involving a princess and the good dragon) which is written on the second floor walls and carpet. We liked, as well, the dragon prints on the pool deck (from the good dragon which protects the property and princess). The staff and owners are the same, but they no longer are a Sheraton property. The buses are freshly re-painted and still leave on the hour and half hour for a short and
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful and detailed review as well as the 5 star rating. We appreciate your patronage and look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary: Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel‎, that is. The name and ownership of the Sheraton has changed...and the new name is used by the phone receptionist (which can be somewhat confusing).   That said, the welcome at the front desk was terrific and staff was very helpful in getting us the type room location that we sought. The room itself had first rate amenities, with comfortable seating and a well stocked bathroom area. The beds were very comfortable and the pillows were the best we've had in years.  The hotel is spread out, so if you're using public transportation, or have special needs, you should ask for a room close by to the lobby. We did, and they were very accommodating.  Noteworthy is their lobby, with many sitting areas that are convenient for visiting or just relaxing, as
Manager Response: Thank you for the very kind review and comments regarding the hotel and staff. Please note that the ownership , the management and our great staff have not changed as it was only the name that changed. We appreciate your business and hope you can again return soon.

Summary: Short 15 minute walk to Disneyland. We walked to Disneyland and used our ART bus passes on the way back after walking all day at the parks we needed a ride back. But everything was very convenient the CVS was right at the corner and it fully stocked with just about everything especially if on a budget and want to take snacks into the parks. Even Restaurants were within walking distance on the other side of the streets. The only thing I did not enjoy was the heated pool it was fully of kids age 2-up treating it like a swimming pool. NO relaxation there after a long day of walking.... And the construction that started the day we were leaving thank goodness. Peace from Walatowa NM.
Manager Response: We thank you for the 4 star rating and for your kind comments. I hope that you reported the bed to our front desk so that we can replace the mattress. We are happy that you had an enjoyable time and look forward to your next stay with us.

Summary Heading: Older Property but a nice stay
Summary: I recently stayed at the Sheraton just minutes from Disneyland and though the property is older then some in the area my stay was comfortable. I did however have a problem with the front desk as my plans for a one night stay had changed, during check-in I informed the young lady at the desk and she replied with the dreaded "NO PROBLEM". In the morning when I was leaving for my meeting I checked with the front desk and to my surprise the "NO PROBLEM" was a major problem, Disney was celebrating some event and all area hotels were overbooked and though I understand it was last minute on my part the fact that now I had to go pack my bags which made me late for an important meeting was very disappointing to say the least. My plans take me back to California next week and I cant say
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the Anaheim Majestic Garden Hotel and I apologize for any inconveniences that you encountered. We are in the process of renovating many of our guest rooms and public areas. Thank you for the 4 star rating and we hope that you return real soon.

Summary: I stayed there for 2 nights during my Disneyland trip. For people who have the same purposes like me, this hotel can be a good choice. The hotel is 1 among 10 other hotels that has Disney Desk so you can just buy your ticket here (same price with online) and provides a shuttle bus every half hour to/from Disneyland Park. Didn't have a lot of time to spend there, but they also have a Gym, swimming pool, and good restaurants (also very nice garden view). One thing that annoyed me is you need to pay for wifi access in the room. But they provides computers with internet access near the lobby also with access to a printer. Since I arrived on the same day that they were changed the hotel name, i got some grand opening gifts. :)
Manager Response: We thank you for your wonderful review and you will be happy to know that wi-fi is now free in all the guest rooms. It came with the change of names. Our ownership, management and staff all stayed the same it was only a hotel name change. I was glad that you were here for the grand opening and hope you come back soon.

Summary: If you have good walking legs and don't want to stay on a Disney resort this is a good alternative.  A little more than a mile to Disney parks and downtown you can easily enjoy your trip.  Hotel has a great deal for kids under 12 eat free at the breakfast buffet.
Manager Response: We thank you for staying with us and writing such a wonderful review. We do our best to meet every guests expectations and hope that met all of yours! Please come back soon and visit us again.

Summary: This is not, as advertised, within walking distance of Disneyland. However, they do have a shuttle bus that runs twice every hour. If you stay here, go down for the buffet breakfast, it's a great deal with a wide variety of delicious choices.
Manager Response: Thank you for the very kind review and we are glad that you had an enjoyable time with us. We look forward to your next stay.

Summary Heading: Took us a half hour to find our room!
Summary: The hotel is fine. Average in every way. But whoever designed this place may have been dyslexic or on LSD because the signs for the various wings point in the wrong direction and we walked round and round endlessly trying to find our room. Also, the food selections in the restaurant and for room service were very minimal and did not include gluten-free options.
Manager Response: We thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay and apologize for any inconvenience that you encountered. Being that we are situated on 13 acres, it can be a bit confusing at times to locate certain rooms. However with the many courtyards, pool area and koi pond, we try to offer our guests a most relaxing environment before and after a busy day at Disney. Thank you for your patronage.

Summary Heading: Our favourite hotel with its private and relaxed setting
Summary: This is our 4th stay at the Sheraton Anaheim. (which we found out will becoming an independent hotel and changing it's name to the Majestic Garden Hotel in August 15). They have renovated various sections of this hotel and they continue with further rooms and hallways to be completed. We had one of the renovated rooms with the courtyard access. Our other family had the traditional room category, which was not yet renovated.  I must say the furniture in the non-renovated room was more practical than that in the renovated room. The renovated room had a nice looking cabinet under the TV, however, you needed to open the door to pull out the centre 3 drawers. One section was for the refrigerator, and the other section was only shelving for the Sheraton drinking glasses, ice bucket
Manager Response: Thank you so much for the wonderful review and 5 star rating. We love all of our guests and especially our international friends who seem to enjoy all of the amenities that we offer. I will share your review with our entire staff as I am sure you got to know many of them beyond the ones you mentioned. Thank you for your patronage and please bother Kim once again before your next visit as I am sure she enjoyed working with you to ensure your stay was everything you expected.

Summary: Great place to stay when you visit Disney park, we spend two days in chindrens day and enjoy so mush the restaurante and room. They aldo offer free charter to Disney park, free parking and wifi. Rooms near the street are a bit noisy but ok.  In general everything is good.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind review and the 4 star rating. We do our best to meet all of our guests expectations and it seems we did so with you. Thank you for your patronage and we hope you come back soon.

Summary Heading: Economical Option Compared to Staying at Disneyland Resorts!
Summary: Given the ever-rising hotel expenses we have incurred at the Disneyland Resorts for the past several years, my family and I thought we would try a more economical option by staying at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel, which is about a half-mile walk to the Disneyland Park tram.  The room price was less than half what we have paid to stay at the Disneyland Hotel and Sheraton accepts AAA discounts.  The hotel property is older (at least 40 years old) but very well kept.  Rooms are spacious, although the bathrooms are very small (meaning about 4 feet of walking space from door to tub).  It has at least one large pool and beautiful grounds.  The hotel also has a restaurant and bar available for guests, although we did not patronize them.  The staff was nice, and Front Desk even upgraded
Manager Response: Thank you very much for the kind review and 4 star rating. Yes we are 47 years old and we offer the largest guest rooms in the Anaheim resort area. Our rates are very economical and we have many optional amenities available. We thank you for your patronage and hope you come back soon.

Summary: My best friend and I along with her daughter spent the night here after a long day at Disneyland. This place is really convenient because you can leave your car here and the shuttle takes you right to Disneyland. They run every half hour. They also have a deli/coffee shop inside.      The bed and pillows were so comfortable. I literally sank into the pillows and fell right to sleep. So comfortable. Next time i do a Disney trip, I will for sure book this place.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your kind review and 5 star rating. We are so glad that we were able to meet your expectations and that you had an enjoyable time with us. We do look forward to your next stay.

Summary Heading: Okay property, seems to have a class system
Summary: Stayed for one night as part of a conference. The conference facilities were as expected. The conference food typical. However, what surprised me was the difference in style between buildings. If you are staying in a newer, more expensive room the hallways are cleaner with thicker carpet to reduce noise traffic. The rooms too are more plush and maintained with the incredible sleeper beds. In the 'cheaper' wings the rooms are less maintained, with worn furniture and basic beds, not sweet sleepers, and the hallways are more dingy with just basic carpeting. This was not something I expected to find in a Sheraton. Normally, at least all the common areas have the same care as well as the bedding.
Manager Response: We are in the process of upgrading many of the guest rooms and public areas. All of our rooms do have the sweet sleeper beds, however some have the newer furniture. We appreciate your patronage and hope you come back soon.

Summary Heading: Just a Double, not a Homerun!
Summary: I was out for business for 4 nights and was a bit disappointed as soon as I pulled into the parking lot.  The hotel appeared a bit outdated and that was confirmed as soon as I walked through the front door.  The staff was friendly and helpful and the food in the hotel restaurant was good.  The room was less than special and also old and dated.  The bottom line is that this hotel needs a major makeover and fast!  I suppose if you're on vacation and have your kids with you and plan to be heading to Disneyland, it will suffice.  I'll try a different hotel the next time I'm in town!
Manager Response: We thank you for your review of your recent stay and yes we are currently under a renovation program updating many of our guest rooms and public areas. We appreciate the kind comments regarding our staff and restaurant as we pride ourselves in delivering the best possible customer service to our guests. Thank you for your patronage.

Summary: I travel extensively for business, and spend 12-15 nights a month in hotels. The most basic requirements are that it be safe and clean. This hotel was neither. Very easy break in points, no security. When corridor doors accessible from the street were found unlocked it took repeated calls over a 4 hour period to finally have someone come and lock it. The un-renovated rooms are unclean (stained carpets, doors, walls, tiles in the bathrooms.) the renovated rooms (aka clean) cost more. At the end of this month this hotel will no longer be a Sheraton. I can see why.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. I apologize for the hotel not meeting your expectations as you pointed out we are currently in a renovation program updating many of the guest rooms and public areas. Again we apologize for any issues you encountered.

Summary: Best night sleep ever! Lovely staff, and no hassles. Great service to Disneyland and the buffet breakfast was lovely. The Disneyland desk in the hotel lobby has the most wonderful staff. We had the best time. I also highly recommend you experience Medieval times dinner and show while you are in Anaheim.
Manager Response: You are the kind of guests that every hotel desires as you gave us a 5 star rating and a rave review. We thank you for your kind words and I will share this review with our entire staff. Thank you for your patronage and come visit us again.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with some disappointing features.
Summary: My family of five were really looking forward to this hotel as it is very close to Disneyland and was reasonably priced, but a couple of things really let it down.  The Hotel is quite old but looks lovely and the staff were OK.  Our room was on the third floor and was quite a walk from the foyer. The room itself was clean and spacious. The restaurant and cafe we really good although quite expensive. The complimentary shuttle to and from Disneyland was great, and the drivers were friendly.  Now for the downside.  We had to pay $14 USD plus tax per day to park our rental car there.  I can understand that they need to keep the general public from using their parking facilities but to make hotel guests pay an additional fee is just money grabbing, especially when the parking lot was
Manager Response: Thank you for reviewing your recent stay with us and we appreciate all of the kind comments. We are currently reviewing our wi-fi policy and should have a decision by the end of May. The majority of the Anaheim Resort Hotels do have a parking charge and we are one of the least expensive lots. With our complimentary shuttle service to and from the park it is well worth the parking charge than to park in the public lots and pay for shuttle service. We thank you for your patronage and hope you are able to visit us again soon.

Summary: Stayed here on a three day trip to Disney,booked through Get Away Today love them. Arrived around 11 and a room was ready for us very dated but they are renovating and it was just a place to sleep after a long day at Disney. The staff was wonderful from the front desk,the gift shop and the restaurant! The shuttle drivers are great and never a wait. Would stay again and look forward to staying in a new renovated room.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review and yes we are renovating many of our guest rooms and public areas. We thank you for your business and hope you return soon.

Summary: Rooms were large and the beds very comfortable. The hotel lobby was very nice with a sunken living room and large fireplace. The restaurant served delicious food. They conveniently  provided a computer and printer to print up your boarding pass.The staff was very pleasant. The grounds were beautiful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your very kind review and 4 star rating. I am glad that you enjoyed the hote, the staff and the many services that we provide. please come back soon.

Summary: This hotel was such a pleasant surprise!  I booked this trip (very budget friendly) through booking.com and the pictures they had posted for the hotel DO NOT do it justice.  It was so clean, well maintained and very close to Disneyland and provided a free shuttle to the parks.  It is so picturesque and reminded me of a french chateau.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us and we want you to know that we appreciate your business. Please come back and visit us again soon!

Summary: Room was good size though the bathroom was a little small. There are two sinks but one is outside the bathroom! Sounds strange but works.The bathtub caulking needed replacing and there was a chip on the tub. No free WiFi in the room but available in the lobby. Great pool with loungers.  Front desk staff generally very friendly and helpful. There was no free breakfast. The $15 breakfast buffet had a large selection.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and the 4 star rating. We are in the process of renovating many of the guest rooms and public areas as some areas of the hotel do look a little tired. However we try to make up for that in delivering 200% great custom service. Again thank you and we hope that you come back soon.

Summary: Don't  be fooled by first impressions. The drive up is rather drab, and the parking lot abuts the highway. However, once inside the hotel, it's very nice.  We are frequent Disneyland visitors, and stayed here on this visit because friends chose this hotel.  Pros:  great sundries shop that also had breakfast items like yogurt, bagels, pastries, 'cereals and milk, at decent prices.  Hot tub and pool were just fine although not resort quality  Beds and rooms were very comfy, and we all got a great nights sleep every night.  Refrigerator in room was a nice size.  Hotel was very quiet.  Cons:  price. Let's face it, you are rarely in the hotel when you come to Disneyland.  We have stayed at many places that were walking distance and were much cheaper, with similar amenities, some that
Manager Response: Thank you for the very kind review and the 4 star rating. We appreciate you taking the time to let us know how much you enjoyed your stay. We are currently going through a renovation of many of our guest rooms and public areas which will help the overall appearance of the property. Thank you for your business.

Summary Heading: Great location and shuttle to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here two nights with our teenagers in two adjoining rooms.  Both rooms were large and the beds were very comfortable.  The rooms were so large that the smallest bathrooms were a bit odd.  The flat screen TVs were nice.  The hotel is rather large so if you are staying with a larger party you might have to walk a long way to find other members in your party,  we were together so it wasn't an issue for us but someone else mentioned it as we were in the elevator.  The bedding was excellent.  Our room was quiet and we had asked to be away from the freeway.  They have a nice inner courtyard area and a pool that kids might like but we were at Disney all day so it didn't matter to us.  The morning buffet was $15/per person which is a pretty good price for a buffet but the food
Manager Response: Thank you for the very kind review and 4 star rating as we are very proud of our hotel and staff. You are correct in that the guest rooms are large and happen to be the largest guest rooms in the Anaheim Resort area, however the hotel was built in 1969 when bathroom size was not an issue so ours are smaller than some others. We hope that you can come back soon and we can once again serve you.

Summary Heading: Does not live up to the Sheraton/SPG Name. Needs major renovation.
Summary: I'm writing this as an SPG member, and frequent traveler who's stayed at MANY SPG hotels, including Sheraton.   Unfortunately this one did not live up to what I had established as their "bar". Check-in was very simple, and staff was friendly. We were assigned room 1104. We walked in the room and it appeared to be nice and clean. Upon closer look, the room was SEVERELY dated and worn. The headboards (2 queen) and chairs had peeling vinyl. There was a 3-4 foot lump in the faded carpet that was actually big enough for my 3 year old to trip over. The television was placed right in front of one of the only mirrors in the room (not a big deal, but certainly not ideal). Also, the secondary room light wasn't even plugged in - it just had a power cable dangling down the lamp to behind
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us and I apologize for the hotel not meeting your expectations. As you stated we are renovating the hotel in many areas and we are in the process of upgrades throughout. The renovation process has to be done in phases so it is a program that will take some time to complete. We thank you for your business and hope that you will again visit us in the future.

Summary: The front desk must have given us the oldest dirtiest room in the hotel. My wife and I just don't like to complain, but ouch. The first thing was a smell when we entered the room, not strong but there.Then I noticed about 5 to 10 significant carpet stains scattered about the place.Then my wife pointed out what those two marks on the headboard of our king bed was. at first look she thought it was blood but as I took a closer look it was the yellow vinyl had worn off and left two baseball size wear marks that looked liked brown stains where a persons head would rest against.Those were the few things that stood out. I shouldn't even mention that the toilet didn't flush properly and the bathtub took forever to drain after. The good things were it only took 3 times to obtain a
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and I do apologize for the issues that you mentioned. We are currently under a renovation program that will remedy many of these issues and will give our hotel a new look.  Again i apologize for not meeting your expectations and want you to know we are aware and are correcting the issues.

Summary: This was my family's 2nd stay here. Rooms were nice, bathroom is small but still fine. Did hear our neighbors but they went to sleep quickly. Love the shuttle to and from the park, makes it very nice! Every worker we  came into contact with was very nice. Will stay again!
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to review the hotel and are happy that your expectations were met once again.  Your third stay should be as good if not better and we thank you for your business.

Summary: Stayed here for a Cheer competition in April. Good: beds and pillows are comfortable, room is large. Bad: Extra charge for in room Wifi, No complimentary breakfast, Extra charge for parking, no microwave in room. Worst of all: the hot tub was murky and full of little kids. A big disappointment after a long day at Disney and the convention center. And expect a lot of noise at 930 for the Disney fireworks (not that the hotel can control this). Would not stay here again for this price.
Manager Response: We thank you for your review and apologize for the issues you encountered in the pool area. The Disney fireworks can be noisy however they are a beautiful display of fireworks every evening for all of the Disney guests and our guests as well. Thank you for your business and come back and see us again soon.

Summary: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of a tour of the West. Room was great size (number 4212) though the bathroom was a little small. There are two sinks but one is outside the bathroom! Sounds strange but works. No free wifi in the room but available in the lobby. Great pool with loungers. Despite being in the middle of the buildings, we had some lovely sun until 5.30pm earlier this month. Front desk staff generally very friendly and helpful. The hotel provides a free shuttle bus to downtown Disney carpark which is great. They leave on the hour and half hour and pick up from the downtown Disney carpark at quarter past and quarter to. It is walkable within about 15 minutes but its not the most pleasant stroll! The real jewel at this hotel is the restaurant. The food
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us at the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. We always enjoy the 5 star ratings and we do our best to deliver 100% customer service to all of our guests. I will share this review with the entire staff and 'Nestor" our dining room manager. We look forward to serving you again on your next trip to the USA.

Summary: Never ever disappointed by the Sheraton/Westin hotels.  This one night stay is no different.  We stayed at this hotel because it was the closest Sheraton I can find near DT Disney where we were to meet family for dinner.  Checked in with ease, and received a free upgrade (SPG member).  The room was fantastic, I wish I could of taken pictures before everyone got comfy and cozy.  Love the wallpaper of a winter forest silhouette (best I can do to describe) The suite was large, king size bed, with a beautiful headboard! love seat, coffee table, two chairs of course TV, small fridge, etc.  It was great!  Only thing, I thought the bathroom was rathe small, but since we're a petite family, it didnt matter.  After reading some reviews, I was a little concern about the freeway noise.  So
Manager Response: Thank you for such a great review and I will be sure to share this with the hotel staff. We do our best to meet and or exceed all of our guests expectations and it is apparent that we were successful with you and your family. Please come back and visit us again soon.

Summary: This is a good hotel. Nothing really fancy but really works well. the pool is a little small, the hot tub is a nice touch. the front desk is really nice and accommodating. the hotel is on the olderr side. But is very clean. I would stay there again
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel and I am glad that you had an enjoyable time. Our hotel is older as we were built in 1969 on 13 acres of majestic gardens and court yards. Our staff strives to deliver the best possible customer service, and to meet all guests expectations. Thank you for your business.

Summary: *After spending time at the beach before going to Disney, we had tons of laundry for a family of 4. Washers and dryers at the hotel was broken. I asked the front desk to fix it and they said they will send an engineer right away. I waited in vain for half an hour while my kids including 1 yr old baby were tired and crying back in the room. I called the front desk 2 times and told them to call me back at the room, which they never did. Washers and dryer sucked up all my coins and I was stuck with wet clothes frustrated before the day of Disney. Worst experience ever.  *Firework is loud at night.  *No one to help unload the luggage. Not family friendly.  *Not really walkable to Disney with a stroller. Need to take shuttles.
Manager Response: I apologize for the hotel not meeting your expectations and the issue with the washers and dryers. The Disneyland fireworks are noisy and I apologize for that as well. Our complimentary shuttle buses to and from Disney are for those guests who don't want to take the 15 minute walk and most guests do use the shuttles. Again I am sorry that your stay was less than expected.

Summary Heading: Avoid unless it's an emergency stay
Summary: We needed one night and found this thinking it would be ok for one night. The hallways smelled of mildew and mold. The layout is horrible, good luck finding your room if it's in the back of the building. It looks like it must have been added on over the years very poorly. Now for the bad, this place is surrounded by freeway on ramps and overpasses, the windows and walls are clearly not modern sound proofed. I didn't sleep for 30 min all night due to motorcycles, trucks and cars flooring it over the ramps. Then the room had stained carpets, the surfaces were covered in dust. When I mentioned the noise the guy tried to pretend like no one has ever mentioned it. I almost spit my coffee out wanting to laugh. Not only these issues, check in wasn't till 4 but we had to check out at
Manager Response: We are sorry that the hotel did not meet your expectations as the vast majority of our guests enjoy the 13 acre layout of the property with the many courtyards, lush gardens, koi pond and expansive pool area. We pride ourselves on delivering the best customer service possible so as to try and meet the requests of all of our guests. Our check in time is 3pm and checkout is at noon which follows suit of the majority of the other hotels in the resort area. We thank you for your business.
