A glass of red wine, though mediocre, was welcome and a nice touch.  Our room on the third floor (the top floor of this low rise hotel) was large and reasonably well appointed. Coffee and tea tea making facilities and a fridge were available, toiletries were provided and there were a fair number of plug points.   The room was large, as were the beds - a couple of small doubles for use as singles. Arm chairs a table and a desk were present together with the normal furniture you would expect. It was all serviceable though some of it had seen better days and was an unfashionable dark brown. The carpet seemed clean enough though it too was in
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the Sheraton Anaheim hotel and pointing out all of the amenities that we offer. You will be happy to know that we are currently renovating many of the guest rooms as well as public areas, to give ourselves a new look. I hope that upon your return to the Anaheim area that you visit us, so that we may serve you once again. Thank you for your business.

Summary Heading: Our stay at the Sheraton Anaheim
Summary: We stayed at the Sheraton last week for 5 nights and loved every minute of it.  Our room was large, very clean and wonderful.  The staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating to us.  They went out of their way to help us in any way that they could.  The food in the dining room was the best we had in the area.  I had the flank steak one night and a fantastic chicken dish another.  They also have a wonderful breakfast buffet each morning.  This is a great place to stay and so close to Disneyland with a free shuttle back and forth.
Manager Response: Thank you for the kind words regarding the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. Our goal is to meet or exceed all of our guests expectations and customer service is our top priority. I hope that you have another opportunity to visit us again soon, so that we can once again serve you. Thank you for your business.

Summary: After a long flight to L A The welcome could not be better. Big comfortable well appointed clean bedroom. Nestor and staff in restaurant attentive and really helpful. Would recommend this hotel anytime
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review of the Sheraton Anaheim and recognizing some of our outstanding staff members. Nestor our restaurant manager and his staff do a wonder job of meeting our guests expectations and delivering excellent customer service. Thank you again for your review and your business.

Summary: I stayed here with my family after Christmas.  Hotel was well run and was relaxing after the crowds at Disneyland, definitely will avoid that place around any major holiday in the future, way too many people.  Our room was comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful during our stay.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to review the Sheraton Anaheim hotel and yes Disneyland during Christmas can get quite busy. I appreciate your kind words regarding the hotel and the staff. All of our employees do their best to meet and exceed the guests expectations and we pride ourselves on our high level of customer service. Please come back and visit us soon, so that we may once again serve you.

Summary: Staff so friendly and helpful as was our first time there especially the young girl on front desk Alexis's nothing was a problem to her or any staff . The breakfast was really nice the only thing with the place could do with freshen up of paint . Skirting boards bit dirty , loveley smell as come in hotel pool and surrounding area clean . Felt drains smelt abit in bathroom sink . Would go back definitely near amenities Evan can walk to parks
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review regarding the Sheraton Anaheim hotel and especially your wonderful comments about Alexis at the front desk. I will be sure to pass them along to her. In regards to the Physical aspects of the hotel, you will be glad to know that we have begun our renovation of the property which will include many of the guest rooms, and public areas. We thank you for your business, and look forward to your return.

Summary: Three things happened to me while staying at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel. The reason I stayed at that hotel was to run in the Disneyland Half-Marathon on behalf of my friend who had leukemia. It was supposed to be a great celebratory weekend and because of the Sheraton, it was the worst.   1. Bug bites. I got huge bug bites all over my face. See photos for proof! 2. Cockroaches. We found TWO cockroaches in our bathroom. They were so big and disgusting. 3. My expensive and sentimental ring was stolen during the time period I was out of the room and a hotel employee was getting rid of the cockroaches.   The hotel management was NO help whatsoever. It took the manager 45 minutes to come and assess the situation. Not to mention I had to physically go down to the front desk to ask for
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the hotel during the Disney Marathon. I apologize on behalf of the hotel for not meeting your expectations as we work to deliver great customer service to each of our guests. I was sorry to hear about your contact with insects, but as you know California is in a drought situation which brings out many different insects.  We do have a weekly abatement program throughout the 13 acres of property that the hotel is situated.   I am sorry for the loss of your ring however an investigation was done, and there was no evidence of wrongdoing on the part of the hotel or staff. Again, we apologize for your unhappy stay with us, as we always work hard to meet every guests expectations.

Summary: The customer service is the heart, soul (and "engine") of this property.  The staff is friendly, helpful and truly genuine in their customer service.   From the front door greeters (Pavel was amazing) to checkin to room service, everyone is happy, and enjoying their craft.  They clearly operate as a team, and it shows.  The location is prime - walking distance to Downtown Disney and Disneyland.  Shuttle service every half an hour, and please tip your driver a few dollars for their efforts.  The problem with this resort is the property itself (or the "chassis").  It looks like you stepped back into 1982, and nothing has been updated.  The carpets, the decor, and the couches in your hotel room - torn, worn and scary.  My headboard had two wear spots on it where people had clearly
Manager Response: Let me first of all thank you for taking the time to review the Sheraton Anaheim hotel after your recent stay. As you stated, the hotel is showing it's age in many areas and I am happy to inform you that this month we have begun our renovation program. Many of the guest rooms and public areas are getting a facelift and we are excited to share this information with all of our guests and followers. In regards to our outstanding customer service, we do our best to make sure that every guest enjoys their stay with us, just as much as each employee enjoys doing a great job for the guests and the hotel. Please come back and visit us once again. We thank you for your business.

Summary: I visited Disneyland with my wife and my son this summer. I choosed Sheraton Anaheim by internet and it was my best election. This hotel is very comfortable, the room is very spacious, clean and i was very satisfaced. The personal for the front desk is very friendly. The parking is very accesible by two ways, the Ball drive or by Disneyland drive. The free shuttle to Disney is every half hour or less depending the people in stand by, we never wait for more than fifteen minutes to go to the Park and the driver was an excellent person. Disney Park is few than five minutes to the hotel, fireworks has a better view for the hotel parking. The Sheraton also has a Deli store where you can find beverages, snaks, and last minute gifts. The restaurant is excellent for breakfast or dinner,
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review of the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. We do our best to meet each and every guests expectations and it sounds like we succeeded with you and your family. Please come back soon to visit us once again, as we appreciate and thank you for your business.

Summary Heading: Great place when seeing the attractions
Summary: Been to a few hotels around here and by far this is the best I've been to. Rooms are massive which is good if you have children, we don't but loved the extra space. Service was great ALL the staff were very friendly from check-in to the bar staff and bell boy. There are free shuttle services to Disneyland.  I loved the overall space of the hotel very open and uncluttered. The car park is open with plenty of space which I prefer, rather than having to wait for someone to fetch your car.  If your going to Disneyland I highly recommend this hotel it's stress free and puts you in the right frame of mind to enjoy the attractions.   Ps If you love shopping I defiantly recommend going to Orange outlets which is only about 5 mins from the hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to tell us how much you enjoyed staying at the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. Our staff is proud to deliver the best customer service possible as we want all of our guests to have their expectations met and/or exceeded. I agree with you that our 13 acres of lush gardens, courtyards and koi pond, puts you in a very relaxed frame of mind so that you can enjoy the many attractions our area has to offer. Thank you for your business and please come back to stay with us again soon.

Summary: I've stayed here several times over the years. Rooms are huge and clean. The front desk staff is delightful. Easy access to I-5 and there is a shuttle to Disneyland. Noon checkout is a huge plus these days, as so many hotels now insist on 11am.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review of the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. Our employees strive to deliver excellent customer service, and our guest rooms are some of the largest in the Anaheim resort area. I was happy to hear that you were able to take advantage of our complimentary shuttle service to and from Disneyland, and yes our 12:00 noon checkout is later than most hotels. We look forward to having you back again soon and we thank you for your business.

Summary Heading: 1st half hour parking is free, Street parking is available North of the hotel
Summary: Not a bad hotel.  A bit old and need some upgrade.  I was told that renovation will start soon.  I am a platinum member.  I get free Internet, free breakfast and lounge assess in the evening.  Location is good, close to HWY 5.  I am on business and the job site is 5 miles away.  I need another 10 nights to get my platinum status for next year.  Parking is not free, but reasonable.  1st 1/2 hour is free, so that you can check in, unload and get out without paying.  Street parking is available about 2 blocks north of the hotel.  Just get out of the gate and turn right.  If you are on a budget, you can try that.    The room is clean.  They gym is small but not too many people use it, so it is OK.  Shuttle is free, just like most hotels.  I took the shuttle to go to downtown Disney
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to review the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. Like most hotels in the Anaheim resort area we do have a $14 a day parking fee for our overnight guests, however as you stated you can park outside the hotel for free. Our complimentary shuttle service is unique as most hotels charge a fee. I am glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope come back soon to see our renovation of the hotel. Thank you for your business.

Summary: Excellent hotel for our end-of-summer visit to Disneyland. The room seemed up-to-date if generic, but quite comfortable. Love the frequent, free shuttle to Disneyland. The restaurant had a nice breakfast for a decent price, and the deli/store was convenient. The room was kind of a long walk from the lobby and the parking lot, but not unreasonable. Overall, I'd happily stay there for any Disney visit.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay at the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. I was glad to see that you had the opportunity to dine in our restaurant, utilize the services in our Deli/Gift shop, as well as ride our complimentary shuttle to and from Disneyland. We will be starting our hotel renovation program next month which will give us many new guest rooms, and updated public areas. Thank you very much for your business.

Summary Heading: Our last stop on our road trip
Summary: After a long trip from the Grand Canyon (7 hour drive) we were greeted with very friendly staff and a room that was already ready even though we were early for check in by a couple of hours. Our room was great tea/coffee facilities and a fridge fantastic and quite large and a small view of the gardens. the concierge was very friendly and took care of confirming our shuttle service to the airport we also brought our disney tickets from here. The hotel had internet facilities free down in the lobby a charge for your room. There was a free shuttle bus service to and from Disney parks which was very handy. Although you could get a taxi from out front for approx $8 which was not bad as we went to breakfast on the way to the park. All in all good and friendly would definitely stay
Manager Response: Thank you for your very kind review of the Sheraton Anaheim hotel and I am pleased that your stay with us was pleasant. Our staff works very hard at delivering the best customer service possible and doing their best to meet every guests expectatations. We hope you can come back again soon so that we can serve you once again.

Summary: I've stayed in hotels run by the Starwood Hotels Group before (The Plaza in San Francisco, Sheraton Marina in San Diego) and was very happy with the hotels and the staff.  That's why I booked a two night stay at the Sheraton Anaheim, and being an annual pass holder for Dizzyland, it made sense since it's right next to the park.  I should've forgot about getting the SPG points and just booked at Disney's Grand Californian.  We drove up, got out of the car and opened the trunk.  There were two bell hops standing not even 10 feet away from us just shooting the breeze.  Our presence wasn't even acknowledged.  My companion asked "Is there valet parking?" To get their attention.  We were told no, no valet parking.  We had to ASK for help with the luggage.  That was not the first
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the Sheraton Anaheim. As you stated, the hotel is not one of the newer hotels in Anaheim and sections of the hotel are in need of remodeling. So beginning September 2, 2014 we are undergoing a major renovation program to give ourselves a facelift. We will be renovating many of the rooms on all 3 floors of the main building, which as you know is located on 13 acres of lush gardens, courtyards, and a koi pond. I apologize for the lack of customer service on the part of our bell staff, as we are known for our excellent customer service. It seems that we failed you in this area and again please accept my apology. Our shuttles do have air conditioning, and I will look into why the air was not turned on on your shuttle. Thank you for your business, and i hope that you can come back to visit us again.

Summary: Just finished having a phone call with my 82 year old mom. She went on for minutes reminiscing about her experience at Sheraton Anaheim. It reminded me that I should post a review on TripAdvisor.  Okay, nearly every review talks about how the hotel is in dire need of a remodel. The bathrooms are too small. The décor may be a bit jaded. A nice pool - clean functional guest rooms - a staff that is courteous…busy but courteous. All worth mentioning because all are true. But here are some pleasant unexpected details worth mentioning that I discovered along the way.  It was the last week of July when I stayed at Sheraton Anaheim for 3 nights with five of my family members (my mother previously mentioned). 5 family members. Multi-generational. All have different needs. We all shared
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind review of the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. Our entire staff is dedicated to ensuring that each and every guest recieves the finest customer service possible, and if any guest has an issue our goal is to resolve it immediatley. It was great to hear that your room was located where you requested and that you enjoyed the view of the Disney fireworks. I hope that you and your mother and nephews all come back soon to visit us so that we may once again serve you. Thank you very much for your business.

Summary Heading: Excellent location for disney and complimentary shuttle, but needs updating
Summary: Location good, shuttle to disney excellent  Rooms tired and carpets dirty Pool small and very busy late afternoon. kids galore unsupervised and somersaulting into shallow water, distressing younger kids on each of our 3 days at the pool. If parents not there, hotel should step in but no one. Also pool area not cleaned until the very end of the day, so rubbish everywhere.  Free parking is a bonus Ate breakfast at the hotel each day, waiters not attentive and brusque if you requested anything Concierge very helpful Wifi in reception area
Manager Response: I appreciated you taking the time to revie the Sheraton Anaheim hotel and apologize for any sub standard service issues you may have encountered in our restaurant. We strive to give the best possible customer service to all of our guests, and it sounds as if we faild to meet your expectations. In regards to our pool area we do not have lifeguards as is posted everywhere, and expect that the parents supervise their children. Again I apologize if you encountered children that were unsupervised, and if a call had been made to our front desk, we would have sent security to handle the issue.  For your information, we will be starting our renovation program in September 2014 to give the hotel a facelift. We will be upgrading many guestrooms, and public areas throughout the hotel. Thank you again for your review and thank you for your business.

Summary: My wife has already done a review,so this is extra marks from me.i loved this Hotel i am 64 years old,i like quiet.This Hotel was excellent.Lots of young families but you would not know.Massive room,superb dining area.Would i go back yes indeed.Thank you for a lovely but short three day stay.
Manager Response: I just want to say thank you for the second review for you and your wife. I am glad that your stay was enjoyable and that you enjoyed our dining options. Hopefully you had the opportunity to dine in our garden patio by the fountain. All of the staff at the Sheraton Anaheim do our best to see that every guest recieves the finest customer service and that all of your expectations are met or exceeded. Thank you for your business and please come back soon so that we may serve you once again.

Summary Heading: Convenient and rooms are nice size
Summary: My family of 5 stayed here for 2 nights. The receptionist was friendly and the lobby has nice fish tanks that the kids really enjoyed. The front doors are not self opening so it makes it hard to come in with your luggage cart and are quite heavy. Also the elevators are super small...really only you and the luggage cart can fit and they are hot. No AC in them but the rest of the hotel was comfortable. We stayed on the 3rd floor in the main building with a view of the fireworks from Disneyland. It was great and think it was the best view of the fireworks I have had, and I have visited many times at several different hotels. The room itself was a good size and we all fit comfortably, even room for a queen air mattress. The room had a mini fridge and a small coffee maker. The
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the Sheraton Anaheim hotel and I am glad to hear that that you and your family enjoyed our facilities.  I was disturbed to hear about the droppings as this is the first I have heard this from any guest. I apologize and will have our housekeeping department check all rooms carefully for any other signs of pests. We do have our property visited weekly by a pest control company and i will mention this to them as well.  As you know the hotel is situated on 13 acres of plush gardens, court yards, and koi pond. A beautiful and quiet setting after a busy day in Disneyland. I hope that you get an opprortunity to visit us again soon, and I thank you for your business.

Summary: Visit: Went to Disneyland on a whim and all of the park hotels were booked.  Stayed at Sheraton to get the SPG points. Pros:  Close to park.  Great tram system running every half hour.  Nice to have the ability to go back to the hotel and take a break. Cons: It's old - you're getting the convenience of being close to Disneyland at a fraction of the price of a Disney hotel.  Frankly, the hotel is fine for what it is - a place to sleep while visiting Disneyland.  Without actually being at the park, it's a fairly convenient location, the tram system works well, and all of the staff we interacted with were quite friendly.  The onsite restaurant was good as well (we had room service as well as eating there for breakfast).  The hotel won't break the bank either.  The rooms are fine,
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the Sheraton Anaheim. I am glad you enjoyed our Staff, food, and amenities that we offer. We are an older hotel, I agree with you however we are starting our renovation program in September 2014 to give ourselves a fresh look. You will have to come visit us again in a few months so that we will have another opportunity to serve you.

Summary: My husband and I live in San Diego and have been annual pass holders at Disneyland for 6+ years now. In fact, we got engaged at Disney and stayed that night and another day with this hotel. Since that time, we still come to Disney with friends and family every few months and we did enjoy staying at this hotel. The hotel is nice (loved the fish tanks!), front desk staff is friendly, and the shuttle to Disney is very convenient. We have never had any problems there up until now. Back in May I reserved 2 nights at this hotel because I am running the Disney marathon. I wanted to come for the run and stay an extra day to play :) Last week I found out that I wont be able to get the 2nd day off of work and I called in to cancel my 2nd nights stay. I was told that 2 nights were the
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to review the reservation process that you encountered regarding Sheraton Anaheim hotel.  I apologize for not being able to reduce the 2 night minimum stay to 1 night however on certain dates we must require a 2 night minimum or 1 night would fill quickly and the next night we would be empty. This happens about 2 to 3 times a year when there are specific functions in the city that bring in thousands of people like the Disney marathon. Again I apologize for having to keep the 2 night minimum, and please understand that we do appreciate your loyalty to our brand and hotel.

Summary: Stayed for 3 nights at end of 16 day tour of West USA.  Rooms huge and comfortable although bathroom smaller than most of other hotels we stayed in. One of our party has Coeliac disease and had proved somewhat of a challenge, but this hotel was excellent and basically made whatever we wanted even to the point of having separate oil for the fries. Cannot thank Nestor and his staff enough for a perfect ending to a fantastic holiday. Hotel also has a lovely pool area and runs a free shuttle to Disney.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the Anaheim Sheraton hotel. We appreciate your very kind comments regarding our staff, and pointing out Nestor as being most helpful. We know how important a gluten free diet is when dealing with Coeliac disease and we do our best to accommodate every guest with their special diets. We are glad that your 3 night stay with us was a great way to end your 16 night holiday in the West. Thank you for your business and we hope that you will once again have the opportunity of visiting us again soon.

Summary: Our one night stay was not pre-planned.  It happened to be a very busy night in the area and we were just happy to get a room.  The fellow at the front desk was very helpful. All in all I liked the feel of the lobby and pool area, though we really didn't have much time to spend in either.  I believe they have a shuttle to the park which has some advantages over staying walking distance to the park, so I would consider this location for our next visit. However the room would have to be in a better location. Since we were so late and it was so busy we were placed in what I would assume is their last resort building (farthest from main building). The room itself wasn't so bad, nice furnishings, comfortable beds and high ceilings.  But the carpet was about the worst I've seen, and
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review of the Sheraton Anaheim hotel and pointing out the pro's and con's of your stay. The fact we are located on 13 acres of plush gardens, court yards, and koi pond, our gust room layout is somewhat spread out. I apologize for not having a guestroom closer for you, however you are correct in that it is our high season and the hotel has been quite full this summer. You will be happy to know that we are beginning our renovation program next month and many areas of the hotel will be getting a new face lift. We thank you for your business and look forward to serving you again in the near future.;

Summary Heading: Very good for one or two night theme park visit
Summary: We stayed here for two nights whilst visiting Disney on vacation . Yes the decor is a little jaded, but the rooms are clean and functional ..the rooms are actually pretty huge , very well sized, but the bathrooms are tiny , hence for a family of three in a room, I'd say this spot is good for a night or two, but it's not brilliant for a longer period than that .. The staff are all nice , busy, but nice ..it's a family hotel with a shuttle bus ( free ! ) to Disneyland , so it's going to be full of families and kids ..expect that , treat it as a clean , close to theme parks room to sleep in , and you'll be very happy you stayed ..it's NOT a resort, it's a nice clean hotel , a cut above all the little Best Westerns and motels around the Anaheim area .. Yet it's priced like a motel !
Manager Response: What a wonderful review you wrote on your recent stay at the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. Thank you for your kind comments, and yes our rooms are large for families and we do cater to all familes large and small. Our complimentary shuttle service to and from Disneyland coupled with our 13 acres of plush gardens, courtyards, and koi pond make us a most relaxing hotel and family gathering place. Starting in September, we will be starting our hotel renovation program giving ourself a new look in many areas of the hotel including a large number of guestrooms, and some public areas. We thank you for your business and hope that you will come back soon to visit us, so that we may serve you once again.

Summary: Easy access to the hotel, great location and staff.  Shuttle buses to Disney every 30 minutes, you catch even the early morning sessions as the hotel accommodates it.  You can also see the night fireworks directly from the hotel front door
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful review of the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. We pride ourselves on our customer service and do our best to give every guest the best customer service experience. We are excited to announce that starting next month we will begin our hotel renovation program updating our look in many areas. We thank you for your business and look forward to serving you again in the near future.

Summary: We had booked at knotts berry farm hotel,but on arrival, after a 10 hour flight and a delay at Alamo car rental we were told they were over booked and we were relocated to the Sheraton. Must say we definitely got the better deal,we had stayed here two years ago and had no complaints so were glad to be going back. When we arrived to we were upgraded to preferred guest status with upgraded room and club lounge passes, when we return we will definitely book this option as the complimentary breakfasts pre dinner snacks and free soft drinks, in a relaxing lounge with tthe most wonderful staff made our stay complete. The bedrooms large and comfortable, pool area clean and welcoming, restaurant offers a varied menu at a reasonable cost and the gardens offer a peaceful break from the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay at the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. We are pleased to see that your stay was pleasant, and that you enjoyed all facets of the property and staff. We do our best to see that every guest experience with us is a most positive experience, and that we develop repeat guests. We will be starting our hotel renovation program in approximately 3 weeks time and we will be getting a face lift in many areas of the hotel. We thank you for your business and look forward to serving you again.

Summary Heading: Good Value; Great for family but a little dated
Summary: We have annual pass to Disneyland and have stayed at numerous places around there.  This was one of the best values.    Service was good.  Room is spacious and clean but a little outdated.  Bed was comfortable.   They do charge for parking - most of them do, but shuttle to Disneyland included (some hotels charge).  Breakfast in the hotel was reasonably priced and had lots of options.    Had nice pool and one could see fireworks from hotel.  In the 80's this place would be top notch, they just need to remodel and update the interior.  Exterior like Swiss Castle is timeless. Children loved it.  Great price compared to other hotels in the area.  Perfect for families.
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest and candid review of the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. This is one of the best descriptions and reviews I have seen. I agree with you that we are one of the best values in the Anaheim Resort area, and we have some of the largest rooms available. Are we a little outdated, yes we are, however begining September 2, 2014 we are starting our hotel renovation program updating many guestrooms and public areas. As you stated, our service is good as is our food in the Bistro. Yes we do charge for guest parking, but as you said Most of the other hotels do as well. Our Castle theme situated on 13 acres of lush gardens, court yards, and koi pond, is a hit with children and adults alike. Thank you again for your wonderful comments, and I hope you come back soon so that we may serve you and your family again.

Summary: What else would you expect located near the happiest place on earth, Disneyland.  Shuttle every 30 minutes to Disneyland.  Spacious rooms & comfortable beds for families sharing space.  Surprisingly quiet so close to the freeway but slept great.  they have a delicious breakfast buffet which can give you enough energy & calories for the entire day chasing Mickey Mouse.  We visited but didn't indulge in the pool but was nicely maintained.  The best part of our visit was the humorous clerk at the front desk.  He kept us laughing while keeping on message about the hotel & information needed.  Price was more than fair comparable to the Big Mouse House hotels. For our family with young grandkids it was the right choice.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the Sheraton Anaheim hotel and we are glad that you enjoyed your stay with us. Your kind comments regarding our hotel and staff were most appreciated and hope that you will have the opportunity to come visit us soon so that we may serve you once again in the Sheraton Anaheim style.

Summary: A nice hotel! A bit dated, I'm sure in its day it was absolutely grand. The shuttle bus to/from Disney was nice and handy! The walls are a bit thin, so heard noise in the hallways and the room next door, as we had an adjoining room.  Ate dinner in the Bistro one night, it was quite nice.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. We all appreciate the kind comments that you made regarding our property and Bistro dining room. You will be happy to note that this September we are beginning our renovation program to many guest rooms and some public areas which will give us a new face lift. We look forward to your return so that we may once again serve you.

Summary: The hotel location is good to access Disneyland. The room is out of fashion and there is only restaurant in the hotel with limited offer.  Moreover, as a room guest, you still have to pay parking fee.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. We have the one main dining room with inside and outside patio dining. We also have our California Deli which serves breakfast lunch and dinner from 6am to midnight. Offering salads, sandwiches, hot dogs, desserts, cheese and vegetable trays as well as all types of beverages. We will be undergoing our guest room renovation program next month along with some of the public areas. This will give us a fresh new look! Thank you for your business and we look forward to your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Still like this hotel but Sheraton should take notice of comments
Summary: I believe I made my 9th visit to the Sheraton Anaheim (Disneyland Drive). This hotel used to be in the top ten in Anaheim but it is gradually slipping well down the order. Why is this? Does the Sheraton group not care about this hotel? If you read the reviews most people are saying similar things such as renovation required, hallway carpets stained and worn, exterior doors not closing properly, lift out of action for more than a day. This is the only hotel I stayed in during my 16 night US trip that didn't have free WiFi in the bedroom, charged for car-parking and charge for using the telephone. I have really liked this hotel during the years but I only wish the Sheraton brand would give this hotel some attention and not take the Anaheim visitors for granted.
Manager Response: Thank you for your past nine stays with us at the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. we appreciate you taking the time to review the hotel and i am glad to report that we are starting our renovation program next month so that we can get a fresh new look. We do care about our appearance and had to wait until we got through the busy summer season. Our $14.00 parking fee is one of the least expensive of all of the Anaheim resort hotels and you will find that all of the big hotels charge for parking. We do offer free wi-fi in our lobby area and in the Sheraton link. I hope that you will get the chance to return to the hotel in a few months so that you can see for yourself our new transformation in many areas of the hotel.

Summary: My husband and I visited Anaheim for the first time a few years ago and had a room that felt like it was about half a mile from the lobby.  When we went to go check in, the beautiful lobby caught us off guard -- the place looked like a castle from the outside!  Well when we got to the room, our first impressions were justified: the room was gigantic, the product of 1970s construction.  The furniture was outdated -- I'm pretty sure my grandmother had the same chest of drawers in her living room.  The beds were comfortable, so I really can't complain, just rate it an "average" amount of dots.  Because you're so close to Disneyland, this is a popular hotel for families.  We were jarred awake by children screaming down the hall at 7am.  It wouldn't have been too bad if we hadn't
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. I must agree with you that we are a hotel that is located on 13 acres of plush gardens, koi ponds, and beautiful courtyards. Our rooms are some of the largest in the Anaheim resort area as you pointed out which makes us a perfect hotel for families.  We will start our guest room renovation program next month which will give us a brand new look, even though we were a hotel built in 1969 sporting a castle theme. Our comfortable sweet sleeper beds that you pointed out, coupled with our complimentary shuttle busses to Disneyland makes us a perfect choice for the Disney bound families. Thank you for your business, and we look forward to serving you again.

Summary: We had a very last minute vacation opportunity and had wanted to visit Disneyland for a few years so we made reservations only 3 days in advance.  There were not many hotels with rooms available for the end of July with only 3 days' notice.  We found this hotel and were happy and not happy with it.   The good things include the service - everyone was especially nice and helpful.  From the clerk at check in, to the waiter in the hotel restaurant, to the cleaning staff and the shuttle drivers.  Very top notch service from all of them.  We ended up booking for 5 nights and didn't know until we checked in that with a 5-night stay, you get certificates to their in-house restaurant.  We used them our second night there.  We got $50 and for two adults and 3 kids, that just about
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. You pointed out so many wonderful things that I want to thank you for those comments. From our excellent customer service, to our extensive grounds with koi ponds, plush gardens, and courtyards. Our complimentary shuttle to Disney allows you to come and go as you wish. I do agree that our hallways need a face lift and I am glad to tell you that we will be undergoing a renovation of many of our guestrooms and public areas starting next month. I hope that you will have the opportunity to come visit us again in a few months so that we may once again serve you. Thank you for your business.

Summary: This is where I always stay for my twice yearly Disney trip with the kids.  Yes, it is a little run down, but for the price I think it is a good deal.  I have always loved the service.  This time the shuttle was great as usual and we had very nice service at the restaurant.  On top of that, the rooms are roomy.  I have given a great review in the past for this hotel on TripAdvisor.  Unfortunately, I can not stand when they deny you services they have to give you and when the outright lie on top of that.  I am at Starwood Gold member (downgraded this year from Platinum, but that will be corrected soon).  I called at 10:00 today to ask for late checkout.  They told me that since the hotel was "sold out" that they could not give it to me.  They are allowed to do that if this were a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the Sheraton Anaheim hotel and explaining the issue of the late check out. First of all i apologize for the confusion and denial of the 4pm checkout. Where we get in trouble is We have many gold and Platinum members on vacation with us daily especially in summer. Our check in time is 3pm and we have many requests for 4pm checkout. When we are almost or at 100% capacity we pre block rooms for our valued SPG guests. We have been caught a few times where the SPG guest checks in at 3, and we tell them their room wont be ready till 4:30 due to another SPG guest checking out at 4pm then we have to clean the room. Again I apologize for the late checkout issue, and hope that you will once again stay with us on your next visit to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Good hotel but could use some improvements. Will likely stay elsewhere next time
Summary: I stayed here while visiting Disneyland for the first time with my wife and daughter. We decided we would not rent a car and were sold by the hotel being described as being next to the park. It is actually a bit of a walk to the park entrance, and it is a walk you do not want to do with kids. The hotel does offer a shuttle which is very convenient and the drivers are nice and helpful.The hotel is attractive with its castle look, but it does need renovation. The room was alright, though a bit dated. There are signs of wear; I was surprised to see an obvious hole in the faucet. We got a room with two beds and it was very spacious. So much so that it seemed like a waste of space. They only had one desk chair and one lazy chair with ottoman which were not enough when we ordered room
Manager Response: Thank you for your honest review of the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. First of all I am happy to report to you that we are starting our renovation program next month. This will give us a face lift in many areas of the hotel. Our castle themed look, located on 13 acres is like no other hotel in the Anaheim resort area, and our complimentary shuttle service to Disneyland allows you to come and go from the park whenever you want. I have discussed with our bar manager the issue you encountered and he has discussed this with all of our bar staff. I do apologize for that incident. I hope you will once again visit our property to see the enhancements that will be in place in a few months, and give us an opportunity to serve you again.

Summary: First trip to Disney, and I thought this would be a fun place because of the whole castle theme.  I get that it's an older hotel, so I didn't expect brand-new furnishings, but I was still really disappointed.  There is an overpowering odor in the lobby of air freshener, which was not fresh.  It smelled like a guy who had on way too much cologne, but it was constant 24/7, like they were trying to cover something up with it.  We visited the pool on day 1, It is small and quite shady, not great for sun-lovers.  The service at the pool was awful.  Took 1/2 hour to get beverages.  The hallway to our room had moldy mildew smelling carpet.  The room itself was okay.  There is no free wifi, so you're pretty much forced to use their tech center down in the lobby, which would be okay, but

I had only one night here at this Sheraton hotel and I'm actually very glad that it was only one night. I have stayed at the other two Sheratons in the area and this was the last one that I had to stay at and review. I had checked into the hotel and although check-in was easy and quick, there is a parking fee of $14 for each car which always bothers me. I parked at the backside of the hotel and the elevator was out of order back there so I just took the stairs to and from my room.  The room was very spacious although the bathroom itself was very small. I had just stayed at a Westin though so I was a bit spoiled by the size of that bathroom. The internet was not free in the hotel room although it is free in the lobby. There are also computers in the lobby to use. The room decor
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the Sheraton Anaheim and I apologize for the hotel not meeting your expectations. The hotel rooms are quite large as we cater to many large families. As you mentioned, we do have complimentary shuttle service to and from Disneyland for those that don't want to walk the distance.  Some of our rooms are looking a little tired and I am pleased to announce that we are starting our renovation program September 2, 2014. This will give us the face lift that that you had mentioned. We look forward to you visiting us again so that we may once again serve you.

Summary Heading: EPIC FAIL to provide most basic service!!!!
Summary: As a former employee of Starwood and a Forbes certified trainer  for luxury properties in Las Vegas I wanted to write to inform you of my recent guest experience. I am in complete shock over the lack of service, the dishonesty of the staff and the failure to take initiative to resolve our problem that we repeatedly reported.   We checked into the hotel for a 2 night stay on July 23rd for my sons 3rd birthday celebration. We were checked into a decent room and have no complaints about the actual accommodations itself.   At approximately 9:30pm we realized that we were staying right in the middle of a large family group that had about 4-5 rooms on our floor. They occupied the room to our immediate right, left and directly across from us. The doors on both sides and across from us

My sister, my two nieces, my two children and I stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim while visiting Disneyland.  The hotel was very well located with an excellent shuttle service to and from Disney.  During our two day visit to the park we never had to wait more than 2 minutes going or coming back from the pard.  The drivers were friendly and helpful.  They even helped me fold a stroller I had borrowed.  The hotel beds were very comfortable and the room was spacious and with no street noise or other rooms's noise, which is nice.  The six of us preferred to stay in one room, and upon our arrival we were told that they had upgraded us to a larger room, which was very nice of them, given that we had two queen beds and two rollaways.  The bkast buffet included a good selection of food,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the Sheraton Anaheim. It was nice to hear that you enjoyed the shuttle service, the dining room, the comfortable beds, and the overall service you received. However, I was sorry to hear that the associate at the front desk did not meet your expectations and for this I apologize. We pride ourselves at delivering the best customer service possible and your experience at the front desk is quite abnormal. We will begin our guest room rennovation program this September and will be giving many of our guest rooms a new look. I hope that you are able to come back and visit us soon so that we may once again serve you.

Summary Heading: Not sure I will be back
Summary: I've been going to this hotel now for 14 years.  I love the spacious rooms and queen size beds.  But it really hit me this time how the hotel seems to be in bad shape.  It may have started from the odd smell in my room.  The carpet needed to be stretched or just replaced.  Some mildew around the tub.  It looks like they just keep putting calking around the tub.  It was not done neatly.  The bus to Disneyland is nice.  I was upset that my boys were coming out of the hotel and the driver demanded to see their room key, while no one else on the bus was even asked to show theirs.  Also at night the buses needed to come more often to get us from Disneyland.  People started shoving their way on to the bus.  That was really upsetting because their wasn't room for everyone.  This may
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the Sheraton Anaheim. We have appreciated your patronage this past 14 years and hope that we will be able to serve you in the future. To answer some of your questions, we will be starting our guest room rennovation program this September which will give us a new facelift. We started asking for room keys upon entering our shuttles as we were having a problem with guests from other hotels near us using our complimentary shuttle, which meant there was not enough seats for our own guests. We also started having our guests hang registration cards in their cars as many people that were not guests parked in our lot and walked to Disney which left us with fewer spaces for our valued guests. We run a very high occupancy in the Summer months and we are doing everything possible to exceed our guests needs. I apologize if that didn't happen on your last stay and I believe that won't be the case on your next visit. Thank you again for expressing your concerns as we take all comments very seriously.

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Front desk was helpful & friendly. The rooms were huge-plenty of space for our 2 kids to run around. Pool area was nice. There is a little deli on the main floor that was convenient for grabbing a few muffins & fruit on our way out the door. Shuttle to Disney was awesome. It comes and goes every 30 minutes all day long. We were able to bring our kids back to the hotel for a nap, & hop right back on to get back to Disney for the evening. Parking was $14/day. It's an unavoidable fee. The shuttle made up for the fact that we didn't have to find and pay for parking at Disney. Would definitely recommend.
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for your outstanding review of the Sheraton Anaheim regarding your recent stay with us. We pride ourselves on our excellent customer service, our complimentary shuttle service to and from Disney, our spacious guest rooms and our food and beverage outlets. We will be starting a guest room rennovation program this September which will give us a new look in many of our rooms. We thank you for your business and we look forward to your next visit so that we may serve you once again.

Summary: My family and I stayed for 2 nights at the end of a combined east coast/west coast vacation.  The hotels offers great value for money.  Regular on time pick up/drop offs to Disneyland make it the perfect hotel.  Beds are comfortable and we chose a Club Room which gave us snacks/breakfast and drinks.  Could not find fault in this property - staff very friendly and free parking for in house guests.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for taking the time to review the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. We pride ourselves at delivering great customer service, while attending to all of our guests needs. We are about to begin a guest room rennovation program this September and will be giving the hotel a bit of a facelift. We look forward to your return so that we may serve you and your family once again.

Summary: My family and I reserved two rooms over July 4th weekend at the Sheraton and everything was perfect. We arrived and were greeted warmly at the front desk, we were given connecting rooms which is what we were hoping for. Check in was fast, we dropped our stuff off at the rooms and bought tickets to Disneyland right there which was very convenient. We jumped right on the free shuttle and at the end of the day it did not take long for a shuttle to arrive to take us back. My nephew loved the Koi fish pond and all the staff we encountered were so friendly. The hotel is so close to Disneyland and freeways, easy access to restaurants and gas stations, etc. We would def go back!
Manager Response: All of us at the Sheraton Anaheim thank you for your business over the fourth of July weekend. We appreciate all of your kind comments in your review, and hope that we extended a warm welcome to you and your family in every way. The hotel is over 45 years old and we are about to begin another guest room rennovation program this September which will give us a new look in many of our rooms. We look forward to your next visit and again, we thank you for your wonderful comments regarding our Hotel and staff.

Summary: This was a very nice hotel for our summer vacation. We were warmly welcomed and registering was a charm. The staff were all very friendly and anything we asked for was promptly delivered. The breakfast buffet was good, a wee bit expensive but the service was very attentive. Very convenient to have a shuttle every 1/2 hour and never waited more than 10 minutes. Loved the pool and pool service! We could come back and relax during the day as we were so closely situated. Our room fit 5 people with plenty of space for all the luggage. The deli was handy with the teenagers always hungry. We took advantage of the games/arcade room. The teens all enjoyed the lobby area for their WIFI connections. We as adults enjoyed the spacious cozy lobby as well to relax and talk about the days
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us at the Sheraton Anaheim, and we are glad that you had the opportunity to enjoy our Garden Bistro Restaurant, the Deli, the game room and arcade, as well as utilize our free shuttle service to and from Disneyland. You had mentioned that you were a family of 5 in one of our spacious guest rooms with plenty of room for your luggage as well. We pride ourselves on our large rooms as well as delivering the best customer service possible. Thank you for your business and we look forward to your next visit so that we may serve you once again.

Summary Heading: Great value hotel near Disneyland and a special bonus!
Summary: This is a great family hotel for people visiting Disneyland.  We are locals but like to stay once or twice per year overnight as a mini-getaway.  Although we like all Sheraton properties in the area we really liked staying here for a few reasons.  The rooms are larger than standard hotel rooms so if you have more than four people in your family you could have the extra children sleep on blow up mattress without taking up all of the floor space.  The club room is another great value as it includes continental breakfast, evening snacks and last time I went free or low priced cocktails for the parents.  One special bonus at this hotel is that if you have small children and don't want to stay in the park until the fireworks at 9:30 you can view them from the parking lot of this
Manager Response: We would like to thank you for your loyalty to the Sheraton Anaheim, and for all the wonderful comments made about our hotel. Starting in September of this year we will be rennovating many of our guest rooms which will give us a new look. Being that we do have larger guest rooms than most hotels, we will be adding a bunk bed feature in a few of our rooms which will allow larger families more options. Thank you again for your business and we look forward to serving you again in the near future.

Summary: We have stayed here twice now as part of a Disney package. The shuttle service is great but it is an older hotel that is starting to show it's age. We have always found the rooms to be clean & the grounds also but there was often room service trays left outside for hours on end. The restaurant is expensive & there isn't much of a choice in hot food at the 'deli'/cafe. Same for breakfast, we usually do not eat at the hotel, take the shuttle to Disney & there are more choices across from the park. There is free computer use in the business area but you do have to pay for wifi in rooms (they do not tell you about the free computers when you check in). On both times we have stayed here, we also found the check in staff to be aloof & not friendly. The porters/drivers etc were more
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to reveiw your last stay with us at the Sheraton Anaheim. I would like to apologize for any of our staff that did not make you feel welcome as we do value each and everyone of our guests.  I apprecite the fact that you enjoy our 13 acres of plush gardens, koi ponds, and rose gardens in our inside courtyards. Our free shuttle service every 30 minutes is another one of our services for our guests and I appreciate your kind remarks regarding our shuttle drivers and bellstaff. We will begin our guestroom rennovation program this September which will give us the upgrade that you mentioned. Thank you again for your business and we look forward to serving you again on your next visit.

Summary: This location is not living its FULL potential and leveraging the proximity to Disneyland and the number of visitors it caters to. Booked 3 rooms for a family event and experience is mixed with highs and lows. I would like to end on a high note so first the low's: 1. Front desk staff  not engaging, smiling or friendly. No charisma at all. No SPG benefits were shared and only mentioned it when asked. She was so focused on making sure paper work is filled out- initial here for the rate, initial here for check-out time, initial here for parking fee, etc., and lastly, signature here. She was very firm on pointing out the NO's, what we cannot have, and all the limitations and restrictions. No value-driven acts from a customer perspective.A BLAH experience/personality and negative

Done well - I guess it has shuttle service every half an hour - Bathroom has been upgraded 10 years ago since its inception from 1970 I guess  Do Better - WIFI is no free in room is very inconvenient.  I would rather seeing the hotel cut down the shuttle bus frequency to Disney - Parking is hard to find if you come late. Don't know what if you could not find ont - Parking for a FEE is ok but I treated it as I paid Disney parking anywhere so it is neutral - proximity seems to be a good thing but not for walking like 30 mins that you need to cross 2 bridges of highway  which is pretty remote - no safe in own guest room...you need to lock it in the public area  - very out-dated room....except the bathroom has done some upgraded in 10 years ago I think, the rest of the hotel is same

I stayed here during a quick trip to Disneyland with my adult children in mid-June. As others have stated, this is an older hotel; still we found the rooms were large, comfortable, and clean. On a more negative note, electrical outlets were sparse and there was no place to hang towels in the small bathroom. There was free bottled water daily.  The staff was wonderful - from the front desk personnel who helped us with early check-in to the shuttle bus drivers who were always prompt and friendly.  We did not eat at the hotel or use the pool or kids facilities, so can't comment on those.  I'd recommend the Sheraton Anaheim, and would definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review the Sheraton Anaheim and giving us a thumbs up! As you stated we are a 45 year old hotel with lots of character and charm. We pride ourselves on our large, clean and comfortable rooms. Beginning this September, we will begin a guestroom rennovation program that will give us a new look. I appreciate your kind comments regarding our wonderful staff, as they pride themselves on delivering excellent customer service. We look forward to serving you and your family on your next visit, and thank you for your business.

Summary Heading: Large hotel with nice location but expensive and complicated layout
Summary: Pros: The location of the hotel is nice, minutes from Disneyland. There is a shuttle every 30 minutes to the parks. Parking is $14 per night.  Cons: it is pricey ($200 in late June) and the hotel is so, so complicated to navigate. The rooms numbers are confusing with 12xx and 11xx around the corner from each other. The room service and restaurant close at 11 pm.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to review your stay with us at the Sheraton Anaheim. As you mentioned, we are spread out on over 13 acres with Koi ponds, Rose gardens, interior courtyards, and a large pool area. Navigating your way to some of the rooms can be tricky, and I apologize for any confusion that you may have encountered. We are reviewing our signage while at the same time beginning a guest room rennovation program this September. We thank you for your business and look forward to your next stay with us so that we may serve you once again.

Summary: The hotel was perfect. Clean, quiet and very comfortable. The front desk staff were very helpful. They gave us the choice of where we wanted our room. Overlooking the pool, the garden or in a quiet area. We choose the quiet area.  The shuttle to and from Disneyland was great. Was on time very convenient and comfortable the drivers were very informative letting us know the hours of the park and the times the shuttle will be there for drop off and pick up. Will definitely stay here again.

We stayed here a couple nights while attending events at the convention center. The truth is that she's a tired old girl and Sheraton needs to do a floor by floor upgrading.  The carpets a dirty, they were little cigarette burns in chairs and the headboard;  The sheers were burnt.  You can even see pieces of the roofing starting to break and fall off.Now, I can go over these sorts of things easily enough, but they drive my wife crazy.  On the other hand, the location, staff and common areas were great.  I didn't make the reservation so I don't know to what extent it is a value or not.  Just be informed that this is not a perfect property, but I suspect it is more than good enough for most people.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review of the Sheraton Anaheim as we take all reviews very seriously. We are happy to announce that we will begin a guest room rennovation program this September as some of the rooms are beginning to look "tired" as you pointed out.  Thank you for the kind remarks regarding the staff as we pride ourselves in offering the best customer service possible. Our complimentary shuttle and close location to Disney is a plus and I appreciate the fact that you were able to enjoy that service. We thank you for your business and look forward to serving you on your next stay with us.

Summary Heading: Normally my 2nd choice next to Disney
Summary: We usually only stay at a Disney property, but if I can't book there I like the Sheraton.  Anthony at the front desk was very kind, pleasant and helpful.  I like the shuttle service which leaves us steps from the entrance to Disneyland.  This is less walking then if you stay at a Disney hotel.  The drivers are all also very nice and it's only about a 5 minute ride.  We stayed in what seemed to be the furthest building away, "E" , I think.  The rooms were modernly decorated.  We called for a portable crib.  most hotels carry a pack and play.  This one was metal but worked.   It was really hot in the room even after turning on the AC.  After retuning from the park the room was still at 80 degrees at 9 at night.  We did have a great view of the fireworks.  But it was still too hot.

We stayed at the Sheraton with our 4 kids for a week whilst we visited the nearby attractions. The hotel was great, the kids enjoyed the pool and our dining experience was wonderful. I cannot fault the staff who were ever so helpful. I considered our stay to be great value for money and will definitely back when we visit next.

Pros: proximity to Disney, large rooms, nice grounds, good pool with meal service poolside, reliable and consistent shuttle to/from the park, family and non family friendly(I would stay here with family or friends), plenty of parking at a reasonable price, friendly and courteous staff.  Cons: club lounge breakfast(really restrictive policy on number of people who may partake, you feel watched like a criminal while in there, and no removal of food so don't go grab some to bring to your family while they get ready, for example), a little dated in decoration(note the world little), small hot tub, some traffic noise in exterior rooms.  We really enjoyed our stay and will return next time we head to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with family!
Summary: This hotel was spacious, has very nice grounds, and large clean rooms.  The shuttle to disneyland was so convient and the drivers were very helpful.  The pool is a little small but very nicely maintained. My husband and I got to sneak away and enjoy a bottle of wine near a gas fireplace in the modern large lobby.  I would definately come back!

Summary Heading: Close to Disney great view of the fireworks from Disney
Summary: Great location away from the chaos and they have a free shuttle bus to the parks/downtown  Disney.  We enjoyed the pool,gardens and the hot tub. They have a cafe for people on the go plus a nice full service restaurant . Enjoyed the lobby setting with fireplace nice to relax after a chaotic day.

My husband is a platinum elite member with starwood and we have stayed in many sheratons, westins and four points over the years. We have stayed in all 3 of the sheratons in this area and always try to stay at this location if we can. Its the oldest and shows some wear but has by far the friendliest  staff and feels the most homey to us! Cynthia, Shari and Jose in the Bar and Nester who is in charge of F&B all make our stay wonderful. The front desk crew always remember us and helps get us settled in. The morning and evening lounge is always well stocked (even though there have been a couple of reviews that Ive read saying negatives things about it) and the staff is helpful with your needs. The GM recently has been changed and we had the chance to meet the new one and he seems

The Sheraton at Anaheim wasn't the worst hotel but it isn't the best either.  Pros-  Nice pool w/ poolside bar  Friendly staff Cheap hotel transportation to disney and other places Great cleaning staff Cons-  No free breakfast (This doesn't add to my rating) Smallish rooms Very crowded and at sometimes loud in the hallways Wi-Fi surcharge per 24hrs

Summary Heading: Great option for a better value stay near the parks.
Summary: We love the Disney resort hotels, but the Sheraton offers a beautiful, nearby alternative for excellent value.   We walk, a lot, so often don't use the shuttle to the parks but when we have we found it to be a reliable option. The shuttle conveniently drops you off close to the theme park entrances. Walking takes nearly 20 mins but is pleasant and safe.   The rooms are ok. Clean and nicely sized. The furniture is old and dated but still comfortable.   We always find the front desk to be kind and welcoming, always happy to answer our questions.   A very pleasant stay overall. We will certainly be back.

My families stayed at this hotel when visiting Disneyland.  I'd guess the Disneyland hotel would be much better, but much much more costly.  The location of the hotel has its pros and cons.  The pros: near Disneyland and away from the crowds.  Cons: nothing within walking distance.  The rooms are spacious and clean.  The bed is on the soft side.  There is computer for public use in the lobby, so you don't have to pay to have wifi in the room ($10).  The parking is $14 per day.  The best part is the shuttle to Disneyland.  The worst part is the buffet breakfast, it is expensive considering the quality of food and service.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the Sheraton Anaheim and your comments regarding our complimentary shuttle, and comfortable rooms. As you stated, we do have complimentary Wi-Fi in our lobby as well as in the Link at Sheraton. I am sorry that our breakfast buffet did not meet your needs, however we do have a full breakfast menu as well that is also available from 6am to 11am. Again I thank you for your review and look forward to serving you again on your next visit to the Anaheim area.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay Near Disney
Summary: Nice clean rooms. Club level rooms are extra spacious. Convenient shuttle to Disneyland. Nice restaurant and the luxury of room service after a tiring day. A good value and a nicer than the nearby motels.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of the Sheraton Anaheim and the kind comments about our Hotel. We strive to meet and exceed the expectations of our guests at all times.  We hope that you will once again come stay with  us, as we appreciate your business and enjoy the oppryunity to serve you.

Summary: So It's really on par with an outdated Day's Inn or at it's worse La Quinta.......Front desk staff seemed displaced and bothered by having to check me in. Hallways were damp and humid with windows open and no AC....rooms are musty and outdated.....staff at the lobby bar seem to be employees of the CA department of aqua-net-CA is so cool-do you know who lives here-tourism...If I had to hear her tell me about how many "famous" people and "Disney execs" stayed there........ugh....You can all keep it....

I stayed here for two nights as part of a group tour. The hotel looks very attractive from both outside as well as inside. It is however rather marooned from things to do unless you get the shuttle (free) down to Disneyland. The room was large and generally clean. However, there was a long black hair in the wash basin, the tap leaked and the 'leather' effect on the chair and bed head were peeling off. There is no room safe and no free wifi but there was a coffee maker.  If I was going to stay in Anaheim in the future I would try for one of the Disneyland Hotels where there is a bit more activity. On the other-hand the Sheraton is quiet which may not be the case for downtown Disneyland hotels.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind comments regarding the hotel and yes we are about 1 mile from the entrance to Disneyland. However we do offer the free shuttle every 30 minutes which is about a 5 minute shuttle ride. I apologize for the worn condition of your room and wanted you to know that we are going to begin a guest room rennovation program beginning this September. Thank you again for your business.

Summary: I stayed many times last year with my family. First, I like the location. It's close to Disneyland Park. Plus, they complimentary shuttle back and forward to the Disneyland Park. It runs until late night. Secondly, It is very hot in Anaheim in Summer. So, i can use their swimming pool to swim with my kids. They love it so much. Now, if i go to Disneyland. I will stay this Hotel again. Forget mention, If you are AAA card member, you will get some discount rate. The thing i dont like is Wifi in room. Dont waste your Money to sign up Wifi In room. Just go to the Lobby enjoy free Wifi. I hope when i come back next time. The in room wifi will gets improved.

Summary Heading: This hotel is not the Happiest Place in the World
Summary: There are major customer service issues at the front desk and the hospitality room for Platinum members.  At check in  they do not smile or welcome you and they try to nickel and dime you on extra costs.  They are not very accomadating.  I have knee problems and needed a room near the elevator.  That is all I asked for after a 5 hour flight.  She seemed annoyed at this and still gave me a room far away from the elevator.  I needed a GPS to find the room as this hotel is sprawled out.  It is also a historic hotel but  it has become very dated.  I don't want to stay in a1950's hotel.  It is dark and dreary.   As for the lounge they put out 6 stale bagels and watch you eat them.  They really were rude to one guest who was taking a bagel to the room.  There is noone in this room

Not the closest to Disneyland but excellent for central access by quick car/taxi to everything. Clean rooms, friendly service and staff open to helping you with anything. 10 min taxi to Anaheim convention center which is an excellent choice if you cant get into local hotels.

This is an older hotel with large, comfy guest rooms.  The grounds are very pleasant.  We often stay here on July 4 as there's a great view of Disneyland fireworks from the parking lot.  Staff is friendly and willing to offer assistance, recommendations, etc.

The Sheraton Anaheim is one of the most " great value for money" hotels in southern California. The room is very spacious, clean, and the rate is very favorable. Free wi-fi would have been perfect!  A few more traffic lights down the road, when you cross the city line, the rate is almost double. I highly recommend.

Just slept at the Sheraton Anaheim while on a visit to Disneyland.   Attractive large lobby and friendly guest services.  Reasonably priced restaurant and snack shop / convenience store.  Free shuttles running to the park every 1/2 hour was nice with very helpful, friendly drivers.  The rooms were large and had basic amenities.  The best part about this hotel is the quality of the beds and the bedding.  Extremely comfortable and made for a great sleep after a long day.  However, a big "con" the charge for internet (9.95 per day).  It's just another way to bleed guests for more money.  It seems like a hotel of this caliber doesn't need to do this.

I stayed here for a conference and stayed in an "upgraded" room which was very nice and big and clean.   I liked the workout facility (Life Fitness treadmills and elipticals). The bar/lobby area was spacious and there is a nice fireplace and plenty of computers for guests to use.  They have a pretty decent game room and a nice little shop/deli, too, where I picked up some snacks.    The facilities are clearly older but it's kind of quaint, with all of the courtyards and the castle-like decor.    The hotel is right next to the 5 freeway, but I don't recall hearing the traffic noise.  The hotel has free Disneyland shuttles all day.  Even though I didn't take it, I was outside waiting for a cab when they were loading people up.   Speaking of cabs, if you need one, do yourself a

My husband and I stayed at this property in November of 2012 and enjoyed our stay so much that when I went on a girlfriend's weekend to Disneyland I booked here again. We were greeted warmly at check in but what really was unique for the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel is that every time we passed by the desk during our stay they called me by name. This personal touch made such a positive impression on my friend. Every request we made was quickly and politely fulfilled. Our spacious room was quiet and overlooked one of the court yards. It included two comfy queen beds, an easy chair, desk, entry table, frig, TV, and bath. We really appreciated the complimentary transportation every half hour to Disneyland. I told the desk manager that I had stayed at other area hotels, the Howard Johnson

We stayed here 5 years ago and had the same rooms, they were old then and they are the same now.  Everything about this room is old, at least it seemed clean, except when you started looking at walls, curtains,etc.  They had doors going to and outdoor courtyard and you could see daylight from them, I put towels on the bottom of the door because it was so bad. Last year we stayed there again and everything was great, nicer rooms for sure!!  I complained on a survey they wanted me to fill out online. I did receive a reply supposedly from the manager, they agreed that the rooms were old and need to be refurbished, and that they were going to be done this summer. We are Starwood Preferred Guests and they did not offer anything like some extra pts. I had complained one time at a

We stay as part of a coach tour around California. We were greeted by GM which was very nice, he is new so clearly taking an interest. Visited Disney which was easy on the shuttle, both daytime and to Downtown Disney at night. Great steak in the restaurant, similar price to eating at Disney and without the crowds.  Room OK, I gather there is a refurbishment planned. Satisfied customers!

Summary Heading: Way past needing a fewshening up
Summary: I stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim on a business trip from May 14 thru 16.  My meeting was at the Disneyland Hotel but I was late registering and they were full.  The Sheraton was the "overflow hotel"  The Disneyland Hotel is very nice.  The Sheraton, not so much.  Overall the hotel is very tired looking. and somewhat dim in brightness.  The carpets throughout seemed old and my room smelled musty.  The Air-conditioning struggled to keep up and was a bit noisy.  Bedding was average.  The bathrooms were small and a bit odd in design. Closet space had no doors.  The desk space had no room for my laptop ad a big screen TV occupied the desk and there were no plugs.  Wifi is free in lobby but an extra charge in the room.  The bar is small and keeps a bit of strange hours.  Basically it

The hotel decor is a little faded from its past glory but it is very comfortable, family friendly and impeccably clean. Great free shuttle service to Disneyland (only a 5 min drive) and the concierge was very helpful in arranging and confirming other tour and airport shuttle bookings. Very nice buffet breakfast especially the crispy bacon and they will happily toast a bagel for you if you ask. Pool was a nice bonus for the kids. Excellent choice of hotel if your main purpose is to visit Disneyland.

We stayed here with our kids for a weekend trip to Disneyland and we had an overall positive experience. I was a little disappointed that the bathroom  looked dilapidated. The paint was cracking on the wall and some of the wall paper around the sink was coming apart. I was expecting a lot more from a Sheraton hotel. The breakfast in the morning was great!

Summary Heading: Great place to stay while visiting Disneyland
Summary: Everything about this hotel was great. We booked the Family Castle Package for the 4 of us. It was perfect, we got a full breakfast each day in their restaurant, free internet and free parking. The buffet breakfast was great with a nice selection. The shuttle was great and very each and convenient to use. Every staff member went out of their way to be helpful. The room was large and we had plenty of room for the 4 of us. Next time we visit Disneyland we will stay here!

Be careful when visiting this hotel, this weekend i was at this and stole all my electronic devices, and all they told me they had left the door open when the doors close automatically.  They are the worst dirty tricks and I was going to have a good time and even my camera with me stole all my photos, please share this as it is not fair to pass this in a hotel chain so serious...

Summary Heading: Not quite walking distance to Disney
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights during spring break. Hotel website says walking distance to Disney, hotel clerk says it is a 20 min walk. We used the hotel shuttle but if we walked, we would have to cross 2 freeways. The hotel is dated, more like a comfort inn, but the room we were in, we had nice sheets and the beds were comfortable. We had stayed at Sheratons before, this one not quite as upscale. Be sure to get to the shuttle stop early @ Disney. We had a huge mob trying to get on the shuttle, the driver was very rude, but they immediately sent a second shuttle. Restaurant overpriced.  Deli shop had good sandwiches. In room wi-fi not free.

We stayed here going to Disney because it was a Sheraton. Boy were we dead wrong on our choice. I love sheraton hotels, but this one was terrible. Once we checked in we noticed things were a little strange. Stained floors, smoke smell throughout the hallways, and even hair on the walls in the bathroom. During an exit to go eat we overheard someone complain about blood on their sheets and the lady at the desk had the nerve to say it was their own blood. The hotel is very very outdated, and nasty.    The only good thing about this hotel was the free shuttle to disney but a cab would only be a few bucks..

The personell is very kind and cooperative. The club lounge works great. Unfortunatly the rooms, the hall needs a deep rennovation. Defintly not a sheraton standard hotel level. I am going there since few years, beacuse is convenient for location and the kindness of the personell, otherwise it would not be a stop for me.

I stayed at this hotel back in 2004 and was very pleased with it, so I overlooked some of the more recent reviews and booked my 2014 stay here, as well - and I am so glad that I did.  The hotel has undergone renovations since I stayed here last.  Even though we were placed in an older-style room, it was clean, quiet and very well kept!  Parking was plentiful (and cheaper than many surrounding hotels) and the staff was extremely polite and helpful.  The Disney shuttle is probably the best reason to stay here - our experience was outstanding.  We took the 1st shuttle of the morning and seating was difficult to find, but that is to be expected at such a busy time.  Overall, it was a great stay!

I stayed here in April 2009 for a few nights and it was very comfortable. There was a regular shuttle bus to Disneyland. A great place to Stay. The room was huge, clean and very comfortable.  There are also very nice gardens making it very pretty.

Summary Heading: Very big hotel, well located but with poor service
