Summary: The rooms are good, cleaned well and really big. Very well located closer to Disneyland park with a nice transportation by bus. My big concern is related to front desk service. No clear explanation about how parking gate works with plastic cards, horrible explanation about internet use and ZERO explanation about hotel facilities.

Summary Heading: Nice, cheaper place, on the north side of Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here to meet up with the parents who had a business conference at the Disneyland resort hotel complex. The Disneyland hotels were fully booked, so we decided on the Sheraton for the price. While the hotel is nice, some of their rooms need a major update. The first room we stayed in looked like a halfway house with Goodwill furnishings and scary bathroom. We asked for a different room, which was bigger and the furnishings were newer. Shuttle service to Disneyland was great and the canteen at the hotel is a great stop for stocking up on supplies (water, snacks, etc) before going into the park. We'll probably try the HoJo if we visit Disneyland anytime soon, but this place isn't bad considering the price.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel - glad I didn't listen to negative reviews
Summary: We are currently staying at this hotel - checked in 04/19/2014 - and will check out on 04/29/2014. I was very worried after reading the reviews - even considered cancelling.. but as new Starwood members I am trying to stay loyal :) Glad I stuck with the plan...   We are in room 3187 - and it is huge. It is a regular king room, the bed is great.. there is a couch (pulls out to double bed) and chair with coffee table in the sitting area. There is a desk with chair, lots of drawers for clothes - normal closet, bar size fridge, coffee maker  (starbucks coffee), decent newer TV. The bathroom is not huge - but really.. it's a bathroom - big enough. I honestly can't believe the amount of space in this room.   There were many reviews that talked about terrible outdated rooms.. I can't

Summary Heading: Clean, Close to Disneyland, Shuttle has issues
Summary: We have been staying at this hotel during our visits to Disneyland for the last several years, we come about 4-5  times throughout the year. It is a clean hotel and does offer a Free Shuttle service to Disneyland. Which is always prompt and a wonderful service if it is not hot outside! The rooms are a good size and clean. The front desk staff seems to be polite but not engaging.    Considering how good our past stays have been, I have become concerned about this hotel after our recent stay. The Shuttle to Disneyland is a major concern and not sure if we will book here again during the summer. The air conditioning was not working on the shuttle during this visit and it was HOT, no windows open and no moving air…it was close to 90 outside, so we were “cooking” inside.  I spoke

Stayed as part of a Disney break. Although it wasn't cheap the rooms were excellent. The service was okay if not a little rude at times. The food was excellent and overall the stay was a pleasant one.

I know my expectation of Anaheim hotels should be tempered by the fact that they're more geared to Disneyland visitors than frequent business travelers. However, the air conditioning in my room never really seemed to work, which necessitated keeping a window open at night, despite noise from the nearby I-5 freeway. Also, when I first checked into my room, there was no desk chair, which seemed odd. I call to the front desk soon fixed that omission, but you would think housekeeping would notice when the last cleaned the room.

We have stayed many times at the Sheraton Anaheim and always had a comfortable stay.  This time our bed was extremely hard and when we called to ask for another room, we were told all the beds were the same. This was disappointing since we were spending 4 nights there.   The room was a good size, the AC didn't work very well but we opened a window and that made the room comfortable.

This is a lovely hotel.  Great for visiting Disneyland, which is why we were there (why else would you be in Anaheim??).  Lovely rooms, restaurant, grounds, pool.  Glad to be away from Disney for awhile - 24/7 is just too much there!  Shuttle totally convenient and the shuttle drivers went out of their way to make it fun and comfortable for everyone.  Added some relaxation to the craziness of Disney!

Summary Heading: Old 60s Style Hote - Poor Platinum Service
Summary: I chose this hotel because I thought it would be convenient for Disneyland. It is NOT, it is a shuttle ride away and if you need to take a shuttle you are better off at other Starwood hotels in the area or another hotel further away--a shuttle is a shuttle. This hotel is across the street from  to a Motel 6.  I am an SPG platinum member and have NEVER seen a poorer breakfast or evening snack spread. There was NO upgraded given.  More rants 1) Can't turn on the shower without freezing for the first few seconds as water sprays directly on to you 2) Bathrooms are like 60s style and super tiny. 3) Poor customer service by the from desk manager 4) Lounge does not following operating hours specified--and expected me to call to get a soft drink 5) Hotel makes you feel bad by saying
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your current stay at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel. Although the hotel is located within walking distance to Disneyland and millions of people have walked to Disneyland since the hotel opened in 1969 we provide a free shuttle for guests since most of our guests are familys with small children. The Club Lounge at the hotel last month was ranked 15th out of 206 Sheraton Hotels in North America by Sheraton Prefered Guests that have stayed with us and I am disappointed that it does not meet your standards. Our Club Loung closes for 1 hour during the day for cleaning as we transfer from beakfast to all day service and I am pleased that beverages were delivered to your room for so you were not inconvenienced. Our Club Lounge is busy for breakfast and during the evening when free appitizers are served amd mostly all of our Platinum Guests spend the day at Disneyland. I am pleased that we are providing free internet service to you as a Platinum Guest. The $14 parking feee is the lowest of any major brand hotel in the Disneyland area. Again thank you for sharing your concerns with us.

Summary: Stayed for five nights to go to Disneyland. The room was just like other Sheraton properties. Mine had a "bubble" in the carpet un front of the TV, which caused me to trip a few times. Had a problem with the main elevator in that after pressing the call button, there was no movement in either lift. Had to take the stairs.  The hotel has a shuttle that runs to disney every thirty minutes. If the park cancels the fire works, you get a LARGE crowd at the pick up point. The hotel still only sends one 32 passenger bus every 30 minutes. Not believing this, I called the front desk, and was told exactly that.

If you can't stay on the Disneyland property, there are several choices nearby; the Sheraton Anaheim is definitely on the list.  The settings are comfortable and casual, which is nice when you've been in crowds all day long. The hotel is pet friendly, so is the shuttle, making our way to Disneyland with the dogs was easy.  The gardens/grassy areas within the complex make it very convenient to take care of our dogs, we respect the property we're staying at and appreciate that we can have our canine companions along for the fun.

We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights while at Disneyland. We really enjoyed our visit! The staff were very friendly and helpful, and both the interior and exterior were nice and well kept. Our room was very clean, too. They also had computers and a printer that could be used, which was great. They don't provide free breakfast, however, they have a breakfast buffet, but they also have a small coffee shop onsite where we bought our breakfast every morning. Didn't get a chance to try the restaurant but the menu looked good.This was a huge hotel, with a lot of corners to explore! The courtyard with the pond was especially nice. Also, a great pool and renovated fitness area.  Though not very close to Disneyland, the hotel offered a complimentary shuttle which ran every half an hour,

We stayed here as part of my loyalty to Starwood. I agree with Radley M a little interior make over, however not really the reason for staying here, Disney was the place.The hotel is great if you have a lot of family members and All Ages and needs looked after. The rooms are exceptionally clean well appointed internally with space. Great lock off facilities if your more than 4 but want to be together. Big Parking area, hassle free and safe. Our breakfast was plenty full and reasonably priced, you can have room and breakfast included at an affordable and better rate. It has a great shuttle service and it's on till late, we caught the shuttle back at 1.30am. William the driver was a hoot. He helped assist the families with their sleepy kids.Its a great place for The Kids to enjoy

My family and I are in the middle of our "Year of Disney Birthdays," and yesterday we finished a long weekend of Disney fun in celebration of my wife's jour de naissance.  Our trip included three nights at this hotel.  Quickie review for those who value pith: Low rates. Renovation recommended. Staff is pleasant but not engaging. Not ideal for business travel. Might be better off staying at Sheraton Park Hotel, Sheraton Garden Grove, or comparable non-Sheraton accommodations in the area.  Now for my full review...  We arrived in the late afternoon on Friday, March 14, 2014.  I parked my vehicle in the open air parking lot and began unloading our luggage.  While doing so, a few uniformed staff members walked by us, seemingly on their way to work (either from a break or from the

Summary Heading: Needs a major renovation but rooms are clean and big
Summary: I stayed here in conjunction with a trade show at the convention center.  There was ample free parking.  My room was clean and spacious. My room overlooked a major freeway - good thing I am a sound sleeper or it might have kept me awake at night.  I had a hard time getting hot water. Sometimes I had to run the spigot for 5 minutes (I watched the clock!) before it started to warm up. One day it never got better than lukewarm.  The hotel staff were courteous and helpful. The gift shop/deli could use a major menu makeover - really limited choices and definitely needs something with more healthy grab-and-go type selections.  The fitness center was really small, considering how large the hotel is.  A small fitness center may work for families on vacation but it doesn't work well if

Summary Heading: Very mean to charge for internet......
Summary: I found it very miserable in this day and age that this hotel still feels the need to charge for internet access for residents. I therefore can't recommend any good food and bev outlets as I made appoint of not Spending another penny in the place. A tiny protest, maybe we should all do it

To start with the room was excellent - large, clean, comfy bed. The common areas were a little seedy -- carpets were dirty, molding falling off here and there. There is a tiny health club -- get there when it opens at 5:30 a.m. or wait for an elliptical machine or treadmill. I came here for a conference. Do not schedule your conference here. Unless you want to go to Disneyland, there is no reason to stay here. There is nothing - and I mean nothing - nearby. It is a cultural and culinary wasteland. You really can't walk anywhere. I know Orange County is autotopia but when you fly in or take the train in for a conference, you want to be able to check out something interesting or at least something good to eat in the evening without renting a car. Forget that here. If you want to
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding the accomodations you occupied during your stay at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel.I am disappointed that you did not find our location to you satisfaction since thousands and thousands of our guests walk to Disneyland and the Resort District that is located less than a mile from our hotel. Our free transportation shuttle drops you off at the Disneyland Transit Terminal that gives you access to over 20 restaurants in the Downtown Disney area and another 50 restaurants adjacent to Disneyland along Harbor Blvd. I apologize for our small fitness center but 95% of the guests that stay in our hotel are here to visit Disneyland and the fitness center gets little use. Again thank you for your kind comments about our accomodations.

Summary Heading: Perfect for a stay at Disneyland
Summary: This was a great place for us to stay for a trip to Disneyland. All we wanted was: a large room, comfortable beds, a hot shower, and a shuttle ride to Disneyland — and we got that and more.   The room was spacious and gave us enough room for all of our baby stuff & the baby pack'n'play so she could sleep. The beds were nice and clean. The bathroom had a sink inside and a sink outside, which made it very convenient to use one sink as the "baby's sink" with all of her products that we and to clean.   The shuttle was very convenient. It picked you up from the hotel on the hour and half our, and picked you up from the park on the 15 and 45. The drivers were always courteous, helping us take our massive stroller in and out of the shuttle. And since the park is just minutes away, you

This Sheraton hotel is too far from the Disneyland parks to walk. There is shuttle service, not free, but still nicer than parking at Disneyland. Nice clean rooms, very family friendly. Club level is very nice for breakfast. The hours are fairly short in the morning, so no sleeping in!

Summary Heading: Great hotel near the Disneyland parks
Summary: This is a standard Sheraton, don't expect luxury, but it is quite nice, big rooms and is right next to the Parks.   We really didn't spend much time at the hotel since obviously we were at the Disneyland parks most of the day, but was very nice to come back to a comfy and clean bed, nice shower and rest for the next day. Staff was friendly and overall I can recommend this hotel if you are visiting the parks.

We stayed at this hotel because it was near Knott's Berry Farm and Disneyland. There was a free shuttle to Disneyland which saved you $30 for parking. The room was spacious and very clean. The beds were also very comfy and the front desk clearly were polite, helpful, and nice. I highly recommend staying here:)

Stayed  for 3 nights and each day was lovely, the Staff were very friendly and helpful, the shop had some nice gifts for children. with snacks and the usual toiletries etc Bedroom was very spacious except for the bathroom which was quite small. They have a pool with plenty of towels to dry your self  The Restaurant served a variety of foods if you are English ask for smaller portions though as they come served quite large, prices are very reasonable They have WI Fi which you pay for but the P C's are free You can book tickets for Disney land at the Ticket desk in the Hotel.,A shuttle bus runs every half hour to Disney land although it takes about 15 minutes to walk, if you didn't want to go to Disney Land they have next door Disney shops with cafes etc worth a visit Would love

Went with another mother to an Army event while our husbands were deployed and decided to go two days early to visit Disney. What a blast. This is an older hotel but very very well-kept.  At check in they made a HUGE mistake on my debit card and charged me for the entire trip even though most of the week was the Army's to pay for. But they were so sweet to get it fix fast. The hotel manager even spoke personally to my bank and assured them it was his mistake.  Food was expensive and not great but that's to be expected in the area.  Shuttles ran very often...every 15 minutes I believe....to and from Disney.  Overall a great experience. And each night during the Disney fire works....run out front, you'll get a great back view of them from the hotel! BTW, the military rate was

Summary Heading: With so many choices in the area, skip this one!
Summary: Stayed there during a very busy convention time. So I guess that is their biggest excuse. HOWEVER I stayed at Sheraton Park every year on a huge convention and NEVER experience "crunch time" like this Sheraton. Must say that this is the worst Sheraton I've stayed at to date! Good things first: they give you free dasani water instead of the cheaper water. Guess they ran out of the cheap water because of the NAMM convention. If you are a gold or platinum SPG, forget it! They act as if they never heard of such a thing. Hotel is really old and worn. Room is quite dirty. Very disappointed. Again, I guess w the sold out capacity because of the NAMM convention, they must be overwhelmed. Again, the Sheraton Park down the street also has HUGE convention and you would never know it! They
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback on your stay at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel. Dasani Water is a Starwood Standard for Sheraton Hotels in the United States. Most hotels provide one bottle free but the Sheraton Anaheim provides two bottles of water free since we are a family hotel. I apologize that you feel that you were not recongnized as a Sheraton Prefered Guest and we will try to do a better job in this area. I also apologize that room upgrades are not available during peak convention periods. The Sheraton Anaheim has been the most successful Sheraton Hotel in Anaheim for the past 43 years and hotels today are not built like the Sheraton Anaheim on 13 acres of land with lush gardens and courtyards. We are not your normal hotel and we do not want to be.

Summary: The hotel is within easy walking distance of the start line for all runDisney events. They happily accommodated our late check out request - AND food was available at 3a for runners.  We will be back!!

My wife and I went  to Disneyland and stayed at the Sheraton. We were about 1 km from the theme parks so a brisk walk got us there in about 15mins. The hotel was clean as was the room. The hotel staff were extreamly helpful. The on site restaurants were clean and reasonably priced. The food was typically American and plenty of it. Overall we had a enjoyably stay and would recommend to all and sundry

As a stand up comedian I travel a lot and have stayed in every grade hotel you can imagine from disgusting dives to 5 star Manhattan skyscrapers.  I was very satisfied with this hotel.  It is older but most hotels within walking distance to Disneyland are. I was there for the Disney half marathon. Most hotels around Disneyland were sold out so the room was a little pricier than usual but a new Sheraton would have charged twice the price for the same size room not matter what the rate was. Here is my experience: * It was clean, the sheets were nice (which I was very happy about because I usually travel with my own but didn't this time) and the beds were comfortable. * I called ahead for extra pillows and a roll-away bed and they were already in my room when I arrived.  * They had

Stayed here in November. It is an older property, but very nice and clean. Also very big hotel. Shuttle over to Disneyland, very prompt, nice drivers. Very comfortable beds. Room service was very prompt and very nice servers. Food was good.

We stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim using points as SPG members. We have stayed at many other Sheratons and decided to stay at the Sheraton Anaheim while we participated in Disney's Tinkerbel Half Marathon Weekend. My eleven year old daughter and I planned to go to the expo Thursday night and run the 5 k Friday morning at 5 am.  Our room failed to meet our expectations of a Sheraton room.  THE BED WAS NOT A SWEET SLEEPER! the mattress was hard and the sheets were rough. We choose Sheraton because of the Sweet Sleeper beds.  In addition, the faux leather headboards on the beds and the faux leather chair cushion were cracked and peeling. While this was purely esthetic, it did leave me unsure about the diligence management put into maintenance and housekeeping.  Service also failed.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your stay at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel. I would like to assure you that all beds in the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel are Sweet Sleeper beds as mandated bt Starwood Hotels. Linen on the bed is again the same linen used by all Sheraton Hotels in the United States as mandated bt Starwood Hotels. The Disneyland Tinker Bell Half Marathon Weekend is always confusing as what directions and instructions the hotel is to provide its guests. 90 percent of guests participating in the runs walk to Disneyland or the location of the starting point of the run. I apologize we could not have informed you better regarding the 5K pre run to the Half Marathon. Thanks for your input it is appreciated.

Summary: Believe me when i tell you to avoid this old and run down hotel in anaheim, there are a lot of options in the area better than this, old carpets, old beds, old doors,nothing works here and the service is terrible, "every body complains, you are nor the only one", "the manager is so stupid" thats what the people who works here told me about this place  because the politics for everything are so strict that makes you unconfortable.Dont stay here never. And sheraton you should change manager right now.
Manager Response: In fairness to the people that read this review you should provide the facts that made your stay as bad as it appears in your review. Politics are not the same as policies and it appears that you are unhappy because you did not get upgraded as requested, had to pay for parking like every guest in the hotel does, or could not gain free access to the Club Room. If you would provide me with details of your unhapiness I would be happy to respond to you. I am also disappointed that you mentioned that my employees said I was stupid as I have managed hotels for the past 40 years and this has never occured before. As you can tell I feel that your review of the Sheraton Anaheim is unfair and not based on facts.

Summary: We stayed here over Christmas, and were able to experience the hotel during a lull and the crush of Disney crowds. Yes, the hotel is farther away, but the shuttle service is fantastic (see below). As a great value, we stayed in 2 rooms for 1/2 the price of staying on-site at Disney (Grand Californian), where we would only have 1 room.  Rooms are incredibly spacious. Sure, I would like updates like a walk-in shower, but in comparison to the Disney properties, these are larger and slightly better appointed.  My point of comparison are the Disney Grand Californian and the Red Lion Anaheim. The beds are definitely more comfortable. Rooms were cleaned daily and the towels and bedding were luxurious. The one drawback was the noise from neighboring rooms and above us. We stayed on the

We stayed in the turret suite this time, it was beautiful. We could see the fireworks from Disneyland in the comfort of our room.  The staff was very helpful as always. I did have two issues; first, we got in late and ordered room service, we were then charged for an estimated weeks worth of room service ($175), this was done without my consent. (If I did agree to this, I wasn't aware of it).  Second, the charge of $9.99 a day for Wifi is ridiculous!  With the amount that the rooms cost, it should be included.  Due to the free wifi area in the lobby being for guest over 18, it causes for all the young people to hang out in a small area by check in. Very tacky!  I think they need to get with the times and make wifi free, you can get free wifi at motel 6 for goodness sakes!

Hotel is great for those headed to Disney Land. Rooms in the F tower could use a refresh. F tower can be noisy if you are close to the freeway  I think $14 for parking in an uncovered parking is stupid. Heck the gates are broken so I have seen many people driving in and out with out paying.  I would only stay here if I was working nearby at the Convention center or visiting Disney

Summary Heading: Average at its best, needs updates
Summary: I've stayed here multiple times for business trips as well as the other neighboring Sheraton. While I didn't use it from a tourist standpoint, I did notice they had multiple shuttles throughout the day taking people to Disneyland. In the immediate area though, there isn't much going on here. For the tourists who want to stay here for a quick, affordable, and easy access to Disneyland, this isn't a bad option,  but there are a ton more in the immediate areas. I wouldn't stay here more than 2 nights.   Having stayed at many Starwood properties, this is definitely below average. The decor of the hotel is very dated. Looks like its from the 80s and could use some updates. Even if they can't update the furniture due to costs, at least get some new paint for the wall where its

Super close to Disneyland with very convenient shuttles to the park. Nicely kitschy feel is a nice break from the usual business-centric Sheratons and is fun for the little one.   Despite the tourist traffic, the property is well maintained, clean and friendly.

They are pretty strict with the 4pm check in, goes hand in hand i guess. Location is very good 10minute walk from disneyland, Lots of resturants and easy to get to converience stores which is handy. The pool area is good lots of chairs, Fitness gym is 24/7 with up to date machines. Recieved a $25 vouchers per night per room for staying here when we checked in. That was also a nice bouns, staff are friendly. rooms are good size too.

Summary Heading: Brady Bunch Era Hotel that "tries harder"
Summary: Prior reviews are accurate in that it's a dated hotel in a very good location for Disneyland.  The deluxe rooms are well sized, but the bathrooms are somewhat small.  Parts of each room are updated (beds/headboards, light fixtures, TVs, furniture, phones) as well as the lobby area, but other parts of the hotel are not (hallways and secondary entrances).  This isn't a big deal, but the Platinum Starwood breakfast was a super basic continental breakfast of mid- to low- quality food - it's free, but definitely very basic (cut fruit, large bowl of yogurt, cereal, toast, juices, bagels with butter or cream cheese).  The hotel has definitely seen it's better days, but I do agree that Starwood needs to make this a Four Points and lower the expectation of guests.  Good luck Sheraton

As Disney Annual pass holders, this is our home away from home. As an older hotel, folks need to  let their imaginations take them to a simpler time, when cynics did not complain that a hotel made to look like an old castle needed updating and simple pleasure amenities included: large rooms with smaller baths, windows that open, rooms that allow pets, an aquarium with Nemo looking fish, a game and pool table room, a deli, outdoor rose gardens, a Koi pond, places to sit and read a book next to a splashing fountain, a Cheers type lobby pub, a clean kidney shaped pool, laundry facilities and reliable buses to take them to the place which is the reason we all go to Anaheim (Disneyland). If you can do this and not fret that a fly flew in the window that opens, or not freak out that

Summary Heading: This Sheraton has seen better days. Great location but mediocre hotel....
Summary: I agree with several of the other TA posters that kind of point out that this hotel has seen better days.  I stay in lots and lots of SPG hotels (Platinum member) each year and this is probably the least impressive hotel.  The positives is the staff is friendly and the location is EXCELLENT if you are taking your kids to Disneyland.  We just overnighted here as we took the kids to Disneyland the next morning.  They have a shuttle bus if you need it that goes to the park but we just drove as we were heading to Los Angeles after a long day at the park.   Disneyland parking is $16 per day.   The hotel is $14 per day and they offered to allow us to keep our car in their parking lot free the next morning but we opted not to for convenience purposes.    The lobby area was nice as they

I always stay at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel when we go to Disneyland, largely because it is the best SPG hotel nearby.  This time we drove down with our Tesla and I asked ahead of time for 110 connection so we could "top off' our car and make it to the next charging station.    They accommodated us.  The plug was only on during the night because it was the same plug powering the Christmas lights, but over 3 nights we got 40 miles a night added which gave me enough to get where I needed to go.  We were upgraded to a turret suite which was nice.    The bus drivers and staff were all very nice and accommodating.

Decent Sheraton with an ok club lounge and breakfast spread.  Right next to Disneyland and runs two shuttles an hour. The shuttles fill up quickly, so don't plan on arriving two minutes before departure and having a seat.

I was so disappointed upon entry to the room.  It reeked of cat urine.  We were moved to another room where an attempt to cover another foul mystery odor was made with copious application of Lysol.  We paid for the stay with Starwood points.  I cannot fathom that either Starwood or Sheraton would associate their names with such a run down, dirty "hotel".

Summary Heading: Should Not be Classified as "Sheraton" level
Summary: Of all the Sheratons that we have stayed at around the world this would have to be the most disappointing. Of the standard level of "Sheraton" service, this hotel seems to be lacking in most, if it was reclassified to a lower level SPG brand it would not be as disappointing. Maybe it is a USA vs. rest of the world issue?  The hotel really needs an upgrade. Whilst the pool areas is fine and good for families, the rest of the hotel is not in great repair and it has a mouldy smell. If you are staying in an Executive Club Room you have to pay for beverages in the lounge. The rooms are serviceable, the breakfast area is good for kids. There is a bus that takes people every half hour to Disneyland. This hotel is away from the "strip".   Ok, the good - the hotel is possibly a good

This is our second time and this resort. The first time we stayed we had a great trip in an updated room. This time there was 5 of us travelling and we asked for 2 adjoining rooms. We got what we asked for but this time we were in the old section of the hotel. The rooms were big and very outdated.  The bathrooms were tiny and everything in need of fixing. The doors were falling off the fridge and the moulding around the room was just laying on the floor.  We also asked for a late checkout because our plane wasn't leaving until 8 pm. All week every staff member we talked to told us how quiet they were so we were expecting no problem. The lady at the front desk was quick to tell us that there was no late check out and that they needed our rooms.  There were only 5 rooms being used

Picked it after a long price comparison on trip advisor and bookings.com, price wise it was a tie between the Hyatt and this one. The exterior look, free shuttle and cheaper parking settled it. When I arrived it did not disappoint all choosing point were vaild and it looked great from the outside the kids liked a lot the two level design was great with no stairs and elevator waits (I was on the ground floor) parking was huge and plenty of exit/entrance points near ur room so no long walks. The room was huge we wr 4 and fitted fine, bathroom was cramped but not unusable. It is a bit outdated 70/80 feel to it but they don't make them that big now the corridors are 2 meters wide. I had no cleanliness issues as others said and all the positive reviews were true and I faced no

If first impressions count the most - I should have left on check in. The lobby and in particular the front desk is in need of major surgery. The back wall behind the counter is pitiful, I would call the paint on the wall as nicotine yellow (and so are the clocks) the lower half is frayed carpet - who's checking this place from corporate?     The good news is the rooms are a bit better, more to the Sheraton standard. The location is also very good, as well as the staff.

Preferred hotel of choice if you are doing any Run Disney events. They have clean and spacious rooms; free shuttle to downtown disney; great and helpful staff; ample parking spaces available. Very close to Disney!

The hotel was fine. In terms of actual accomodations, it got the job done. But the proximity to Disneyland was incredible. You couldnt get much closer without being In the park. The Disney fireworks were almost directly over-head when we were watching them from the hotel.

Summary Heading: Next to Disneyland - very spacious rooms
Summary: The Location is very convienient and the Hotel has a free shuttle bus to the Disneyland entrance. The hotelrooms are very spacious. In addition, the Hotel has a Disneylandticketshop in the Lobby area. This way, you dont have to stand in line at Disneyland to get a ticket.  Friendly staff at the cozy Hotelbar and yummy 'chicken wings' !

Stayed for a week on business in July of 2013… What a funky joint with a cool history!  The room was huge!!  Dinning room, living room and a loft master bedroom.  I will say it could use some fresh paint but it didn't matter because they don't make places like this anymore.  I love the castle exterior and inner courtyards, this makes it a nice break from traditional hotels.  Front office staff were great and very helpful… but I must say, the bar and restaurant are the hidden gems!  The bartenders remembered my name and room after the first night as well as my drink of choice!  Filet Mignon and Shrimp cocktail were outstanding!!  The burger, one of the best I've ever had, anywhere in the country.  I love the place and look forward to my return!  thanks guys!

Summary Heading: Good Option Close to Disneyland Park
Summary: The location is not right across the street as many of the Disney Partner hotels are but is a very short 5 minute shuttle ride that drops you off at the many entry so definitely worth considering if you are looking for more than the usual outside hallway motel.

Summary Heading: I Love This Property but They Need to Up Their Game
Summary: Our family has been staying at this hotel for over 10 years now and love the location, the size of the rooms and the price - but this time I had several issues with our room - first the headboard has a vinyl covering that is pealing off - so it looks like a giant stain on the headboard! (Not a great initial site when you walk into your room.) Then My wife went to adjust the mirror in the bathroom and a dirty wash cloth dropped out from behind the mirror onto the counter - again a bit gross. And the final issue was with the desk. I stay at lots of Sheraton's and love their standard desk which has a pop up socket built into the desk - very convenient for charging your laptop and phone - unfortunately our desk had a hole where the socket should have been.  All three things are

Our first night at this hotel we found our room to be full of spiders. Now, I can deal with a spider here or there, but this room had dead spiders on the floor, the lamps were full of webs and spiders, they were popping out from behind the bed, coming down from the ceiling, and one almost landed on my head. When we called the desk to request a new room, we were transferre to somewhere and then disconnected. So, then we went to the front desk where staff not only laughed at us, but told us they were all sold out for the night but let they would see what they could do.  Finally, we were given a new room. An upgrade to a suite. Awesome. . . Right? Wrong! It was gross! The couch was so dirty no one wanted to touch it, let alone sleep on the pull out bed (really noisy and

This was by far the worst exeperience I've ever had, especially considering I am a gold SPG member. The staff, the front desk, the front desk manager and general manager were the worst people I've ever dealt with. SPG screwed up my reservation and the hotel staff didn't care and wouldn't help in any way. My so call upgraded room, was right next to a freeway entrance which I could hear the traffic, the carpet had stains all over it. It was disgusting and I was so turned off by the staff I left the property and refused to stay, which is nothing I've ever done in my entire life, I usually love Starwood properties. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, frequent shuttle to Disney
Summary: We really enjoyed the Sheraton Anaheim.  The shuttle departed for Disneyland very half hour which was fantastic.  We also really enjoyed the restaurant.  It was very good value and we had breakfast every day and also enjoyed 2 superb dinners when the wait at downtown disney restaurants was ridiculously long.  On a another note, our hotel room was clean, fresh, comfy bed BUT our room was so HOT!  We had to open the window to cool it down but then had to listen to freeway noise.  We tried numerous times to adjust the air conditioner, but just couldn't seem to cool it down.  If it wasn't for the hot room, it would have been faultless.  However, I would definitely return to Sheraton Anaheim next time we are going to Disneyland.

We were a bit disappointed on arrival at this hotel.  First time visit to the US, this hotel did not meet our expectation.  Nothing exciting to write about this hotel.  The room was pretty average.  This hotel really needs a major makeover.  Old carpet is smelly.  No free parking.  No free wifi in room.    You can pick up free unsecure wifi at the lobby.  For those who don't have laptops, there are a few desktop PCs at the lobby.  One or two is broken.  There are plenty of better hotels around the area.  They do offer complimentary shuttle bus service to Disneyland plus other freebies such as: in room wifi and parking.

This hotel was a pretty good value. It appears they have updated the rooms recently. The service at the front desk was helpful. I had complimentary bottled water in my room which is much appreciated. It is very close to convention center, and although I have stayed at both the Hilton and the Marriott when visiting this convention center the Sheraton will be my choice from now on.

This was our second visit here in August 2012 with family and parents in law. I was in communication with the hotel prior to my stay to ask questions re deals for SPG members and the replies were great. I also asked for similar rooms to my first stay which we're over looking the pool and view of Disney fireworks and they arranged this without question. Good shuttle service to park. Food in restaurants both for breakfast and evening meals was very good and we ate there a number of times. Kids eat free deals made it quite reasonable. We really do love this hotel but it needs a little bit of attention as it is starting to look a bit tired. Staff are excellent and very attentive. Would recommend.

Summary Heading: Stay elsewhere...hotel is not up to par...
Summary: My room was dirty, the carpets had tons of stains on them. Area around doors dirty needed to be cleaned. Even the tub was not up to par. Bed was lumpy needs to probably be replaced. Carpets in Hallways needed to be cleaned. They were totally gross. It looks like if they were cleaned that they cleaned down the middle and left the edges. Also they are worn and really need an update.   Laundry room was no more than what reminded me of a covered carport it was outside by the pool. Called one night for extra towels and it took over an hour and a half plus 3 calls to get extra towels. There was a very loud crying child and I told someone at the front desk as the child woke up in the middle of the night crying..both nights he awoke for about an hour each night plus the child gets up at

We stayed here during our trip to Disneyland last week.  It was pretty nice, clean and convenient.  The buffet breakfast is average, but the wait staff is very nice, friendly and made us happy.  The room was big, we had two queens.  The bed I shared with my husband had a big dip in the center so I was rolling to the middle all night long.  The beds were average in comfort.  There was plenty of hot water for the shower.   The biggest issue I have is the shuttle service.  They did not have enough shuttles running and they were always leaving families behind and/or asking us to put our kids up on our laps.  I don't mind putting my 8 year old on my lap for a 5 minute drive, but I'm pretty sure the teenage boy on our bus was not too pleased about it.  Twice we got to the bus queue

We stayed here for 8 nights from the 21st September and were returning for the 4th time. We were pleased to be given a King room (306) which was a great size. The wifi worked well in the reception area and the restaurant was great. I know there are a few complaints from other reviewers about the hotel looking old and maybe some of the carpets in the corridors are a bit tired looking but this would always be my choice when staying in Anaheim. My only complaint is $14 a night parking seems a little steep. Nice walk to Disney or take the free shuttle bus which works like clockwork. We will look to stay here again next year

Great family hotel and close to Disneyland – the only reason you go to Anaheim. The room was comfortable…clean but a little tired and dated. It had all the facilities that we needed and was very affordable but we were all in one room (3 kids and two adults). We dined in the restaurant one night and that was a very good meal. The pool and surrounds was nice and the laundry facilities were more than adequate. The staff throughout the hotel were helpful and courteous and getting to and from Disneyland from the hotel is very easy with a door to door shuttle.. We booked our tickets to the theme parks from the hotel, where there is a special desk and staff member who just does this. We also took a coach ride to the shopping areas (about a 50 minute bus ride) and that was free – just

I chose this hotel based on the reviews by tripadvisor devotees thank you, you did not disappoint. After a long flight and doing battle getting a rental car with "Dollar Car Rentals" we arrived, 3 kids, dad and a spent mum in tow! Was not expecting much but committed.   What welcomed us was a clean, comfortable and pleasant room, enough space for the 5 of us. Staff where always helpful and prompt.  Pool could do with solar heating no shortage of sun here and washing facilities need a door to keep the dust away when it blows, and trust me it blows!! Very happy with our say will recommend to friends;) Budget conscious families will enjoy this 31/2 star hotel.  Be careful bar is pricy BYO! ENJOY YOUR STAY

My family and I stayed here in 2008 for our first trip to disneyland. It was a great experience. Hotel was clean and people were so nice and we loved our room. So when we started to book this years trip this was my first choice of places to stay. I didn't even look at another hotel. And now as I sit here looking around this room I am wishing I had looked around a little more. First, I would like to say that the people are great. But the hotel is really starting to show it's age. The rooms are not as clean as I remember. Our second day we had to call the front desk because the shower drain was clogged. They sent a young man who pulled out a large (and gross) clump of hair and fixed that problem for us. But what really pushed me over the edge was the fact that we have killed three

Stayed 3 nights while going to Disney, 3rd Disney trip with offsite hotel.  Treated SPG Members well, it was much appreciated. There was one small issue but they made it right and were very professional.  The rooms were clean and looked like any typical Sheraton.  The shuttle left the hotel every 30 minutes and picked up at the park every 30 minutes too. Used the shuttle 8 times total for one-way trips, on time every time!  if you want to walk, its only 15 minutes down Disneyland Dr.  Overall good stay, would recommend.

This was our second stay at Sheraton Anaheim, previously in 2011, and both stops were made during a road trip.  With a car we found it easy to visit lots of places in Orange County and central LA.  Also spent a little time by the pool which was nice for chilling.  Self-service laundry facilities near the pool were very useful.  Corridor areas feel a little tired but generally as a base it was perfect; good breakfast, which was included in our room price though don't believe this is always the case.  Had a very nice dinner one evening in the restaurant.  All staff were very helpful and friendly. If you're not in Disney then it is good to watch the Disney fireworks display from the front of the hotel.  We found the shuttle bus to the park to be a very efficient and regular service.

Summary Heading: Never judge a book by its cover
Summary: What an awful experience.  We stayed at this hotel for the Disneyland Half Marathon weekend.  We had tried to get a room at one of the resort hotels, but they were already full, so we booked this hotel through the Disneyland website.  My husband made the reservation.  Our toddler and I decided to head out to the park for the Friday with the plan that my husband would come out and meet us when he was done with work that evening.  It was 100° and by the time we made the walk to the hotel, my daughter and I were hot and thirsty.  I went to check in and the person at the front desk told me that I couldn’t check in because the reservation was in my husband’s name.  I said that I had the confirmation email and credit card with which had been used to pay.  They told me that because we

Summary Heading: Showing its age but still good value
Summary: We visited the hotel on business for 3 nights due to its location and price. We arrived around 9.30 and were checked in with the minimum of fuss. Having a large amount of luggage, I was concerned about the fact that the elevator only went to the 2nd floor and my room was on the 3rd - a hotel staff member was available to help with the bags however. The hotel corridors are very dated - carpet is threadbare in some places and has a damp, musty odour as you get further from the main lobby however the room I had was large and clean if a little dated. My room was on the highway side of the hotel so the road noise, combined with the very loud aircon meant I had to sleep with earplugs for the duration of my stay. As we had been travelling for over 14 hours we headed to the bar for a

Summary Heading: Worth it for the view of the Disney fireworks alone (if you get the right room)
Summary: We stayed here in last year as part of our daughter’s 18th birthday celebration tour of the West coast.    Be warned there are two Sheratons in Anaheim and sat navs have been known to get it wrong – it took our taxi driver 20 minutes to find the correct one.    From the outside the hotel seems to be  a quirky mix of olde England  and 70s architecture but who cares about architecture when you are on Disney’s doorstep – and this after all was the reason for our stay?   Again with the other hotels on our tour I had emailed them in advance of advise that our stay was part of a birthday celebration and asking for an upgrade.  In fact when we booked this hotel we had requested a room which would enable us to view the Disney fireworks.  On checking in I was disappointed to discover

Staff were very helpful, especially Gary at the concierge desk, nothing was too much trouble.  We had a pool view room which was great as the rooms on the other side overlook the parking lot.  To our surprise it wasn't noisy either as we were right next door to the elevator.  Breakfast had a variety and loads on the plate.  A lot of families stayed at the hotel, as it is only about a 10 minute walk to Disneyland.  There are also a few restaurants around the area within walking distance so no need to drive for dinner which we like.  Rooms themselves were very roomy and clean, it was a great stay, we were there for 8 night and I could have stayed longer.

was starting to hit the expiration date on plat upgrades.  got a nice suite.  good club lounge and room service.  def looks like a long walk to the dl park.  but good value.  Interior pool rooms could be noisy.

Despite the older facade, this Sheraton hotel is quite comfortable and provides very spacious rooms to their guests.  We stayed here for a weekend stay at Disneyland and were pleased with the room.  Since this hotel is quite large and a bit older, the rooms go down several hallways that are a bit of a trek from the front desk or elevator that you take up to the other floors.  There is a club wing where guests who pay for the club service are able to eat and drink in their private lounge.  We stayed in their standard 2 queen bed room that was on a far off wing.  Here is the breakdown of the stay:  Upon inspection the room was well kept.  There were no signs of dust on the picture frames, lamps, behind the TV, or in any of the sleeping and restroom areas.  The remote was not

Was it a fluke it was that hot in Anaheim when I visited?  Not really.  The fluke was the humidity.  I've stayed twice now at the Sheraton Anaheim. (please note there are two Sheraton's close  together and the name of this hotel is Sheraton Anaheim)  On both occasions I've been left with a bad feeling about my stay.  You see the rooms are absolutely beautiful inside and very plush with plenty of room for storage however the walls are particularly thin so every conversation at the pool, rooms next door and above you are heard as if they are in your room.  Strangely this doesn't bother me too bad.  What does bother me though is the quality of standards I've come to expect at a Sheraton.  This was in no way what I felt I received in relation to anything outside of my room. There is

I haven't stayed at this property for over 3 years.  It was apparent that they have not maintained the area or done any improvements during that time.  We used a AAA discount which helped soften the blow of our final bill.  The employees were all very nice but the property suffers from wear and tear.  The building we were in was HOT, no ventilation in the hallways, the carpet by the elevator was puckering in several spots, the elevators were HOT and slow, the pool deck was cracked and missing paint in several areas.  Pool did not offer enough umbrellas and the water was "cloudy".  Our room was not as clean as we are used too...pubic hair in the bathroom, large coffee like stains under the sink and the toilet was streaked with rust lines, the window was spotty and had spider webs

Summary Heading: Friendly and clean hotel across from the magic
Summary: I was very surprised by the hospitality and service of this hotel. On the outside, the hotel looks old and outdated. But the rooms have been renovated and are very big. I had a very comfortable king size bed. I will definitely stay there again.

I just got home from spending a weekend at the Sheraton across from Disneyland. It was the perfect location if you are going to enjoy any Disney activities. It was only about 10 minutes to walk to Downtown Disney and the parks. The hotel itself was comfy and clean, room service was quick, and the pool was simple but nice. Would definitely stay here again:)

We just stayed at anaheim sheraton this weekend for the Run disney 1/2 marathon. The hotel was very clean. The pool and spa were nice. There was an employee at the pool every day to make sure the area stayed nice, neat and clean. Our room was spacious and was cleaned daily. The complimentary water bottles were a nice treat. The location was at the north end of disneyland with a good view of the fireworks and seemed to explode overhead which I thought was very cool. No good views here of the theme park except for the fireworks. 1/2 mile walk to downtown disney. The hotel shuttle ran to and from disneyland every 30 mins. The game room was nice for the kids. I would stay here again.

I love this hotel!  I always stay here and enjoy the cleanliness and guest service.  My daughter loves the pool area and the coi pond.  The bartenders and restaurant servers are very friendly and the food was above average.  Watching the Disney fireworks by the pool was very enjoyable for the entire family.  There is a "Disney" feel to this hotel without being cheesy, probably because of the castle out front.  This is a well run hotel and I will continue to come back.

We've been coming to this same hotel every time we visit Disneyland. The staff is always very friendly and helpful, rooms are always clean, and, it's always full. Guess others enjoy it too !!! Yes, the hotel might need a little updating but for it's closeness to the park and the FREE shuttle service, it works out great. Plus, you can watch the fireworks from the front parking area !

Great hotel close to Disney.  I was here on business but enjoyed my stay here.  The beds were very comfortable, room was clean, and the staff very friendly.  My only complaint is that I wish they would replenish the coffee condiments.  I only had sugar and cream on my first day, nothing more after that.

I have to admit I was a little wary about staying at this property.  When I booked my reservations back in May, the reviews were mostly positive about this hotel.  However, the day before we were to leave for a 6 night stay I checked the reviews with Tripadvisor  and all the recent reviews were horrible.  I almost cancelled my reservation.  I decided we would stay the first night and if it was too bad we would change hotels.  We had an AWESOME trip!!  We arrived around noon and were able to check in immediately to our room.  They upgraded us (no charge, we are Starwood Preferred guests) to a deluxe room.  We also had a rollaway as we have to young adult boys who didn't want to share a bed.  There was plenty of room even with the rollaway. They put us on the ground floor with an

A friend and I stayed here for two nights during the D23 expo. We spent minimal time at the hotel (we were basically just there to sleep) but I was really impressed with the experience. The room was absolutely enormous, almost to the point of being too big (if that's possible). You could easily fit multiple people on air mattresses if necessary. And I loved how the bathroom area was on the other side of a dividing wall from the rest of the room, so that someone could have the lights on in the bathroom without disturbing the others in the room. Check in was really easy and the shuttle to Disneyland was great, we only waited about 5 minutes for it. The only thing I didn't like was that they charge $14 for parking, which seemed a little excessive. I would definitely stay here again.

Visited with family from Australian for our first Disneyland visit and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Sheraton. Highlight of the hotel is the landscaping and design of the premises. Very pleasant sitting areas and features and very cosy lobby with fireplace to wind down after long shifts at Disneyland. Highlights of the stay are definitely the presentation of the resort, internet fee in the lobby only, efficient shuttles to and from Disney (spot on most of the time and not too full) and the buffet breakfast. Breakfast was not included in our package but found it to be reasonably priced (in comparison to Aussie prices that is) Not too fussed about (not many lowlights) the rooms, which were quite simple but adequate and location is not the best. If you don't have a car you are

This sheraton looks a little old. Carpets should be changed. The service is good, but the room service is very poor. There is NO true continental breakfast that every one can expect in a sheraton. I'm fed up with the chemical disgusting breakfast. Rooms are large, but bathroom were durty, with calch inside the tube and on the taps. Rooms are noisy because of A/C and the traffic, too noisy. One other bad point, is the plug. Plugs are so old, thatyou cannot plug your laptop or phone to charge them, exceptif you have adaptor and some mechanical device to block it. One other review describes very well this issue. Internet is charged. It seems that the management does not understand that we are in2013, and that every guest expects to be connected. The self parking is nice andthe

Stayed here with my family multiple times a year for almost 10 years. We love Disneyland. But the latest stay will be the last at this hotel. First, the good. It's a Sheraton (even if just on the exterior and lobby area). Beds are comfortable. Pool is decent. Free shuttle to and from the Parks. I got sick eating from their restaurant a few yrs ago so haven't been back. Now the Bad. 1) Hotel is showing its age. Peeled paint, cracks on walls and fixtures I can overlook. But I couldn't ignore the old dirty carpets in the hallways and room, the grimy bathtub with hair on arrival. Towels are not Sheraton grade - they feel rough and not clean looking. We had one little bottle of shampoo each day. Service was slow and staff was not polite or helpful. They looked like they didn't want

Summary Heading: Needs a lot of improvement !  but I will be back
Summary: My family and I have been coming to this hotel for the past 8 yrs and as the years go by the Hotel has gotten worse when it comes to cleanliness. Last couple times we been at the Hotel the Rooms are dirty not the work the ladies/men do to vacuum and dusting and such, I am talking about the Deep cleaning, Carpet was disgusting, Furniture was real bad spots all over the sofas and the smell in the Room was not really pleasant.   On the other hand we come to this Hotel because is closest to Disneyland, the Food is awesome specially the Morning Buffet my kids love it!   Service is excellent, that is the one thing that motivates us to come back.   When mention to the Person on the counter about the carpet and Furniture he gave us a small discount for out trouble, I was not expecting

Summary Heading: Great proximity, but could use some upgrades
Summary: This hotel is literally across the street from the parks. A 15 min walk and we had a GREAT view of the fireworks show at night from our room. The space could definitely use some upgrades though. The mattresses aren't up to the Sweet Slumber beds that Sheraton typically has, there was a HUGE stain on the carpet (which was 'covered up' by 2 trash bins, maneuvering with a stroller with the stairs and elevators was a bit tedious. All of the staff was extremely polite and friendly though! We would still stay here in the future and would recommend to our friends with children, but upgrades would help.

I recently stayed here for 5 nights with my family while we visited Disneyland and Universal Studios.  I agree with the reviews below that this hotel is old.  The rooms, carpet, etc., are old and dingy feeling.  We paid just over $200 a night, after taxes and parking fees, etc.  For that price, I expected more.  This hotel felt like a $59 a night place, not a $200+ a night place.  The positives - the restaurant on site is good.  Food is decent.  But again, it is overpriced for what you get.  Our family of 5 ate here 2 nights and each night the bill was right around $175 before tip.  That's alot for 2 adults and 3 kids.  Also, you can see the Disney fireworks from the hot tub / pool, which is really cool.  You don't get the music, and the low height bursts aren't visible, but you

The staff were great.  Carol at the front desk even said that our status with SPG allowed us to upgrade to the best rooms available.  We choose not to, due to having 3 rooms together on the same floor worked out better for us.  The standard rooms were huge and incredibly quite.  The hotel is older, but updated and clean.  The beds were comfortable. The bad - the bathroom is small with the shower, toilet and sink all in the same room.  This made it hard for more than one person at a time to get ready to go out.  It would have been nice to have the sink, or a second one, outside of the bathroom.  In all 3 of our rooms the showers did not drain properly and you were standing in ankle deep water.  Besides the bathroom everything else in the room was great.  We had breakfast

Summary Heading: The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly
Summary: THE GOOD: *The rooms are larger than most hotels. *The grounds/outside are well kept. *The beds are comfy *The shuttle drivers were nice and accommodating.   THE BAD: *This hotel screams 1970's. From the popcorn ceiling to the gold ornate bathroom doorknobs. Vintage and not in a good way. *Our room wasn't clean. The carpet very obviously hadn't been vacuumed in our room, there were little bits of things on the floor.  We asked them to come vacuum and I think they may have while we were out for dinner, but it didn't look much better. *The curtains and chair in the room were stained. *There was hair in the drawers and on the towels. *The shuttles are old and crappy. I literally saw duct tape all over the ceiling in one of them.  Once evening we got on one and it smelled so

Let me start by saying that the service is what is expected from a Sheraton. It's location is perfect just across the street from Disneyland. However, the property is in desperate need of a remodel. The carpets were stained and the room smelled bad when we arrived. Opened the windows (nice feature) and turned on the AC and it cleared up the smell. Went to plug my phone in and none of the outlets in the room would hold the plug in for a charging session. Ended up charging in the bathroom. Not a bad option, except it is isolated from the rest of the room.

This hotel is very close to Disney and is reaping benefits.  The hotel room rates are what you would expect from a Sheraton.  The one thing that threw me off was they wanted to charge me 14/night for parking.  When I asked why I was told "If Mickey gets to charge you parking, so do we".  He also told me that if they don't charge parking, visitors at Disneyland would be parking in their lot for free.  I understand that part but if you want to stop people from using parking lot of purposes other than staying at your hotel, use the gates and key swipe you already have on the premises to enforce guest parking.  Don't loot the poor families visiting your hotel for a vacation because you are so close.  The rooms are clean but old, the hotel is a maze.  The club lounge for platinum

The staff here are ultra courteous, friendly and professional.  The room next door to mine got very loud about 1:30 A.M. two nights in a row.  I phoned the front desk and someone came up right away and took care of it.  The restaurant serves very good food, and the deli is open lat to accommodate a late return fro Disneyland.  The food, the room, the pool, the grounds, the shuttle service and the smiling staff made my stay most pleasant!

Summary Heading: Dont stay here! Dirty and our car got broken into!
Summary: We go to Disneyland every year and stay for a whole week because we meet our California family there.  We have stayed in several of the hotels around ball and Katella and this was my worst stay so far.  I will be brief to described so you read the full review.   I am not a picky intolerant person, in fact is the other way.  I do travel a lot and most of the time forget to write reviews, I just do it when they exceed expectations. But this went very bad, so I need to warn people.   1- The worst: our car was broken into while parked in the hotel and the 3rd row seats were stolen. Managament could care less, Security guard said, unfortunately we had this happen here before.  Management never follow up with us.  When checking out, this was brought up to another manager, who said,

Summary Heading: Great Hotel For A Disneyland Vacation
Summary: The staff are very friendly and the hotel is clean with spacious rooms and nice amenities. Beside being a Sheraton with all of the things you expect out of the brand the complimentary Disneyland shuttle service makes this hotel a no brainer for your Disneyland vacation. The shuttles run all day long every 30min back and forth to the park. We wont even consider staying at another hotel and we visit Disneyland ~2 times a year.   Considerations: Wifi is ~$10 per device for 24hrs. (AT&T customers will be able to access the network for free however) The restaurant and bar are a bit on the expensive side. (but there is a small general store in the lobby which has sandwiches and snacks).  There is an additional nightly fee for parking. While some of the areas of the hotel were recently

We have stayed at this hotel 3-4 times - always with our kids, for our Disneyland trip. The things we love about it: very close to Disneyland and they provide a free shuttle, breakfast at the restaurant every morning - not expensive and super convenient, and lastly the rates are so reasonable! it's also very cute in its design and clean and has nice garden views - also the rooms are unusually specious - very comfy for a family with 2 kids and lots of stuff. Definitely will come here very time we make a trip to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: More of a motel instead of a hotel
Summary: The time has come and gone long ago for this shell of a hotel. The outside is rundown faded with many missing shingles. The inside is worse and they do not even try to make things better. Was excited of the location of the hotel but they was quickly gone. The layout of the hotel is very confusing when we finally arrived to our room through the cleaning chemical scented hallways we were greated by a clean outdated room that smelled very moldy and musky , opening the aluminum windows 1/2 an inch did not help. Furniture , bedding, closet doors and bathroom looked close to 30 years old, hence a motel.  Could not stay in room due to odor and front desk did not attempt to do anything. All front desk personnel looked half alseep and non attentive. Really could have put a damper on our

We recently stayed here for the proximity to the Disneyland resort.  We had the 2 queen bed room.  The room was a decent size but the carpet and walls were so dirty I wouldn't let my kids walk around without shoes or dare to lay on the carpet!  The rooms were ok, little refrigerator, cable, small bath, not updated.  The pool was fine, nothing fancy but pretty clean and lots of fresh towels.  The hotel is really close to Disneyland and offers a Free (don't forget to tip the wonderful drivers) shuttle to and from Disney.  It is not a large shuttle and sometimes at the 9:45 shuttle it was so full you had to wait for the next shuttle at 10:15 so I suggest you try to catch earlier unless you don't mind waiting.  The parking is $14/day, wifi is $10/day and not very fast.  There is a

The lobby is nice and the staff is friendly and helpful. That's where it ends. The carpet smells like mildew in the hallways. Our bathtub was filthy and the bathroom ceiling had mold that had been painted over. Under the bed, we found an old French fry, a fruit roll up wrapper and a used condom!!!!!! I am an SPG member, and I opted to pay more money to stay at a different hotel just to get out of this place. The shuttle is nice, but that doesn't make this place worth staying in for the lack of cleanliness that you receive. I travel frequently for business and I have certainly seen my share of bad hotels. This one ranks very high on the list of the worst hotels I've stayed in and I will never stay here again.

I asked for the quietest room in the hotel when I made my reservation.  Upon arrival, I was informed that my room has been upgraded.  I was very surprised and pleased, of course, because an upgrade means something of a better quality.  My "quieter" room located next to the exit door on the first floor, with windows facing a very busy intersection on Disneyland Road.  Between people constantly slamming the doors and police activity, I was trying to complete a very important project, which required the utmost concentration.    The furniture and the towels in the suite were unpleasantly "not fresh".  There is no full length mirror in the suite.  There was a huge dirty stain in the living room.  Because I was unable to close the drapes, I had to stay without any light in the bedroom

This is my first pick hotel for the Anaheim area, and has been for the last nine years. First, the cost is reasonable, especially if you make your reservations early. If you are part of Sheratons SPG club you also usually get a very large room. Next, the breakfast buffet is also very reasonable at $14/person (less for children) ...if you have teenage children you will appreciate the breakfast buffet...and it opens early, which is nice if you are catching an early shuttle to Disney which is only a few minutes away. The shuttles are well managed and run on time every half hour. If one is filled then another is called into service. Another plus to this hotel is its location which is on the backside of Disney which means every night you have perfect viewing of the Disney 20 minute

DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Booked this hotel for my wife and children for our family vacation to Southern California and our room was on the second floor. From the outside it looks like a castle and is very appealing, especially for families. Once inside, the lobby O.K. but dirty carpet and outdated. Once checked in and walking to rooms- you notice the filth increasing & a creepy feeling ( think ' The Shining' ). Carpet is black from dirt in areas and smells of mold and rot. In room- more heavy mold smells & cigarette smoke although we booked SMOKE FREE room. Dirty fingerprints on doors, mirrors, and walls. Hairs in sink, tub, and GIANT black dirty hairball in bathroom air vent. Found more black hairs inside the sheets of the bed when we tried to go to sleep. Saw

Stayed here for 3 nights last week.  Chose it for the proximity to Disney and cute decor.  We had a 2 Queen room and it was really big with a good-sized bathroom, overlooking the rose garden (though we couldnt see because a tree blocked our window).  Had tried to use suite night upgrades (Platinum with SPG) but the hotel was full so we didn't get one, but the room worked well for us.  The beds were very comfortable and had fluffy pillows.  It was mostly clean but there were bugs in the hallways (open windows) and it looks like they hadnt vacummed the hallways in months.   The hotel is slightly outdated and worn, but it was still nice looking.  The layout was definitely confusing.  It took us like 10 minutes to find the club lounge because if you go down the wrong hallway, it's

Summary Heading: Good hotel with just a few annoyances
Summary: Pros: large rooms, comfortable beds, free shuttle to Disneyland twice an hour, friendly staff  Cons: thin connecting doors - hear what's going on next door and lose sleep, old carpets, some stains on walls, $14 per day of parking with no street parking available, $10 per day for WiFi, $13 for breakfast

Have stayed at Sheraton Anaheim many times now. The staff are brilliant and many of them have been there for a long time which makes me believe that they are well treated by the Sheraton. Some things that could be better in my opinion is that it should have free wi-fi internet in the bedrooms like most similar hotels. The carparking should be included in the price. The coffee in the Deli is over-priced when you consider many hotels offer it complimentary in their lobbies. Once again I would like to thank Zeke for his great service in the dining room at breakfast he is so efficient and enthusiastic.

We had a great time!  We loved the shuttle to the parks and the friendliness of the employees.   We appreciated the daily supply of bottled water, too  Our one negative comment would be that the pool is NOT child friendly.  It is too deep immediately for children, and it goes to 9 feet.  Children must be held at all times, even our 7 year old.  The children who swim still shouldn't be left alone in the pool.

Summary Heading: Great location near Disney.  Solid family hotel.
Summary: Our family of 6 spent 3 nights at this solid mid-range hotel while we visited DisneyLand and other Anaheim attractions.  The location is excellent:  right on the main avenue within a 5 minute drive to Disney with plenty of good restaurants close by as well.    The property is modern and nicer (in our opinion) than the other Sheraton in Anaheim which is slightly closer to Disney.  The standard rooms were larger than normal and recently renovated.  The shuttles to and from Disney were right on time and easy to find (top and middle of hour coming back and 15 and 45 past the hour going) though you do pay a $3 charge per family member per day.  Still, it beats parking at Disney time wise and unless your family is a big one cost wise as well.  They have a well maintained, functional

Summary Heading: Ticked most of my boxes but could have been better
Summary: Stayed in the hotel with my family during a visit to Disneyland. Rooms were clean and nicely furnished but could have been slightly better maintained (wardrobe doors kept coming off their tracks). Apart from that, all the staff were very polite, pleasant and efficient, especially the shuttle bus drivers and the waiters in the restaurant but the management needs to put more staff on the front desk to make sure they can deal with their card holders in a timely manner. Only other negative issue my family experienced was an unanswered but acknowledged e-mail to the hotel before our trip!

Summary Heading: My advice?  Do not stay here or if you do beware ... !!!!!!!!
Summary: I am absolutely appalled at the level of service I was given and I am a gold Starwood member. It took me 30 minutes to book my reservation, yes THIRTY minutes.  Annoying, but since the agent clearly stated that it included breakfast for my husband, myself, and my son I thought it was a good deal.  I asked for my itinerary to be e-mailed, and since I didn't receive it by the next day, I called back and asked for it again.  This time I received it, but no note about breakfast so I called back, and SURPRISE no breakfast!  I advised of the conversation, and was told that they would have to go back to the recording of the booking.  Again, annoying, and not good customer service in my opinion, but I knew it was in there so I waited for a reply .. and waited ... and waited ... nothing.
Manager Response: I have previously apologized for the inconvenieces you experienced communicating with Starwood Hotels Central Reservation Office and the Sheraton Anaheim. Unfortunately you made your reservation through Sheraton's Hotels Prefered Guest reservation desk since your first night was on points staying for free.  That does not allow the hotel to change your reservation. I attempted to advise you of this fact but was unable to due to your elevated voice inflection that did not allow me to speak. It is unfortunate that at times it is necessary to advise a guest that if they do not stop yelling in will be necessary to end the conversation but it does happen. You review is unfair to the Sheraton Anaheim since you made and were confirmed a reservation that did not include breakfast. In the past 8 years the Sheraton Anaheim has had over 90,000 guest rooms occupied by Sheraton Prefered Guests stayimg for free on points and not one of them had breakfast included with their accomodations. I apologize but the Sheraton Anaheim is an innocent victim in this situation.

Summary Heading: Great value & close to Disneyland: my family would go back
Summary: Top 5 things my kids and I liked: 1. Super-comfy beds with expensive soft linens and seemingly new mattresses 2. Large, luxuriously decorated clean room 3. Beautifully landscaped property with flowers 4. Mini fridge in the room & two free bottles of water every day of our stay 5. The free shuttle service to & from Disneyland rocked.  On the 4th of July, around 10 p.m. they began running them continuously, instead of on the half hour to accommodate everyone with very, very nice staff Top 5 things we did not like: 1.  No free wi-fi in the rooms or by the pool (silly) 2. No concierge services (staff seemed perplexed about our request for advice about the best affordable way to go to Newport Beach for the day).  Thankfully, the bellman had a brochure, which I read.  (Bottom line: we

We booked 2 rooms to visit Disneyland as a 3 generation family and got large adjoining rooms. The rooms were well equipped and i appreciated the free bottled water. The pool is a good size and very clean. The staff were great, always friendly and helpful. I had a minor issue with my bill that was handled immediately to my satisfaction. The only complaint is the shuttles. Some of the busses are in rough shape and they're not air conditioned. They were always on time though and the drivers were helpful and friendly.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel and close to Disneyland
Summary: We chose this hotel because the other Sheraton was sold out. I used points and have platinum status so I was able to take advantage of the perks at this hotel (free internet, welcome gift which was either 500 pts or a stuffed disney char, and access to the concierge lounge). The rooms were sizable and what I expected for a Sheraton. They do charge for parking so I recommend that you just use their free disney shuttle. We made the mistake of thinking the disney parking was closer the 2nd day, we were wrong. It was still far enough that you had to take a shuttle. The property seems quiet and has a lot of travelers for Disney. I'm not sure why else you would stay here except for the theme park. A huge plus was the store in the lobby which has commodities/snacks and is open until

We always stay at one of the Disney hotels but our out of town guests didn't want to spend the exorbitant prices to do so.  I was told about this hotel and I am forever grateful! It was a 1/3 the price of the least expensive Disney hotels, it was clean, the staff was lovely, and they had a free shuttle that took is back and forth dropping us right at the entrances for both parks. I highly recommend this hotel and I will probably stay there from now on too!

We recently stayed at this hotel and were impressed with how close to Disneyland it was. The free shuttle service is a plus and they are available frequently enough to ensure we were well supported   We were a family of four so the rooms were a good size meeting our needs.   The beds and pillows were very comfortable and allowed for a really good nights sleep!  The venue is quite dated however and hallways not vacuumed everyday. I would also question how secure the block at the rear is given the easy access to both the building and floors.  The staff were very friendly at check in and the concierge supportive of our requirements regarding our visit to Disneyland.

I highly recommend this hotel For both families and business travelers. The staff is fantastic. Especially cynthia, sherri and jose in the lounge! The rooms are clean and spacious and the manager Ken Buksa is one of the best in the business.   Sincerely   Scott cardwell

The hotel has a big lobby compared to others. My 10 year-old son loved the pool. It has a decent restaurant and bakery/coffee shop. We had a regular guest room but it is bigger than a typical hotel guest room. The gated hotel parking lot is huge. Kolby and Selene from the bakery are very professionals and always helpful. The free wifi at the lobby sometimes doesn't  work - it lets my smartphone to connect to their network but can't access the internet. But it worked just fine sometimes.
