Do I have to pay for roaming charges to my service provider if there is available free wifi? Not a big deal for people who doesn't shares memories through social networking. Foods at the restaurant are good. Restaurant servers are very friendly and helpful. It was a good stay overall.

Went to California for a family members graduation and took advantage to make it a vacation too. This hotel was PERFECT for our needs. Family lived in Laguna Niguel just a short distance from hotel, Disneyland only a mile away(they provided free shuttles for that)and all the other attractions we seen (Midway, San Quan Capistrano, Disneyland,Catalina Island and Hollywood) were all a day trip. Perfect location. Now the hotel .......... our rooms were large! Loved the way the bathroom and dressing room was private from the bedroom. Beds were comfortable and first and foremost the rooms were very clean. Staff were wonderful and very helpful. Pool and grounds were beautiful. The only drawback was that there wasn't anywhere close by to eat.(Of course you could eat there.)If you don't

We stayed here in May 2013 two couples aged 26-29. The hotel is very clean, well layed out and spacious. 2 minutes from Disneyland where they provide a free shuttle bus to and from daily.  The Rooms were HUGE! Great if travelling as a family. We got a reasonable rate for the 2 nights so well worth it as a choice.  There was free wifi in lobby area. We ate dinner in the restaurant - very tasty! Overall Great and would return.

Summary Heading: A average hotel with limited options other than going to Disneyland.
Summary: This is a very basic hotel appropriate for daily trips to Disneyland or California Adventure only. The shuttle leaves every 30mins to & from the park entrance. All staff was friendly and helpful. The upper floor room I stayed in was very oversized easily accommodating 2 queens. The bathroom however was oddly undersized and a bit annoyed my tub had a slow drain despite it being serviced. Overall the hotel and room was clean despite it felt outdated from lack of day lighting and 1980's interior finish combinations. On my stay I encountered ice machines on my floor almost always empty. I wished the hotel offered a free shuttle service to Downtown Disney, or to the Anaheim Garden Walk to enable guest to have options other than Disneyland. I also wished the exercise room did not

Summary Heading: Don't waste your money on a club room!
Summary: I had booked a club room with this special deal and when I got there, they had no record of it.  Ok, I accept the fact that I probably made that mistake, but instead of helping me, they connected me with the Sheraton 800 number where I spent the next 30 minutes on the phone.  They of course no longer had the same deal available.  I booked a club room assuming like in every other hotel it included breakfast, all day beverages and an evening managers reception.  When we went to the room, the young woman said they have a 2 hour break in the middle of the day.  The managers reception did not include wine, or beer.  You could purchase it.  The breakfast was fruit and cereal.  This was not worth the $40 extra I paid for my room.  The walls were also paper thin where I could hear the
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding the value of the Club Lounge at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel. Cost to be upgraded to the Club Room is $30.00 total or $10.00 per person based on three people in the party like yours. Continental Breakfast includes Sliced Fresh Fruits, Yogurt, Granola, Whole Fresh Fruit, Bagels & Cream Cheese, Breakfast Pastries, Assorted Cold Cereals, Assorted Breakfast Breads with Toaster and Starbucks Coffee and Fruit Juices.With three people in your party your cost is $5.00 a person for breakfast. Happy Hour include Two Hot Appetizers, Cheese & Fruit Display, Vegetable Display and Cocktail Snacks. Both period include complimentary non alcoholic beverages for the entire day. This again is at a cost of only $5.00 a person. We do close for two hours in the afternoon to properly clean and restock the Club Lounge and I apologize for that. All Sheraton Club Lounges are perceived as a Great Value and I am disappointed that you do not feel the same way. Thank you for bringing your concerns to my attention as it will make me try harder to please future guests of the Sheraton Anaheim.

Summary: This hotel is so clean.    The grounds are beautiful.  They are well manicured. We watched the fireworks at Disneyland while sitting out by their pool.  The staff is friendly and nice.  The shuttle to Disneyland ran every 15 minutes.  The room was very spacious so we didn't feel cramped.  My family also loved the pictures of castles in the hall ways.  It was a nice place to stay while visiting Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Only stay here if you are going to Disney.
Summary: We are currently staying at the Anaheim Sheraton Hotel in Anaheim Ca.  Overall, it's a very OK hotel.  The rooms are OK, the food is Ok... The location is OK.  If we weren't going to Disney for two days, there would be no reason to stay here.

Summary Heading: Sheraton Anaheim big rip off with WiFi!!
Summary: Just returned from a 3 night family vacation at Disneyland. The hotel was nice with large rooms. There was 4 of us and the rooms were good size and we didn't feel crowded. They were nice and quiet, away from the highways and traffic. The staff was accommodating. Now for the negative. With 4 us in the room we all had our own devices which required wifi. We logged on to see that the charge was 9.95 per day. By the time we checked out we noticed they charged us per device per day which became over 100.00 dollars.! Also since we had a car, why do we need to pay 14.00 a day to park in their own parking lot? By the time you pay for your room, plus room tax and add up all the other fees, it was a very expensive hotel!! Plus the food there at the restaurant was way over priced!! No
Manager Response: Thank you for noting your concerns regarding your stay at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel. The $14.00 that is charged for parking is the lowest parking fee of any major hotel in the Disneyland Resort area. Free Wi-Fi is available for all guests in all publice area in the main lobby. Four computers with the latest technology are also available for guest use at no charge. Thank you for staying Sheraton and we appreciate your business. Ken Buksa, General Manager.

Summary Heading: Nice family hotel close to disneyland
Summary: The hotel is very nice for a family type place. It had a cute castle theme look on the outside but inside felt like a medium/high end business hotel with a nice lobby, pool and restaurant. The attraction is obviously Disneyland and there are free shuttles to get you to the park. The rooms are well appointed and large. The place is very clean and the service is good. The only negative is the location of the hotel bordering a large freeway. Other then that it is a nice place for a family.

We just returned from a 1 night stay. Check in was very easy.  Friendly staff.  The room was HUGE and clean.  We were on the first floor with a garden view.  Room was very quiet.  Great air conditioning.  We got a package with breakfast buffet which was very good.  Unfortunately did not use pool but hope to on a later tip.  Best part is the free shuttle to Disney!  We will stay here again.

We enjoyed out stay at Sheraton! The room was clean and quiet, short distance to the parks and a free shuttle! Every night we enjoyed fireworks right in front of our window! Restaurant food was great too! Beautiful gardens outside. We highly recommend this hotel for your next Disney visit!

I booked this hotel due to location. I've stayed in the area several times in the past but never saw this property. We stayed 7 nights and had a great time. The front desk clerk was one of the nicest people I've met travelling in a long time. She greeted us warmly and even held out for a 3rd floor room with a view of the pool and fireworks...PERFECT location! I travelled with my three kids and they all enjoyed the hotel as well. Location was great and the free shuttle to Disney was a blessing! Watch as other properties charge for their shuttle. My only complaint was that we tried to hook up our camera to view movies from the day on the TV but they had it locked out. Maintnenance told us they dont allow you to watch your own movies or videos so they can charge you for

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with free shuttle to Disneyland
Summary: My family and I stayed here for 1 night, we got early checked in after arrived at 11 am and took the free shuttle to Disneyland. The hotel is huge with garden setting, lobby is nice and big. Lots of sitting area with free wifi. The room was large and clean, the bathroom was small comparison to other Sheraton hotel but for the purpose of our say it was fine.  The hotel carpet shows its age but for the location, we don't care, we are very satisfied. The staffs at check in were very nice, they show us where to park so we do not have to walk far after check in. we have  a few hours before departure the next day and she gave us late checked out until 4 pm so we took the shuttle to down Disney to eat and shop for a few hours.  Will stay there again next time we visit Disneyland.

Stayed here as part of a Virgin Flydrive and were not disappointed.  We had a huge room for our 2 night stay and no issues at all.  Bit of a drive into LA but that was the only let down.  Pleasant hotel in a nice area.

The rooms are old, not as clean as other Sheraton hotel and definitely need more maintainance. However the lobby and surrounding areas are quite ok and we actually enjoy taking pictures there. Service is not that good as one of the waiter in the restaurant was arguing with my uncle during breakfast and actually charged us for breakfast although it's included as his kind of revenge. Luckily I checked the bill and complaint big time to remove those bills.

nice to get more than you expected from a hotel this close to the Disney parks. Usually the hotel is not up to the standards we expect.  We  were totally satisfied with this hotel.  The staff was the most friendly we have ever had. You are far enough from the parks but have a free shuttle every half our. It is also dedicated to this hotel and not connected to others( as some are) There is a "deli" open from 6 am until 12pm. It was nice to be able to come back from the park and get a snack or drink at a reasonable price, instead of paying the crazy park prices.  The breakfast was ok but a little pricey. I think they have the option to include it in the room price. The rooms are larger than most we were used to, but the bathroom is undersized. It works for 1 person at a time. The

We stayed here for 2 nights while visiting the parks.  While the location is convenient, the hotel was old and needs update..  We were given a room in the very back of the hotel on the 2nd floor.  The hallway leading up to the room smelled old and musty.  Not sure if they had some water damage at some point but that carpet should be ripped up.  We ate at their bistro downstairs and that was a mistake also.  The shuttle service is a plus.  If you are spending your entire day at the park then your stay could be bearable.

Yes the rooms are large but very dated decor that hasn't been updated for many, many years. Shuttle buses were mostly convenient but some didn't have working air conditioning and were very uncomfortable. in room refrigerator didn't seem to work, even on coldest setting. Ice bucket was ridiculously small, only large enough for a single bottle of beer.   Most annoyingly, the bathtub drain was completely clogged - something that really bothers me in any hotel. It was so clogged that there would be no way that the housekeeping staff would not notice it if they had actually been cleaning the shower/tub - which tells me either they ignored it or they weren't actually cleaning it well. Showering in ankle deep water is disgusting. I normally try and stay in Starwood hotels, and I felt

My family and I stayed here for the 24 hours on the 24th at Disneyland and were pleasantly surprised and we would gladly stay here again.  First, the rooms were much larger than many of the hotels surrounding Disneyland.  We worried about the noise issues that others complained about, but we had a room right next to the ice machine and didn't hear a thing.  We stayed in the north wing, while it was the farthest from the lobby, it looked like an add on and may have been quieter than the original wings.  The shuttle service was great. They were running service before the park opened and ran all the way through the next  morning.  The shuttle was right on time and large so we never had an issue with getting on. There was one time where a large group was trying to get on late and

Summary Heading: Huge rooms and close to the Disneyland
Summary: Biggest room I ever stayed. Hotel is beautiful. They have a shuttle to the Disneyland. Theybalso have different entrances around the hotel which makes easy to stop the car close your room. The only issue was the smell from the restrooms.

Summary Heading: I should have stayed somewhere else
Summary: From SFO, booked this hotel to be  closer to Disney for the kids. Not being familiar with the area, I could have just booked at the other hotels just across the Disney entrance where they have all the restaurants and other places of interest instead of being stuck in the hotel. The hotel's sprawling layout also requires you to take really long walks going to your room. Breakfast was also very disappointing. The only thing I liked is that their rooms are relatively bigger than those hotels. I also wonder why they still have to charge $14 per day for their in-house guests when they really have a spacious parking area.

We were looking for a hotel that was just outside Disneyland but close enough to the Park for our three night stay.  This hotel was the ideal hotel for many reasons.  We are travelling with two young kids (2.5, 5.5 years old) and the convenience factor was key for us.  The hotel provides a free shuttle that runs to Disneyland twice an hour when the park opens till it closes. The shuttle ride is a short ride, and while walking to Disneyland is possible, why bother when you have a free shuttle and it was great having it coming back from a long day. The shuttle drops you right off by the entrance versus into one of the massive parking lots surrounding the Park. Our stay included breakfast for two adults. Kids are $8.50 and under 3 years is free. The breakfast buffet was great:

We stayed over the Memorial Day weekend. The hotel has beautiful grounds, nice swimming pool and a very nice restaurant.  Good size game room and a nice store with a deli.  Now the bad news.  Our room was HOT!!!  We tried to get the air conditioner to work since it was 12am when we checked in, it all looked right, but the room stayed a cool 78.  We let the front desk know the next morning; they did fix it only to have it quit working again the next day.  So we spent another sleepless night in a hot uncomfortable room.  We opened the window (there was no screen) just to be able to breathe.  We never got the issue resolved, and since we spent all day out of the room at Disneyland we didn't bother to move.  Moving rooms wasn't offered either.

5/24/2013 I would love to give this hotel -0 stars.  This hotel is not dog friendly my friends... Dogs  are not allowed to stay in the room alone.  Please note  this policy is not  posted online or mentioned to you on the  phone when making your reservation.  But  you will be told when you check in...  Surprise!   Well we were..  You will not able to leave your pets  alone in your room for any amount of time during your stay at The Sheraton.   best I was not informed about this policy until I checked in my husband and I  lost out on going to DISNEY'S  once a year park stays open for 24 hours event.   After talking to 2   managers Ken and Kim ( who do not have any people skills) I was  left in disbelief.  They could not care one bit that our 24 hours disney park trip was ruined.
Manager Response: In fairness to the Sheraton Anaheim you should share all information regarding your pets stay at the our hotel. Upon check in you signed a form that listed guidelines that must be abided by guests with pets staying in the hotel. This form stated that pets cannot be left alone in the guest rooms by itself. You metioned that you were in Las Vegas recently and it was necessary for you to hire a pet sitter for basically the same reason. It is common pratice in the hotel industry to enforce the no pet in a room alone policy for both safety and other guest inconvenience reasons. Most guest with pets take them to the kennels at Disneyland during their visit to the park.  The Sheraton Anaheim has one of the most pet friendly policies in the Disneyland area and as an example all dogs that check in are furnished with dog beds, a water dish ans snacks. Unfortunately if guests are upset while staying in a hotel they can post reviews in an attempt to damage the hotels business and in your case your review in unfair to the hotel and the thousands and thousands of pets that have stayed here in the past. Ken Buksa, General Manager

Summary Heading: Hotel is well located to freeway - but service is lacking and VERY confusing layout
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel several times.  There is another Sheraton in Anaheim that is MUCH better - but this is the one that was on my corporate list.  At checkin I asked about the Club Lounge and they told me it was only for Platinum members.  I told them that I was, that my number was in my reservation, and gave them my number again.  She told me that my number has "expired".  Impossible.  She insisted it was expired (odd since I had stayed at the Westin LAX the night prior and there was not issue).  She told me that I would have to call SPG and sort it out and that she would not allow me into the lounge.  I asked her to call SPG.  Reluctantly she did.  Turns out she had transposed my member number.  She did not apologize but did reissue a key that gave me access to the

Summary Heading: Sub-par hotel, considering its star rating.
Summary: Rating Explanation: 1-3: Bad, Below Average, Average, respectively 4: Above Average 5: Above & Beyond  Cleanliness: 4/5  Staff: 4/5 ----Friendly and helpful but not very conversational and didn't really go above and beyond.  Room Amenities: 4/5 ----Hair Dryer missing or hidden; +1 for the free water.  Shower Pressure: 2/5 ----I'm a shower pressure snob and this shower was weak.  It took forever to get soap out of my hair and I have really short hair.  I can't imagine this for a person with long hair.  Bed Comfort: 4/5 ----Though I could hardly get any sleep considering how hot the room was.  (See explanation below)  Environmental Comfort: 1/5 ----The A/C-Heat Unit is centrally controlled and keeps the room temperature at a really balmy 70+ degrees, which to me is uncomfortably

Stayed at the Sheraton and Boy were we Surprised! Great Service, Polite and helpful workers as well as a big swimming pool to relax in or swim a few laps if you're feeling energetic! The great Surprise was around 11pm. You could see the Fireworks go off at the Disneyland Theme Park as you're relaxing in the Jacuzzi! What a Memory! Everyone came out to see the Fire in the sky! Wonderful!!! I recommend this hotel especially if you're planning on visiting Disneyland - very close to the park!  Enjoy!

Summary Heading: Good choice for a Non-Disney Hotel
Summary: If yo are looking for a Hotel and don't want to pay premium for a Disney property, this is a good choice.  Well located near the freeway and Disney Parks.  Free Disneyland Shuttle every 15 mins make it easy to get back and forth.  Very nice, reasonably priced Coffee shop-Deli in the lobby.  Rooms equipped with the basics.  Hotel staff very responsive when locked out of room and delivering a needed cot.  Of course there is a little charge for anything extra, parking, bottled water and a cot so beware. Rooms have nice little fridge so bring your own bottled water and snacks. A variety of pillows were available in the room, this was nice, we slept great after long day of Disney.

Summary Heading: Very convenient to use for a Disneyland Trip.
Summary: The Sheraton Anaheim is a nice, reasonably priced, hotel for people looking for a good place to stay when they are going to Disneyland. The rooms are not fancy but they are clean and comfortable. There is a free shuttle that goes to Disneyland every 1/2 hour. We will definitely stay here again when we go to Anaheim for a Disneyland trip.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for Disneyland
Summary: The rooms are quite large in the living area, but the bathroom is surprisingly very small.  Not much room for one in the bathroom - forget about having two people get ready at the same time.  But the bed was comfortable, everything clean, and the staff friendly and knowledgable.  Easy transportation to and from the Disney property.  Use the airport shuttle and never needed to have my own car.  the breakfast buffet was adequate: two types of scrambled eggs, french toast, pancakes all cooked in bulk in the kitchen; several breakfast breads, fruit, cereal.  I had dinner in the main restaurant for two evenings and both meals were excellent.

I have stayed here twice now, loving it both times, and have booked to go back in march 2014. The staff here couldn't be more helpful, attending to anything that we needed. As we are a couple in there 20s, we didn't want to stay in a Disney hotel surrounded by kids, so here was a perfect place to stay so we could get away from the hustle and bustle of the surrounding hotels, and there free shuttle to disneyland every half an hour is perfect. On the 3rd night of out 12 night stay our bathroom flooded, and within half an hour we were moved to a different, upgraded, room. There restaurant is nice, offering a great breakfast buffet, and lovely meals for lunch and dinner, which is nice when you have had a busy day out and don't want to go to far for dinner. The grounds are lovely,

We have stayed here on three previous occasions but this latest trip has been disappointing. The location is great for Disneyland and the free shuttle is spot-on however, the oversize rooms are rather dull, the lack of an in-room safe is irritating but worst of all has been the noise. One room switch required due to noisy people above us but in the current room we still hear every word of our neighbours time in the bathroom. The walls are paper thin and the a/c ducts seem to act like speakers. Think we have been lucky in the past but sadly this trip has put us off this hotel for good.

During my stay in Anaheim, I spent 5 days at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel and 3 days at the Peacock Suites. If I could go back, I would have completely ditched Sheraton from my schedule and booked Peacock Suites for my entire stay.  Here are the positive points about Sheraton: - proximity of the premises to the Disneyland Park and the California Adventure Park - free shuttle service to Disney  - free newspaper  Negative/dislikes: - overall hotel is in need of maintenance - within the room: the bathroom toilet did not properly flush (we stayed on 3rd floor - room3155) - there were stains on the carpet - the walk from the elevator was far - the ceilings was dripping when it rained and there were buckets to catch the rain drops that stayed out way longer then the 1 day it rained. We

This is a very nice hotel where the staff were very freindley and helpfull. The rooms were very clean although they needed some updating. The resturant servered very nice food and the location is also good as it was just  a short walk    from disney.

my wife and i usually stay in 5 star plus resorts, but we have a ton of SPG points to use up.  we took our 13 month old to Disney for a couple days (just to get away and relax).  This hotel is dated on the outside like an older castle look and feel.  The staff and the rest of the hotel are amazing. The restaurant made us feel very welcome, very professional and fun.  it is not a 5 star Michelin rated, but the food was good, the service was outstanding.  Front end staff were also fantastic, and very helpful.  Rooms were spacious and comfortable with a little fridge, but outdated but who cares we are not there to hang out in the room, it was to sleep and that was excellent.  The pool was fantastic and fun.  I am in hotels around the world, and for a family this is an excellent

We had a pleasant stay at this property. Let me highlight the PROS first:  great proximity to Disneyland, super convenient shuttle and family-friendly hotel atmosphere.  I was super impressed by the shuttle service, even at very congested times.  The shining moment was hiking a sleeping young child on my shoulders to the shuttle line at about 10pm.  I expected a nightmare scene and was amazed that they placed a concierge there to tell people exactly where to be and make sure you got on the bus (which took <3 min to arrive); i forgot the guy's name but he deserves a medal.     On the flip side, one thing that surprised me (esp as a Starwood Gold Member and the cost of room) was the condition of the rooms and limited dining options  The rooms were immaculately clean but old with

Summary Heading: Thanks Kris for a Great Stay!
Summary: Giving this hotel a fours stars only because of  our experience with Kris at the front desk. We had an issue with our room (too noisy by the elevator) and he moved us to a quiet room right next to the pool. He also gave us info on where to take our morning walks. Hope he is involved in some way in training the rest of the front desk. He also checked back with us to make sure all was going well with our stay. At check out the girl that checked us out dud not even ask how our stay was. There is a  deli off the lobby at the two girls that work their made us great sandwiches which we took by the pool. Great prices for a hotel outlet. The shuttle was great, we used it to go to downtown Disney and also to the Anaheim Garden Walk where there are great options for dining and shopping,

Summary Heading: Disney Friendly, but Far Enough Away
Summary: We stayed four nights at this hotel during a recent off-season, spring break, first time visit to Disneyland with our three girls, all under age ten. The price was good, the free, twice-an-hour shuttle to Disneyland was a huge bonus and the location was just far enough away from the parks that we did not have to eat, breathe and live Disney 24/7. The hotel staff was very friendly. The restaurant and bar were of good quality, with friendly, prompt and excellent service. The room was of plenty adequate size, with the two queen size beds large enough for us all to get a decent night's rest and recharge. The main attraction, though, was the swimming pool and whirl pool. Alcohol is allowed in the pool area, but not in glass, so bring plastic vessels, if you want to enjoy a cocktail

We stayed in at the Sheraton Anaheim during a quick trip to Disneyland.  Though the lobby is lovely, our room seemed filthy with stained, dirty carpets and armchairs; likewise the hall carpets were soiled.  The bathroom was very small and dated; my daughters compared it to an airplane bathroom.  The staff at the front desk seemed not at all empowered to fulfill simple requests.  Our room was very noisy partly due to traffic and to the hotel HVAC system.  The only positive was the shuttle service to Disneyland.  We paid over $200 for this room per night (before taxes) and will not be returning.

We visit Disneyland 3-4 times per year. We have stayed at almost every hotel within short walking distance to the park, because we really don't like having to drive & park. We tried the Sheratonthis last trip because they offer a shuttle to the Park. Overall it was great. The shuttle was convenient & fast. The room was quite large and quiet, with comfortable beds. We also had a roll away bed in the room (there is a charge) and there was plenty of room for it. The room was clean. On the downside, the hotel is large and very spread out. It is a hike from the Parking Lot & Lobby to your room. I had issues with WiFi that were extremely frustrating & hotel staff were not very helpful. (Again, a charge for WiFi - unless you go sit in the Lobby).  The hotel is well appointed and a

We stayed here for a quick family trip to Disneyland. The location was great and the price was decent considering what was included in the rate. Wifi for one device, parking, shuttle, breakfast buffet for 4. All those things quickly add up, so to have them included was great. The service in the Garden Court restaurant was terrible. Slow and rude.   William (shuttle driver) and Sarah (front desk) were the only stand out team members during our stay. Both went above and beyond. The shower water never heated up and engineering's response was "you're using the shower during peak hours." This is unacceptable. I was unable to wash my hair during my stay. The walls of this hotel are paper thin so bring earplugs for screaming children at all hours of the night.  We asked for an upgrade

Summary Heading: Perfectly acceptable hotel for a Disney stay.
Summary: We usually stay at the Sheraton Park Anaheim, but this was a last-minute trip and they were booked. So, I made a reservation here. It's very close to the park and they have a complimentary shuttle. I think the Sheraton Park is a little bit nicer, but here the rooms are bigger so it was a little more comfortable with the kids. The pillows were absolutely fantastic, and I am REALLY picky about pillows. We honestly do not spend all that much time in the hotel since we are there for the parks, but this hotel gives a clean place to put our heads down and recharge. Plus, I can stay on SPG points.

Summary Heading: Has most of the stuff you'll need.
Summary: This was the first hotel of our trip, and it may have been because we're not used to how polite American's can be- but we were really impressed with the staff here! The check in staff were friendly and just smiled politely and helped us when we had no idea what we were doing (thankfully they heard the foreign accent and helped us!), the guys who work in the cafeteria were always friendly and talkative, no matter what time we went in there, and the porters were awesome too. After going on to stay at 5 more hotels while in America, we realised this hotel had pretty much everything we needed, that some of the other hotels didn't provide. Cheap laundary, shuttle to the parks, cafeteria that carries food & random bits and pieces, wifi. We loved it.

Summary Heading: Acceptable if just needing a place to stay for Disney
Summary: We stayed 4 nights this past week.  We arrived at 4pm and were able to check in quickly.  We got a 2-queen bed room.  Rooms are bit dated, but are a pretty good size.  Bathroom is tiny.  One good thing is there is a sink outside the bathroom another inside the bathroom.  Shower water could have been hotter, but it wasn't cold.  Beds were comfortable and firm.  Pillows were too soft for my taste.  Despite turning up the mini-fridge, it remained cool, but never cold.  Placing something in the freezer box only got the item to what I expected the fridge temperature to be.  We didn't have them clean the room during our entire stay, but asked for more towels after a couple of nights.  Towels arrived promptly.  Wi-Fi is extra charge, but Starwood members get it for free.  Lobby did not

The family spent 4 days visiting Disneyland and chose the Sheraton Anaheim. Kids are 6 and 8 and it was their first time to Disneyland. Shuttle to hotel was fast and handy. We didn't rent a car. The bus to Disney/California adventure was easy and we used it all the time. The hotel itself was looking a tad tired and for what we needed it was fine. The hallways were mildew smelling despite many closed windows. The beds were comfortable and clean. Bathroom was hilariously small and hot water was there one morning out of 4. Towels were starting to go threadbare. Buffet was good for what we needed. It was goofy to try to find the normal TV channels. Pay per view for PBS? Really???Pool was cold, and hot tub kept us warm. Would have been a lot of business from us dads if someone came

Summary Heading: They should change their name to the "NO Hotel"
Summary: Not impressed at all! Last year it took us four hours to get our room, this time it took two hours to check in.nothing but lies, lies, lies. We had  made the reservations months ago and always request a certain room, away from traffic. We always get a run around and constantly lied to. Forget about any kind of up grade or comps even if you have platinum  status with the Sheraton resorts. We even offered to pay for a suite but obviously, Rocky, the guy at the front desk, didn't feel the need to comply with our requests. He wouldn't even let us talk to the manager. We have never experienced such horrible service at any other hotel we have stayed at.  These guys aren't here for the customer...very, very poor service. We did receive a free dinner from the general manager but having

My husband and I stayed here for three nights, as we visited Disneyland for part of our honeymoon.  Rooms were clean and comfortable.  Service was great.  We had room service each night, and were very impressed by the speed of service.  Jose, who delivered our food one night was friendly and very respectful.  We will definitely stay there again!  Bed and pillow were EXTREMELY cozy!

Summary Heading: Excellent shuttle, nice employees but limited A/C & room amenities
Summary: We were a family of 5 going to Disneyland & we are gold SPG members. No upgrade - they only offer it to Platinum members. No club rooms available, but offered $10/person to use club lounge, which was not close to our room.   We were given rm G4310. Room is spacious, and has a small fridge for your food & coffeemaker. Small clumps of pizza on ground - no big deal, as otherwise clean. Be aware - rooms in that whole tower has NO control over A/C or heating (the thermostat is not connected). You can increase the fan speed only. Room was 78F in March (after windows were open with lots of highway noise) - complained to housekeeping, then front desk and then manager, engineering came, and they turned on A/C for the tower. In the middle of the night, they turned it off - suddenly woke

Great hotel for a trip to Disneyland.  It's located right on the other side of the freeway from the parks and the hotel runs shuttles every 30 minutes to and from the park.  We never moved our car during our stay.  The hotel is older but has been remodeled and is quite nice.  The part in which we stayed had stairs with no elevator, which was a bit inconvenient with luggage, but other than that there are no complaints.  Our room was a suite with a living area with pullout sofa for the kids and a bedroom for my husband and myself for $179/nightly including parking.  We were able to purchase our tickets at the hotel, so that we were able to avoid ticket lines outside of the parks.  They had a café with bagels, pastries and coffee on the premises, which made for a quick, reasonably

This is my favorite place to stay when in Disneyland. What I like best about this hotel is that they have their own shuttle that takes you to and from Disneyland at no extra cost. The shuttle goes directly from the hotel to Disneyland, no stopping at other properties. The rooms are nice and include a small refrigerator. They have a small bar, deli and restaurant near the lobby. No other eateries really close by. You can ride the shuttle and walk to Downtown Disney or even eat at some restaurants outside of Disneyland park if you prefer. They also offer a kiosk if you would like to purchase your tickets there before going to the park. Ground are very nice, various garden areas where weddings are held and a great koi pond with a bridge. Best of all, it looks like snow white could

This is a great hotel if your family is making a trip to Disneyland. They have a free shuttle that drops you off at the doorsteps of Disneyland and picks you up back to the hotel. The hotel is also located right next to the highway so it was easy to jump in the car and make our way to Hollywood and Universal Studios. The rooms were clean but a bit dated. Our air conditioner unit kept going out but the staff was friendly and worked until the damned thing was fixed. My kids had a blast at the pool which was clean and large. We were able to see the Disneyland fireworks from the hotel grounds but the best views are from the parking lot so you can see some of the lower fireworks that may be obscured by the hotel if you are in one of the gardens or pool area. Our booking included free

Summary Heading: Not a bargain once you pay $14 a day for parking and $9 for wifi
Summary: The hotel is not a bargain once you pay $14 a day for parking and $9 for wifi in your room.  There is a small fridge but unfortunately there is no microwave, their excuse was “it’s a fire hazard”. You can get free wifi in the lobby, and use a microwave in the gift shop, though I found that too inconvenient.    The 2 queen room was quite ample with plenty of empty space to move around in, or set up luggage racks.  There was an extra dresser, and a total of 6 large and 6 small drawers in the room.  There was a small side table, flanked by two side chairs, and a desk with a comfortable desk chair.   The bathroom was unfortunately very small by comparison.  There were not enough outlets on the walls and despite the two power strips we found ourselves jockeying to plug in our phones

We thought that we lucked out when we got this property using our valuable Starwood points, little did we know that we would be given a sub-standard room. The check in was acceptable, we had requested a King bed, but we were told that they were sold out, so we took the Queen. The room itself was ok, not great, the rug was very stained and the bathtub drained dripped extensivly. We were shocked to find out, after the first night that the room did not have air conditioning, when we called to complain, we were told that again the hotel was sold out and that they were sorry. Not as sorry as I was when I found out that all of the rooms in the main bldg. did have air conditioning, but we were not offered that. Was it because we used our points and not cash, I think so. We spoke to the

Summary Heading: The most embarrassing example of a Sheraton property you will most likely ever see
Summary: Smell is like mildew Look is old , stained, and a real dark downer Staff is rude and not well trained General manager is indifferent to any of his staff being rude and unhelpful I will never visit this property again. Starwood should be embarrassed that this hotel has their name attached. Maybe and I mean maybe a visit from hotel impossible can help save this miserable hotel. I doubt it however.
Manager Response: Dear Guest, It is always disappointing to receive a review as negative as the one you posted. In fairness to the hotel we should share with the people that read your review that it was posted due to the fact that you were upset that the hotel would not open up the California Deli and Gift Shop that is closed between the hours of 2:00 pm and 5:00 pm daily so you could use the microwave to heat uo a leftover hot dog that you purchased at Disneyland. I only hope that people that read your review will also read the honest reviews that also appear on Trip Advisor. Reviews should be fair and yours wasn't.

Summary Heading: The only place I stay when I go to Disneyland
Summary: I have been staying at the Sheraton Anaheim for several years now when I go to Disneyland.  The rooms are large which we really like since I have a family of four.  The beds are comfortable.  The windows need to be updated.  That would help a lot with noise.  It depends where your room is located.  If you are near the freeway you will hear it a little.  We stayed on the third floor.  Our window was to the garden.  So it was very peaceful.  We had a room close to the elevator but could not hear the elevator at all.   You can always find parking.  We got to the hotel at 9:20 at night.  The check in was fast and the person helping us was friendly.  We got there just in time for the Disneyland fireworks.  The hotel has the best view.  We stayed in the parking lot watching the

Our double room was large with lots of space. The room was clean and we had everything we could need for the night.  I love the lounge area off the lobby where you can sit by the fire or just relax on a cozy couch.  But best of all is the shuttle service to and from Disneyland.  After a day a Disneyland you really don't want to walk anymore!  I will definitely stay here again.

As Starwood members, we opted to stay at the Sheraton on a recent trip to Disneyland. Overall, it was a good experience, but we cut our stay short and had a much better experience at other LA sheratons.  The good: it is close to Disney--we and the kids even walked back from Downtown Disney one day--it took awhile, but was doable. The kids loved that it looked like a castle. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The pool seemed nice, and we enjoyed the outdoor hot tub. The shuttles run regularly and if one fills up they will send another. The bad, is not too bad--the property just needs updating. The carpet in the hallway was worn and coming up in bumps. There was peeling wallpaper in the very small exercise room. It just didn't seem to have been freshened up in the previous

Summary Heading: Not within easy walking distance to Disneyland ...
Summary: So, the hotel was not as close to Disneyland as I expected but it has a complimentary shuttle bus that goes back and forth every 15 minutes so its location is still very convenient to the two parks. The hotel is older and the lift had a bit of a weird smell but the room was spacious and overlooked the pool. Whilst it's on a main road the hotel was quiet and the bed was really comfortable which is a must after long days of Disneyland-ing. The restaurant is really good, with a wide range of meals on offer for very reasonable prices. The staff were all very friendly and helpful ... only downside was that the Disneyland concierge who we bought our tickets from wasn't really that helpful and provided us with incorrect information. Other than that ... I recommend the Sheraton Anaheim.

Overall quite good for the Disney area.  All the Disney area hotels get a huge amount of traffic, so hotels can get rundown and staff a bit jaded.  This hotel does a pretty good job of providing clean, safe, personable service despite the crowds. The rooms are a bit dated, especially the bathrooms (quite small), but they're very large and the beds very comfortable. Add the pool, the awesome shuttle service, and a good deli off the lobby, all at a very reasonable price point...and it's a winner!  The breakfast buffet is overpriced but quite substantial, but less expensive than a la carte.  I've stayed twice in the past few years and will come back!

This was a great hotel to stay at for our 5-day trip to Disneyland and California Adventure. The hotel is close to the parks and the complimentary shuttle takes approx 5-10 minutes to get there. The shuttle was great for the toddler in our group as it was a quick ride back to the hotel for a nap in the middle of the day and then another quick ride back to the parks for more fun in the afternoon. Shuttle drivers were wonderful and always greeted with a smile.   We ate at the breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant day 1 and should have ate there the other two days. The food was great and the same prices as local IHOP or even at Disneyland itself. There is a Target and Walmart nearby for snacks or milk as needed for the kids. We had a rental car but didn't need to use it much

I've stayed at this Sheraton with my family for years, but travelled there with my husband for the first time in October 2012.  This is a great option for travellers looking to spend time at Disneyland and California Adventure, but who don't want to pay the crazy prices to stay at the Disney hotels.  The rooms are huge and clean, the pool is calm and quiet, there is a decent restaurant and an okay deli/gift shop.  The free shuttle to and from Disney twice hourly is a huge hit, although the buses stop running when the parks close, so if you're enjoying an evening at Downtown Disney, be prepared to take a cab back (only a few dollars).  There's a Starbucks across the overpass from the hotel but the lineups are insane (you can get coffee at the hotel too).  All in all, a great

Summary Heading: A good place to stay for your weekend at Disneyland
Summary: This place was a great basecamp for our weekend at the Disney parks.  It's just a few blocks away, and a very comfortable place to stay.  Upon our arrival, they said our room had been upgraded and we ended up with a suite.  Nice!  The room was big, with full couches and a living room area next to the bed.  Free coffee and bottled water to go in our room fridge.  Everything was very clean and inviting.    They have a nice restaurant downstairs, where they have a decent breakfast buffet.  They also have a pool, convenient poolside food and a small exercise room.  The best part is the proximity to the Disney parks. It's less than a mile away, and they offer a free courtesy shuttle every half hour or so to and from the front gate. Very convenient.  Also, it's in the heart of Anaheim

Given the title of this review...what more could you want in Disneyland with kids? To have the finer things and pampering while in Disneyland doesn't make sense to me because it is so crazy & high energy (but while in an Adults only resort in Tahiti, well - that does make sense!).  We arrived Jan. 23 for a 5-night stay with a 4 year old (just turned) and his monster trucks (which he played with on the lobby ramp and no one cared).  SHUTTLE DRIVERS - oh my, some of the most pleasant people I've met. Remember you and maybe even your name; If they see you again, they inquire about your stay; When we left, I wanted to hug each one of them (Manny, Javier, Bald Guy...who we named "the mean guy" which was completely the opposite of his nature).  FRONT DESK STAFF- in retrospect they did

Lovely hotel!  My kids loved this Tudor style hotel, with a koi pond near the outside courtyard, and large fish tank in the lobby, they were amused for hours.  My two bests of this hotel are the very large guest rooms,  and the free shuttle to Disneyland.  The shuttle comes every half hour and takes only 5 mins to get you to your hotel room. Great place to stay.

Summary Heading: Worst representation of and SPG property I've experienced
Summary: From the moment i checked i could tell the management of this property was more worried about squeezing every dime out of their guests rather than taking care of its customers. As a Lifetime Gold member with SPG i fully understand the brand and its normal level of service.   When checking in I was not offered my SPG amenities (points free internet or free in room movie)  nor was there any recognition of my SPG level. David the desk manager who checked me in wasn't exactly rude but didn't really care to provide any service either. This in itself was not a big deal but let me continue.  I stayed 4 nights booked into a Club Level Room with an additional two nights booked on points. The first thing while checking in I was asked to pay an additional $99 a night to stay in my club

Summary Heading: Clean and comfortable, great free shuttle to Disneyland
Summary: i stayed at this hotel about 30 years ago and not much has changed. It is well located for the Disneyland Parks but the free half hourly shuttle is the real gem. Not many other resorts or hotels offer this. The rooms are huge, though showing their age. The bathrooms are tiny and need a good facelift. Value for money is however excellent. Avoid rooms facing the freeway.

Summary Heading: In order to provide a breadth of feedback, we only post reviews after we've received at least five.
Summary: I recently stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel and was asked to provide my feedback on the experience. It wasn't great. here's what Starwood's website indicates when you submit a review. It brings meaning to the phrase, 'only hear the good stuff'.   - Thank you for your review    - In order to provide a breadth of feedback, we only post reviews after we've received at least  five. Once this threshold is met, if approved, your review may take up to 48 hours to appear.  As for the property, I would be unlikely to stay here again. For me this was a distinct representation of how the promise of a brand experience can come crashing down. It takes more than some matching toiletries across a group of hotels to make a brand.  An ageing a dark property, which was surprising considering

This hotel works very well for a group going to Disneyland. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are large. Most of the desk clerks were really nice, except the one late at night that couldn't find my niece and nephew's room, even though it was all paid for in advance. We had a problem with our hot water the first night, but it was fixed by morning. The hotel carpet and furnishings are getting old and need replacing and some of the hallways smelled mildewy, but our room smelled fine. However the bed was super comfy!  Spent 3 nights and would go back for the value and convenience. Walked back from Disneyland the 2nd night and it was probably faster than waiting for the free shuttle (although the shuttle is still great to have!)

Summary Heading: All good except for sullen staff. To think it is a hotel a stone's throw away from the world's happiest place!
Summary: Loved the place cos it looks exactly like a Disney castle. Our room was huge but bathroom is comparison was miserably small. Beds were great,  King sized and super comfy! It was great that we could park right outside the section of the hotel where our room was situated which made it feel like we were returning home every night. And yes, the hotel car park is a perfect spot for watching the Disneyland fireworks at night. Possibly better than watching it in the park itself.   The free shuttle service to Disneyland was great too! Remember the very kindly bus driver who asked every guest if we enjoyed ourselves at the park. Like a old nice grand daddy.   Now for the downsides: The service was so bad. These people serve guests like we owe them a living. Hey guys,  it's Disneyland!

This is the third time we have stayed at this hotel and it will be our last. The hotel is old and tired. it's a mile walk from the front desk to the room. The bathroom is tiny as is the bathtub/shower.  I guess we stay here because it has a shuttle to the park.  Last time we stayed here, we had an enormous room, this time no upgrade available so we got a standard room.  Bed was also uncomfortable.

We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel included in a package deal for Disneyland.  The hotel is old, but very well kept!  The rooms are HUGE, clean and quiet.  The staff (all hours) were very amazing, I was truly impressed at the professionalism.  We would most definately make a recommendation to stay at this hotel and will plan to do so again on our next visit!

Summary Heading: IT WAS OK - would stay somewhere else next time
Summary: I would probably stay somewhere else next time. It was OK... the rooms were nice and the beds were comfortable but being in the middle of 2 freeways makes for noisy rooms. We were initally given a very noisy room but were moved after I asked to be relocated. Even then, the room was still a bit noisy with the traffic from the freeways.  It was futher away from Disnelyland than what I woud have liked. I didn't like relying on the shuttle to get home after a long day and at one point, some people were refused entry onto the shuttle because it was full - not sure whether these people had to wait another half hour or whether a special trip was made to pick them up but that's tough after a long day.  Would have preferred to stay along the Disneyland strip where we could walk backwards

Lovely quiet hotel, so close to Disney, within driving distance of Hollywood and related attractions as well. We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights are were really sad to leave for Vegas. Staff were great - my dad left his Ipod there - the staff kept it and posted in to our UK address. Hotel is quite flat and spread out so feels spacious. Would stay here again and again and it's great value. Rooms were large, spacious and clean. Bathroom was a little small but perfectly adequate.

Nice property and well located/ Although not walking distance from Disneyland, the shuttle service is excellent. We actually missed a shuttle by a couple of minutes and he concierge arranged a cab to take us there free of charge!

We stayed at the Sheraton for 3 nights in November 2012. It was a nice.  We stayed in a two queen bed room. It was pretty standard.  There was confusion regarding parking. We gave up on whether we had a room  we booked included parking or not.  The free shuttle was great. It was nice not to have to deal with the craziness of the disney parking garage.  The hotel is quite large and winding. My wife and I got lost one time. It was also a very LONG walk to our room after a long day at disneyland. The room was basic nothing over the top. It could use a upgrade the decorations looked a bit 1980's.  There was a strange smell in the hallway on the floor we stayed on.  It was a bit musty.  We didn't bring it up to the front desk..they weren't overly friendly whenever we approached.  The

This hotel was perfect. The have a free shuttle to take you to and from Disneyland. The rooms were nice a big for a family of 4. The buffets and room service were fantastic. The pool was clean and fun. Grounds were lovely for pictures. This hotel looked full in the parking lot but we hardly ever saw anyone. The nightly fireworks at Disneyland can been seen perfectly from the parking lot, perfect spot with no crowds. They have a deli for food and snacks, and a game room( which needs updated games that work for kids) I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Disneyland. Staff were nice.

I took my family down for a part business and part personal trip to Anaheim.   We booked for a 2 night stay.    We went to Disneyland after the first night at 7 am.    My child was tired so we came back to the hotel to rest from 430pm for a quick nap until 6pm.  Our room was not cleaned.      Around 5pm, a note was slipped under the door stating to call the front desk for further service to the room.    At 6pm,  I called  to ask if someone could clean the room.    The woman at the front desk said "sorry there is no room service for you since you refused service by putting a do not disturb sign.   I cannot help you."    Interesting...   if they knew i had the room for 2 days, why do they wait until 5pm to clean the room.    My biggest complaint was how the front desk person

Have stayed at Sheraton Anaheim on each of our 5 trips to LA/Disneyland so far.  Lovely hotel, lovely staff, very obliging.  Rooms a little tired and small, but very comfortable.  True King Size Bed!   Free shuttle to/from Disneyland every half hour.     Had breakfast in the hotel a couple of times.  Very nice. Didnt use the Spa there, so cant rate it. Wouldn't hesitate to stay there again on our next trip.

I truly enjoyed the hotel! We went and spent two days of fun, one at Disneyland and one just touring LA. Great location to both and the shuttle service was amazing. The customer service was perfect and I will stay again

I stayed here for a Disney marathon weekend. The location was a little weird at first but it was in walking distance for my event. Probably about 1/2 a mile from Downtown Disney. The inside of the hotel is a little dated, not very modern. My room was very big. The size is perfect if I was bringing my family. Everything was clean. My room was right off the pool and jacuzzi which was a good size. The parking was packed at night so I suggest if you find a parking spot close to your room don't move your car. I had to park at the front entrance which was far from my room, but that's what I get for going to Starbucks at 8pm. Unfortunately, the rooms were not very private. I could hear my neighbors talking at 11pm and I had to get up at 2am. Also, I could hear people walking down the

Summary Heading: Exactly what we were looking for
Summary: The hotel was awesome! The rooms were nice, there was a pool and decent gym and we got given a $75 voucher for their restaurants. The location was the best thing about the hotel though - right around the corner from a 7/11, close to take-away places like pizza and subway, a shopping centre and about a 15 minute walk from DISNEYLAND! We could actually see disneyland from our balcony :P I would stay there again :)

Summary Heading: A very good choice for Disneyland
Summary: Disneyland hotels may be convenient but are rather expensive.  Off campus there are dozens of choices including some just outside the park entrance.  These hotels have interesting facades but some are rather well "used" on the inside.  When staying off campus I like using the Sheraton Anaheim.  It is not really walking distance but they have a regular, large shuttle bus (free) that departs the hotel and stops very close to the main ticket area of Disneyland.  It runs every 30 minutes until just after park closing.  The hotel is two story with a somewhat facade of a castle.  Entry area looks well kept and modern.  There is an restaurant adjacent.  Service and menu were good but a little pricey.  There is ample parking but there is a charge of $14/nt.  The rooms are normal

Stayed at this property multiple times using points and the rooms were ok for the category.  Make sure they dont put your "POINTS" room by the freeway.  Its so loud you can't sleep and they charge you for moving to a room that was not originally booked by starwood.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, too far from Disneyland, Ordinary service...will never stay @ Sheraton again!
Summary: I travel internationally for business and have always enjoyed the Sheraton hotels around the world however after my stay at this hotel l won't be rushing back. The hotel is a block or so away from Disneyland but is way way too far to walk. The hotel provides a shuttle so you have to be organised to get there at departure time - if you miss the shuttle its a long wait for the next one. The rooms are large, spacious & very comfortable however our room was the furthest from the lift...so so so far away...if you have children or are elderly it could be exhausting....especially if you need to make regular room visits. The internet was down & When l did get connection it was at a snails pace. The customer service was unfortunately its biggest downfall. There was only 1 person at check

Yes, this Sheraton is near Disneyland and with a Free shuttle which the Sheraton at the Park does not offer.  Upgraded to a large turret suite.  As you will have read from other reviews, this hotel is OLD.  I can remember it when I was a kid.  It's in dire need off a rooms update.  Yes the lobby has been updated but not the rooms or hallways.  We were only here one night, so it wasn't that bad.  For families the free shuttle to Disneyland is huge, but there aren't any restaurants within walking distance of the hotel.  You'll need to drive wherever you might want to eat.  The club room is nice for morning continental breakfast. Great service and the staff was all quite nice and helpful.  They charge for parking, which seems a little over the top...just another way to gain

Stayed here for business one night. The hotel is right next to Disney, which is great for families. The night I stayed there were fireworks going off in the park and I watched them from there, felt like I was in the park watching them. The hotel is somewhat dated, but clean. The service was excellent here and I would recommend staying here if you're planning to go to disneyland.

clean hotel - we stayed for 4 nights at the end of December 2012.  The hotel's sole purpose is to house Disneyland tourists.  The staff was pleasant but not abundant.  There were times when lines formed at the main counter.  On the first morning, maids were vacuuming an upstairs room at 8:00 AM.

We stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim during October 2012.  Arrived mid-week and the hotel was virtually empty so we got the pick of the rooms with a view over the rose garden, really filled up at the weekend though.  Excellent location with free shuttle bus to Disneyland, 5 minute journey and you could easily walk it if you wanted to. The rooms are enormous but bathrooms tiny in comparison and could do with updating.  Great facilities and all staff we dealt with were friendly and helpful.

Blessed by the stay and the room. We got to our room early and had lunch then got blessed with an upgrade Thank you Carol!! What a wonderful surprise. My brother just lost his job  you can imagine what that can do to a single father especially during the holidays. So we at the last minute invited him and his boys to join us. My family really enjoyed being able to visit and have a relaxing stay after the craziness of the long Christmas lines at Disneyland.  The boys enjoyed the heated pool too. Your shuttle staff to was so nice and to be honest they are the reason we stay there!! We got to Disneyland and realized my hubby lost our camera and the shuttle service found it!! Again, another blessing!! Yes, i would say if you plan on going to Disneyland, this should be your

Summary Heading: This is not actually a Sheraton I ever known
Summary: We stayed there because it is very near to the park. That's it the first time and the last time. I would rather find a motel, it's about the same quality but a lot cheaper. We are quite disappointed since we booked this hotel as it is "Sheraton". But this hotel doesn't meet Sheraton's standard at all.  Parking - It's not free. Enter by taking the parking card from an automated machine, the guy at check-in will give you a plastic to swipe when you leave the gantry.  Check-in, we reached hotel quite late at night as 11pm because of the evening flight. Just only one guy before us was checking in, it took us about 10 minutes at the line. But once it's our turn, the guy is quite nice and explained everything to us including the map and facilities. So the same as he did for the

We were two families with 4 adults and 5 children including 3 teens. We stayed for 3 days in two interconnecting rooms. The rooms were the largest that I have seen. There was ample space to move around even with an extra bed. The hotel was clean and spacious. There is convenient shuttle service to Disney (every 30 minutes). With little planning we never had to wait more than 10 minutes for a shuttle! The staff was very courteous, helpful and professional.  There is no safe in the room but they have a managers safe in the front desk. There are no good restaurants with in walkable distance and the one in the hotel is pricey. We ate at or near Disney most of the time. The shuttle pick up area in Disneyland gets chaotic during peak hours (evening). These are all minor issues and we

We stayed here on our weekend trip to Disneyland. Arrived early and was able to check in right  away which was great after the drive from the Bay Area. At check in we were given the option of a high floor and low floor. We choose low which we would later regret. The room was 2104 and just down nine steps from the elevator. The room was clean and very spacious. Had a coffee maker and a fridge. The one thing the room was missing was a in room safe. If you have small kids be careful picking this floor when the hotel has banquets and parties. From nine pm to after midnight yelling and loud talking from people walking back and forth to the parties.  All in all nice hotel. Had room service one morning and it was great. The food a delicious and the service was quick. They also don't

Just returning to the Scottsdale area after three days at the Sheraton Anaheim and I'm already missing it! Perfect for the Disney traveller, and even if you wish to just enjoy the property!   The rooms are HUGE! The space is nice, however I think that they could use a bit of an upgrade layout wise. The property is a little older which is slightly noticable - but they've made some great improvements.  The staff members at this resort always go above and beyond! Front Desk agents helped us get a great room, offered to help with all of our luggage needs too. Cynthia at the bar deserves an honorable mention; very insightful about every aspect about the hotel, disney and local area too!  Thanks Sheraton Anaheim! We will be back and I'm already sending other guests your way!

We just returned from a 3 night stay to vidit Disneyland. Loved the hotel. Very clean. Comfortable beds with down like comforters and pillows. Rooms had old school furnishings but lots of space. We had two queens overlooking the pool and there would have been plenty of space for a cot. Very roomy. Shower was great. Bathroom is small but clean. The shuttle service was awesome. Staff was wonderful. Very quiet . We could watch the fireworks at night and hear tem too!

We loved staying at this older Sheraton and give it 5 stars for friendly staff and excellent service. The front desk was especially welcoming and called us by name. They extended our check out when asked, too. The shuttles to Disneyland were wonderful and promptly ran every 30 minutes both ways. The drivers remembered their passengers and made them feel welcome. To get to the parks early on busy days, we did walk (an easy 20 minutes) in the early morning but took the shuttle back and forth and at night. The waitstaff in the restaurant were great, too. Our room was on the 2nd floor and overlooked the koi pond/gazebo area. It was so quiet; we never heard a single sound from the freeway.  One day the parks were especially busy so we took a two hour break on the grounds enjoying the

We've stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim several times, but I've never rated our stay.  It's not a new hotel and could use some renovations, but we had a great experience.  We were able to check in at 9:00 am, and that was a plus! The shuttle was convenient and free (some aren't!)  I made one call to the front desk, and they responded quickly to my request. We'll definitely be back!

Summary Heading: Great value for a trip to Disney
Summary: I dont know what some people are moaning about.  It isnt a 5 star, but if you want a 5 star you have to pay for a 5 star.  It is not a new hotel and so has a little wear and tear but nothing to complain about in my view. This place was quiet, well kept with comfortable beds, good linen and very good cleaning.  Our room was large and reasonably priced.  The pool is nice and you can watch the fireworks from the parking lot.  The restaurant was pretty good if a little pricey for what you get.  The staff were very helpful and friendly, particularly the fellows who run the shutttle back and forth to the park.  I would stay here again any time.

The hotel is ok. Nothing to rave about.   It has a pleasant feel but definately in need if a refurn. The carpet throughout looked and smelt like it had been there since the 1984 Olympics. The staff were super friendly and there is a very convenient shuttle to disneyland.  Parking us expensive for an outdoor car park. Hotel is smack bang between 2 freeways so its a bit noisy. And no chance to walk to Disneyland. The hotel rooms although dated are huge. They are also very dark though.  Staff super friendly. Found it clean, comfortable and served its purpose for a Disney bed.

If you book at a Sheraton Hotel you expect a certain level of standards but unfortunately this hotel was not so nice. It was old, the rooms were smelly, the bathroom had mould and carpet had stains.   The receptionist was not so nice either. I asked some questions and she pretty much ignored me and commented something like: "Its not my job, you have to ask someone else".  So disappointing especially when you are about to go to the happiest place on earth... Disneyland!  Wont be staying here again. For the price we paid we would have gotten better accommodation... Sheraton does not mean its going to be a nice hotel!  Location wasnt bad as they provided shuttles but there are so many other hotels across the road from Disneyland.   Dont stay here... you will be very disappointed.

Summary Heading: Not as good as I was hoping it would be
Summary: We decided to go to Anaheim at the last minute and spend some time in Downtown Disneyland as we were limited on time. We had been wanting to stay here for some time and since we were only going to stay for one night we were OK in paying what I felt was a higher price than the surrounding hotels. There was no Valet or bell hop service when we pulled up, there was a stand, but no attendant. The lobby was very nice and check-in was very quick and friendly. Our concern was once we got into our room, upon leaving the lobby we were hit with a strong odor of mold/mildew which only got worse as we got closer to our room. The room was very spacious but outdated and as large as the room was, the bathroom was very small. The one big plus was the free shuttle service directly to the

Summary Heading: Great place to stay near Disneylan
Summary: We just returned from a weekend at the Sheraton Anaheim to celebrate our son's 5th birthday.  It was our second visit to this property and it's an excellent value and nice hotel in the Disneyland area.  It's very close to Disneyland and there is a free shuttle than runs from the hotel to Disneyland every half hour (and back too).  We flew from Northern California and didn't even rent a car this time because you don't need it.  We just took a Super Shuttle from the airport to the hotel and then the hotel has a free shuttle to Disneyland and Downtown Disney every half hour (and back) so you don't need a car.  I actually like NOT staying right in Disneyland as it's nice to get away from all the people and chaos.  There were four of us (2 adults, 2 kids) and our room with two queen

Summary Heading: Fine but nothing special - big rooms
Summary: We did a four-day stint here as part of a training class. It was a bit of a letdown initially as we thought we were staying at the Newport Beach Radisson as per prior year. Nope.  The hotel is right at the edge of Disneyland and clearly was once quite upscale. Now, it looks a bit dated and the freeway up against it add nothing to the charm. And that said, the hotel itself is solid. The room we had was very large but very spartan. Old furniture but good bed, good mini-refrigeartor, good flat screen and good (and free w/our rate) WiFi. The place was super clean and the public areas were quite pleasant.   The restaurant was adequate and slightly pricey, but the service was very good.   The hotel is proximate to good grocery stores (Ralph's on Euclid) and plenty of fast food and the

I have shown tremendous loyalty to SPG. I am a Platinum member and a lifetime Gold member. I have written many positive reviews. The manager at this hotel was very rude and simply does not care if you come back or not. I had a family reunion weekend. I was paying for several rooms, but the last night my husband was ill and in the morning I called to see if I could cancel the room for that night. The manager would not do it or even give me any option. Most SPG hotels bend over backwards to make their loyal SPG members happy knowing that is how their reputation is built and that a Happy SPG member will continue to go out of their way to stay at a SPG hotel. NOT THIS ONE>...The place is run down and the only good thing to say is that there is a free shuttle. However, you do have to

I have stayed in this hotel a couple of times and will definitely stay there again. I cannot fault it.  Price, room and particularly the atmosphere.   It is not far from Disneyland.  Fifteen minute walk or the regular shuttle.  Free internet.  This place is good.

What a fabulous hotel - from the rooms, to the restaurant, the bar & the staff! The shuttle is so convenient to and from DL. It runs every 15 minutes and they give you the schedule upon check-in. The rooms are clean & spacious. The restuarant food is terrific. The front desk staff wonderful and helpful. I have to mention Cynthia, the evening bartender, is soooo delightful and so great at her job, I will return to this hotel simply because of her! She is the perfect way to end a long day in the park (or at a meeting whatever brings you down this way). It's very rare to come across someone who enjoys their job so much...and it shows!!!! Thank you so much Cynthia! It's not one of "the" Disney hotels, but the room rate is MUCH better & really you spend most of the time in the park -

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with excellent shuttle service
Summary: This hotel has a great shuttle service to the park and has lots of room on the shuttle, and it has the shuttle drop right outside the gate.  We had a great time and even got an upgrade to right outside the pool  for our room.  The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable with a nice chair and ottoman to rest those tired feet from all the walking in the Disneyland Park.  However no :"free breakfast"..

just returned and had a great stay. rooms are spacious and clean. staff was pleasant and helpful. we sat down to breakfast with our 2 small children and the waiter had plastic cups with straws for the kids within 2 minutes of sitting down without asking. shuttle to the park is a huge help especially with kids and strollers. hotel is a nice balance for kids and adults. i would stay here on business as well. we are staying here next time for sure

We decided to stay at this hotel for our Disney vacation and use some hotel points.  For being a Sheraton I expected more.  The front desk lady who checked us in was very rude, horrible customer service.  We arrived before check in time and I knew that we would have to wait till the room was ready.  When I asked how we could tell that the room was ready she replied that the room might be ready now but she has no idea how to tell.  We were supposed to stay 4 nights but checked out after the second night.

Dealing with this hotel has been an absolute nightmare in every way. They made a mistake while booking my reservation (they booked it for the wrong days) that took almost a month to resolve, and the nightmare still continues. In the 20 + conversations that I've had with them over the phone they somehow failed to mention that they had a 3 night minimum (even though they allowed me to make a reservation for only 2 nights originally), and now will not allow me to cancel one of the nights stay without canceling the whole reservation. The customer service has been so poor that I'm embarrassed for them. I've never had so many problems making a simple reservation! Ugh!
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel.  As you are aware you booked a reservation during a period that the hotel was only selling either two of three night stays due to a large convention in Anaheim at the time of your reservation.  You confirmed a two night stay and the day before your arrival you attempted to cancel one night of the stay that was against the hotels booking restrictions for that period.  You were advised that you could cancel your entire reservation with no penalty but could not cancel only one night of your stay.  In fairness to the hotel, the people reviewing your unfair review should be aware of the true facts regarding your reservation.

Summary Heading: Great hotel if you want to go to Disney
Summary: A great hotel if you are visiting Diney as it is very close and a free shuttle.We choose this hotel as it was central for what we wanted to do in LA. The room was clean and big enough for us, the bathroom was a bit on the small side but ok for us. The only down side to the hotel was it was very noisy first thing, people up and about early, a lot of talking and slaming of doors and kids getting excited, the rooms aren`t very sound proof.The restuarant served great food and there was a shop you could get cereal and bits for breakfast so that was good. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

We stayed here for seven nights in September 2012. Upon check in the staff were very helpful and polite. They gave us free wifi Internet for our entire stay and also $100 voucher to spend on dinner in their restaurant. Our room was always kept clean and tidy and restocked on a daily basis. The restaurant food was always fresh and the staff so welcoming and polite. The shuttle bus to Disney was always regular and the drivers very friendly. Over all we had a fantastic here and would highly recommend it. The customer service was fantastic. Thank you to all the staff at Sheraton for making our stay so great.

The good part is the hotel itself. We had a very nice quiet room overlooking the rose garden. The room was very spacious, almost overly so. The bathroom was, however on the small side. The entire hotel can use an upgrade. In the Starwood world, this is a category 4 hotel which, anywhere but next to disneyland would be a 2 or a 3. Everything was clean and well maintained, the hotel is simply dated. There is no reason not to stay here, just don't expect the upscale nature a category 4 may otherwise be. The very good part is the sevice. We found all the personnel to be knowledgeable and helpful. The shuttle to Disneyland was very convenient. Although scheduled to run ever half hour, if ther was an overflow of guests, a second shuttle was put into service. On our way home from

Summary Heading: Love this hotel - Great Value, Great Service.
Summary: We've stayed 3 times at this hotel and it has become a favorite place by Disneyland.  The staff are friendly, fun and accomodating and the hotel is kept up to date and is very clean and beautiful.  The pool and grounds are meticulously kept and the restaurant is very good, comfortable and kid friendly.  The beds are very comfortable and the rooms large and very nice without having to spend a fortune.  There is a free shuttle that runs every half an hour from the hotel to Disneyland and has never let us down.  There is also a little deli and snack shop that has very fresh food and is very convenient.  Love it here!

Summary Heading: Unsanitary room and bathroom-will not stay here again!
Summary: October 2012 my family stayed at Sheraton Anaheim--we could not be more disgusted.    We found the lobby and front desk staff inviting, however, when we arrived at our room we were incredibly disappointed and disgusted at what we found.  After returning from a long day at Disneyland I moved the chair in the room a bit---only to discover a dehydrated and molded apple that had been left beneath it.  As you can see from the pictures, the carpet was stained and the apple was clearly not new---old, shriveled and covered in spots of mold, it was evident that the cleaning crew in the room had not simply neglected to vacuum and find the apple one day, but multiple days--the molded apple looked to be atleast a week old.  I was so disgusted that this was the same floor my young children
