I booked this for a one night stay to go to Disneyland for Halloween time. There are five of us, two adults, two young kids and a baby. The price was great. We were able to check in at 1. The room was spacious, lots of room, two queen sized beds and a crib, not a pack and play. Also enough room for a lounge chair and two tables. The pool is large, lots of chairs with shade. Hot tub. The lobby has a bar, restaurant, technology lounge and sitting area with fireplace. There's a rose garden courtyard and a pond courtyard with koi. There's also a deli/gift shop. Yummy sandwiches, perfect to pack for the park. The shuttle service leaves at top and half of the hour, and picks up at Disneyland at :15 and :45. Our double stroller fit in back without folding. The staff was so friendly,

Summary Heading: Ok hotel, low standards of staff quality!
Summary: A basic hotel in a good location, perfect for Disney!  The entrance is nice, look pleasant as do the rooms etc although if you look clearly its worn and old and really needs a bit of TLC. Fair size rooms however our bathroom was like a little cupboard. A family of five in the room opposite us who let there three boys run around the corridor shouting at 8am, seriously some people do not have any respect but not a fault of the hotel only in that with us being a honeymoon couple a room away from families might have been a better choice.  TV selection quite good and coffee making etc good, a fridge which was handy but no safe which was not good! I don't think I have ever stayed somewhere with no room safe. They have them at the front desk which is not very convenient!  So the hotel

My wife and I stayed there overnight for a birthday weekend. The room was ready early so we could leave our bags and take the shuttle to Disneyland. The pool was a nice temperature for swimming and cooling off, and being a salt water pool was different. We didn't have any chlorine smell from that, although they must have put chlorine in the jacuzzi. It was really strong, but still a great temperature. The staff was very helpful, the grounds were nicely done, and the lobby area was beautiful.  My only complaint was the buffet brunch. Most of it was fine, but they cooked the scrambled eggs and frittata so they were very dry and crumbly, and didn't taste that great. All in all, we had a good time with a pleasant room. We did not use the Internet so I don't know what they charge.

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland and great pool
Summary: We stayed for just one night at this property. The hotel is massive. The lobby is beautiful and the front desk staff was great. I don't think there was anyone else standing on the same wing as us, so it was beyond quiet.The hallway carpet was stained and bumpy in places,which was a little disappointing. The room was spacious, but not a good use of the space. The pool was great. Salt water and it went to all the way to 9 feet deep. We used the shuttle to Disneyland that was extremely helpful. There is a additional fee for wifi, but we were told it was free from the lobby. Also almost all the other hotels I've stayed at in the Disneyland area, have take out menus in the room. This one didn't, which stunk after a long day and we wanted to have something other than pizza delievered.

Good Location We stayed at this Sheraton because of the proximity to Disneyland. And over all, that was a great perk.  They had a sales desk to buy your tickets ahead of time and they had a shuttle that ran twice an hour. We were actually close enough that we walked to the Grand California for dinner one night.  Bad Location This Sheraton is right off two busy roads, and our room faced on of these roads. The traffic noise was awful, and we really couldn't sleep well because of it.  Also the hotel is very spread out and we had to walk a ways to get to the right elevator (there was only one, and it was slow).  Overall I would give this a 3.5 (but I can only give who numbers).  If you go make sure you have an interior room and not one on the street.

Even McDonalds has free wifi. This place is a joke. 10 dollars for 24 hours when all you want to do is Skype family for five minutes before going to bed.  I'll never book with this chain again. They're probably used to milking tourists   coming to Disney who don't know any better.

We stayed at the hotel and we were placed in a room that smelled like a kennel. I complained and asked to be moved to a room that did not have a horrible smell. They did move us to another room and I asked if this room was also a room they kept dogs in. They told me No but this room smelled even worse and I had a barking unattended dog in the room next to us. The solution was to send housekeeping into our room and spray air freshener. Very Very Disappointed and the hotel is not kept up at all.

Summary Heading: Nicest place by the happiest place!
Summary: The staff has been amazing here!   Free shuttle rides to Disney, delicious restaurant, great deli/gift shop.  The grounds are really beautiful (rose garden, quiet nooks) private seating, fountains and trees galore.  We were quite pleased with our 3 day stay.   Our room was ground floor facing the rose garden.  Only 1 complaint: Disney fireworks insanely loud at 9:30 and last quite a while. At first I thought it was gunfire. So yeah, you can see the fireworks from here, and hear them.

My family will be staying at the Sheraton Anaheim this December.  We can't believe that they charge $9.00 a day for in room internet.  Sheraton and Westin Hotels can't see the bigger picture of offering value and extra services for the business and family traveller by offering free in room internet.  Get the customer in door and they will spend more money.  There are many comparable hotel chains that offer free in room internet.  I have 3 rooms booked and they will not offer free internet in one of the rooms.  Will not stay at Sheratons after this holiday.

We recently visited Disneyland and used SPG points to book our hotel stay. We had the choice of either this property or the Sheraton Park and we pretty much flipped a coin. And we lost. My in-laws stayed at the Sheraton Park as part of a Southwest package deal and we spent as much time as we could at their hotel. Their hotel was newer, closer to the theme park and the pool was much nicer. I will say that the people at our hotel were very cordial and the shuttle worked like clockwork. Overall, it was adequate but the Sheraton Anaheim could use some updates. If we visit again, we will choose the Anaheim Park Sheraton.

My husband & I stay here whenever we plan a 2-day trip to Disneyland, and have never considered looking elsewhere.  We've also stayed several times with our kids & grandkids.  The rooms are nice and quiet and the beds/pillows are extremely comfy (which is important after a long day at Disneyland!)  The main draw for us is the free shuttle.  A bus leaves the hotel and Disneyland every 30 minutes.  The hotel even provides an early bus at 7:30 a.m. for those lucky enough to have early entry to the park.  We're usually so exhausted when we get to the room that we've never tried any of the amenities (restaurant, pool, etc.)  As a footnote, I stayed at DIsney's Paradise Pier Hotel a few months ago with friends (their choice).  It was a long walk from the hotel to reach the entrance or

We stayed here in July for 7 days. Thought it was a great hotel for families (people without children might have found it noisy). Staff were very friendly and helpful. Kristopher at reception was a delight. The concierge helped us sort out a car hire problem and was fantastic. The shuttle was so convenient and the drivers were friendly. You could not get better value for so close to Disney. The staff kept the rooms clean and tidy and there was room service every day

This is an old hotel but it's in good conditions.  It is very clean, comfortable and has a very friendly staff.  The restaurant offers great food, specially the breakfast. They charge a daily fee for the parking but offer a shuttle to get to Disneyland.  There is a bar, a deli and a fireplace in the lobby.  It is a good option if you plan to go to Disneyland or Fullerton town.

Summary Heading: Mediocre at best, we won't return
Summary: Stayed on Aug 14 and 15 2012 at the Sheraton Anaheim for family road trip to Disney.  Figured it wouldn't be all that nice but would be convenient to Disney / CA Adventure.  It is quite a tired Sheraton, no internet wire in the rooms and no free wireless for Gold SPG like most if not all others I've been to.  The big disappointment was that despite being close to the parks and several buses for shuttles, they never seemed to be on time.  On a Wednesday morning, my family got down and made it on the first shuttle; others who didn't fit were promised a shuttle right away and after 25 minutes another shuttle arrived to take us.  After a great but long day at the park and the World of Color show, we had to wait 45 minutes for a shuttle.  Our kids melting down, while several other

Summary Heading: Allways a great place to stay when you think Disneyland
Summary: The Anaheim Sherton Hotel is a great place to stay when your ready to plan a trip to Disneyland. The hotel is a 5 minute ride to Disneyland and the hotel provides a shuttle every 30 minutes so you don't have to worry about parking. The Hotel offers spacious rooms some with courtyard access, a restaurant, bar, deli, lounge with fireplace, pool and koi pond. Staff are friendly and eagar to help. Always a great experience.

For the money this is a decent choice.  Pros- Nice Lobby Great staff Free Shuttle every 15 mins Great bed Big Room  Cons- Long walk(20 mins)  Odd Smell in the room Stains on carpets Small Gym  Overall its an "OK" hotel. For the price its fine, but next trip we would rather stay somewhere across the street from Disneyland so we don't have to wait for the shuttle every day.

Nice big hotel with a garden, a pool and a patio, and an enjoyable secluded out of the way feeling which is both surprising and welcome considering it is so close to Disneyland. A free shuttle brings you to Disneyland every half hour. The staff was friendly, although we did have to wait around a while for our rooms to be ready and there was poor communication between the cleaning staff and the front desk. We were also somewhat disappointed by the restaurant. All in all, however, a very good value for a reasonably priced hotel and an excellent choice for any family going to Disney.

I think it's fair to say that I'd expect more from a 4 stars hotel. The room is somewhat very odd. It's so big and yet so empty. I guess if you have a big family with 2 king size beds they would fill up the space. For us we strongly feel the room is very poorly designed.  First day after a long walk in the park we were looking forward for a nice hot shower only to find out the water in our bathtub did not drain. We called and the repair guy came within 10 mins, I applaud the promptness. But this is something that shouldn't be overlooked. If the water did not drain, it should have been detected when the room was cleaned after the last guest checked out.  The backdoor is awesome, but the gap between the door and the floor isn't properly sealed. It leaves a small hole, big enough

Despite not being directly on the doorsteps of Disney, this hotel compensated this by offering regular free shuttles to & from Disney throughout the day.  Our first day here, my family utilised the deserted pool. Our 2nd whole day was spent @ Disneyland, which shed light on why the pool was deserted. We discovered an outlet mall "The Block" was only a $15 cab ride away, so spent our 3rd day casually & happily shopping. Our 4th day was spent @ California Adventure Park, & again, thanks to the hotel shuttle service, we were able to spend a whole day there without rushing to catch the shuttle back (last shuttle back is about an hour after the parks close, not bad at all). Didn't utilise the hotel much, as is evident from our schedule above.

We stayed here for 5 days and straight away were welcomed by a very friendly guy at reception who was able to deal with our adjoining room request very quickly.   Our rooms were enormous, much larger than other similar hotels that I have stayed in.   The location is fantastic. Disney is only a short walk or if you and the family are tired you can use the courtesy bus which will take you and return you safely. Buses leave every 30 mins or so.   The food within the hotel is very good. There are also several food outlets locally if you don't fancy anything on the menu.  Parking is not usually free but Virgin Holidays paid for our parking during our stay.

We were only here for one night on a whirlwind tour through Disney, but the hotel is beautiful.  Grounds are lovely; service was great; there is a shuttle to the park, and we could not have been happier.  It is a great alternative to the [much] more expensive hotels within Disney.

We stayed just 1 night prior to a trip to Disneyland. Compared to the horrid experience in Disneyland (see review) the hotel was a giant relief. Room was spacious with 2 queen size beds, easy chairs, desk and enough space for clothes. Check in fast and friendly - booked ahead on line. Food in the restaurant for dinner was good, if somewhat expensive for what it was. We had breakfast a la carte (don't like buffets) and it was a typical breakfast, eggs good, refiels for coffee, potatoes not so great - cold and a bit tasteless - same with the toast.  What I did not like was that it was "a mile" walk from lobby to our room, which faced the parking lot and was noisy. The carpet in our room was severely stained, which was a turn off, however the bed linen was spotless and good.

Stayed as part of an extended trip around West Coast. Convenient for Disney but a not favour for downtown LA/Beverly Hills. Rooms large and modern, other fzcilities adequate. However parking charges at 14 USD per day and wifi at 10 USD are totally unwarranted. Free shuttle to D inset very convenient and punctual.

Great shuttle service in the am - but the afternoon one has Been MIA for over 30 minutes past the pick up time. We ran trough Disney in the heat to show up 10 minutes early for the pick up time (1:15), and still no shuttl. The Candy Cane Inn has been by twice. Our first time trying the shuttles - Not so good in this heat!

Summary Heading: Not bad--but not great for convention center visit
Summary: I stayed here this summer when attending a meeting at the Anaheim Convention Center. The Sheraton across from the center was full and they suggested I try this place. It's a decent place but also kinda worn and not terribly well kept-up. It's the sort of place where the little trash cans outside the side entrances are overflowing with soda cans and cigarette butts when you enter at night. Not a big deal...but I'm just trying to give you a sense of the place. Our room was basically fine.  If I were to visit the convention center again, I would pick a hotel on the OTHER side of Disneyland (closer to the convention center). There are a whole bunch of them within walking distance of the center. From this Sheraton, it's about a 10 minute drive -- or longer, if there's much traffic

Stayed here for 5 nights in June 2012 with hubby & 4 kids. Room is spacious enough for the 6 of us. the free shuttle is great to go to Disneyland. The fireworks from Disneyland can be clearly seen from the hotel grounds especially the car park. The only problem we had is wireless internet in the room is not free and the wireless in the lobby was not functioning well the time we were there. The management should consider free wireless in the room at least for starwood members.

we stayed for 3 nights with Disneyland as our only goal.  The hotel was awesome!  Very clean, restaurant was super nice and the free shuttle bus to Disneyland was perfect.  The hotel also had a computer/printer in the main lobby so we did our automatic flight checkin and printed our boarding passes there before we left.  I couldn't be more pleased with the place!  The hotel staff was soo nice and friendly you would think you were at a Disney resort!  AND we purchased our park tickets in the hotel lobby!!   Way nicer than I envisioned the place when I booked online and especially for the great price!!  A must stay if Disneyland is where u are headed.  A bonus, the great outdoor pool/hot tub is the perfect place to enjoy the Disneyland fireworks if you leave the park before

This was our second stay at this hotel ..... we hadn't intended to stay here for our second visit (not that there was anything wrong with it first time round - we just like to try different places) but after checking in and straight back out of the awful Carousel Inn this was our first choice alternative and luckily they were able to accomodate us at short notice.    We were given rooms on the ground floor with a second door which led out to the pool area which was a nice aspect and very convenient when using the pool.  The rooms are a little bit out dated but are spotlessly clean and very spacious and there is a fridge and coffee/tea making facilities.  The lobby area is very welcoming, particulary the sunken area with the fireplace, and there is a great bar and restaurant.

After a horrible experience at the Anabella the Sheraton was able to accommodate our party with a very pleasant staff! The location is wonderful being walking distance to the parks and to Downtown Disney while having immediate freeway access. The rooms were spacious and clean. Couldn't be happier with our stay!

Summary Heading: Not willing to help when Expedia Messed Up
Summary: Expedia sold us a 6-person suite at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel...when we got there, it was a standard room with 2 queen beds and the option of paying $30/night for a couple roll-aways that appeared to be on loan from San Quentin.    The hotel staff basically told us that we were hosed and to take it or leave it...at 10pm after a long day's drive (with a couple of kids and my elderly parents), we took it.  For our troubles, the front desk offered us the phone number to Expedia Customer Care and the satisfaction of knowing that we weren't the only ones who'd been screwed ("We've had lots of problems with people thinking Expedia was selling them a 6-person suite when they book a 6-person suite" actual quote)...absolutely nothing else...they were "nice" about it, but

We were weary travelers after a long drive into the LA area.  The hotel was easy to find and the lobby was a welcome surprise.  The exterior of the hotel mimics the castle/gingerbread style of the Disney castle, but the lobby is a large, fresh and modern space with an inviting lounge and updated finishes.  The walk to our room was unfortunately wrought with smokers as their designated area was a breezeway separating the buildings, and the ashcan looked worn and dirty.  The room was comfortable and basic, although it felt a little at the low end of Sheraton/Starwood standards.  Can't put my finger on it, but it just seemed a little tired.  The shuttle service was ok, but let me warn you: the pick up area for where the Sheraton van (specifically) will be is not well marked and the

Summary Heading: Not as bad as they say
Summary: We were very vary because of all the bad reviews, but my wife wanted to stay here because if the location.   The good: as opposed to several other reviewers, we did not find any pubic hairs from previous guests in the bathroom.   The bad: the location was not as good as expected. Next time, we will stay at one of the two other Sheratons in the area and walk to Disneyland from there.

The hotel was conveniently located and the shuttle service made is very easy. The assistant hotel manager checked us in when we arrived and gave us lots of incite on Disneyland and the property. We relaxed in the pool and we were afraid that our 5yr old would not feel comfortable with all the older kids in the pool but everyone seemed to behave.  We liked the "Link @ Sheraton" in the lobby where you can check your e-mail or print directions. Rooms are what we expected for the price point.

Summary Heading: Revisit was much better than prior visit
Summary: Despite vowing never to return to this property, we did.  Location was the reason for going back on the promise but am glad we did.  Since our last visit, there has definitely been an improvement in the professionalism and friendliness of the front desk staff.  Kristopher is a major asset to this hotel.  Every time I approached the desk for information, directions, etc., he addressed me by name, was very courteous and helpful.  What a difference from before.  The room we were assigned was large and well laid out.  The bathroom was very small, although the shower fixtures were raised and allowed for a fantastic shower with great pressure.  Towels are still thin though.  The bed was comfortable and the room kept relatively clean.  The only downside to our room was its proximity to

Summary Heading: Wow! You've got to see the fireworks from the parking lot; don't fight the Disneyland crowds.
Summary: Took a friend and her 4 year old for a day at Disneyland and arrived early in the morning; the hotel checked our luggage, gave us temporary keys and assigned a room so that when we got back around 5 PM we just stopped by the front desk to ask the bellman to deliver our bags and were we off to our rooms. We planned to go back to the park to see the fireworks from Main Street, but the staff advised the best view was from their parking lot. Worth the room to see the fireworks. While waiting for the fireworks to start we noticed a wedding party assembled near the front entrance. When the fireworks started the photographer got photos of the bride and groom with fireworks as the backdrop; pretty cool. Our 4 year old thought they were just for him.!

Having spent  four nights in Vegas we drove across the mojave desert onto our next stop Anaheim .we were dismayed on arrival at the location of the Sheraton,on the Santa Ana freeway but the hotel grounds were very well maintained. We had arrived early but had no problem checking in early and reception staff were very friendly and helpful. Our allocated room was well appointed but had a musty stale smell and the basin waste pipe was blocked, we called reception who immediately sent a maintenance man round and was upgraded to another room. This room was fresh clean with the most comfortable beds. The pool area has plenty of sunbeds and tables with food and drink available by phone,my 10year old loved the pool and we could keep an eye on her from the comfort of our sunbed. The

Summary Heading: Run Away...Run Fast, Run Far, Far Away from Here
Summary: Booked this hotel for a family vacation from June 25-29,2012. Have stayed here before for business travel years ago & thought it was a good hotel.  Boy,  Was I WRONG. Booked Deluxe room, found there was nothing Deluxe about it. Room smelled, no view,  & next to banquet areas. In-room video game system did not work, Tried to call for wake-up call no answer--also called front desk no answer. Sink would not drain. Toilet had to flush 3 times inorder to work properly. Again, no answer at the front desk. Parking was FREE for us as part of our Vacation pkg. In reality,its free for everyone due to the exit gates being up & open all the time. Just get a ticket upon entering, park, & upon leaving, just drive thru the open gates Fee FREE! We only stayed one night as that is all we could

I stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel from June 24-28, 2012. I stayed with my family. My kids thought it was great. They liked the Castle appearance from the outside. the pool area was nice. The pool can get pretty crowded. That is because there are a lot of rooms at this hotel. I had a room, where my backdoor opened up to the courtyard. It was very nice. It was a quiet area, so my kids could take a nap during the day if they needed to. The pool area was louder. Not a great problem, just don't get a room by the pool, if you are trying to avoid any extra noise. Highly recommend getting a room with a backdoor if you can. It was nice to have, especially with small children. My kids could go play in the courtyard behind our room. The rooms were spacious. There was two queen sized

Our family booked this hotel because it's close to Disneyland and it looked nice from the outside.  While the lobby is nice, the layout of the hotel is really bad!  Our room was so far from the front that it took nearly 5 min to walk through the maze and that end of the building was dirty.  The carpets were dirty and the side doors had opened and leaves blew in everywhere and weren't cleaned up for 2 days.  Our room had a lot of problems too.  We called the front desk to let them know the air wasn't working and they said to just adjust it and it would be fine.  The room never got below 74 and it was too warm to sleep at night.  The carpet in our room was not pulled tight so there were a lot of rolls in the carpet and I tripped and fell and hurt my knee in the middle of the

Summary Heading: Disney visit, okay, Business, not really
Summary: This Sheraton is another property that has seen some updates and modernization, but still has issues.    Halls smell like dog, and carpets are in many common areas out of date and somewhat worn. My room was okay - walls are thin (noisy, given all the kids here for Disney), the bathroom door had splatters of god-knows-what on it, there were burned out light bulbs in the room, but otherwise reasonably clean and comfortable.  The food itself isn't the stellar, and there's a limited menu that wears thin after a day or two, but the waitstaff for restaurant and room service stood out by being pleasant, helpful and efficient.  One nice touch is that room service prices aren't inflated, and there's no service charge.  The hotel is near to the Disney property. But, if that's not your

I stayed at the Sheraton Hotel with my bf whilst visiting Disneyland California. I wish i had researched this hotel before booking. The pictures make the hotel look amazing but to be honest  I wasn't that impressed with it. The staff were lovely in particularly the waiter who made an effort with us.  We met some lovely people whilst staying at this hotel including some Americans who recommended visiting San Diego, so will definately give that a go next year. The hotel was not in the best location there wasn't a lot surrounding it but there was a free shuttle from the hotel to disneyland. I think if i was to go again i would stay in a hotel closer to the Disneyland resort. We went on a few trips including a shopping one where we visited stars homes from a mini bus. That part of

We picked this due to its proximity to disneyland and for a nice luxurious experience. It has on ok gym, nice (but cold) pool, good staff, great rooms and average food for the price. We enjoyed our experience and appreciate the helpful staff, but the food and table service could have been much better.   The rooms are large and spacious and the hotel is good to relax in near the fire after a long day in Disneyland. All the tours stop at this hotel so you also link up with universal studies, Hollywood etc too which is convenient.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with a Great Location
Summary: This is a great hotel.  It is not a new property, however it is well maintained.  The staff is excellent.  The restraunt is average.  The pool is great.  Goes from very shallow to 9+ ft deep.  Great to swim and stretch before a long day of walking and standing at Disneyland.  The shuttle is complimentary and drives to Disneyland shuttle drop off area.  The shuttle is very reliable.  Leaving hotel on the hour and half hour.  It departs Disneyland on the quarter hour (15 min after hour, 15 min to the hour).  On time, every time over a 4 day periord.  Rooms are large, clean & comfortable.  This place is a bargain for a Sheraton.  Book the AAA discount rate if you are a member.

Summary Heading: Cool Castle Feel - Wouldn't Stay Again
Summary: Low End Starwood - Room was a bit smelly but not too bad.  I actually kind of liked the castle/retro feel for one night. Wouldn't stay here again though.  Free parking was ok, rate was 130 - the value was closer to 89$/99$.

Summary Heading: Super shuttle, rooms need some updating
Summary: The beds are comfortable and bedding is nice. The bathtub in our room was older and not in great shape. The free shuttle to the park is very convenient.  We ordered room service for breakfast. It was a little pricey but the food was good and hot.

I have been working really hard for a couple weeks, so my partner wanted to surprise me, and have a local getaway weekend, he booked this hotel as a surprise.  Boy did we get a surprise, and not a good one.  We checked in, and the manager was very helpful and friendly, so he checked us in to our first room on the property, and everything went downhill from there.  It appears the lobby is newly renovated so I thought great, they re-did the rooms as well, not the case.  When we got off the elevator, I felt like we were back in the late 70's early 80's.   The first thing we noticed was the hallway smelled like mildew badly. It had that forget to take your clothes out of the washing machine for a couple days smell.  Upon opening the door the we encountered the same stench, the room

I have been wanting to write this for a while since I stayed here with my family back in may of 2011.  I just got back from seoul and wrote about our other hotel stays, I felt guilty because I should have written about this hotel earlier since I promote this hotel to everyone I know.  Before I begin let me say this review is not for those that have tons of money and dont care how much they spend, or those who have been saving all there life to have a luxury vacation.  This is for the family or people who travel every year, but have to watch there dollars.  That is why we can travel more often because we budget wisely.  Now when my children were younger yes we spent the extra money and stayed on the disney property. However we were the type to stay in the park the whole day

From the smiling faces of the front desk staff to the incredibly comfortable beds and linens, it was a wonderful one-night stay separating our Disney days.  Upon check in, we received our room keys and directions on amenities. Staff called us about ten minutes after we were in our room to make sure our accommodations were acceptable.  Parking was free and a breeze, shuttle service to and from the park was free as well.  The room was clean and despite the high school prom that was going on that night, the hotel was clean and without disruptions.  Great place for a family to stay that allows for some down time away from the hustle and bustle of other places in the same price range.  Great value!!!

Summary Heading: Decent, but some things are unacceptable...
Summary: We stayed here for one night while visiting Downtown Disney and the parks. The staff is ok, the shuttle to the park was great, there are restaurants and a game room as well. The rooms are outdated as is the carpet, hallways etc. The lobby is nice, the pool is small but adequate and the grounds are well maintained.  There are different buildings so I'm not sure if they all have the same problem, but our building smelled of smoke... slightly inside the room and a lot in the hallway. The hallway carpet was quite stained, and the ice machine looked like something out of the 70's.  (see photo)  The room was clean and a decent size for a family of 4 (with 2 kids), but there are a couple of minor concerns and a couple of major ones too. I can get past the popcorn ceiling, the slight

Summary Heading: An oasis of peace among the Disney maddness
Summary: We picked this hotel for a one-night family stay due to a good email offer we received from Starwood. We liked the proximity to Disney and knew nothing else about the property.  Sheraton has done an excellent job of keeping this property fresh and bordering on luxurious despite the fact that it was obviously first built some time ago. While Mom and the kids played at the Magic Kingdom, Dad stayed back at the hotel and had a perfectly pleasant afternoon reading in the California sun by the pool, and doing laundry (a must after four days on the road, driving from Denver) at the on-site coin-op washers and dryers.  Our standard hotel room was perhaps the most spacious we have ever encountered, looking out over a pretty courtyard. The pool and spa were comfortable, and there were

We have stayed at this hotel many times over the past twenty years because of its proximity to Disneyland.  There is a very "Disney" flavor to the hotel and there is a shuttle that carries guests to and from the Disneyland Resort every half hour.  Staff are pleasant and very helpful and the rooms are very large and many overlook the beautifully landscaped facility.  It is hard to find a fault with this place, but there are a couple of things that are annoying.  A few years ago, they started charging for parking.  The parking area is very large and it seems this is just a way to extract some more money from guests.  There is also a charge for internet except in the lobby area.  It seems odd that one can stay at a very inexpensive hotel and receive free internet, yet at a very

Great hotel. Really friendly service from all the staff. They upgraded us because it was our honeymoon and the room was huge! It was also really quiet and had a very pleasant outlook. The shuttle service to Disneyland was brilliant too. It left every half hour and was extremely reliable and easy. Not much around the hotel by way of restaurants, but we were there for Disneyland (and why wouldn’t you be?) so this place was just perfect. We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel that maintains Starwood quality
Summary: Stayed in the hotel during a huge conference in the nearby convention center.  Overall, the hotel is tastefully done and lives up to the normal Sheraton / Starwood standards.  Staff is friendly and no problems checking in / out.  Pros:  - relatively convenient to the convention center  - good quality for the price  cons:  - pretty small fitness center ~ i chose to run outside  - limited shuttle services to the convention center (i had to use my car and park)  In spite of what some of the other reviewers state about it being a 'short-walk.'  Its really only a short walk there...but after a day at a convention (or disneyland) the walk back is anything but short.

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay for Disneyland!
Summary: This Sheraton isn't as upscale/business orientated as many we have stayed in, but why should it be?  The demographics that it caters to are people who are going to visit Disney!  Everyone was very nice, even the fellow guests!    The beds are great and so is the bedding.  The rooms were fine, nothing exceptional.  The biggest perk of staying in this hotel instead of one of its competitors is two fold.  One, it is not noisy like so many hotels that are near major attractions are.  Two, they have great room service.  They have it very plainly printed in the front of the Room Service menu that they do not add a surcharge for room service and their prices are the same as in their Bistro.  Anyone who has come back from the park worn out, knows how that can be priceless.  But only if

This hotel is a great choice if you are travelling to Disneyland.  Although it is not right next to the park, the hotel offers a shuttle, which is only a short ride away.  The rooms are very large with very large, comfy beds.  There was a bar fridge which was convenient to store drinks and food in.   Also the grounds were very nice.  The hotel exterior had a "Hansel and Gretel" look to it, and there was a large pond with koi in it.  You can even see the Disneyland fireworks from the property Free use of computers and printers and free wifi in lobby which was perfect.  Would definitely return.

Summary Heading: Comfortable and clean but lots of hidden charges!
Summary: Great location for Disneyland and a free regular shuttle there and back made this a great place to stay for our 3 day trip.  The hotel is very well maintained, clean and modern, and the staff are very helpful.  Having stayed in a few hotels in California, this place just lacked that personal touch and everything is extra - parking, wifi, water in the room...!!  But having said that, it is a large company so I guess that's to be expected.

We'll never stay anywhere else in Anaheim.  Here for 2 days & and couldn't have been more impressed, from the moment we checked in.  This hotel is stunningly spotless and beautiful, the room was HUGE,  food outstanding, and the staff couldn't possibly have been more helpful or cheerful!  Front desk was completely accomodating, breakfast buffet was a thing to behold, our bed was SO comfortable, biggest closet I've ever seen in a hotel room, pool & jacuzzi great, and Room Service was fast, friendly, and delicious.  We used the Diensyland Shuttle and it was a breeze;  drops you off MUCH closer to the gate than the Disneyland tram from its own parking lot.  Only downsides:  bathroom has almost no counter space, and $14 daily parking fee is sort of hidden when you make a reservation.

Stayed a week at the Sheraton Anaheim with my family in a king suite. We really thought the hotel was very nice with the pool and gardens and loved the proximity to Disney. The shuttle was great for getting to Disney. You can also walk but I wouldn't recommend tiring out the kds because it is a little trek. 1 blck over is harbor blvd which has every fast food everything you can imagine and I liked the proximity but glad we weren't staying on harbor, it's too commercial and loud for our tastes. One thing to be aware of, when the fireworks go off, it's LOUD but that's a small price to pay for quaint, clean, and charming hotel so close to Disney.

We stayed here for 6 nights and used it as a base for Disneyland/Universal/Knotts Berry etc. We felt welcome, and enjoyed the standard of amenities and facilities. Great staff, Good selection of restaurants and well located.

We stayed here on April 20th, and the hotel looks very nice online but in person it is so old and worn.  They charge for parking even though the arm guarding the entrance was constantly open (broken).  This was totally ridiculous!!  When we returned from Disneyland the hallways smelled of (please pardon my description) diarrhea.  The hallway was hot, stuffy, and the stench was overwhelming!! The room itself was clean but so old.  This hotel should be listed as historical landmark and close its doors to guests.  With all the beautiful hotels in the Anaheim area I would not recommend this Sheraton to anyone.

Summary Heading: great place close to Disney without feeling it!
Summary: We stayed here last May and after just returning from a different hotel I just had to write how much we enjoyed our stay here. The location is close to Disneyland without feeling like you are in the middle of the hustle and bustle of it all so it is nice.  The room was large-had 2 queen comfortable beds along with 2 tables, chairs, mini fridge and still lots of room for our 2 little ones to roam and play. I don't know the occupacy of the hotel but I never heard any voices , noises, door closings. Very quiet!  The shuttle was very convenient as we were there for 2 days, often returned at least once to the room to nap and freshen up for another go at Disney. Only during the night hours were we forced to stand or squeeze in the bus, otherwise it was fine. Make sure to have your

Summary Heading: Our 8th year at the Sheraton Anaheim
Summary: We have just returned from our 8th year visit to this hotel & yet again it was brilliant!!  When we arrived the check in staff were very efficient, helpful & cheerful.  The room we were given was huge as all rooms are & yes the bathrooms are small but what do you need a large bathroom for you go in do what you have to do & leave.  The cleaning staff were great everyday we would come back to a lovely clean/tidy room & if you were to see any of them in the hallways you would always get a cheerie Good Morning. We cant fault this hotel at all, the staff right the way through the hotel are brilliant, the public areas are always clean & tidy.  We loved of an evening to sit at the bar chatting to the other guests & being entertained by the bar staff, thanks Cynthia & Sharrie.  We ate

Sheraton in Anaheim was a very pleasant experience. The staff was great, the hotel was in good proximity to the disney parks and there was a very convienient shuttle that brought us back and forth. Their breakfast buffet was remarkable. The waiters were very nice.   The hotel bathroom was quite small but that was the only negative and the time we stayed the pool was under construction so we couldn't use it. Everything else met our expectations and we would definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Convenient location and a shorter walk to Disneyland than public parking
Summary: This is my 2nd visit to Disneyland Anaheim with the 1st experience staying within the Disneyland compound, so I thought let's see how this works out.  Definiately from a cost perspective it is less than half of what one will expect to pay to stay inside Disneyland but is the convenience worth the premium?  I would say that breakfast options outside of Sheraton are plenty (e.g. IHOP, Denny's) so it was good to walk out of the hotel on to a breakfast stop before heading to Disneyland.  We were a party of 5 adults, a child and a dog and the kind people at reception organised a room on the ground floor (where all reservations with pets will have to stay) next to each other although we will in very late.  Essentially, all the energy would be spent at Disneyland so what one needs

This was our first visit to Disneyland. This hotel was perfect,  Beds were great, comfortable,  sleep quality. We slept very well. Has nice grounds on the outside koi ponds, spa and pool. Something extra to do with kids, Our nieces and nephews loved that. The shuttle was very easy to use and is included, hotel is very close to the park. We must have gone at a good time because the bus was not even close to full when we were on it, Everyone that worked there was very nice. We had  3 rooms total all other family members liked their rooms as well. Good choice. No breakfast that is free, but has room service, cafe ect. Has microwave and refridge in rooms. Nice place.

Family of 2 adults & 4 kids from the UK, we arrived at the hotel to be greeted by Johnny hey what a lovely guy! He helped sort trips & gave great advice. The hotel is excellent Service brilliant breakfast great, we had superb meals in the Bistro at night the food was excellent. The Staff were all very polite & helpful, the hotel runs a shuttle bus to Disney every 30 mins till 1:30am!!!! All I can say is stay here it is fantastic and stress free. Thank you so much for a brilliant time. The George Family (1131,1133)

Stayed here for 1o nights and couldn't fault the hotel, staff or location. Free Bus to Disney which is only a 5 minute ride. Food was great in restaurant,and also a good little cafe inside the hotel for takeaway breakfast/lunch which was ideal if you want a quick snack before heading into LA or the parks. The hotel is also a pick up/drop off point for the Gray Line coaches for the organised trips which suited us perfectly. Lovely pool area and reception areas with computers etc. and a little laundrette beside the pool which was very handy. The staff were amazing, we've never stayed anywhere before which had fantastic customer service. When we head back to LA, we will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Lovely hotel, not spectacular but still good!
Summary: 1. Sheraton Anaheim.  My review is from the point of view of a 15 year old girl so if you're planning on travelling with teenagers & wonder what they'll think hopefully this might help.  The Sheraton Anaheim was just 1 of the hotels that my family & I stayed in on our west coast trip and although it wasn't the best, it wasn't the worst either (but to be honest it's incomparable to the Mandalay hotel of Las Vegas).  May I add for the trip we were doing we didn't get a choice of hotels. First of all; the location. The location was spot on for the disney park (with use of a free shuttle) but nothing else. Personally I came to LA to see the big sights and get in the midst of the city, but this hotel is a 30 minute drive from all of that. That's in fact probably my biggest

We were very surprised by our stay after reading such great reviews.  The hotel is like a factory, huge and impersonal.  The room was very noisy, we heard everything that happened in the bathroom above ours.  We heard knocking in the walls most of the night.  The restaurant staff went out of their way to be rude to us. The shuttle bus was convenient, but  I'd stay closer to the park next time where I could just walk across the street.

Summary Heading: Thankfully discouraged from booking by staff
Summary: Family of 5, including 2yo twins and 6month old baby...website wanted us to book 2 rooms so I called to see if we could just have one room with our 5th person still an infant.  The gal that answered didn't want to answer questions without definate booking dates and said that she couldn't answer my question without knowing our dates and length of stay and really didn't had an attitude!  Really?  After holding for more than 6 mins for her to return with her o so pleasant attitude, I decided to hang up and search some other options based on this experience and most reviews mentioning cleanliness of rooms.  Too bad, the room size would make this perfect for when we weren't using time shares for the family.  We'll take our money elsewhere!    Update and serious cleaning to rooms and

We booked this hotel based on its location and the Sheraton name.  Location wise we are still  happy with the fact it's only minutes away from Disneyland parks and the hotel offers free shuttle every 30 minutes to and from the Disney parks which are quite convenient.  But we did expected a little more from Sheraton in terms of service.  1) We arrived on a Saturday afternoon and there was no valet available to help with luggage and no luggage cart available for us to move the items ourselves.  My husband waited in the car with our 2 kids (5 and 2) while I checked in.  The front desk was helpful and gave me a schedule for the Disney parks as well as the schedule for their free shuttle.  The front desk also called for a valet to help with our luggage but it took a while for him to

Summary Heading: Best place to see the fireworks
Summary: The hotel is a little outdated not bad just outdated. so why the four stars? Well this is the bst place to watch the fireworks! Way better than in the park. It was amazing!! they shoot them of right over the hotel. I stayed here only for one night on business but will be returning with my family so they can have the same experience.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel for a Disneyland Vacation
Summary: This is the fourth year we have stayed here. We have stayed as part of a group, and just as a family. The hotel has some good packages- we just got free breakfast and free parking as part of our last stay. The rooms are nice, the hotel has a wonderful shuttle that is VERY RELIABLE to take you to Disneyland. I would say the front desk staff could be more helpul, and much more friendly, however my kids got hot chocolate from the deli, and the staff working there was very nice, and even got them whipped cream to go on top. Our room was clean, with comfortable beds, and the hotel grounds are very safe and well maintained.

Summary Heading: Quality hotel for a trip to Disneyland
Summary: The Sheraton Anaheim was a quality place to stay for our time visiting Disneyland. The hotel is quiet and comfortable and the staff are incredibly helpful. It is not a world class resort but it is close to the action and offers a free shuttle bus to and from Disneyland Parks every half hour. There is also a cute bistro/restaurant for buffet breakfast and a nice dinner. The room was comfortable and clean.

The room was very large and comfortable and the hotel had a lovely castle theme. The staff were extremely friendly upon arrival and continued to be friendly throughout our stay at the hotel. The restaurant was lovely and served a range of food. In the hotel was a shop for all your essentials and a games room for the children. I really enjoyed my stay here and it was comfortable and quiet.

This hotel needs an overhaul. Musty-smelling air (hallway & room), old carpeting, pictures, ceiling tiles, furniture, etc. RIDICULOUSLY slow internet connection; it took a minute to 1:30 for this page to load on my PC - not kidding. Average to below average food in the restaurant. I wouldn't stay here again and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

This is always the hotel that I stay at with my family when I go to Disneyland.  I love the shuttle service to Disneyland.  The rooms are big.  We ordered room service at 10:00 pm and the food was good.  The staff is very friendly.  The kids enjoyed the swimming pool.   The one and only negative is the windows should be replaced.  They are old and you could hear the freeway outside.  But the noise didn't stop us from getting a good nights sleep.  The beds are very comfortable.

We stayed at the Sheraton for 3 nights, 2 adults and 2 children.  The rooms are huge and have queen beds.  Shower not the best, water not hotmail the time.  I think the hotel was very nice, great lobbying the shuttle very realize.  Best Sheraton by Disney.
My home base in Anaheim.  This hotel is one of nicest in the area. 3 minute shuttle rides and run every 1/2 hour.  Very dependable and friendly drivers. Hotel is very well maintained.

Wish I could give it a 5 star the staff was great and very friendly, the food was good, and the free Disney shuttle was key for us. The only thing was our room kinda smelled a little funny and we could hear the rooms tv next to us all night long keeping the kids up when I called to ask if someone could call them to turn it down nothing happened, so we did not sleep at all. But the kids did like the fish tank and game room and the staff was very nice

The hotel is located near Disneyland. It was about 10 minutes walk to one of the gates which was very handy. The rooms are huge and nicely decorated. There's a cafe downstairs which is more of a diner where we've had breakfast which was just OK.  The hotel itself didn't seem too luxurious and quite soulless.  I don't have to mention that there is nothing to do in Anaheim apart from Disneyland (if you are a fan of this sort of entertainement).

Summary Heading: Great way to start our honeymoon
Summary: I can't say enough positive things about this hotel! We stayed for 3 nights at the start of our honeymoon. The rooms are huge, clean and tidy! The staff knew we were on our honeymoon and brought us a bottle of champagne to our room on the first night which was completely unexpected and a lovely gesture! It's ideally located for Disney and not to far from universal studios. The staff were great and couldn't do enough to help us have a fab stay. The breakfasts are awesome and set you up well for a busy day at the Disney parks. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to others and thank you to all the staff who really made the start of our dream honeymoon

This is another of those " its seen its best days already "...   It was functional as a hotel, its good if you are visiting the Disney parks..  Rooms are huge. ( you could make two rooms in each space and they would still be good sized )..     Service was good, staff friendly and helpful.  Restranant was ok..   Some paint, new carpet, new fitting etc, would really make this great.  ( the lobby is really nice, it just doesn't follow through )

Summary Heading: Enormous rooms, friendly staff, great location
Summary: We stayed one night at this hotel while visiting Disneyland. The hotel has a free shuttle to Disneyland that runs every half hour and takes about five minutes. This worked out great for us.  Check-in and check-out was easy, with very friendly staff members on both occasions. I think this is the first time I’ve been handed a map of the hotel during check-in. It turned out to be useful, as this place is enormous and a bit of a maze.  There’s convenient parking just outside the hotel. You can leave your car in the parking lot until the evening on your departure day, which is great if you want to squeeze in some extra time at Disneyland before driving home. We were a bit confused as to how we would get out of the parking lot after checking out, but it turned out that we could just

Summary Heading: Very average and could do better
Summary: I travel to Anaheim every January for a convention and always stay at this hotel.   It's well located, has large rooms and a heated pool. Where they let themselves down is on the service side, despite staying here over 10 times my requests to have a room nearer the pool still get completely ignored, on this last occasion I requested it in advance and I asked again at check in. I was assured they would do everything they could and then given a room as far away from the pool as it was possible to be. This approach to customer service seems to flow through the whole hotel apart from the bar staff who are excellent and always make an extra effort.  If you need a place to stay it is clean and has all the amenities this is fine but it lacks anything above that because of the lack of

Summary Heading: Best hotel in Disneyland for the $$$$
Summary: Not too sure what a few of the poor reviews below are about. This is a clasic Starwood Hotel - clean, good service, nice rooms, not too sure what the naysayers were looking for. Anyhow, we had a three night stay there last week. Got a room on the first floor on West side. We were about ten seconds from our vehicle which was great, probably a three minute covered walk to the lobby and front desk. Room was immaculate and spacious, all amenities you'd want. Starwood even leaves you a brand new loofa sponge to use in the shower!!  Internet in the room is $10 but at Sheraton there's free wireless in the lobby as well as four available desktop computers and free printer. So we would just pit stop in there on the way to/from Dland and get our fix. A great idea to get people out of

What great size rooms!  We had three adults in two king beds and had all the space we needed - even had a separate basin and mirror outside the bathroom which is great.  Beds were COMFY ++ and room was clean.  Carpets throughout the hotel are threadbare and perhaps a little musty smelling which was off putting - these are the main reason for the lower score to be honest.  As regular Starwood geusts we did expect more. Location is fantastic and the shuttle to Disneyland was fantastic with really friendly drivers. If the bus fills up they order another which would only take a couple of minutes ot come by. The internet section downstairs was great - free with fast broadband access and child free.  Bar and restaurant staff were lovely apart from one barmaid on a weekend night who

we stayed here for 5 days in november 2011. the hotel is very nice, although probably slightly dated, the room was hugh, the bed was awesome and soooo comfy. we had one at the back of the hotel over looking the pool and was dead quite, the front of the hotel has the car park and a very busy freeway outside. the staff were all friendly and helpful, they put a free shuttle bus on to disneyland which is great, if you book through virgin the parking was free otherwise i think it was around $10+tax a day. if you think this is a good hotel to visit hollywood and l.a from then think again, even though its only about 45miles out, its rush hour every hour of the day and it takes a minimum of 3 hours to drive into hollywood, its also about a 2hr drive to san dieago (sea world). all in all

It's 1 of 3 Sheratons surrounding Disneyland, and it's also the closest. A free shuttle takes you on a less than 5 minute drive to the park. The rooms are insanely large and very clean. Not kidding, a king room has lots of floor space. Big comfy bed. It's a quaint, quiet, clean, warm & modern Sheraton hotel w/ a little old school feel. Alexis at the front desk was a sweetheart and genuinely friendly and welcoming, always asking what else we needed. There are a ton of motels, hotels, and the Disney hotels, and well, this is just a great Starwood property in the area.

Went with my wife and 14 year old son, had a very large room with 2 nice kingsize beds (slept really well). The room had a desk, a table with 2 comfy chairs, lots of storing place. Our room was facing Disneyland and we could see the amazing fireworks each night a 8.45 from or room sitting in the comy chairs drinking wine. I appreciate the well sorted Deli where you can buy sandwiches, chips, drinks, soup, sallad, cheaper stuff to your breakfast, wine, beer, soda. They also have restaurants. There is a free shuttle to Disneyland. The pool is really nice and they have a small Arcade with some games and a pool table. We have a nice feeling staying at this hotel.

Summary Heading: Not What I Expect From a Sheraton
Summary: Although I am generally loyal to Starwood brand hotels, I cannot recommend this particular Sheraton. Although the hotel's location and proximity to Disneyland are great, the rooms were extremely shabby and worn out. The plastic shower tub and dubious-looking massage shower head looked like they had been there since the early 1990s, or perhaps even before.   The bathrooms are tiny; in fact, ours was so small that there wasn't even room for a sink or mirror. Those are located outside the bathrooms. This is a pain if you're trying to get ready while your spouse or partner is still trying to sleep (take it from me, the sleeping partner).  On the plus side, the beds were standard Sheraton issue and were very comfortable. There was a large flat screen TV in the room. While the

Got there the room was located in north tower,1st floor patrick checked us in, didnt give us all the information he gave other guests. Someone left a cup of old soup in room stunk the whole room advised front desk was moved to main building 3rd floor. No elevator service to 3rd floor had to carry luggage up 3rd floor very unhappy. Outdated room could not sleep in beds not new charged for 3 nights for parking, on phone was told only 2 nights
My family and I have stayed here the last few trips to the Magic Kingdom.  Rooms are very large, great for family travel. Shuttle to park is convenient with great helpful drivers.   we will be back!

We arrived on Christmas Day.  We had a standard room with a King bed.  The room was extremely large and comfortable.  The room was so large that we were able to leave the pull out couch extended during our entire stay, and it did not interfere with any of the light saber fights between my husband and son.  The shuttle services was wonderful.  The drivers were punctual and helpful.  We loved the ease of going back and forth from the park at our leisure.  The food at the hotel was adequate and convenient.  We would definitely stay here again.

Very convenient location and they have a free shuttle to Disney. The lobby is cozy with fireplaces and beautiful fish tanks.  We did the breakfast package, which is worth it. They upgraded us to a suite for free on new years eve which was great! The bathroom was a little small and dated, but the rest of the suite was very comfortable.  You can see the Disney fireworks very clearly.  We will definitely go back again.

First time there service was great. Rooms were big and very updated. The small Deli had good food and excellent service. Free shuttle bus to Disney with enough pickups and drop offs. Only down fall.. not walking distance to restaurants. Had a great time I'm sure we will be back.

We stayed at the Sheraton November 19th-23rd, 2011.  I booked two rooms overlooking the pool as I was going with my husband, two children and two sisters.  The rooms were adjoining which was fantastic.  The children LOVED this hotel, its outside looks like a castle and they have Koi ponds, Rose gardens, heated pools etc, my children (5 and 6) thought they were staying in Beauty and the Beasts castle.  The pool was heated and even though it was extremely cold out, they swam every day.  I found the hotel to be clean not dirty in the slightest.  The staff were wonderful (except for the Disney desk, I found those staff memebers to be curt and not very helpful at all), all the rest were brilliant, from the front desk to the GRA's that cleaned the room.  The breakfast staff in the

This hotel is awesome!  The rooms are HUGE!  The shuttle is great as well.  It is only a 5 minute shuttle ride to Disneyland.  The drivers will load your strollers for you.  I wasn't that impressed with the breakfast buffet, however, it is the normal breakfast buffet food, nothing too special.  The staff was extremely nice and curtious.  I am always weery of staying at a different hotel than our norm but this paid off.  I don't understand why they charge us to park though.  That is why I give it 4 stars.  We will be back to the Sheraton!!  Thanks Sheraton of Anaheim!!

Summary Heading: Good, clean and close to Disneyland
Summary: This is not a hotel you would come to for romance or for poshness, but who would go to Anaheim for those things anyway?!  Most people go to Anaheim for business or for Disneyland, the latter is why we went.  Pros:  Clean!  I picked this resort because I had read so many bad reviews about the Disneyland resorts (i.e. bedbugs?!) that i didn't want to risk putting our 18 month in harms way.  It didn't disappoint.  Service! The way it should be.  Everyone was friendly, prompt and went out of their way with a smile on their face.  Lobby was big, relaxing, very inviting and modern.  Very nice fireplace that we were able to sit by and enjoy a cocktail.  The grounds were dressed up for Christmas and very quaint.  The shuttle back and forth to Disneyland is quick and timely, always on

My husband and I stayed over the weekend to celebrate our anniversary.  We honeymooned at Disneyland (18 years ago) and wanted to recreate some honeymoon magic and since we have Starwood points we chose this location.  Because of said points we were upgraded to a suite.  The room was large but not very well appointed.  There was a pull out couch and a chair (both not very comfortable to sit on) and a table that served as a desk.  There was a lot of dead space in the room.  The bathroom, while clean, was miniscule.  With all of the dead space in the room it was baffling how tiny the bathroom was. The bed was fairly comfortable but the pillows and linens were awful as were the towels.  Many reviews stated that the walls are paper thin, my husband declared this the understatement

Summary Heading: Good off Campus Disneyland Hotel for SPG
Summary: First I am here on SPG points. This makes it a great value.  Goods: spacious nice lobby, friendly staff, good food in main restaurant, spacious rooms (500 sq ft), free shuttle to DLP. Note: the other Sheraton has 300 sq ft rooms and a shuttle that costs $.  The cons: staff is friendly, but not pros. Took 15 min to get bellman, no vallet car service, waiter in restaurant did not clear dishes off table or make sure we had proper utensils, bathrooms in rooms tiny, and worst of all NO GOOD Coffee. The only latte on the property is through a machine in the lounge reminiscent of something you'd see at 7/11. Restaurant had nothing either.  All in all, happy, especially for price.

Summary Heading: Good value for a good hotel
Summary: If you are looking for a five star hotel this is not for you, but that said you can't go past this hotel for it's presentation cleanliness and room sizes, we have stayed here on no less than 6 times and always go back, the restaurant for breakfast and diner is like most hotels eat outside somewhere The shuttle service to the resort is a great service and is ALWAYS on time

We stayed in this hotel b/c I had stayed in it decades ago as a kid when my family first went to Disneyland. The hotel is okay. The staff is really nice from the valets, shuttle drivers are darling, front desk, room service, housekeeping, everyone was lovely to deal. The shuttles run every 1/2 hour and are always on time and Disneyland is just around the corner.   The room smelled kinda musty which bothered me. They have satellite tv/movie channels which didn't feel like working one of the nights we were there. Carpets look worn. My sister and her family and a 2 bedroom suite which was furnished nicely but had some dated components to it... and in room bar that just looked odd.   Like I said, it's just okay.

The rooms and public areas in this hotel need updating.  The third floor hallway outside my room had several buckets to catch water from either a leaking roof or leaking HVAC systems.   The room itself iis dated, older furniture and TV and small dated bathroom.   Location is convenient to Disneyland but I suspect you can find a nicer hotel at less cost.

After traveling for an entire day, it was a relief to finally arrive at my hotel.  Unfortunately, the 2 outside attendants (bellhops?) didn't even offer to help with with my 3 bags.  The front desk person was very nice; however, again, never even asked if I needed help getting my bags to my room.  The room was spacious, but smelled musty.  Also, I had to unplug lights and crawl on the floor to get to the outlets so I could charge my computer and devices.  The wireless signal is not very strong and they still charge for internet.  I was able to hear the conversation going on in the room next to me and had to leave the tv on to drown it out.  I suppose it's ok if you're just staying here for Disney, but as a business hotel, it is lacking.

Summary Heading: It's ok if you're ok(with it)
Summary: We stayed here on a visit to Disneyland with some extended family for four nights with kids ranging from infants to 13 years of age.  The shuttle was on time and the drivers were friendly and helpful.  The front desk seems to be well staffed but no one goes out of their way to help meet your needs.  We have stayed at Starwood properties in Hawaii, New York, Los Angeles, Chicago...this falls a bit below average.  The hotel is old and outdated but they seeem to keep it clean.  There are obvious repair issues needing immediate attention even as you walk down the hallway to your room.  There are strange sounds at night that none of us could decide the origin of (water heater, air conditioning, ten men with large steel shovels shoveling coal in the steam engine room...?)  The walls

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights to go to Disneyland. The room was spacious and clean. Check in was good as we arrived early in the morning and they had our room ready by midday. Close to everything in Anaheim and the shuttle bus to Disneyland was just a bonus. We walked to and from Disneyland as it was a safe 10 -15 minute walk to the front gate but it was nice to know the bus was there if we needed it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Anaheim.
Wonderful welcome, excellent food and wine. Great internet area, good fitness room. Good idea to get shuttle bus into anaheim we found a great restaurant there! Would stay again!!!

I stayed at this hotel for 2 days while visiting Dinseyland. I found the room very spacious, clean, well appointed and very comfortable. Check in was warm and friendly with also no fuss and informative and helpful with questions I had asked. Close to almost everything you would want to do in Anaheim. All staff were friendly and the room was cleaned very well both days. Guest services were helpful especially after checking out they held my bags for the day whilst going to Disneyland. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Anaheim.

From the top notch shuttle to the wonderful buffet breakfast this place was great.   I was worried about not being right across the street from Disneyland but it was nothing to worry about!   The shuttle was always ready and the staff were extremely polite.   The beds were super comfortable and the rooms extremely clean.   The only negative thing I can say is the bathroom was small; there were 4 of us in the room so you really couldn't get more than 1 person in the bathroom at a time.  Overall this hotel was fantastic and I will be staying here next Disneyland trip.   Oh I almost forgot to mention that you have an awesome view of the fireworks show from the parking lot and no crowds!!!
this was a really nice hotel. the staff was friendly and the room service was really good.

We stayed here as we were going to Disneyland for one day out of our LA area trip.  We are used to 'mid level' hotels - nothing fancy.   I called earlier in the day as we were going to check -in late and I wanted to make sure we didn't lose our room. Front desk was very polite & said room saved until 7am the next day. Great!  Once we arrived at night - we pulled up and I thought "hm. not as bad as some of the reviews said." Parking was easy and as we rolled into the lobby I was surprised by the upgraded lobby. Don't be. All the money went into the lobby.   Checking in was quick - and the staff was nice. I heard very nice/ fun banter with the other guests and everyone was efficient and helpful.   Once we had our room assignment we went forth - to the scariest, dirtiest, oldest

While this hotel is located close to Disneyland and offers shuttle service on the half hour, the decor is more than a little tired and desperately needs to be updated.    Rooms are large and beds are comfortable, there aren't enough available plug in's for cell phone chargers or computers.    Free WiFi in the lobby is a joke, reminiscent of 56K dial up. Anyone requiring Internet access for business should avoid this hotel. Took 1.5 hrs to check-in on line for our flights home.

I picked the Sheraton because of closeness to Disnelyand. I was disappointed in the way they do the breakfast vouchers. We were treated a little rudely by the head hostess. First we were offered orange juice and coffee to go, then when we asked for it we were told it was against policy? A bit inconsistent. Also we had trouble with our remote and t.v. Never seemed to work right. I dont know if anyone ever came to look at it? I also noticed in the deli where the muffins were, they were some knats flying around in there...I was a little surprised about that. The rooms were clean, although not that great for children, too much office furniture set-up. When your traveling with kids you need more bathroom space. This Hotel is set up more for Conferences and meetings then for familys.

Summary Heading: Stop knocking on my door, housekeeping!
Summary: This hotel can be seen off the freeway and its outside Castle-like appearance is very fitting for its environment since it's right next door to Disneyland.  The shuttle comes every 30 minutes (I forget the first and last shuttle times) so it's very convenient for Disneyland travelers.   We arrived pretty late since we went to Disneyland first.  Upon arrival, the front desk did not recognize me as a Platinum SPG member so there was no upgrade but I did request for late check-out for 4pm and they said it was ok.  The thing that was really annoying is that after 2-3p, housekeeping constantly knocked on our door every 30 minutes even though we put up the do not disturb sign on our door knob.  It seems like front desk didn't update them on the late check-out and we finally just said

We stayed for 4 nights whilst visiting Disneyland. Whilst the property is starting to a look a little tired it represents good value. The rooms are large and comfortable and quiet. Shuttle service every 30 mins to and from Disney land. A real surprise was the food at the bar and restaurant, very nice. Would stay there again

Summary Heading: Very nice alternative to on-resort property
Summary: Typical Starwood service- front desk was helpful on check-in and all employees encountered were cheerful and went out of their way to assist.  Shuttle was always on time (5-7 minute ride), but gets crowded at opening and closing.  Room was big and comfortable, but bathrooms are small.  Road noise was the biggest drawback- audible in the room.  Arcade had some broken machines.  We did not use the pool, but it looked fine.

Summary Heading: Nice rooms but staff attitudes need improvement
Summary: We stayed for three (was supposed to be four) nights at the Anaheim Sheraton.  Having previously stayed at this property, I was looking forward to the stay.  Unfortunately, I was greeted by what appeared to be a trainee at the front desk and what should have been a fast process, took forever and was extremely frustrating.  Only one of two rooms was ready (it was 2 and check in was 3).  We did not get the other room until much later.    The rooms were large and clean, with the exception of the bathrooms which were tiny.  The beds were very comfortable and there were lots of pillows available.  No free wi-fi in the rooms and the free wi-fi in the lobby was snail-paced.    The lobby bar was a nice place to stop before bed in the evenings.  We had one excellent bartender on the

Worst experience from check in til we left hotel without even staying here! Room smelled terrible & carpet was so dirty you wouldn't want to walk barefoot. We requested a different room & were directed to a floor where the ceiling tiles in the hall were removed with buckets strewn about catching water from leaks I presume. We went back to front desk to express our dissatisfaction with the property & the manager would not even look at us- she told us we were past the cancellation & would be charged if we didn't stay- she was VERY rude & unprofessional! This hotel is not clean & very rundown. Sheraton should be embarrassed! Never again- we will dispute the charges with our credit card

Summary Heading: Great location, top notch after renovation
Summary: Some reviews have stated that portions of the property are not yet renovated, but I didn't experience this.  The carpets, lobby and rooms were all outstanding.   I had an inside room on the second floor so had a quiet night as well.  I can't comment about road noise for any of the outer rooms, but perhaps that's an issue. Location - short walk to Disneyland w/ free shuttle as on option Service - very friendly staff Restaurant - had breakfast there most mornings - nice and reasonably priced Lobby - updated with wifi, computers, etc.  ATT wifi customers get free wifi in room too  Rooms - No complaints.  All good and modern.  Sbux coffee in room was a nice touch.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, great location but noisy rooms
Summary: We stayed here for 4 nights to enjoy the amusement parks in the area. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very nicely maintained and the gardens are beautiful.   The location is very good near the highway and they offer very efficient shuttle services to the Disney Parks.   The unfortunate thing is that all rooms have connecting doors, making the rooms rather noisy. During our second night our neighbor kept us awake for a long time. The frontdesk staff was very nice and gave us a different quieter room immediately.   Two minor drawbacks;   - expensive in room internet - parking $10 per night

Summary Heading: Excellent location, services, and a friendly staff
Summary: I stayed here for a business conference. The hotel seems to cater more toward the Disneyland tourist families. However, the hotel is quiet and the staff is very friendly. The location is excellent. In general, the hotel is clean and well-maintained. However, parts of the hotel are a bit dated. The hallways and fitness center could use a modernization. My room was comfortable. The bed and bedding are new and high quality. The room size was large, but not really geared for the business traveler, except for the in-room coffee maker with Starbucks coffee and Tazo tea. The room lacked any real workspace, had a small CRT TV, and there was a slight smell of cigarette smoke in the bathroom area. There are old crank out windows,which I haven't seen in a hotel in many years, but was a

Summary Heading: Overall good, but bathroom was excluded..
Summary: We stayed 2 days in this hotel when we visit Disney, This hotel was like a maze, and unfortunately the room assigned for my family was located at very the end of somewhere in this hotel, we had lot of baggage and a strollers with us, but we can't have any one to assist us to bring staffs to my room??  The Room is big with standard comfort Starwood level, but the bathtub in the bathroom was so bad. We took a shower and the water was never discharged from the tub, and we need take a bath for our little babies?  Kids were too little and my family was tired to go long way to switch the room and we can only try to clean the tub? I'm wondering to know if their housekeeper watch their job well.  The shuttle service to Disney is convenience and it's easy to park our car in the hotel to

Hi stayed at this hotel as part of the Virgin Air tour. Lovely hotel and great location.. Rooms and staff really nice.  Had dinner in hotel once and was very good.  The shuttle bus is very convenient.  Would recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Stayed for 8 nights, would stay again
Summary: My husband and I met up with my parents for a "theme park" vacation.  When we went to check in, they found us adjoining rooms, rather than just sticking us where ever there were vacancies. The rooms were very large and roomy.  I read complaints about the bathrooms, but found absolutely nothing wrong with them.  There is an extra vanity area outside the bathroom, so the bathroom didn't seem too small.  The beds were incredibly comfortable and we all slept very well.  If you are going to eat breakfast in the hotel, definitely go with the buffet...you end up paying more for less if you order pretty much anything else.   The shuttle to Disneyland was awesome...very friendly drivers, unbelievably convenient and always on time.  The only drawback is a serious lack of outlets to plug

Summary Heading: Free shuttle to Disney and large comfortabe rooms
Summary: We stayed here to visit Disneyland and found the rooms to be large and comfortable. It is a huge property and staff were very knowledgable about all things to with Disney and there is a Disney desk in the lobby which was really helpful. The free shuttle to Disney and back was great especially as kids are really tired by the end of the day spent in the park. The cafe/store was a great alternative to dining in the restaurant for a quick inexpensive breakfast.

Summary Heading: Stay here, you wont regret it!!
Summary: We have just got back from the states, we stayed here and it was brilliant.  we had two massive beds.  The pool area isnt massive but it was never too busy.  I think alot of people stay here and go to disney, as disney is literally round the corner!! WE had a car so we drove to hollywood in about 45 mins.  I think its in a good location.  Me and my husband didnt go to disney during the day, but visited it at night for the restuarants (you dont need to pay to get into the park to eat here). Some people in the pool was saying that the bathrooms here were small.  The bathroom was small-ish but how much room do you need? there was plenty of room and the bedrooms where very big.
