We did alsorts during our stay, universal studios, hollywood home tour, it was all brilliant.   The only

Summary Heading: This hotel is a bit smelly!
Summary: PROS: The hotel offers a service whereby you can purchase your tickets to Disneyland / Disney's Adventure Park from the Sheraton lobby. The hotel also offers a free shuttle to and from the entrance to Disneyland. The room was large and the bed was very comfortable. The Sheraton was very accommodating and the available breakfast was fantastic.   CONS: The main problem with the Sheraton is......the terrible smell of rising damp in the corridors outside the rooms. Fortunately it was not present in the actual room, the lobby or the main restaurant area but it was very off putting.

This was our first time to Disneyland as a family (2 adults and 1 child) with Mother-in-law also.. Decent size rooms.  Comfortably sleeps four.  Very comfortable beds.. . smallish bathroom but imaculately clean.. Free shuttle was great (only 5 minutes away). Internet acces. Beautiful and reasonably priced buffet.. small shop in the hotel had everything you could need at a fair price,, Staff were happy to help with any queries.  Not in the main stream and noise of Disneyland but definately close enough!!

Stayed here on tour of California and the west. Hotel ensured we had connecting rooms without prompting. Rooms were spacious, comfortable and quiet. Restaurant prices were reasonable; food was as one might expect. All in all a great place to stay with easy access to   Laguna beach (half hour drive ) and close to LA tour company, which wil pick you up at the hotel. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful.

very close to disney and free shuttle makes it an ideal place to stop for disney however we didnt feel it was worth the price we paid, whilst it was very clean and spacious sleeping area, the facilitys were dated and the bathroom was tiny. The pool was a good size and was usually quiet which we enjoyed as well as a lovely warm jacuzzi was lovely. the staff were very friendly and was a good view of the disney land fireworks from the hotel which i loved.Also a disneyland concierge in the hotel helped us book a charecter meal as well as giving ticket advise. i would reccommed this hotel but only if u get a good price-it is not worth what we paid

We were very disappointed with this hotel. It is reated by Virgin as 4* and I'm sorry but it is 3*, just marginally better then a Travellodge. The carpets are filthy - and smell. When you walk down the corridors to your room the smell is definitely noticeable. The beds were uncomfortable - too springy and sift as were the pillows. I struggled to sleep the 6 nights we stayed here. The sheets were hard and noisy I think that they put too much starch in them. Wireless internet was unreliable - luckily for us as we travelled with Virgin it was free I would be really fed-up if I was charged for it each day that I tried to use it. The shower in our room did not work properly and the hairdryer was sticky to touch.  The room was very spacious and had a lovely view over the rose garden

We stayed at the Sheratton for a couple of days so we could visit Disney before then moving on to other locations in California. The rooms are large and comfortable, even if the decor is a little outdated. Everything was clean and in good order.  There is a good restaurant and the staff are helpful and friendly. There is a free Disney shuttle to and from the park at regular intervals.

PROS:  FREE shuttle to/from Disneyland (and at reasonable times) Extremely friendly staff Beautiful lobby area Large rooms  CONS: Carpet was filthy - there were red stains in front of one of the beds (like fruit punch was spilled), and some weird HUGE orange stain between the 2 beds! We didn't want our 2-year-old on the floor at all. One day, housekeeping turned off the fan in our room completely. And it was REALLY warm that day, so our room was stifling when we returned from a long day at Disneyland. The sundries store in the hotel didn't carry much sundries, and the closest store outside the hotel is a good mile down the road. Not very convenient. The beds were uncomforable - maybe it was just our room, but sweet sleepers are usually pretty comfortable. Not this time. Too

I have stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim seven times over 23 years.The Tudor style hotel is a great value for money place to stay. Situated at the back of Disneyland the free Hotel  Shuttle Service is exemplary in its customer service. Very convenient in its shuttle times running up to the close of Disneyland each night.  The rooms are enclosed in the building which makes them very quiet and all weather access. The rooms are clean and modern and SAFE.  The Hotel staff are very considerate of your needs and were always helpful. The Hotel is on the pick up location for all tours that go to Hollywood & Universal studious & other LA attractions. On the down side , beware of the small food shop at the Lobby level. I was ripped off by the attendant when I gave him a US $ 50.00 note and

We are local, but we like to stay here because it is relatively inexpensive and the free shuttle is very convenient. It is a solid 3 star, clean and rooms are decent sized, but it is on the older side (I think but in the 70's) so bathrooms are smaller. If you stay here, request a garden facing room as some face the busy freeway which can be loud t night.

This was our 3rd stay as every year we stay here as my husband and sons participate in the Disneyland 1/2 Marathon. Stay away from the "newest" building. All these years, you think they would have fixed the air-conditioning situation. Lastly, they are not great with check-in, they made a huge error with our recent stay.  I ended up having to find another hotel, to then pursue the issue more and then they found my reservation. Ended up paying 1/2 for the other hotel stay as well.  I had to be assertive to obtain a discount, the front desk manager was rude and everytime I went by the desk he gave me an irritated look. Very uncomfortable and unavoidable all weekend.  The error was theirs yet he had a difficult time admitting it.  Breakfast Buffet...the best ever!!

Summary Heading: Great Family Hotel near Disneyland Resort
Summary: This is the second time we have stayed here. The best thing about the hotel is the staff. They work really hard to make your stay worry-free. Although it is close enough to walk to the park (a long walk) they offer continuous shuttle service. When Grandma had trouble getting up the first big step into the bus, they told us to call when we were ready to leave and they brought over a small. low step bus just for us. This was for every day we went to the parks, a ride just for us. Rooms were clean with refridgerators. There is a deli, really saves some money. Dd not eat in the resturants.

It was such a huge room that we never stayed before, but the TV was old-fashioned and small. The bathroom is comparably small. The room provides all the basic needs. The service was good. The beds were comfortable.

Summary Heading: Friendly staff and close to convention center
Summary: Stayed here one night while in Anaheim. Front Desk was very helpful and friendly. Room was nice, average hotel space. We felt safe and our room was nice and clean. Our room faced the parking lot, but we were able to see the Fireworks go off at Disneyland which was a nice perk.

Summary Heading: Nice large rooms with free shuttle to Disneyland
Summary: We enjoyed our 2 nights stay at this hotel during our visit to Disneyland.  The bedroom was large, beds were comfortable, and the environment was quiet.  There is a free shuttle to Disneyland every 30min that saved us the parking fee and the walk.  We didn't eat at the hotel, but other services was fine.  Overall, the hotel was good value!

We stayed here for 8 days in August. The rooms were very comfortable and clean and we slept really well . Ate in the restaurant very nice food and good service. The thing that gives this hotel the edge over others we have stayed in is the outstanding staff, nothing is too much trouble. They are the hotels best asset especially Art at the front desk  The shuttle bus to the park is reliable and convenient.

Summary Heading: need to think twice of visiting again
Summary: it is shame that when i order water bottles they said they have run out of water and wanted me to go to & eleven to buy them at night. Hotel like sheraton do you belive it? And I have doubts whether they replace our towles when the cleanning procees. They wnated us to put the towels on the floor which we wanted to change. but there was one towel which we used and had hair colour stain on it and in the night we saw it was in the bathroom again nicely folded. so we were reluctant to use all the towels on that day. One more thing........  staff in the restaurant  is not frinendly and I assume all depend on tips. It looks like tip is a must! even if we like their  service or not. but the front office and bell desk staff is nice.

We will be returning to the Sheraton Anaheim in March 2012 for our 8th visit - we just love it for many reasons. 1) The staff are so friendly & helpful from the Chamber Maids to the General Manager nothing is ever too much trouble, if you ask for something then they get it for you, if you ask for directions then they find out & tell you. The staff at the front desk are always cheerful making a point of saying Good Morning with a smile, they are all very helpful & make check in/out as quick & painless as can be.  2) The rooms are huge, yes the bathrooms are small but how big do you need a bathroom after all you dont hold parties in there you do what you have to do & get out.  We have never in all the years we have been visiting had problems with leaking taps, no hot water or

Summary Heading: A great location for Disneyland and restaurants
Summary: Hotel was within easy walking of Disneyland and also plenty of restaurants to suit all budgets.  This was just as well as would not recommend the hotel restaurants - Overland Stage lacked atmosphere and the food was a little bland.  Rooms were very clean and comfortable, although a little small for a family.  Also the garden view was a 10 foot hedge which made the room very dark.  Pool was great and not crowded in the afternoon.  Beware the hotel welcomes pets and there were guests with dogs either side of us which did tend to bark when left alone in the room.

Summary Heading: The Hotel is 5 Star but the service is like 3 star.
Summary: 1.) The place is old and hasn't been re-renovated for decades. 2.) Wireless is not free and the wireless point is at the lobby so if you're using it in your room the connection is going to be terrible. 3.) the food taste really bad. 4.) the waiters has an attitude and ignores your request, a simple hot water request isn't too hard am i right? wrong! they have to give you a jug that has coffee stain in it and the hot water taste like coffee water, and some of my family member will have a tummy ache if a drop of coffee is in their drink. 5.) the bus to Disney is so small even on a weekend when there are a lot of people they use the small bus (but they have a bigger bus) and people have to wait for the next bus when it's full (30min wait) 6.) When you look out the window you only

This was the fourth American hotel of our Californian/Nevada tour and thanks to Tripadvisor, every one has been a success!Would never book a hotel without reading the reviews first and this is why I seem to be able to give 4 and 5 stars. This hotel, however, excelled this year. Thought our assigned room a little dark last year so mentioned it when we checked in and were immediately allocated a lovely large and newly renovated room overlooking the rose garden.Through Virgin Holidays we also got free internet connection in our room(there are free computers in the reception/lobby area.) and late check out.  The concierge were able to get us 3 day hopper passes for Disneyland at $199 each instead of the $224 in the parks. The buses to the parks were very reliable and if there were

Summary Heading: Decent DisneyLand hotel with free shuttle
Summary: The hotel is good at providing a calm place to relax after a hard day of Disney-ing. The hotel has a nice pool that closes at a good hour so you can sleep and not hear it. Be warned if you a light sleeper, the Disneyland fireworks will rattle your room when they are launched. It woke up all the adults in our group. The shuttle drivers to Disneyland are very nice and the staff is overall friendly. The on-site concierge seem to be able to only tell you about Disneyland things so don't bother asking about other things to do in Anaheim. It does not have starwood club lounge and it's benefits. The rooms are good sized ( except the bathrooms??) and have refrigerators in all the rooms! I would stay again!

The hotel was chosen as it was near to Disneyland. The reception staff were wonderfully friendly. The hotel is very large and it was a bit tricky to find our room after a 16 hour journey to the US but once we did we were very happy with the room. It was large and clean. Fridge and coffee making facilities were provided. The bathroom was well stocked with towels and very clean. We stayed for 5 nights and the room was immaculately cleaned each day.  There's a shop in the hotel and a small deli for those who don't wish to use the restaurant. This was very useful as there are few restaurants or facilities within walking distance. [we didn't have a car]. It is possible to walk to the Downtown Disney area and it's many eateries and it took us about 15 minutes to get there on foot. The

I was traveling alone to Disneyland with my daughter and wanted a place that had interior corridors (as opposed to our door opening to the street outside) and a shuttle.  This hotel had both and was a decent price with a AAA discount.  The room was extremely spacious, clean, and had comfortable beds.  Our room faced the interior rose garden so it was a little dark during the day but it didn't matter much since we were going to Disneyland.  The room was especially dark at night with the blackout drapes closed.  The only complaint I have is that one of the lamps had a bulb that burned out and one of the bedside lamps needed to be tightened.  It would sometimes fall over.  I believe these are minor complaints in comparison to the convenience this hotel was for me.   Also, be aware

We enjoyed our stay here, the staff were friendly,the food was great, the rooms clean and tidy, the beds were wonderful. The bar staff were great, fun very informative. Can book tours etc in lobby, free buses run to Disneyland. Would stay there again.

Summary Heading: don't bother. plenty of better hotels surrounding disney parks.
Summary: I picked it mostly because of free parking. THIS IS NOT TRUE. $10/night/car. I do not remember where I read it, but it was while researching various hotels for a few weeks before finally deciding on this one. By the time we got there, we couldn't do anything about it (the customer is never right anymore). So, we checked in. The room, while large, was more dingy then I ever expected. The beds were nothing special, the carpet old and stained, the toilet seat old and chipping and the walls were mostly bare. There was also a weird old smell in the hallway when we first arrived. Considering this is a AAA 3-diamond hotel, we were shocked at how the rooms were kept. Later that night, I checked my back account. They charged me the full amount including $40 to park immediately without

Summary Heading: It works for the price per night
Summary: We arrived late the 3rd of August and Christiana was very nice and helpful.  I have stayed at other Sheraton Hotels before.  The room that we were given was ok, not modern or updated just ok.  We had to go around the resort three times to locate where the F building was located,  the only problem at night is parking.  If you don't mind walking then you will be fine,  We were situated in 2142 and the elevators are so small.    The shuttle bus to Disneyland was pretty good,  the driver Alfredo was very friendly and made us feel at home,  but the PM driver was like can you show me your hotel keys,  I am like really.. and then again when we came back from the park.  I just wished they have more variety in restaurants, store (cashiers are so slow) ,  room service was excellent and

Summary Heading: Sheraton Anaheim continues to please us
Summary: We have been making the long trip from Northern Ireland to California for a number of years now and we have always made the Sheraton our base for visiting Anaheim. The staff are excellent and I have to make special mention of Elizabeth, Karan and Zeke. They went out of their way to ensure we had a great stay at the Sheraton and made us feel really welcome and comfortable. This location really suits us and we have a good idea of where to find restaurants in the area where we can go and eat in the evenings. Obviously a car is necessary if you want to eat outside the disneyland area. There are places to eat within 3 miles of the hotel such as the Red Lobster, the Outback, Cheesecake factory and Ruby's Diner. I enjoyed the cooked breakfast in the Sheraton and I have to repeat that

When I checked in, depsiite being a Starwood Preferred Guest, I was given the first guest room off the lobby next to the elevator.  Noisy to say the least.  When I asked for a room change I was told that was the only "single" available.  Funny, because it had two Queen beds.  The pool area is filled with screaming kids (to be expected, it's near Disney) but don't expect any peace or quiet. The restaurant is good for breakfast, good buffet, good service.  They'll even only charge you for the buffet but cook your requests to order.  For dinner, there's not much choice.

Summary Heading: Older Sheraton hotel - close to Disneyland
Summary: My husband and I attended a wedding in the area and booked this hotel using points. The hotel looked like an old castle from the outside, but the inside had been renovated. Our first impression was that the hotel felt very dark, not enough lighting seemed to be coming through. The room was pretty large but the bathroom area was surprisingly small.   It looked like they had shuttles going to Disneyland every so often, which we did not take advantage of. It was actually pretty close to Disneyland, probably within walking distance. It was a good enough hotel for free, but we probably would not book another stay here.

Summary Heading: Great place if you are going to Disneyland for a vacation.
Summary: Very clean and great customer service!!! We will stay here again.

We stayed here for 7 nights.  We had to check out of a different hotel because the rooms were too small.  We have always loved this place.  Our room was huge & very comfortable.  We have stayed in their bi-level suite in the past, & was absolutely beautiful.  We were on the 3rd floor, & had no complaints.  The pool is great.  We love the California Deli in the hotel.  The staff was very nice & helpful.  The only thing I really didn't care for was they now permit guests to bring their pets!!!  This is a fairly new thing w/ this hotel....they never use to permit this.  I saw people walking their dogs around the pool area, in the pretty flower gardens.  I wasn't pleased w/ this!  The maid service was okay, but they had left 2 dirty coffee glasses that we got from the bar in our

Summary Heading: Huge rooms, great pool, loved it!
Summary: We enjoyed staying here.  The rooms are very big, and we had plenty of space to live comfortably for 4 days.  The rooms have all been updated, but you would not know this from looking at the lobby.  The shuttle service to and from Disney was always on time and the staff were wonderful, but the busses were a little run-down.  We enjoyed the deli, but the restaurant was overpriced for what you received.  The pool was wonderful, and there is a laundry available.  I would recommend requesting a room away from the highway AND the pool if you can get one, just for a little more peace and quiet.  One of the best features of this hotel is that you can watch the fireworks from the pool.  They were fabulous, and I think we actually had a better view from the hotel than the park, and we

Summary Heading: Great hotel but super thin walls
Summary: Hotel is great, super safe, great for families, and the free shuttle to Disney helps a lot.  Very large room.  Bus runs every 30 mins and the last bus to depart Disney to the hotel is 1 hour and 30 minutes after the Disney Land closes.  Staff are very friendly.  Has a very nice pool.  Only complain is the super thin walls as you can hear everything from your next door neighbor.  This didn't really bother us to much as we were pretty much gone for the day.

The hotel was nice BUT the room was outdated and a bit musty. The beds were at least  comfortable and the room was large so that was a plus.  Also, a nice surprise in our pool view room was a view of the fireworks at night. The drinks at the bar and food at the restaurant were overpriced but good.  The shuttles were always running and it was nice not having to deal with parking at Disneyland. For the price I would stay here again.

My hubby & I stayed her for one night. We went to Disneyland & booked a night at the Sheraton. The hotel looks very nice & clean in the lobby. We took an elevator to our room, you can tell that it's an older hotel when you walk around but they did remodel the rooms. The room was clean & simple. The bed was comfortable & the bathroom was also clean & had been remodeled as well. Perfect hotel if all you need it for is to sleep. They also offer an hourly shuttle to Disneyland,  free with you room key.

We arrived to the hotel a few hours early before check-in.  The hotel staff offered to hold our luggage and give us key cards to use the shuttle bus to the Disney Park.  The service was wonderful.  Rooms and beds were very comfortable and clean.  My only complaint was that our room was in the C-Wing, which is quite far from the elevators.  Usually it wouldn't be a problem, but if you’re coming back from a long day of walking in the parks your feet are quite sore and you are very anxious to get to your room which seemed to take forever.  I even got lost. Haha.  Each morning we were greeted with "Good Morning" or "Hello" from any staff persons. And everyone just seemed very helpful.  There are guest use computers available in the lobby; you just need your room information.  There

Loved this hotel! the staff was very helpful, the room were a good size, clean and comfortable and the breakfast buffet included w/ our stay was fantastic! and very close to Disneyland w/ shuttles back and forth from the park quite often. if your going to the Disney this is a good place to stay.

Summary Heading: It was above average but I wouldn't call it superior
Summary: We booked the "superior" good neighbor hotel with a Disney vacation for our anniversary. It is located minutes away from Disneyland but walking is not recommended. The convenient hotel shuttle was a big plus and made it easy for us to get to and from Disneyland. The staff was friendly, helpful and were very accommodating. We stayed on the 1st floor and our room was a little rundown. There was a large stain on the floor (which my husband jokingly referred to as a murder stain) that greeted us when we walked in. There was not adequate electrical outlets in our room for us to charge our cell phones. I plugged my charger into a power strip and the lamp and refrigerator shorted out. It has a unique comfort and served its purpose. I would recommend ordering breakfast to be delivered

Summary Heading: Great location for Disney and large rooms
Summary: Can't beat the every  30 min shuttle service to Disneyland . It takes you almost to the front of the ticket entrance. What was SUPER great was having a rep from Disney there to tell you every thing and sell you your tickets. The rooms were very large and the hotel is spread out very large as a single 2 story . Nice little gardens are spaced around. The lobby and whole restaurant  area is new and attractive . The hallways totally need to be recarpeted . The food is not spectacular , but okay and it filled us all up. For the proximity to Disney and the ticket lady there it was great.   Don't get a room next to the elevator. We had to change rooms because it was TOO loud.

Summary Heading: We Loved the Location and the Hotel
Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel and were very impressed by it. The rooms are large and clean, no noise from outside. Pool is lovely, with plenty of sun loungers and chairs. Onsite laundry facilities are great if you are travelling for a period of time ( bring your own washing powder though as the powder in the gift shop is expensive). The hotel is a great location for getting to Disneyland and with the free shuttle bus that goes every half hour and runs for up to an hour and a half after Disneyland closes its brilliant. Breakfast buffet is lovely with a fair selection on offer, approx 60 dollars for 4 breakfasts there. worth it before going to Disneyland. Staff were all friendly and helpful, we enjoyed the hotel and location so much we ended up staying a 2nd night. Only bad

We stayed 3 nights in June at the Sheraton Anaheim hotel and in general we were very happy with our stay. The service was great, the hotel is well kept with a spectacular lobby and beautiful gardens.  Our room was at the back of the property so it was a pretty decent walk to get to the front. The hallways look a little bit old and some renovation would make them look as good as the lobby. The rooms are huge with very comfortable beds. When we arrived, the bathrooms were not pristine so we need to call the maid to have her clean it again.  The complimentary transportation to Disneyland is such a great value departing exactly every 30 minutes.

Summary Heading: Great Location and Value for money
Summary: The family and I stayed here for oiur visit to Disneyland etc. and had no problems at all. Just a quick walk down the street, maybe 15 mins, but there is always the shuttle bus for those tired feet after a big day at Disney or California adventure.  Good interconnecting rooms, laundry facilities, pool.. everything you need.  The concierge was extremely helpful with a hire car, tours, and airport transfers. Straight on the phone, all sorted.  Thoroughly recommend.

We visited the Sheraton Anaheim for a 3 night stay just after the July 4th weekend - this was our second stay at this hotel (the last time was 4 years ago, we live in Scotland!). I can't stress enough how excellent the staff are at this property. We'd had a long drive from Tahoe & checked into the hotel at 8pm, the lovely & adorable desk clerk upgraded us to a HUGE & spotless room, absolutely perfect. Our package included parking, breakfast & in-room wi-fi. I must say that is the best breakfast buffet I've ever seen - so much choice, & all fresh! The serving staff were lovely. Free shuttle bus service great, always on time. Pool perfect, laundry facilities handy, the little store/deli was open til midnight which was great for me to buy milk to put in my tea after a long day at

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but wouldn't stay again.
Summary: This hotel is wonderful if you're just looking for a clean place to stay a night or two. But if you're looking for a hotel for your Anaheim vacation, you probably have better options. The place is clean, with an average staff and a good breakfast. The rooms aren't spacious by any means but, like I said, they'll do for a night or two. The pool area is nice to relax as well. Overall, it's a nice place, but the hotel is just pretty "average." It's fine if you're just stopping into Anaheim for a night, but if you're taking a whole vacation, you have better options. It's pretty far from Disneyland and the convention center as well.

OK, gonna bore you with my family history. My mom and I stayed here in the early/mid 70's and so this hotel is near and dear to my heart.   So I was excited to return after 30+ years-- two years ago. We loved this hotel. Cute little gardens, comfortable rooms and fantastic bus service. On our second stay, the breakfast buffet was included....which is a heck of a deal.   I was quite shocked on our third visit when we entered into a room that hadn't been renovated in maybe 20 years? Blond furniture, pale gold sculpted carpet...really really dated. Although the room was sorta clean, there were 20 year old stains (and smells). I guess that explains no why the reviews have been all over the place. The dated rooms are really depressing.  Thankfully, a quick call to the front desk

We recently stayed here for a week in July for a family trip to Disneyland.  It does need some updating, especially the carpets but the rooms were huge and the beds were great.  The grounds are quite spacious, pool was great and the room service prices are the same as the restaurant with no delivery charge.  It is further out from Disney so walking to restaurants and shops is not an option, but the shuttle runs every 30 minutes all day and night.  Being away from the main strip wasn't always a bad thing as it is quite peaceful and you can see the fireworks from the driveway of the hotel.  Staff were friendly and when we did eat here the food was good.  If you don't mind the shuttle ride to the park, it's a great place to stay.

the hotel was spotless, staff very helpful,food great nothing negative to say.the beds were so comfortable you didnt want to get up(if you can call that a negative on holiday)    would recommend this hotel for couples ,families or business.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a Disney adventure
Summary: Let's face it, when you are vacationing at Disneyland Resort, you are not spending much time at the hotel.  DLand resort hotels are very pricey and this hotel is much more reasonable for a family on a budget.  The hotel looks like a castle which is a huge draw for my 5 year old "princess" and the rooms are clean, beds are comfy.  Staff is okay...not warm and fuzzy like Disney employees, but the employees here will do what needs to be done.  I found the best customer service was in the restaurant in the early mornings.  The breakfast servers are very friendly. In addition to your hotel rate, keep in mind that it is an additional $10 per car per day to park.  However, you do get in and  out privileges.   They have a free shuttle that goes to and from the resort every 30

While this hotel delivered as advertised it seemed to be overpriced and did not live up to Sheraton standards.  Ridiculous wifi policy: each device must pay for it's own wifi, whereas every other hotel at which I have stayed gives a blanket code that can be used over multiple devices. Sheraton...it's 2011! Families have more than one wifi device nowadays....

stayed here for 6 nights, lovely clean hotel in a great location to disney! on arrival check in was quick and easy, there is a $10 per day car park fee but as we had booked a package holiday with virgin this was all accouted for which was great!. we had a room that you could see the disney fireworks from. room was spacious with 2 large double beds, bathroom is quite small though, but clean and fine for what your in the room for. we also got a voucher to get money off food in the restaurent which unfortunatly we never got round to using. the free disney shuttle is definitly a major plus with this hotel as it runs every half a hour to and from the parks, we used this daily. the hotel is in walking distance to the park but i wouldnt say its a nice walk as its along the main roads.

We've stayed at a lot of hotels in the Disneyland area and this one is great value for the price.  We really appreciated the free shuttle to Disneyland, the free parking and - with our room package - free breakfast.  The shuttle runs every half hour and during peak times they send two so you don't have to wait too long.  It's very convenient and the drivers are very helpful and accommodating.  The breakfast buffet is quite good and if you eat well at breakfast, you can eat less at Disneyland, where the food is pretty high priced for what you get.  The rooms are clean, comfortable and very spacious.  There are plenty of computers in the lobby if you need the internet.  We would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: The friendliest hotel we've ever stayed in!
Summary: Great hotel for Disney, the free shuttle is regular and on time and if it gets full they get another bus out - plus it is only 5mins drive away. Hotel was large with nice public areas (our daughter loved the big fish tanks in reception and the fish in the pond outside). Our room was a really good size, with super comfy beds and was really clean, if a little gloomy although we didn't spend much time in it! Pool area was good and always popular. We had breakfast and an evening meal in the restaurant and both were faultless.   However, the real stand out for this hotel is the staff - they were all superb. They made us feel really welcome and we all really friendly and helpful. Everyone had a kind word for out little daughter - even the manager when she toddled off into his office!

We loved the over sized room; perfect for our family of 5.  We had plenty of room for the playpen and could roll the double stroller in to the room at the end of the night, ready to go for the next morning.  Shuttle bus was super convenient and all of the drivers were very friendly.  Nice little store on property, with all the essentials.  This is our new favorite Disneyland hotel.

Stayed in this hotel part of our Virgin Holiday! Just the best hotel for location for everything, its an hours drive from downtown LA and Hollywood, perfect if your doing trips in those areas like the walk of fame and studios like Warner Brothers and Universal Studios. The hotels real asset is that its pratacily touching Disneyland which is perfect for getting to Disney early in the morning before the rush, there is a shuttle bus that will take you for free every 30 mins into the heart of both parks. The rooms were massive with great big beds, with a nice little dressing area with waldrobs and mirrors and a clean and modern bathroom. The hotel had a resturant, the food was ok, with Downtown Disney being a 5 min bus ride you can always eat in great resturants there. The hotel is

Summary Heading: Good Option when Traveling with Pets
Summary: We were on a long camping road trip with our two kids and dog.  We decided to get a hotel for two nights in Anaheim so that we could visit Disneyland for a day.  Having a dog with us seriously limited our lodging options.  After looking at the various pet-friendly options (Embassy Suites North, Hilton, Sheraton Park, Red Lion, etc.), we settled on the Sheraton Anaheim for the following reasons: free Disneyland Shuttle, cute castle exterior, location to the park, lower pet fee of $25, and overall price.  The Hilton was not an option due to rules preventing owners from leaving pets alone in the room.  (Note: our dog is quiet, extremely well housebroken and would never do anything to destroy a room).  Also, we snagged a rate on Expedia that included free daily parking, normally

The Sheraton, Anaheim on first appearances from outside looks a little dated and perhaps tacky but we were very pleasantly surprised on entering. This is entirely down to the staff and from the moment we checked in until the moment we left every one of them was outstanding in their service provision and friendliness. The hotel itself once you’re in is fine. The rooms are large and clean with coffee making facilities and wi-fi, the restaurant serves decent food at reasonable prices. The 2 staff who went above and beyond for us were Cynthia the bar manager and Paul the barman. Cynthia is a lifelong friend from the moment you meet her and her standard of service is second to none. We would return here and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The nightly fireworks display viewed from the

We had a great stay at this hotel.  You do pay for parking, but there is a shuttle to Disneyland so you do not have to pay to park at Disneyland.  The rooms are really big and comfortable.  The halls are outdated, but the rooms and lobby are updated.  There is a sandwich shop where you can pick up sandwiches, chips, etc. when you come back to the hotel exhausted from the park.  My kids loved the pool.  This is kind of an old school charming hotel but clean and updated where it matters.  Also, several computers for use in the lobby without charge to print boarding passes etc.

Summary Heading: Very Average.  Try the Park Sheraton
Summary: The exterior and lobby are the best things about the hotel.  I was excited to stay at the hotel as I remember it fondly from staying there in my childhood...30+ years ago.  The rooms are very large, but tired.  Our room came with the faint hint of chemicals covering vomit....free of charge.  The hotel runs a shuttle every 30 minutes to DIsney which is nice, but puts you at the mercy of the shuttle.  We had the privilege of waiting and additional 30 minutes one night because they underestimated the number of people and needed to make multiple trips.   The pool also ran out of towels and it only took 3 calls and 30 minutes to get more.  Needless to say, we left  and checked into the Sheraton Park hotel which is the superior Starwood property in quality, pool and rooms and the

Summary Heading: Great rates, close to Disnelyand, rooms need to be modernized
Summary: The Sheraton Anaheim hotel is in very close proximity to the Disneyland parks (20 minute walk or free shuttle ride). The hotel has a nice bar area and a restaurant with great food. The bar area is off limits to children, which is a plus after listening to crying children all day in the theme parks! Free high speed internet in lobby only; in-room fees apply.   The hotel boasts great room rates (good AAA discounts) and large rooms, which is true. My main criticism is that the rooms (which are clean) are in great need of being updated. The carpeting is worn, and the furnishings are tired, including a 27" tube TV. Also, the walls are paper-thin, allowing you to hear loud guests and dogs barking.  The hotel is definitely worth the money if you don't mind the older furnishings and
Cool layout of hotel! Super friendly staff! Great room!

Summary Heading: A good choice for Disney; but pray you don't get the neighbours from hell!
Summary: We had a generally positive experience here.  The staff were friendly and helpful, it was far enough away from Disney that you could retreat to the pool and hot tub in the afternoon, which never became overcrowded and was quiet.  They offered a complimentary shuttle bus which leaves for the parks every half an hour, taking about 5 minutes.  Our King Suite was large and well positioned and housekeeping did a very good job. The taps on the sink and shower were hanging off the wall which meant we had to be a bit careful of them, but they worked, there weren't many available sockets in the room and the bathroom was quite small.  Breakfast was delicious, although a little pricey. Our final 2 nights however became a living hell when new neighbours moved in.  We were alerted to their

The first thing that grabs you is that they have themed the outside of the hotel to be very medieval looking. Great if you have kids!  The hotel is very spacious but it's easy to get lost roaming the corridors though!  The room was very spacious and nicely appointed with a good size TV, tea and coffee making facilities, complimentary bottled water, fridge and a good sized bathroom. We had a lovely view of the well kept inner courtyard with a Koi Pond and gazebo. Very restful. The sound proofing was very good as we didn't hear any of our neighbours at all.  The food was a surprise. I had expected it to be typical run-of-the-mill hotel fare, but instead it was really very good indeed. The New York Strip Steak was excellent and the breakfast options were many and very good quality.

While you may get an advertised low rate or some deal the fact is they charge for everything that most of the less costly hotels provide for free. Parking cost $10 a day, meaning if you actually want to stay here you have to pay. Wireless is 10 per device per day so if have two laptops it costs an additional $20 per day. Realistically you can expect to add an additional 20$ per day to the cost of your room which prices this hotel above many other hotels in the area. Besides the bait and switch pricing practices provided here the layout of this hotel is not friendly to those travelers who don't want to haul bags for long distances. The architecture provided little twists such as half high stairs and an extremely spread out design which cause you to haul bag up and down stairs and

We stayed here for 4 nights and loved it. We flew here from L.A. and it seemed so quiet and peaceful in comparison!  The lobby and pool and grounds are lovely and if you're planning to do DIsney stuff then this would be absolutely perfect. They have a shuttle bus that goes there too.  We wanted to see in L.A in general so it did us up to an hour some days to get there and back but we personally quite enjoyed coming back to the peace and tranquility.  The room itself was great, large, clean and very comfortable.  Would recommend without hesitation.

Summary Heading: Nice place and very close to Disneyland
Summary: Very nice hotel, 1st time for me to stay in 1st floor but was perfect as we traveled with a dog so we could open the door and let it go outside! Room was quite big so had enough space for a baby-crib as well without feel crowded. Not that we had a chance to watch TV but anyway it's time to change for LCD, old fashioned TV just not fit there.
Very nice and has a nice gym and heated pools. Very beautiful land. Surprisingly quiet since it's next to the freeway.

This is my second stay at this Sheraton property, the first was last June. I bypassed lots of lower priced hotels, because I remembered what a wonderful experience we had on our first visit.  The rooms are EXTREMELY clean, and the beds are really COMFORTABLE.  We arrived at 2:45pm, and needed to be in the park at 4pm to see my son perform with his middle school.  The employee at the desk was extremely rude, as she asked if she could help us and then said "Just a minute", and turned around and walked through a door slamming it behind her. As we waited two other employees were checking people in and just ignored us. She returned and when I gave her our reservation information, she explained check- in was 4pm and we needed to wait until then. We explained our need to be in the park

The room was a great size with 2 larger than average beds. The decor is a little dated but well maintained and clean. The location is great and the hotel runs a very efficient and free shuttle to Disneyland. The room had good facilities and we were very satisfied.

Summary Heading: Great place away from the Disneyland hub
Summary: We stayed 4 nights in a Family Connector which is basically 2 adjoining rooms.  The size of the rooms was fantastic, but like others, we couldn't believe the size of the bathrooms.  Get rid of the door and replace with a sliding door!! Positives were: - close to Disneyland without being in the masses - heated pool for the kids - the Guest Services team were very helpful - parking not expensive - size of the rooms very good - enough supplies in the Deli to avoid having to go to the supermarket Negatives were: - kids running up and down the hallway at all hours - fireworks every night literally feel like an explosion going off in the hotel - sirens during the night if on freeway side.  We tried to call front desk the first morning to get moved, but no-one answered our call on 2

Summary Heading: Perfect for a family going to Disneyland
Summary: This hotel turned out to be just fine for our recent two day trip to Disneyland.  Our room was not luxurious, but it was clean, had a small fridge and a very comfortable bed.  My only complaint is the size of the bathroom.  The tub is so close to the toilet, I barely had space to sit on the edge of the tub to bathe my son.; not a big deal just a minor inconvenience.  Also, the fireworks from Disneyland are very loud around 10PM.  The shuttle service was great. It was free with your stay at the hotel and came right on time, which was abut every 15 minutes.  I don't think we ever waited longer than 20 minutes.  The hotel also has a small mini mart, arcade and aquarium in the lobby area, great for the kids.  There is also a ticketbooth, so that you can buy your tickets before you

Great location, wonderful staff, quiet facility, peaceful grounds, great pool, good food and a wonderfully on-schedule bus service to/from Disneyland. Only downside is no walkable restaurants nearby but the hotel restaurant was great and fairly priced.  Plenty of dining in Disneyland Resort and nearby (via taxi) locations. Yes the facility is older but has been well maintained and has large rooms.  We had first floor with door to interior courtyard with gazebo ten feet away.  Pool was about 125 paces away in another courtyard area.    Definitely would stay again and again!

Summary Heading: Ok place to lay your head
Summary: This is our third stay at this particular property.  Keep in mind that this hotel is rather old.  They have attempted to "update" the property but, adding granite, wallpaper and new bedding is hardly what I call an update. It still has popcorn ceilings old TV's!! It offters a free shuttle to and from the Disney parks which is probably the best amenity they offer.  The rooms have a sort of musty odor to them, could be from the damp air??  Room service food was decent.  The food wasn't bad and the service was prompt however, it was really overpriced which is to be expected.  If your looking for convenience and don't care about all of the amenities some of luxury hotels offer, then this is a good place to lay your head at night.  Especially after a day at the Disney parks.

My business partner & I, years ago, noticed that there are some hotels that, well, smell. We now call them "What is that smell hotes", and the Sheraton Anaheim, sadly, is one of them. I can't identify the smell, exactly, but it's a little like musty body odor. The smell permeates the lobby & the hallways. Thankfully, the room itself did not smell.  This hotel is badly in need of a remodel in all of the public areas of the hotel. I made the mistake of eating breakfast at the lobby restaurant -- it was a breakfast buffet, and the food was simply inedible. I tried almost everything that looked like it might be edible, but finally had to settle for some Frosted Flakes. That inedible breakfast set me back (well, set my client back) $15.00.   I was in an upgraded room/suite, and the

Great hotel in a fantastic location. The rooms were really big although the bathroom was tiny in comparison. Breakfast was great, and we also had a snack in the bar which was good. The free transportation to Disney was great. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

one night stay this was the first hotel we saw and stayed it was getting late had limited time and wanted to get started with disneyland, the room was good, the hotel needs some money spent on it in my opinionon check out I told reception the bedside lamp was faulty there was no thank you for letting her know, or no care shown. I know better if I was to visit this area again.

Large Rooms, Our room had a front and back door-leading into the Rose Garden which was great for the kids to play outside. Kids loved the Games room, We loved the Deli/shop, The shuttle to and From Disneyland was Perfect. Great Location, with everything you need in this Hotel. Keep in mind that the fireworks go off at Disneyland every night at 9.30pm, so when you get woken with lound bangs....it is not gunfire :-)

International visitor and so wanted a hotel that was easy to get to and from Disneyland and one tripadvisor review had said this hotel had a free shuttle service and big rooms, and it definitely had that.  What were pleasant surprises was that it had a pool with a colocated spa pool which my child loved.  It had coin operated/guest laundry machines which I needed to use as we were there for 5 days.  It had four PC's in reception & printeres with free internet for us guests to use which is very handy when your are wanting to book and confirm stuff online or keep in touch with family.  The beds were fantastic and having a big room with LARGE closet meant plenty of space and nil clutter for us to co-habitate in... great when sharing room with children.  It encourages room service

We stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim because we've had great stays at other Sheratons.  This Sheraton was sorely lacking modern updates, however.  Very dated interior, especially in the rooms. Common areas were nice but some wear was noticable, i.e. the tables in the dining room being very scuffed and old looking.  Rooms were comfortable enough but I was disappointed that they did not have the Sheraton Sweet Sleeper beds, just average and obviously older spring beds.  Overall, this Sheraton was a decent enough place to stay and the service was good, but I would prefer something that was a little bit more up to date.

We stayed at this hotel after finding a good deal on the internet, with the sole purpose of using it as a base for Disneyland.  The name Sheraton in Australia and Asia is usually associated with luxury accommodation.  Obviously this does not apply in Southern California.  The Sheraton Anaheim Hotel is nothing more than a cheap roadside motel!!  The rooms are horribly outdated with kitsch decor.  The place is just plain depressing.  However, the staff were friendly and helpful.  We had some time to kill on the first day, so took a $20 taxi ride to Westfield Santa Ana mall and basically did all of our shopping there in 3-hours.  There is also an upmarket mall in Cost Mesa ($30 taxi ride) in case you need a Tiffany's or Gucci store.  The hotel is a 1-mile walk from Disneyland or

We had booked a room at the Sheraton for two nights during our trip to Disneyland. My husband was told it was "across the street" from Disneyland, so we were surprised to see it's several blocks away and over the freeway. It was lovely both inside and out. We were delighted to get a free upgrade to the turret suite once we arrived, just out of the blue! It didn't seem like there were many guests staying while we were there, and I just figured it was because it was on a Thursday and Friday. Our gorgeous suite overlooked the pretty pool area. Most of the families had young kids and everything was nice and clean. The pool did get a bit loud one night with some young adults, but nothing major. We enjoyed seeing the fireworks from Disneyland from our room.  We ate at the restaurant

This place is amazing! Me and my husband were taking a trip to Disneyland for our one year anniversary and we wanted a place that was special. We really found it. This hotel reflects the magic of Disneyland! The outside is a castle, there is a rose garden, a koi pond, a little gazebo for weddings, a cute area with a pond and a little bridge. There is also a pool, hot tub, a nice hotel restaurant (albeit expensive), a cheaper deli, an arcade, a gift shop, and a lounge to use their wifi and computers. This is the perfect place to stay if you are going to Disneyland not only because your little princes and princesses will love the environment but because it is right across the street, and there is a complimentary shuttle (that sheraton owns.. so you don't drive all around Anaheim

We took our son to Disneyland for his 1st birthday and stayed at the Anaheim Sheraton.  The rooms were large and the beds were comfortable.  Even the roll-away bed we requested was very comfortable.  We were connected to the room next door where more family was staying.  This made it much more fun for our son who loved all the room he had to run around.  The staff was very courteous and the complimentary transportation to Disneyland was fast and easy.  The room service was a little pricey, but what do you expect at Disneyland...?  Also, if you have a U-verse account with AT&T you do not have to pay for the high-speed wireless internet.  Just enter your user name and password and multiple computers can share.  Would definitely consider staying here again.

We were visiting Disneyland and booked this hotel with Starwood points which had been awarded me due to a previous not so pleasant stay at another Starwood hotel.  I will say that the hotel itself has a very nice lobby and the front desk workers were neither rude nor terribly welcoming.  I did speak to the manager for a few minutes about an issue with a charge for the roll away we had in our room and  he was very nice.  The room itself was quite clean and large.  The negatives were that there were only two outlets accessible to us for plugging in our phone and camera chargers etc and the bathroom vanity is all in the bathroom which is tiny tiny...not room for two and so if you wanted to blow dry your hair outside the bathroom you would have to use one of the two outlets...the

The room smelled like bleach inside and out.   There is very little nearby for dining or other services.  There is no club lounge for SPG Platinum members (and no complimentary breakfast in lieu of).  I had an internet charge added to my bill even though I have Platinum status and the internet service was too slow to be usable (I switched to my mobile card).  There was a hair in the soap dish.

Summary Heading: Good location, superb beds, free shuttle to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is older, including a somewhat outdated lobby.  The rooms are very spacious and the beds are incredibly comfortable.  There is a coffeemaker in the room, which is nice in the mornings.  The staff at the front desk was not very welcoming.  There is a free shuttle from the hotel to Disneyland which is very convenient.  I would definitely stay here again, given the proximity to the parks and the comfort of the rooms.

We stayed at this hotel as part of a fly drive Virgin holiday, so I can't comment on the cost of the hotel, but we had a great time here. The room was big and clean and the bed comfortable. We had breakfast in the deli every morning. We ate in the hotel restaurant on our first night and the food was pleasant enough, but a little pricey. The coffee machine wasn't working in the deli one morning, so we had to buy coffee in the restaurant, which was much more expensive even though it was given to us in paper cups. The pool area was clean although it was a little cold for me to use in September as it was outside. The bus service to Disneyland was really convenient and reliable. The staff at reception were very helpful with queries as was the girl at the Disney ticket desk.

Summary Heading: Good stay, large rooms, small bathroom,  great shuttle
Summary: Very good shuttle to and from Disneyland.  Drivers were great.  Hotel is older, but kept up well enough.  Gardens and grounds are pretty.   Rooms are very large for a standard hotel room.  Bathroom is tiny, but not a huge deal since how much time do you spend in there anyways?  I can't resort hotel  that charge for internet.  9.99 a day is too much.  Overall, a nice place to stay, and I'd consider it again.

Summary Heading: Getting better but not SPG Platinum friendly
Summary: Large room made the roll away work out great for us.  The shuttle was fabulous, timely and friendly.  The lobby improvements have made the property more desirable than the last time we visited 3 years ago.  The hallways seemed damp and mildew-y.  We did 2 nights and visited the park 3 days so we saved money by not paying Disney for 3 days of parking!  The hotel only charged us for 2.  The staff was average but did not go out of there way.  Caution to SPG travelers - this is not a Platinum friendly hotel.  Don't even hope for an upgrade.  I have never known a Platinum to get one even when the computers in their lobby show upgrade rooms available.  We got a noisy freeway side view but we were so tired it did not much matter!.  Oh -get to the shuttle early on busy days as there is

Summary Heading: Family hotel with many good points
Summary: We stayed at this hotel in December 2010, overall our experience was positive, the amenities were great.  There was a great open fireplace area in the lobby where we spent some quality time with other Aussies, who were in abundance.  The restaurant was adequate but didn't live up to the great rap given to us by the staff.  The rooms were large and clean, the roll away bed was excellent after sleeping on broken pull out couches in other hotels.  The best part of this hotel was the free shuttle bus to Disneyland.  The worst was the smelly hallways - with the constant smell of damp carpet steam cleaning - although the hallways didn't look like they were recently cleaned.  We also were told off by staff for our teenage son using the computers in the downstairs foyer area even though

Summary Heading: Not bad if you know what you're getting into ...
Summary: Given its proximity to Disneyland, it's full of kids, which has got to be wearing on any hotel staff.   Just checked out after a short two-night stay. The restaurant and its staff was the highlight - warm, friendly and efficient. Our room, in the new building, was clean and comfortable. The Sheraton Sleeper beds are fabulous. The hallways, in contrast, smelled strongly of mildew and the carpets seemed very worn. The lobby got a recent facelift and is attractive enough, but they need to keep going!

Summary Heading: The worse hotel in the world!
Summary: The GM is incredibly rude! I spend 1/3 of the year in hotels mostly at the Hilton, Marriott's or the Sheraton. The service at this hotel is by far the worse I have ever experienced.  Just like the last reviewers, the staff is rude.  The GM is the most unprofessional and belligerent individual I have ever come across.  DO NOT STAY at this hotel!

My family and I stayed at the hotel in August and were very dissappointed.  The property was beautiful however the staff were rude, the room was not properly cleaned when we arrived.and the fridge did not work.  The coffee shop in the lobby had bags flying around the croissants.  Gross!  I got bitten very severely by some kind of bug in the room.    Would never stay there again!

This hotel comes at the end of a fabulous 3 week tour of California & Las Vegas where we had stayed at Hilton and Starwood Hotels throughout. When we arrived with 4 pieces of luggage, a stroller and 2 young kids, there was noone at the door. We helped ourselves to a luggage cart, pushed it inside the lobby. Still we were ignored despite the fact that a porter was standing right inside the main door, chatting away to someone else. Then was the queue to check-in during which a surly receptionist told us there was no other rooms available and we were given a room that looked fit for a B-class movie out of the 70s, complete with greying ceilings, chipped furniture, low ceilings, sad sad corridors, old CRT small TV and small toilets fit for the airplanes. This is shocking given the

Summary Heading: don't stay here if you have an escalade
Summary: On top of one of the poorest Sheraton hotels I have stayed in,  there were 4 cadallic escalades broken in to in one night and one Tahoe.  Police say they are there all the time and there is no security to stop it.  At least my family was able to ride home but there was another family whos car was gone. When I got home I found out another family from my town had there Escalade stolen from the same resort last year.  This is alarming.  the front desk replys by saying don't leave anything in your car.  How can you take out your stereo system and back seats while you stay on vacation? Its not to hard to put in security cameras at the exits.  Best bet is to fly in and take taxis.

We stayed here as our first time in LA for 6 nights and thought it was great. There is a free shuttle bus to Disney which was not far away and runs regularly. To get to Hollywood though its about an hour away but worth the trip if your visiting Universal. The rooms was spacious and very clean. We used the pool once which was good and there was plenty of beds available. We had dinner here as we were given a promotional voucher when we booked in. The meal was brilliant and the waiter was very helpful! There is also free internet access. The deli/shop is also good value for money. Overall a really good hotel! Very happy with everything.

We have stayed at Sheraton Anaheim, 900 South Disneyland Drive, Anaheim three times now and each time we have enjoyed our stay.  The rooms are pleasant - on the large size but small bathrooms.  Overall it is a nice hotel with a shuttle bus that takes your to Disneyland.  There is free internet near reception for guests (four computers), a small cafe/shop and vending machines.    We checked in at 12.45 a.m. (two hours on the Super Shuttle - which I would NOT recommend using, try the Disneyland Express bus instead or Greylines Bus) and the check-in staff member was very pleasant and quick to get us to our room, much appreciated at that time of the morning.  I would recommend this hotel - there are three Sheraton Hotels in Anaheim so choose wisely.

I have no trouble recommending this hotel to families wanting to spend a few days at Disneyland. The rooms are spacious, the front desk staff in particular are very helpful, breakfast was included although while being a bit ordinary was necessary for starting an inevitably busy day at Disneyland. Still wondering why there is a charge for room Internet access when it's free in the front lobby.

Summary Heading: GREAT VALUE with the Birthday Package.  Huge Rooms. Some drawbacks-noisy, bad TVs.
Summary: We booked the Castle Connector Suite for three nights and choose The Birthday Package for our family of four.  Great value for the most part.  They have updated the rooms, but stopped short in some areas where they shouldn't have.   THE PROS Castle Connector Suite includes 2 very large rooms.  700+ sq. ft for one room, and 500 sq ft. for the other connecting room.  Awesome size rooms with nice furniture.  Free Parking  Comes with breakfast - not your average hotel breakfast.  First class.  Comfortable Beds with plenty of pillows  Lots of towels, good quality products (except toilet paper-gas station quality)  Free Shuttle to Disneyland with courteous drivers  Birthday cake and other treats delivered to room as part of birthday package  Polite and service oriented staff  THE CONS

I have just spent 10 nights at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel and found it to be most acceptable. I was most impressed with the service when we arrived very early on the morning of our first day there, after traveling for nearly 20 hours, I was looking forward to dumping my bags and grabbing a few hours sleep, I was quite expecting the reception to say that they could hold our bags, but check in would be later in the afternoon, however, to my surprise they let us check in right away even offering to move us to another room later in the day after cleaning if the room was not to our standard - this is fantastic service and we very much appreciated this. The hotel rooms are a little dated in terms of furniture, however, in saying this, when I looked at another room later in the day of

My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton as our first stop of our flydrive holiday exploring the West Coast.  The flydrive was a set itinerary by Virgin so we weren't able to choose the hotels individually.  The Sheraton Anaheim if perfectly fine.  Nothing majorly impressive nor particularly bad.  It's centrally located and very close to Disney and so if you are planning visiting the Disney Park whilst in LA /Anaheim, this hotel would be a good choice.  The buffet style breakfast was reasonable in terms of choice and cost - $13.95 pp.  Rooms are very spacious.  NB hotel is situated on one side, on a busy highway, so would recommend asking for a room facing the courtyard or at the back, which we were fortunate to be given.  There is a free shuttle bus which takes you to Disney,

Summary Heading: Everything I could ask for & GREAT shuttle service to Disneyland.
Summary: The room was clean, big and very comfortable. The beds were terrific. Great room service, friendly and helpful staff. Lots of parking. Quiet and great location, but don't plan on going to sleep before the Disney fireworks go off. The shuttles to Disneyland ran every half hour. PERFECT.

Summary Heading: Standard Sheraton but nickel and dime you.
Summary: A good Sheraton Hotel near Disneyland.  However, $14 a day to park and $10 a day for internet, so figure that in your cost.
Hotel was clean and the service was good. Very close to Disneyland with shuttle service which makes the trip relaxing.
good decent hotel friendly helpful staff hotel clean but decor a bit tired breakfast buffet $15; also average bus to disney excellent; free, runs every 30 minutes; 7-8 minute trip nice pool area

Summary Heading: RE:  Friendly staff, ok room, check shuttle for Halloween Party
Summary: My husband & I stayed overnight at the Sheraton Anaheim since we were going to the Mickey's Not So Scary Halloween Party this past Tuesday.  We chose this hotel because it offered a complimentary shuttle to the parks and was close in proximity.  When we checked in on Tuesday afternoon, we inquired as to how late the shuttles were running.  We found out that they weren't going to be picking up hotel guest that were attending the party at DL. (it is up to the hotel's general manager's discreation if the shuttles will pick up the Halloween party guests at the park) and that we could catch a cab back to the Sheraton from the Downtown Disney area or we could drive to the park.  My advice is to make sure you check with the front desk on shuttle schedules especially on Halloween party

This is a great place stay on your trip to Disneyland, or even to have another big event.  We had our wedding and reception here (900 S Disneyland Dr) on September 4, 2010, and I could not be happier with how well it went!  The service was second to none (I cannot overstate this)!!!!  The catering manager (Debbie Hodge) was an incredible help from before we decided to have our wedding here, until after the ceremony (THANK YOU DEBBIE)!  All of our guests (and us) gushed about how good the food service, and the food itself was!    The ceremony location was outside in a beautiful courtyard, which was surprisingly quiet.  You would forget there are other people staying in the hotel, AND it's a no-fly zone in the skies above the hotel because of its proximity to Disneyland, so there

I love this hotel, I forgot to write a review for it last year when I stayed for my birthday, it has been my favorite place to stay since I was a little girl. It's magical and charming just like disneyland. Highly recommend it to everyone

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel, Great Food/Room, Close to Disney
Summary: cant fault this hotel, we had free parking, really easy to find, free shutte to disney, rooms were very clean and of a good standard, the rest of the hotel was very good and the food was excellent

Summary Heading: Disappointing at first, but got better as each day went on
Summary: When we first got to the hotel, I was very disappointed with the hotels looks. We hoped when we got to the room it would look better than the lobby. The rooms were huge, but old furniture, small bathroom space, and plain old looks. We thought it didn't live up to sheraton standards. But look aren't everything, and as the days went on we used the  pool and the workout room and got used to the nice hotel. The hotel really is nice!  Pros:  nice staff, clean rooms, nice pool, nice workout room, quiet hotel Cons: old funiture, right on a highway, thin walls, But overall thi is a nice hotel, and I would definetly stay here again!

Hi Great Hotel (although not so sure about the mock Tudor effect!) Easy access to Disney, nice little pool to relax in after spending a long hot day at Disney. We didn't eat here, as we ate out in the park, but used the deli for breakfast and snacks, which was easy and cheap. Would stay here again

We have just come back from a trip to california. We stayed in this hotel for the first 5 days. Really liked the hotel, it suited us and what we needed. Very close to Disney and there is a free shuttle. We only went there once as we were more interested in exploring LA. Bit of a journey if we wanted to go anywhere and traffic is not good, we spent quite a long time in traffic jams. We eat breakfast in the hotel 3 times, very nice and we had dinner there on our first night, which was good as well. We found the staff to be really accommodated and nothing seemed too much trouble for them. We only used the pool once because we were just so busy. We had a car and parked in the car park, we didn't pay because we were with virgin holidays and it comes free with that, but there was a

Summary Heading: Stay here if you are going to Disneyland
Summary: If you are going to Disneyland, this hotel is right across the street from the parking garage entrance.  Older hotel but very well kept. Staff very friendly. Well stocked deli convenience shop. Walking to rooms can be a little far and confusing. Lobby is very nice. There is a free shuttle to Disneyland as well.

We booked this hotel as part of a West Coast vacation. This was our first time in California. The hotel is pretty easy to get to from LAX. On arrival we were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. It is set very close to Disneyland. The room we were allocated was good sized room. We were on the ground floor so we had 2 doors. One from the interior of the hotel and one from the courtyard at the back.  The pool at the hotel was good too. It was not too busy which was great. We tried the breakfast buffet in the hotel. It wasn't the best. The sausages and bacon were cold. They had a lot of stuff out and it didn't seem to keep warm. Not sure if that was worth the money.  There is a free shuttle bus to take you to the gates of the Disneyland Resort. There was free internet access near the

Have stayed at the Hyatt Orange County just a mile or two down the road, on 3 occasions. No problems there, but fancied a change and a hotel nearer the Disney Parks. Although the Hyatt is more modern and the rooms are brighter, this hotel has many good points. Primarily, its proximity, also a well needed fridge in the room and a very pleasant garden to sit out or walk in .Room was large and beds comfy(though Hyatt's were more comfy!).The shuttle was, as other tripadvisors have remarked, very efficient and most of the drivers were pleasant. It's only a short ride so the lack of air conditioning wasn't too problematic.  The reception area was a bit dark and had to wait quite a while when we first checked in,but the concierge where they sold Disney tickets was excellent. We got the

We stayed here as part of a Virgin 3 centre holiday.  It is a comfortable hotel  - its main attraction is that it is about half a mile from Disney with a regular free shuttle bus to take you there and back (we did walk but it's across a lot of roads so not very pleasant)  The rooms have 2 double beds,  a very small but adequate bathroom. fridge, tea and coffee making facilities and a tv.  Our room was very close to a noisy 12 lane freeway, and a room overlooking the courtyard would have been better.  The pool is pleasant and quiet (as most are at Disney) with free towels.  The buffet breakfast is good, the evening meals are ok, but nothing special.  On our first evening I had a cobb salad which would have served 4!  The deli does snacks (eg soup/chilli) as an alternative.

Summary Heading: About the best of a bad bunch in Anaheim
Summary: Stayed first week in July as a base for Disneyland and exploring LA. To set the scene I'm not a fan of Anaheim. I guess it's a bit like dropping Disneyland into a dodgy suburb of your nearest big city. The park is great but come outside and what are you faced with? Not a lot except concrete, freeways and factories with a few hotels and downmarket restaurants. Come back Orlando all is forgiven! The hotel itself is attractive from the outside and set around courtyards and a swimming pool. It's too near the freeway for my liking so I would go for a room around one of the courtyards or the swimming pool. View is better too. Upon booking through expedia I requested a pool view which not only was met upon arrival but we were offered an option on a courtyard room too. Good service. The

Summary Heading: I am from Minnesota "NICE"  This is Sharaton "NICE"!
Summary: Nice rooms with comfortable large beds, refridgerator, and a great view of either the Disney fireworks or there very nice pool area.    The food at both Restaurants was very good and reasonable.  The Deli was also great for on the go. The staff at all three choices were above and beyond friendly!  The staff at this hotel was more friendly than my own timeshare in Orlando.  My 20 year old son even noticed how friendly everyone was, from the maids to the front desk, to the restaurant staff.  If I had my own hotel, I would be stealing these people away from the Sharaton!  Great location for the Conference Center, Disney, shopping and eating.  This is also the CLEANEST hotel I have ever stayed at.  The gym and pool area, (which I have seen as disasters at many very nice hotels) were

Summary Heading: Sheraton Anaheim a castle of a hotel
Summary: I spent the night of 28 Jul 2010 I rode down with the family  from Ventura. They had decided to check out a couple of activities in Anaheim. The hotel is expensive but worth it.  I call it "Rejuvinated Classic".  and seems ideal for Business People but also for  leisure travelers. Use of the computers is complementary.  I utilized one to clear out junk emails. (Emails from TripAdvisor are Gems.) whilst have 1 beer. The room with the double beds are ROOMY even with an added  roll away bed.   Reefer in room ok.  Stainless steel ice bucket was sweet. The restaurant has tasty meals when one is too tired to venture over to the neighboring  economy restaurants.  Teriyaki Steak is very good.  My favorite part of the hotel is the KOI POND.  I give the Hotel a A-.   I would absolutely

As a child going to Disneyland we'd always pass the Sheraton and we thought it was a castle that only rich people could stay at. Thanks to a nice discount through AAA, we were able to stay there, even on a budget for $119 (plus tax and the outrageous $10 parking fee).  We were also able to bring our dog, for a $25 fee, which I thought was reasonable considering it was the Sheraton. The room was very large, at the end of the hall near an exit, perfect for taking the dog out for a stroll. The beds were very comfortable, including the twin size rollaway.  The room was quiet, even with the hum of the freeway next door.   The grounds are beautiful and the pool area very nice. The on site deli was a bit pricey, but considering there isn't anything close by, it was fine. We did walk to

Summary Heading: An out-dated Tutor Hotel that needs Renovating!
Summary: The location to Disneyland and area restaurants and shopping is not great.  The hotel does provide a reliable shuttle service with great staff (other than the caucasian driver who leaves earlier than scheduled time and shuts the door on people when the bus is full).  Mostly however, we had no complaints.  To add insult to injury, the hotel charges $10/night for parking - now that is unacceptable.  There is a business centre in the lobby (good luck getting on it as all the young people sit on the computer for hours).  There is free wifi in the lobby but not in the room.  The hotel is a Tutor style, with windows that do not open (generally).  We had a room (suite) in the turret.  The sitting area was very large with a bar, fridge (no micro), a couple of side windows we could open,

My college friends and I went to Disneyland for a Christmas vacation and had a blast!  We had a really large room that slept all four of us comfortably.  The location was great, as we were on a budget (being college kids).  Plus, they have free transportation to Disneyland which helped, even though it's within walking distance (which we did and it wasn't bad at all).  Great location, great price, and really nice rooms.  Although it's no Disneyland hotel, it definitely had everything we wanted!

More like a Ramada than a Sheraton.   Rooms- Upgraded space rooms are decent, halls ways have a very bad smell. Halls ways old and dingy like the castle exterior.  Free Shuttle to Disney- Good service but beware most have no AC on board! It was 98 degress everyday we were there, imagine getting on a bus with no AC. Just horrible! My daughter vomitted it was so hot.  Be ready to pay for parking. They nickle and dime you to death.  Staff- could care less. Will not do anything to go out of their way to help. Ask for the hotel GM and they will tell you he is not onsite. Where else would he be? They will not help you nor will they get you to someone who may.  Many other hotel choices in Anaheim. Don't choose this one.

This hotel is well placed for disney land with a free shuttle bus available. There is a desk in the hotel where you can book trips etc. Food was good and the service was fine, the only negitive point I can make is that the bathrooms are small. There seems a lot of space waisted out the room, which could have been used better. That is just a minor point, this dose not take away the fact that the hotel is excellent. If you are there for the 4th of July, (like we were) then get your wine/beer and watch the firework display from the carpark. It was fantastic, no crowds, no hustle and shoving. The traffic was at a stand still outside the Hotel, so you might as well  enjoy the display with out the disruption.

Summary Heading: Nice and comfortable hotel, close to Disney
Summary: We stayed in this hotel for three nights and this was our first stop of our two week holiday. Having slept in Sheraton hotels before, this one did not disappoint. This is a large hotel but also has a sufficiently large reception area with plenty of staff do deal with new arrivals. The room was large enough with great beds. Bathroom was slightly dated, but with sufficient space for all your stuff. Only downside was that the room at the very back of the hotel, near one of the large roads so it could get noisy with traffic. (however we were so tired from our flight from London that sleeping was no problem!) On our first night we were starving so it was great there is a nice restaurant in the hotel where service is quick and very friendly. The hotel also has a bar and breakfast is

Summary Heading: Can't walk to Disneyland, but still good
Summary: My husband and I stayed here last week during our recent trip to Disneyland. We chose this hotel because we were traveling with our small dog and we had limited options but I am really glad we stayed here! The hotel is not within walking distance to Disneyland, well you could walk but it would require walking over a freeway overpass to get there and it would be quite a hike. I have stayed at several other hotels closer to the D'Land entrance and this place was far superior as far as the room went! We had a lot of space and discovered that we even had a sofa sleeper!
