The hotel itself is really charming on the outside and pretty nice inside.   There is a great lobby bar and a nice fireplace to unwind by. Our room was quite large and actually had two entrances, one of which went

We decided to take the kids (8,13 & 15) to Disneyland and wanted to stay close to the park. We also needed ajoining rooms to ensure the safety of our oldest two. The Sheraton offered adjoining rooms so we booked with them. This hotel is one of the oldest and the decor shows that. However the rooms are large and perfect for families. The staff are so family friendly and made the children laugh and smile. The shuttle bus to and from Disneyland is a life saver! Free internet is such a bonus too - great way to keep in touch with friends and family back home. The foyer/lounge area is so relaxing and like a home away from home. The kids loved the pool and having a laundry on site was a blessing too. If you want luxury this isn't the place to stay, if you want a great family place to

Summary Heading: Pleasant experience, excellent shuttle service to Disneyland
Summary: The front desk was very accommodating, the shuttle service was superior!  We were “upgraded” to a large room in the “B” wing. The room was huge but very strange, with a tiny bath and no mirrors in the room. Since we had four women in our group we requested a different room (@1:30 in the morning!) The front desk did not really understand our concern until he actually saw the room (he said he had worked there three years but had never seen a room like this). We were shown other rooms and moved to a room in the C wing. The room was very comfortable with several mirrors and a larger bath.  The hotel is close to Disneyland and has a good breakfast buffet. The grounds are very attractive. The hotel is very clean but somewhat dated. The shuttle was great, we have stayed in other hotels

Summary Heading: Lovely grounds but rooms and staff need some improvement
Summary: I agree with the previous poster, this hotel does not look after Starwood Elite program members in any way. We have received similar treatment as SPG Gold members also. I am now Platinum, but wonder if treatment would be any different there. Front desk staff will often just ignore you when you stand in the SPG Elite line. Why have the line if you are NOT going to attend to it? We had similar issues with hot water at least once during our stay, but we were never offered anything to help with the issue. It was just bad luck and "oh well, too many people are having showers at the moment, you'll just have to wait"! Not what you want to hear on your Early Disneyland Park Entry day. Its a hotel, surely they can accommodate for guests to have a shower when they need to.  I requested a

Stay at many Starwood hotels, including Westins, Sheratons, etc. Have a "gold" membership in their rewards program. This is the worst Starwood I've ever stayed at.  Stayed two nights ... on BOTH mornings NO hot water in the room. First morning I request  that a manager contact me. Nobody does. No offer to move us to another room, no compensation, not even a "we're sorry..." nothing. Second morning of no hot water I request some kind of compensation, and the manager offers one free night. When we checkout, nobody at the front desk has a clue this has been offered, and treats us like we're trying to full a fast one. The assistant manager is standing right there.... but ignores the situation.  Sewage smell. On multiple occasions a sewer like smell permeated our room. This could

Summary Heading: Big Rooms, Great Customer Service - Nice place for families
Summary: Went for a business trip. Had a room with Single King Bed. Very comfortable. The rooms are huge. Had a refrigerator (didn't work quite well). Big Desk. Nice couch. A lot of free space.   The staff were great and helpful. There is an extra $10parking charge per day. (Very good for this area - you can come in and out as many times). The Cafe was great.. the staff was very friendly. Minute away from Disney which means its full of families with kids.

Summary Heading: Just the job for families exploring the theme parks of LA.
Summary: This is a big hotel but it didn't feel big in terms of service which felt personal and with attention to detail. It caters very well for families visiting themeparks, particularly Disneyland which is only a few minutes drive away. They put on shuttle busses to get there every half an hour throughout the day which is a real boon. The hotel is easy to find with a good, reasonably secure, car park. They gave us some discount vouchers for use in the restaurants which was appreciated. Food was very good in the restaurant with a varied menu and excellent service. The shop has most things you need and its nice to be able to pop down there for a coffee whenever it suits you. You can get a snack breakfast there as well if you want to but the hotel breakfast will cost no more and is very

We stayed here for 5 nights in April. The rooms are very spacious and kept clean. The bathroom is small and the TV was also kind of small, but not a big deal. But all in all we really liked this hotel. Very friendly employees and the shuttle service was GREAT! Beautiful lobby and grounds. The deli/store was very convenient. Will stay here again!!

My family just stayed here the night before and after our day at Disneyland.  It's a basic hotel.  The rooms are spacious and everything is fresh and new.  In some of the back hallways, things look a little worn, but still very clean.  Breakfast was not cheap and nothing to shout about but the service was great.  It is close to the highway, which is helpful for finding it and you do not hear it at all.  I would definitely recommend it for a family going to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Good Hotel for our Disneyland Trip
Summary: The hotel is located right off I5, but we could not hear the freeway in our room.  We were in the smaller detached building on the 2nd floor.  The hotel is clean and looks nice but if you look closely you can see somethings need updating.  Our room was clean and comfortable.  We made good use of the mini frig.  We were about a 3 minute walk to the lobby/resturant area.  The food is fairly expensive in the resturant but convenient and although nothing to rave about, it was satisfying.  The menu is fairly limited.  We had good service all four times we ate there.  They do need to replace the faux suede chairs,  all were stained/dirty.  We appreciated the 15% off card for the resturant/deli when we checked in. It saved us over $50.  The last night we ordered a pizza and it was

Great place to stay for Disneyland. The shuttles run every half hour. Free internet downstairs. We received great service on check - in and received a warm welcome.   The hotel itself was not quite what you would expect for a Sheraton. The hotel is ageing quite a bit. There aren't many choices for dinner nearby so a car would be a wise move.   All in all, great value and location for Disneyland visitors.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great location, very friendly and helpful staff.
Summary: I recently stayed in the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel with my partner and 1 year old daughter. The hotel was very easy to find which was great after a 14 hour flight and driving on American roads for the 1st time. Check in was quick, the staff were friendly. Our room was nice, big and spacious, we had a baby cot ready for our little girl. The shuttle service to and from disney was very handy. You can watch the fireworks from the hotel. Information was available in the lobby at the Disneyland help desk about trips to other destionations like Hollywood, Universal Studios etc. The breakfast buffet was very good. We had a very happy time at the Sheraton and would recommend the hotel.

Summary Heading: Too expensive for what you get.
Summary: My brother in law insisted that we stay at this hotel because it looked nicer then the Best Western Park Vue (which we had booked). We got a price of about $130 per night. The service was nice, but the hotel is getting old. There is a musty smell in the hallways. The fancy fish tanks at the front have parts held together with duct tape. There was a leak in the ceiling outside our rooms for a couple of days, we mentioned it a couple of times, after 3 days they fixed it. None of these things were a disaster, but for the price we were paying and for the way that they presented themselves I expected more.  The restaurant prices were crazy. Buffet breakfast was $14, and there was not anything special about it. My mom stayed at a hotel that was half the price and full breakfast was

Summary Heading: Great Starwood Hotel for Disneyland Stay
Summary: We got upgraded to a Starwood Guest room, which was fantastic for our young family. I was initially upset with the Hotel Management, as I had requested a room so I could watch the Fireworks. We stayed 5 nights, and the Fireworks were only on 1 night (weekend), so we had a better room....Hotel Management were right :-) The restaurant gave me a 10% discount voucher which was great. My wife was sick, and I asked the Restaurant manager if I could get "Take-away" so I could have in my room with my wife. It was a bit different my request, but with some convincing of the Hotel Manager, they allowed it, and I tell you what, I had travelled in the USA for 3 weeks, and it was my best meal - Great Steak, that I recommend. The Hotel had a frequent shuttle bus to Disneyland.....and the thing

Like everyone else we were trying to find a nice, clean hotel for our trip to Disneyland with our 3 young children. Was happy about the reviews i read & booked a 2 queen beds room. We were extremely dissapointed with the room though. We got room 2224 (2nd floor) & all night long we had to endure awful & extremely loud noises coming from either an elevator engine or trash compactors maybe?... We didn't know what it was & my husband went to ask for a different room but the staff would not help us. They just pretended they didn't know what the noises were or where they were coming from.. That was insulting since you could hear them even from the hotel hallway, they were so loud.. We had a baby with us & also 2 young children so that was just awful. We asked to check out early to

Stayed here for a week as part of out three week honeymoon,  We were exhausted when we checked in and te staff on the front desk were very accommodating and even upgraded us to a better room due to us being on our honeymoon :-) Hotel location fine - looking back we wished we stayed nearer to disney (walking distance) as we were that tired that we found it annoying when we missed the bus and had to wait for the next one, but that's just us. Hotel had a nice bar with friendly staff and a lovely restaurant serving a buffet breakfast which we ate on two occassions and once for a meal.  Fantastic!  Our room was huge!  Not ultra modern, but we were not particularly expecting that as we had seen the rooms online.  It had a huge bed with living area and desk and a nice size bathroom.

Summary Heading: Run the other way - as fast as you can.
Summary: This hotel is an embarrassment to the Sheraton brand name. Really, it was one of the worst hotel experiences I have had in a long time - and I travel a lot. The room smelled like mildew and had huge stains in the carpet. The bathroom was not clean and the shower was broken - water was tuck halfway between the shower head and the tub spout, so water pressure was bad in either. There was no maid service or turn down the night I stayed there. The halls were loud both day and night.   The "Health Club" was a joke - I mean really, when are hotels going to learn that people really want to work out in a place larger in size than a single hotel room. This one was stocked with a few cardio machines, a couple of weight sets - and 12 people trying to use them all at once.  When I tried to

Summary Heading: Friendly staff, comfortable & clean - wish we could have stayed longer.
Summary: We arrived at the Sheraton anaheim after a 14 hour flight, tired and hungry! The check in was quick and friendly and we requested a quiet room (to catch up on some sleep), which was easily accommodated. The hotel is very large and spread out so there is a good chance you may have to walk a bit to get to your room, but we found the beds very comfortable and clean and the room was a decent size. Bathroom was very clean. It isn't as close to Disneyland as other hotels  but the shuttle bus takes 5 minutes and leaves half hourly  (free, except for tip), and is a great idea -especially when coming back to the hotel with sore feet! The drivers were always friendly and even helped us with our shuttle back to the airport. The "deli", which is really  a convenience shop, is a great idea

We stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim for 1 week with our 2 young children.  The hotel offers great value for money and is a great base for visiting Disneyland.  Although not really walking distance with 2 young children, the bus service was regular, prompt and very friendly drivers.     The rooms were very spacious even with a cot in the room.  We were located on the ground floor and our room backed on to a lovely garden area with gazebo and grass.  This was a real bonus at the end of the day as the kid's played out here every evening.  We could even see the Disneyland fireworks from the grassed area.  The bathrooms are small and a bit tired but didn't bother us too much.  We used the pool which was great to have but a bit cold and no shallow end so not ideal for very young

Stayed here for 7 days and found it a great base for visiting the theme parks.  Initially our room was located right next to the service lift which kept us awake till the early hours and then started again a few hours later at breakfast time.  The following day we asked to be moved and were quickly and efficiently moved to another room, the staff being full of apologies, overlooking the gardens.  Although not as modern (our first room looked recently renovated) this room was large and clean.  The staff, on reception, the maids and in the restaurant were all extremely polite and helpful.  The courtesy bus to the theme parks is also a bonus.  Another good Sheraton hotel.

We found the staff at this hotel to be exceptionally friendly and responsive.  Our room was spacious and clean.  They provide frequent shuttle service to and from Disneyland.  We will definitely stay here again

We stayed here in late august 09 and had the best holiday ever, the hotel staff could not of been more helpful, helped us with park tickets, excursions, car hire, taxis and more. The staff were also very polite, we got good mornings and goodnights which made us feel very welcome. The swimming pool was a good size and very clean and open late which was nice to cool off in after a hot day in the parks!!! The rooms were very clean and tidied everyday with fresh towels and clean bed sheets. Hotel shuttle was great and also ran til late. Hotel is in good location very close to disney with a disney desk actually in the lobby - very helpful for sorting out all your tickets as soon as you arrive so as to decide what to do first! A fantastic hotel in prime location, wouldn't wish to have

Summary Heading: Will Not Stay Here Ever Again
Summary: We have stayed here twice, with one stay acceptable (not great, but acceptable) and the other terrible.  Noisy at times, poor customer service, rarely-stocked ice machines, slow shuttle service, and guest rooms with a tinge or more of cigarette smoke/odor.  There is also an unreasonable parking fee of $10 per day. NOTE:  If you should decide to stay here, DO NOT have them add the parking fee to your room tab.  More often than not, the gate is open so you can just leave without paying the fee.  Don't even use the parking pass payment machine unless you are trying to leave, the gates are down, and you have no choice.  Should be able to just follow a shuttle out.  Advice:  If going to Disney, select a hotel across the street from the park....instead of one that requires a shuttle.
Shuttle to DisneyLand every half hour. Parking cost $10 a day though if you rent a car.

Summary Heading: A fantastic start to our holiday
Summary: We stayed here for three nights at the beginning of a two week fly/drive trip and it was the perfect place to start.  After a long flight, a big queue at the car rental place and our first experience of driving in America we were really pleased to be checked in quickly and efficiently and were thrilled with the size of our huge room.  The hotel operates a free shuttle bus to and from Disney which makes for an easy day out, it's also within easy reach of Universal Studios if you have a car.  Breakfast and dinner were delicious and very generously proportioned!  Prices are on the higher side but worth it.  Free internet access in the lobby area is also a nice touch.  Definately a great start to our holiday.

Summary Heading: Disappointing guest rooms - won't stay here again!
Summary: I checked out all the photos on their website before making the decision to book a room at this hotel, let's say looks can be deceiving.  The hotel is definitely conveniently located and has great shuttle service to and from Disneyland.  They do however charge for parking which is a bummer, but the hotel looks very nice as you enter the lobby with nice high end furnishings on the main floor.  We checked in at the reservation desk with no problem and after seeing the nice looking lobby expected that our room would look similar.  Wrong!  We entered our room which smelled pretty much like a hospital, very stale smelling air (turning on the ac didn't help).  The room was quite large, but something about the spacing/layout seemed very odd.  The walls were bare (except for a small out

Summary Heading: DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU HAVE A DOG AND NEVER, EVER CHECK IN LATE AT NIGHT, NASTY, RUDE FRONT DESK CLERK AND MANAGER.
Summary: I am an spg platinum member.  All Starwood hotels are wonderful with pets,, staff is always accommodating, professional, very polite.  i will not bore you with my sob story about how rude the front desk clerk and front desk manager were to my mom and godson when they checked in at the Sheraton last night and to me later on, but just know this:  if you have a pet (this is not the case for any other starwood hotel in the world) and check in at this hotel, you can only stay at ground level and in the back of the hotel, next to the parking lot).  they will try to say it is for the convenience of the pet !!!!! don't believe it.  it is the very bad decision of a very neurotic "upper level" manager, who is also unaware of how rude and incompetent their night clerks are. I had stay in

A girlfriend and I stayed here just after the New Year when we decided that we wanted a two-day trip to Disneyland without paying Disney's exorbitant room rates.  (She works for the Walt Disney Company and I'm an annual passholder and we still couldn't find enough of a discount to justify the cost!)  Enter: Sheraton Anaheim, which I knew to be very close to the resort.  So close, in fact, that you can hop a shuttle and be in the parking plaza in about 8 minutes if you get good timing.  I really like the location, as it's on the north end of Disneyland, which is less busy and jam packed with hotels and restaurants than the east and south borders.  I found the theming to be delightful and the room was HUGE.  I also really liked that our particular room had entrances to both the

We just had a quick one night stay at the Sheraton.  The hotel was nicer than expected, and very convenient in terms of getting to and from Disneyland.  We literally drove up, checked in, and jumped on the shuttle to Disney.  The ride took all of five minutes.  It dropped us off very close to the entrance, so there isn't a lot of walking involved. It picked us up at 10:00pm, and we were back to our room in no time.  It was a little chaotic trying to wait for the shuttle though.  There are loads of buses and taxis picking up in the same area at the same time.  However, the shuttle pulled up on time, and we boarded easily.    The hotel is very nice, clean, and there is a nice breakfast buffet that is only $6.99 for children.  Definitely nice after spending hundreds of dollars on

Summary Heading: Conveniently near Disneyland, a little too near the freeway
Summary: There was a minor glitch to our online reservation. Although I confirmed a 3 night stay, their system only had a reservation for 1 night. Luckily, I had my email confirmation and the nice lady at the front desk was able to give me the same rate ($132) for the other nights. The price was affordable for the accommodations, as we stayed at peak vacation time in August.  This hotel is an old motel but they did a good job upgrading the lobby with modern tempo furniture (soft carpet, soft seats, very comfortable). They also decorated the rooms nicely with a leather headboard, a large flat panel tv, new desk and couch. The air conditioning is powerful and is a gem on hot summer days. They have a complimentary shuttle to/from Disneyland that runs every half hour.  The only con to this
Good sized clean room for a family of 4 (w/ 2 young kids). Staff is friendly. Parking is not free (bad). Nice breakfast and dinner. Excellent shuttle service to disneyland.

My family and I stayed at this hotel for the 2nd straight year.  Again we had a lovely time there and we really like the amenities here.    At check-in, I was asked if I wanted to become a Starwood member and I accepted.  We were given a free upgrade suite which REALLY accommodated my family.  The one bad thing about this one-room suite was the size of the bathroom.  It was tiny! Ok for one person but when you have a little ones that still need assistance in the restroom, it gets crowded--quick.  But the largeness of the room made up for the tiny bathroom...:)  Another cool thing about this room (one of eight rooms in this wing of the hotel), the Disney nightly fireworks show was literally right outside our window.  We didn't have to go outside at all to see the beautiful

Summary Heading: Bus service makes it worth it
Summary: This was our third trip to this hotel.  Rooms are pretty clean and large.  Bathrooms are tiny as previously stated, but that does not bother me.  Nice hotel grounds.  Bus service is the best!

We have stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim many times before. This was the first time we were disappointed. It took two room changes before we found a suitable room. The first one was just so shabby and the sound of barking dogs greeted us in the morning. The second room was acceptable but the shower leaked. The third room however was lovely.  The grounds and the pool were well looked after. Free internet was a bonus. The waiters,concierge and front desk staff  were wonderful., very helpful and attentive, nothing was too much trouble for them. The restaurant was very reasonable and we ate there on many occasions. Breakfast and dinner.   I felt the Sheraton has lost a bit of its sparkle, which is sad as it was always one of our favourites.

Summary Heading: good value for money hotel-close to disneyland but need the courtesy bus
Summary: Stayed for 7 night sept school holidays (vic aus).  Hotel is neat and tidy. Gardens and Pool outside areas immaculate. However surrounded by multilan highways so no use taking a walk! HOtel provides shuttel bus to disney main gate which provides access to disney land, california adventure and a great place to eat and shop- downtown disney.  Rooms large for the price but bathroom very small for our party of 5. also the carpet/fittings were very dated but bed was very comfortable and big tv for teh kids with free disney channel was good. Staff all friendly and shuttle bus drivers always helpful. Best value for money weas the Cafe not the restaraunt where you could buy breakfast, nibbles and even a beer. Tour Brochure wall near cafe has all sorts of info abour the are. we used one

I don't know.  There were issues here...weird sewage smell in the room, noisy doors...it just really isn't that nice.  Don't be swayed by the rating, because it did not compare, in our opinion, to the price.

Summary Heading: Excellent Hotel, Great For Disney and LA South
Summary: We stayed at the Sharaton Anaheim for 5 nights, the first leg of a 3 centre holiday (LA, Vegas and San Francisco - Virgin).  The hotel is situated alongside the I5 therefore access to all routes is easy. Disney gates are 5 minutes from the hotel, which makes it a great base.  We found all aspects of the hotel to be of a high standard. Friendly, courteous and helpful concierge and reception, made the arrival pleasant.  Our room which overlooked the pool area was of a very high standard, clean and comfortable,  We had queen beds and we both slept soundly; I was a little concerned due to the proximity to the I5, but heard nothing. Didn't use the hotel restaurant so can't comment; can recommend Mimi's on Harbor Blvd for good food at reasonable prices. We did Universal Studios which

Summary Heading: Great hotel, great rooms. Unfriendly staff. Expensive.
Summary: Overall, I think that the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel is a very nice quality hotel and the beds are super comfortable. Which is good after a long day of walking and standing outside.  The decor and mood of the lobby is extremely sophisticated and classy.   One thing that got on my nerves were the staff. I had an issue which was probably something that neither I nor Sheraton could have done to fix, but I asked if they could possibly do anything to help and the person on the counter didn't say anything other than "No. No... no." in a really rude and monotone voice. I personally think that they could have handled the situation with a bit of friendliness and understanding. But he wasn't the only one that was rude (he was certainly the worst). Another person on the counter, when I was

Stayed here for 6 nights to explore Disney/LA etc. Excellent rooms, very spacious, free access to internet/printers. Lovely looking hotel, nice pool etc. Can see the Disney fireworks from out front, or from your room if have a Disney facing room. Hotel does do shuttles to Disney on regular basis but we had car hire which is best if you want to explore the rest of anaheim/LA-other local shops/restarants are a long walk. Hotel is right on the I5 so pretty much anywhere is accessible from there. Would recommend if visiting Disney or have a car!

Stayed here with my family for 6 nights.  We had adjoining rooms overlooking the pool.  Both rooms were spacious and spotlessly clean.  The beds were comfortable and the linen crisp and clean and the soft fluffly towels were changed daily.  The rooms had tv, tea and coffee making facilities that were replenished daily and a fridge.  I found all the staff extremely friendly and  helpful.  We had the breakfast buffet every day which had a good selection of food and room service was excellent.  The pool was lovely, with plenty of loungers and clean towels to use and was kept spotlessly clean as I used to see the poolman clean it every morning and test the water for bacteria.  All in all I cannot fault this hotel and will definitely consider a Sheraton hotel in the future.

Summary Heading: convenient location to disneyland with comfortable rooms
Summary: This hotel is a convenient location to disneyland and rooms are comfortable, clean with modern furnishings.    You can buy your disneyland tickets in the lobby and there is a shuttle that leaves every half hour to the parks.  My only gripe is that service is quite slow.  We had some issues with our air conditioning and given that it was +80 degrees outside, we wanted a/c right away.  Service did not come until 3 hours after we called and we had to call the front desk 3 times.

We arrived on Saturday morning prior to check in and one of our four rooms were available, which was great.  We did not have to store our luggage in a closet until 3 p.m.   Unfortunately, the air conditioning in that room was broken and the room was so hot we could barely breath.  We were able to access a fan from housekeeping at about 11:30 p.m. to blow the hot air around but no one ever offered to have someone try to fix the air conditioning.  Until the following morning that is when we requested to be moved to another room and then the front desk person stated that she could call engineering and have them fix it.     We ate in the hotel restaurant, which has excellent food, but the place is very dirty.  The chairs are all stained and the bench seating is even worse.    After

Our 6 night stay at this hotel began well but deteriorated when we returned from a day of activities to find our room door open.  We reported this to front desk staff and luckily found nothing in the room was missing.  After the 3rd night a checkout bill appeared under the door which we thought was strange but we were in the middle of enjoying our vacation so left it in our room and went on with our plans for the day.  When we returned to the hotel later in the day, 3 staff members came to the door at different times to ask us if everything was alright, the last of these being the head of security at 10:20pm! Instead of being direct and telling us that staff had expected us to be checking out earlier that day, he again asked us if everything was alright and then had the nerve to

Summary Heading: Good for Disneyland area not much else
Summary: This is only five minutes from Disneyland and the hotel has a free shuttle service every half hour. Buffet Breakfast was acceptable with reasonable choice. Pool Area is very nice with plenty of loungers. Hotel is very spacious, with large, clean, tidy rooms. $9.95 for daily internet access and found it to be very slow. Hotel offered a 20% discount on food and drink apart from room service, this was welcomed. We had Dinner in hotel both nights and found the quality to be very good, and as usual for the States massive portions. Please note the hotel is stuck between 4 main roads, so cannot walk to any other Resteraunts. Cannot comment on traffic noise as we had a room overlooking the internal courtyard and pool

Overall, we liked the Sheraton Anaheim. We spent 3 days at Disneyland and had 2 connecting rooms. Our rooms in the North Tower were clean.  Carpet and bedding appeared to have been updated fairly recently. The concierge desk in the lobby sells Disneyland tickets. The buffet breakfast was convenient and service was very good. The shuttle runs every half hour to/from Disneyland and aside from the distance (a bit farther than many hotels) it worked very well.  The only negative we experienced was regarding customer service.  When we called the front desk to inquire about moving to different rooms; we were told that we were not assigned a "deluxe" room (as booked) because the hotel was very full. The front desk person transferred us to someone who listened to our request, then

Summary Heading: Beware: Poor Treatment if There is an Issue
Summary: During our second stay at this hotel this year; we were given a very large, dirty room. Stained floors, dirty shower, dust everywhere, a mirror was missing from the wall and a sofa pull out that had springs poking out. Disappointed in our room, I talked to the front desk. They put me through a great deal of trouble before finally agreeing to move us to a clean room. Clean meant a clean shower, with stained carpet and a few maintenance issues. We had the maintenance issues fixed by a very polite maintenance man and tried to be happy with our room. By the fourth day we were too uncomfortable to stay there any longer. Knowing we would not be refunded for our last two days, we moved ourselves to another hotel and paid for two nights in both places.   We left some of our items at the

Summary Heading: I wish I'd found this place years ago!
Summary: We are Disney people, go at least twice a year, sometimes more. We have stayed several places, included 2 of the Disney Resort hotels.....and I will tell you, this place rocked! We had our dog, and they are so amazing when it comes to your pets. Our room was GIGANTIC!!!! and very nice, so were the beds, comfy too...all the lower floors have a back door that opens to one of there lovely gardens. The staff at the desk, the restaurant, housekeeping, bell staff and shuttle where top notch...friendly and very accomadating with anything and everything.  It's close to Disneyland, but the free shuttle takes you straight to the park and then straight back to the hotel, save your feet and legs for walking around D-Land!. The hotel was beautiful, the grounds were beautiful, I will book

I spent four nights here with relatives as part of a trip to see Disneyland and Universal Studios. We were not disappointed. The service was excellent, the rooms very large, and the location convenient, with a regular shuttle service to Disneyland. The layout is a bit of a maze and it was a short hike to our rooms, but that was hardly an inconvenience. Great value here.

We stayed here 2nd week of July after a week in Vegas, the hotel was just perfect for our wedding anniversary. Can't understand the negative reveiws, but they do seem that the bad ones are american, check in was fine,1st room was overlooking the rose gardens on the 2nd floor, asked to be moved to ground floor because i do smoke, reception changed no probs just near a exit door for me. All staff were very helpfull in all aspects including the two bell hops which organised many of our trips Hollywood studios, downtown LA,Seaworld etc, we did do one trip via someone eles, big mistake!! took hours to return on Greyline my advise would be pay a few dollars more and use VIP Tours at the bell desk at front door. The free shuttle to disney should run every 30 mins but we found that they

We stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim for 2 nights in July 2009 (we were supposed to stay 3 nights, but cut it short.)  We were there to go to Disneyland with our two children.  While the lobby and common areas have been remodeled and are nice, the room we stayed in was dated and the walls needed to be cleaned.  While this is not a 4 star hotel as suggested, the room was inexpensive and the shuttle to Disneyland was prompt.  We will probably look for something walking distance to Disneyland if we are to go back in the future.  (The hotel is said to be across the street from Disneyland, but it is not a feasible walk due to location of freeway, etc.)

Summary Heading: Big, Beautiful and so close to Disney!
Summary: When I first turned up at this hotel (after flying in from Las Veags) my first impression was that it was in the middle of nowhere!  It didn't close close to anything. How wrong I was! The hotel exterior is very pretty, done in the style of a very large old English House.  Check in was reasonably quick (I turned up early so they had to check my room was ready) but other then that, no problems.  The room was HUGE! Bigger than my flat at home!  2 queen-size double beds, table, armchairs, workstation, TV, built in wardrobe - and it was only one of their cheap rooms!  The only problem was, the hotel is a bit of a maze and it took me a while to find the room - even after 6 days there I was still having trouble (probably down to my terrible sense of direct though). Maid service every

Stayed at the hotel with my wife and our three children (15, 11 & 5) for four nights. The staff are very friendly and the hotel has a great games room and deli. It is ideally located for Disney and Knotts Berry Farm. We also visited all of the southern California beaches such as Newport and Huntingdon from this location. It has ample free parking and a good pool which the kids loved. At night you can see the fireworks going off at Disney. The rooms are very spacious.

Summary Heading: Not such a great place to stay
Summary: Paper thin walls, the hallways smelled funny from the carpet, it was like going through a maze to get to our room, if they promote being "green" they should provide hooks to hang bath towels on. I had to get creative as to where to hang our wet towels. Housekeeping was great and that's the only good thing I can say about this hotel.

Summary Heading: Amazing value - Large rooms - Free Disney shuttle - Pool w/ lots of chairs and towels
Summary: My family stayed here for 3 nights and loved it! - I went on the Sheraton Anaheim hotel's website and scrolled through the deals with an AAA membership and found a great nightly rate AND a free breakfast buffet for 4 each morning.  The breakfast buffet is stocked (eggs, pancakes, bacon, sausage, potatoes, croissants, bagels, muffins, yogurt, fresh fruit, dry cereals, oatmeal/toppings, and probably a few other items I can't remember).   Our room was huge with ample storage space and comfortable beds.  The room had 2 doors - 1 leading to the interior corridor and the other that led to an outdoor courtyard and pathway.  Some rooms had the second door leading right to the pool. The pool is sort of kidney shaped with a shallow end and a deep (9ft) end.  Plenty of chairs surround the

We stayed at the Sheraton on our way to Kauai in Hawaii, the staff were friendly and we got to now one or two by name, the one staff member who took time to talk to us was Joe, he was lead security, what a pleasant person, also the reception staff were great , nothing was to much trouble, we had a fantastic room that was  the size our living room and dining room combined in the UK, the food was excellent and the shuttle to Disney was good, we used it to go to Denny's and MiMi's for food then caught it back, you can see the Disney fireworks from the hotel car park, the Hotel is a long way from LAX but is worth the visit.

Afer spending all morning at Disnelnad, it was nice to show up and check in with no wait at all. As a Starwood gold member, was given a big room, but too much wasted space that could make the bathroom bigger. front staff is very professional, not like the girls working the little store/deli. Just pointed to where the coffe was and kept on talking. Shuttle service to disney is great, even though 15 minutes seems forever when you want to go to bed. Oh and free internet in the lobby, I love that!

We have to girls 5 and 3 from Australia .  After long days at disneyland all you need is a room.  The rooms are huge.  Loud banging when fireworks on at disneyland but everyone would have that problem.  Lots of lounge around area.  Good little cafe for toast and cereal and coffee in morning.  Dont go to the mexican market, disgusting with trashy shopping (our only mistake). Noone on the counter at the hotel could tell us where the good shopping was so we just hung around downtown disney.  Lovely gardens.  Nice food in the restaurant.  Big tv.  we stayed in the main building, dont know if the adjacent tower is any different.  The cleaners were excellent and nice ladies.  Shuttle was perfect, no need to stay in the busy stip out the front of disneyland.  Overall very happy.  Our

Summary Heading: I liked the hotel a whole lot!
Summary: I have stayed here before. When I checked in I got a smoking room and thats not what I wanted I wanted a queen non-smoking. I called the desk and they told me to wait till 9:00 am the next morning I could'nt sleep because of the smoke. A non-smoking was'nt ready till 1:00 pm and I got at pet room on the 1st floor and then I changed it again at the same time I got a good room 2171. Now my stay is stress free and the non smoking rooms are clean . The next day the the lodgenet system they had on the tv was messed up for about an hour. On channel 0 a computer generated voice said you can also get a variety of adult titles press menu now and then a test pattern then the same thinh over and over again then it stoped. It looked like it was in a loop. I would definetly reccomend this

My parnter and I spent a week at this hotel and absolutely loved it. The lobby and public areas were cool and relaxing and the gardens were beatifully kept.  The concierge, receptionists and housekeeping staff were friendly and helpful at all times. Our room was air conditioned, huge, had plenty of storage and had a fridge.  Big telly set which included a channel giving lots of info on Anaheim.  Free internet access is available for guests, you just need to enter your surname and room number. The California Deli was great for sandwiches and drinks and the bar area was lovely, too. As a few other reviewers have said, it's probably best to have a car if you plan to do anything other than Disney, though there were a couple of fast food places within walking distance.  As we had a

My husband and I went to Disneyland for our honeymoon, and stayed at this hotel for the duration of the visit.  I've stayed here before, and have always had a good experience.  This was no exception.  Our room was very large, with the large closet.  The smallest portion of our room was actually the bathroom.  This was fine for us, but perhaps not that great if you're staying with more than a couple of people in the room.  A fridge was provided, but no microwave (actually, when we asked about the microwave, we were told we could be provided with one at an additional rate of $25 for each night of our stay!).    The hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous- it's designed like a castle.  The lobby area is very warm and relaxing.  The only downside is that the hotel's layout can be a

Summary Heading: Great Hotel, But be prepared to get a Taxi or have a long Walk
Summary: We were originally supposed to stay at the Tropican Suites, directly across from Disneyland, but were "upgraded" due to a double booking. Shuttlebus took us directly to Sheraton from LAX Airport (approx 1.5 hours in traffic) Hotel was still just across the road from Disneyland, but all the way on the otherside. Great Hotel, everything you can expect from Sheraton, clean, great service, free Shuttles to Disneyland etc.. Hotel was great, but I would definatley recommend staying at one of the hotels directly across from Disneyland near the McDonalds. Its just a hassel at the Sherton to have to walk or get the Shuttle each time you want to go eat out, or go to pub. At night time its hard to find a taxi, and Sherton is a good 20-30 min walk from the city centre. Great Hotel, but for

We spent two nights at the Anaheim Sheraton. Things got off to a bad start when we  waited about ten minutes to check-in then we got handed off to a trainee that did even know where our room was. We were sent to the 4th floor for a first floor room. We were also told for the first time that we needed to pay an extra $10 to park our car! The lobby was very attractive but the rest of the hotel looked at bit in need of renovation.  There were none of the usually hotel amenities, no free wi-fi, no buffet breakfast, no free coffee or water in the lobby. Water was provided in the room but if you made the mistake of taking a bottle of water you were charged about $4. For a hotel that was competing with other disney hotels, the pool  was small and cold, the temperature on the pool

We travelled to Anaheim with a 6 month old baby and other members of our family  in April/May 2009 and we were delighted with our choice of hotel.  We are planning to return in a couple of years (once the new attractions are built at Disney).  The rooms were massive, the cots were brilliant, the maid service was excellent, the reception staff were without doubt amazing as were the Deli staff.  The Deli is excellent for breakfast, and allow you to heat up baby food in their microwave. which was of great assistance to us.  We ate in the restaurant for breakfast twice, although the food was ok, the service was not as good as the rest of the hotel (in my opinion).   I would stick to the Deli for breakfast.  Although close to Disney, it is a 25 minute walk, so the shuttle bus was

Just returned from a 2 week holiday at this hotel, we went as a family group which included 5 adults and one 6 month old baby in 3 rooms, nice hotel with nice grounds which include a small swimming pool and jacuzi. The rooms were large and spacious with a fridge, coffee maker, TV and air conditioning, there was no in-room safe in any of the rooms however. We used the deli in the hotel daily, very good sandwiches and very friendly staff. The hotel also runs a free shuttle bus to disneyland which is excellent, you can also walk to disneyland from the hotel which takes around 25 minutes. The hotel has a 20% discount card that you can use in the deli/restaurant which we had to ask for from the concierge. Would stay at this hotel again in the future.

This hotel is lovely and was much better than expected. My partner, 2 year old son and I recently spent 4 nights here and were not disappointed. The exterior was very pretty and much more attractive than most of the other hotels in the area. Our room was huge with 2 comfy beds, large plasma, chairs, desk with chair and lovely bathroom. Out of a 4 stop stay this hotel room was the biggest! The staff were very accommodating and always polite and made our little boy very welcome. If visting Anaheim again would definately stay here again.

Summary Heading: Good Location and accomodation after a hard day at the Parks to relax in
Summary: Arrived Mid Afternoon, greeted by enthusiastic porter and checked in by friendly male receptionist, smooth check in.  Rooms very spacious, two double beds which were very comfortable.  Large tv, telephone, fridge and desk.  Bathroom was a little on the small size but how big do you want it?  Both the room and the bathroom were clean and towels, soap and shampoo were replenished on a daily basis.  There was an iron and ironing board and also a hairdryer provided.  The gardens within the hotel were very peaceful as was the swimming pool and jacuzzi.  The pool was heated but felt a little cool whilst we were there, however the jacuzzi was very warm and relaxing, there are signs telling you that you have to be 16 or over to use the jacuzzi but these rules seemed very relaxed as

Summary Heading: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL
Summary: This hotel is a 3-star at best!  The rooms were NOT as pictured on the website.  The lobby was very impressive, and you can tell that is the ONLY place they spent their remodeling money.  The rooms were sub-standard.  The bathrooms (and we checked out two rooms in this hotel) are so small...to close the door, you have to squeeze next to the toilet to close.  Just like in a public restroom stall.  The staff were rude and didn't have our reservation correct.  Very over-priced...check out other local hotels and other major chains.  They say this hotel is across the street (which it is), but it is behind the enormous parking structure.  So to walk to the front gate, prepare for a 20 minute hike!  You cannot see the night fireworks from the hotel because of the parking structure.  If

The hotel lived up to all our expectations and more.  Our room was a good size, very clean and well furnished.  The staff were very friendly, always ready with a smile and greeting.   The whole hotel was well maintained with staff always cleaning, gardening etc. All in all, a fantastic place, and if we ever go back to Anaheim that will be the place we stay. Great value for money!

A lovely hotel with good rooms.we had a fridge,so were able to keep fresh milk etc for breakfast. the hotel has a free bus to Disneyland ,which runs every 30 mins from 8.30am to 12pm. The staff are friendly and the grounds are great. fountains,fish pool complete with bridge,and a pergola. cannot fault thhis hotel,and would stay ther again.

As we were travelling in a large group, the room size was going to predict the greatmess of any hotel. We booked the connecting queen rooms and loved how huge the rooms were. No problems whatsoever with the room, the pool or any of the amenities of the hotel.   The one negative-the shuttle service. Yes, they did come every 30 minutes, but the drivers leave much to be desired. One in particular-the shuttle was completely full and he insisted on staying at Disneyland for the remaining 7 minutes of the shuttle time, as opposed to leaving and returning within that amount of time. Ridiculous to sit on a full shuttle bus to turn passengers away saying he would be right back.   Other than that-great hotel. Very nice lounge area's, pool area, games, and courtyards.

We arrived from Sydney after a really long flight and were greeted by a great conceige who gave us our room key. We had a drink in the hotel bar to unwind and Paul the bartender is a legend!!! The room was great, very clean and spacious. Just what you need. Internet wifi costs $9.95 but was free in the business centre. There was no minibar and no breakfast, but the free shuttle to Disneyland was great!!! The rooms are serviced daily by the maid and there is also room service if you are peckish. Disneyland is great but DCA park is not as good. Worth saving your money for Disneyland instead. If you are going to disneyland, the fast passes are great to beat the queues and plan out your day. Take the sunblock, you will get burnt. Food is very fattening in the park and worse outside

I was the director of a conference that selected this hotel for our 300 person conference.  What a choice! The staff is extraordinarily helpful, the food was great.  The prices at the bar and at the deli inside the hotel were a little high, but that was nothing since there was a gas station in walking distance.  The rooms were huge and beautiful, the pool area was spotless and clean.  I heard nothing but exceptional comments from my attendees.  I would highly reccomend this place to ANYONE...I will be back.

We booked the 1200sf room for the size at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel, Well its not 1200sf but two rooms that connect with a separate doors and card keys to get to the rooms. Talk about dirty, The carpets in both rooms looked like a kindergarten after art class. Both Toilets in the rooms had to have maintance look at them twice for not flushing! They suggested we use the lobby toilets! That’s ok for just a couple, but when you are traveling with 8 guest and 6 are under the age 14 that was a big challenge. The hotel is advertise across the street from Disney. Well its little over a mile away by shuttle which happens to be driven by the bell hop. If he/she is out then your bags are up to yourself! We was lucky to be traveling with a couple teenage boys that help us.  The biggest

Stayed here in early Dec 08 for 5 nights and need not have worried about mixed reviews on TA site. My kids loved the place, great beds, no Traffic noise that we could hear, close to Disneyland etc. One great benefit for families on a budget is the Deli they have. Here you could get Breakfast cereal, juice, Tea ,Coffee, Toast, Muffins etc rather than spending  a small fortune on a restaurant Breakfast daily. If you have small kids who don't eat heaps then it was perfect. The Disneyland shuttle was great and we picked it up all the time over 4 days and it was comforting knowing you just walked outside straight onto that Sheraton bus and it took you home. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Summary Heading: Loved it! Would definitely stay again. It was absolutely fantastic!
Summary: We were on a family vacation, 13 people total! 6 adults, 7 children (10, 9, 8, 7, 6, 2 and 5 months old) including 1 child in a wheelchair. This is one of the only 4 star resort hotels with a family connector suite. They offer nice sized rooms and a fantastic location. We're from Seattle so we were really excited about the Starbucks just a few blocks away. The free shuttle to Disneyland was also very nice. Must give a shout out to our wonderful Russian driver...this guy was amazing! Also, Geoffrey at the front desk was wonderful as well. Since we had a child in a wheelchair we had to always call ahead and request the shuttle with the wheelchair lift. This was never a problem. They were always tremendously accomodating! FYI, if you can't handle staying at the park to watch the

Stayed here on business for 6 days in January. Obviously, a very "touristy" type hotel due it's proximity to Disneyland, but it's a good all round hotel.  All the staff I encountered were friendly and courteous, if a little over efficient - it took more time that I would have expected to check-in due to being spoken to as if I was a little child booking in to my first hotel by the guy behind reception. This is a purely subjective opinion as everyone else I encountered were friendly and efficient.  The room was HUGE. Two queen sized beds and the room still looked enormous. Very comfortable room with very little, if any, noise from adjoining rooms or the corridor. I was fortunate enough to have a pool side room too, which is a real bonus if you get chance to request one. The

We stayed here for two nights whilst on a road trip around California to visit Disneyland.  Location: Just a few minutes on a (hotel provided) bus to Disneyland.  Issues: None  Positives: The whole experience was great - we hadn't booked a hotel here so just turned up - no problem finding us a room at a good rate, and we also go an upgrade!  We had the same waiter on both evenings and he was very friendly and helpful.  We're fussy eaters but it wasn't a problem to change ingredients on the menu.  Restaurant: As above, we had an excellent waiter.  The food was good too and the restaurant itself was nice and ambiently lit.  Prices were reasonable.  Bar: There was a nice "library"-themed area with some sofas etc where we could relax with a drink, which was nice.  Room: Our room had

We decided on the Sheraton based upon friends' recommendations that obtained the identical AAA package.  Sheraton Anaheim Hotel did not honor my Travel Confirmation reservation as arranged between AAA, Sheraton, and Disneyland.   Confirmation stated "free breakfast buffet" included, however, Sheraton GM disagreed.  Sheraton GM commented, "they do not recognize any travel confirmations, other than one's made DIRECTLY with the Sheraton."   Furthermore, he knew of no such package (ever) offering free breakfasts.  Little did he know that I discovered a fact later on that there was a policy change that never was communicated to AAA, and reservations had not been updated to current.  So in the end, the Hotel was "less than truthful" and chose not to rectify matters.  This is a  poor
large room quiet floor, nice pool, good restaurant

We stayed at the Sheraton hotel in Anaheim expecting high quality and a great location to Disney, we were not disaoopinted with either. The location was brilliant and the quality was exceptional.   I was initially concerned about the noise from the highway outside but you cannot hear a thing.   The beds were very comfortable and the staff were friendly and welcoming. If I were to return to Anaheim or LA I would not entertain any other accomodation.                                    **********FANTASTIC**********

I have been to this hotel twice.  December 2006 and December 2007.  Both times we have enjoyed staying there.  The lobby area at Christmas is gorgeous!  The rooms are very "normal" hotel rooms-they are huge though.  Perfect for a family with three children 12, 7, and 5.  We don't feel like we are in a small box!  We're going again next week.  Looking forward to staying again.    If there was one minus about the hotel it would have to be the very grumpy wait staff in the lobby restaurant.

After reading many mixed reviews I was wondering about this hotel ! We are a family of 5 ( Kids are 12, 10 ,8 )  so we needed a hotel that has room for us all. This hotel has huge rooms and the rollaway bed was actually a twin bed on wheels not a folding cot and we still had room to move around . But first things first. Upon arrival the kids were amazed by the castle themed exterior and the park like grounds. We were greeted at the front desk by friendly and helpful staff . Found our room on the second floor ,it was clean and ready, Also found the rooms very quiet . The bathroom was small but it worked fine for us. A large mirrored closet and desk outside the bathroom helped . The refrigerator was great to have .   The shuttle service is the best , Direct to Disney and back to

Summary Heading: Excellent Choice for Disneyland Area Hotel
Summary: GREAT FANTASTIC HOTEL! We are Gold status Starwood Members and couldn't’t get a room at the Sheraton Park Hotel so we had to “settle” for the Sheraton Anaheim Resort (Castle) hotel instead. What a blessing it was! (more on that later)  Believe it or not, this is NOT a cheesy castle themed hotel like the hotel stock photos suggests…except for the outside entrance area. Other than that, the hotel would be better described as an English Tudor hotel with fountains, koi ponds and a rose garden.    Outside, staff greeted us upon arrival at their  booth set up for tours, questions and so forth. Upon entering, we were surprised to see such a LARGE, beautifully decorated lobby. One part of the lobby has 4 sofas, many wing-back chairs, bookcase; a separate part of the lobby has a step

Summary Heading: The place to stay on a budget for Disneyland
Summary: The rooms are huge.  The bathroom could be modernized, but for the most part, quite nice.  For the price, the best option around to go to Disneyland.  There is a free shuttle that takes you right to the park that leaves every 30 minutes.  The service at the front desk was not very helpful... When there internet went down, they asked us to call some phone numbers to fix it.  They could not be bothered to do so themselves.  I like this hotel and will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Loved the Hotel would stay again
Summary: We Stayed at the Anaheim Sheraton for 3 nights with Our 3 children 12,17 and 19 . We are Gold SPG members and were trying our membership out for the first time. I was pleasantly surprised that it only took 7000 pts for such nice rooms.They did give us a larger room that was 500 sq ft and 2 Queens and still lots of room for a rollaway bed. We decided once we were in our room that we would like to try a Suite instead. I had to pay a little more in cash but we felt it was worth it.We were given the Turret suite, Which is a smaller room with a seperate master Bedroom and a shared Bathroom. We liked it because it gave all of us a little privacy and 2 tv s to watch. I wished it had been a little bigger though. The Lobby is Beutiful as is the entire Hotel. The workout room could have

Summary Heading: Wonderful Disney Experience at Sheraton Anaheim
Summary: Recently stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim with my wife and 3 children. We were very pleasantly surprised by the size of the rooms, which comfortably accommodated all of us, and we we conveniently located near the pool. Our Sheraton stay exceeded our expectations, and we found it to be an excellent base for what turned out to be an amazing Disney experience. Thanks to the Sheraton Anaheim team! We highly recommend your hotel based on our experience.

I don't know what all of these negative hotel reviews are about, but, I stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim recently, and didn't have a bit of trouble, with the customer service, food, anything. I guess some people you just can't please. No matter how hard you try.   I think the hotel itself, is in immaculate shape, the decor is aboslutely beautiful, and the service I received was well beyond, better than what I see written here, in the past couple of reviews. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.   I really enjoyed myself here, and i'll definately be back!!!

I'll first start off by saying that although I'm only 23, I am (in my opinion) quite well traveled. I've been to many different parts of Canada, the US, and the Caribbean.   I booked this hotel after being told by the couple we were traveling with that they got a rate of $140/night as a "summer special" - great! That was in our budget for sure. I called the reservation line, gave the dates of travel, and was old that a room would be $185/night. I mentioned that friends of mine were staying the same dates and they got a summer special of $140/night, could I please get that? To which she got a bit snotty and said, "Well I GUESS I could give you that rate" - keep in mind, I'm friendly, I believe you get what you give, I was very polite when I asked this!  Moving on!  CHECK IN  We

On our tour of California, the Sheraton Anaheim was our first stop. After 14 hours travelling the greeting from reception was first class. The receptionist sorted our room out within minutes and we were on our way. The rooms were as good as you get. Everything was in pristine condition and can not be faulted. The area around the hotel is good, with Downtown Disney just a 10-15 minute walk away and excellent access to roads. Well priced car parking, great pool area and nice restaurant all add to the feel of the hotel.   In the evening we came back to the hotel and spent an hour in the bar with a drink or two. All of the staff was exceptionally friendly but in particular, Paul who worked in the bar was a star. It was probably because of him we spent a litte too much time in the
Good location for visiting Disneyland, free shuttle to the theme park is a bonus. Service was somewhat rude and room service overpriced but otherwise a good location stay.

Summary Heading: Rooms take you back to the 60's
Summary: My Family stayed at the Sheraton on July 30 and 31st. We looked at the pictures and the reviews and decided to book it since it was so close to Disneyland. The Hotel lobby is very nice, with an area with a fireplace and sofas, next is the restaurant and there is a booth where you can buy two days tickets for Disney. The grounds are kept very well manicured. The shuttle to Disney runs every half an hour and is very convinient. We had an spacious  two queen beds room, it was clean but the furniture is very cheap and old, the bathroom was exactly the size of the tub without much room to move, there is no sink with vanity on the outside, even the doors are reminescent of the track homes of the sixties. The TV isn't much better. The one good thing is that the coffee maker had

This was my favourite hotel (of 4) on our trip. It was located about 10 mins from Disney on the shuttle bus which ran every half hour til about an hour after the park closed and more often at busy times. The hotel itself was really nice, our room was massive with a really comfortable king size bed and little coffee machine with starbucks filter coffee provided. The only drawbacks to the room were that there was no safety deposit (at reception only) and the shower temperature was a bit screwed up, cold was hot and hot was cold!! It took a bit of working out. Otherwise loved the room. There was a pretty decent little shop that had cereal bowls and milk for a cheaper and easier breakfast option along with fresh doughnuts, medication etc. There was also nice gardens and a games

Summary Heading: Ok hotel if you are visting Disneyland
Summary: My wife and I stayed here so we could spend several days at the Disneyland Theme park and for that purpose, this hotel is a good choice.  There are four buses per hour that travel back and forth to Disneyland: Buses leave the hotel on the hour and half hour and leave Disney land at a quarter after and a quarter to.   The room was just OK, the bathroom quite small and a refrigerator in each room.  Since we spent the whole day at Disney, we spent very little time in the room and thus room accommodations were not that important to us. This hotel does not offer a free breakfast and if you have a family (especially with teenage boys!) feeding them could get quite expensive and you might want to consider some hotel with free breakfast (the two near by Marriot Residence Inns offer free

Summary Heading: Will Stay Here Again - Disney Friendly
Summary: I booked the hotel late and as expected got a room that is typically horrible - the corner by the ice machine and the elevator.  We stayed for four nights and each one was enjoyable and quiet.  We had a King bed with the couch-bed.  The fold out bed was fine for the kids (7&8).  We used the room just for a place to stay.  We ate at the deli once, and we were suprised at the amount of food for the $ - very fair pricing for the product.  The lounges and grounds were very nice and the parking area seems secure.    My only dissatisfaction was with the $10/day parking fee.    The shuttle service was great - more frequent than the "very half hour" published.  We never waited more that 15minutes on either end.

As a Starwood Corporate and Gold Member for more than 15 years, our most recent stay at the Sheraton Anaheim has made our decision never to stay at a Starwood Property again!!! There are absolutely no pros about this hotel other than the fact that you pay for what you get...our room rate was dirt cheap!!! Cons: -Extremely rude and inefficient front desk staff. -Unresponsive hotel management team in dealing with customer concerns. -Free shuttle to Disney for hotel guests and anyone else who is smart enough to park for free at the hotel parking lot and get on board-No seats on the shuttle for paying hotel guests as others from around the land got on board and hoarded their way on the bus each morning-an awful experience. -Hotel charges guest for parking at a tune of $10/day-not

Stay: March 3 - March 4, 2008  Room: Standard Room  Upgrades: None  Comments: Fine Hotel, staff took a little long to check me in, did not give me an upgrade as a SPG Gold member at the time.  Room was fine, location is great if you are going to Disney.  Parking is not included, keep that in mind.  I would only recommend this if you are going to Disney and not able to stay on the property.  Otherwise there are plenty of other hotels around.

Before booking this I had read mixed reviews but with the expectation that this not the Ritz, but a family hotel, I thought it was an excellent choice and value.   We checked in on June 22nd and were greeted by the friendly staff who gave us an early check -in. The lobby by the way has a series of fish tanks that the kids loved because of the look-a-like Nemo fish.   The rooms to our surprise were very spacious which was great for the kids. The only two negatives were the size of the bathroom and the carpet was very run down.   The hotel is very close to Disney and, like many others have mentioned, there are no restaurants nearby. We found the hotel food prices to be more expensive and of lesser value than the meals we enjoyed in Disneyland and California Adventure. If your

This hotel has uneven service, high pros and low cons.  This would be okay if the hotel was $100 or under.  I think for the price, the service should be better.  The shuttle made it worth while.  This is clearly a priority for the hotel.  I never had to wait more than 15 min for a shuttle, it was great service.  Housecleaning, on the other hand, is horrible.  On our first day there, we were able to check in early - at 10 am.  This was fantastic.  However the next day, when we returned from our day at the park, at 2pm, our room was still dirty.  So, that means that over 24 hours had passed and nobody had been in our room to clean.  Our trash cans were overfilled, we had dirty towels on the floor, and our beds had not been made.  I put my baby down for her nap and called the front

Summary Heading: Magic hotel very close to the magic
Summary: This was destination #6 in our 2007 summer holiday which took in San Francisco (Holiday Inn, Fisherman's Wharf), Yosemite (Yosemite View Lodge), Carmel (Carmel Mission Inn), Santa Maria (Holiday Inn), Beverly Hills (Beverly Hilton), Anaheim (Sheraton Anaheim) and San Diego (Paradise Point).   This review is for the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel.  First of all let's face the facts.  Walt Disney's purchase of a few empty fields in Orange County all those years ago did not stay a secret for long.  Hence everyone pitched up and started building around his plot. What you have today is a bizarre case of a magical land-locked Disneyland Resort with no end of hotels/motels on the doorstep.  You've therefore only got a choice of 3 Disney hotels "on-property" (not like the many in WDW Florida),

Summary Heading: Not a bad place to stay!
Summary: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel starting on May 22, 2008. We were taking our kids to Disneyland and decided to stay here. I paid around $125 per night for a two queen bed room. Unlike many other hotels near Disneyland, this hotel has access to the rooms from the inside.  We were at the hotel at 12:00 PM while the check-in time was 3:00 PM. But the lady at the check-in did let us check-in right away. She wasn't too friendly though and I had requested for a room with a view but she was too busy issuing a room to me that she didn't care to provide me wth any choices. But we did get a room on the second floor with a view of the pool area.  The room was the most spacious double room that I've ever stayed in. The furniture looked a little dated but nothing too bad. The bathroom

We awoke to a 2 inch cock roach over our bed on the ceiling.    Because of a problem with check in I received a free breakfast, but when I went to eat breakfast, the food buffet was covered wtih flies.   When I told the restaurant manager of the flies (and showed her), she said she could do nothing because the restaurant manager was not in.   Five phone calls to the hotel general manager, Ken Buksa where not returned but he did write the following in a letter he would not do anything about the bugs because I complained during check in and received a free breakfast (the same one covered with flies that made me sick).  Am I am have been a Gold to Platnum member with Starwood for 20 years.   This was the most disgusting of all Starwood hotels.   I recommend Motel 6 over this

My neice and I stayed for two days while visiting Disneyland.  The rooms are very large and the beds are so comfortable,had the best nights sleep ever.  We had no problems with noise as other reviews had written, our room was very quiet.  The only complaint I have ( and not the hotel's fault) is there are no resturants near by, you have to either eat at the hotel (very expensive) or wait until the shuttle drops you off and walk accross the street to eat.  Overall we had a great stay, rooms are very clean and the hotel lobby is beautiful.  Shuttle service is great also.

Before booking this I had read mixed reviews but I'm so glad we booked this as it was excellent!  We travelled with some friends and when we arrived our Travel Agent had only booked 1 room but the hotel staff were great & found us another room across the hall from us straight away with no fuss.  The check staff were friendly and anytime we needed to ask a question, whoever we asked on the front desk was really helpful.  The rooms here are HUGE!  We were amazed at how big these rooms were and even managed to ballroom dance round it!!  The only let done was the size of the bathroom - it was so small it was funny, especially in comparison to the size of the room - the wardrobe was probably bigger!!!  But then again I didn't need to spend long in the bathroom so the size wasn't a

I stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim for the first time this April and found myself my new favorite hotel in the Disneyland area! Staying at the Sheraton Anaheim was perfect for the active Disneyland vacation we had planned. The moment we arrived there it was just perfection. The staff at the desk were very helpful during check-in and even when we realized that someone in our party had forgot their medication at home they wrote out the directions to the nearest Walgreens. The hotel itself is much larger than it looked from the front. We had simply booked the cheapest room we had found for the hotel. While the view was not wonderful as it was facing the other side of the hotel it didn’t need to be spectacular. We were there for Disney! The room, although the cheapest, was extremely

What a beautiful room, felt like a celebrity, a celebrity surrounded by slamming doors and children running and jumping above us. The party in the hall outside our room was pleasant to listen to while we SHOULD have been sleeping. I recommend it, if you don't want to sleep....

This hotel is advertised as a suite hotel---it is not.  The room is basically a motel room style with a pull out couch.  The bathroom is so small that most of your things have to put on the computer desk outside the room.  The fridge was too small to put leftovers in.  Also the breakfast buffet is not included in price and cost us $60-$70 a day for 2 adults and three kids.  The front desk staff were rude and would not concerned when we complained about our room.   I have stayed in a Sheraton Suite hotel in Vancouver which was lovely---it actually had a bedroom  with a door and a large bathroom.   Anaheim also charges for parking everyday---so much for the free shuttle.   I would recommend the holiday inn suites instead(staybridge)  which does include breakfast buffet, free

We have just returned from 9 night stay. I was worried about booking this hotel as it was away from the most of the other hotels. However my fears were short lived. The free shuttle out weighed staying at any  of the hotels within walking distance of Disneyland and it was nice to get away from the madness near the Anaheim resort area. We saw how long the queues were for the ART shuttles and really how far a block walk was. When the shuttle was full they sent for another bus so there was only a small wait. We also caught the shuttle for shopping and wating out. We stayed in the newer wing- with rooms recently renovated, but the hallway needed attention. The room had 2 queens and a rollaway for 2 adults and 2 kids, small bathroom and dressing area. They said these were the bigger
Love the sheraton !!! rooms were BIG. staff were very friendly and the shuttle bus was great.

The exterior of the hotel was lovely -a s you would expect from one being in a Disney area. The room we had was alot larger than we were used to and the beds were large but quite soft. everywhere was clean although the carpets were alittle dated. The real fire in the snug around from reception was a great idea for the cool nights

We stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim for 6 nights and found the hotel to be fine/adequate. The room was large and clean but a bit dated and the bathroom was really small; there is no safe in the room they are behind the front desk. Our room was on the ground floor and it was a bit odd because it had 2 doors one to the inside corridor and the other to a courtyard but we did get used to it.This is a good family hotel and the shuttle to Disney was excellent. The hotel is not is such a good position as some as the other hotels but it is still near the Freeway and the park. The hotel restaurant is not good, we tried it once for dinner, and once for breakfast and I wouldn't recommend it. I would recommend getting the shuttle to the park as it runs every half hour and then walk across the

For the rate, this hotel is a great find and my family enjoyed our stay. Like most places, it has its pros and cons, but for the most part, I preferred it to one of the newer convention area hotels we'd stayed at in the past for one simple reason: LOCATION.  On the plus side: it has a GREAT location & a GREAT free hotel shuttle that runs on time, every 1/2 hour. It took only 6 mins from leaving the hotel to walking off the shuttle at Disney. There was no waiting, it would arrive & leave on time. Having used the "ART" system on a prior trip, this is a big plus!! The shuttle drivers are all polite & helpful to families with kids & strollers (like us!)  The hotel has a deli where you can get a quick snack, milk, fruit, sandwiches, salads. We grabbed stuff there in the mornings.

Hope someone from the Sheraton reads this review!! We had an unexpected extended stay at the Sheraton (10 days).  the room was only a LITTLE like the pictures.  Far too small for two adults and two teenagers.  (we apparently had the smallest room in the hotel) - next to a room with machinery in it which was a bit noisy. I wish I was a person who demands better!! The hotel was very busy so initially had no other rooms available. the front desk was occaisionally not very friendly or helpful (1 or 2 of the staff).  The rest of the staff were wonderful.  The shuttle to Disneyland was great and ran like clockwork.  A NOTE FOR EVERYONE.  TAKE A MUG!!! The hotel only supply disposable cups. - YUK!!. Take a jug as well if you drink tea as only a coffe machine is supplied. - ask front

Stayed at Sheraton Anaheim this past weekend for 3 nights, in town for cheer nationals.  During Christmas, we had stayed at Sheraton Park for 5 nights and loved it but unfortunately it was booked so stayed at this one, again using Starwood points so can't comment on the value.   The exterior of the hotel is beautiful and so is the lobby area.  The rooms are huge, much larger than at the Park, but no balconies.  No need really since I would of been overlooking the freeway onramp.  So there's my first complaint.....traffic noise!!!!  It was bad.  If you go, request a room facing the interior courtyard.  Also, when the fireworks went on at Disney, it was LOUD in our room but we couldn't see anything!  Eventhough the room was large, I'll have to agree with the other review, the

Summary Heading: Great Little Hotel! Perfect Weekend getaway
Summary: Me and My husband went on the first of March for a little getaway to Disneyland.We got a great room rate through AAA.(huge discount) When we got to the hotel we found it so cute and charming.The hotel entryway was great and the little garden outside was very cute especially when we where tired of the park and just wanted to kick back and relax.The only minor things we didnt like was the parking was a bit complicated to get in and out their is a 10 dollar charge a day but it was not a big deal due to the fact they have a free shuttle to Disneyland which that pays for itself makes the ART shuttle service look like a joke.The walk way to our room was a bit confusing due to the hotel is set up like a huge manor so we had to walk a long way to our room however again very minor and

Summary Heading: Perfect for family trip to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed here for week long trip to Disneyland and not disappointed.  Rooms were as promised very large with two new Sheraton Sleeper Queen beds and a rollaway all fitting easily into the room. Staff were efficient rather than friendly, although the onsite snack shop staff were very helpful.  Big plus was the free shuttle bus to and from the park, always ran on time. Twice when one bus was full with others from the hotel still waiting the driver radio'd back for a second bus to come straight away. Food bit pricey for what it was at the hotel but used shuttle bus to access stores/ shops at Downtown Disney or at front gate, while the Block at Orange shopping mall less than $10 taxi ride away.  Only downside was the occsional noise of returning guests from the park after midnight or

My family of four (myself, husband and 2 children aged 6 and 8) stayed at the Sheraton in July of '07 for 7 nights.  After much research on the Internet, we decided that it would be the place for us and we were RIGHT.  We checked in @ 4 (took less than 3 minutes) and went to our HUGE poolside room.  The bathroom was very nice, but small. The beds were absolutely amazing after full days of site-seeing, walking, rides, etc. The view was nice too(when we had the curtains open).  The only drawback was the very first night when we went to bed @ 9.
