I think we were all dead asleep when we were awakened by enormous BOOMs.  At first, we were utterly shocked... until we figured out it was the Disneyland fireworks!  It was almost like a dream (considering we were still half-asleep)!  We

I stayed here on business in order to check it out as I am coming back to Anaheim with my family in a few weeks.  This is what I would call your typical family friendly hotel.    Parking is $10.  Free shuttle to Disneyland runs every half hour.  Lobby is beautiful, fish tanks and well appointed.  Restaurant menus looked good, standard fare, but a little pricey especially considering this is a family hotel.  I ordered room service breakfast and it arrived on time, hot, and with everything I had requested.  Bring your own coffee, the one delivered was pretty bad, but I'm sure it was just a fluke, usually coffee is hard to screw up.  My room was huge, as advertised.  Lots of space for a crib or pack n play plus the pullout sofa for older kids.  The furniture was circa 1976.

This was a very nice hotel, the shuttle was awesome to Disneyland! The beds were great! I dont even remember laying my head down! The snack area was a little pricey, I brought my own food which helped out alot. If your not going there for Disneyland....the firworks can be seen from the font of the hotel, but it also sounds like cannons going off!! we didnt mind at all though. I would definetly go back!!

What a surprise, out of all the hotels we were to stay at during our trip this was the one we were most worried about due to previous reviews.  There was no need, we couldn't fault this hotel in anyway, friendly staff, oversized rooms there were only two of us but could have fitted 22 into our room!!  Free shuttle bus to Disney and as we had booked through Virgin we received free parking on site normally $10-$15 per day resonable considering in LA.  The hotel was themed around an Tudor Mansion, but wasn't tacky.  You even received a free postcard with postage paid to send home.  We visited both of the Disney parks, however the best theme park was Knotts Berry, would suggest by pass Disney and go to KB.  It suits all ages.

I chose this hotel instead of Sheraton Park Anaheim (which I've stayed at before) just to see how it was.   Two Pros: - Free shuttle to and from the park  - In-room refrigerator   Cons: - $10 per night parking fee (same as Disneyland parking fee) - strange odor in the hallways and the room - although shuttle was free, it did NOT come on time once when we were there, and it was raining! - rude front desk clerk who seemed disturbed that he had to get off his cell to check us in - no restaurants within walking distance - room/bathroom extremely outdated - paper thin walls  Overall: This hotel was not worth the points that I used and definitely is not worth anyone's hard-earned money. If you're trying to decide between this Sheraton and the other one (Sheraton park) you should

We found this hotel to be perfect for what we needed it for:  a jumping off point for the Disneyland parks.  Positives:  Very nice hotel with pretty lobby w/gorgeous aquarium in it. Great location (very close to Disney parks). Convenient Shuttle service, and ticket concierges in lobby for parks was great.  Room was clean, spacious and very nicely (3 1/2 - 4 star) decorated (it's not 5 star but that's not what we booked). Restaurant w/breakfast was delicious and offered a nice variety of food.   Negatives:  They charged us to park our rental car in the hotel lot.  We would definitely stay here again.

I have read some of the reviews on the Sheraton Anaheim and really, I wonder if we were at the same hotel! We found the hotel to be very nice. The rooms are large, the bathroom is small - but it is a bathroom!  We never ate our meals at the hotel, but rather took the shuttle to the park, walked across the street and chose a restaurant from the many available on the main drag. The shuttle was very convenient and very accomodating. If the shuttle filled up, the driver always called for another right away. We found everyone helpful -especially the front desk when Supershuttle never showed up to pick us up! I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. We are not snooty people, nor do we book fancy hotels.  But this was the best hotel we have ever stayed at. Go and enjoy.

The sheraton anaheim is a really nice hotel. The bus service to disney was good as well every half and hour. The jacuzzi pool was nice too has it was too cold to swim in the big pool. The food was nice in the garden restaurant at night try the new york steak it was lovely and also the salmon. Pevel sorted some of our trips out he was the bellman and he was really good. hes got a friend called toni and he will do a private taxi around anywhere you want to go to. hes know a lot of knowledge about the area and would defintley recommend that. Go to warner brothers studios was a good day out.  a very nice hotel to stay in

Our family was vacationing for one week with another family.  between the two families there were children ages 10--13 years.  We were able to book our (non smoking, 2 queen size beds in each room,) rooms side by side, and on the main level.  The  rooms had an entrance from an interior hallway and a second entrance from the outdoors.  The outside doors opened directly onto very well kept and lush grounds and the pool area.   This was great location for us, as the kids loved to swim and we could also see the fireworks if we were in our room at firework time.  The hotel stafff were very friendly, the maid service was timely and thorough, and the room was quiet and clean.  The beds were comfy and yes, the bathroom is a bit tight, but they have a nice dresser near the entrance to

Summary Heading: Convenient for parks and major connecting roads
Summary: We decided on this hotel after reading previous reviews.  We went there under no illusion that we would have an olympic sized swimming pool as a bath, however it did feel like I had to run the 500 metre dash from my bed to the bathroom sometimes.  The bedroom was HUGE, we had been given a twin room, even so there was still masses of room left and it felt like there was room for additional beds to be added.  There was a fridge in the room which is a plus after a hard days slog at the parks having cool refreshments waiting. I also loved the fact that there were ceramic mugs for my coffee along with disposable cups too.    Navigating from Reception to room and vice versa proved to be slightly annoying sometimes when realising that a wrong turn had been taken.  As the hotel is only

I stayed at the Sheraton for five nights in 2005. The sweet sleeper bed is the best bed in the world! The room itself was spacious and well appointed, but the bathroom is a bit cramped and outdated. The location is great for Disneyland but next time I'll definitely stay closer to Hollywood. Take a day tour to Tijuana, it was good fun and it's nice to leave Disneyland for a day in the real world.

We booked a deluxe room for 4 nights thru AAA for $125 P/N. At check in , I requested a quiet room ( not facing the Highway ),  the rooms was on the second floor facing the rose garden and the room look exact like the one from the hotel website's photo.   However, the hotel room's  wall/ceiling/floor  were paper thin.  The staff that worked below our room , I believe is either an office or a storage room that is below us.  They awoke us up at 6:30 Am with loud talking and jamming with the door bell.   Noises were also coming from other guest  yelling in the hallway,  taking shower, and slaming  their room door.   We changed another room to the top floor with no adjacent room next to us.   The new room  was a standard room that need some refurbishment and the noise level from the

Summary Heading: Great Service but little in area to eat
Summary: When you arrive it doesn't really look like a "Sheraton", but more like a Motel. The lobby is nice with fish tanks and a lounging area with fireplace and chairs. The hotel is a maze and elevators and stairs are in weird spots. After 6 nights there, the kids still turned the wrong way coming out of the room to get to the elevator! Service was great... the fridge overheated and they were there to replace it in minutes. The ottoman leg broke and they had it fixed by the end of the day. They were also fast with extra blankets when asked.  The resturant is expensive and not alot of cheaper choices for those late night meals after Disney. The kids meals were costly as well, but there weren't alot of other options in the area.  A hotel with a continental breakfast would have been

Summary Heading: This aint like any Sheraton that Ive ever stayed in
Summary: Whe you think of Sheraton, you think of 5* luxury, great service, fine dining restaurants, valet parking and all the trimmings. Thats why this Hotel shouldnt be called a sheraton. For a start, its a MOTEL, not a Hotel. There is very little in the way of service.  When we arrived by taxi, the bell hops ignored us and we had to schlep all our luggage in ourselves (all 100kgs of it). After check in, same story  - no one to help. There are stairs and elevators and floors of varying levels so good luck if you are disbaled or have a lot of luggage like we did.  Our room overlooked the freeway. Nice! Lucky the windows had double glazing.   The pool was pleasant but being Anaheim, there are lots of families and kids running around.   Breakfast was good - I cant comment on other meals at

Summary Heading: Good stay, close enough to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here for 7 nights.  Firstly this hotel is not very close to Disneyland but they offer a free shuttle every half an hour.    Last time, we stayed on Harbor Blvd and when we go back will probably stay around there again. The Sheraton is a good place to stay though.  We found the places to eat at night were limited because of our locality. The restaurants close to Disneyland involved cab rides etc at night if Disneyland was shut and over 7 nights this became a little annoying (and somewhat expensive).  As for the hotel it was fine. The room was a king size bed and large enough but nothing special, very cramped bathroom though (toilet, bath/shower and sink in very small space).  The hotel had a small shop and deli in house. Most things you paid for the convenience factor,

Summary Heading: Fun stay but in desperate need of a makeover
Summary: .  First of all.... we are all huge Disney fans so  to us the entrance to the hotel was magical, the castle like exterior made us feel like we were checking into Fantasyland.  The foyer is large with lots of comfy places to sit and pass time. The check in process was quick and we were off to our room in minutes.  We had a  room on the 1st floor which meant that we had to take the elevator up one floor and then as we exited the elevator we had to walk down a small flight of stairs with our suitcases which was a pain. We watched the bellman struggle  with this a few times..!!l. The room was huge with a window that opened onto a lovely courtyard. .  All in all the Sheraton  Anaheim is a good choice if you can get a cheap rate. Not up to the usual Sheraton standard. It is not

Unlike many receptionists we encountered on our travels, we were always welcomed with a warm smile and helpful advice. The hotel had a great bar and restaurant.  The courtyard and pool area were delightful.  Our room was huge with a very comfortable king size bed.  The bathroom was big, clean with fab complimentary toiletries. We really enjoyed our stay here and it was only a 3 minute drive to  Disneyland and just up the road from a selection of good restaurants.

What a great hotel.  The room was massive and the bathroom ok too.  Do you live in the bathroom??? NO!!!  The hotel was very well kept and the staff extremely friendly. The room was clean and sheets changed daily.  Swimming pool very nice and an abundance of towels.  Laundry facilities which are warmly welcomed because although I was on holiday I still had two more weeks to go and with a 7 year old that spills almost everything he eats it was nice to wash clothing ready for the next part of our trip where there were no washing facilities.  Shopping in the area great and the Outback restaurant only a couple of miles from this hotel on Highway 5.    If you have a car you must visit Huntingdon beach or Newport beach.  What a fantastic location.  We are visiting again soon and will

Summary Heading: a very nice hotel close to disney
Summary: first of all i would like to comment on some of the trip advisor reports about this hotel.one general repeating point made mainly by americans is the size of the bathrooms are small.do these  people camp out in the bathrooms.also crumbs on carpets are another favourite.again mainly americans.are these people forensic scientists or something.im glad i didnt take any notice of these reports because i found the bathrooms fine and the carpets clean.i was impressed by the size of the rooms and they was clean,comfortable and well equipped.the hotel staff were friendly and the hotel stood in very nice surroundings.the shuttle bus to disney was efficient and ran to the timetable ok.the  entrance to disney is approx 10mins on bus.also most of eating places are 10mins by car.you can walk

My fiance' and I stayed here from the 11th of August for 7 nights.  This was our first overseas holiday and thoroughly enjoyed everything that this hotel had to offer.  The room was large and very cosy and the beds were extremely comfortable after a long day at Disneyland.  The buffet breakfast was reasonably priced considering it was all you can eat.  It was great to be able to fill up on a good breakfast before a day of sightseeing.  We also had dinner in the restaurant and found the meals to be quite large and very delicous.  The staff were always too willing to help and very friendly.  We ate many times at the Deli which had a good variety of snack foods as well as some healthy alternatives.  It was also good for a quick breakfast on the run when we didn't have enough time

The room was clean and spacious.  There were a King size bed, a couch, coffee table, end table and 2 chairs. Also plenty of towels and pillows. Like everybody said, the staff were friendly and very helpful. Location is good.  What we didn't like:  The blanket under the comforter was old looking, although we didn't use it because the weather was hot and a top sheet was all we need. There was no shower cap in the room, unfortunately I didn't bring one and didn't bother to call housekeeping since I took a shower at 6am.  I mentioned this on our checking out and was told that we have to ask, they don't suppy shower cap automatically. That was a surpise for a 3 or 4 star hotel. If you are a light sleeper ask for a room away from the freeway. I couldn't sleep well, the noise bothered

Do not be put off by the carpet in this hotel, if they just had it cleaned it would be a wonderful hotel.  That said we travelled 3000 miles on our holiday this year and stayed at very many hotels, this was one of the best for the room and the particularily friendly staff, at reception, in the resturant and the bell hop.  The food in the resturant was very good, in fact we ate here 2/3 nights

We used to stay at this hotel 7 years ago - so we were hesitant about going back . We wondered if it has been updated . However, we were pleasantly surprised by their front desk. The lady helping me was extremely helpful and proactive. She gave me her full attention though I was staying for only a night. My only complaint was that the room assigned to me was at the end of the hotel wings- and it was located just next to a connecting door between 2 hotel wings - the noise from the hotel guests opening and closing the doors can be disturbing at times but we were sound sleepers so it did not bother us too much.   What is extremely useful in this hotel is the Disneyland conceirge stationed in the hotel lobby. She helped me with my dinner reservations at Downtown Disney and also with

We stayed at this property from August 22-25.  The beds and linens are to die for!  Best part of our stay.  Unfortunately we had a room that bordered the freeway entrance so it was very noisy.  The room itself was large and clean but the bathroom needs work - tile, grouting, tub, etc.  The gift shop had a nice deli area for inexpensive snacks and a quick breakfast.  I was very disappointed in the pool area.  The pictures are deceiving on their website as it is quite a bit smaller.  Also there is a deep end in this small pool (9 feet) which is horrible for parents with little kids.  We did nothing but worry about our small ones around that deep area.  If there was a slide or a diving board I could see why it was there but there isnt.  Whoever designed this knowing that its a

We stayed here for a week in August before heading to Las Vegas.  The room was quite large and there was plenty of room for the 3 of us, myself, husband and 13 yr old daughter.  The bathroom is exceptionally small, but it didn't really matter and I preferred to have the extra space in the bedroom.  Housekeeping was very good and it was useful having a fridge in the room.  The buffet breakfast was good value especially as we were given vouchers from Virgin for our daughter to have it free.  We used the restaurant twice in the evening when we were late back and found the food to be very good.  Other times we walked to Down Town Disney which was an easy 10/15 mins, where there were several eating places.  There are no shops nearby, but the garage over the road was useful for

If you're going to Disneyland, this is the place to stay. The complimentary shuttle was reliable and convenient, running every half hour. The rooms are large, newly renovated, though not a soundproof as they could be. The restaurant was great -- good food, good service, similar prices to any higher-end hotel restaurant. The hotel isn't superb, but it is clean, comfortable and extremely conveniently located if your destination is Disneyland.

The Sheraton Anaheim is a great location for your stay in Anaheim.  There was a free shuttle that ran constantly to Disneyland and back.  The ride to Disney was less than 10 minutes. The rooms are comfortable and the bed is divine (Sheraton sleeper bed).  As well there is a nice place to grab a quick and inexpensive light breakfast prior to going to Disneyland for the day. Finally, the fireworks at Disneyland are clearly visible from the hotel parking lot in case you are not in the park. I would certainly stay there again

This was our first taste of Californian hospitality and what a greeting we got! Situated as it is in the shadow of the Disney empire even old uncle Walt himself would be proud of the very high standards at this truly lovely hotel.  Do they send them all to charm school here or what? Everyone from the receptionists the domestic staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. Everything about this place is right: great staff, attractive lobby, nice pool, well-maintained grounds, good restaurant and so the list goes on. We didn't see any problem with middle-aged grumps like ourselves living in the same space as families with energetic children.  Perhaps they apportion rooms with greater care than most other hotels.  This will not be our last taste of this terrific hotel.

This was our third stay at the Sheraton Anaheim (previously visited in 2003 and 2005) so this was our first visit since they had redecorated. Once again we had a pleasant stay. Our room was large enough for our party of four (Mum, Dad, and 2 'kids' in their 20's). We were usually so tired by the time we got to bed that we figured we might as well save the money and have one room as the beds are plenty big enough, and very comfy. The only problem to having 4 to a room was having one bathroom on days you were trying to get out quickly for Disneyland! We didn't find the bathroom too small (seriously, how much time do you really spend in there?!) and were glad of the extra space in the bedroom. We also never had a problem with anything being left dirty.  Usually when we have stayed

We first stayed at this hotel in 1997 on our honeymoon and we were really looking forward to going back with our daughter. It had been such a beautiful hotel, with carpet so thick that you couldn't pull your suitcase along the floor.....I am pretty sure that it is still the same carpet - and it hasn't been cleaned since! The carpets in and around the elevators were absolutely filthy as were the ones in the room.   Each set of sheets that they dressed our beds with had either tears or marks...or both, every day. The bed skirt was dirty and the brown blanket on the bed was very old looking. We slept with just the sheets over us.   The floor in the room had not been vacumed properly when we arrived as there was popcorn under the chairs and on them. The furniture generally was old,

Lovely place to stay with children.  Staff extremely helpful, rooms large with comfy beds and bar staff great! Easy bus to attractions and the best place to watch the fireworks in the carpark, even better than disney itself! I would recommend and would definately stay again Rucky

Summary Heading: Third time at Sheraton Anaheim and still impressed us
Summary: This was our third visit to the Sheraton at Anaheim and we hope to be back .The room we were given was excellent , plenty of space and generally quiet. As most visitors point out the bathrooms are small, however this didn't cause us much of a problem. I must thank Elizabeth for organising our room. The buffet breakfast was better quality than before and good value. The staff on duty in the restaurant for breakfast were excellent, and I would like to give a special mention to Zeke , he was very helpful ,professional and pleasant. We spent 6/7 days here and we find it a good base for the major themeparks. I can only think of positive things to say about the Sheraton during this visit.

We stayed at the Anaheim Sheraton from July 16-20th.  I chose this hotel because it was a Disney "good neighbor" hotel and we  wanted to stay somewhere nice, without the expense of one of the Disney resort properties.  We checked in on Monday evening around 7:00 pm.  The check in was easy and our room was very nice.  It was off to the side of the hotel and not in the main building, but it was fine.  The freeway was actually right at the back of the property and I heard other people complain about the noise from the cars, but we didn't hear anything.  The room was very clean and recently updated and the beds were VERY comfortable!  The bathrooms were smallish, I guess, but after staying in New York city, where the bathrooms are notoriously small, it seemed okay to me.  We had

Good points: great location 5 minutes from Disney & close enough to dip out of the park for a mid-afternoon swim; the free shuttle into Disney (they even put on a 2nd bus at park closing); friendly staff at front desk, bar & deli; on-site Disney ticket sales; huge bedroom (big enough for 2 adults & 2 teenagers); good bedroom amenities; well appointed public areas; warm pool & Jacuzzi; helpful people (they let us park & use the shuttle after we had checked out); cold beer! Poor points: small bathroom; bedroom decor probably ready for updating.  If we visit Disneyland again the Sheraton would be on the list of hotels

I recently returned from a seven night stay at the Sheraton Anaheim.  Despite carrying the Sheraton name, the hotel is average at best.  As with other reviewers, I found the size of the room, two queen-sized beds, quite large.  The carpets are worn and need to be replaced.  The small washroom isn’t really a problem, though it is a tight squeeze.  The beds are comfortable, and the room was clean.  The deli was expensive, just like most places in the Anaheim area.  One morning, I went to buy a banana only to find fruit flies swirling around the "fresh" fruit.  Later that day, there was a fly enjoying itself hopping from one donut to another in an enclosed case.  The front desk staff is efficient and friendly.  Because there is no safe in the guestrooms, I had put my valuables in a

My husband and I stayed here for a week at the end of June, and loved it from beginning to end!!!   Check-in - We choose the hotel for its proximity to Disneyland, and from when you first arrive the outside is so beautifully designed that it really gives you the Disney spirit! The man who checked us in could not have been more friendly or helpful, and immediately gave us an upgrade to a newly decorated suite, which overlooked the beautiful rose gardens.  The whole hotel looked to have been recently renovated, and was pristine.  Any staff we met while staying there were very friendly - I have seen some reviews saying the staff were unfriendly, but that was not our experience by any means.  Room - Our room was MASSIVE! We were told when we checked in that they were the biggets

Summary Heading: Nice Stay - Consistent year after year
Summary: We have stayed at least once per year for the past 8 years at the Anaheim Sheraton.  The reasons we keep coming back are the large rooms, excellent shuttle service to Disneyland, efficient front desk and satisfactory housekeeping.  In general, the staff is friendly and well trained.  Even though there are several families with kids, the hotel is very quiet.  The value is difficult to beat in the Disneyland/Anaheim area.  Upon our mid-afternoon, mid-week arrival, we received prompt bell service and rapid check-in.    On the downside, the hotel restaurant is somewhat high priced for the average guest.  However, the food and service are excellent.  The gift shop has an adequate selection of breakfast items: bagels, muffins (from Costco), doughnuts, cereals, fruit, and beverages.

I was shocked by how bad this hotel was, especially aftre reading so many nice reviews. Here's what didn't work for us: dirty: when we checked in the room had popcorn all over the floor that hadn't been vacuumed, mirror was smeared. HOT!- The air conditioning was set at 76 and didn't go below that. When I called to comlain they said you just had to fiddle with the dial which we did for all 2 days. No matter what you programmed in, it never went below 76 and our slit of a windor overlooking the parking lot/freeway didn't let in much fresh air. The "Deli" was disgusting- old overpriced food. Across the street from Dsineyland?- NOT. Try about 2 miles away (across the street from the Disney employee parking lot. Oh yes the free shuttle was over an hour late at midnight leaving this

We stayed at the Sheraton for 5 nights, Fathers Day week.  We arrived on a Sunday morning.   We tried to check in early.  They had a room available, but because I requested a room facing Disneyland, one of those was not available yet.  This was around 10:30 am.  We decided we would grab a bite to eat in their restaurant before heading off to Disneyland.  Our luggage was conveniently kept in their "closet".  An hour later, after we had eaten, my husband wanted to check back in with the front desk to see if a room happen to become available yet.  Not only was a room available, but the person at the front desk who originally helped us, had already checked us in!   The room was very spacious with beautiful dark wood funiture.  There was even a fridge!  It was clean and inviting.

The hotel itself was very nice.  The lobby was amazing and the rooms were big and clean.  The carpets did need to be cleaned but that was really inconsequential.    We had problems with check in and billing.  My husband is on active duty and we purchased a voucher from the MWR for a reduced rate.  The hotel insisted that we give them our credit card number in case there were extra charges.  We reluctantly did that.  We ended up paying twice for the hotel room; once when we purchased the voucher from the MWR and again when the hotel charged us $115 to our credit card.  So if you purchase a voucher with the military be very careful that you do not get taken over this way.  We are in the process of disputing it now.

Summary Heading: Still needs a bit of tweaking
Summary: We've stayed at this hotel several times in the past, and were pleasantly surprised to see it had undergone a huge remodel since our last visit.  The lobby, bar and restaurant area look great, with lots of comfy seating.  They retained the little nook wiht the fireplace, which is a relatively kid-free and quiet place to sit.  The rooms look much nicer, with nickel finish lamps and new carpets, furniture and linens.  The rooms were always on the large side, with more than enough room for a rollaway for larger families.    Once you start looking closer, it appears they had a set budget for the renovation, and ran out before they completed it.  The bathrooms are still tiny, with the 1980s fussy brass doorknobs still attached.  They didn't even bother putting in the rounded shower

Myself and my girlfriend drove down from San Francisco for a trip to Disneyland. The hotel did not dissapoint. The hotel pictures were accurate and our room was great. We got upgraded to a larger room without even asking!  The room was great, nice and clean with a view of the rose garden away from the freeway. Very close to Disneyland, and they had a free shuttle which ran to there and to downtown Disney all day long.  The restaurant was quite pricy, but compared to the price of food in Disneyland it wasn't that bad at all. Dinner was very good, but their buffet breakfast could have used more items.  But overall a great stay, and I will stay there again next time.

Everytime I go to Disneyland this is the hotel I always stay at. It's right across the street from the park so you know you won't have a long dreading ride thinking only about one thing..a comfortable bed. Which by the way they have! after walking all day all you want to do is relax and these beds are so comfortable. I fall right to sleep as soon as I get into bed. Although the hotel can be quite confusing on getting around, make sure you ask the front desk for directions to your room. It also doesn't hurt to ask if they can do any sort of upgrade, this may work more if you arrive late at night.

My sister and I stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim during Memorial Day weekend for my first visit to Disneyland.  The people at the front desk at the hotel were extremely helpful and very polite.  The particular girl that we came into contact with made us seem like we've known her our entire life.  There is a free shuttle that takes you to Disneyland/Downtown Disney/California Adventure  It was wonderful and it ran every 30 minutes starting 30 minutes prior to the park's opening.  We had a wonderful experience and are returning in August; we will once again be staying at the Sheraton!!!  Job well done!

The hotel website as well as photos shows the lobby, some of the grounds and rooms. All photos were impressive but in reality the rooms were far from what you would expect. The lobby is magnificiant and has an urban New York feel to it. BUT and for us it was a big but (that also included changing rooms 3!! times) the bathrooms were bad! BTW - I never had such a problem before at a hotel nor did I ever asked to change a room (and I travel a lot). While the rooms (all 3 were exactly the same) were big the bathroom was what you would expect MAYBE at a day use motel. The hotel went through a major renevation (and it does shows) BUT I am guessing they ran out of money when the got to the bathroom. They were updated but small. Again, the bath tub was so bad (peeling and with rust)

I recently stayed one night at the Sheraton Anaheim right near DIsneyland.  Arriving at the hotel is a wonderful experience, as it looks like a big castle.  The landscaping and hotel design are really unique and fun--it makes you feel like you are really at Disneyland.  Entering the lobby is also breathtaking, as the lobby is huge and spacious.  There are tons of sitting areas, one centered around the beautiful fireplace.  Off of the lobby there are either 1 or 2 different restaurants, a gift shop, business center, game room, cafe, and a booth for buying park tickets.  Check in was very smooth and quick, however the man who checked me in wasn't overly friendly.  The grounds are absolutely enormous with different wings and courtyards in between.  I loved the pool area which was

The layout of the hotel was confusing. Poor directions from the front desk. The bathroom in the room was so small that it was very difficult to use. The only good thing was the shuttle to DLR & the friendly drivers. Never again!!!!! Will pay more to stay on property or not go at all.

Summary Heading: Good value if you can get a good rate
Summary: We (me, 6yo daughter and a girlfriend) stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim May 10-13. We got a rate of $116 thru Expedia.   My family stayed here a year ago and had a mixed experience. On that trip, we were initially given a horrible room next to the freeway. It was worn and dreary and smelled of cigarette smoke and used cat litter (no joke). Needless to say, we asked for a new room and got a nice unsmelly one away from the freeway. Interestingly, on this recent trip we were given the exact same (second) room! I was very happy.  Overall, our experience last week was excellent. The room was large and always made up on time. The bed linens were comfortable and looked relatively new. And yes - lots of pillows. The shuttle buses between the hotel and Disneyland ran like clockwork and

We stayed six nights at the Sheraton Anaheim.  It was perfect !  The lobby associates were fabulous.   We had two different groups of family members arriving and leaving at different times of the week.  We needed 3 rooms. The staff was able to keep everyone within the same hallway, just steps away from each other.  The rooms are absolutely HUGE.   There were two queen beds and a hide a bed in the sofa area.  With plenty of room for the grandkids-all five- to run around with their pirate swords and princess hats and still enuf comfortable space for the adults - all eight- to stretch out and recoup after the long long days at the parks.  We were also able to witness the fireworks from our room window!  They were awesome on Sat night! I don't know what happened with the floor plans

The beds were so soft that I just wanted to take them home.  ELEVATOR....very relaxing environment....great breakfast at their restaurant.  Very convenient little store inside the hotel.  Great staff makes you feel right at home.  Just down the street from Disneyland.  You could also buy tickets to Disneyland at the hotel.  They also have a nice pool, laundry service, and you can see an amazing view of the fireworks show at Disneyland from your room or outside of the hotel....so close some car alarms went off.

My family and I have stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim before and have always enjoyed ourselves. This time was no exception. The hotel is imaculate and service is superb. The lobby was elegantly decorated for the holidays and the staff was very festive. They have expanded their shop to include a mini-deli serving breakfast, lunch, dinner and snacks. There is a nice game room available with pool tables and video games. Rooms are spacious and well dressed with a fridge, high speed Internet (wireless) and comfy beds.  My family stayed four days and I stayed a week (combined a family trip to Disneyland with business). The location on I-5 is very convenient for work related travel. It's only 20 minutes to Orange County Airport. Disneyland is a must see during the holidays and the

I stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim during a recent business trip. The hotel is located by the highway relatively far for any point of interest. The only truly positive note about this hotel was the size of my room, which was quite large. Everything else was mediocre at best. The bathroom was small, the shower outdated and absolutely no amenities, not even a shower cap. The breakfast buffet left much to be desired, old, dried out scrambled eggs and poor service to boot. If you can afford it, the Anaheim Marriott or the Anaheim Hilton are far better choices.

Summary Heading: Good Place To Stay -But Not All I Expected
Summary: My first review ever! I chose this hotel from its listing on Trip Advisor and Disney's sites as a 4-Star hotel.  Personally, I would not call it a 4-Star nor was it  what I expect of a Sheraton.  We asked and were offered nothing with our Starwood card.  The hotel and our room were clean and some areas including our room looked newer but I thought the decor was in a dated-looking style.   The best things about this hotel were: The Beds - extremely comfortable as mentioned in other reviews - 2 queens provided lots of room (we have 1 tween and 1 younger teen). The Room Size - lots of space for luggage and moving around. Proximity to Disney - hotel's shuttle took about 5 minutes and was always right on time.  Others reviewed that they walked but it looked like you'd be walking

I don't know if the other guests writing this are on an alternate dimension, but we just spent 4 days here and thought the only nice thing about it was the grounds with the koi pond.  The rooms are big, but didn't have ANY amenities (safe, mini-fridge). The coffeemaker was broken. I travel alot and stay at alot of hotels. This is NOT even a 3 star hotel.  The staff was NOT friendly to us or our kids.  The bellhop improperly stacked the cart and our luggage fell off. He just snidely commented that he wasn't the one to put that piece on.  There's only one restaurant. Food is mediocre, but considering price, it's over-rated. The hostess made us wait 45minutes for a table that was empty when we checked in with her.  The worst was the shuttle to Disneyland.  Going is fine, but coming

Summary Heading: Best place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous!  Perfect for singles, couples and families.  The service is outstanding - treated like you were a VIP the entire stay.  The room we stayed in was huge!  King sized bed with a living area that had a couch, easy chair, and coffee tables.  The room was super clean, had fresh, crisp linens, and the bed was extremely comfortable - perfect after a busy day of sight-seeing.  The restaurant served up delicious meals (we tried breakfast and dinner) and wonderful service.  Beautiful patio just off of the restaurant, which allows smoking patrons.    We also visited the lounge, which was extremely busy due to a conference at the hotel.  But, once again the staff were attentive and treated us like VIP's.  Try the cafe/gift shop.  Great service and wide selection

We met up with friends from Spain at this hotel.  Staff was great!  They gave us an EXTRA large room it was HUGE.  There was plenty of seating for when we had our friend over in the evenings.  The bathroom was a bit small for the size of the room.  Room was very clean, had a nice mini fridge too.  Staff was very nice, everyone smiled and said hello.  Property was nice and well maintained.  Not too crowded when we were there.  Pool a bit small for the size of the property.  Room had a great view of the Disneyland fireworks on Sat and Sun nights!  Location is close to Disneyland, within a 10 min walk.  We walked to downtown Disney a few times.  We were so impressed with the property (The courtyards are beautiful with gardens and fountains).  The staff was just awesome!

Summary Heading: Very comfortable, felt almost as good as home
Summary: I stayed at the Sheraton during presidents day weekend. It was very comfortable. The rooms were just like the pictures and the beds were perfect. The service was excellent. They have a very good breakfast buffet for only 12.95 and it was so nice that they provided us with the shuttle service. It was always on time and never late. The hotel was quiet and clean.   See all the pictures and my trip report on my blog.   http://myvacayisbetterthanyours.blogspot.com/  hotel pictures are included.

This hotel is by far the best chain in the country. The appearance, the staff and the room is superior. We had an overnight in Anaheim and the they treated us like VIPs from the start. Very friendly and personal desk clerks as well as everyone who worked there. Our room was spacious, clean and very quiet. The beds are the most comfy ever with down comforters and lots of down pillows, NOT those awful rubber flat ones. I look for Sheraton just for this factor. The bathroom was well stocked with lots of fluffy towels and great toiletries. Nice grounds and easy transportation to and from Disneyland. We had room service that was excellent. We will go back to this hotel anytime we visit  Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel thats been revamped - Good for Disney
Summary: Stayed here as part of our honeymoon after coming from Vegas and Palm Springs.  We had stayed here the previous year, prior to the revamp and its certainly a nice place.  The rooms are still HUGE, apart from a poxy small bathroom, and the beds are really comfy.  Its just a couple of minutes to drive to Disney and there are buses from them hotel but we didn't use them.  The shop is good in the hotel but its V.Expensive along with the bar.  Would recommend it for people going to Disney, but its a bit to far our of the main LA areas like Hollywood, takes about 45 mins in the car.

This was a very nice hotel.  We have stayed at several in the area and this rates at the top of our list.  At check-in, the desk was very helpful.  I was given an upgrade without asking and free parking for 2 cars.  My husband was coming in from LAX to meet us and the girl at the desk was very helpful with giving directions.    The room was huge!  With 2 queen beds, a couch, a chair, coffee table, plus writing desk with tons of floor space to spare.  Also a large closet, coffee maker, an empty and cold refrigerator.  A tiny bathroom though.  The only complaint we had was that noise from the room next to us travelled through the air vents and if you have noisy neighbors, that could be a problem.  The Disneyland shuttle was nice as it only services this hotel.  A very short ride

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you are visiting Disneyland
Summary: We stayed here on Saturday and Sunday. I have to give it an above average rating only because of the great shuttle to Disneyland. They run on the hour and half hour. We parked our car on Sunday morning at Disnyeland and that was a mistake. We should've taken the shuttle.  The shuttle takes 10 minutes.  We didn't have a safe in our room and the closet doors were missing but that wasn't too big of a deal to us. I agree with the other comments posted about the room being large. The bathroom was really small, it was like you opened the door and it barely hit the toilet, to give you an idea of how small it really is. But our room had been remodeled so the furnishings were nice.  Also, the front desk didn't seem too proactive about anticipating our needs. We dressed up our 2 year old
Very large rooms, extremely comfortable beds, quiet (in rooms away from Freeway), excellent shuttle to Disneyland.  Much nicer than the Harbor Blvd. motels, for about the same price.

Summary Heading: A castle wedged between 3 main roads
Summary: A welcome change from the big, international, traditional style Sheraton hotels, Sheraton Anaheim is only 2 levels high of hotel rooms and suites giving it a very boutiquish, family feel.  This warm castle-themed hotel is further complimented with a relatively small lobby with a fireplace and comfortable couches rather than a massive atrium with crystal chandeliers and marble floors.  We stayed at this hotel on 3 Jan 07 to 6 Jan 07 only by chance.  Our original plan was to stay in Anaheim for 3 nights but then extended to 6 nights.  We had already booked our rooms at the Hilton Anaheim, but due to room availability at the Hilton we had to book at another.  The travel agent recommended the Sheraton and gave a quote, we were happy with it.  This hotel is wedged between 3 major

i recently stayed there for two nights with my boyfriend during our 3-day trip to disneyland & california adventure.  we arrived early and were happy to find out that a room was ready for us (and a smoking room at that...its rare to get what we want these days, being smoker outcasts and all.  anyway!)   the decor of the hotel is just generic hotel garb.  the bar could use some upgrade/updating, but the bartender was really sweet.  the best two things were 1) shuttle to disneyland & 2) comfortable beds.  we ordered room service for breakfast which arrived cold.  we also ordered a large pot of coffee which didn't make it either.  i was still charged for it though and it was painful getting the charge removed.  you would think they'd just take the guest's word for it, rather than

We started our 14 day American tour here and with this being our first time to the states we didn't quite know what to expect. We were impressed with the hotel, It was very big and decorated nicely and loved the huge fish tank inside. We were greeted by the freindly reception desk staff, who gave us lots of information and gave us a pool view room which was nice. The room was huge and had two massive beds which were very comfirtable after a long day at Disney. Breakfast was the only dissapointment, the food was average and the staff just ignored everyone - unless you shouted at them that is. The free busses were great and the guys driving us to and from Disney were great - very chatty and helpful and we never waited longer than 10 minutes for one either way. We only had three

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you are visiting Disneyland!
Summary: We booked directly with the starwood hotel website (sheraton is among their hotels), and got the AAA rate.  I asked for an early check-in and late check-out.  We got to the hotel at 8 am, and were pleasantly surprised to have our room ready for us.  We stayed on a third floor room.  The room was large, complete with a bed, and a couch, and frigerator.  Great for kids.  The room was large and clean, and it was very very quiet in the evening.  Their shuttle service to Disney was great and dependable.  The price was great.  I highly recommend families with children to stay here, especially if you are visiting Disneyland.

Summary Heading: What we paid for and less
Summary: My husband and I prefer to stay here 4++ times a year for the proximity to Disneyland.  After our last stay, we put comments in the booking area re: how poorly we were treated at check in.  This time we were treated very well.  However, as Starwood Preferred Guests, we were NOT upgraded nor greeted or treated as such.  The check in staff was much more friendly.  Unfortunately, we were checked into a wing of the hotel that was not being used.  The heat was not turned on and after calling the front desk the second day(thinking it was us), an engineer was sent up to address the problem within 5 minutes.  The room rarely still went above 65 degrees.  Please be aware that the hotel charges an additional 10 a night for parking.  We have NEVER been charged as frequent guests.  We

we got a very good price for the Hotel through Qantas Holidays so I was not really in a position to argue about the room - thus we ended up in one of the older, unrefurbished rooms. It had 2 queen beds and was very large - no fridge.  No entry onto the courtyard, no lounge. The carpet was very tired and worn, the bathroom was quite small. Also they don't have the usual array of toiletries - there wasn't even a shower cap. There was a coffee maker - but powdered milk.  The bed and pillows were very good, great nights sleep. This place is jammed between 2 freeways - so ask for an inner courtyard room. All up probably better to pay a bit a more and get an updated room. The room service was a bit patchy - one day they took the plastic bag out of the bin and just left it on the floor

I booked this hotel for my mother and aunt, and they couldn't say one bad thing about the place. The staff were very friendly, the proximity to Disneyland was great, and the room was nicely appointed, with very comfortable beds. The hotel has a very cool lounge and sitting area in the lobby which made me want to bring a book and hang out.

I was very impressed with the Sheraton Anaheim hotel. My partner and i have just returned from a 13 night stay.   The rooms were huge (admittedly bathrooms are small in comparison but definately adaquate) and nicely decorated - even the rooms which have not been renovated yet were in a good condition. The lobby is very modern and sophisticated, and the grounds are beautiful.  The beds were very comfortable and the cleaning was fine.  The staff at reception (particularly Martha) were friendly and very helpful. We were being quite fussy, wanting a king bed, quiet room etc... but the staff were happy to oblige our many reqests!  I would say that if you are sensitive to noise, the rooms facing the freeway are quite noisy, so try to get an inside garden facing room if you can.   The

We boked the Sheraton after reading the revies on this site.We booked with Getawaytoday.com and when we got to the hotel, they hadn't sent the fax through to the hotel regarding our requests.This didn't make any difference to the check in staff, they were pleasant and efficient and gave us our room key without any difficulties.When we got to the room it faced a brick wall !We spoke to the bell hop who called the front desk and we were then taken to 3 other rooms to see which one we wanted!We choose a room on the ground floor but weren't really happy with it and when we spoke to the front desk & told them we had requested a renovated room on the 3rd floor,we were given the keys within minutes.I can't fault their customer service at all.  FYI-if you want one of the newly renovated

Our party of seven stayed at the sheraton anaheim on the 12th of october.We had adjoining rooms,very spacious and the maids did a great job each day.The staff at this hotel were very pleasant and helpful.The hotel is lovely and as for the beds-very comfotable.We did not eat in the restaurant but used the deli which also was very good.The shuttle to the disneyparks was good and the drivers very friendly.I would certainley rate this hotel as 4 star. The children loved the pool and garden areas.As for the disney fireworks you had agreat view from the car park.I would definately recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Comfortable stay with below average desk staff
Summary: The rooms are very spacious and the beds are super comfortable.  The rooms are clean.  When I made my reservation through Sheraton, I stated that I wanted a non-smoking room and was told that non-smoking rooms were available.  When I checked into the hotel the desk personnel did not bother to look at the non-smoking room request and sent me on my way.  After going to the room and discovering the mistake, I phoned the desk to switch rooms.  My new room was in a the wing of the hotel that faces a busy freeway entrance/exit road.  The road noise was impossible to drown out and it made sleeping difficult.  Bottom line-- ask for a room on the inside portion of whatever wing.

We booked this hotel with disney.com and also booked our disney parkhopper package through it as well. Since we only booked 6 days ahead it said our tickets would be at the hotel....we were a little leery but decided to go ahead with it. When we first walked in the lobby we were more than impressed. The hotel is chic and warm. Its just beautiful. The staff was very helpful and gave us our tickets right away. We were worried that we wouldnt be able to check in because it was 10am in the morning but they had a room cleaned for us right away! We got to the room and it was great! The beds are soo lush and inviting! And we had a floor to ceiling window with a view of their beautiful courtyard. Then we went down to the front of the hotel where the shuttle to disneyland is supposed to

Summary Heading: TRUE Sheraton Quality for a reasonable price!
Summary: I stayed with my grandson 26-29 october and have nothing but praise for this hotel. I have stayed at many hotel all over the world and in all price ranges. This is a TRUE Sheraton with GREAT quality, service and all else one expect from a quality hotel. We stayed in a HUGE room 15feet from the pool for $115 a night. I have nothing but praise for this hotel and would recommend it to ANYone. The pool surface needs updating but that is in the plans to be done soon. The Grounds and public spaces of this hotel are beautiful!

I was really worried about staying here after reading bad reviews but I needn't have been. The Sweet Sleeper beds live up to their name and are extremely comfortable. The staff were helpful and polite and the food was lovely. The rooms are huge with lots of storage space (handy for 3 women!) and the hotel itself was very quiet and peaceful. The Disney shuttle was great and we used it even though we had the car it was so convenient. The only criticism was the fact we had to pay $10 a day to park the car in the hotel grounds. A bit annoying since there was nowhere else to park it. Overall an excellent stay.

Summary Heading: Trip Advisor was right -- great place to stay
Summary: I used Trip Advisor to guide our selection of hotels since a lot of the ones near Disneyland don't fare so well in the reviews. I'm glad I did -- the Sheraton Anaheim was an excellent choice. I strongly recomend it, particuarly for families doing Disneyland.  Positives: Nice/clean rooms, comfortable beds, VERY courteous staff, nice lobby area, frequent buses to Disneyland that were always on time and always had enogh capacity (for example they sent two buses when the park closed anticipating that there would be more people coming back). My wife agrees with me that this was a good choice.  Negatives: The pool needs some work. Also, they're a little uptight about kids making a little noise by the pool (our kids were not that loud at all and the general manager came over to make a

Stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim Aug. 29 - Sept. 1st.  I was a little worried about some of the reviews on this site, but I assume they were pre completion of the renovations.  We stayed in a two queen bed room overlooking the pool on the third floor.  I did move down to ground level 2nd day just to be closer to the lobby, pool and have a walk out to a private and quiet garden area.  Both rooms were very similar and newely renovated.  The first room also had a refrig. that was empty, but the deli on site is open from 5am to midnight so we really did not need to keep anything cold.  I preferred the ground floor room.  I did not hear any freeway noise in either room nor did we have any problems with the air conditioning system.  We were able to set temp. It was quite hot outside and

This hotel ranked 4th out of 5 hotels my wife and I stayed at during our honeymoon week in the US. The hotel is pleasant, but three incidents with Front Desk left me unimpressed, especially given that this is a Sheraton. 1)On arrival, the evening clerk ran through her routine with “a smile in her voice”, but it was voice only.  Not once did she ever really smile, and she rarely made eye contact with us. 2)The room was nice (excessively large, though, with the smallest of bathrooms), so we called Front Desk to extend our stay by one day.  The clerk didn’t tell us to come by and get new keys.  Instead, we walked all the way back to our room to find the keys didn’t work, then had to walk all the way back out to get new keys.  No apologies from the staff. (In comparison, the clerk

This was part 3 of our road trip.  We stayed in the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel for 4 nights.  We were advised by our travel agent to stay here in order to explore LA, but I would say that it is a little too close to Disney and far away from the many other attractions of LA to be as useful to us as we had hoped. We had visited Florida to do Disney etc in November 2004 so we were more interested in seeing other attractions in LA than Disney, but were perhaps a little further out than we needed to be.  The rooms were spacious, clean and very comfortable.  The restaurant which we used once for breakfast and once for dinner was lovely and service was friendly, prompt and courteous.  The small shop was very handy for bits and pieces.  The grounds were pretty and well maintained.  The pool

Summary Heading: Best hotel I ever stayed in
Summary: We just returned from the Sheraton Anaheim and I can honestly say that I have never had a more pleasant stay away from home ever.  We booked two ajoining rooms and they were HUGE!  The beds were comfortable and just what I needed after a day at Disneyland.  The shuttle was great and dropped us off close to the bag check at Disneyland.    We only did the breakfast buffet at the restraunt and it was good.  Staff was friendly but the room was the best part.   I highly recommend this hotel.

Summary Heading: Excellent place to stay for a visit to Disney
Summary: The hotel recently went through a renovation and it is quite nice and elegant. There is a deli store that acts as a convenience store within the hotel, a nice bar, a great resturaunt that serves the most wonderful breakfast buffet at a decent price (we had breakfast and lunch there), a great gameroom for the kids complete with real arcade games, a beautiful salt-water aquarium in the lobby section, lots of comfortable seating areas with a large 24 hour burning fireplace. The hotel is very much done in the Sheraton-Westin style in colors of rich creams, browns and dark cherry wood. The courtyard is relaxing and pretty to look at with a koi pond. The rooms are graciously appointed and roomy with a refrigerator, with its renown "heavenly beds". A free Disney shuttle runs every 30

When I was planning our Disneyland trip for the last week of June 2006 I looked at several hotels in the Disneyland area. I just couldn't decide where I wanted to stay this time. We ususally stay somewhere different each time. I am so glad I chose the Sheraton. There were some mixed reviews but I honestly can't imagine why. This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at. Almost always I find something to complain about in every room I stay in (my family thinks I'm too picky). But when you are spending a decent amount of money on your vacation you should get what you pay for. Even before we left, I decided to add a night at the beginning of my stay and I noticed online that the price had dropped by about $20 a night, the manager was agreeable to give me the lower rate for

What a fantastic hotel.  My family and i stayed here at the end of our big USA road trip.  The rooms are very nice and the beds are so comfortable.  We really enjoyed the pool area with the spa.  I must say that the hotel staff we exceptional.  My mother got sick on the last day of our stay and the hotel staff called a doctor to make a hotel call, they also allowed her to stay in our hotel room after we had checked out.  As we were visiting Disneyland everyday we found the hotel shuttle very handy and reliable.  We ate breakfast every morning in the hotel restaurant and can i say you must have the pancakes they are beautiful!!!!!.  Overall this was one of best hotels i've stayed in and i've travelled half the world and stayed in too many hotels to count.

I was not sure what my stay was going to be like after reading other reviews. As a starwoods guest I cashed in my points and stayed here. Better than expected! The place was under construction but the staff was impressive. The morning breakfast brunch was great. Best part, the shuttle ran like clock work to Disneyland. I would definetly stay again.

Summary Heading: Room O.K., Poor staff, under renovation
Summary: My family stayed here for 7 nights in May 06. We checked in and overall the room was a good size and contained 2 Queen beds (I think the only 2 Queen bed rooms in the Disney area), although the bathroom is very small. The hotel is under renovation, primarily the front entrance and foyer, which while not nice was O.K. The killer for this hotel is the staff. They just do not care. We particularly had a incident where my wife wanted to access our passports etc which were in the hotel safe, in our 'personal' locked box. The staff member handed over our box, which when opened contained nothing!!, the good news is that it was the wrong box and our items where fine. However it does not excuse the mistake, or the access we had to another box (which may have contained someone else's

My family of 5 adults arrived at the Sheraton on 1st May. Our initial response to the hotel was good, although there was a lot of remodelling going on and mess everywhere.  We where given keys and I was surprised at the size of each room.  Our room faced a major highway and also the construction site at the front of the hotel.  The noise was bad so I went to the desk and requested other rooms away from the noise.  They obliged with no problem and our rooms now overlooked the pool area, which was much quieter.  The rooms where large and the beds where very comfortable.  The bathrooms where dated but very clean.  The pool area was wonderful, we spent a lot of time there and in the spa. The little convenience shop was expensive but handy for items we had forgotten to pack. The

My friend and I travel frequently to Disney and trade-off picking our hotel for the trip. This time it was her choice and she decided to try something new. After staying there, we both decided...NEVER AGAIN!  It started with check-in. We arrived a few hours after check-in time and even though the hotel and staff did not appear busy, it took some time to actually check-in. When we got to our room it was actually dirty, but I'll spare you the icky details of what we actually found in the room. The staff knows nothing of customer service as they tried to be funny about the whole thing instead of at least attempting to be sincerely apologetic.  We also had mysterious charges on our bill and during our attempt to rectify the situation we were treated as if we were trying to scam the

I must say that I was VERY apprehensive about staying here after reading some of the previous reviews on Tripadvisor.  We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of this hotel!  They are going through some renovations, but none of that was inconvenient to our stay.  Our room was far from the front desk, n the third floor facing the inner courtyard.  We all slept very well each night.  The sheets and the pillowtop mattress were comfy.  They even had a feather duvet, which was oh so comforting after a day at Disney.  Each room has an individualized climate control, which is new.  Everything in the room was clean and new, decorated very nicely.  The shuttle bus to the park was very convenient, runs every half hour!  We never waited longer than 15 minutes for the bus!  A great

We have stayed at this property many times before however it has certainly lost its appeal & is definately not of Sheraton standard.   The carpets were grubby, the pool was so bad we didn't even venture into it & our bathroom was missing a few vital things ie plugs, which took 2 days to replace.   More concerning was when i approached reception about the state of the pool the girl said i ' don't go out there never seen it' so I suggested she might now need to take a look at it then to which she replied 'maybe later & anyway it has a ceritficate from Orange County who inspect all hotel pools' I then asked to see ithe certificate but suprise suprise she didnt know where it was. She then said  'the hotel had just been taken over & was undergoing restoration' when i asked why didnt

We stayed here in April for three nights at the end of our 'king of the road' tour. It was the most dissapointing hotel of the seven on the tour. The hotel is undergoing massive refurbishment so the main entrance is closed and lobby tatty. Our first room in the north tower was a dark shabby motel room overlooking the freeway. We complained and moved to a pool view room which was like a different hotel from the north tower. The hotel is next to Disney and if you are visiting here then it maybe OK, but we wanted to see the beaches/ LA so a long drive anywhere. There are also no restaurants within walking distance. When I asked the concierge for a good restaurant nearby she sent us to Downtown Disney (are they paid for that?!)-  a nightmare of chain restaurants with queues! We

My husband and I stayed here 3 nights with our 9 year old nephew in mid-April.  Overall, it was a nice hotel and a good value.  It is still under construction in the main building and some of the wings, but that was little bother to us, other than the parking lot area being considerably reduced in size.  As another reviewer mentioned, this is definitely not a new and swanky hotel, but neither is it dirty or run-down ... just sort of average I'd say.  The bathrooms are small and older-style, where the sink, toilet, and tub are all in one little area so two people cannot be getting ready at once.  But still clean and neat.  The beds were very comfortable with cushy comforters and pillows.  We ate in the restaurant one evening and had excellent meals; not inexpensive but not too

Don't let teh cutsey castle theme fool you this is one bad hotel.  At check in we were given what sounded like a nice room with direct access to the pool on the ground floor.  The room itself was dirty and had a musty smell but that was only the beginning. The wing we were staying in was being renovated which ment that the coridoor carpets were covered with plastic sheeting not wonderful but OK we thought.  At 6am however we were woken by heavy duty industrial noise comming from the adjacent room and a strong chemical odour.  On fully opening the curtains we found that beneath the peeling wallpaper ants were crawling through the window frame and into our room!    The hotel staff were not wonderfully helpful and even told us that we could not walk directly to Disneyland which was

Six nights spent at the hotel. Room large enough, beds were very comfortable but room had interconnecting doors on both sides. This meant that whatever time your neighbours went to sleep/woke up then so did you due to the noise.  Current building work not too intrusive.  Staff very average, pool very average and restaurant very average.  Shuttle bus useful and efficient.  Buffet breakfast not good value for money. Overpriced, little choice and no variation from day to day whatsoever.  Overall a very average hotel.

Before my most recent visit, I had stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim numerous times, spanning back to the 1980s.  I had always found the service and the facilities to be very nice.  This time, however, I had numerous complaints.    First, right off the bat I was checked into a room that wasn't made up.  There really was no excuse for this to happen. I arrived early but not too early (5 pm, not 1 pm when you would expect lots of rooms to be unmade still) or late (like say, 9 pm or after when few rooms remain). In addition, the front desk wasn't even busy at the time; I was the only guest checking in so the desk wasn't overwhelmed or hurried. Anyway, I called down and the front desk had a bellhop run up a new set of keys to a new room but the bellhop didn't apologize when he gave me

My first impression of the hotel was disappointment. We were booked in for 6 nights at the end of our holiday which also took in the sights of San Francisco and Vegas.  There is some upgrading work in progress so the front of the hotel was under scaffolding and some of the facilities were not available e.g. the snack bar.  The location also felt very isolated and desolate in the middle of a freeway.  We had just arrived from Vegas so I guess anywhere would have felt quiet!  However, after some bad first impressions, the place did improve.  We were given a large standard room with a side view of the pool (room 3155).  The decor was fresh and modern and the beds were extremely comfortable (a Sheraton selling point apparently).    We did not have a rental car so set off on foot to

Summary Heading: Spacious Room for Family and Convenient Shuttle to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel for 3 nights for a family vacation Disneyland.  The staff was courteous and the room we got was spacious and quiet.  The hotel is a little older, but we got a really good price through a corporate discount.  The shuttle to Disneyland ran every half hour and it only took 5 minutes to get there.  We would stay at this hotel again next time to Disneyland.

We read the reviews already provided about this hotel before our recent stay there and were quite apprehensive to say the least. Our worries were a waste of time, yes there was a refurbishment going on, however the staff were fabulous, I had a tooth ache one evening and the shop was temporarily closed (due to refurbishment) the staff could not have been more helpful - tablets were with me within 5 minutes no charge. The room was really spacious and very clean - beds awesome! Yes the hotel is on a busy highway as are most of the hotels in Anaheim, however the shuttle bus is reliable and if you fancy a nice walk it took my husband and I only 15 minutes to walk to the Disney Parks. Also not forgetting the hotel manager bought my husband and I a cocktail at the bar one evening!

Summary Heading: old hotel, not worth the money
Summary: We went on Nov.2006 as a family, i guess we got one of their old room. I thought sheraton is a pretty descent hotel, but was suprised by the gross carpet and odor in the room. The a/c was out.  we had requested a new remodeled room but they were out at that time, we reserved it for two nights and couldn't wait to get out of their. bottom line, if you get one of the old room is worst than staying in a motel. At the end of check out they suprised us with parking fees... i would never stay there again.

First things first this hotel is a very LONG walk from Disneyland.  Lucky for us they had a shuttle.  We did not get a room that looked anything like the picture. As we walked the halls we did notice that they did have nicer rooms, just did not give us one.  If you stay here make sure you ask for a newer room.  The heater did not work, or should I say they do not let you control it yourself.  We froze all night and had to get a space heater from the front desk just to stay warm.  The 2nd night I asked to be moved and recieved no help from the clerk.  I would never stay here again!!!!

Summary Heading: Great hotel but don't let the nose put you off
Summary: We stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim and found the hotel a great place to stay, the only problems, as has been mentioned is the proximity to the freeway which can be noisy at times. You may want to request a room away from the freeway due to the noise.  The room was very clean and spacious.   The shuttle service was prompt and friendly and ran every half hour.   I would definetly stay at this hotel again.

I stayed at this property last May and I was really surprised by all the negative feedback about the Sheraton...I just came back from a 6 night stay there again (3/11-3/17) and I never encountered any problems at all...In fact, they couldnt do enough for us. my room was fabulous, just as it was before, anytime day or night that we needed anything they were ready to accomodate us..there is nothing wrong with this property, it is very clean and the grounds are beautiful..housekeeping is there with anything you need within minutes of your request.. the shuttles run on the 15 and 45 right on queue..beds are so soft and comfortable...people are respectful...I had a newly remodeled poolside room and never had anybody bother me...all new furniture, new carpet and a fridge came with the

Summary Heading: Great Experience at the Sheraton Anaheim!
Summary: My family and I just returned from a wonderful five night stay at the Sheraton Anaheim. We received a newly renovated room facing a beautiful courtyard, the room was very clean and quiet. The hotel is under renovation, so if you get an old room you may not have the same experience we did. Also, you may want to request a room away from the freeway due to the noise. The pool is very average, so if your planning on spending a lot of time at the pool this may not be the right hotel for you. The shuttle service was promt and friendly, running every half hour. I would definetly stay at this hotel again especially after the renovation is complete.

I'm sure this hotel does their best and the staff seemed nice and the rooms were clean enough.   BUT we cannot get over the bad location. The freeway noise continued all night, you could hear it and feel it. We dreaded our sleepless nights and were tired and cranky in the morning at the parks.  Next time we will spend the extra to stay at one of the Disney hotels inside the park near the restuarants and fun etc. Forget the shuttles and traffic and garbage trucks etc etc.  We need more magic!

We stayed here for 5 nights during a 21 night tour of California and thought the hotel was excellent. Our room was huge, clean & comfortable and the amenities were great. Liked the laundry facilities being near the pool- meant you could swim & see when the washing was ready to put in the drier!!  The shuttle to Disney was great and seemed to operate whenever it was needed, not just sticking to the timetable when it was busy.  We stayed in a good few hotels during this trip & the Sheraton Anaheim was one of the best & one we would have no hesitation in recommending or visiting again.

We attended a convention at the Anaheim Sheraton the first week of March. The property was completely surrounded by freeways so the rumble of high speed traffic permeated everything, also you can forget about walking anywhere. Once at the Hotel you are pretty much stuck eating at their high priced resturant unless you want to drive for miles to find an alternative. The first night we had to call the front desk as the shower/tub were plugged up with something ugly and would not drain at all. One of the room lights had an apparent short and snappped, crackled and came on and off like a strobe light until management replaced it.  The hotel was an older property and under what appears to be constant reconstruction. In fact we had to enter the lobby from a side enterance as the font

I just stayed at the hotel for one night.  It was a business trip and arrived late and left early.  There is a substantial renovation going on which should help greatly.  I was given a newly renovated room which was huge, well decorated and immaculate. If you can get one of these, you will be absolutely delighted.  Not sure what your experience would be in an old room and the parts of the hotel that are somewhat dated--the gym was terrible The hotel is right on the border of disneyland--so convenient for folks going there on vacation...taxi driver said properties on disneyland itself are extremely expensive

Excellent Hotel. all staff were brilliant - couldn't be more helpful. Concierge, desk staff, janitor, room service and shuttle driver all brilliant. Location a little isolated by the busy roads on all sides. The free shuttle to Disney was well used, efficient and reliable. Great place to watch the fireworks over at Disney. Best view being just outside reception. Beds were amazing - best we have ever slept in. We'll be back one day

Summary Heading: Think Twice before staying at this hotel.
Summary: After arriving in Anaheim from Australia we were definitely looking forward to a comfortable bed and a warm welcome.  Think again about the welcome!  The staff on the front desk obviously do not enjoy nor value their job.  The girl that checked us in was not directly rude but her oficious manner and lack of courtesy was most unpleasant.   We were given our room and treked down a long hallway to it.  Imagine our surprise when we walked inside to a reasonably small room (there were 5 of us including two teenagers) to find only 2 double beds.  The main problem was that out of our tiny window was a huge freeway.  The noise was really loud. (Avoid a FREEWAY room at all costs) We treked back to the reception to the same girl and she told us there was only one room available that we

We stayed at the Sheraton in November.  We had stayed on previous visits at cheap hotels, which were ok for the price, and expected our experience to be even better at a hotel that is supposedly "superior".  First, I was a bit surprised at the $10/day parking charge- seemed a little high to me, even for a superior hotel.  Our room was nicely decorated and had a back door that opened to the pool area.  Bathroom was less than desireable and the shower wouldn't drain quick enough to keep from filling the tub, but we were satisfied with the size and location of our room.  My husband awoke the next morning with a nasty rash on his arms and torso- we still don't know for sure what it was, but it came on the morning after we checked in.  We awoke at 3 in the morning to a couple of

I am a Starwood Prefered Guest member, who trust Sheraton name at anytime we traveling around the globe. We stayed for 3 nights with kids and friends. However, this Sheraton is only have a nice look from outside, and the garden. The room is quite big, but old. The hallway carpet is yucky. Have no fridge, and this is the first time, I have found that the Sheraton Hotel asking additional fee for its standard fridge. In addition, it has No Free Wireless Internet in the lobby, as Sheraton usually provided. I usually like Sheraton, but should no improvement of room and services of this hotel, I dont think I want to stay here next time.

I visited the Sheraton with my boyfriend in the September 2005, as part of a multi trip holiday. i found the staff to be very helpfull as when the air conditioning in my room was not working right i notified reception where they sent an engineer straight away who deal with the problem right away!  The hotel room was basic and very close to a main highway, which at first was a little noisy but we soon got use to it.  The hotel is in a good location for access to the highways near and is very close to Disneyland, where a shutlle runs between hotel and park, and always ran on time.  The restaurant in the hotel is pricey but the food is very good. The swimming pool looked nice and was quiet although i did not swim in it.

We have taken a trip to southern California/Disneyland every year for the past 7 years and have stayed at some fantastic hotels. I read some great reviews on other web sites about the Sheraton and thought that we would give it a try. Unfortunately it was a huge disappointment for us.  The first room we were put in was right next to their construction zone.  We knew that with three kids, this would not be a good thing.  They told us at the front desk that the construction doesn't start until about 6am (Too early for us!).  We were moved to a second room. The first thing we noticed was that someone seemed to have been there just moments before.  Turns out there were some plumbing issues in the room next door and  the bathroom in this room was the back up. The room was large, but
We got a newly renovated room, so it looked brand new.  The hotel has a shuttle bus to disney and we had no troubles catching it.

Well, I have always read reviews on tripadviser and wondered how there can be so much discrepency at hotels and usually side with the ones that give a good review at hotels where I have stayed.
