I read reviews for this hotel and saw the wide variety of things but decided to stay here mainly because it was close to where I needed to be.  My main complaint was with the room.  At first glance I thought it was a nice large room, but after a closer look, I found it to be very shabby and dirty.  The counch in the room was so disgusting I would not even sit on it.  It had holes where it was worn and stains that were really bad.  The bathroom was about the smallest bathroom I have ever seen.  The worst part about our stay is that when we got up the next morning (early thanks to all of

We stayed here between Chritmas and New Year last year for 3 nights.  The hotel is close to Disney and regular shuttle buses run between the two.  The room was quite large and the beds were amazing - could have stayed in there forever!  Room heating hard to control and quite a long walk to the rooms.  Breakfast was brilliant and eveyone at the hotel was polite.  Would stay again and recommend it.

Summary Heading: Hotel and service range from excellent to terrible
Summary: The four of us (2 children) recently stayed in this hotel for two weekend nights.   We were allowed early check-in.  Upon arrival in our room, we were amazed over the size of it. It was probably 400-500 square feet, excluding the bathroom; however, it had not yet been remodeled and the carpet was full of large dark stains, especially around the seating area with two large, older stained couches.  Yuck. O.K. if you're in a $20.00 ghetto hotel.  The deluxe comfy linens on the two queens were standard in all rooms.  I say either clean the darn carpet and sofas until the room is renovated or don't rent out the rooms.  The room looked like some dumpy efficiency unit, rather than the consistently good room that you'd expect from the Sheraton chain. The room also reeked of paint from

Stayed 5 nights at the Sheraton during a tour round California.  Hotel was excellent.  Room was huge and the beds were very comfortable.  Bathroom was fine and the shower was top notch.  As others have mentioned the only problem was with the heating which you can't control but luckly we didn't really need it.  Shuttle to Disney runs every 30 minutes and was really usefull.  Would stay here again

The Sheraton Anaheim has gotta be one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in...We stayed for 5 nights at the end of September 2005.The room was amazingly big...the bed was the comfiest and BIGGEST! ive ever seen,everything seemed very clean and had no problems with the room whatsoever..they also had a nintendo gamecube in the room but only prob was there was only one controller and you had to pay to play it..the bathroom was small but adequate enough,gotta say the grounds were really nice but it was quite easy to get lost in them they were that big!the Deli was quite nice,gift shop tended to be a little expensive though.Restaurant was ok but there wasnt really much choice on the menu in my opinion and it was also a little on the expensive side,the only drawbacks about this

We stayed at the Sheraton again for one night last weekend (my second time there). The first time (3 years ago), it was fine.  This time, though... I had reserved a room far in advance, called ahead the morning of arrival, and even so, they had no king bed rooms left when we arrived at 4 pm.   They first put us in a twin bedded handicapped access room by mistake.  When we called from that room to ask if this was a mistake, they moved us to another room in the block of (older) rooms disconnected from the main section of rooms.  The room needed refurbishing. Some of the lights didn't work, old furnishings, etc.  Also, the room doors make a very loud banging noise, which you can hear when people leave the rooms around you--this woke us up about 6 am in the morning, as did the kids

We stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim for five nights between November 3rd and 7th, from the moment we arrived it was a disapointment, after arriving from lax battling with our suitcases not a porter in sight, bit strange we thought for a Sheraton Hotel.We then checked in and asked for a King bed room, not available, only queen, strange we booked this hotel 8 months prior, but we had been upgraded, gee when I saw the room, if this is a delux I would hate to see the standard room, the bathroom was terrible, small old and the most uncomfortable bath I have ever been in, and the room although ok in size was bland and boring.The room was also a long long way from the elevators, again with no porter help in sight. The next problem was when I wanted some laundry done and rang the

We have just arrived home after a tour of California and surrounding areas and we stayed the last five nights at the Sheriton Anaheim. It is a lovely friendly hotel with fabulous rooms which are huge and spotlessly clean,we had the most comfortable beds and pillows and the linen was changed every day. My only critisism is that the bathrooms were a bit small compared to the size of the rooms, but they were spotlessly cleaned every day. The pool and surrounding area was lovely and had a launderette tucked away near the pool so you can do your washing whilst sunbathing or swimming, it only cost $1 per machine and driers the same price.The hotel lobby was very impressive with a lovely roaring fire and lovely couches to relax in with a nice drink after a hard day at Disney which was

The Sheraton in Anaheim is a real gem. The staff is terrific - assistance with anything and everything was friendly and timely. The rooms are really big and the beds are top notch. The hotel also provides a free shuttle to Disneyland every half hour. I plan on returning to the Sheraton Anaheim very soon!

We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights in early august on our San francisco/LA/Las vegas driving holiday,our stay got off to a poor start as we were allocated a room in the north tower an annexe type building tagged on to the main body of the hotel & facing the interstate 5 we complained to the rather sullen female behind the desk who said the hotel was full, i get the feeling that most new arrivals are palmed off into the north tower hoping they wont complain our 2nd room was much better but was right next to the staff service elevator & the clunking noise was unbearable,so we asked for another room this time it was 3rd time lucky.  Other than that minor blip at the start we cant really fault the hotel rooms & lobby area superb,pool ok,garden grill ok although i think the

The hotel seemed to look nice however when we arrived the employees at the front desk were all upset at their own Manager.  This hotel seems to have some major issues at the front desk an no one seems to care.  This was our second trip to the Sheraton and will never return again.  The Management at this hotel is a disgrace to the Sheraton Family and to the community they represent.  The rooms are old and moldy as well.  The a/c is only controlled by the hotel and they really do not care about your personal comfort level.

This hotel was amazing! there are koi ponds all over the place with a beautiful garden setting. The courtyard is beautiful and it is soooo quiet to just sit and relax. The adjacent bar is a very nice addition, it is very calm and relaxing, as well. The lobby is very large and also very nice.  The rooms are very accomodating and this hotel is perfect for a family, with children, etc. or even an old couple just looking to relax. Disneyland is like a minute away and the hotel even has shuttle service. Muy excelente!

Summary Heading: Above Average - If I was Larry, I'd be happy
Summary: Stayed here for 4 nights on my honeymoon (was travelling a lot during the honeymoon). Staff were very good and even upgraded us to a suite which was big! The bathroom was a little small though.  Good shop, deli and pool.  Liked the restaurant and nice friendly bar guy.  Don't order a pizza from Papa John's who deliver - it took them over an hour!  Worth going to the block @ orange shopping mall - takes only about 15 mins to get there and has great shops 'n restaurants.  I would stay here again.

We, (family of 4 adults) stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim for 5 nights 2 - 6 September 2005. Wonderful large room, great service, good location for Disney, decent food but a little repetitive, comfiest beds in any hotel we have stayed at, (we know now why so many other reviewers have mentioned them).  We did not have a hire car but no problem for Disney as the hotel runs a very reliable shuttle service. We also hired a cab to Knotts Berry Farm for approx $25 each way.   Not the best location for restaurants but we did walk to a Carrows about 15 mins away on South Harbour Boulevard which was good. However there are plenty of options for eating at Downtown Disney or just outside the parks main gates.  We bought passes for the parks in the hotel. Rates compare favourably with those

We got the oversized room from the internet (at a good price), which shows a lavish entryway with fireplace, coy pond, etc., but never shows the rooms.  We got into this oversized room, and the price was apparent: the floor was stained, the beds were broken and slanted, and the furniture was horrible to even look at much less sit in.  The next door neighbors stayed up till 3am, baby crying and all, so needless to say we got no sleep.  The next day was more of the same, so I asked for a new room.  All they had was the rooms by the highway, but at this point I didn't care.  This new room, much smaller, was cleaner and much more appealing to the eye.  The rest of the stay went without a hitch.  The hotel courtesy shuttle is a nice feature that we did use.  The hotel uses central

This hotel is nicer than i expected it to be... Very nice staff check in was easy and quick. The room we had was in the tower on the 4th floor was quite nice, a bath and shower which was nice as i do like my baths! Two big beds which are the best beds i have every slept in currently trying to buy one over here now!! The best nights sleep for ages.   The restuarant was very nice although you would not want to eat there every night as the menu would get a little boring. The breakfast was nice $13.99 each for a buffet quite filling too good start for the day.  There is a games room, did not use it but looked in loads of things in there air hockey, pool and arcade games.  There is a deli does sandwiches teas, coffee etc looked nice but again did not use it. And the shop, usual

my friend and i stayed at the sheraton anaheim for one night in august  i go to disneyland a lot, and had never stayed there before, but it seemed reasonable, so i booked it  for years my family stayed at paradise pier hotel, formerly the fabulous pan pacific, next to disneyland hotel, but their prices have gotten so high and it has become noisy and hectic since disney took it over, so i have been trying out different places  the location of sheraton anaheim is good in proximity to disneyland, and the free shuttle to disneyland a great service - the last place i stayed offered directions to the shuttle stop down the street ($3/day)  staff on check in was amiable, and we enjoyed getting a drink and sitting on the patio after we arrived - very pleasant environment  when we got to

Convenient parking, very nice lobby area with adjacent restaurant/bar.  Great service at check-in, very helpful.  I asked about a restaurant and they offered to go look it up - so willing to help above and beyond.    I was pleasantly surprised when I walked in my room - it was huge!  I haven't seen a hotel room that large in a long time.  Some parts of the room were showing age - the light fixtures on either side of the bed were worn out and hanging like they were about to fall.    The bed was wonderful, the bathroom was small but nice.  I had plenty of places to sit down and relax.  My room overlooked the pool, but I didn't find it to be noisy at all.    My one major disappointment was the air conditioning system (or lack thereof) mentioned in previous posts.  There is a note

I booked this trip through the Disney Travel Co.     We arrived around noon and the desk lady gave us early check in. She upgraded us for free to a pool veiw room 2nd floor. When we went to our room people things were still there. She appologized and promptly moved us to another poolside room ground floor. I have to admit I liked the first rooms decor better. Our room was very nice though, roomy and tastefully decorated.     That day we played in the pool, it was a bit cramped but very popular with Japanese and European tourists.    In the evening we took the free tram to Disneyland. The tram runs evey half hour but I warn you to TRY TO CRAM ONTO THE BUS ASAP! There is no standing alowd; if the bus is full you will be left behind till the next half hour. I felt bad for several

Summary Heading: Another jewel in the Starwood Crown
Summary: We just got back from two days at Disney and two nights at the Anaheim Sheraton. Before booking there, I came to this site to read the reviews and was scared to death that, because we were going to be checking in late, we were going to end up in the dreaded (insert twilight zone theme music here) TOWER! But, being a Starwood Preferred Guest member, I decided to risk my family's happiness and comfort for the starpoints.  Well, we ended up on the first floor instead. The room was HUGE. Wish our room was this big at the Westin Maui! The beds were comfortable, the shower was very nice and the air conditioning (even though the outside temperature was about 100 degrees during our stay) was adequate. What made this hotel stand out from most others (except other Starwood properties) was

Summary Heading: Loved it but not the security.....
Summary: After driving down from northern California, in the middle of August 2005, we were pretty tired, however we were greeted by the very nice people at the front desk who gave us our key to our extremely spacious room.  We had two queen beds and more than plenty of room to move around.  The room was very clean and fairly contemporary.  The duvet covers looked brand new and the beds with all their pillows made you just want to jump in!  We were on the bottom floor (which I don't normally like--for security reasons).  The one complaint we had was that the doors leading to the outdoors from the general hallways were not able to be locked.  The door through which we entered (from the parking lot) didn't even have a handle on it!  There was a placard there, however, telling guests to use

We arrived late at night and were assigned a room at "the tower".    The air conditioning in that building wasn't working and we were told it would be fixed by the following day.  It was too late and we were exhausted so we stayed there that night with the promise from the front desk that the next day we would be moved to a room in the main building.  The staff is helpful and polite and for our discomfort we were given a $25 gift certificate, which we used in their restaurant for lunch days later.     Lunch was good and the servers very polite and informative about things to do and see in the area.   Huntington beach is very close to Disneyland, about 10 minutes, nice place, you see it on the KTLA news a lot.    There is another beach very close but I forgot the name. The

Summary Heading: If we ever go back to Anaeheim, we would certainly return.
Summary: We stayed at the Sheraton during Aug 2005 and loved it.     I've stayed in many hotels wordlwide and this one is one of the best I've stayed in for:  Staff; Service; Concierge; Location.  Rooms are a little dated but generously proportioned and comfortable.  two double beds in standard rooms.  Aircon is a little dated too - but adequate to make you comfortable.  Shuttle bus to Disney every thirty minutes was excellent.  Staff in bar and other areas of the hotel very warm and friendly and eager to please.  No complaints at all in that department.  Grounds and features are lovely.  Some lovely quiet spots for reading or enjoying the sunshine.  Very nicely tended grounds and surrounding area.  I guess the hotel could use some refusrbishment in some areas and is starting to look and

My husband and I have stayed at this hotel twice now and have thoroughly enjoyed it both times.  The purpose of our stays have always been DISNEYLAND so found this hotel perfect for location.   The staff are always friendly, the rooms are huge and very tidy, the restaurant serves good food.  What else can you ask for?   Our purpose is served and our needs catered for!  Thank you very much!  We will be back!

We recently stayed at this Sheraton from 7/21 to 7/27.  We arrived at the hotel early and fortunately our room was ready.  We had room 2222.  It was oversized with two good sized queen beds.  The room is what a good hotel room should be.  I do agree with the other reviewers that the bath room is a tad small.  I found the hotel to be in good shape.  We used the pool every afternoon and found it to be clean.  The laundry area which we used once was also clean.  The lobby area is very nice and the bell men, if asked, will allow the kids to feed the fish found in the lobby and around the grounds.  The California Deli is priced reasonably...rather than fighting the crowds at Disney at night for ice cream, we would return to the hotel and have it...$1.95 for a single scoop.  We seemed

"The Tower" is a 4 storey building on the north side. The rooms are smaller than in the main building, in need of renovation (dirty carpets) and with narrow windows with little view. Ours overlooked the Interstate. The air conditioning in the Tower did not work the first night and we were given a $25 dining certificate in compensation.  We moved to the 2 storey main building the next night and felt that we were finally getting our money's worth. The main building rooms are huge and can accomodate roll out beds without being cramped. The bathrooms are nice but I wish they had a separate sink area  outside. We couldn't get a fridge the first two nights as they are in short supply and despite being assured on reservation and each morning that we would get one. We received $

Summary Heading: Friendly service but showing it's age
Summary: We just returned from a three night stay at this hotel. We had a 2Q standard room for $140/NT. The room was spacious by comparable standards at other hotels we've stayed at in the area. It included a desk and chair and a separate reading arm chair w/ottoman. The room was in the main hotel and not the tower.  I'll start out with the bad first. The room showed its age, with broken tile in the bathroom, an inexplicable leak after every bath that left water on the bathroom floor, and carpeting that was lifting in several locations. The windows looked dirty and showed greasy/smudgy handprints on them from what I assume were past guests.  The bathroom door and frames were dirty and in need of painting. The carpeting in the hallways were also lifting throughout and had that tired, worn

On our honeymoon and just visited Las Vegas so we were still in a high but got put down when we arrived at the Sheraton Anaheim The hotel i about an hour away from the airport and we were getting the airport bus which only comes once an hour and our luck... we just missed it so after an hours wait we boarded but the driver got us in a good mood (you have to tip everyone, shocking i know but they depend on it... apparently) we got to our hotel and it looked alright, we went to the reception desk, got to our room and were dissapointed that there were 2 double beds in the room when we were told there will be a kingsize, we phoned downstairs and were told to come back to reception, so we had to lug our luggage downstairs again to be given a key for.... you guessed it, next door to

Summary Heading: Pleasant, but frayed around the edges
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights early July.  It has seen better days, and the decor is a bit tired, but I wouldn't write it off.  The rooms were spacious and kept very clean.  Overall it was comfortable.  The check in was very smooth, and the staff at the hotel were among the friendliest we encountered in all 7 hotels we stayed in on a touring holiday.  If you are not travelling with kids, I would avoid the rooms around the pool.  Hotel is close to Disney, and a shuttle bus runs every half hour.  You also get a great view of the fireworks each evening (bit of a shock the first night as we had gone to bed early - still on UK time).  This hotel is really only a good location if you are travelling to see Disney (which we were not).  If you want to tour around LA in general it is

The main problem with this Hotel is the proximity to the park. It really is too far to walk and is in an awkward location surrounded by freeways, etc. After 11pm everthing in the hotel is closed and there is nothing close by if you want to have a snack for do anything. The bus shuttle was convenient and quick, but you must plan your schedule around its take offs, or you will wait...and it only goes to Disneyland and back. The rooms were spacious, the beds were okay. Not what I thought they would be. The pool in dated, crowded, people smoking, and it is surrounded by the hotel. The hotel is in desperate need of paint. The paint on the exterior is literally peeling off. Since this surrounds the pool, it wasn't pleasant and we only went there once. I feel there are better hotels,

We spent three quiet nights at the Anaheim Sheraton from 7/18-7/20.  I don't normally write reviews, but after seeing the alternatives on Harbor Blvd I encourage you to consider the Sheraton.  The rooms: I agree with other reviewers that the interior of the room felt a little dated. However, our room was large, clean, and the 2 queen beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was a little smaller than I expected, but adequate and very clean.   The shuttle: This was definitely a convenient way to get to and from Disneyland. It really only takes 5 minutes to get to the park entrance, which is at least half the time it takes to walk from one of the 'main gate' hotels on Harbor. The drivers were very friendly and the shuttle was always there on schedule.  The hotel in general: The

We stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim over the Fourth of July weekend. We checked in around noon and were initially told that check-in was not until 3pm, but front desk found a room for us anyways. I think the best thing for this hotel is the location and the grounds. It's very close to Disneyland and the grounds are immaculately kept! The room itself is just ok. Everything was clean but the age of the building is beginning to show. There were cracks in the bathroom sink and the water took forever to drain from both the sink and the tub. We saw Disneyland shuttles coming and going at regular intervals at the front, but did not use the service. At night we were able to see fireworks from Disneyland reflected on the glass of the building across from our hotel windows. It was very

We arrived at the Sheraton Anaheim earlier than check-in time.  No problem!  The front desk allowed us into our room.  Actually they even allowed us to choose the location!  We have teenagers, the pool area would be perfect for us.  Again, no problem!  Our outside door opened at the pool gate.  Perfect for us.  The pool noise mentioned previously wasn't a problem for us as our kids were the ones making the noise while we were there.  We could have done without the early morning pool cleanup usually before 7am.  We ate in the Bistro for breakfast most days.  The buffet looked alittle used most of the time so we ordered off the menu.  There wasn't any outdoor seating which was a disappointment.  It looked gorgeous out there.  Room service was also fantastic and quick. The kids

Summary Heading: Great for a couple of nights
Summary: We stayed here for the first three nights of our driving holiday. The rooms were huge and spacious, the beds were heaven, the bathroom wasn't huge but i wasn't intending to stay in there long. My two very tall teens had bags of space. The air con is a blessing and easy to use.  The fireworks from the parking lot at night were great ( get settled just in front of the main enterance, my kids sat in the jeep roof and even the cops pulled over to have a look!).  We had hoped for a room over looking something pretty but we had booked direct on email and stipulated quiet. It was just that, even though we were on a busy run through we heard little noise and I'm pretty fussy! Coffee perculator was a novelty and very pleasent once we worked out how to get the coffee made! It was nice to

PROS:  When you drive out of the mickey and friends parking structure and go to ball rd, this is the first hotel you come to.  Very close, easy location.  However, do not let this deter from staying elsewhere since everything is minutes away from disney.  We had two queen beds very comfortable.  Room is very large for basic hotel room.  Very large safe also.  Swimming pool is heated.  Washer/dryer located by pool for quarters.  Food to go area behind gift shop is nice if you're running off to the park in the morning to grab cereal or a bagel (no toaster though.)  The workers were all very polite and helpful.  Service express a real plus.  Called us back to make sure we had our extra towel request. CONS:  This hotel (at least the room we were in) is in need of renovation.  The

We stayed from june 18th. to june 24th 2005.  The rooms were clean the staff very nice (while at the lobby my children were seeing the carps in the small pool and one staff lady asked the concierge to bring fish food  so my children could feed the carps, of course they loved it!).  Transportation to the Disney theme parks is free and the drivers are very courteous.   I`ll stay again there.

Summary Heading: Lovely place, close to Disney, some problems.
Summary: My extended family (12 of us!) had booked three rooms with 2 queen beds for mid-June, with my little family of five staying for a whole week (the rest were booked for 4 days, 3 nights).  We stayed in the G wing, which is a whole separate building from the main hotel, leading to my first complaint: the place is large and sprawling, with your key needed to access other wings/areas past a certain time.  This would make you feel secure, except my building did not have key pass restrictions, making you wonder why they bother with it at all.     The hotel itself had a lovely lobby with an indoor koi pond, several courtyards with fountains, and despite its very close location to the freeway, you don't really hear the freeway unless you open a window.  What you will hear is the

Beautiful property.Check in and out was seamless.The room was a very oversized room with two queen pillow top beds with big thick duvets and endless amount of pillows.The bathroom was very clean and continous supplies.Our room overlooked a nice quiet courtyard.I would recommend asking for a room away from the noisy I5 freeway.The food in the restaurant was very good.We had breakfast there a few times and found it very tasty.12.75 for the buffet with lots to choose from.The shuttle to Disney went every 30 mins.It can be very busy late at night for the return so be aware.We walked one day to take advantage of the early entry to the park and it took around 15 mins.All flat.You just need to cross one major intersection.The staff were very friendly.Best hotel we stayed at over our 3

We stayed at the Anaheim Sheraton for one night in June 2005. We were able to check in a couple of hours early, and probably could have checked in even earlier than that as it seemed there were very few people in the hotel.   All of the staff were very kind and efficient. Room was typical of most Sheratons - nice beds, small bathroom. The kids loved the koi ponds and arcade. Pool was a good temperature, but could definitely use a replastering - looked kind of stained on the bottom.   Breakfast buffet was so-so. I have stayed at other Sheratons where there was an omelet station and kids ate breakfast free. Not so at this one. You're better off ordering off the menu.   BTW, the Spaghetti Station, which previous posters had raved about, has been demolished. For dinner you will

Summary Heading: Absolutely PERFECT! Wonderful place for a Disney visit!
Summary: Just got back from a 2 night stay at the Sheraton Anaheim.  This was my 4th stay at this wonderful hotel, but my first in over 10 years.  I will definitely return here for my next Anaheim visit!  We booked a deluxe room with 2 queen beds. Very spacious, and had two entry doors -- one to the hotel corridor, and one to the outside greens/pool area.  We didn't have enough time to use the pool or sauna but it was nice to have the option, and others seemed to be enjoying it.  The room was very clean, the beds were fantastic, and I really appreciated all the fluffy down and feather pillows!  There was no honor bar or fridge in the room, but the coke and ice machines were very close.  There was an in-room coffee maker (which we didn't need to use, but it was nice to have the option),

My family and I stayed at this hotel in May 2005 for 6 nights, our room was ready early and we were able to settle in quickly. The beds are incredibly comfortable and the room was a good size considering we had our 20 year old son and 19 year old daughter travelling with us. They enjoyed the fitness room and watched the fireworks from the pool every night when we were not in Disneyland. The grounds are lovely and well maintained.  We enjoyed the dining room for most breakfasts and some lunches and dinners. Service was good and not too pricey. The shuttle to Disneyland and back was brilliant as you could come and go at leisure. All in all we found this hotel to be extremely comfortable and would have no hesitation in staying there again.  Karen  Australia

stayed here for 10 nights ,hotel  deserves a 5* rating but the rooms them selves let the rest of the hotel down  clean but not  any better than some of the 3* rooms ive stayed in, [florida,vegas] food good and fair prices ,staff v/good,kids liked games room ,pool  good but the way they have built hotel round pool you loose sun by 7.30pm and it gets cold [unlike florida,but you dont get the florida rain so its up to you] good fitness room[small].$10 a day to park car, you get a good view of disney fireworks from main entrance,theres nothing right outside hotel but  spaggetti station restaurant[good food ,drink] and a feul garage,anything else  by car,or free shuttle to disney,was not impressed with anahiem,apart from disney.

Lovely hotel.  We were a bit dissapointed when we turned up to find the hotel surrounded by motorways, but once inside you were in your own world and it was lovely. We only stayed 2 nights which was enough for what we needed to do.  As everyone else has said, the beds were the best in the world!  Pool was nice too, expecially after a day out. Don't like Anaheim as an area, but once you get in the hotel you feel safe.

This review is one of the 3 I hope to leave regarding my stay in LA (Sheraton Anaheim)/Las Vegas (Luxor) and Boston (Fairmont Copley Plaza).  Arrived at the Sheraton Anaheim on the 19th April.  We asked for a quiet room as I heard that some rooms are next to the motorway.  The first room we got was right near the Jacuzzi and the swimming pool with people shouting.  Also the wallpaper was peeling all round the window and looked really shabby. We decided to go down to Reception and change rooms. This they did without fuss and we were moved to another room.  This was okay.  Nothing special still a little shabby but fine.  The hotel itself was a little dark and nothing more than really an Econolodge at Best that you stay in in Orlando.  The staff were pleasant.  Breakfasts were

All in all I was very pleased with our stay at the Sheraton Anaheim.    Bonuses: First and foremost the beds were awesome.  It felt so good to crawl into bed after spending 12-14 hours walking through Disneyland.  Sheraton will have me as a repeat guest just because of the beds!  Our room was very large which was a huge bonus - however the bathroom is very small.  The door barely skims by the toilet.  The lighting in the bathroom and room in general was very nice.  I can't stand poorly lit rooms.  Our room was directly off the pool area which would have been great for my kids if we would have had time to swim but we didn't.  A few nights I was worried that the noise would continue forever because there were several large groups of teenagers in the pool but right about 10:00

Stayed here as part of a package and were really impressed. The hotel has very pretty grounds but what impressed us most was the level of customer care. Nothing was too much trouble and if anything was wrong it was seen to immediately. The staff were all very friendly and helpful but the real plus was the beds. We have never encountered such comfort. Heavenly!!

Sheraton Anaheim is very nice place to stay to go to Disneyland. The rates are much better than staying on an on-site hotel and the friendliness and promptness of the staff makes the trip wonderful.  Checking into the hotel was excellent!  Nice service.  I was checking in late at night so they were also training another new person.  I found their ability to train their staff and take care of me at the same time absolutely wonderful.  The lobby is very nice - wonderful.  We absolutely love the KOI ponds - wonderful koi ponds and from the looks of it most all guests do too. Large Koi - different colors.   Nice sitting areas.  The grounds are so nice there -lots of nice gardens and fountains so a nice place to stay away from Disneyland/California Adventure and other places (angels

I don't think our experience was representative; however, the fact that it could happen indicates that this hotel is less than superb unfortunately. Firstly, we could not check in upon arrival.  Our room "wasn't ready". Secondly, after we decided that we would leave our luggage behind and take the shuttle to go to Disneyland, we encountered astounding rudeness at the luggage handlers' counter.  One of them swore in front of my young sons, the other was disdainful and rude.  When we returned around 11 pm, we had a room finally but our luggage was not there -predictably given the previously noted luggage handler's charms-AND we were told it could take "a while, an hour or two" to make it available to us (I proposed retrieving the luggage ourselves but that wasn't a valid option).

We recently returned from our family vacation to Disneyland.  Our travel agent booked us at the Sheraton Anaheim Hotel . .  . . . what a great place!  It's close enough to Disneyland to be there quickly, but far enough away to take a break from the hustle and bustle of the crowds.  They have a shuttle that runs every 20-30 minutes that quickly takes you to Disneyland.  Everyone was friendly!  We spent 4 nights and 3 days and could have stayed longer.  The restaurant had great service, good food and was fairly priced.  And kids eat for FREE!  We will definitely stay there again!  Two thumbs up!

March 4 - March 9, 2005  Rooms:    Room was clean and large and the bed was  comfortable.   Toilet didn't work too well but the room was nice and didn't care to move.  There is no fridge though so it was hard with a toddler.  (Cost for a fridge is $20 per day).  It was nice to relax there after a long day and sink into the bed.  Location:      The shuttle service was reliable (every 1/2 hour) and it is a quick ride.  We had no problem being at this location.  It was nice getting away from the hustle and bustle of the Disneyland area.  Food:    The little deli was handy for late-night snacks.  Service was okay (they pushed the Breakfast Buffet) at the Garden Bistro but the breakfast was good, especially compared to the food at Disneyland.  Pool:    Water was clean and warm.  The

Summary Heading: Great Hotel with only one little flaw
Summary: We stayed 3/21 to 3/26.  Check in was quick and smiple. The front desk clerk though didn't give me any info on anything other then my room location. We went to our room, it was facing the I-5, it was also big and the beds were great with plenty of pillows on them(First hotel we have been at with more pillows then we needed, it was great). Bathroom was a bit small but there was a second sink and mirror which helped make things move along faster in the morning. Now to the only flaw, the rooms do not have their own heating or ac. The whole hotel has to be on heating or ac at one time. There is a note explaining the problem next to the thremastat. But you can open the windows and you can request a fan if it is not cool enough when the ac is not on. Since the room was a bit loud I

We enjoyed our stay at this hotel from March 14-17, 2005. Convenient shuttle every half hour to Disneyland. We stayed in a large, comfortable room with two queen Sheraton sleeper beds (small bathroom). Beds are wonderful after a long day of walking in the parks! Also at hotel: game room with arcade and two pool tables, Garden Bistro restaurant (we didn't eat here), Cafe with breakfast, lunch, and snack items, and work out room. Very clean and well maintained hotel. Would highly recommend as a nice alternative to staying at a Disney resort! Will definitely return to this hotel.

Stayed here a couple of weeks ago (Feb 2005). On arrival they said they had me down for a free upgrade - it was a very nice room. It had a sitting room, wet bar, small but perfectly adequate bathroom and a lovely semi circular bedroom with two of the most comfortable beds ever in it. The room could have done with a little TLC but on the whole I was extremely happy with it. One thing I was happy with was the amount of towels in the bathroom - I hate hotels when they supply two only - this was most definitely not the case here.   The lobby area was fantastic - there was an open fire and across from the lobby was a pool with koi carp in it and the bar and restaurant.  The front desk staff were very friendly and extremely efficient and only too happy to help. I used the Disney

We stayed at the Anaheim Sheraton over President's Day weekend and were extremely pleased with the hotel.  I was a little concerned because it wasn't within walking distance to the Parks, but the hotel shuttle was convienent and always on time.  Since it was raining, the shuttle was preferrable to walking anyway.  I had minimal interaction with the staff because everything was working so well.  The room was quite large and the beds were soooooo comfortable.  After the long days at the Resort we looked forward to a great nights sleep and were'nt disappointed.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and will certainly stay there on my next visit to the Disneyland Resort.  I got a great deal through my favorite travel company Get-Away Today.  Check it out!!  KM - February 22, 2005

Summary Heading: So great we are going back with friends
Summary: My family stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim at the end of March 2004 at the glowing recommendation of our neighbors.  The first things we noticed when we arrived were the secureness of the parking lot, the absolutely beautiful grounds (in fact our 5 year old asked if she could smell the grass when we got out of the car), the beautiful lobby, the TRULY heated pool, and above all the EXTREMELY friendly staff.  I had corresponded with the hotel prior to our stay with many requests.  When we arrived I was pleasantly surprised to find that they had met every single one of them.  The room was spacious and very quiet. And those beds are incredible.  I didn't want to get up in the morning.  The shuttle was always punctual and the drivers were very friendly and helpful.  We enjoyed our stay

Stayed here for eight nights at end of July/beginning of August 2004. We thought it was an excellent hotel. We were upgraded to a deluxe room at check-in as our allocated room was not ready. The room was huge. The bathroom was small but adequate. We ate in the bistro in the evening a couple of times and thought the food was good. The buffet breakfast was excellent, with lots of choice. The complimentary bus service to and from Disney was excellent - it ran every half hour from 7.30a.m. and was very reliable. It is very near I-5 and so getting to and from the hotel by car was easy, but we had no problems with traffic noise. We will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, a little farther than expected from Disney
Summary: We stayed at this hotel after flying cross country on 2 hours sleep and then spending the remainder of the day at Disney parks with friends.  Were were exhausted.  The hotel was exactly what we were looking for.  Quite, comfortable, clean and reliable.  It was a little farther from Disney than I expected but they did provide a free shuttle.    My only complaint is the charge for hotel guests to park. Other than that - a perfect stay.

A well situated hotel with good facilities and friendly staff. If using the facilities in the business centre watch the cost it is expensive.   Following two weeks and 7 different hotels the beds were a welcome relief. Amazing beds.

I stayed here last Christmas, and I couldn't have been more pleased! The room was large, so there was plenty of room for the opening of the gifts Christmas morning. Also, the pool was fantastic...Loved watching the Disneyland fireworks from the hot- tub! Great Hotel!

We stayed here for the first week of October after a hectic week in Vegas. It was just as hectic in Anaheim with all that we wanted to do, but the rooms here made sleep very easy and we got a good night sleep. I was a bit concerned about staying here having seen other reviews of people saying they were disturbed by noise from the traffic outside so took my earplugs, but actually did not need them. We were upgraded free of charge to a sleeper suite and it was really nice. The hotel is spotlessly clean. The staff are wonderful, very friendly. Actually, everyone we encountered in USA was friendly, which realy made our holiday. They cannot do enough for you. This hotel is a four minute ride to Disney and the hotel provide a free shuttle bus every 30 minutes. Tours from the hotel are

Just returned from our stay in Anaheim and I booked this hotel based on the great reviews posted here.  Everything mentioned is right on!!  Rooms were very spacious (500 sq ft), the grounds were beautiful, bed was amazing (sweet sleeper bed), and staff very friendly and helpful.  If we ever return to Anaheim, without question we will definitely stay here again!!

We stayed here for five days on the last leg of our honeymoon. After racing around San Francisco and Las Vegas we needed a break and this hotel was just the ticket. Check in staff were very helpful. We had one of the deluxe rooms with the sweet sleeper beds. The room was the biggest I have EVER seen and the beds were just SO confortable. The Disney shuttle was very reliable and came exactly on time. I would recommend you use this if only to get you down to the resort area where there are more restaurants etc. We only used the hotel restuarant on our last day for lunch but it was lovely and the staff very efficient. Cuban Pete's around the corner is a must for great food and live salsa. Free fireworks every night also topped off our stay. Would go again!
Very nice hotel, big rooms and close enough for a walk from disneyland parking lot . The children enjoy the gardens and pool, In my opinion, the best deal in Anaheim.

Just got back from a 3 night stay. Read the hotels reviews before booking and asked for a room away from the freeway - can honestly say we did not hear it at all. Shuttle was definately unreliable which is not convenient with a 2 year old in 100 degree heat. The rooms were spotlessly clean. Wouldnt recommend the breakfast - overpriced. Some staff were extremely accomodating and let us have a late check out of 3pm at no extra charge ( the first girl I spoke with said they had the room booked and couldn't).  Overall I feel the staff made an effort to be acommodating, and I would definately stay there in the future if we were able to get 3 nights for 2 again.

having just returned from the states and spending nine nights at the sheraton anaheim i can report that my family i and had a wonderful stay at this first class hotel.the bedroom was huge with two very comfortable double beds. the free shuttle service to the parks was of great benefit after a busy day walking around the two wonderful theme parks.making use of the fast past system at the popular rides is a good tip as when you return at your alloted time you walk right to the head of the lines. remember to watch the free firework display in the evening from the comfort of the lovely pool or hot tub. we cant wait to head back to the sheraton!

This hotel was absolutely adorable.  The front desk is accommodating, althought not the friendliest.  Our A/C was broken, and they quickly fixed it.  The concierge was very helpful in getting us late tickets to Medieval Times, which was about 9 miles away.  The hotel is clean, and not so large that you get lost, although the grounds can be a bit confusing.  The pool looked nice, although we didn't get a chance to use it, but we enjoyed walking around and looking at all the greenery.  The location is convenient to Disneyland.  You probably CAN walk there, but it'd be a better idea to take the shuttle.  It's very close, but not exactly close enough to walk.  A couple minutes by car.  Make sure to get the Sweet Sleeper bed (the deluxe room).  It's really great - new with a

I attended a Conference in June at the Sheraton.  The food was good and the rooms were always neat and supplied for our classes.  My hotel room was very large and very comfortable.  NO mini bar.  ( maybe a good thing!)  The lounge and bar are comfortable, and the pool and gym were clean.  Everynight you can go out front and watch the fireworks.  Don't miss the great Cuban restaurant around the corner.

My stay was so nice, My husband and I took a trip with our kids for the fourth of July. We stayed four days at the hotel. The rooms were very nice and the restraunt was also good, We had a problem at first but it was fixed with 20min It was not a big deal just the room that we were ut in at first was facing a wall and with kids that is not a nice scene  But I called the front desk and they changed us rooms. It was such a nice stay, our rooms were clean every time we had come back from disneyland and we always had freash towels too. The only thing bad is the wait for teh busses that take and pick you up from Disneyland the busses only ran every 30min and that is long when you have kids. But overall it was nice and relaxing.

We arrived before check-in time and were advised that our room wouldn't be ready until 3pm.  We changed clothes in the lobby restrooms so we could head straight to Disneyland.  We had the bellman store our bags and he offered to deliver them or told us we could pick them up later but we got the feeling that he would only deliver them if he got a tip first.  When we returned after park closing, we picked up the keys and our bags from a much friendlier bellman.  The room was quiet, clean and spacious. There were only two of us but it would fit a family of six quite comfortably.  Our room on the fourth floor had a view of a quiet walkway between the buildings and had two queen-sized "sweet sleeper" beds and a sitting area with a table and two chairs.  The room did not seem

Summary Heading: ideal for Disney, but not a lot else
Summary: We stayed here with the express aim of visiting Disneyland, and for this it was absolutely ideal. The free shuttle was great. Rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel was huge but there was always ample room in the restaurant and bar. Staff were friendly and our room was enormous! The only real drawback was that as we had no car, in the evenings we were stuck, as there was really nowhere within walking distance to go, except 'The Spaghetti House' restaurant across the road, which admittedly did a great line in good value meals. However it was either that or the hotel restaurant (expensive). No bars or shops around. All in all a good experience. Not quite the luxury I would associate with Sheraton, but no real grouses.

my wife and i booked this hotel for the second week of our honeymoon.  after a weeks stay in a very anonymous las vegas it was a breath of  fresh air to be greeted by friendly and courtious service. in addition  to that they gave us a free upgrade to a suite and a free bottle of  wine.   the pool was clean and tidy the gardens immaculate and the bar and restraunt very reasonable. the free shuttle to disney was always on time and extremely handy.    i would reccomend this hotel for honeymooners who want a bit of privacy and some decent service.

Not up to the standards I've come to expect from Sheraton Hotels. Rooms were adequate, clean & neat. I was annoyed at the 10 dollar a day parking fee and the dollar per local phone call charge. You can get better value for your money at many other area hotels. I will not stay there again.

My husband & I just stayed at this Sheraton 2-14 thru 2-17. This was our 2nd stay and we were hoping it was a lot better than 2 years ago.  But it's about the same. The reservation clerk at the 800# didn't tell me the truth because she said all the rooms had been renovated & had the new sweet-sleeper beds. NOT SO! Also, I requested a Non-Smoking room in a quieter section and they put us in a Smoking room beside the freeway. Front desk clerk irritablely changed us to another room but when we hiked down to it (a long way from the lobby and there is NO offer of help with your bags) it was still a smoking room. But after we complained again they moved us a 2nd time to a Non-Smoking room. We couldn't get the main building - were in the last building beside the freeway but at least

We stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim this past weekend with our two young children and had a fabulous experience! After a six hour drive and awful LA traffic we arrive to a beautiful castle like hotel (which delighted our kids!). The front desk was so nice and efficient. I requested a refrigerator for our room for some medication for our daughter and one was brought right away free of charge! The beds were great! So comfortable with fluffy pillows and beautiful linens. Althoug a bit on the small side, the bathroom was very clean and worked well.  Unlike some other reviewers, I found the hotel to be well insulated and did not hear a peep from any of the other rooms or the hallway. The game room was so much fun for the kids and the pool was so warm that it felt like climbing in a

Summary Heading: Excellent service and value at the Sheraton!
Summary: Stayed here last year for 2 weeks. I don;t usually stay in the same place for such a long period of time but was glad we had! The staff were very friendly and when they realised we were from the UK on checking in, promptly agreed to upgrade us! no extra cost!! AMAZING!  The room was a suite, very clean, up to date and accomodating. The food on site is well priced and the breakfast is a must! A shuttle service is waiting to whisk you off to the Disneyland resort BUT it is not that far to walk (its good to burn the calories from the breakfast off!). A top rate hotel well worth a visit!

Summary Heading: Decent for the price and a weekend at Disney
Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Anaheim for a weekend visit to Disneyland last weekend. We chose the hotel because we got a great rate. The hotel is older, but clean. Nice lobby with a fireplace. The front desk clerks are very friendly and courteous. We had booked a room with 2 queen beds, but requested a king bed, and we were accomodated.  Our room was large and had a view of the courtyard. The rooms do not have individual AC/heating units, so if the hotel has the heat on, you cannot turn on the AC in your room. Our room was warm and a bit stuffy at night, but we were able to open a window and that took care of the problem. The only drawback was that the walls are very thin, we could hear the TV, conversations, and showers of the rooms on all sides. We were sleeping in,

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for our Disneyland vacation
Summary: We stayed two nights, December 13 and 14. We paid well under $100 a night on a Travelocity package. We got a huge room with a lovely courtyard view. The room was very clean, had two comfortable queen beds and a dressing area. The bathroom was a bit small but clean and well equipped. The mattresses appeared to be new pillow top units.  We had dinner from room service one night. The food arrived quickly and was very tasty and hot. The prices were very reasonable.  The shutttle service to Disneyland was great. It ran every half hour, right on schedule. The drivers were courteous and the bus was very comfortable. If you have a car and want to drive to Disneyland, the Sheraton Anaheim is the closest hotel to the main Mickey parking structure--about a block and a half away.  Our kids

Came home tonight from a Christmas visit to Disneyland with my two children (17, 11 yrs old). This trip was a surprise Christmas present for the kids. We stayed at the Sheridan Anaheim. After reading some of the reviews I was very aprenhensive about staying there. All my concerns were unfounded. The Sheridan was one of the best experiences for us during this past five days. The hotel grounds, common rooms, and staff are outstanding. The rooms were spacious (extremely important when your family is burnt out on people, crowds, noise, etc. and they need some space), clean, and quiet. It was nice to look out our room window and see grass, flowers, landscaping: it was nice to eat in the dining room and see plants, water fountains, gazebos, etc. The food in the dining room was good

Summary Heading: Just fine - get a new room!
Summary: My husband is a member of their frequent stay program - so our stay was free. However, if I had paid for the room we were given, I would have given the hotel the same review! We got a new room right off the lobby with another door that took us right out to the koi pond (my son loved this feature!) The room had seen some use even though it had been redone - but it was huge. Beds were fine. Room was non-smoking. It was close enough to walk to Downtown Disney - use Disneyland Drive NOT the way the front desk tells you to go - on very busy streets over 2 overpasses. All in all - i would stay again even if I had to pay! A refridgerator would be nice! Staff was great, bus drivers friendly - just a great experience. We did talk to someone who complained a little so there are still some

This hotel has very beautiful courtyards and the lobby is great. The staff is also very helpful. But, the rooms are in desperate need for renovation. They are large rooms but the decor, carpet, and overall quality of the room is poor. Not what you would expect from a Sheraton hotel. Extremely worn interior. My 3 children and I have stayed here for the past 4 years(6 days each stay) but have decided to find a new hotel to start staying at because it feels almost like a motel 6 inside the room. We will come back once the rooms are renovated because everything else about this hotel is great.

Stayed here for 3 nights in Nov 2003. Really loved it! Our room was huge, the beds were great (brand new) and the decor was lovely. The rooms were spotlessly clean and seemed newly renovated. The hotel is not really close to Disneyland, but that didn't matter as the free shuttle back and forth every half hour was easy to use. Only takes 5 minutes to get from the hotel to Disneyland on the shuttle. And, it was always on time. The hotel has lovely grounds (lots of ponds with huge fish in to amuse the kids). The gardens were lit with fairy lights each evening which was pretty. There is a games room and a deli/shop near the foyer which has good snacks and drinks. Just across the road is the "Spaghetti Station" restaurant. Good, cheap pasta to keep your energy up for the days at

Summary Heading: Not as bad  as many people have said...
Summary: I returned yesterday after spending three days at this hotel.  I read some of the reviews just before leaving, and wondered if I had made a big mistake.  The mistake it turns out, is giving any credance to some of you out there who have egregiously misrepresented this hotel.  The Sheraton Anaheim is fine. It is a 3 star hotel and fully lives up to that rating. The hard mattress felt great to me. The room was spacious, and everything in the hotel was clean.  An added bonus was a nice little deli which made it unecessary for one to go to the Am Pm Mini-mart across the street. The shuttle to Disneyland worked flawlessly, and the staff were universally friendly and helpful. They have a great breakfast buffet...  If you want to be in closer proximity to restaurants etc. then go to

Summary Heading: Visit ONLY if guaranteed remodeled rooms
Summary: We are in the Sheraton Club and decided to stay here for the mileage, but expectations were low. But not low enough. The carpets and furniture are filthy, and the beds are in fact horrible and hard as a rock. Do NOT stay here unless you are guaranteed one of the new rooms of which I am told there are few. The restaurant, shops and personnel are adequate. Nothing close by except the freeway and Disneyland.

Not what you think it's going to be like. I stayed there because I had stayed there almost 10 years ago as a teenager.  The beds in this hotel are as hard as a rock - I challenge you to get a good nights sleep. They are upgrading the beds however, and presently have a bed on show in the lobby stating 'Coming Soon'  I was surprised to find no small refrigerator in the room. It's location means there are no shops within walking distance and you have to rely on an ampm gas station if you want anything.  Pool is very dirty (possibly because it's heading into winter)

The Sheraton rooms were poor of a three-star standard. When we asked for a room upgrade we were told there were no rooms available. In the room the bath was very dirty; the bathroom had dirty walls and a sink full of dirty water. Two bed lights on the walls did not work and the main light switch was broken. The bed linen was never changed during our stay, this due to a card that was to be left on the bed requesting new sheets, not being discovered until our leaving day. Surely this system to save water by the hotel is something that should have been discussed with us on checking in? Power was cut in the hotel for repairs during one night for four hours leaving no lights for the toilette etc. The bed was very uncomfortable and the general condition of the room was poor and in

My wife and I stayed here from 09/03/03 to 09/08/03. and found it to be great. Clean and quiet rooms. The beds were comfortable. The employees were very helpful and friendly. We even got to see a wedding at the gazebo. The grounds were fun to walk around and look at, some of the koi fish were so big. The food was very good. The best thing of all is "we were only 5 minutes from the happiest place on earth.

Summary Heading: Not what you think it will be.
Summary: When taking a look at this hotels website, I thought I would be staying in a fairly nice hotel that lived up to the Sheraton name. I thought the rate of 85 bucks a night was a great deal. We got a well used room that was spacious. Room feel and quality was comparable to a Holiday or Days Inn. We didn't spend much time in the room so it didn't matter that much but a dissappointment none the less. Spend the extra bucks if your looking for something nice somewhere else.

We have stayed at the Sheraton anaheim for two years running. It's a great hotel, particularly if you have kids. The hotel is themed like a sprawling 3 storey castle. The entrance is an imposing castle turret with a portcullis decked with flags and pendants and you feel like you are in Disneyland just by arriving. The lobby is spacious, has a shop, games room and a couple of bars / restaurants. Rooms are arranged around attractive courtyards with immaculate lawns, gazebos, fishponds etc. Courtyard facing groundfloor rooms have two doors (one to the corridor and one to the courtyard) Ask for one in the swimming pool courtyard and you can watch the Disneyland fireworks over the hotel rooftop everynight ! Magical ! The rooms are large and reflect a modern sort of American

Stayed here in August with my family. The kids loved the pool (small but warm). Rooms very big and clean. Staff very helpful - upgraded us on second stay - no charge. Good view of fireworks. All for $85 a night - no complaints.

I totally agree with the recent reviews from Texas and Las Vegas.  Saying the the rooms need redoing is an understatement. I felt I was at a Motel6.And the shuttle to Disneyland was a nightmare! Instead of having two buses available for this crowded August time, they crammed people in the bus and made them sit in the asiles. Next time I will splurge and stay at Hotel California Disney which looked absolutely wonderful.

We stayed at the Sheraton from August 19-23. All in all, our stay was very pleasant. The lobby and the grounds outside were very attractive and inviting. Our room was a good size-very clean and well kept. The decor was plain but that was not important to us. After all, we were only in our room during the evening for bed. We also requested a room facing Disney and got it. We watched the fireworks from our window and it was spectacular! No need to fight the crowd for a prime spot. The shuttle to Disney was great-very reliable and courteous drivers. The food at the restaurant was pretty good. Unfortunately, there was no complimentary breakfast nor did they have a deal where kids ate free.  So although we got a good deal for our room, the savings we got went towards breakfast.

My family of four stayed at the Sheraton last week (mid August). I had always thought highly of Sheraton Hotels, until this stay. This one was quite disappointing. IT NEEDS UPDATING!!I got what I thought was a very good rate of $85 a night, but upon arrival realized quickly why it was such a reasonable price. The outside looks lovely and grounds are very nice. It's the rooms that are awful. Old, dingy carpet, bathrooms look like they were tiled long long ago. Front desk staff was nothing special as far as friendly or helpful....just doing their job. They put us in a handicapped room without asking if it was okay. The toilet which had pegs under the seat to make it higher, scared my two year old so much that she started wetting her diaper again. Handicap bars next to the toilet

Summary Heading: Stay Away From Sheraton Anaheim (at least until they renovate!)
Summary: Having read all the reviews below prior to booking Sheraton Anaheim I now have to say that I made a HUGE mistake not heeding the advice of the very capable reviewer from Portsmouth, NH. But practically everyone else who wrote a review loved the hotel, so I thought the Portsmouth folks just happened to be the brunt of bad luck, Murphy's Law.  No. They were right on the mark with their review. People, this hotel is TERRIBLE!!  I have stayed in Sheratons before with great success. Universal Sheraton is very nice and the Sheraton Cerritos is REALLY nice, so I had no trouble believing that this Sheraton would be great, especially next to Disneyland.  Well, the lobby is fine and pleasant enough. But make your way to the hallways where the rooms are located and it seems like you've

I had gotten a great nightly room rate but all of the other charges were too much. There was nothing listed about the daily parking rate or that on a weekend you may have a problem finding a parking spot. This was the first time I was charged to use a hotel's computer to check e-mail. The grounds were very nice. The pool was adequate.

We enjoyed our stay, for the most part, at the Sheraton Anaheim. We had no problem with early check in. The room was quite large, clean, and held our family of four quite nicely. Housekeeping did a nice job of restocking towels, coffee, etc. My husband didn't care for the bed and thought it was really uncomfortable for a person with back problems.  Expect to pay a lot in $$ for dining in the hotel restaurants and incidentals at the lobby gift shop (i.e., 2 AA batteries $3.50 (for portable fans attached to a spray bottle which are all the rage at Disney); liquid cold medicine $8-9.50 a bottle; chapstick $2.59 per tube, etc.). There is a laundry facility located by the pool which came in handy. The pool is rather warm for swimming, but loads of fun for the large amounts of

The hotel is very easy to find & we had an early check-in no problem.  The hotel is impressive with a very comfy lobby & restuarant area. When I arrived I saw a beautiful bed displayed in the lobby, this was not the bed I got in the room. They should have the new beds soon I am told. If you need a more comfy bed as I did you will have to make some adjustments, there is a Walmart close by. All in all we were very pleased & will recommend this hotel to our friends. The kids loved the pool area whick was very clean & with a fence very safe.

Beware of buying hotel tickets from Expedia.com. The hotel you are staying at (like the Sheraton Anaheim) will try to stick you in their very worst room available. We requested nonsmoking. Cigarette smoke makes me sick. We got a smoking room. We protested, said we couldn't stay there, and the front desk girl asked if she could send someone down to deodorize our room. I again said no, we couldn't stay in the room. So they moved us to an AVAILABLE nonsmoking room. This room was as ugly and unkempt as the smoking room - ripped wallpaper, worn & weary shower curtain, stains in the carpet, beds as hard as concrete. Very depressing, as we wanted to stay in a nice place. I requested a new room. The girl at the front desk said, "We GAVE YOU WHAT YOU WANT, MAAM." We had to call back

We were unable to get a decent rate at one of the Disneyland resorts, so we decided on the Sheraton, due to it's close proximity to Disneyland. My wife had stayed there years ago and liked it. I loved their spacious rooms and large heated pool, along with a jacuzzi. They also have those large fish inside and outside of the hotel for the kids to enjoy. Their fitness center is also nice. The staff from the reservation desk to arrival was great. The only fault was a broken elevator in the back, but we preferred the lobby elevator anyway. I recommend and would definitely go back in the future. The rates were also very reasonable for the accomadation and service.

The rooms are very spacious - great for families. Very nice facilities and helpful staff. The shuttle service to Disneyland was excellent, but it helps to have your own vehicle if you want to go anywhere else. We would stay there again.
